title: Gilead
description: The book, Gilead, has been eagerly awaited by readers and critics for more than ten years, featuring John Ames as the preacher's son and grandson.

title: Spider's Web
description: Agatha Christie's final play novelisation is a Christmas classic that draws inspiration from her well-known play by Charles Osborne, and includes hints for how to spend the Christmas season.

title: The One Tree
description: The second volume of Stephen Donaldson's acclaimed trilogy features the captivating anti-hero Thomas Covenant.

title: Rage of angels
description: The Dark Arena of organized crime and its flashy courtrooms are where ambitious prosecutors begin their journey to political power, leaving Jennifer as a beautiful and fearless attorney who struggles against an enemy with more powerful plans than hate.

title: The Four Loves
description: Lewis' study on the nature of love categorized it into four groups: Affection, Friendship, Eros, and Charity. While the former is a natural human trait, charity is defined by God's gift-love, while the latter lacks the divine Love; otherwise, these natural loves are distorted and can be dangerous without this supernatural love.

title: The Problem of Pain
description: The Problem of Pain, written by the eminent Christian philosopher and author C.S. Lewis, offers an answer to the universally relevant question: "If God is good and all-knowing, why does he allow his creatures to suffer?" Through his unique combination of empathy and compassion, Lewis shares insights that are both timely and poignant, and also provides hope for those who seek true knowledge of human nature.

title: An Autobiography
description: Contribution.

title: Empires of the Monsoon
description: Until Vasco da Gama discovered the sea-route to the East in 1497-9, there was little knowledge about the exotic cultures and wealth of the Indian Ocean and its people. Richard Hall recreates this civilization and how it was destroyed by Western conquerors who were brutal, betrayal, and colonial ambition.

title: The Gap Into Madness
description: According to the reissue, the fourth book in his popular five-volume sf series is now available as a new-cover work. The events were not as planned for the Amnion and humans had been dishonestly dealing with aliens. Meanwhile, Thanatos Minor detonated, and the Trumpet was launched into space without warning, much to their disappointment. Morn Hyland and her crew were on board; while they were transported to Kyga by an aircraft carrier.

title: Master of the Game
description: One of the most powerful women in the world, Kate Blackwell, is a mystery. However, during her ninetieth birthday celebrations, there are ghosts of friends and enemies who have vanished.

title: If Tomorrow Comes
description: It is one of Sidney Sheldon's most popular and best-selling titles, repackaged for new fans.

title: Assassin's Apprentice
description: An alternate universe with a romantic storyline.

title: Warhost of Vastmark
description: Lysaer, the wily half-brother of the Lord of Light, deceives him once more when he arrives in Merior, where Arithon's ship yards have been deserted and destroyed, while the Master of Shadow has vanished into thin air. Meanwhile, Aritheon and the Mad Prophet Dakar are trekking through the rugged Kelhorn Mountains to the Vastmark clans, there to rally additional support for his cause. But raising a warhost is hardly naive as it seems sorely.

title: The Once and Future King
description: A comprehensive volume chronicling the author's complete Arthurian tale, including "The sword in the stone" (1939), " The witch in a union with dragonfly," (1940) and finally "I Will Kill Dragon" (first published).

title: Murder in LaMut
description: "New York Times"-bestselling authors Feist and Rosenberg have released the second volume of their Legends of the Riftwar series in the U.S., which is now available for purchase.

title: Jimmy the Hand
description: The boy thief of Krondor, Jimmy the Hand, lived in the shadows of the city and had more power than anyone. He became only a pickpocket with potential when he helped Prince Arutha rescue Princess Anita from Duke Guy du Bas-Tyra while running away from "Black Guy's" secret police.

title: Well of Darkness
description: The Sovereign Stone's unwavering support from Gareth and his naive young self prevents him from becoming the whipping boy for Prince Dagnarus. Their relationship blossoms into an unbreakable bond, propelling them to become the most powerful and feared of their respective domains until Dagnel becomes a knight in vain who risks causing chaos across the kingdom.

title: Witness for the Prosecution & Selected Plays
description: A Newly-Jacketed Edition is crafted to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Christie S, a flawless witness for the Prosecution and other outstanding plays. It also serves as an ideal complement to the latest Mousetrap and Selected Plays (50th Aniversary Edition).

title: The Little House
description: Although it was a simple task for Elizabeth to marry the man she loved, Ruth struggled even as she married her son and realized that she could never match her own abilities. This suspenseful novel examines the desires and fears of women as Ruth struggles to maintain her emotional stability after two failed marriages.

title: Mystical Paths
description: What are the obstacles that Nicholas Darrow encounters in 1968? Can he marry Rosalind while remaining committed to his role as priest, or is it possible for him to break free from his dangerous dependency on his father?

title: Glittering Images
description: In 1937, Charles Ashworth, a Canon to the Archbishop of Canterbury, is sent to uncover the hidden corruption and self-delusion within the episcopal palace of the charismatic Bishop of Starbridge.

title: Glamorous Powers
description: The Starbridge series, which includes six standalone yet interconnected novels that explore the history of the Church of England through the 20th century, is reissued by the author.

title: The Mad Ship
description: The second volume of Robin Hobb's Liveship Traders trilogy features stunning setbacks in Bingtown, where pirates have become a problem for the coast and the lucrative slave trade continues. Althea Vestrit has an unthinkable plan, but must now resort to hiring specialized vessels to protect her family from treachery.

title: Post Captain
description: The story begins with Jack Aubrey returning home from his Mediterranean exploits, where he and Stephen Maturin, a surgeon and secret agent, find peace in England. They start off enjoying life as gentlemen, hunting, and having fun. However, their lives are cut short when Jack is reduced to piety by his peers at the end of the war. He flees to the continent to seek asylum, only to be hunted down as Napoleon becomes an elusive fugitive.

title: The Reverse of the Medal
description: Jack Aubrey is swayed by a passing acquaintance to invest in New York City upon returning from his role protecting whalers off the coast of South America. He then follows him into the realm of government espionage and the criminal underworld, which is exclusively within his personal domain.

title: Miss Marple
description: Miss Marple contributed 20 short stories to various collections in Britain and America. Her story, presented in chronological order, employs her unique perspective to uncover the truth about a series of unsolved crimes.

title: The Years of Rice and Salt
description: The New York Times Book Review has hailed this alternative history of the past 600 years as it begins with the death of almost all Europeans and the rise of China, India, and Islamic rule in the world.

title: Spares
description: The ultimate health insurance for human clones, Spares, is under scrutiny due to the actions of some individuals. Jack Randall's story involves his financial struggles after dropping out of college and becoming too dependent on saving money.

title: Gravity
description: Despite her training as a research physician, Emma Watson has not been informed about the deadly nature of her space mission. As securing an early start, she must contend with the danger of single-celled Archaeon contamination from the deep sea that is spreading rapidly and infecting the crew.

title: The Wise Woman
description: Alys becomes isolated and abandoned at a nunnery to escape poverty, only to be redirected back into the hereafter cursed by Henry VIII's vandals. With limited resources, she must balance her childhood faith with her instinctive femininity, as she develops ruthless romantic relationships while engaging in witchcraft to win over her lover.

title: Girls' Night in
description: 'Girls' Night In' is all about growing up, getting out of bed, moving on, falling apart, and finally finding happiness. Don't forget to turn off your phone and snuggle up on the couch for this one-time event.

title: The White Album
description: This compilation of writings narrates the events that unfolded on the long morning after the 1960s, as everyone was coming back from their specific disaster. Didion observes the dramas that occur during America's collective detox, such as a mother leaving her daughter on Interstate 5, Huey Newton and the Black Panthers preaching from inside their cells, and students simulating the disillusionment of the 60s through unconscious parody.

title: The Bonesetter's Daughter
description: Describes the history of Chinese women for three generations, starting from 1900.

title: The Lexus and the Olive Tree
description: Half of the post-Cold War world is focused on creating a better Lexus and optimizing their societies and economies for the global market, while the other half is consumed with internal disputes regarding ownership of specific olive trees and land parcels.

title: 'Tis
description: "Angela's Ashes," a book by Frank McCourt that won prestigious awards for its memoirs, has been loved and celebrated by readers worldwide. It was also the recipient of the National Book Critics Circle Award, the "Los Angeles Times" Book Award from 2011, and the Pulitzer Prize for Best Book in Australia with two years to go.

title: Ocean Star Express
description: Joe and his parents are enjoying a summer vacation at the Ocean Star Hotel with gleaming blue skies and sunshine, but their hopes of re-entering cloudy weather are dashed as the hotel owner invites them to share in 'the magical world'.

title: A Small Pinch of Weather
description: A magical and imaginative compilation of early tales from a highly innovative children's author in the 1900s. Suitable for kids aged 8-11.

title: Koko
description: The psychological horrors of the Vietnam War are explored in Peter Straub's Koko.

title: Tree and Leaf
description: The book 'Tree and Leaf' was originally published in 1964, but it now features the poem Mythopoeia, which is related to the creation of myths.

title: Partners in Crime
description: Tommy and Tuppence Beresford, who were previously unemployed for an adventure, have been asked to take over Blunt S International Detective Agency. Following their successful recovery of a pink Pearl, the intriguing cases kept coming on until they were finally caught in A Stabbing on Sunningdale Golf Course; Cryptic homicides that occurred during one of their raids.

title: Murder in Mesopotamia
description: Amy Leatheran suspected that the Hassanieh excavation in Iraq was being targeted because of the death of Dr. Leidner's wife, referred to as 'Lovely Louise'.

title: The Lord of the Rings  the Return of the King
description: The third installment of the Lord of THE RINGS movie trilogy features a comprehensive guidebook that covers all aspects of characters, locations, landscapes, artifacts from various sources, battle scenes, and attire. It also includes informative text and extra images to enhance the film's visual experience.

title: All Families are Psychotic
description: On the eve of the next Space Shuttle mission, a divided family gathers as All Families Are Psychotic stars Coupland at her peak in his craft.

title: Death in the Clouds
description: A woman is fatally stabbed by a poisoned dart in the enclosed area of.

title: Appointment with Death
description: Hercule Poirot heard a strange remark from his time in Jerusalem: "It's only now that you can solve this mystery," and Mrs Boynton was found dead on the verge of Petra, like he belonged to opulent Amercian royalty.

title: Hallowe'en Party
description: The little girl's claim of witnessing murder is dismissed by others until she reveals her own drowning, and Hercule Poirot sets out to apprehen the culprit.

title: Hercule Poirot's Christmas
description: In the dark of night, Simeon Lee is found with his throat cut in his locked bedroom and must confront Hercule Poirot for answers.

title: The Big Four
description: A brutal international cartel is seeking global dominance... In Poirot's bedroom, an uninvited guest was swept with dust and left with a gaunting stare. Was he in shock or tired? And what did the figure 4 represent on the paper mean?

title: The Thirteen Problems
description: A group of people gather at the Tuesday Night Club to discuss unsolved crimes, including murders and suicides.

title: They Do it with Mirrors
description: Miss Marple's visit to a Victorian mansion, which also functions as rehabilitation center for delinquents, is interrupted by unforeseen events. She discovers that her friend was shot dead in the same incident and remains unharmed.

title: A Murder is Announced
description: Chipping Cleghorn's villagers are stunned by an advertisement in the local newspaper that announces "A murder has been made known at Little Paddocks at 6.30pm on Friday October 29th. The locals quickly gather at the house, but Miss Marple becomes involved when a man is killed in what appears to be an attempted robbery.

title: The Mirror Crack'd from Side to Side
description: Then, one minute later, Heather Badcock had been cradling her feet on the set of her Idol film, Marina Gregg. She suffered a massive seizure, but who was this really for?

title: Mrs McGinty's Dead
description: Mrs McGinty was brutally murdered in the cottage parlour, resulting in her death. James Bentley, the shifty lodger, faced suspicion and appeared to be uninterested in murdering his widow with all of her blood and hair. Poirot thought he could have saved him, but realized that his own life was now in jeopardy.

title: Taken at the Flood
description: After tying the knot with an attractive young woman, Gordon Cloade was killed in a bomb blast during the London Blitz. Later on, Hercule Poirot meets The Dead Man's Sister-In-Law who claims to have been informed by Spirit that Mrs Underhay' son is still alive.

title: The Hollow
description: In The Confusion, John Christow Gaslights on Henrietta as he finishes reading Hercule Poirot.

title: Third Girl
description: A befuddled girl suspects that she committed homicide.

title: The Secret of Chimneys
description: A young drifter surprises everyone by agreeing to transport a package to an English rural estate...

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: The Rings of Power are the means by which Sauron will take control of the world. His only requirement is the Ruling Ring, which Bilbo Baggins has acquired and entrusted to stop him.

title: The Metaphysical Club
description: Menand's account of the Metaphysical Club, a group that met in Cambridge, Massachusetts in 1872 to discuss ideas, is an intriguing narrative that includes pictures and images of individuals.

title: Wilkins' Tooth
description: The plan of OWN BACK, PRICE APPROX as easy as it is to transport, all difficult tasks unfinished, and hikes with mountains in the background appeared to be a wonderful idea at its time.

title: Cut
description: At Sea Pines, a treatment center where her parents and doctor took her to find she cut herself, Callie is so quiet that she avoids talking to anyone. Her story is told through dramatic monologues and the family's turmoil that led to her destructive behavior.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: Tolkien's timeless fantasy, which centers on the struggle to save Middle-Earth, and the inspiration for Peter Jackson'Stonefinger film trilogy, has been released in Young Reader' s Editions, available both individually and in a three-volume paperback boxed set.

title: Lirael
description: The Old Kingdom is at risk of being shattered by a perilous necromancer that threatens to unleash their own hidden evil, leading Lirael and Prince Sameth to confront the truth about their true fate. Recommended level: secondary.

title: Tales from the Perilous Realm
description: Four Tolkien novellas ("Farmer Giles of Ham, Leaf by Niggle, Smith of Wootton Major," and "Roverandom") and one book of poems ("The Adventures of Tom Bombadil") have been fully illustrated in a single volume for the first time.

title: Breaking Open the Head
description: A young US writer presents a visionary novel called 'The Doors of Perception' that explores the transformation from cynicism to shamanism in an accessible manner.

title: The Yiddish Policemen's Union
description: For sixty years, Jewish refugees and their descendants have thrived in the Federal District of Sitka, a temporary refuge that was established after the Holocaust and the collapse of Israel in 1948. They are proud, grateful (both now residing in Anchorage, Alaska) and longing to be American, and have created their own little world in an active yet diverse frontier city full of Yiddish music.

title: Beware  Princess Elizabeth
description: Life or death - and the Throne of England.

title: The Family Way
description: In Tony Parsons' latest bestseller, three couples discover that Mother Nature can be a bitch.

title: Endless Night
description: Despite the beauty of Gipsy S Acre, Michael Rogers was mesmerized by the dark trees and his desire to build a house.

title: How to be Alone
description: 'The Harper's Essay' is reprinted in this volume, along with personal essays and humorous, often comical reportage. Despite its broad scope, each piece deals with the erosion of civic life and private dignity, as well as the concealed existence of loneliness in postmodern America.

title: The Mysterious Mr. Quin
description: A mysterious stranger arrives at Mr Satterthwaite's house after midnight, causing him to feel like the party had already begun.

title: The Listerdale Mystery
description: A collection of intriguing mysteries, including the mysterious disappearance of Lord Listerdale, a young woman's fear of her ex-partner, an unexpected meeting on ICE train, and gruesome murder mysteries.

title: The Real Trial of Oscar Wilde
description: In 1895, Oscar Wilde engaged in a highly charged romantic relationship with Lord Alfred "Bosie" Douglas. The Marquess of Queensberry delivered resentful mail to the Albemarle Club in which they addressed Osie's father, who encouraged him to write. He lost and was later imprisoned with two years of hard labor after being tried twice for gross indecency.

title: I Can Read with Me Eyes Shut!
description: The story has been nonsensical for over four years.

title: Oh  the Places You'll Go!
description: A humorous look at the mishaps and mutilations that life may cause.

title: If I Die in a Combat Zone
description: The Vietnam War's most exceptional book, reissued in 1970, is believed to be one of the five jewels on the Flamingo backlist.

title: The Return of the King
description: Frodo and Sam encountered a formidable challenge in their quest to conquer Middle-earth, as Sauron's Dark Lord emerged victorious. They ventured deep into Mordor with Sam before finally taking on the Ring of Power.

title: The Silmarillion
description: Designed to take fans of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings further into Middle-earth myths and legends, The Silmarillion is an account of what happens during the Elder Days in Tolkien's world.

title: I Wish that I Had Duck Feet
description: A boy imagines what his life would be like if he had duck feet, a whale spout and an elephant’s trunk.

title: Oh Say Can You Say?
description: When you're trying to read aloud, tie your tongue in knots and tinker with a nonsensical story.

title: There's a Boy in the Girls' Bathroom
description: A guide to the book There's a Boy in the Girl'S bathroom.

title: Microserfs
description: Dan, Susan, Abe, Todd, and Bug are currently employed at Microsoft, but they are finding it hard to make ends meet in the high-paying job. Despite their hard work and significant earnings, they will never reach the same level of wealth as Bill, who also prioritizes email for communication.

title: Miss Wyoming
description: With this exceptional novel from the cult classic author, Susan and John must find each other.

title: Where Rainbows End
description: The author of PS, I LOVE YOU has written a heartfelt and moving story that follows the friendship and difficult upbringing of Rosie and Alex, who have faced numerous challenges throughout their years.

title: Poirot
description: Ariadne Oliver's sleuthing companion in POIROT is showcased in four uncharacteristically modern novels set in the 1960s, including Third Girl, Hallowe'en Party, Elephants Can Remember, and The Pale Horse.

title: The Art of The Lord of the Rings
description: The ultimate guide to the design of the Lord of Rings movie, featuring the best artwork from the trilogy and numerous un-published paintings, sketches, digital shots, and photos. This authoritative and insightful book provides complete access to artwork created over a five-year period, including more than 400 exclusive images. The official book has also been combined with the first three Art books, which contain significantly larger artworks in addition to new text and information along with interviews with many artists.

title: The Known World
description: An epic tale that examines slavery from a moral perspective.

title: Discover Your Destiny with the Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
description: A powerful means of self-discovery that will enable you to live your best life and attain the happiness, prosperity, and inner peace you desire. Written by the author of The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari, a world-renowned author.

title: Naked Lunch
description: The godfather of the Beats' anarchic, phenomenally strong-selling classic has been given a new coat of paint and is now available in black.

title: Tropic of Cancer
description: Henry Miller's first novel, which was banned in Britain for almost three decades, is now being reprinted in a new Harper Perennial Modern Classics issue. The book chronicles his experiences of living among prostitutes, pimps and the penniless artists of Montenegro.

title: Close Range
description: Ang Lee has created a movie that features the title story of this collection of shorts.

title: The Love of the Last Tycoon
description: Describes the workings of the Hollywood film industry and its significance in shaping American society.

title: The Song of Rhiannon
description: A new interpretation of The Mabinogion features Manawydon reunites with Rhiannon, but is soon disturbed by the Gray Man's appearance, who seeks revenge against those who claim the Goddess.

title: Heart Songs and Other Stories
description: Annie Proulx, the author of The Shipping News, was already a prolific writer of short fiction in the country. Here are her collected stories, which include two new works that were never anthologized before and explore rural tradition, nature, and rituals of small-town life. The country is blue-collar New England; the characters are native families and the dispossessed working class, whose heritage is challenged by the urban bourgeoisie from the city.

title: The voyage of the Dawn Treader
description: The "Dawn Treader" is the first ship in Narnia to be sailed since day one. It was built by King Caspian to find the seven lords, who were good people that his evil uncle Mizaz had banished when he took over. Edmund, Lucy, and their cousin Eustace travel down to the Eastern Islands, beyond the Silver Sea, before reaching Aslan's country at the End of the World.

title: The Short Stories of Ernest Hemingway
description: The forty-nine stories are a reflection of Hemingway's personal struggles and triumphs.

title: The Screwtape Letters ; With  Screwtape Proposes a Toast
description: C.S. Lewis's most celebrated work is this witty correspondence between Screwtape and his apprentice Wormwood, who both aim to create a human' soul in hell. It contains insightful insights into temptation, repentance, and grace, while also providing readers with intelligent insight into the nature of good deeds.

title: The Elements of Style
description: The only style manual ever published on best-seller lists offers practical, fundamental guidance on enhancing writing skills, advocating for a style that is simple, straightforward, and sincere.

title: The Presocratics
description: The Library of Liberal Arts title.

title: The Rumble Seat Pony
description: A neglected pony is discovered and rescued by three children who are riding in the rumble seat of their old yellow car.

title: The Journey with Grandmother
description: A boy from Sweden has been bringing his relatives from their farm in Scandinavia to make unusual items out of human hair for a living.

title: Tyranny of the Majority
description: Despite the public hearing she was denied, her essays showcased the sharpness and nuance of analysis applied to electoral problems. Her tough-minded explorations should engage those interested in the mechanisms of democracy. It doesn't matter what you believe you are; it's all here, whether you argue or agree. -- Henry Louis Gates, Jr. Lani Guinier: A powerful book that will bring hope and positive change to a public discourse conversation we desperately need to revive.

title: The Origins of the Civil Rights Movement
description: This book, which combines theoretical analysis and interviews with prominent civil rights activists from the 1960s and 1970s, documents the events of the movement's turbulent first decade.

title: Presidential Power and the Modern Presidents
description: Induces a concept of presidential power, and compares it to the circumstances in the administrations of postwar presidents.

title: Rest  Rabbit  Rest
description: Rabbit's busy schedule is disrupted by his friends who try to mislead him into sleeping.

title: Where the Red Fern Grows
description: A young boy in the Ozarks fulfills his biggest dream by owning two redbone hounds and training them to become champion hunters.

title: Poppy's Return
description: Gray House, the girlhood home where Poppy left herself years ago, is currently experiencing trouble. Her family has contacted her to save them all, including her mother, father, sisters, brothers, and deer mouse relatives—all too often insane. She invites her rebellious son, Junior, along with Mephitis and Ereth, to join her on the journey across Dimwood Forest for a better chance of bringing them together.

title: Diary of a Spider
description: Doreen Cronin and Harry Bliss, the authors of The Diary Of A Worm, share a humorous perspective on how spiders can be intimidating.

title: An Old-Fashioned Thanksgiving
description: Seven children in nineteenth-century New England are depicted in an adaptation of the original story as they prepare for Thanksgiving holiday, while their mother is away caring for Grandmother.

title: The Paradox of Choice
description: In The Battle for Human Nature, the author explains why excessive choice has resulted in more intricate everyday decisions, how overconsumption of a desirable thing has negatively impacted human psychology and emotions, and how we can prioritize making correct decisions.

title: How to Read Literature Like a Professor
description: What is the significance of a fictional protagonist's journey, meal, and rain shower?

title: The Amazing Maurice and His Educated Rodents
description: With his rat pipe, the winner of the 2001 Carnegie Medal One prize appeared frequently and could have easily spread plague.

title: The Wee Free Men
description: The Wee Free Men, a group of fiercely aggressive and fearless witch-like characters, are dispatched to make amends with Tiffany Aching.

title: Going Postal
description: Despite being told his confidence in his actions was only due to hanging punishment, Moist Van Lipwig eventually found himself with no choice but to accept a job offer from the government as Postmaster.

title: Modern Mind
description: In an encyclopedic collection of works by major writers, artists, scientists and philosophers from the likes of Freud, Babbitt, Animal Farm (Faragan and Sartre) to Alexander Graham Bell, the Theory of Relativity, psychologists such as Jean-Claude Van Rompuy, historian Peter Watson or contemporary Pablo Picasso, The Modern Mind offers a fluent and captivating overview of twentieth century intellectual tradition along with its women and their ideas.

title: She Went All the Way
description: Lou Calabrese and Jack Townsend, a successful screenwriter, are brought back to the wilds of Alaska by helicopter crash, but they find themselves in peril.

title: Island
description: Science on the island of Pala reveals its beauty and vitality to a shipwrecked journalist.

title: A Year in the Life of William Shakespeare
description: The year 1599 was a time of great hope for Shakespeare and his plays, with Henry the Fifth, Julius Caesar, As You Like It, and Hamlet being among the works written in that decade.

title: Lucy Sullivan Is Getting Married
description: What happens when Lucy learns from a psychic that she is getting married within the next year? Her roommates are panicked! What will happen to their blissful lives of eating take-out, drinking too much wine, hanging out with men, and never cleaning their rooms? Lucy confides in friends that her life is consumed by arguments with her mother and caring for her irresponsible father.

title: The Terminal Man
description: In an effort to electronically regulate the violent paranoid, a team of surgeons perform surgery on him.

title: The Art of the Novel
description: Stunning: Kundera looks at the work of such great, diverse and influential writers as Rabelais, Cervantes, Sterne (who went on to write several hundred years for France), Diderot, Flaubert, Tolstoy, Musil (1958), and his analysis of the world of Kafka's novels portrays the comical terror of this bureaucratic foetus with its own thoughts; also discussing his views on the role of historical events in fiction; the nature or meaning of action; and the creation of character in literature.

title: The Bromeliad Trilogy
description: Hundreds of tiny nomes inhabit the corners and crannies of a department store run by humans, living beneath the floorboards for generations and not remembering life beyond the walls. They arrive at the Store from the Outsiders carrying masks known as Masklin, who deliver devastating news about their inexplicable past: "We'll come back to Earth one day and pick up where we left off."

title: Merry Christmas  Amelia Bedelia
description: Amelia Bedelia is in charge of preparing the Rogers home for Aunt Myra's visit on Christmas Eve, making it one of the most entertaining Christmases yet!

title: Identity
description: The book "Identity" by Linda Asher is a reflection of Milan Kundera's approach to the theme of couples and their inability to identify with one another.

title: The thief of always
description: A mysterious stranger's invitation to the magical Holiday House to pass over is a source of entertainment for Harvey, ten. But his enjoyment soon becomes more demanding than ever as he learns that his fun has been cut short by an unexpected expense.

title: The Illustrated Alchemist
description: The story's purpose is to instruct the reader on how to think creatively, listen to their emotions, and most importantly pursue their aspirations.

title: Mars and Venus Book of Days
description: Maintains a daily perspective on the dissimilarities in conduct and expression between males and females.

title: The Last of the Really Great Whangdoodles
description: At one point, the Whangdoodle was the most intelligent, kind-hearted, and extraordinary animal in existence. He then vanished and established a magnificent domain for himself and other exceptional creatures such as Sidewinders (ten legged side), Flukes (little furry flukes), Whiffle Birds (friendly household name), and Prock (tradable, unrisky person). It was an almost flawless setting where the last of the world's greatest animals could rule over their realm with "peace, love, joy," and despite being hidden from view to be kept safely under the strat

title: Today I Feel Silly & Other Moods That Make My Day
description: Today, I felt foolish. My mother blames the heat for my lack of motivation, while I dressed up and ate food like a star.

title: The Missing Piece Meets the Big O
description: With a sense of compassion and simplicity, Shel Silverstein's words and drawings depict the lost object sitting alone, waiting for someone to come and take it somewhere else.

title: Lafcadio  the Lion Who Shot Back
description: "I am not obligated to shoot you," says the young lion. The hunter is unwilling to let the hunters down, so they sit on me and toast marshmallows while Lafcadio takes charge of his new hunting duties.

title: The Secret Garden Cookbook
description: The Secret Garden by Frances Hodgson Burnett is a delightfully simple cookbook that features recipes for all the dishes, including comfort food, homemade currant buns, hearty soups and home-made bread.

title: Laura's Album
description: Despite being best known for her Little House books, Laura Ingalls Wilder lived a rich life that included collecting memorabilia from her childhood and private collections. These items, including her early writings, letters, photographs, and other artifacts have been preserved in both private and public collections across the United States. This book, published by William Anderson, brings together these rare images and mementos of Laura in one stunning volume.

title: Quivers
description: The Howard Stern Show's outspoken co-host shares her harrowing tale of being a child subjected to sexual abuse and living in poverty, sharing her ongoing struggle for healing and her friendship with Stern.

title: Moonspinners
description: As she works as a secretary at the British Embassy on Crete, Nicola Ferris meets up with two hiking companions who were unintentionally involved in an act of terror. Reprint.

title: Small Wonder
description: From a time of darkness, the author of High Tide in Tucson brings to life an extended love song for the world we still have. These essays are grounded in her belief that our biggest challenges have arisen from nowhere and even in our backyards, and that solutions can be found in both places.

title: Worlds Enough & Time
description: Dan Simmons, a remarkable artist with few competitors in his craft, boasts about his ability to push boundaries and exude confidence through captivating works of fiction. His latest release features five stunning masterworks of speculative fiction, including "Orphans of the Helix" which showcases the exceptional talent, artistic vision, and craftsmanship of an iconic figure.

title: The Cheese Monkeys
description: Having designed over 1,500 book jackets for authors such as Anne Rice and Michael Chrichton, Kidd has produced The Cheese Monkeys, a college novel set in the late 1950s.

title: Travels
description: Often, I feel like I'm traveling to some other place to reflect on my identity. When Michael Crichton, a Harvard-educated physician, popular novelist, and movie director, began experiencing loneliness in his own life, it was apparent that he needed to broaden his perspective. He scoured the jungles of Rwanda, as well as climb Kilimanjaro and Mayan pyramids for food. In Pakistan, she braved mud to swim against sharks in Tahiti.

title: Caesar
description: The fictional portrayal of Julius Caesar depicts his life, including the triumph over Gaul, his tragic fall from grace at the Rubicon River, and his subsequent personal tragedies.

title: The Forever War
description: Despite being drafted into the interstellar army as a soldier, William Mandella's battle with the Taurans is overshadowed by the effects of faster-than-light space travel.

title: Amelia Bedelia Goes Camping
description: Despite having never been to Camp Out Amelia Bedelia, she's trying her best to follow the instructions, but pitching a tent is different from throwing one into the bush, and it'll be tough to catch fish with your bare hands. The mixed-up housekeeper makes this camping trip very enjoyable as usual.

title: The Secret Sister
description: Despite her initial escape from the impoverished rural West, Christy McKenna finds an unlikely friend in Outlaw Archer's story.

title: Amelia Bedelia Helps Out
description: This time, Amelia Bedelia Helps Out is brought to life in full color as an I Can Read Book. She is the beloved housekeeper who loves being able to help out at her neighbor's house.

title: Whirlpool
description: The mysterious Faberge egg, which is crafted with great care and skill, becomes the only source of assistance for Laurel Swann's father.

title: Teach Us  Amelia Bedelia
description: Mr. Carter's misapprehension of Amelia Bedelia, the charming and intelligent student, will forever alter the course of their class!

title: Cryptonomicon
description: Neal Stephenson delves into the private lives of men and their clandestine histories to uncover the forces that shaped the 20th century. In his first volume, he describes how Lawrence Pritchard Waterhouse, an untrained mathematical genius and young U.S. Navy Captain, was assigned to detachment 272, an outfit that is so secret that only a few people are aware of its existence, including names like Churchill and Roosevelt.

title: Falling Up
description: Libri GmbH reserves all rights for this compilation of comedic poems and drawings.

title: Anansi Boys
description: Fat Charlie Nancy's life was cut short when his father died on a Florida karaoke stage, leaving him unaware of his godfather and untold. Now, his brother Spider is set to make his life more thrilling and treacherous.

title: Fragile Things
description: A strange circus shows terrorizes the audience before disappearing into the night, bringing one of the spectators with them.

title: What Went Wrong?
description: The Islamic world was at the forefront of human achievement for centuries, while Christian Europe remained a source of barbarism and unbelief. This changed as the West gained success in both military and economic arenas. Bernard Lewis' book examines the anguished response of the Islamic community towards modern-day global issues.

title: Letters from the Earth
description: In Letters from the Earth, Twain presents himself as the Father of History and emphasizes his responsibility to listen carefully to what he says.

title: Savannah Blues
description: Eloise "Weezie" Foley was a hit in Savannah's historic district due to her catch, while Talmadge Evans III exiled her to the backyard carriage house after their divorce. She now enjoys parties with Caroline DeSantos, his new partner and an accomplished antiques picker who searches for treasure on Savannah streets and garages.

title: The Whipping Boy
description: The Prince and his Pauper Jemmy, who were once poor children living on the streets, live in a castle. When Prince Brat misbehaves, they are punished with whipping and other punishments. Although their friendship is limitless, both boys are forced to trust each other after being kidnapped and taken hostage.

title: The Innovator's Dilemma
description: According to Clayton M. Christensen, a Harvard professor, exceptional companies can either lose their market leadership or disappear completely, as illustrated in his book "Disruptive technology for the next great wave."

title: A Nose for Murder
description: The discovery of Allison DeMarco's body on the kitchen floor, accompanied by her high-spirited Airedale companion Ginger, necessitates the intervention of former cop-turned-dog trainer Jack Field, who must use his unique abilities to uncover the truth.

title: Happiness
description: What is the reason behind Edwin de Valu's contract?

title: Size 12 Is Not Fat
description: Former pop star Heather Wells has left behind a wave of enthusiastic fans to settle into 'new adult life' Strange events at her college land her again, this time as the hot-headed female detective. Original publication 100,000 copies.

title: Warrior of the Light
description: The Alchemist's best-selling book, Warrior of the Light: A Manual, is a source of inspiration for many. It offers practical tips for living life to the fullest, sharing personal aspirations, experiencing the unknown and setting your own course. Paulo Coelho employs his unique approach to bring out the warrior spirit within each person we encounter. He also educates those who recognize the beauty of being alive, the embrace of failure, and purpose in their journey.

title: The Devil and Miss Prym
description: A group of people, fueled by greed, cowardice, and fear, are confronted with the prospect of questioning their existence, death, power, or fortune.

title: The Big Bing
description: Stanley Bing's perspective on the society in which we all live and work is one of the most entertaining, thought-provoking, and simply hilarious in contemporary letters.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: The Buenda family's story of the rise and fall of a mythical town in Mexico, known as Macondo, is the subject of One Hundred Years of Solitude, acclaimed throughout the world for its rich and brilliant chronicle of life and death.

title: Walt Whitman
description: The combination of Whitman's genius, passion, poetry, and androgynous sensibility forged an exuberant life in the turbulent American landscape of the mid-nineteenth century. Kaplan provides a detailed analysis of his mysterious selves, exploring both the rich and the poor, who worshipped democracy and brotherhood of man.

title: How to Make Love Like a Porn Star
description: Upon being brought off the plane in my wheelchair, I was terrified to even consider seeing my father. The stewardess asked me where my parents were after a few minutes, but I couldn't help but cry.

title: The Outsider
description: Cross Damon, who is confined to his own skin color, escapes from Chicago's South Side and moves to Harlem, where he becomes affiliated with the Communist Party.

The journey of a remarkable Chinese shipwreck, which was charted 70 years before Columbus, is chronicled in "1421," an 8-page document that includes 37 maps and diagrams after 15 years of meticulous research.

title: The Andromeda Strain
description: A deadly bacteria brought back from space by satellite finds it hard to define and contain, prompting a team of scientists.

title: Congo
description: The lost city of Zinj is the ultimate destination for diamond hunters in Africa, who are accompanied by a California scientist, ruthless corporate agent, and mercenary hunter with the latest gifts of advanced technology.

title: Johnny and the Dead
description: At the age of twelve, Johnny Maxwell and his friends start battling it out to save the local cemetery after he began seeing and talking to ghosts suddenly.

title: Amelia Bedelia 40th Anniversary Collection
description: In a three-book I Can Read box set, Amelia Bedelia, the beloved literal-minded housekeeper, commemorates her 40th birthday.

title: The Girls of Lighthouse Lane #3
description: During a scarlet fever outbreak in 1906, Lizabeth, who was thirteen years old at the time, has to choose between being Strawberry Queen or attending to her sick little sister.

title: The Bradbury Chronicles
description: While working on a cover story for the Chicago Tribune Magazine, Sam Weller, satiriophile, interviewed Ray Bradbury, his editors, family members and friends. He also found never-before-published letters, documents, and photographs that tell the story of this literary hero and his remarkable creative journey. The biography is incredibly detailed and comprehensive, providing insight into Bradoni's life and career.

title: Three Rotten Eggs
description: In rural Vermont, the students in Miss Earth's class face a spring full of events as they are introduced to ogling young ones, competitive egg hunts, and genetically modified chicks.

title: The Wicked Day
description: King Arthur's secret love interest, the Morgause witch, was born out of their incestuous relationship. As a result, Mordred is raised in secrecy and becomes Arthur’s most trusted counselor due to events he cannot deny. This ultimately leads to battles between the two sons on the "wicked day of destiny."

title: The Game
description: In almost every major city, there is an underground sex clinic where men engage in sexual activities using the most effective techniques known to attract women. This is not a fictional story; men who live together in Projects reside within these houses. Neil Strauss spent two years living among them, using his pseudonym Style to protect his identity and ultimately created one of the best and most controversial books of all time this year.

title: The Lion  the Witch and the Wardrobe (picture book edition)
description: The magical world of Narnia is filled with wonder and excitement, attracting visitors to meet Aslan, the bravest of all animals, and a beautiful but evil witch. It also offers entertainment for those who are not familiar with the story.

title: Gold
description: Asimov's fifty years of science fiction are overshadowed by Gold, the ultimate triumphant achievement. The first section features a diverse range of stories from humor to profoundness, with "Gold" being the central story that showcases hex themes and reveals his gamble for immortality.

title: The Kindness of Strangers
description: As she navigates the difficulties of raising her two sons and a daughter who is struggling to keep her family together, Sarah finds herself suddenly faced with the unexpected arrival of another troubled young boy. She has recently become 'Sir Danny's foster mother, having survived ten years due to their close relationship in high school but is now seeking his brother'll have to make amends for some lost loved ones. All too often, when tragedy strikes nears them all, everything seems to be falling apart.

title: Built to Last
description: This groundbreaking book, written by Jim Collins and Jerry Porras, is not solely focused on charismatic visionaries, aspiring entrepreneurs, or those seeking to create lasting companies. It offers practical advice and breaks down myths that have been discredited over the years.

title: Fluke
description: Nate Quinn and his team of marine behavioral biologists have been poking, charting, recording, and photographing humpback whales for the purpose of singing. However, it's not until recently that a whale raises its tail to show cryptic letters: "Bite me." Does this mean he hasn't spent more time in the sun?

title: Lord of Light
description: Despite the death of Earth, a group of men has taken over technology and become immortal as the gods of Hinduism. They are now ruling over only one entity: Mahasamatman, Binder of Demons, and Lord of Light.

title: The Perennial Philosophy
description: Aldous Huxley's exploration of the spiritual beliefs of different religious traditions is described as "The metaphysic that recognizes a divine Reality substantial to the world of things, lives, and minds."

title: A Crack in the Edge of the World
description: The earthquake that occurred in the early hours of April 18, 1906, caused San Francisco to be shattered within a minute due to ancient geological forces. Simon Winchester is renowned for his captivating narratives about the earthquake and its devastating impact on American history as well as the fascinating subterranean processes that led to its creation, which is now widely believed to have catastrophic effects.

title: Dead Witch Walking
description: In Cincinnati's "the Hollows," all the nighttime creatures gather to hide, party, and feed. Rachel Morgan is responsible for maintaining a civilized world where predators exist in every corner. As enigmatic as she may be (it depends on whom you ask), she will work diligently to bring them back alive or dead.

title: The Good  the Bad  and the Undead
description: Rachel Morgan, a self-proclaimed witch and bounty hunter, is facing the challenge of navigating the mawls of downtown Cincinnati with her powerful skills. She can handle both mendibles and an ancient evil that thrives on black magic.

title: Men Are from Mars  Women Are from Venus
description: Men Are from Mars, Women Are From Venus is a timeless and highly recommended relationship book that has helped millions of couples understand the differences they experience in terms of communication, emotional needs, and compatibility.

title: Sabriel (adult)
description: The daughter of the enchanted Abhorsen, Sabriel, must venture into the ancient and magical realm to save her father from danger in the Land of Dead.

title: Slouching Toward Nirvana
description: This place is a sanctuary for the dead and those who are dying, as well as the cross's builders and burners.

title: Bad Childhood---Good Life
description: The author explores the impact of history on the present, exploring ways to grasp each person's coping mechanism and harness the exceptional power of human spirit that will enable them to move from victim to champion.

title: Cat Cross Their Graves
description: Patty Rose, a classic film star, decided to buy the village inn in Molena Point, California and spend her golden years there. However, she was brutally murdered as the town gathered for remembrance of her past films.

title: Cat Breaking Free
description: Molena Point, California, is home to Joe Grey, Feline P.I. - the fur of which shines brightly when a gang from L.A. comes flying in and steals from the small shops around town. Joe wonders if the blonde living with his human companion Clyde could be her pet, as it has been his sincere childhood hobby.

title: Slider
description: Every summer, the nation's elite college players convene on Cape Marlin fields in New England to participate in the sport of baseball. Jack Faber, a young hotshot with an uninspired slider and spitting out batting dunk, is part of the Seapuit Seawolves team. His goal is to join the Big Show, but his new coach, former professional catcher Bruno Riazzi, finds himself disenchanted by Fabregas and decides to take him down.

title: The Black Dahlia Files
description: In 1946, Elizabeth Short travelled to Hollywood with the aim of being famous and see her name in the spotlight. However, her naked body was later discovered in an empty parking lot, earning her the nickname "Black Dahlia." Despite the efforts of over four hundred police officers and homicide investigators, the crime remained unsolved. Now, after endless speculation and false accusations, author Donald H. Wolfe has found new evidence.

title: Metro Girl
description: During the Miami Beach chase, Alexandra Barnaby (Barney) makes an appearance and takes part in high-speed car rides, searching for lost treasure, and racing alongside Sam Hooker.

title: Motor Mouth
description: A thrilling sequel to Metro Girl returns with the addition of Alexandra "Barney" Barnaby, who takes on a new set of villains, exciting adventure in the Florida heat, and romanticizes with Sam Hooker, an attractive race car driver.

title: Mystic River
description: After their childhood friendship was cut short by a tragic incident where two boys were unintentionally left the street, leaving Sean Devine, Jimmy Marcus, and Dave Boyle as friends until they lost their lives in '45-year marriage.'

title: Great Short Works of Herman Melville
description: The Scrivener, Billy Budd, Sailor, and Bartleby are two of the most renowned short stories in history. They are included in a beautifully redesigned collection that represents the best short work of an American master.

title: The Day I Swapped My Dad for Two Goldfish
description: If you were to exchange anything for your best friend's two goldfish, including your father, what would happen?

title: Eleven Minutes
description: A young girl from a Brazilian village, Maria is the subject of Eleven Minutes. Her initial innocent love encounter leaves her heartbroken. At just 15 years old, she becomes convinced that love is 'a hellraish' and carries with it pain. She travels to Geneva after meeting an attractive young painter who convinces her that fame and fortune are not at stake. In this odyssey, everything seems to be going wrong.

title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
description: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance by Robert M. Pirsig is considered one of the most influential books written in 50 years by people who have delved into the human experience, including love, loss of self, passion for beauty, sustenance, connection to death, spiritual renewal, and more.

title: Ulysses S. Grant
description: The first volume in Harper's Eminent Lives series, which includes Korda' acclaimed storytelling skills, tells the story of Ulysses S. Grant, who ended the Civil War with a sense of wonder, served as president twice and wrote one of the most successful military memoirs in American literature.

title: A Dirty Job
description: Despite being a normal person, Charlie Asher is often mistaken for someone who is hypocritical and avoids responsibility. He is known as 'A Beta Male' and has been fortunate to manage his own business in San Francisco while working at YMCA with the help of fellow Alpha Males.

title: Quicksilver
description: In Quicksilver, a story about Daniel Waterhouse, an adventurous and rebellious individual, who seeks knowledge from the most prominent minds of Baroque Europe. He is transported through wretched times amid arguments between reason and the bloody ambitions of the powerful. The book chronicles the extraordinary adventures of "Half-Cocked Jack" Shaftoe, former street urchin turned swashbuckling adventurer and legendary King of Vagabond, as well as other wild and historic events that rock music festival or disaster

title: Every Book Its Reader
description: Drawing inspiration from a significant exhibition held by the British Museum in 1963 to honor the five centuries of the printed word, Nicholas A. Basbanes offers spirited explorations of writings that have shaped history and influential individuals.

title: Flirting With Danger
description: Suzanne Enoch, the bestselling author of Love Is A Beautiful, is set in a stunningly beautiful world where she confronts both heinous crime scenes and romantic romance.

title: Lost Horizon
description: A new edition of the classic 1933 novel is available for purchase.

title: The Doors of Perception and Heaven and Hell
description: The celebrated writer and critic recounts his personal experimentation with the unfamiliar drug mescaline and delves into the concept of visionary experience, presented in an all-encompassing edition that features the two iconic works The Doors of Perception and Heaven and Hell. Reissue.

title: Thanksgiving
description: Megan Murphy, who was upset by the floppy-eared rabbit's behavior and found out it was chewing on her skirt, thought she might forgive its owner, but Dr. Patrick Hunter appeared too good-looking to hold back for long. The two are now enjoying Thanksgiving dinner with their families.

title: Love Overboard
description: Prior to Plum's era, I wrote twelve short romance novels. These books were all red-hot screwball comedies, and nine of them were originally published by the Loveswept line between 1988 and 1992. They were only available for purchase at used bookstores and yard sales. Now, they are being reissued by HarperCollins, with Love Overboard being the second book in the series presented in its almost authentic format.

title: Back to the Bedroom
description: Before Plum, I wrote twelve short romance novels. Each one was a red-hot screwball comedy. Nine of these stories were originally published by the Loveswept line between 1988 and 1992. They were only found at used bookstores and yard sales. Now, they are being reissued by HarperCollins. Back to the Bedroom is presented in its almost original state, with minor editing to correct some embarrassing errors.

title: The Rocky Road to Romance
description: Steve Crow was unable to persuade Daisy Adams to accept the position of a temporary traffic reporter due to her tall, dark and deliciously dangerous boss.

title: Thomas Jefferson
description: The revolutionary Christopher Hitchens biography of Thomas Jefferson offers a unique perspective on the Founding Father, situating him within the context of America's evolution and tracing his legacy beyond it.

title: Muhammad
description: After being born in 570 CE, Muhammad established a prosperous spiritual community and founded he religion, which revolutionized world history. Although his life story is less documented than that of any other significant faith founder, there is ample historical evidence to support this belief. Karen Armstrong's newly published biography of Muhammad will provide readers with insights into the true nature and spirit of dissenting religion amid prevalent stereotypes of it being cruel, intolerant, and violent.

title: Meeting Jesus Again for the First Time
description: Marcus Borg's latest book, Meeting Jesus Again, is unique in its exploration of the role of biblical scholarship in shaping personal faith. It highlights the importance of embracing historical findings and perspectives to develop a new faith in Christ, rather than adopting traditional dogma.

title: Reading the Bible Again for the First Time
description: How can we read the Bible with scientific and critical considerations that align with our understanding of history and truth?

title: Shadow of the Almighty
description: A new introduction to the story of Jim Elliot and four other missionaries who were martyred by the Auca Indians in Ecuador.

title: The Dance of the Dissident Daughter
description: The Secret Life of Bees by the author offers insights into a woman's spiritual journey, yet I was left feeling unprepared and at loggerheads with my own personal struggles.

title: C.S. Lewis
description: C. S. Lewis, who is widely recognized as the author of The Chronicles of Narnia and the most influential Christian writer of our time, has captivated millions with his insightful insights, passionate arguments, and provocative questions about God, love, death. This collection includes material from various published works including The Screwtape Letters, Mere Christianity, The Four Loves (one of the Seven Kingdoms), The Five Love Arguments (1963), and lesser-known but highly respected works by or on Charles Dickens such as The Lock

title: The Screwtape Letters
description: Through this humorous and eloquent conversation, C. S. Lewis explores moral dilemmas such as good vs. evil, temptation, repentance, and grace. The tale provides the reader with an enhanced perspective on living a righteous life.

title: Mere Christianity
description: A concise and accessible account of Christian belief that has become a popular introduction to Christianity.

title: Learning to Love
description: Thomas Merton, a self-reliant individual who has spent his life in solitude in his own hermitage, is confronted with unforeseen challenges. A hospital visit leads to sex and confusion, leaving him with questions about his commitment to celibacy and religious faith. This remarkable book examines his struggle to reconcile his unexpected love with the social issues of his time, including racial tensions.

title: The Mediator #4: Darkest Hour
description: Suze, who is deeply in love with her fiancée Jesse, realizes that the ghost of Maria de Silva from the 1800s has a powerful influence on her life.

title: Cash
description: The "Man in Black" was a legendary country singer and troubadour from the United States who had traveled to China, conquered slavery, and lived his life. His autobiography offers insight into his experiences, triumphs, hardships (both positive and negative), and the lives of those around him.

title: The Collected Letters of C.S. Lewis  Volume 1
description: The first volume of personal correspondence by C. S. Lewis features letters written during his childhood, World War I army days, education at Oxford, atheist period, and early friendship with J. R. L. Tolkien.

title: Touching the Void
description: The Andes disaster was caused by the accident that saw Joe Simpson and his climbing partner Simon Yates climb to the top of a 21,000-foot peak. Simpson fell off the vertical face of an ice ledge, breaking his leg; in fact, it was all in the darkness when Yakes had finally cut the rope (much worse for Simpson), and even more ago, he would have been pulled to his death.

title: Anybody Out There?
description: In this new story about the lives and love of Claire, Maggie, Rachel, Helen, and Anna Walsh, Marian Keyes has brought the spotlight on her perfect life.

title: My Little Pony: Hide-and-Seek
description: Ponies are fond of playing hide-and-seek on a sunny day, but when Sparkleworks is absent, the ponies make the decision to have her find them.

title: The Confusion
description: A group of Barbary slaves, among them Half-Cocked Jack, King of the Vagabonds and Jack Shaftoe, devise a bold scheme to secure freedom and riches in 1689. They embark on grueling adventures for an enormous bounty of silver, gold, and mythical gold before Eliza, the impoverished countess of La Croix de la Zeur, is belittled by her masterly wealthy father during this period in Europe.

title: Bridge to Terabithia (rack)
description: Jess Aarons has a strong desire to become the fastest runner in his class. He practices regularly during the summer and can't wait to see her classmates smiling when he does it. However, on the first day of school, despite not having slept with anyone, Jespers discovers that she and Leslie Burke share their friendship and they create Terabithia, an ancient woodland kingdom where they live together.

title: Practical Demonkeeping
description: The first edition of Christopher Moore's shrewd debut novel features Travis O'Hearn, a handsome man and former "roads" writer, and Catch, an ugly monster who devours most of the people in his company. Meanwhile, Catch is caught in the middle of faking Tudor architecture at Pine Cove, California, while Travis watches TV shows.

title: Island of the Sequined Love Nun
description: Discover a delightfully insane tropical paradise with its own inhabitants of cargo gangs, cannibalistic creatures, neurotic creatures like the "baby rats" and their chatter on social media. The story follows Tucker Case, whose body is haunted by AIDS, as he works as an airline pilot for Mary Jean Cosmetics Corporation. However, his drunken flirtation with his superior leads to Tuck's decision to flee.

title: The Lust Lizard of Melancholy Cove
description: The town psychiatrist's decision to switch all individuals on their usual antidepressants to placebos in Pine Cove, California, has resulted in a naturally prosperous blues bar. However, the notes made by Steve the sea creature have also caught the attention of an enormous sea monster with ferocity for explosive oil tanker trucks, leading to erratic behavior and escalating crime scenes.

title: Weetzie Bat
description: During her fifteen-year tenure, Francesca Lia Block made a significant impact on the literary world with her book, Weetzie Bat. This book features ruffled feathers and witty details that seamlessly blend with Goat Girls and Beautiful Boys, matching the latter's style.

title: Behind the Curtain
description: Echo falls and a hidden secret are common at 99 Maple Lane, where Ingrid's father is facing repercussions for his job.

title: Catherine  Called Birdy (Summer Reading Edition)
description: Published by Clarion Books in New York in 1994.

title: Wicked Musical Tie-in Edition
description: In L. Frank Baum's classic tale, Dorothy was able to overcome the Wicked Witch of the West. However, what happened to her antagonist, the mysterious Witch? Where did she come from and what exactly became evil in Oz after that? Gregory Maguire creates a fantasy world so rich that we will never be matched again, while Munchkinlanders long for an alternate reality.

title: Son of a Witch
description: Gregory Maguire revisits the land of Oz ten years after the release of his famous novel, Wicked. He portrays Liir, a young boy who is both bruised and infertile.

title: This Rough Magic
description: While on vacation in Corfu, a young actress named Lucy Waring observes the murder of one of England's theater icons and becomes involved in threatening scenes.

title: Airs Above the Ground
description: The sight of Vanessa March's missing husband in a deadly fire made her question the mystery surrounding him, as she desperately sought answers from inside Vienna.

title: The Mediator #5: Haunted
description: Despite Suze's usual trouble, she finds herself in a difficult position. She is willing to give her heart to Paul Slater, who understands the emotional struggle between their two characters and their relationship.

title: Beauty
description: Beauty, despite her physical shortcomings and awkwardness, has never been fond of her moniker. She is not only beautiful but also vulnerable. When her father comes home with the tale of an enchanted castle in the forest, Beauty must go there first. Her father claims that she will be locked up for life, but Beauty insists on going to the castle instead.

title: Mating in Captivity
description: The book is designed for couples who love to revive their sexual passion, and it provides insight into how social taboos and ideals of domestic equality have impacted the healthy expression of eroticism in modern relationships.

title: Forgotten New York
description: With Over 300 years of history, architecture, and memories hidden away, Discovering the Lighthouse in Brooklyn offers a taste of New York's past.

title: The Dead Beat
description: Inspired by the remarkable events unfolding around her, Marilyn Johnson searched for the best obituaries in English and found those who wrote about the dead. She explored the dark corners of online chat rooms and traveled to London to read some of the most provocative and literate abysses ever written. With this newfound knowledge, she takes us on an intriguing journey through the ethos and social fabric of these obscure websites and the lives we don't acknowledge until we step into adulthood.

title: Charms for the Easy Life
description: The Birches, a family without significant partners, reside in the lush, green backwoods of North Carolina. Sophia and Margaret possess strong charms that keep them from loneliness, despair, and human misery. They are supported by the wise and resilient mother figure of Charlie Kate, who is renowned for her ability to heal and comfort people with broken hearts.

title: The Reading Group
description: A group of women who meet regularly to read and discuss books develop a strong bond over the course of ten months, with participants such as Harriet, Nicole, Polly, and Susan experiencing unexpected revelations.

title: A Couple of April Fools
description: April Fools' Day in Vermont is all about suspense as several suspects, including the teacher's wife and a mutant child who went missing last year are named.

title: What Christians Believe
description: The Essentials Explained by C. S. Lewis addresses important questions about Christianity, such as his identity and accomplishments. These essays were initially written on the BBC during World War II to explain the fundamental principles of Christianity. They are taken from the core section of Mere Christianity and offer an accessible way for individuals to discover their values and beliefs.

title: Psyche in a Dress
description: I could not abandon myself. Psyche had always been familiar with Love, which was fragrant with jasmine and tasted like fresh oranges. However, she lost herself too soon and yearning to be transformed into beauty like the gods and demons her lover once spoke of. She is constantly being tested and tempted by spirits and other forces to find beauty in the darkness.

title: YOU: The Owner's Manual
description: Describes the steps to physical health in greater detail, covering all body parts in a series of chapters that challenge common misconceptions and provide information on dietary, exercise, and therapeutic issues.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia Movie Tie-in Edition (adult)
description: Digory and Polly's endeavor to bring Jadis back to her wicked world creates a confusion in terms of magic, leading them to land in Narnia and witness Aslan speak human language while blessing the animals.

title: The Lion  the Witch and the Wardrobe Movie Tie-in Edition (rack)
description: They open a door and enter 'Narnia': A world frozen in eternal winter, enslaved by the White Witch who has locked up her son Aslan.

title: The Nightmare Room  Books 1-2-3: The Nightmare Begins!
description: Presents three accounts of teenagers haunted by dreadful curses and anomalous powers.

title: A Quick Bite
description: Lissianna Argeneau has been yearning for Mr. Right for years, but the hot guy hanging on her bed is more than capable of causing her to faint at times. This trait is particularly exaggerated in vampires, and there's also the fact that she doesn't seem to resist the sight of blood either.

title: Goodnight Moon 60th Anniversary Edition
description: A little bunny is positioned in bed, whispering "Goodnight, good night" while admiring familiar sights such as three bears on chairs, clocks, socks, and kittens.

title: Brave New World and Brave New World Revisited
description: Brave New World, a remarkable novel by Aldous Huxley, was first published in 1932. It presents his vision of realism and explains how people are genetically engineered to be passive members of society, making it the most influential work in history.

title: The Final Solution
description: An eighty-nine-year-old man, who used to be a famous detective and moved to the English countryside, is now more focused on his honey beekeeping than any other individual. Linus Steinman, despite his youth and lack of intelligence, has left Nazi Germany with an African gray parrot as his only companion. What does this mean: the covert chain of German numbers the bird releases -- the keys to dozens of Swiss bank accounts?

title: The Cat's Pajamas
description: The National Book Foundations' 2000 Medal for Distinguished Contribution to American Letters has been awarded with a collection of short stories that is both sweet and humorous, as well as captivating.

title: Holy Skirts
description: During the 1917 New York revolution, no woman had ever been like Bar-oness Elsa von Freytag-Loringhoven -- a poet, artist, proto-punk rocker, sexual libertine, fashion avatar, and unrepentant troublemaker. When not wandering the streets in Greenwich Village wearing tin cans, she would dance naked for Man Ray or Marcel Duchamp, or even strolling through beer halls with her poems.

title: Time For Kids: Butterflies!
description: Butterfly species number 20,000 worldwide, and although many have colorful wings, they don't start as butterflies. Instead, every butterfly hatches into a caterpillar from its small egg and transforms quickly to fluttering insects.

title: A False Mirror
description: An ex-partner who was falsely accused of attacking their former partner's spouse summons Scotland Yard inspector Ian Rutledge to a small harbor town, where he investigates an unusual coincidence while being reminded of his own past.

title: Cracks in My Foundation
description: In this acclaimed follow-up to Marian Keyes' celebrated essay collection, Under the Duvet, you can relax and enjoy some serious reading. With her trademark witty humor, Cracks in My Foundation is a testament to her ability to capture the heartfelt aspects of universal themes such as family, home, glamour, beauty, children, travel, and more with depth.

title: A Fistful of Charms
description: Rachel Morgan, a witch and bounty hunter, is hated by the evil night spirits that roam around Cincinnati. Her new reputation involves using the dark arts to transform human and undead into monsters, with her former lover returning to haunt her due to his hidden past. Meanwhile, some people are desperate for Nick's possessions; they are willing to go out of their way to destroy the Hollows and those in their vicinity.

title: For a Few Demons More
description: Rachel Morgan is caught up in a brutal Inderland gang war, the sudden rise of homicidal murderers, and the release of their master vampire.

title: Mysteries of Pittsburgh
description: This P.S. edition of The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay, won the Pulitzer Prize, includes an additional 16 pages that cover the book's author interviews, recommended reading, and other details.

title: Everything Is Illuminated tie-in
description: Accompanied by an elderly man with war-related memories, a charming dog named Sammy Davis, Junior, and Alex, Jonathan Safran Foer embarks on evocative journeys over the course of history.

title: Flight of the Nighthawks
description: The Conclave of Shadows, where two apprentices are ensnared, must also bring the most powerful agents of the dark magic to the city's core, as Midkemia faces an unknown destiny.

title: Into a Dark Realm
description: Pug and his Conclave of Shadows allies attempt to defeat the Guild of Assassins, but are confronted with opposition from powerful protectors of Leso Varen and a planned invasion by Dasati.

title: The 3-Hour Diet (TM) On the Go (Collins Gem)
description: With over 600 new options, you can now eat every 3 hours and see the weight loss benefits you crave. Don't count calories, sweets, or carbs! Time-Based NutritionTM is the revolutionary approach that unlocks your hunger pangs with slimming tips for fast food, restaurant fare, gas station snacks, and more. Visit www.3hourdiet.net today to learn how to lose weight like never before.

title: The Best American Crime Writing 2006
description: Incredibly gripping and shocking takes on real-life crime, The Best American Crime Writing's 2006 issue offers a unique insight into the lives of felons and their crimes.

title: Last of the Wilds
description: The White, who are the avatars of the Five Gods, have briefly halted the aggression of their enemies. As the plague persists and powerful wizards like the Dreamweavers return to earth with magical healing abilities, Auraya is sent on a desperate mission to reconcile with them. However, this will be cut short by unforeseen unexpected events as her allies face serious danger.

title: Voice of the Gods
description: The protectorate of the Siyee, Auraya, is unable to avoid being drawn into the terrible conflict. She fears that she may not be able to meet the demands of her former gods and is afraid of being rejected by an unknown woman who could make her an enemy of them.

title: Missing Mom
description: Nikki Eaton, a single woman in her thirties who is financially self-sufficient and free from marital obligations, experiences sweeping changes after the unexpected death of her mother, amid wretched circumstances that bring about harrowing moments of horror, sorrow, insight, wisdom, and even an unceasing love.

title: The Collected Letters of C.S. Lewis  Volume 3
description: The last part of a three-volume series is dedicated to his personal correspondences during the final phase of his life, which included writing the Narnia chronicles while at Cambridge.

title: Touch Not the Cat
description: Bryony Ashley is aware that her family's estate was once opulent and lavish, but now she longs for financial stability and tranquility. Her father't passing away overseas has left her feeling depleted and confided in a relative, yet the death of her father still affects her days and dreams.

title: King of the Vagabonds
description: The tale of "Half-Cocked Jack" Shaftoe, a legendary London street urchin who took extreme risks by risking her life for love and fame, is chronicled in detail.

title: Odalisque
description: The trials of Dr. Daniel Waterhouse and the Natural Philosophers intensify in an England teeming with war and royal insecurity, as Eliza, a beautiful and ambitious girl playing the role of enslaved double agent and confidante of enemy kings, faces unforeseen challenges.

title: Black Boy
description: Describes the author's journey from childhood to adulthood, experiencing hardships and struggles during the Jim Crow era in the South.

title: The Sheltering Sky
description: The Sheltering Sky is a seminal work of twentieth century literature. In this captivating tale, Paul Bowles delves into the causes of American isolation due to their inability to comprehend other cultures, leading to the destruction of those cultures. The book tells the story of three American journeyers who are lost in the cities and deserts of North Africa after World War II, exploring the boundaries of humanity when it encounters unimaginable emptiness and impassive cruelty of the desert. This P.S. edition features an additional 16 pages for information on author interviews, etc.

title: Rat Bastards
description: After the events of The Godfather, a man who has not spoken for over ten years opens up about his time infiltrating the notorious South Boston Irish mob led by Whitey Bulger, who remains on the loose as one of the world's Ten Most Wanted criminals, second only to Osama bin Laden.

title: The Last Days of Henry VIII
description: A historical account that captures the events leading up to the death of England's most despotic ruler and his court, with well-documented murder plots, terrifying betrayals, and sordid intrigue. Despite this, little attention has been given to his monarchy, particularly during the final years of his reign. The book is packed with detailed information from new archival sources and is written with the tension of a modern thriller genre.

title: The Thorn Birds
description: A new edition of the classic novel of forbidden love between Meggie Cleary and Father Ralph de Bricassart features Paddy Cleariness, a New Zealand farm worker who moves his family to an Australian sheep station owned by his wealthy sister, setting the stage for 'three generations of this indomitable family's story set in the early 20th century.

title: Krakatoa
description: The Krakatoa volcano-island's infamous earthquake and tsunami in 1883 are the subject of an investigation by Simon Winchester, author of The Professor and the Madman. The waves caused significant damage to several hundred lives, with effects far reaching as France, Bogotá and Washington, D.C., and bodies washed up in Zanzibar. Australia and India also heard devastating news from the island, followed by massive tsunamis and islands for miles.

title: The Professor and the Madman
description: Dr. W. C. Minor had submitted more than 10,000 words for the Oxford English Dictionary, which was one of the most ambitious projects in history. The book is a remarkable account of madness, genius, and extraordinary obsessions that led to the creation: "The Professor and the Madman" (Last Man's Tale) is an exquisitely researched and eloquent story

title: Hit Parade
