description: The anti-hero of Hit Man and Hit List, John Keller, is the introspective professional killer who returns in a new mystery story that explores his life, the ethics of his deadly career, and his potential retirement.

title: The Curtain
description: Based on the author's personal perspective on how the novel has influenced and contributed to western civilization, asserting that the growth of a novel transcends both language and international boundaries while unlocking new aspects of life. 35,000 copies were printed initially.

title: A Hard Day's Write  3e
description: The Beatles' lyrics are narrated by Steve Turner in a lavishly illustrated and heartfelt manner.

title: The Lion  the Witch and the Wardrobe Read-Aloud Edition
description: Through the use of a wardrobe, four English school children enter the magical realm of Narnia and help Aslan, the golden lion, defeat the White Witch who has cursed the land with eternal winter.

title: Mambo Kings Play Songs of Love  The Tie-in
description: Cesar and Nestor Castillo, two Cuban musicians who achieved stardom in New York City during the late 1940s, are now referred to as the "Mambo Kings." (Reissue) (Historical Fiction)

title: Sex with the Queen
description: Following the success of Sex with the Kings book, Eleanor Herman uncovers the secrets behind a queen's private mansion.

title: Brave New World
description: The classic prophetic novel by Huxley portrays the socialized horrors of a utopian future devoid of individual freedom.

title: Queen of Babble
description: Lizzie Nichols is once again in the hot seat when she aggravates her cheating partner, Andy, by pretending to be an unfaithful partner at a catered wedding in Provence, where the groom is left in disgrace, the bride is mobbed with insults, and Andy returns to ruin everything. 100,000 first printing.

title: Animal  Vegetable  Miracle
description: In her debut nonfiction book, Barbara Kingsolver shares a story that will challenge readers with its old truth: You are what you eat.

title: Good Omens
description: As per the Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch, which was written in 1655 before her exploding explosion, everything seems to be going according to Divine Plan except for two angelic forces and a fast-living demon.

title: Dates From Hell
description: Despite thinking that her date was exceptional, the man in question was not. It's true that we all had terrible dates and our worst-case scenarios were actually quite memorable. Thankfully, our partners were human! Kim Harrison, Lynsay Sands, Kelley Armstrong, and Lori Handeland are now offering up dating mistakes on books and magazines.

title: Continental Drift
description: Russell Banks's Continental Drift, a literary masterpiece that captures the essence of hope lost and gained, as well as the gripping narrative of fragile lives uprooted and changed by injustice, disappointment, and the seduction and reality of the American dream, is one of her most powerful works.

title: The Burglar Who Thought He Was Bogart
description: An exotic Eastern European beauty and her obsession with Humphrey Bogart films make Bernie Rhodenbarr a true love interest in the bookseller. However, their relationship suffers when they are both caught up in crime shows. This sparks Bernie's secret passion of burglary: taking valuable documents from his Park Avenue apartment but then being forced to flee early by the occupant after leaving without any chance of winning.

title: Next
description: Can a loved one be found without certain body parts? Are blondes becoming extinct? Is it common for all species to share the same food source?

title: How to Be Popular
description: Steph Landry, a teenager, discovers an old book on popularity and alters her social status by following its advice, much to the surprise of her two closest friends.

title: The Annotated Charlotte's Web
description: Charlotte's Web, one of America' best-loved children' s books, is written with a seamless flow that captures the heartfelt portrayal of characters who will remain prominent in children’s literature for all time; and it has an almost effortless pace and fluency that makes reading this book as enjoyable as it is reading. The Annotated CharlottesWeb provides access to the creator' studio and allows visitors to peer over the shoulder of one—the most rigorous and meticulous American writer, Tom Rhodes, while watching his masterpiece.

title: Charlotte's Web: Wilbur Finds a Friend
description: The introduction of Charlotte, a friendly spider, is what scares Wilbur the pig, who has just moved to another farm.

title: The Autumn of the Patriarch
description: Gabriel Garca Márquez's The Autumn of the Patriarch is one of his most ambitious and intricate works, as it tells the story of a Caribbean dictator who corrupts power. From charity to violence, from benevolence to bloodshed, fear of God to extreme cruelty, the dictator in this work embodies both the best and the worst of human nature.

title: How to Make Money Like a Porn Star
description: Claudia Corvette is the quintessential femme fatale in adult entertainment, known for her unkempt bedroom and super-sized body. Her life is a blend of childhood cliches and adulthood fantasies, as her videos project their blue light onto lonely men around the world.

title: Little House in the Big Woods
description: Two girls spend a year together on the Wisconsin frontier, helping their mother with daily chores, enjoying their father's stories and singing, and sharing special moments when they hang out or get together with family or neighbors.

title: Farmer Boy
description: Almanzo, a nine-year-old who now lives with his family on swanky farmland in New York State, is raising his two calves, helping with ice cutting and sheep pulling, and hoping to have his own colt by the end of the 19th century.

title: The Long Winter
description: The Newbery Honor Book reissues as Laura's family relocates from the claim shanty to town for the winter, with an Indian forecasting seven months of unfavorable weather.

title: Little Town on the Prairie
description: Laura dedicates her fifteenth summer to aiding Mary in her transition to a college for the blind.

title: The First Four Years
description: In the first four years of their marriage, Laura and Almanzo Wilder have a child and are unsuccessful in farming on the South Dakota prairie.

title: The Alchemist - Gift Edition
description: A young boy told the alchemist that he was afraid of suffering while looking up at the moonless sky.

title: Pretty Things
description: Liz Goldwyn's lifelong fascination with the opulence of classic burlesque has led her to spend the past eight years communicating with, visiting, interviewing, teaching striptease and developing friendships with legendary American burly queeens. She takes us on a journey back in time when the hourglass figure was at its peak and strip dancing was embraced. Discover Betty "Ball of Fire" Rowland, known for her flaming red hair and bump–and-bumps appearance.

title: Eaters of the Dead
description: The Norsemen accompany an ambassador of the Caliph of Bagdad from Nineveh to endure, for three years, the cruelty of their lifestyle and the creatures that afflict them.

title: Genome
description: The mapped human genome is the most significant scientific breakthrough of the 21st century, and its discovery raises crucial questions about how we live. Genome offers unparalleled insight into the implications of this groundbreaking discovery by selecting a newly discovered gene from each chromosome pair and explaining its history in detail.

title: The Zero
description: Five days after a terrorist attack decimated his home city, Brian Remy has memory problems: gaps in his self-inflicted gunshot wounds, an unknown girlfriend and deteriorating eyesight -- all complicated by the recruitment process to gather information for an obscure intelligence operation. 100,000 prints.

title: Kitchen Confidential Updated Ed
description: The culinary world of Chef Anthony Bourdain is presented in a delightfully funny and delectable feast, filled with unconventional yet authentic accounts of his extensive involvement in drugs, sex drives, and haute cuisine.

title: DREAM & THE UNDERWOR
description: James Hillman's analysis of dreams reveals the first major shift in thinking since Freud and Jung, starting with The Myth of Analysis and Re-Visioning Psychology.

title: The Crying of Lot 49
description: The imaginative satire about Oedipa Maas, a woman who is involved in an international conspiracy, encounters some very interesting characters, and attains'some degree of self-awareness'.

title: An American Childhood
description: An American Childhood, a moving and touching memoir by Pulitzer Prize-winning author Annie Dillard, has captured the hearts of readers across the nation.

title: Teaching a Stone to Talk
description: In this captivating collection of books, Annie Dillard, a Pulitzer Prize-winning author, delves into the world of natural phenomena and human significance.

title: Holy the Firm
description: In 1975, Annie Dillard relocated to a wooded room on an island in Puget Sound, where she spent two years questioning time, reality, and death. Her books Holy the Firm chronicled various topics such as moths, candles, salt water, rock mountains, birds, cats, spiders (spotted here), and people who died in airplane crashes.

title: Think on These Things
description: Initially introduced to Indian society as talks, this book contains material that is deeply meaningful to thoughtful individuals of all ages and backgrounds. Krishnamurti's approach to understanding basic emotions like ambition, greed, envy, and the pursuit of power sheds light on these themes.

title: The Dance of Intimacy
description: Dr. Lerner's book The Dance of Intimacy provides guidance on how to strengthen and heal positive relationships, highlighting the challenges faced in terms of intimacy at different levels.

title: Tell My Horse
description: As an initiate in the voodoo culture of Haiti and Jamaica during the 1930s, the author shares her experiences.

title: Jonah's Gourd Vine
description: The young Black man, John Buddy Pearson, who becomes a well-liked pastor at Zion Hope, struggles to balance his good intentions with his instincts.

title: The Chaneysville Incident
description: The Chaneysville Incident is a tale of an event that, according to legend, took place in Chanesville. It recounts the story of John Washington, despite his brilliant and bitter demeanor, who travels through his family's dark past to discover the few remnants of their tragic family history which he endeavors to reconstruct and embrace.

title: The Writing Life
description: Annie Dillard, a friendly recluse and member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters, has written eleven books, including An American Childhood, The Living, and Pilgrim at Tinker Creek.

title: The Lost Continent
description: A humorous and unaltered account of a man's discovery of America and his quest for the perfect small town.

title: Three by Annie Dillard
description: A stunning compilation of Annie Dillard's most acclaimed works.

title: Declarations of Independence
description: An honest examination of American political ideology is provided in the book A People's History of the United States, written by the renowned author.

title: The Complete Stories
description: The author's career as one of the most prominent African-American writers of this era is chronicled in a collection of short stories, many of which were published in literary magazines during his lifetime, along with unreleased pieces. Reprint.

title: Legends  Lies & Cherished Myths of World History
description: Richard Shenkman, a whistleblower, exposes the nonsensical ideas we were taught about revolutions, religions and heroes in history.

title: The Infinite Plan
description: With over 65,000 copies sold, this novel is the story of a man's quest for love and his soul, which has made it to the top of bestseller lists in various countries worldwide.

title: Soul Mates
description: Thomas Moore's companion book, Soul Mates, offers a deeper understanding of his inspiring wisdom and compassion for life, as well as practical insights into the importance of nurturing souls.

title: Cathedral  Forge and Waterwheel
description: A fascinating exploration of the Middle Ages' remarkable inventions, as narrated by the authors of Life in a Medieval Castle.

title: The Throne of the Third Heaven of the Nations Millennium General Assembly
description: This is a must-have compilation of the award-winning poet and novelist's four former poetry books, as well as some of his unreleased pieces.

title: Success Stories
description: The Painter family's pursuit of the American dream is explored in Sucess Stories, a varied yet compelling collection. Additionally, Russell Banks explores the ethics of materialism and greed in contemporary literature.

title: Testaments Betrayed
description: The Unbearable Lightness of Being, Immortality, and The Book of Laughter and Forgetting are among the novels that have made Milan Kundera a prominent figure in contemporary literature. In Testaments Betrayed, he defends the artist's moral rights and the reverence for art and its creator. The central theme of this work is loyalty to both those who created it and their works.

title: Mr. Ives' Christmas
description: In Hijuelos' novel, Mr. Ives is the story of an adopted child who was raised in a foundling's home during the 1950s. He is characterized as being highly accomplished advertising worker, devoted family man with two children, and optimistic about living the American dream. However, his son Robert is tragically killed at Christmas due to his violent parents.

title: Slowness
description: The author of Slowness, the first French-language novel by Milan Kundera, presents a light and romantic novel with two tales of seduction set in an autumn evening.

title: As Nature Made Him
description: Exposes the case of a man who was misrepresented as being mistakenly blamed for advocating for female circumcision during his baby's birth, and then having surgery to make him male again.

title: The Active Side of Infinity
description: "In a way, events that alter our course are personal and impersonal. My teacher, Don Juan Matsus, guided me to gather the significant events of my life as an apprentice."

title: You Can't Go Home Again
description: Novelist George Webber is driven out of his hometown when his autobiographical novel's success enrages the family and friends he has written for him.

title: The Fifth Mountain
description: In the ninth century B.C., Elijah, a biblical prophet in the Middle East, confronts Jezebel's pagan beliefs and falls for Yridiah with Xena (a strange land) in Zarephath, but his happiness is tragically broken when tragedy strikes.

title: V.
description: The eerie and wild tale of the 20th century, featuring two individuals, one seeking lost possessions and the other having little to lose, and "V."

title: The Poisonwood Bible
description: The missionary journey of Nathan Price, an evangelical Baptist, who traveled to the Belgian Congo in 1959 with his wife and four daughters has revealed that their traditions have become increasingly unsafe in a different world.

title: Cloudsplitter
description: Cloudsplitter is a modern masterpiece that showcases the incredible story of Owen Brown, the last surviving son of John Brown. It is written with both historical and invented elements and is an impressive work of fiction.

title: Plato  Not Prozac!
description: From Kirkegaard's insights on how to deal with death to the I Ching' s recommendations for adapting to change, as well as other philosophers who have played a crucial role in helping people navigate complex issues like relationships and ethical living, to Plato, Not Prozac!, an easy way to find solutions that work best for you.

title: The Map That Changed the World
description: An intriguing account of William Smith, a nineteenth-century engineer and the originator of modern geology, recounts his discovery that rocks exist in multiple layers against an earthly backdrop.

title: The Odyssey of Homer
description: The most powerful rendition of Homer's Odyssey in contemporary English.

title: Collected Novellas
description: Gabriel Garcia Marquez is renowned for his mastery in crafting magical worlds, and his novels have brought delight to millions of readers worldwide. His stories are filled with unforgettable characters and set in exotic locations, captivating readers with their imagination and genuineness. In his debut novel, Leaf Storm, Gabriel Garca takes readers on a journey through the mythical village of Macondo, ravaged by torrents of rain, where he must finally live up to an ancient vow.

title: Collected Stories
description: This is a compilation of twenty-six of Gabriel Garcia Marquez's most brilliant and beautiful short stories, written in the order they were published from three volumes: Eyes of.

title: A Mulligan for Bobby Jobe
description: Despite his pro golf swing being more impressive than his attitude, Bobby Jobe's lead in a major tournament is marred by bogeys and the loss of his Henry "Greyhound" Mote.

title: In the Footsteps of Mr. Kurtz
description: Mobutu Sese Seko, the president of Zaire for thirty-two years, exhibited the same level of cleverness as his namesake, seducing Western powers, buying opposition with brutality and charm; while pauperized, "like some modern-day reincarnations of Joseph Conrad," he plundered the country's copper and diamond resources, sipping pink champagne in his jungle palace.

title: Every Tongue Got to Confess
description: The late 1920s saw Zora Neale Hurston travel through the Gulf States and collect a vast collection of African American folklore in Every Tongue Got to Confess. The stories, which range from longer narratives about God, the Devil, white folk, and mistaken identity to humorous one-liners, reflect diverse perspectives on faith/love relationships, family life, slavery, race, or community.

title: Kitchen Confidential
description: The author of Gone Bamboo, who is a chef from New York City, shares his experience.

title: One Matchless Time
description: Jay Parini has compiled a biography of William Faulkner, highlighting his exceptional talent and remarkable literary prowess. He draws on previously unseen sources, such as letters, memoirs, and interviews with his daughter and lovers, to help unravel the mysteries of this gifted writer.

title: The Girl in the Glass
description: The Great Depression has left a nation in distress, but only privileged groups have survived. They include the extremely wealthy and corrupt individuals, including Diego, an undocumented Mexican immigrant who relies on Thomas Schell to provide financial support. However, they are eventually forced to participate in elaborate private conversations with New Yorkers until something unexpected happens.

title: The Best American Science Writing 2002
description: If science is just the pursuit of new forms of ignorance, as Matt Ridley puts it, then perhaps with these advancements comes new questions: Is human genetic engineering commonplace, or is human cloning safe? Are there multiple universes? Climate change will affect the future? The Best American Science Writing 2002 features the most recent and most revolutionary research conducted by leading academics in fields such as medicine, genetics, computer science, evolutionary psychology, advanced physics, and the environment.

title: Wittgenstein's Poker
description: The ten-minute meeting between Ludwig Wittgenstein and Karl Popper in Cambridge, England on October 25, 1946, was an unsatisfactory event. Although it was a brief encounter, the events of the confrontation remained largely unresolved for decades; Wittgerger's Poker is characterized by contrasting perspectives on various fields such as philosophy, history, biography, and literary detection.

title: Smart Discipline(R)
description: Smart Discipline® seminars, pioneered by Larry J. Koenig, Ph.D., offer a straightforward and effective method to assist children with ADD/ADHD in following their rules at home and school. The system can be customized to suit children's individual needs, and results are typically seen within days.

title: The Schopenhauer Cure
description: Julius Hertzfeld, a prominent psychotherapist, is forced to confront his own mortality after undergoing psychiatric treatment for HIV/AIDS. He meets Philip Slate, another sex addict who he hasn't helped in over two decades, but still claims to be cured by the teachings of Arthur Schopenhauer and is trained as if specialized in philosophical counseling.

title: African Nights
description: The stories of life in Africa are both lyrical and beautifully written, filled with mystery and poignancy. They preserve space, its traditions, ancient cultures, incredible beauty, rare animals, extraordinary people, and the challenges and pleasures of living in this amazing place. African Nights is a treasure trove of memories that offers hope to those who experience the healing power of Africa.

title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
description: "As a literary icon, Mark Twain's autobiography is unparalleled in its scope and quality, surpassing even the autographies of Benjamin Franklin and Henry Adams. Its style, scope, imagination, laughter, and tragedy are all hallmarks that make it renowned."

title: Joy in the Morning
description: A young couple from Brooklyn who are willing to make a difference in their lives by marrying, have little money, and facing parental disapproval.

title: The Darling
description: Hannah Musgrave, a political radical and former president of the Weather Underground, is the main character in The Darling, which takes place between 1975 and 1991 in both Liberia and the United States. She flees America to West Africa where she and her Liberiana husband become friends with the notorious warlord and ex-president, Charles Taylor.

title: The Making of a Philosopher
description: The Making of a Philosopher is essentially narrated by Colin McGinn, chronicling his life on both sides of the Atlantic, from Descartes and Anselm to his tenure in New York. It offers elaboration on contemporary academic perspectives on prominent twentieth-century philosophers such as Bertrand Russell, Jean-Paul Sartre, and Noam Chomsky, with stories that explore various philosophical ideas related to different philosophies.

title: The Language Instinct
description: This classic study features the world's foremost expert on language and the mind, who elucidates everything you've been curious about from how languages function to their ultimate purpose. Steven Pinker uses humor, intelligence, and everyday examples to weave together our extensive knowledge of language into a captivating tale that highlights how it was an instinctive human trait acquired through evolution, such as web spinning in spiders or sonar bats.

title: Prodigal Summer
description: Barbara Kingsolver's fifth novel is a celebration of the wildness of nature and humankind, drawing inspiration from three stories of love stories set in the mountains and farms of southern Appalachia. The characters encounter different challenges but build bridges with each other and the natural world during alternating summers.

title: Tales of the City
description: Russian Hill's inhabitants are a blend of eccentric, mysterious, naive, moody, up-and-down, unrefined, adventurous, and reserved. They inhabit distinct worlds and anxieties within the same environment.

title: Fear of Falling
description: "Fear of Falling" is a remarkable and insightful publication that examines the middle class's insecurities to explain its shift to the right over the last 20 years. It links these misconceptions to their origins, which are now rooted in aspirations and fears that have caused it to step back from being able to lead successfully.

title: The Hidden Hand
description: An offer to assist Private Investigator Race Williams in tracking down a criminal gang leader is turned down by the larger detective agency, who then discovers that he is on the case and has an assassin waiting for him.

title: Europe
description: This historical masterpiece captures the history of Europe, East and West from the Ice Age to the Atomic Age, including the rise and fall of Rome, the sweeping invasions of Alaric and Atilla, Norman Conquests, Papal struggles for power (between Francocrats and Florentines), the Renaissance and Reformation,the French Revolution and Napoleonic Wars,Europe's ascent and descent into world power,and its eclipse in our own century after two catastrophic World Wars.

title: Savage Inequalities
description: This New York Times best-selling book by Jonathan Kozol, a National Book Award-winning author, is the most remarkable account of his disgraceful examination of the American school system, and it has sold more than 250,000 hardcover copies.

title: Gold Bug Variations
description: A national bestseller, the National Book Critics Circle Award was presented to the remarkable author of Three Farmers on Their Way to a Dance, and it was also recognized as one of the "Best Books of 1991" by Publishers Weekly and nominated for prestigious awards.

title: Three Farmers on Their Way to a Dance
description: The haunting photograph of three young men on their way to a country dance, captured in the spring of 1914 by August Sander, serves as the backdrop for two contemporary stories set in New England.

title: The Fourteen Sisters of Emilio Montez O'Brien
description: A portrayal of America's new arrivals is presented through the perspective of a Cuban-Irish family with fourteen daughters and one male-dominated son.

title: Fiskadoro
description: Fiskadoro, described by the New York Times as "a wildly ambitious novel" and likened to the writings of Herman Melville, who could have written them if he had lived today, studied the Bible, 'The Wasteland,' Fahrenheit 451, and Dog Soldiers, watched Star Wars and Apocalypse Now, dropped acid, and listened to hours of Jimi Hendrix and the Rolling Stones.

title: The Stars at Noon
description: The 1984 film, The Stars at Noon, is a story of an American woman's mission in Central America that is as mysterious as her location. She portrays ten to fifteen years ago and begins with the help of Anwar Ali Khan.

title: Operation Wandering Soul
description: The National Book Award-nominated book, which explores the melancholic reality of childhood innocence in the midst of modern Los Angeles, is an exceptionally imaginative and emotionally charged read.

title: Reasons to Live
description: Hempel's classic collection of short fiction is characterized by intricate characters who have discovered that their safety nets are not reliable and must now work with the threads of humor, irony, and spirit.

title: Prisoner's Dilemma
description: A father of four, a history teacher, black humorist, and invalid with recurring fainting episodes is facing an issue. His family is anxious about discovering the cause of his illness and is working on restoring his beloved Hobbstown to life.

title: The God of Small Things
description: The Booker Prize-winning debut novel features dark paranoia and family bloodshed, chronicling the decline of a family in Southern India during the late sixties, which begins with an episode of forbidden love. Reprint. Tour.

title: Courtesans and Fishcakes
description: A young scholar's captivating reenactment takes readers on a journey through Classical Athens, which, despite its conventional historical backdrop, enjoyed its delight as much as anyone else.

title: Girlfriend in a Coma
description: After Karen Ann MacNeil regains consciousness after eighteen years of a coma, the world undergoes harrowing and radical transformations that transform reality, with Karen and her companions struggling to prevent their demise. The first printing is limited to thirty-four copies.

title: The Long Hard Road Out of Hell
description: This autobiography chronicles Marilyn Manson's journey from a fearless Christian schoolboy to achieving commercial success.

title: Confessions of an Ugly Stepsister
description: Can magic truly manifest in this new land? This latest addition to the Wicked series from Gregory Maguire is a captivating and provocative take on the classic Cinderella story.

title: The Dirt
description: The most influential, enduring, and iconic metal band of the 1980's presents an epic tale of their legendary journey.

title: Life Is Elsewhere
description: The title of the author's book was originally intended for The Lyrical Age. According to Kundera, youth is the lyrically defined age, and this novel is an epic of adolescence that deeply erodes certain but sacrosanct values such as childhood, motherhood, revolution, or even poetry. Jaromil'Story is so authentic in its portrayal of him; his mother being literate and leaving him to dwell with her son in bed, while his father lying beside him symbolizes his own life on "belonging" to be eternal forever

title: Cat Laughing Last
description: Fans of Lillian Jackson Braun and Rita Mae Brown, as well as those who love cats, will find this novel gripping.

title: The Crow: The Lazarus Heart
description: Jared Poe, an S&M photographer and current rapist on Death Row in Louisiana, is mourning the loss of his lover and cannot fathom how he will ever find the culprit.

title: The Light Fantastic
description: Terry Pratchett's irreverent novels have earned him a place in the hall of fame among parodies like Mark Twain, Kurt Vonnegut, Douglas Adams, and Carl Hiaasen. In The Light Fantastic, the only person who can rescue the world from calamity is Rincewind, an inept wizard...

title: U.S.S. Seawolf
description: The Chinese are using stolen U.S. military technology to create a new type of weaponry, and the Xia III submarine is one of them. The Seawolf submarine, which can launch atomic bombs across the Pacific Ocean and destroy an American West Coast city, is the most stealthy hunter-killer submarine in the U's fleet.

title: Realms of Dragons
description: This lavishly illustrated work, which follows the pattern of "The Wheel of Time," is a definitive guide to the fantasy worlds of popular authors Weis and Hickman. It features detailed illustrations, many in color.

title: The Player of Games
description: The Empire of Azad is where Gurgeh, a champion game player, travels to, one hundred thousand light years later, and the winner of their intricate game becomes emperor.

title: My Soul to Keep
description: Jessica's marriage ends in tragedy as she realizes that David is not the ideal family man she hoped to be. She remains hopeful and believes that her relationship with him will remain intact, but as time passes and people close to her pass away at high rates, David confesses to being part of a sect from Ethiopia more than 400 years ago who gave up their humanity to save them.

title: Peril's Gate
description: The fate of all realms in Athera hinges on the resolution of the bloody conflict between the princes, as Arithon, the Master of Shadow, has no choice but to team up with a rebellious enchanter or face the brutal forces of their enemies.

title: Fugitive Prince
description: Insane battles ensue between half brothers, Lysaer, the Prince of the Light, and Arithon, who are victims of grenades from the Koriani Enchantresses.

title: Love in Vein
description: A new and sexy take on the classic horror genre's fearless anthology has been brought to life by Poppy Z. Brite, an acclaimed author of dark fantasy novels.

title: Cat on the Edge
description: Joe Grey's week has been a blur as he gains the ability to understand human language and is eventually recognized as capable of doing so.

title: Cat in the Dark
description: "I'm anxious. What if the police come across a cat opening ot he skylight and masterminding the robbery? The tabloids will be happy." Meanwhile, Molena Point, California, has caught up with gangsters in crime-preying environments. A yellow-eyed tomcat with no inclination towards the law, and spoiled human who is no better.

title: Treasure Box
description: Despite experiencing a devastating childhood tragedy that left him feeling broken and alone, Quentin has made millions from brilliant investments and unexpected love. However, his marriage to Madeleine is now bringing him closer to reality with the love of his life.

title: Homebody
description: With his skills as an expert craftsman, Don Lark was able to restore his own soul through damaged houses. However, tragedy struck him hard, prompting him to search for empty homes to purchase, renovate, and sell at a profit.

title: Imajica II
description: The magical story of lost lovers on the brink of annihilation, their passion being the key to freedom. Imajica has redefined offant fiction by blending extreme sexuality and spiritual anarchy, transporting readers to regions of passion and philosophy that few have explored before; it's epic in its size, intricately choreographed, and doomed to death.

title: Choke
description: Despite his efforts, Chuck Chandler, a prominent tennis player from Key West, struggles to maintain control during important matches and becomes implausible when he encounters Harry Carras and his stunning wife Clare, leading him to suspect that the latter may have been responsible for his demise.

title: Dirt
description: Stuart Woods revisits Stone Barrington in his latest novel Choke, taking readers on a thrilling rollercoaster ride through the world of high-profile celebrity gossip. Amanda Dart, formerly known for her ice-creamed personality and poisonous pen, is turned on by an anonymous gossipmonger who sends confidential information about her sexual misconduct to national opinion figures via fax.

title: Kilo Class
description: In the near future, China is poised to purchase ten of Russia's kilo class nuclear submarines with the aim of subduing Taiwan permanently, but it needs the assistance of a covert team of Navy SEALs to intercept the delivery.

title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
description: Zora Neale Hurston's 1937 classic, Their Eyes Were Watching God, is a timeless love story that has been cherished by many. It is an example of Southern romance that was written with the unwavering voice of Janie Crawford, despite her struggles to reconcile her love for him with her past struggles and personal commitments.

title: A Tree Grows in Brooklyn
description: Betty Smith's A Tree Grows in Brooklyn, a beloved American novel set in the 1920s, is renowned for its heartfelt and moving portrayal of aging girls. It is fraught with emotion, cruelty, laughter, heartache, and life-affirming themes. Francie Nolan, who spent her formative years in Williamsburg, Georgia, has been captivating and inspiring millions of readers for over 60 years. By juxtaposing both overwhelming emotions and poignant moments, the story showcases everyday triumphs and tragic events.

title: Daughter of Fortune
description: Eliza Sommers, a young orphan from Valparaso, Chile, is introduced to rogue men and their unyielding brother during the Gold Rush of 1849. She travels to California and joins her new boyfriend's side as she navigates the rough terrain of the newly arrived gold rush in America. With the help of her friend and trusted advisor, Tao Chi'en, Elizes creates an unconventional yet self-sufficient existence for herself while dealing with the challenges of society.

title: By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept
description: In a story that explores the heartbreak of love and loss, Paulo Coelho's book The Alchemist offers uplifting and poetic insights into two unlikely pairings.

title: The Alchemist
description: A young boy told the alchemist that he was afraid of suffering while looking up at the moonless sky.

title: Veronika Decides to Die
description: Despite having everything, including youthful beauty, boyfriends, a loving family, and thriving career, Veronika, aged 24, experiences the absence of something in her life. She wakes up one morning in November with erections of sleeping pills to ensure she never wakeup. However, she is now being told that she has only days left to live at psychiatric facilities. Drawing on Coelho's experience, this book explores what it means to be insane and recognizes those who do not conform to society.

title: Goodnight Moon 123
description: Before falling asleep, a small bunny counts and bids goodnight to all the things in his room.

title: Charlotte's Web Signature Edition
description: The story of Wilbur, a pig owned by Lucretia and his friend Charlotte is based on the life of Fern, who was saved by Templeton, an intelligent planned by both him and Charlotte.

title: By Myself and Then Some
description: Despite the challenges, Lauren Bacall remains the embodiment of courage, independence, and brilliance. She collaborated with Humphrey Bogart to produce some of the most memorable and captivating film scenes ever seen.

title: The Art of Loving
description: Discover how to live a meaningful, fulfilling life by unlocking hidden talents for love in the fiftieth Anniversary Edition of the iconic book.

title: Factotum tie-in
description: The story of Henry Chinaski, a young author who left the military, follows him through various life experiences in America during World War II, with its beer-soaked and unappetizing plot becoming an all-consuming disappointment.

title: The White Masai
description: A former European entrepreneur narrates how she fell in love with Masai warrior Lketinga on holiday in Kenya and then left her life behind to settle in the remote bush country of Africa, where they worked to build a relationship despite language barrier and cultural barriers. 30,000 first printing.

title: Mandy
description: In the midst of her orphanprrlhood, Mandy, who is now ten years old, escapes over the wall to discover something new. She finds herself in a small wooded cottage and struggles to find her place to call home. As time goes on, she borrows things from the orpinage and sometimes even lies when visiting for shopping. However, there comes illisipantly at one point during this stormy night, and no one seems to notice.

title: The Crusader
description: The Crusader, a book by presidential historian Paul Kengor, is the only unwritten biography of Ronald Reagan that includes shocking revelations about his political allegiance to the Soviet Union.

title: Spider's House
description: During the 1954 nationalist uprising in Fez, Morocco, Paul Bowles wrote his most subtle and captivating novel, The Spider's House. It is both descriptive and uncompromising in its portrayal of the dilemma faced by an outsider within an alien society, and also explores the cultural divide that is a common theme in his works.

title: Days
description: Paul Bowles, at the suggestion of a friend, began journaling in 1987 and during 1989 wrote about his daily experiences, not only meals, conversations, and health concerns but also an interesting glimpse into artist work in he didn't write before.

title: Howl
description: The initial release of the groundbreaking poetic work provides a special anniversary edition that details the origins of Ginsberg's celebrated poem and discusses the literary references and composition techniques employed in its creation. A reissue is available for purchase.

title: Coraline
description: The new flat where Coraline belongs has a locked door and surrounded by brick walls, but she eventually finds reversing it. She also discovers that the food is better in another house, and books filled with colorful pictures are part of her childhood memories.

title: Points in Time
description: The fervent and brilliant book of Bowles is about Morocco, distilling expendable knowledge from emotion and the history of a people into poignant visual representation. He captures the very essence of Moroccan culture while pausing at various locations to create vivid images of the country's past through centuries of history and customs.

title: At the Edge
description: The trio of Claire, Tempest, and Leona possess a unique sense of wonder that none of them could express.

title: Remind Me Again Why I Need A Man
description: The pain of finding the perfect husband despite her attractive appearance and intelligence is overcome by television producer Amelia Lockwood, who endures a year of night classes while trying to reconcile with burgeoning ex-partner.

title: Stardust
description: To win over Victoria's cold heart, Tristran Thorn will do whatever it takes to bring her the star that they both desire, including bringing her to the other side of an old stone wall where Faerie lives.

title: When the Heart Waits
description: Through her memoir The Secret Life of Bees, an inspiring autobiographical account of personal pain and spiritual awakening, Sue Monk Kidd recounts a profound emotional experience where she lost all sense of purpose.

title: The Gabriel Hounds
description: Despite being forbidden from making unexpected visits, Christy Mansel and her cousin Charles end up in Damascus. They both choose to barge in unintentionally instead of visiting their aunt, Harriet, despite the family's strict rules prohibiting such behavior.

title: The Pact
description: Prior to the phone calls on November 3rd, the Golds and the Hartes had been inseparable for a long time. It was not unexpected for anyone to notice that their relationship had grown beyond friendship. However, tragically, Emily died suddenly at the age of seventeen from gunshot wounds caused by her beloved husband and son using crowbar attacks.

title: Ines of My Soul LP
description: A historical novel that narrates the story of Inés Suarez, a Spanish conquistadora who was able to conquer Chile and establish its dominance.

title: Women
description: A compelling account of a middle-aged man who has been unloved for an extended period, but at the age of fifty, he starts developing deeper connections with women.

title: Smithsonian Intimate Guide to Human Origins
description: The Smithsonian Intimate Guide to Human Origins reveals that anthropologists are constantly revising the human family tree, from ancient forests to modern biomechanical research and molecular genetics. These discoveries have raised several important questions: should chimpanzees be considered part of our species? Did humans form social groups in early humans due to the difficulty of birthing these animals? Were humans related to Neanderthals?

title: My secret
description: The website, founded by the founder of PostSecret, was made up of a collection of postcards with anonymously written secrets that were artfully crafted by people from all over the world.

title: The Secret Lives of Men and Women
description: The Secret Lives of Men and Women, a new addition to Frank Warren's PostSecret series featuring explosive confessional postcards that explore the world through photographs, collages, illustrations, and more.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird (slipcased edition)
description: Despite being eight years old, Scout Finch is an independent thinker who can understand her father's warning that killing a mockingbird is sinful. She also enjoys the benefits of school and staying composed. The story takes place in Maycomb, Alabama, where they face the harsh realities of the Depression and struggle with their gifts for self-indulgence.

title: The Complete C. S. Lewis Signature Classics
description: Seven Spiritual Masterworks, a well-known collection of religious texts by C. S. Lewis, features some of his most significant spiritual writings such as Mere Christianity The Screwtape Letters The Great Divorce The Problem of Pain Miracles A Grief Observed The Abolition of Man.

title: The End of Days
description: The Earth Chronicles book series concludes with a third volume that brings the author's ideas about the Anunnaki alien life to full realization, answering fundamental questions about Daniel in the Bible, Sir Isaac Newton in Chemistry, and the end of the world.

title: The Blue and Brown Books
description: According to the sub-title, these works are unfinished sketches for Philosophical Investigations, which is considered by many to be the most important and influential philosophical work of modern times. The 'Blue Book' was dictated to Witgenstein's Cambridge students in 1933-1934: "The Brown Book" describes the growth and germination of the ideas that ultimately found their final expression in Wittinger'

title: The Pursuit of Happyness
description: The story of a homeless father who raised and cared for his son in San Francisco's desolate neighborhoods until he became the crown prince of Wall Street. Chris Gardner, despite being born in Milwaukee and educated in the medical field, arrived at San Jose at the age of twenty and quickly found himself in high-pressure jobs that required him to work hard on cutting edge research projects. However, soon after landing prestigious positions at leading companies in Silicon Valley, Gardner was surprised by his ability to attract investors.

title: What A Lady Wants
description: The last unmarried man in the world is certain to receive a cognac bottle and one shilling each, thanks to the efforts of four attractive gentlemen.

title: A Little Bit Wicked
description: Which unmarried man will come out on top? Despite the fact that no wise individual would want to wed, four of London's most handsome men have staked their wager on who could win the prize. Gideon Pearsall, Viscount Warton, is one of them.

title: The Wit and Wisdom of Winston Churchill
description: This is a highly entertaining compilation of humorous anecdotes, stories, and trivia about Winston Churchill, narrated by renowned historian and actor, for audiences of all levels: from novices to veterans, as well as those interested in World War II.

title: Sleep  Pale Sister
description: Sleep, Pale Sister by Joanne Harris is a gothic masterpiece that draws inspiration from the strong and dark aspects of Holy Fools. It takes place in 19th-century London and depicts how Henry Chester discovers the beauty of delicate child girls like Lillie J. Long during one of her most recent novels.

title: Midnighters #2: Touching Darkness
description: Book two of New York Times bestselling author Scott Westerfeld's Midnighters series is set in the world of daylight, and it begins with the discovery of terrifying secrets during the secret hour.

title: The Queen of Attolia
description: Megan Whalen Turner's novels, which have been acclaimed by the New York Times as her best-selling books, bring to life the world of epic fantasy and showcase Eugenides, the thief, who is both a captivating and incorrigible character.

title: The Collected Poetry of Nikki Giovanni
description: Nikki Giovanni's complete poetry collection from 1967 to 1980 is included in this omnibus. The collection will feature five adult books of poetry, including Black Feeling, Black Talk/Black Judgement, My House, The Women and the Men, Cotton Candy on a Rainy Day, and Those Who Ride the Night Winds.

title: Sugarplums and Scandal
authors: Dana Cameron;Mary Daheim;Lori Avocato;Kerrelyn Sparks;Suzanne Macpherson;Cait London
description: A delightful collection of Christmas stories, SUGARPLUMS AND SCANDAL, has been written by six of Avon's most renowned storytellers, filled with love at first sight, romance at last, and mystery at heart. Each author brings their own unique voice and characters to the table, as well as their personal fan bases.

title: How to Buy  Sell  and Profit on eBay
description: A guide to eBay sales and profits, with an entertainingly informative introduction by eBay's most successful private salesperson, Adam Ginsberg, who has sold over a million dollars in merchandise every month.

title: Owning Your Own Shadow
description: A popular author illustrates how we can regain and reconcile with the "shadow" aspect of our identity.

title: The World's Religions
description: Contains information on Hinduism, Buddhism, Confucianism, Taoisme, Islam, Judaeis and Christianity along with indigenous customs of the Americas (America in the West), Australia (Australia), Africa (North America) and Oceania).

title: A Manual for Living
description: A collection of enduring Stoic principles conveyed in profound and uncomplicated aphorisms. This is the foremost and most excellent instruction manual for Westerners, which offers thoroughly pragmatic and contemporary ideas on how to live with serenity and happiness.

title: The Pilgrimage
description: Previously known as The Diary of a Magus, this book recounts Coelho's journey on he spiritual path (where c was an opening to the soul; wisdom in inner knowing), and exercises in self-control and self discovery which recollection readers recall from his pilgrimage along the ancient road to Santiago.

title: The Valkyries
description: The Valkyries, a captivating and authentic story, takes place in Rio de Janeiro, where Paulo Coelho hands over his only manuscript for The Alchemist to his mysterious master J.

title: Rainforest Home Remedies
description: Find alternatives to chemical anti-depressants and painkillers on your spice rack. Discover natural antiseptic salves for insect bites. Use the Maya ritual to alleviate envy, grief, sadness, and fear. Rinse your house with positive energy after cleansing your home. Relieve negative emotions with the easy-to-use bronchitis remedy.

title: A Circle of Quiet
description: The author's retreat at her own country home has prompted the author to share fruitful reflections on life and career in this journal.

title: Bulfinch's Mythology
description: A stunning gift box featuring interpretive essays by Richard P. Martin, a professor of classics at Princeton University, and Thomas Bulfinch's timeless rendition of famous myths and folk legends.

title: Romanticism
description: A study of the influence of Romanticism on Western culture.

title: Betsy-Tacy
description: Betsy and her new family have a strong bond, but they only see each other's children on Hill Street. Betsie is thrilled to be playing with Tacy, who she met at Betsons' fifth birthday party and has grown closer to her.

title: Betsy and Tacy Go Over the Big Hill
description: After years of pretending not to be ten, Betsy, Tacy, and Tib are eager to experience excitement as they fall in love with the King of Spain. They then embark on a solo adventure across the Big Hill and Little Syria for the first time, learning about American culture and traditions.

title: Heaven to Betsy
description: The life of two high school freshmen in 1906 is depicted in a novel.

title: Let the Hurricane Roar
description: The Dakotas homesteading of a young pioneer couple is beset with hardships and misfortune.

title: The Wish Giver
description: Upon the arrival of a peculiar little man at the Coven Tree Church Social, three young believers-in-magic promise to fulfill their requests in an unexpected way.

title: Racso and the Rats of NIMH
description: With his eagerness to learn how to read and write, Lacso is a determined hero who travels from Boston to Thorn Valley. His bragging and lying tactics are starting to deter him, but he eventually finds himself in the position of 'Wonderfull Nacho' after Mrs Frisby and The Rats of Newbery won Best Novel by the author's father.

title: Child of the Owl
description: Barney's horse, the penthouse suite in his dreams, is a source of excitement for Casey.

title: R-T  Margaret  and the Rats of NIMH
description: The superintelligent rats of NIMH rescue Margaret and her younger brother, Artie, during their camping trip after they get lost in the woods. They are taken into the rat's community, where they can safely stay for the winter season. All that remains to be done when the rats return, but it is difficult to avoid questions all the while.

title: The Rainbow People
description: "Yep's storytelling style is lively and poetic, with a touch of humor and fatalism. The collection is beautifully organized and divided into 20 stories, each with its own theme such as 'Tricksters' or Virgil and the Virtue of Flowers'."

title: Dragon's Gate
description: In 1867, Otter travels from Three Willows Village in China to California, where he will be joined by his father and uncle. He is not familiar with the other Chinese people in this new land, and his vision is one of learning everything possible, returning to the Middle Kingdom and freeing China from the Manchu raiders.

title: Betsy's Wedding
description: The sixtieth anniversary edition of a beloved story features Betsy and her high school sweetheart, Joe, who confront all the challenges of young newlyweds with alterations such as introducing an updated biographical section and forward.

title: Betsy and the Great World
description: With her college experience and romance with Joe behind her, Betsy, who was twenty-one in January 1914, decides to enjoy herself during her long European trip alone.

title: Betsy Was a Junior
description: Betsy's third year at Deep Valley High is set in a small town shortly after the turn of the century. Reissue.

title: Crazy Lady!
description: With his father's loss, Vernon becomes increasingly distant from him and engages with his peers to mock the neighborhood outcasts, including Maxine and Ronald. However, he struggles to oppose the placement of Ronald in a special care facility at NYPL.

title: Strawberry Girl 60th Anniversary Edition
description: Despite the challenges of farming, Birdie Boyer is eager to harvest her big, juicy strawberries. However, she has not yet started and cannot plant them in their new farm in the backwoods of Florida. Her father cautions against counting biddies until they are fully developed.

title: Seven Spiders Spinning
description: A group of seven Siberian snow spiders, frozen in time during the Ice Age, escape to Harvard for analysis and wreak havoc on a small New England town, ruining an annual school Halloween pageant with hilarious consequences. This book was reissued as an ALA Notable Children's Book.

title: American Dragons
description: Encompasses short stories, poems, and plays that depict the experiences of being an Asian American.

title: The Midwife's Apprentice (rpkg)
description: The 1995 Newbery Honor Book, Catherine, Called Birdy, by Cushman, portrays a young woman in medieval England who finds her place of birth in raucous and dangerous settings, much like Chaucer.

title: Winter on the Farm
description: The Little House books follow the journey of a little pioneer girl and her family across the Midwest in barefoot carriages. Garth Williams' artwork has been woven into these classic books, which have become irreplaceable treasures since their first publication over sixty years ago. My First Little Book features Almanzo Wilder, the young boy from Farmer Boy who would marry Laura Ingalls during Winter on the Farm, as well as Almazz performing his afternoon barn chores and sitting down to enjoy some hearty meals.

title: Down to the Bonny Glen
description: When Miss Crow comes along to visit, Martha realizes the importance of her work and discovers that she could gain valuable insights from her if she took the time to get to know her.

title: Monster
description: I was in the center of a movie at the Dell Lock D and Mandarin Depot Detention Center. It felt like my life had come to an end, and I thought, "This is going to be the story of Monster."

title: Emily of Deep Valley
description: Emily Webster dreams of joining the rest of the group after high school, but she has to stay at home to care for her grandfather, a Civil War veteran, and it is at this location where she embarks on numerous new experiences. Reprint.

title: The Trumpet of the Swan
description: Like his family, Louis is a trumpeter swan, but he cannot play the instrument with joy. Serena, who loves him so much, doesn't care about it and instead shows interest in him by playing lots of brass trumpets until his father buys him one.

title: The Good Liar
description: An elderly man named Marcel, who now lives in the United States, recalls his upbringing in German-occupied France, particularly during the summer when he and his older brother RenT made the acquaintance of a young German soldier.

title: Old Town in the Green Groves
description: After grasshoppers rotted the crops, Laura Ingalls, an eight-year-old from Plum Creek and her family move to Burr Oak, Iowa, where they begin their new life as volunteers at a hotel.

title: Howl's Moving Castle
description: In the land of Ingary, everyday possessions such as spells, invisible cloaks and seven-league boots were common. However, the Witch of the Waste was not an isolated incident in that after fifty years of silence, it was believed that the witch was about to terrorize the country again. The public assumed that she was the real Witch when a mysterious black castle with four thin turrets appeared on the horizon, but the castle belonged to Wizard Howl, who reputedly enjoyed sexual attraction towards women at least.

title: Four Stupid Cupids
description: The students' Valentine's Day plan turns into a joke when four foolish cupids from Ancient Greece try to find their teacher.

title: Charlotte's Web (full color)
description: The beloved classics of Charlotte's Web and Stuart Little have been reimagined as lavish new collectors' editions, where the original black-and-white art by Garth Williams has been transformed into vibrant color artwork by Rosemary Wells.

title: Little House Friends
description: Adventure and fun: Laura Ingalls grew up on the western frontier with her friends.

title: Christmas Stories
description: Two new Little House Chapter Book titles have been compiled into gentle adaptations of Laura Ingalls Wilder's celebrated Little Home stories. Christmas Stories features pioneer Christmas celebrations, visits from friends, delicious meals, and gifts.

title: Winter Days in the Big Woods
description: Ma and Pa are aided by Laura in keeping the little log cabin cozy during the snowy season.

title: Christmas in the Big Woods
description: Despite the cold weather that hit her hometown, Laura Ingalls lived in a cozy house in the Big Woods of Wisconsin with her Pa, Ma, Mary, Carrie, and Jack. They spent many days working to warm up their small home before winter arrived.

title: A Little House Birthday
description: The Ingalls family is excited to welcome Laura into their world on her fifth birthday celebration in the Big Woods of Wisconsin. Special gifts are given and she sleeps soundly while playing a song with her father. Our tenth My First Little House Book features Renée Graef's stunning full-color illustrations, inspired by Garth Williams' iconic artwork, and showcases Laura and her family in true spirit.

title: The Deer in the Wood
description: Pa shares the story of meeting a mother deer and her baby fawn in the Big Woods of Wisconsin with Laura and Mary, giving even the youngest child ear candy.

title: A Little Prairie House
description: Laura Ingalls, along with her Pa, Ma, sisters Mary and Carrie, and bulldog Jack, departed west to the prairie years ago. They traveled in their covered wagon every day for several months until they found the perfect spot. With the help of Mr. Edwards' neighbor, Laura helped build a cozy little house in the heart of the open prairie that has become cherished by generations of readers. Laura INgalLUS AUSTER: Little House is renowned for its enduring themes and stories from across the country and beyond.

title: Grizzwold
description: Grizzwold, the adorable bear, is having trouble finding a suitable home due to his size and lack of coordination. His bear boots are not sturdy enough for comfort.

title: Chester
description: An animal named Chester, who is interested in becoming more tame, arrives in the city to find an accommodation. The artist's ability to keep things moving quickly propels this book forward, according to the Saturday Review.

title: Captain Cat
description: Captain Cat, a loyal feline, has the ability to jump out of bed and retrieve his badge whenever the bugle whistles. He is more skilled than any of the soldiers in this role, but he and his friend Pete are the ideal friends to maintain ties with the army. "Hoff's impressive musical abilities have persisted, while his title has retained its dexterity." SLJ

title: My Little House Crafts Book
description: Embrace the spirit of Laura Ingalls Wilder's pioneer childhood by crafting crafts like those found in Little House books.

title: Pioneer Girl
description: Pioneer Girl, the first picture book biography book to feature Laura Ingalls Wilder, is a unique and touching portrayal of her life.

title: Shade's Children (rack)
description: During the Dark Ages, Shade's children are held responsible for The Key to Survival in an urban wasteland where the Overlords have forbidden all children from living beyond fourteen years old. On that sad day, the child is subjected to an evil harvest and transformed into something like a machine intended for slaughter. With luck, cunning, and skill, four of the children escape alive.

title: All-American Girl
description: Samantha Madison is currently in the midst of Top Ten Reasons. Her sister is the most popular girl in school, while her little sister has achieved genius status and is in love with her big sister's boyfriend. She has been caught selling celebrity portraits during her school years and forced to take art classes. Recently, she has saved the president from an assassination attempt, making her a hero globally.

title: Hexwood
description: Strange happenings take place at Hexwood Farm. Ann Stavely witnesses people disappearing through the farm's gate, only to never come out again. She then meets a tormented wizard in the nearby woods, who she believes was asleep until the next morning. Meanwhile, time seems to move forward in this location where despite finding Xenophon and Radiotelephony, they still haven't settled in.

title: A Light in the Attic Book and CD
description: Shel Silverstein's A Light in the Attic is now available in a special edition, celebrating its 20th anniversary. The book will include dozens of hypothetical scenarios and highlights from his album, as well as evocative lyrics and emotional songs.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia (adult)
description: With its world-changing plot, fantastic creatures, and epic battles between good and evil, The Chronicles of Narnia is a must-read for any serious reader.

title: What Would Machiavelli Do?
description: If Machiavelli were to consume other people's discord, he would not seek out assassins or moochers but rather decline them. He would understand that self-love was more important than words of apology.He would kill people, but only do so with a sense of psychological control.His book could be sold by using other individuals' opinions!

title: The Sense of Wonder
description: Rachel Carson's award-winning classic, which was first published over 30 years ago, is now being reissued with stunning new photographs by Nick Kelsh. The book offers a unique perspective on her adventures with Roger, covering intimate journeys along the Maine coast, including scenes of moonlight, storm clouds, and birdsong.

title: Virgin
description: The Blessed Virgin fulfilled a prophecy that was delivered to ten years after it had been delivered in 1914 to an average peasant girl in Fatima, and this prediction is followed by global droughts and famines over several years.

title: Mission Possible
description: Elaborates on the process of upgrading an existing organization and creating a new one for the future, as well as the need for modifications to safeguard the business's future.

title: Crucial Conversations
description: Learn how to remain composed and achieve positive outcomes when feeling overwhelmed by emotions.

title: How to Talk to Anyone : 92 Little Tricks for Big Success in Relationships
description: The ability to break barriers and conquer obstacles is attributed to Leil Lowndes' exceptional abilities.

title: Easy French Reader  Second Edition
description: Easy French Reader is designed to help beginners and intermediate speakers learn French quickly and easily. Its progressive reading style emphasizes the importance of gradual reading, making it a great way to improve your understanding of the language.

title: Slim to None
description: Slim to None, a book that follows the author's footsteps with anorexia and its impact on her life, provides readers with valuable insights into this devastating condition.

title: Practice Makes Perfect: Italian Verb Tenses
description: The book focuses on teaching Italian verb tenses effectively, rather than just those of other books. It provides an overview of how specific types of verbs work, detailed explanations of why they work in certain situations, and practical exercises to help beginners and intermediates learn to speak and write Italian fluently.

title: Goodman & Gilman's The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics  Eleventh Edition
description: The unrivaled leader in medical pharmacology, this book has been updated to include all important new developments in drug action and disease interaction. It is the ultimate guide to the "desert island" of chemistry as medicine.

title: Incident Response & Computer Forensics  2nd Ed.
description: This latest best-selling book, written by FBI professionals, provides a comprehensive overview of the legal, procedural, and technical aspects of incident response and computer forensics. It includes new chapters on forestry and policing principles, as well as case studies that provide practical guidance for countering and handling modern hacker attacks.

title: The Last Dance
description: The Last Dance is the most widely recognized textbook in the field, offering an interdisciplinary approach to death, dying, and bereavement. It incorporates both experiential and scholarly approaches, as well as the emotional and intellectual aspects of death and dying through extensive revisions.

title: The Complete Works
description: Moses Hadas was accompanied by an Introduction and edited edition, which was done by Alfred John Church and William Jackson Brodribb.

title: Who Moved My Cheese?
description: The story of four individuals who find joy and happiness in a maze is told through zany parables, such as Who Moved My Cheese? It's based on the idea that cheese can symbolize what you seek in life.

title: How to Have a Beautiful Mind
description: While the emphasis on physical appearance is prevalent nowadays, there is a simpler way to become desirable than dieting or buying expensive clothes. People who are visually appealing can still be beautiful if they possess exceptional minds and apply them effectively in conversation. The clear instructions in this book emphasize the importance of applying lateral and parallel thinking skills to decision-making and communication, as well as effective oral communication techniques.

title: The Toy Maker
description: A single man was responsible for creating the toys that influenced generations of children, such as Frank Hornby who created the train set, Meccano, the dinky toy, and Scalextric. However, no one has written about him until recently.

title: Darwin's Watch
description: The wizards of Unseen Univeristy are responsible for the safety of Roundworld, which is now in a dire situation. They were aware that the creatures had invented ways to escape the Big Freeze and even intervened to divert humanity to octagons on an alternate timeline. However, Victorian England has failed at this time, and progress has been slow.

title: A Time to Kill
description: A Southern town is shocked by the sexual assault of a 10-year-old black girl by two white men, until her father takes legal action.

title: "Surely You're Joking  Mr. Feynman!"
description: Richard Feynman, a Nobel Prize-winning theoretical physicist in 1965, was known for his adventurous spirit and unconventional personality. His life was filled with adventures that allowed him to blend high intelligence, unquenchable curiosity, and skepticism while conversing with his friend Ralph Leighton over the course of several years.

title: Timequake
description: The alteration described by Kilgore Trout, a science-fiction writer, is that the universe will experience 'a crisis of conscience' when it expands and there are no clear answers.

title: Blood and Gold
description: A beautiful and sinister story about Marius, a patrician by birth, scholar by choice, one of the oldest vampires of all time. It begins in ancient Rome and ends when Thorne met Maharet, an ancient Egyptian vampire queen who holds him and others in chains with chains made of red hair.

title: An Imaginary Life
description: One of Rome's most renowned poets, Publius Ovidius Naso, was banished to a remote village on the brink of the Black Sea in the first century A.D. and left to construct an audacious and deeply moving work of fiction from such brew that he is exiled from his native tongue and dependent upon the mercies of barbarians who impregnate their dead and communicate with the spirit world.

title: The Great World
description: The memorials to war are ubiquitous in every city, town and village in Australia, with generations of young men enlisting in battles across the globe. David Malouf's THE GREAT WORLD is a true representation of this experience, covering more than seventy years of Australian history from the Seven Years' War at Seaside to the present day.

title: The Risk Pool
description: Sam Hall and his son Ned, a small-town gambling hellraiser, are the focus of The Risk Pool, which tells the story of three years of their lives. When Jenny has lapsed into obscurity and retreats into an imaginary world, Nedon enters his father's seedy nocturnal world while exploring the town'regime and trying to win Sam' infatuation.

title: Survivor
description: Tender Branson, the last surviving member of the Creedish death cult, has taken control of a Boeing 747 to share his story with the plane's black box before it crashes. He was recruited by the repressive cleric and served as cimitable for all Creechish younger sons. His actions led to his sudden rise to fame as media messiah and promotion to the top of freak-show heap in 2013.

title: Bagombo Snuff Box
description: A young PR man at General Electric sold his first short story to a doomed publication before the Golden Age of magazines ended 50 years ago. He later left the company and joined the ranks of Hemingway, Fitzgerald, and Faulkner to try to earn $1500 per month. This proved to be incredibly profitable for him, as four major magazines ran five stories weekly and smaller ones scouted.

title: Ali and Nino
description: In Azerbaijan, Ali Khan and Nino Kipiani are a married couple who share contrasting cultural backgrounds. Although they live in the city, there is reluctance to accept each other despite their differences. Ali is convinced that he will marry Ninova once she finishes school, but this is not an easy task due to their shared religious beliefs and parental pressure.

title: A Star Called Henry
description: Henry Smart, born in the 1901 slums of Dublin with his father as a one-legged bouncer and settler of scores, has become accustomed to life on the streets. He is often cold and hungry and spends his days robing and begging before walking out safely.

title: Set this House on Fire
description: The day after Peter Leverett met Mason Flagg, his former friend from Italy, he was found dead. The hours before his death were a nightmare filled with violence and unrealized circumstances.

title: The Confessions of Nat Turner
description: The story of Nat Turner, a slave, preacher, and leader of the only effective slave rebellion in Virginia's notorious institution, is set against historical precedent. In it, his confession was made to his jailers under the influence of his God, detailing the betrayals, cruelties, or humiliations that were once part of slavery but still gripping both races.

title: Experience
description: With his exceptional talent and innovative writing skills, Martin Amis' memoirs are the most talked-about of his career in recent years.

title: Hannibal
description: The hallmark of Harris's writing is its ability to capture the essence of suspense and make it a popular literary masterpiece.

title: Operation Shylock
description: Suppose a stranger with an identical name stole your identity and pretended to be you while traveling around the world. What would happen next?

title: The First Forty-nine Stories
description: In Ernest Hemingway's Preface, it was stated that "there lie multiple genres in this book. I hope you will find some stories of your liking where traveling and seeing the world can lead to dullness or bluntness when writing."

title: The Professor of Desire
description: David Kepesh, a college student who labels himself as 'a rake among scholars', is not fully aware of the prophetic and potentially lethal message conveyed by Philip Roth in their novel about the dilemma of pleasure.

title: The Phantom Menace
description: A long time ago, in a far-off galaxy, an evil legacy that had been assumed to be beyond reach is awakening. The dark side of the Force is on the verge of overwhelming the light, and only an ancient Jedi prophecy can stop hope, saving the young queen of Naboo's world.

title: Traitor
description: From the depths of calamity, there is a beacon of hope.

title: Star by Star
description: This is a must-read for fans of Star Wars fan fiction and the New Jedi Order series!

title: Fury
description: A brilliant and ethereal comedy by one of the world's most renowned writers, Fury is about a middle-aged professor who moves to New York City in 2000. The book begins with an intense depiction of life at opulent speed in an age of unprecedented decadence, as Malik Solanka, entrepreneur and historian of ideas, abandons his family without any hopes of finding work or reason.

title: Yeats is Dead!
description: Amnesty International supports a remarkable "serial" novel written by fifteen of the most talented Irish writers. The story begins with Roddy Doyle and concludes with Frank McCourt, while thirteen other Irish authors share an intricate tale of murder, chaos, and literary maneuvering in modern-day Dublin.

title: The Dying Animal
description: America's most unflaggingly energetic and morally serious novelist begins his book with the assertion that sex is not superior to all other things, regardless of how much we know or think we should. The speaker is David Kepesh, a well-known TV culture critic, former New York College lecturer, and vocal proponent of the sexual revolution for over four decades.

title: Illusions
description: A man in the cloudy air between Illinois and blue infinity trusts the propeller of his biplane, while Richard Bach, a disillusioned writer and itinerant barnstormer, sees nothing but gas and sparks. However, this belief is short-lived as he meets Donald Shimoda, an ex-mechanist who can make wrenches fly and Richard's imagination soars...In Illusions, the unforgettable sequel to The Man with Killers, which explores three parts of the story of how Tongao on the

title: In the Pond
description: Ha Jin's unhurried portrayal of everyday life entangled in the chaos of major social movements has earned him the nickname Issac Babel. He is known for his powerful prose, captivating writing, and ability to capture the essence of beauty and poignancy with his debut novel, In the Pond.

title: How to Travel with a Salmon and Other Essays
description: A humorous and irreverent collection of essays by Eco explores a wide range of topics, including militarism, computer jargon, Western culture, librarianship, bureaucracy, airplane travel, Amtrak trains, bad coffee, express mail, fax machines, and pornography.

title: The Trial
description: The Trial, a book set in 1914, tells the terrifying story of Josef K., an honorable bank officer who is arrested and must defend himself against an unsubstantiated charge. Kafka's nightmare has left readers haunted by this true-to-life experience.

title: Turtle Moon
description: "For a woman who is divorced, engrossed in her teenage son, and the events that transform her life from simple to complex, this account captures the heart of Veronica's story."

title: Atonement
description: Briony Tallis, a 13-year-old who is still pursuing her passion for writing, charges her older sister's lover of an unprovoked crime that forever altered the course of many lives.

title: A Birthday for Frances
description: Despite not being happy on her birthday, Frances is uncertain about whether she will give Gloria her entire birthday gift and may choose to keep half of it for herself. After all, sisters aren't good at drawing, so they never do well in playtime.

title: The Gangs of New York
description: The Gangs of New York provides a journey through an increasingly unrecognisable city that is steeped in poverty and rampant violence, informed by legend, memory, police records, the self-pragmatism of aging criminals, popular journalism, and historical research. Asbury's most definitive work on this topic is his account of the gangs leading up to the creation of Mafia film and its portrayal in films like The Godfather.

title: The Whore's Child and Other Stories
description: "The initial set of tales showcases a remarkable and captivating story, as the author explores an unexpected and intriguing range of human behavior. Russo's characters are warmly welcomed by us in this novel, much like his other novels.

title: In Watermelon Sugar
description: In iDEATH, individuals journey to the depths of their dreams where the sun changes color daily. They reject the violent and unkind nature of the Forgotten Works gang and live peacefully in watermelon sugar. In this book, Richard Brautigan uncovers and expresses the spirit of a new generation.

title: Blackwood Farm
description: Among The Others Are: Lestat, Saviour And Demon, Presidency Of A Gothic Story Of Family Greed And Hatred Through Generations; Bloodlust And Betrayal, Possession And Matricide.

title: The Carpenter's Pencil
description: An artist sketches the Portico da Gloria porch of a cathedral in Santiago de Compostela during the early months of 1936, during an unrelenting civil war that has gripped and troubled Spain and the rest of the world.

title: Sputnik Sweetheart
description: For the first time, Sumire is in love with Miu. Despite being told that she may be a lesbian, K, her primary school teacher and friend, has spent the last several hours on the phone saying "I love you."

title: South of the Border  West of the Sun
description: During his childhood in the suburbs of post-war Japan, Hajime had no siblings and was only companion to Shimamoto, an only child who spent long afternoons listening to her father's record collection. They lost touch after their family moved away, leaving him content with his wife and two daughters and success as owner of a jazz bar.

title: The Elephant Vanishes
description: When a man's beloved elephant disappears, his life is subtly upended.

title: Dance Dance Dance
description: By blending an eccentric cast of characters with Murakami's distinctive prose, this book presents an assault on all sensory perceptions, a murder mystery that is also philosophical speculation, and dreadful tales of prolific capitalism.

title: The Rings of Saturn
