While this question has fascinated scientists for centuries, cognitive psychology has finally provided some clarity on the mysterious process of creativity. In Notebooks of the Mind, author Vera John-Steiner draws upon her subject to present an entirely different perspective.

title: Masters of Small Worlds
description: The South Carolina Low Country's Stephanie McCurry is an innovative study that examines the role of the yeomanry in plantation society, exploring both the intricate web of public relations and the politics of slave society.

title: Ride of the Second Horseman
description: In "The Origins of War," Christopher Marlowe wrote that war may have been a product of literary imagination, while Robert O'Connell believes that it is an invention that emerged in specific historical situations.

title: The Great Wave
description: Who is deeply troubled by the current state of the world.

title: Bakkhai
description: Bakkhai, a scholar of Euripides, examines the religious ecstasy brought by Dionysos to Thebes, both in terms of beauty and horror. His offer of closeness to nature and freedom from civilization's constraints, particularly for women, stirs up both bitter resistance and fanatical acceptance.

title: Manic-Depressive Illness
description: The second edition of Manic-Depressive Illness will provide a comprehensive review of the biological and genetic literature that has been dominant in recent years, with new findings from the previous edition. Drs. Frederick Goodwin and Kay Redfield Jamison have updated their research on psychological and epidemiological evidence, as well as those related to diagnostic issues, course, and outcome, while also providing practical guidance for differential diagnosis and clinical management. This book is highly regarded by psychiatrists, physicians, psychologists or clinical social workers who are interested in using this academic medical intervention program.

title: El Libertador
description: General Sim12n Bol1, aka El Liberator, also known as "George Washington" in Latin America, was the pivotal figure of the independence movement in terms of his victories over Spain, including Bolivia and Panama. He went on to become the first president of Columbia in 1819, and later became dictator of Peru in 1802, while Upper Peru became a separate state, which was named Bolivia in late 1825.

title: Medea
description: Jason and the Argonauts performed the Golden Fleece with Medea's magical powers, making her one of the most powerful female performers ever.

title: Philosophy of Mind
description: The book is a complete collection of readings in the philosophy of mind, covering everything from Descartes to the most advanced aspects of the subject. It includes extensive selections on foundations, the nature of consciousness, and the essence of mental content.

title: Norse Mythology
description: Contains information about Norse gods, heroes, rituals and myths.

title: Battle Cry of Freedom
description: Battle Cry of Freedom is a new and exciting book that will undoubtedly become the go-to source for anyone who wants to learn about the Civil War, as it features fresh perspectives on historical events, including old stories and new ones that were once dismissed. James McPherson's fast-paced narrative seamlessly blends political, social, and military events throughout the two-decade gap, from Mexico to the conclusion of another at Appomattox, providing evocative descriptions and thoughtful analysis of the significant events leading up to this war, such as

title: Introduction to Philosophy
description: The fourth edition of Introduction to Philosophy, published on July 25, 2008, is the most comprehensive topically organized volume of classical and contemporary philosophy. It builds on the success of previous editions, including the inclusion of a new coeditor, John Martin Fischer, and has been updated to make it more accessible to beginners in philosophy courses. The text includes sections on life, God and evil, knowledge and reality, science philosophy, the mind/body problem, freedom of will, consciousness, ethics, as well as philosophical puzzles and paradoxes. Additionally, seventy-best education for students who miss school also features an

title: Strategies of Containment
description: A classic analysis of US security policy, with new insights into the role of Reagan, Bush Jr., Clinton, & Bush Jnr. in safeguarding the country. Preceding: 1982.

title: The Faiths of the Founding Fathers
description: An in-depth analysis of the spiritual beliefs of America's founding fathers provides an overview of religious culture during the late colonial era, while also considering the individual beliefs and contributions of both men and women who played a crucial role in American history.

title: Acts of God
description: A new section has been added to the book, dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina. Steinberg argues that natural disasters should not be dismissed as isolated acts of nature or divine decree. He also notes that business and government decisions have led to higher losses of life and property.

title: The Oxford Handbook of Philosophy of Mathematics and Logic
description: The fields of mathematics and logic have been significant areas of research since the beginning of philosophy. Since it is crucial for correct reasoning, it has also been a central aspect of philosophical thought. As epochs like these arise, philosophers have increasingly turned to mathematics as supplementary material for investigating general philosophical issues and for its contribution to knowledge gathering. Today, these fields are still highly relevant in the field of mainstream philosophy, as evidenced by the high number of articles published in these journals; however, over the past decade, there has been an explosion of work on these subjects.

title: Aristophanes' Peace
description: Aristophanes' Peace, which was performed at the City Dionysia in Athens in 421 BC, marked the end of a decade-long war with Sparta. Olson's version of the play is an entirely new compilation of manuscripts, many of which were not previously published. The commentary covers primarily literary matters, but it also includes extensive discussions on various subjects.

title: Lysistrata
description: The Lysistrata of Aristophanes was last edited in 1928 and had its final commentary in 1927, while the only previous English edition was published in 1911. This current version of the play is the first to report all manuscripts, papyri, and testimonial sources from the text over the past 60 years. It also provides a new overview of its history and lays out sweeping insights into how the Aryphanic corpus was transmitted.

title: Julius Caesar
description: Caesar is warned before returning to Rome after a successful battle, but instead falls into the assassination plot of Brutus, Cassius and Cascador.

title: King Lear
description: Showcases the tragedy of King Lear and his efforts to divide his kingdom among his three daughters.

title: Macbeth
description: Notes from both critical and historical sources are present in Shakespeare's play about murder, political ambition, and the ongoing guilt of those involved.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
description: Demonstrates the comical blunders that occur when young Claudio is tricked into believing his partner was disloyal.

title: The Oxford Dictionary of Quotations
description: Over twenty thousand quotations from every era and location are combined in a comprehensive reference that includes information on the earliest traceable source, birth and death dates, and career briefs for each entry, as well as supplementary material.

title: Medieval Philosophy : A New History of Western Philosophy  Volume 2
description: The new history of Western philosophy written by Sir Anthony Kenny is an intriguing account of a millennium of thought that began around 400 AD, covering everything from the origins of Christian and Islamic philosophy to the Renaissance. During the middle ages, philosophy thrived, and the intellectual pursuit of the period reached its peak in the thirteenth and fourteenth centuries with the systems of such great thinkers as Thomas Aquinas and John Duns Scotus.

title: Contemporary Political Philosophy
description: Will Kymlicka's latest edition of his best selling critical introduction to contemporary political theory features updated chapters on various topics from the last 11 years. These changes include new debates on political liberalism, deliberative democracy, civic republicanism, nationalism and cultural pluralism, as well as updated sections on citizenship theory, multiculturalisment, and liberal egalitarianism.

title: Clouds
description: The new translation of Clouds examines the two versions, the history of the play, an analysis of Right and Wrong, what the chorus was for, and the meanings of some of its most famous sexual jokes. Additionally, Dover provides notes on metrical analysis, a comprehensive commentary, as well as indexes that were previously unexamined in the previous version of this play.

title: Power  Sex  Suicide
description: Within our cells, there are many complex living things that share the responsibility of producing energy. Mitochondria are small structures that play a crucial role in driving complex life on Earth. However, they also have their own DNA and separate set of genes from those within the cell nucleus. It is believed that these organisms evolved as bacteria during different periods in history and were enslaved within larger cells to create new life.

title: The Oxford Companion to Philosophy
description: More than 2,200 entries are available that cover all aspects of philosophy and the lives and works of significant philosophers from ancient times to the present day.

title: The Church in Ancient Society
description: The Church in Ancient Society offers a detailed and enjoyable account of the first six centuries of Christianity. It examines how this influence was disseminated, including its impact on ancient Greek and Roman culture, belief in gods, and religious practices.

title: William Shakespeare: The Complete Works
description: Provides an overview of William Shakespeare's works, highlighting the early manuscripts and their significance, as well as providing a canon and chronological structure for writing, an examination of his language, and citations.

title: East and West: The Making of a Rift in the Church
description: Christian Christians have experienced the most significant separation between east and west, Roman Catholic and eastern Orthodox, which persists to this day. Henry Chadwick's detailed analysis of the splits between Rome and Constantinople begins with the Apostolic period and extends it to before the Council of Florence in the fifteenth century.

title: An Introduction to Political Philosophy
description: The revised version of this highly successful work provides a concise and accessible introduction to some of the most important questions of political philosophy. Wolff presents an easy-to-follow structure for newcomers, while also introducing some unique ideas of his own.

title: Six Easy Pieces
description: The post-World War II era saw the rise of Richard P. Feynman, who was considered the most innovative physicist ever. His career was marked by both groundbreaking works like the atomic bomb and quantum electrodynamics, as well as his humorous and brilliant teachings.

title: Robin Williams Web Design Workshop
description: Williams applies her lessons on creative design, which is highly respected in the graphics industry, to the Web. Full color is provided.

title: The Actor in You
description: The Actor in Youenh enhances the reader’s appreciation of the art of acting by helping them realise that they already have skills: ‘playing a role;... creating scenes (and endings) for dramatic effect[clarification needed] [note 1] [...] an easy-to-use, direct-looking and enjoyable writing style—which has been well-used in the classroom thanks to teachers who used it with great success.’ This revised edition features exercises and examples from readers’ daily life as well as famous films and TV shows.

title: It's Not about the Bike
description: Express on Sunday highlights Lance Armstrong's exceptional talent, despite his professional achievements in 1992 and 1994.

title: Non-Fiction
description: Chuck Palahniuk's world has been vastly different from mine and yours. The pieces in Nonfiction are both highly entertaining and deeply disturbing.

title: Every Second Counts
description: Following his courageous fight against terminal testicular cancer, Lance Armstrong returned to professional cycling in 1999. His first book, It's Not About the Bike, was a global bestseller and now features more insights into his remarkable life story, including the birth of his twin daughters Grace and Isabel.

title: Quimby the Mouse
description: The use of classic animation and advertising techniques in Quimby the Mouse is a clever way to channel modern existentialism, with its mournful mouse silhouette suffering from every angle while the Beckett-inspired rhythm of hope fills the pages.

title: The Crescent Obscured
description: Throughout the colonial period and recent conflicts in the Middle East, encounters with the Muslim world have helped define America's national identity and purpose. Robert Allison examines the perceptions and misperceptions of Islam among Americans during their interaction with North African nations from 1776 to 1815, while also exploring how Islam had shaped American society as a nation-state.

title: The Bridge on the Drina
description: By examining The Bridge on the Drina, we are presented with a vivid depiction of the agony that the Bosnian people endured from the late 16th century to the start of World War I. As we endeavor to reconcile the present nightmare in this area, this book is an invaluable resource for understanding the history of our nation and beyond.

title: Love and Saint Augustine
authors: Hannah Arendt;Joanna Vecchiarelli Scott;Judith Chelius Stark
description: Hannah Arendt's significant early work is now accessible for the first time through an English translation authored by Joanna Vecchiarelli Scott and Judith Chelius Stark, which includes his own extensive revisions and additional notes extracted from letters, contracts, documents, and other sources.

title: Plato's Symposium
description: The Symposium on Plato, which was deemed the most sexually charged of all philosophers by Allan Bloom, is considered one of his finest works. This new edition features the English translation of Seth Benardete's "On Platop'S Symposium," as well As two other informative commentaries on the topic: "The Ladder of Love" and "Alchemy," written by A. Bloom himself.

title: Philosophy in a Time of Terror
description: Borradori's introduction argues that philosophy has an essential role in understanding terrorism. Just as the traumas of colonialism, totalitarianism, and the Holocaust wrote the history of the twentieth century, the current challenge to "get beyond this" is already being experienced by global terrorist groups.

title: A Preface to Democratic Theory  Expanded Edition
description: In this fiftieth-anniversary edition, Dahl has crafted a comprehensive new afterword that reconsiders Madisonian theory in light of recent research. Additionally, he provides supplementary material for his posthumous foreword, reflecting on the changes in his influential volume and its impact on political science.

title: Lost Prophet
description: A biographical portrait of one of the most courageous civil rights activists of our era. American historian D'Emilio takes Bayard Rustin on a journey through the dark and cruel world of homophobia.

title: The Work of Mourning
description: The New York Times has identified Jacques Derrida as one of the most famous philosophers in the world, and his reputation is well-deserved. However, he also earned respect for his career and friendships with colleagues and peers. The Work of Mourning is a collection of texts that pay tribute to these friendship among others.

title: History of Religious Ideas  Volume 3
description: The third volume of A History of Religious Ideas is the culmination of Eliade's work on the movement of Jewish thought in ancient Eurasia, the Christian transformation in the Mediterranean region and Europe, and the rise and spread of Islam from the sixth to the seventeenth centuries. His extensive knowledge of history and current scholarship provides a synthesis that is unmatched. He also examines the interactions of the three religions and shows how they have maintained their mutual influence, much like his previous works.

title: Bengal Nights
description: The 1930s Calcutta is the setting for this intimate roman á clef. Written by Mircea Eliade, it was a semiautobiographical novel that recounts Alain's awakening experiences and his encounters with pious French engineers.

title: The Complete Tales of Nikolai Gogol
description: The collection of short stories depicts life in rural Russia and satirizes Russian society.

title: Love  Sex & Tragedy
description: A distinguished classicist presents a retrospective of the Greek and Roman origins of various systems, from hard structures to political regimes, exploring inaccuracies and philosophical concerns throughout history.

title: Greek tragedies
description: The Grene and Lattimore editions of Greek tragedies have been highly regarded and celebrated by the University of Chicago Press. They are currently being reprinted in a beautiful slipcased edition for the Centennial, along with other refurbished versions of well-known paperback titles. Two of the original translations have also been removed for this edition; David Grenede only translated one of these plays: Oedipus, an Anglo-Dutch version from 1830.

title: The Complete Greek Tragedies: Euripides
description: The Grene and Lattimore editions of Greek tragedies have been highly regarded and celebrated by the University of Chicago Press. They are currently being reprinted in a beautiful slipcased edition for the Centennial, along with other refurbished versions of well-known paperback titles. Two of the original translations have also been removed for this edition; David Grenede only translated one of these plays: Oedipus, an Anglo-Dutch version from 1830.

title: Greek Tragedies
description: This is a playwright's compilation of 15 plays by Euripedes, Sophocles and Aeuschylus, including the Orestiae trilogy (written by Severus), Oedipus (3 centuries after Euryptes' death) and his Trilogy of Odinodentes.

title: Oresteia
description: The three plays are translated from H.W. Smyth's Loeb Classical Library, which includes a brief overview of Aeschylus' life and the organization of early tragedy.

title: Euripides I
description: The list of contents includes Alcestis, The Medea, and Hippolytus.

title: Aeschylus: The suppliant maidens
description: Nine paperback volumes of the Greek tragedies, including Grene and Lattimore, are the most extensive selection in English available. Throughout time, these authoritative and highly regarded editions have been the preferred choice of over three million readers for personal libraries and individual study as well as classroom use.

title: Billy Budd  Sailor
description: With the inclusion of detailed notes and commentary, the definitive text of Billy Budd, Sailor provides a glimpse into the development and evolution of Melville's masterpiece.

title: Gilgamesh Epic and Old Testament Parallels
description: Heidel's essay examines the prevailing ideas of death, afterlife, and flood in ancient Tigris and Mesopotamian cultures, using the same careful scholarship as his previous book, The Babylonian Genesis, to compare them with comparable parts of the Old Testament.

title: Works of Hesiod and the Homeric Hymns
description: The 2005 Harold Morton Landon Translation Award from the Academy of American Poets was won by Daryl Hine, a celebrated poet and translator who translated ancient Greek texts into verse.

title: The Collaborator
description: Robert Brasillach, a prolific novelist, literary critic, and passionate critic of French democracy, was executed by treason in France on February 6, 1945. He served as the editor in chief of the fascist weekly Je Suis Partout and faced criticism for his wartime denunciation of Jews and resistance activists. Was Brasiliach indeed guilty of such an act?

title: Heat Wave
description: Sociologist Klinenberg's book "Heat Wave" provides insight into the silent nature of heat waves and the role they played in causing over 700 deaths during a week-long wave of unprecedented heat and humidity in Chicago in 1995, along with illustrations and maps.

title: Moral Politics
description: Lakoff examines the rhetorical and unconscious worldviews of liberals and conservatives in this renowned work, uncovering distinct yet unmistakable perspectives on morality.

title: A River Runs Through It
description: The Big Blackfoot River and fly fishing are the subjects of interest for the narrator and his brother.

title: Young Men and Fire
description: The Montana Mann Gulch fire of 1949 is the subject of a fascinating investigation, with eyewitness accounts, new evidence, and research from fire scientists.

title: Antitrust Law  Second Edition
description: The first edition of Richard Posner's book, which was published 250 years ago, provided an economic explanation and rationale for antitrust law. This approach was a stark contrast to the intellectual chaos that existed at that time.

title: A Dance to the Music of Time
description: "The whirlwind of distant events in Germany and Spain is a precursor to the storm of WWII. In England, men and women are on the brink of fate as they face difficulties due to their marriages, extramarital affairs, frivolous fashions; personal triumphs and failures."

title: The Family Idiot
description: This volume, published by the University of Chicago Press, is a crucial translation of essentially everything known to anyone interested in the last great contribution of Flaubert. Sartre's study of The Family Idiot remains undisputed as one of the greatest works in intellectual history, but some have questioned whether this novel or biography, or "criticism-fiction," was an exact reflection of his philosophical, social, and literary life.

title: History of Political Philosophy
description: This volume offers an unparalleled look at the thoughts of key figures in the Western tradition of political philosophy from the classical Greek period to the twentieth century, with extensive contributions from scholars on various philosophers. Including new and revised essays, this third edition is much more comprehensive than before.

title: From Counterculture to Cyberculture
description: The American popular imagination was haunted by computers in the early 1960s, when they represented a dysfunctional organization and mechanical conformity that enabled the military-industrial complex. However, with the rise of the Internet, computers became radically different from this, embodying neoclassical utopia created by hippies who fiercely opposed the cold war establishment. A new book, From Counterculture to Cyberculture, examines this striking and ironic transformation.

title: Genetics and the Origin of Species
description: The first edition of Dobzhansky's groundbreaking and classic inquiry into the biological theory of evolution, as outlined in "Genetics and the Origin of Species" with an introduction by Stephen Jay Gould, was published three times between 1941 and 1951.

title: The Pillow Book of Sei Sh?nagon
description: The Pillow Book of Sei Shonagon is an exceptional representation of Japanese court life, written during the height of Heian culture. It contains many engrossing accounts, humor, and subtle inflections. Seijin poet Sein Shonigon was a contemporary and former adversary of Lady Murasaki, whose novel, The Tale of Genji, fictionalized the court lifestyle that Lady Shondo documented so vividly in her diary.

title: Three Plays by Kobo Abe
description: Kobo Abe's passion for the absurd despite universal concerns is evident in his translations of three popular Japanese plays, Involuntary Homicide, The Green Stockings, and The Ghost is Here.

title: The Columbia Reader on Lesbians and Gay Men in Media  Society  and Politics
description: The development of gay identity, religious beliefs, scientific and medical studies, legal perspectives, mainstream media, lesbian and gay media in general, and community prospects and tactics are among the topics covered in over one hundred articles, essays, or primary documents--ranging from Eve Kosofsky Sedgwick's essay "How to Bring Your Kids Up Gay" to Joseph Cardinal Ratzinger' 'Letter to the Bishops of the Catholic Church on the Pastoral Care of Homosexual Persons' to a 1947 Newsweek article, "Homophilophiles in Uniform."

title: Poems Between Women
description: Poems Between Women, a collection of poems, explores female-female relationships and complex emotions. The poems cover historical development and changing mores across the 18th century, including topics such as marriage equality, homosexuality, and heterosexuality.

title: Antigone's Claim
description: What is the rationale behind smokers' belief that smoking the first cigarette is better? Why do heavy drinkers believe "the hair-of-the-dog" treatment aids in relieving hangovers? How does marijuana impact one's mental and emotional health? Intoxicating Minds is not a drug-fueled fantasy, but rather reflects an exploration of how drugs have changed and become prevalent.

title: The Vital Illusion
description: How will the advent of cloning impact us? What does the turn of the millennium reveal about our relationship with time?

title: An Arab-Syrian Gentleman and Warrior in the Period of the Crusades
description: The life of Us?mah ibn-Munqidh, who is considered the epitome of the peak of Arab civilization during the early Crusading period, is documented in his memoirs, which offer a unique insight into medieval European culture and medical practices.

title: William Faulkner
description: The novel investigates the perplexing phenomenon of new veiling among lower middle class women in Cairo, Egypt, who voluntarily adopt a traditional symbol of female subordination.

title: Nathaniel Hawthorne  The Scarlet Letter
description: Contains an account and sample of various interpretations of Hawthorne's "The Scarlet Letter," including moral and historical criticism, New Criticism, archetypal and myth criticism (both established and emerging), psychoanalytical/feminist criticism (5-5) and linguistic and semiotic criticism (6-1).

title: The Poetry of Sylvia Plath
description: The collection of'seminal' essays on science fiction is dedicated to exploring the subject of serious critical questioning in Liquid Metal. It features eight distinct sections that cover topics such as the cyborg, sciencefiction city, time travel, primal scene, fandom, and 1950s invasion narratives. Notable authors include Susan Sontag, Vivian Sobchack (a member of CAST), J.P. Telotte, Peter Biskind, Constance Penley, Joanne Burgstad, Pauline Foster Foster:

title: The Intellectuals and the Flag
authors: Todd Gitlin;Professor of Culture Journalism and Sociology Todd Gitlin
description: urged left-wing intellectuals to return to public life and "rejoin the culture of knee-jerk rejection, intellectual fads and political orthodoxy" Gitlin calls for renewed patriotism under the values of sacrifice, toughness in critics, and willingness to look back on the global role America plays in the aftermath of 9/11.

title: More Than You Know
description: Mauboussin combines biology, physics, and psychology with disciplines that are typically not associated with finance to support investors in decision-making and promote a new investment philosophy.

title: Nietzsche and Philosophy
description: Nietzsche and Philosophy is lauded for its exceptional blend of academic depth and imaginative interpretation, making it a highly regarded work. It is also one of the most excellent introductions to Deleuze's philosophy, as it highlights three crucial concepts in Niettan thought-multiplicity, becoming, and affirmation-and provides lucidation on Niétischean thinking.

title: Oliver Twist
description: This delightful collection offers an opportunity to delve into exciting tales, such as the menacing adventure of Frankenstein, the thrilling adventure at Treasure Island, and the captivating animal narrative in Call of the Wild. Each story is a condensed and easily understandable version of The Long Walkman, which loses none of its originality and style without any significant impact.

title: 20 000 Leagues Under the Sea
description: This is the brevity of the adventures of a French professor and his two friends as they explore both the oceans above and below on Captain Nemo's fantastic electric submarine.

title: Avid Editing
description: The text is designed for users who have primarily or recently worked with Avid Xpress, formerly known as DV and Media Composer. These digital editing systems provide an abundance of creative options for filmmaking and video-making, but are challenging to master. Chapters offer readers detailed project directions and practice chapters while the DVD includes immediate interactive narrative footage that can be downloaded from the publisher. The book can also be read and studied at home, or while sitting in front of an AviD, following the book's step-by-step instructions.

title: Directing the Documentary
description: The reader is guided by Michael Rabiger through the stages of conconcerting, editing, and producing a documentary. He also offers guidance on legal matters, ethics, authorship, career options (e.g.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
description: A tiny and hungry caterpillar in Eric Carle's children' book manages to chew through the pages, resulting in a delightful tale.

title: The Best of McSweeney's
description: The second instalment of Dave Eggers's crash course in McSweeney' s, Volume 2, brings together more stories from the first ten issues and showcases the brilliance, innovation, and unexpected in this remarkable collection.

title: Stuart Little
description: A charming mouse named Stuart Little embarks on a quest to find his closest companion, the small bird that spent ten days in his family's garden.

title: Zora Neale Hurston
description: Describes the events, connections, and triumphs that defined the life of the black novelist, folklorist (often called poets, playwrights), and explorer-gatherer, Mary Shelley Longfellow, in terms of her contributions to the fabric of black folk tradition.

title: Chicago Stories
authors: James Thomas Farrell;Professor James T Farrell
description: This compilation features twenty-five short stories in James Farrell's American short fiction collection, which were selected from his first ten books and take place in Chicago.

title: Dante's Vita Nuova
description: The Vita Nuova (the New Life) is a new translation that has gained immense popularity in comparative literature classes. Its original text tells the story of Dante's love for Beatrice, but it is presented in prose and sometimes in verse. Musa believes that the "Book of Memory" was intended to offer melodramatic commentary on his young lover, using tradition from ancient Rome as an example.

title: A Theory of Semiotics
description: The most significant contribution to semiotics since the works of C. S. Peirce and Charles Morris, according to the Journal of Aesthetics and Art Criticism, which draws on various disciplines and explores diverse themes.

title: The Role of the Reader
description: Not only is this novel and its intriguing content highly stimulating, but it is also extremely heuristic. The Review of Metaphysics recommends this book for anyone interested in exploring the new reader-centered forms of criticism emerging in literature.

title: The Basic Problems of Phenomenology
description: Continues and prolongs the explorations initiated in Being and Time.

title: Hegel's Phenomenology of Spirit
description: In his lecture on Hegel's Phenomenology of Spirit in 1930-1931, Martin Heidegger included some of Heidesgger' defining statements regarding temporality, ontological difference and dialectic, as well as being and time. Within the framework of His project to reinterpret Western thought through its central figures, HeIDEGGER takes up a fundamental concern: Being and Time, "a dissolution of the history of ontology...a problem of temporal decay with the question of Timing." He suggests that this statement

title: Dante's Inferno
description: Contains verses translated into English from Dante's "Inferno," as well the first canticle of the "Divine Comedy" in ten different ways.

title: Introduction to Documentary
description: How do Documentary Films tackle ethical concerns?

title: The Treason of Isengard
description: An alternate universe with a romantic storyline.

title: The Lost Road
description: Volume 5 of the History of Middle-earth, which contains the initial myths and legends that led to Tolkien's war-themed novel, The Silmarillion.

title: The Lays of Beleriand
description: The third volume of The History of Middle-earth provides a comprehensive look into the early myths and legends that were used to create Tolkien's war story, The Silmarillion.

title: The Monsters and the Critics
description: J.R. Tolkien's seven essays are the result of his research into medieval literature.

title: The Hobbit  Or  There and Back Again
description: Until a wandering wizard granted his wish, Bilbo Baggins, the wealthy hobbit, lived sanely in his cozy home.

title: The Parallax View
description: Attempts to correct dialectical materialism by discussing the "parallax gap," which is caused by the displacement of an object due to a change in observational orientation between two points.

title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
description: The recent changes to "Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs" have had a significant impact on computer science curricula. This highly anticipated revision includes new implementations of major programming systems, including interpreters and compilers. The authors also included new small changes that reflect their teaching experience at MIT. A new theme has been introduced that highlights the central role of different approaches to managing time in computational models: objects with state, concurrent programming, and loops/time tables.

title: The Man Who Tasted Shapes
description: Exposes the peculiar medical mystery of synesthesia, a state where individuals can sense different shapes or detect various sounds and scents, and proposes that everyone possesses synesthetic abilities.

title: Elbow Room
description: Reason, self-control, time, cause and effect, accidents, responsibility, free will - all of these concepts are discussed in essays.

title: Theory of Colours
description: Goethe's explanations of color phenomena can lead readers to disengage from the wavelength theory, which he never mentions, and instead encourage them to consider color theory without prejudice.

title: An Odyssey in Learning and Perception
description: An Odyssey in Learning and Perception chronicles a fifty-year intellectual journey through the domains of learning and perception, with utmost effort to merge them into 'perceptual learninganddevelopment' theory, which can be applied to both humans and non-humans, as well as to individuals between the ages of 11 and 15. In the field of psychology, from the early 1950s an important series of studies was conducted by Eleanor J. Gibson that led to the creation of perceptural learning but ultimately culminated in the seminal work, Perceptional Learning

title: Pop Internationalism
description: This collection of essays by Paul Krugman concentrates on "pop internationalists" who speak impressively about international trade while disregarding basic economics and misusing economic figures. He uses a clear, engaging style that gained popularity for his popular Age of Diminished Expectations, which emphasizes the importance of understanding economic terms and measurements.

title: Development  Geography  and Economic Theory
description: In the field of economics, why do some ideas become popular while others are left largely unexplored?

title: Inattentional Blindness
description: The radical claim by Arien Mack and Irvin Rock is that there is no conscious perception of the visual world without attention to it.

title: The Language of New Media
description: Lev Manovich's theory of new media is rooted in the cinema and features both imaginative and rigorous elements. He places new medieries within the historical context of visual and media cultures, exploring how they use outdated media techniques to create an illusion of reality, address the viewer, and represent space. Furthermore, new médiagraphies explore unique categories and forms associated with new mediums, such as interface and database.

title: Turtles  Termites  and Traffic Jams
description: A book by Bradford, with bibliographical details (p. [157]-163) included.

title: Looking Awry
description: A key figure in the emerging social movements across Eastern Europe, Slavoj Zizek offers a masterly interpretation of Jacques Lacan. He delves into the intricate philosophical concepts of the French philosopher and psychoanalyst through his use of contemporary popular culture, including Hitchcock's Vertigo and Stephen King'S Pet Sematary from McGill University to Montenegro.

title: The Puppet and the Dwarf
authors: Slavoj Žižek;Žižek;Stockholm Inst Of Transition Staff;Mladen Dolar;Alenka Zupancic
description: In his book The Puppet and the Dwarf, Slavoj Zizek offers a unique perspective on early Christianity that considers it as the first revolutionary group. He also draws on pop culture to explore contemporary intellectual divides, using both theoretical and philosophical approaches in his analysis of religion.

title: Treatise on Happiness
description: In the Treatise on Happiness and the treatissage dedicated to Human Acts, one can find the first twenty-one questions from I-II of the Summa Theologiae. St. Thomas Aquinas' explanation of what real happiness is and how it can be attained is a detailed and challenging account of his definition of goals for human life, both past and future. This translation presents the lasting contributions of this important Christian thinker in accurate, consistent, contemporary English.

title: Marketing and the Bottom Line
description: By conducting extensive research with top companies like 3M, Accenture, British Airways, Diageo, and McDonald's, Marketing and the bottom line aims to revolutionize the market by examining how marketing impacts financial success. Ambler views marketing as a strategic function at the board level, emphasizing the importance of marketing metrics to make it more accountable for its actions, spending, or earnings.

title: Traders  Guns & Money
description: Traders, Guns and Money is an exceptional first-person account of the derivatives industry, with Warren Buffett coining the term "financial weapons of mass destruction" to describe them. While some WMDs are more complex, derivative buyers lack knowledge of their risks and are often left clueless about their origins.

title: The Heights of Courage
description: The State of Israel was invaded by Egyptian and Syrian forces in October 1973, during which Israel outwitted and triumphed. The brief and bloody Yom Kippur War is considered a unique event in modern military history, as tank units engaged in combat against each other while soldiers on the ground demonstrate human sacrifice, discipline, and endurance.

title: C. S. Lewis
description: Explores the life and legacy of the British writer and academic who is most well-known for his "The Chronicles of Narnia" novels.

title: The Lost World of Agharti
description: The quest for truth in the ancient legend of a hidden kingdom that was connected to every continent through vast tunnels and passageways has been ongoing since antiquity. According to legend, the people who inhabit this utopia lived in seclusion for thousands of years, protecting the Vril Power from which humans and nature can be ruled. This remarkable book recounts the findings of numerous explorers who have searched for information and attempted to follow the tunnel system leading to Agharti.

title: Zero
description: Despite being banned by the Babylonians, forbidden by Greeks, worshipped by Hindus and used as a tool for defying heretics in Christianity, Zero is now considered an unresolved number.

title: Zen Buddhism & Psychoanalysis
authors: Daisetz Teitaro Suzuki;Erich Fromm;Richard De Martino
description: How do Eastern and Western perspectives differ on the characteristics of the human mind and our role in society, and what insights can we gain from Zen and psychoanalysis?

title: The Wanderer
description: My pleasure has always been watching flowers and insects fight for survival. They would burst into full size and last an hour during hot weather, while big, strong flies were just as lively in midsummer. I also witnessed a unique type of earth-bug that could jump several times its own length without any resistance.

title: Memoirs
description: The Nobel laureate and one of the most remarkable poets of our time, Pablo Neruda, narrates his distinguished career as both diplomat and politician, during which he interacted with notable personalities such as Gandhi, Che Guevara (a revolutionary poet), and Mao Tse Ching.

title: Paso Del Norte
description: Juan Rulfo, a significant contributor to Mexican post-Revolutionary literature, gained worldwide recognition for his exceptional short novel Pedro Páramo (1955) and his collection of short stories El llano en lámas (1953), which was translated into English for the first time.

title: 100 Love Sonnets
description: Poems reveal the depth of the distinguished Chilean writer's affection for his partner.

title: Long Day's Journey
description: By combining historical photographs, advertisements, posters, and contemporary accounts, Schwantes reconstructs one of the most vibrant times in the American West. The collection comprises 255 illustrations, 40 of which are in color.

title: Philip Vera Cruz
description: In his memoir, Philip Vera Cruz eloquently presented California's labor history and Asian American experience in its most recent chapter. The speaker provides an exceptional leadership perspective that sheds light on the significant role played by Filipino laborers in shaping the United Farm Workers movement.

title: Mark Twain's Own Autobiography
description: The study consists of fifteen papers that explore three closely related topics: 1) the textual construction of professions, 2) the discursive process of incorporating outsiders into special discourse communities, and 3) the influence of texts on various social activities.

title: Letters to J. D. Salinger
description: Contains nearly eighty personal letters addressed to the author of The Catcher in the Rye, written by prominent writers such as Frederick Busch, Nicholas Delbanco, Stewart O'Nan, George Plimpton, Melanie Rae Thon, W. P. Kinsella, and others.

title: The Poems of Alexander Pope
description: The Twickenham Edition is the only one-volume presentation of Pope's poems, except for his translations of Homer. It includes all but the corpus of his poetry as printed in the previous edition.

title: Psychoanalysis and Religion
description: The dilemma of the modern age between traditional religion and a philosophy that prioritizes the satisfaction of instinctual and material values is examined by renowned psychoanalysts.

title: Euthyphro  Apology  Crito  Meno  Gorgias  Menexenus
description: The Parmenides are highly regarded by scholars and philosophers as one of the most important texts in Plato's later dialogues, with annotated sections that provide insight into the physics and ontology that Aristotle proposed in his Physics and Metaphysics VII. In this book, R.E. Allen provides a comprehensive translation and structural analysis of these texts, which assumes formal elements such as logic and geometry.

title: The Shaping of America: A Geographical Perspective on 500 Years of History
description: Atlantic America, 1492-1800, and Continental America from 1800-1967 are both in the order of V.1.

title: Seeing Like a State
description: In a range of fields, Scott examines failed attempts at authoritarianism.

title: Leonardo on Painting
description: Martin Kemp and Margaret Walker have compiled material from Leonardo da Vinci's Treatise on Painting, his surviving manuscripts, and other primary sources to their editing.

title: Dreaming in Pictures
authors: Douglas Robert Nickel;Lewis Carroll;San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
description: "Although Reverend Charles Lutwidge Dodgson wrote about Lewis Carroll, he was known for his photography in the art world of Victorian England. His photographs are not limited to Carroll's style, but rather reflect the work of a serious photographic artist."

title: Art and Beauty in the Middle Ages
description: The renowned Italian novelist and philosopher Umberto Eco's lively and authoritative book offers a comprehensive overview of medieval aesthetic ideas, exploring the relationship between aesthetic theories and the artistic expression and practice of Medieval culture.

title: Long Day's Journey Into Night
description: The play portrays the author's personal struggles in a family of four individuals with mental illness.

title: Marcel Proust
description: It is a magisterial account of the life and times of Marcel Proust, using recently published letters, memoirs and manuscript material to provide new insights into his artistry, character, and most importantly his masterpiece "In Search of Lost Time" (known in English as "Remembrance of Things Past") with 47 illustrations.

title: How Democratic is the American Constitution?
description: He contends that the American Constitution contains significant flaws and distracts from a democratic society, including discussions on the electoral college, the Federalist Papers, and proportional representation.

title: The Voices of Morebath
description: The recipient of the Hawthornden Prize for Literature is a woman.

title: Cosmos
description: In crime fiction, Gombrowicz delves into the depths of human suffering.

title: Cuba
description: This exhibition delves into the controversial island nation's past, examining its pre-Columbian origins and the destiny of its indigenous peoples, while also providing current information on Cuba'S position in a post-Soviet world.

title: Eva Hesse Drawing
authors: Menil collection (Houston, Tex.).;Eva Hesse;Drawing center (New York).;Drawing Center (New York, N.Y.);Walker Art Center (Minneapolis, Minn.).;Museum of Contemporary Art (Los Angeles, Calif.)
description: Presents a display catalogue that showcases the artist's functional sketches and reflections on her artwork and techniques.

title: The Annotated Waste Land with Eliot's Contemporary Prose
description: It is a definitive edition of the twentieth-century's most influential poem.

title: The Collapse of the Third Republic
description: On June 17, 1940, William L. Shirer witnessed a massive display of gray German uniforms on the streets of Paris during his visit to Europe. This was followed by six weeks of intense fighting in the spring and summer of that year, which resulted in an unprecedented military triumph for one of the world's oldest, greatest empires, and most civilized nations—the second-most powerful empire on earth—and the owner of one derivable military equipment ever built. How did this event come about after years of research into World War II archives, as well as hundreds of contacts who had still included

title: The Complete Short Stories Of Robert Louis Stevenson
description: The editor has compiled Robert Louis Stevenson's short fiction into four volumes, including the complete New Arabian Nights and The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, as well as ghost stories, medieval romances, farces, horror stories (such as Abel and Hobbit), and the South Sea Tales. Stevensons was a formidable writer who wrote some of Scotland' best-known novels such as Treasure Islander, Kidnapped, The Weir of Hermiston, in which he had no realty or based on his own unique

title: Hemingway
description: Through his innovative writing style, which was characterized by its precision, graceful use of language and irresistible depth, Ernest Hemingway (1899-1961) transformed the literary landscape and revolutionized the reading and writing community. His works, including The Sun Also Rises, A Farewell to Arms (published after his death), For Whom the Bell Tolls (1979), The Old Man and the Sea (1981), and numerous short stories, explored universal themes such as stoicism in adversity, as well as our futile struggles against nature and death, an important

title: Unsung Heroes of Rock 'n' Roll
description: With 42 illustrations, the author of "Country" now pays tribute to a time when music was in constant state of flux, suddenly disbanded, and brutal--the golden age of rock 'n'roll, long before Elvis even existed.

title: The Dark Side Of Genius
description: The definitive biography of Alfred Hitchcock, the enigmatic and highly private director behind Psycho (1969), Vertigo (1979), Rear Window (1978), The Birds (1984), and Over forty other films, provides a comprehensive overview of his life and career, with an emphasis on the film's central themes of blondes, food, murder, and idealized love.

title: Johnny Cash
description: Discusses the journey of a country singer who became famous as the "Man in Black" and struggled with feelings of guilt, addiction, and self-doubt throughout his life.

title: 23 Days in July
description: In July, the Tour de France takes place over twenty-three days and covers more than 2,100 miles of rugged mountain terrain, making it the most demanding sporting event ever. Lance Armstrong, a five-time winner, was determined to become the sixth Tour champion in 2004, but he faced four fierce competitors who were determined not to make his dream come true by preventing Le Boss from achieving his goal.

title: The Deeper Meaning of Liff
description: Provides a glossary that includes "Tingrith," which refers to the sensation of aluminum foil against paper, and "Ahenny," as people gaze at each other's books.

title: The Last Boleyn
description: While Henry is generally polite, he can also come across as arrogant and possessive. He is a diligent worker, but his frequent illness puts pressure on him to do his job.

title: Giada's Family Dinners
description: A collection of effortless and adaptable recipes for Italian food enthusiasts with a hectic schedule, written by the Food Network host and top-selling author Everyday Italian, provides guidance on creating delicious yet straightforward meals for both casual evenings or special holiday celebrations. 400,000 copies were printed in the first edition.

title: The Spy Who Barked
description: Adam Sharp, an eight-year-old spy, is in pursuit of the Ambassador of Barkastan, who has stolen a top-secret computer program named DOGBARK that allows him to comprehend dog language.

title: Terrorist
description: Despite being raised by an Irish-American mother and a father from my past, Ahmad, an 18-year-old son, is deeply committed to the teachings of Islam and disobeyed attempts to join him in terrorism.

title: Beloved
description: In a new edition of the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, Sethe, an escaped slave living in post-Civil War Ohio with her daughter and mother-in-law, is haunted by the ghost of their dead baby girl. The book hits the first market with 25,000 copies.

title: The Name of the Rose
description: Brother William of Baskerville becomes a detective in 1327 after uncovering his confidential investigation at an Italian abbey, where he discovered seven unsettling deaths and decrypted manuscripts.

title: The Road
description: A father and his son journey through the ruins of a devastated American landscape to preserve their last remnants of humanity in an uncertain, post-apocalyptic world.

title: The Best of Wodehouse
description: The Code of the Woosters and Uncle Fred in the Springtime, along with fourteen short stories and three autobiographical pieces, are among the works presented by a prominent humorist from the 20th century.

title: Buried Child
description: A confrontation with the dark secrets of the past is set in motion on a farm where Dodge, Halie, and their sons, including Bradley who lost his leg to stab wounds from an alcohol addiction, are brought together by the arrival of Vince and his girlfriend.

title: The Devil Wears Prada
description: A girl from a small town who recently graduated from an Ivy League college finds herself in the company of prestigious fashion magazines, but she wonders if all the benefits are worth it to work for the editor.

title: Death Match
description: A former FBI forensic psychologist, Christopher Lash, is hired by the matchmaking company that introduced the pair to each other after they were found dead from an apparent double suicide. He uses this discovery as part of a covert investigation into whether the firm may have harbored secrets.

title: The Lighthouse
description: At Combe island in the Cornish coast of England, Commander Adam Dalgliesh and his team are tasked with solving a high-profile case while facing challenges from Kate Miskin, who has her own problems and is struggling to reconcile with her ex-commander, Sergeant Francis Benton-Smith.

title: If Beale Street Could Talk
description: The families of Tish, sculptor, and Fonny, who are both pregnant, work together to prove that the charges against their loved ones are untrue, including false imprisonment for the alleged rape of a Puerto Rican woman. Reprint. 10,000 first printing.

title: A Million Little Pieces
description: This memoir chronicles the struggles of a man who had struggled with substance abuse and addiction, recounting his journey to recovery and how he overcame it to confront the consequences of his actions.

title: Robert Langdon Novels
description: While in Paris for work, Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon receives an urgent call from the police about a murder in the Louvre. The police uncover cryptic evidence near the body and attempt to solve the puzzle. He is surprised to learn that there are clues hidden in Da Vinci's works, which are visible to everyone--and cleverly disguised by the artist.

title: The Sunset Limited
description: The new play by McCarthy encompasses all the heart-rending fiction he has written, but "The Sunset Limited" is more than just blood and gut feelings. It's also about the struggle for the human soul.

title: A Walk in the Woods
description: Describes the author's thrilling journey on the Appalachian Trail, exploring its natural wonders, eccentric inhabitants, and unconventional delights.

title: The Civil War
description: Foote's Civil War history is presented in three compelling volumes: Fort Sumter to Perryville, Fredericksburg to Meridian, and Red River to Appomattox"--Publisher description.

title: The Alchemist's Daughter
description: Emilie Selden, a young female scientist and alchemist, was raised in an eighteenth-century society under the watchful eye of her father, who was an eccentric chemistic scholar. Regrettably, she is drawn away from her home, work, and father due to unexpected temptations from the outside world. Reprint. 25,000 first printing.

title: Cesar's Way
description: A guide for understanding and addressing common dog behavior, The Dog Whisperer by the TV personality suggests using a dog's natural pack instincts to fix behavioral issues. He also emphasizes the importance of exercise, discipline, and affection in each dog’s life. First printing: 50,000 copies.

title: Small Bites  Big Nights
description: Despite his limited history with accidents, Percy and Harold are always willing to lend their support when they need it.

title: Why Do Men Fall Asleep After Sex?
description: The creators of Why Do Men Have Nipples? are back with a new book that offers an unconventional approach to the topic of health, exploring unmentionable body parts, bodily functions, and embarrassing body peculiarities. The book has already sold 300,000 copies.

title: Everyday Pasta
description: Exhibits a diverse selection of Italian culinary options, encompassing both classic and innovative dishes, along with straightforward instructions for preparing fresh pasta and various accompaniments.

title: Dreams from My Father
description: A man born to an African father and a white American mother discusses his childhood in Hawaii, his struggle with identity depletion, and the achievements of his life.

title: Gifted Hands
description: Explores the life and legacy of the celebrated neurosurgeon.

title: Trial by Fire
description: Following the discovery of a young African-American man shot in the rubble and the burning down of minister Nick Foster's church, paramedic Issie Mattreaux works with emergency personnel to investigate the scene.

title: "A" is for Abductive
authors: Leonard I. Sweet;Brian D. McLaren;Jerry Haselmayer
description: Abductive B is used for Carpe Manana, Double-Ring for EPICtivities, Fractals and Grace H for Holarchy, Icon J for Grace, J-Factor for Icons, Loopy M for Metanarrative N for OPEN-ENDENDY, Prayer Q for Quest-ions, Radical Orthodoxy, and S.

title: Breach of Promise
description: Actor and father Mark Gillen investigates the extent to which modern courts will attempt to prevent a child from being raised by clerics who hold extreme Christian views.

title: Deadlock
description: U.S. Supreme Court justice Millicent turns to her new pastor for guidance after being fatally struck by a car and undergoes utterance of 'honorable' religious conversion forcing her to reconsider voting and face impeachment.

title: Ever After
description: A young Army reservist named Justin and her heartening love for him, which she profess for years, eventually become married, while Emily's parents face the challenge of reconciling their differences over Iraq war issues.

title: Fanning the Flame
description: The mission, the cross, and the Bible are being led by members of the evangelical Anglicans.

title: The Church on the Other Side
description: Experimented methods for pastors and churches seeking dependable and practical support to move beyond the current era. Revised and expanded, before being renamed Reinventing Your Church.

title: The Church in Emerging Culture
description: A lively, entertaining, and educational discussion on the shape of the modern church.

title: Becoming a Contagious Christian
description: The Becoming a Contagious Christian course is renowned for its practical and hands-on approach to evangelizing, with over one million participants sharing their experiences.

title: Journey into God's Word
description: Journey Into God's Word is designed to help believers gain the skills needed to navigate life.

title: Zondervan Handbook to the Bible
description: Bible study guide.

title: Velvet Elvis
description: A guide to pursuing genuine Christian values that encourages an expression of faith that is personal, rather than conforming to the beliefs of others, in a handbook that draws on Jesus' experiences and offers insight into the infinite nature of God.

title: Purpose Driven Life MM Camouflage Edition
description: The most popular spiritual journey of all time, this 40-day study will help you understand your purpose in life and God's plan for your life.

title: A Search for What Makes Sense
description: Realizing faith is not a mere physical exercise that requires abandoning truth and intellectual honesty. In two companion volumes, Brian McLaren calls to rest on the shoulders of both your mind and heart as he guides you in discovering'real, honest, good, enriching, transforming, and yourself'.

title: The Complete Green Letters
description: Contains five volumes, each of which offers biblical principles and keys to spiritual growth in Christ.

title: Zondervan NIV Study Bible
description: The NIV translation of the study Bible has achieved the highest sales figures. It comes with updated and fully revised sections, as well as a library of study materials including over 20,000 in-text study notes. "An excellent choice for homeschooling" is what makes this book stand out.

title: How to Write a Damn Good Novel
description: Covers: Characterisation, storyline, subject matter, tensions, conclusion and conclusion, viewpoint, argument/concept, editing, pitching, rejection.

title: The Sun in the Morning
description: She describes her childhood spent in India, her love for the romance, mystery and culture of that country, and the creative inspiration she continues to find in the India of the Raj.

title: The Awakening
description: Elaine Showalter's book, The awakening as a single book by Margit Stange, explores the relationship between personal property and the female self.

title: James Herriot's Treasury for Children
description: A compilation of the author's short stories for kids, including "Moses the Kitten," "The Market Square Dog," and "Smudge, the Little Lost Lamb."

title: Modern Classics of Science Fiction
description: According to Brian Aldiss, William Gibson, and Le Guin Lucius Shepard, among others, the best stories will always be remembered for many years to come.

title: The Great Ape Project
description: Given the claims made throughout, it is no surprise that The Great Ape Project has been a contentious issue even before it was released in the United States.

title: White Man's Grave
description: The father and friend of a missing Peace Corps volunteer pursue him, convinced that American dominance and power span the entire planet--but soon discover greater powers and an unknown world.

title: Isak Dinesen
description: Isak Dinesian, the only complete biography of one of the most renowned storytellers in modern times, was honored with the National Book Award by Judith Thurman. Her memoir, Out of Africa (amazing work), established I'sk as a significant twentieth-century writer, twice nominated for the Nobel Prize, and shed light on his life and art.

title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
description: The Academy Award-nominated screenplay, which features the role played by Hugh Grant's beloved bumbling bachelorette, six old friends, and three disastrous reception scenes, is hilarious. Four Weddings and a Funeral grossed over $250 million worldwide, earned critical opportunists praise for its innovative direction, including Best Picture and Best Original Screenplay nominations, as well as being declared the 90s' romantic comedy of the century.

title: With William Burroughs
description: The eccentric and brilliant artist William Burroughs, who blew readers' minds with his classic "Naked Lunch", remains intriguing. Victor Bockris captures the private and public, dreamlike and prophecistic statements of Buroughs and his distinguished associates in 60 photographs.

title: The Everyday I Ching
description: Explains the application of the ancient Chinese book of divination and relates the I Ching's hexagrams to contemporary life problems.

title: The Far Pavilions
description: A monumental novel set in nineteenth-century India that has achieved worldwide success, narrates the story of love, war, and adventure in the foothills of the Himalayan mountains. Reprint.

title: From Bondage
description: A veteran Jew reflects on his journey from the impoverished areas of New York to the rich and wise. He recounts a romantic relationship with his college instructor. By the author of A Diving Rock on the Hudson.

title: Mary Queen of Scotland & The Isles
description: This is a fictional depiction of Mary Queen of Scots' life, starting with her ascension to the English monarchy in 1542 and continuing until her reign as Queen France ended after her conquest.

title: The Communist Manifesto: Marx
description: A 30-page introduction is included in this edition of The Communist Manifesto, along with related documents that outline the trajectory of Marx's ideas from the 1840s onward. The resulting set of documents provides insight into the political, social, and intellectual contexts of the Communist Republic.

title: Through the Dark Labyrinth
description: Delves into the life of Durrell, the author of "The Alexandria Quartet," and examines how Eastern religions influenced his writing.

title: I Capture the Castle
description: Cassandra Mortmain, a young girl from France, recounts her six challenging months in the bizarre and destitute life of her family in ruins-marbled Suffolk castle in her diary, which ultimately revealed that she is deeply in love.

title: Marilyn Manson
description: Provides an account of the band's life, including their music, touring accomplishments, and message.

title: Radio On
description: One of the Generation X listeners, who claims to be an insider, analyzes what is on the radio every day and how her audience interacts with it from morning until night, in car, at home, and in the office.

title: Human Croquet
description: A dark and moving look back at the past of a young girl, Isobel Fairfax's sixteenth birthday.

title: The Autobiography of Henry VIII
description: Margaret George's career was established by The Autobiography of Henry VIII, a remarkable historical novel written in the first person as her private journals. It took fifteen years of meticulous research and five handwritten drafts.

title: Bachelor Brothers' Bed & Breakfast Pillow Book
description: In a novel that features local poet Solomon Solomon as the protagonist, Hector and Virgil return to the pages of this tale filled with stories, recipes, gossip, and childhood memories.

title: One Thousand White Women
description: May Dodd and her group of women travel to the western prairies in 1875 under the auspices of the U.S. government to intermarry with the Cheyenne Indians, leading to a controversial "Brides for Indian" initiative that aims to integrate them into the white male community. This book is the story of one of America's most colorful and unforgettable adventure journeys so far.

title: Requiem for Harlem
description: One of the century's most renowned authors has created Mercy of a Rude Stream, the fourth and final volume that chronicles an intensely saddened love affair while reconstructing the world of Jewish Harlem and Greenwich Village. The first printing was limited to 15,000 copies.

title: High Five
description: The absence of Uncle Fred, homicidal rapist and stalker Benito Ramirez, amorous vice cop Joe Morelli, and would-be lover Roger are all obstacles that New Jersey bounty hunter Stephanie Plum must overcome to make ends meet.

title: James Tiptree  Jr.
description: Exposes the accomplished writer who utilized James Tiptree, Jr.'s male pen name to publish science fiction short stories in the 1970s, narrating her experiences as an intelligence officer during World War II and her shocking suicide.

title: Birds of America
description: A Pulishers Weekly Best Book of the Year winner and a National Book Critics Circle Award finalist, Lorrie Moore is one of our top authors today. Her book Birds of America is crafted with her signature sharpness and intelligence, depicting countless people who have been lost or forgotten in times past, and each story is filled with humor and depth.

title: And The Band Played on
description: A study on the AIDS crisis exposes the federal government for its lack of intervention, health officials for their indifference and scientists for seeking fame in the face of the epidemic.

title: We Wish to Inform You That Tomorrow We Will Be Killed with Our Families
description: A remarkable first book that narrates the response of a people to genocide and its lessons for humanity.

title: Death in the Andamans
description: The Andaman Islands visit and traps Copper Randal and Valerie Masson in an enigmatic drowning and murder case. Reprint. 15,000 first printing.

title: Death in Berlin
description: During her journey to Germany, where World War II has left an indelible mark on her life, Miranda Brand is caught up in a search for diamonds and homicide by the night train.

title: Death in Kashmir
description: Upon reaching Gulmarg, a resort town in the mountains above Kashmir valley, Sarah Parrish is confronted with danger, intrigue, and multiple murders. Reprint. 10,000 first printing.

title: Four Mothers
description: The story of five generations of women in a family that lived in Jerusalem for 100 years is the subject of this beautifully imagined debut novel, which celebrates the magical realism of stories and folklore from the first child to the last child.

title: Timbuktu
description: In Paul Auster's remarkable new book, Mr. Bones is the canine hero of Willy G. Christmas, a brilliant and troubled homeless man from Brooklyn who has been suffering greatly. He and Willié embark on ersatz journeys to Baltimore in search of his high school English teacher and re-home for his companion. We witness Mr." Out of their respective thoughts, Paulauster has penned one of the most captivating tales in American fiction.

title: The Italian Girl
description: The remains found near Bradfield are believed to be those of a girl who went missing in 1953, as Michael Thackeray investigates the skeleton.

title: The Naked and the Dead
description: Describes the diverse personalities and nostalgic memories of a group of American soldiers who were involved in defending their country from Japanese attack during World War II. First printing. 15,000 copies.

title: Enchanted Evening
description: Her autobiography concludes with an account of her experiences in England, India, and China during the period between the two World Wars.

title: The Illustrated Story Of O
description: Story of O had the potential to revolutionize the book trade and change morales overnight, as I believed it would do so without warning.

title: Catfish and Mandala
description: A Vietnamese American's memoir recounts the aftermath of war and the enduring gap between Asian Americans and their former country.

title: The Satanic Verses
description: The subcontinent is ravaged by an Apocalyptic battle when a jetliner explodes while flying over India. Reprint.

title: Absent in the Spring and Other Novels
description: The first printing of a special omnibus edition featuring Giants' Bread, Absent in the Spring, and The Rose and the Yew Tree, is available now. They were originally written by Agatha Christie and published under the pseudonym Mary Westmacott.

title: Round Ireland with a Fridge
description: What is the most reckless action you have ever taken while under the influence of alcohol? Or, what happened if you tried to win one? Tony Hawks managed to hitchhike across Ireland with a fridge, and his bravery resulted in one of the greatest moments of his life. He was accompanied by his trusted traveling companion-and-domestic gadget that took him from Dublin to Donegal, as well as several other towns and cities.

title: An Unfortunate Woman
description: The author's last unpublished novel, completed before his 1984 suicide, explores the fragile and enigmatic shadowland surrounding death and examines how the protagonist fantasizes about someone else'.

title: The Glass Bead Game
description: The Glass Bead Game, Hermann Hesse's final novel and the recipient of the 1946 Nobel Prize for Literature, is a captivating tale of modern life that has been passed down through literature. It tells the story of Joseph Knecht, who was raised in Castalia, Italy, bringing together aesthetics with scientific knowledge to achieve mastery in this game.

title: Emotionally Weird
description: In a humorous novel about mothers, daughters, and love, Effie and her mother Nora discover the secrets of their lives and loves history while taking refuge in their ancestors' home on an island off the coast of Scotland.

title: A Writer's Workbook
description: A set of exercises and warm-ups designed to help aspiring writers deal with fear of failure, dyslexia, writer's block, rewriting, and other related issues. Reprint. 15,000 first printing.

title: Waiting for My Cats to Die
description: A humorous journey through the experiences of middle aged woman Stacy Horn, a television addict who has dedicated her life to caring for her two diabetic cats and coming to terms with an unexpected mid-life crisis.

title: Serious Girls
description: Maya and Roe, both teenagers, form a close friendship after being placed in an all-girls' boarding school as outsiders. They discuss their life experiences and adulthood expectations, questioning how they could become people with character and style instead of just school girls. As they venture beyond the classroom to explore the city and meet men, one wonders how their identity can be restored or disintegrated.

title: Lords of the White Castle
description: A young courtier named Fulke FitzWarin, accused by Prince John of playing chess improperly, causes chaos within the royal household and could potentially endanger the Fitts' estate.

title: The Christmas Shoes
description: Robert, a wealthy lawyer with troubled family life, meets Nathan, an eight-year-old boy who is the father of the dying child, while shopping for presents on Christmas Eve.

title: Education As My Agenda
description: After retiring from the Baltimore public schools in 1998, Gertrude Williams was dubbed by The Baltimore Sun as the most powerful principal who outlasted two superintendents. Her oratory memoir chronicles her struggles to secure essential education during her time as teacher, counselor, and principal for over twenty-five years. She also shared details about her upbringing in black society in Germantown, Pennsylvania; her pursuit of black history and culture while studying it for the first time.

title: Banvard's Folly
description: The most significant aspect of history is success. Those who are immortalized in its annals are those whose ideas, accomplishments, or personalities have dominated, endured, and ultimately won. Examples include John F. Kennedy's Profiles in Courage, Giorgio Vasari'S Lives of the Artists (first edition), and Samuel Johnson'LIVES of Poets.

title: The Last Jew
description: In 1492, the Inquisition takes control of Spain, and after centuries of pogrom-like riots encouraged by the Church, Jews who have been an integral part of Spanish culture since Roman times are expelled from the country through a royal edict. Those who choose to remain opt for Catholicism due to intimidation from Church and Crown, but hundreds of thousands choose not to leave, with some dying before they can escape.

title: How to Write a Damn Good Mystery
description: Writer James N. Frey, who has been nominated for the Edgar award and is known for his books on writing a great mystery novel called How to Write 'A Tale of Myths,' has written how-to books that are sure to become the standard reference guide.

title: Jenny and the Jaws of Life
description: A compilation of narratives about children, rapists, businesspeople, and cheaters who fluctuate between particular affections and desires.

title: Plum Lovin'
description: Despite receiving an abundance of love letters and hate mail, Connie Rosolli turns to Lula, Grandma Mazur, and the mysterious Diesel when she suspects that her true friend is actually their spy. Twelve Sharp's first printing contains 1,250,000 words.

title: McCarthy's Bar
description: A humorous and nostalgic tale of an American's journey to Ireland, exploring its countryside and pubs as he searches for his roots. Reprint: 20,000 First Edition.

title: The Pythons
authors: Graham Chapman;John Cleese;Terry Gilliam;Michael Palin;Eric Idle;Terry Jones
description: The popular comedy team that started in 1969 is commemorated with personal stories, humorous recollections, and over one thousand photographs and illustrations.

title: The Little Princesses
description: The childhood and early adulthoods of Queen Elizabeth and Princess Margaret are chronicled by a caregiver who provided the firsthand account of their life.

title: The New York Times Guide to Essential Knowledge
description: Features information on various fields such as art, architecture, biology, business, history, medicine, sports, philosophy, and film, along with essays by experts, a biographical dictionary, writer's guide to grammar.

title: Little Children
description: A stay-at-home dad, a former feminist, and an obsessive parent among several young suburban families is devastated when he discovers that their sleepy lifestyle has been destroyed by trespassing.

title: The Gatekeeper
description: The Truth About the Irish, a book by an Oxford academic and author, candidly details his experiences as an impoverished youth, convent gatekeeper, Catholic in Protestant England, working-class Irish immigrant among the Oxbridge elite, and raped Marxist visiting professor in Mormon Utah. Reprint. 15,000 copies.

title: Dominion
description: Defends responsible treatment of animals, contests popular views on animal sentiment and awareness while profiling a safari convention, factory farm, and the works of prominent writers.

title: SPQR VI: Nobody Loves a Centurion
description: Decius Caecilius Metellus, a Roman playboy/detective, is faced with the challenge of serving in his country's military, as he has been forced to leave Rome for reassurance due to the influence of terrorism. He decides to go to Gaul to fight alongside Caesar, where the general has not been successful in overtaking.

title: Something Borrowed
description: Rachel experiences a night of partying with her close friend's partner and is consumed by guilt, until she has to make impulsive decisions due to the weight of her emotions. This novel marks the first time it will be printed for 50,000 copies.

title: P.S. Your Cat Is Dead
description: Jimmy Zoole, a promising actor and writer, is confronted with shattered relationships, the loss of his best friend, job losses, and double burglaries. On New Year's Eve, however, things pick up again when Eddie, who is also attracted to women, comes back for Christmas. First printing: 15,000 copies.

title: Something Blue
description: Her faith in beauty was shattered when her fiance leaves her for a plain woman, and Darcy, who is now pregnant, escapes to London and struggles to maintain her glamorous lifestyle, only to realize that her previous methods are no longer effective.

title: All Things Bright and Beautiful
description: The adventures and experiences of veterinary care as they treat unwell cattle, pregnant sheep, ill dogs and their eccentric owners are recounted by a Yorkshire native in an autobiographical piece about the bonds between humans and animals.

title: Inside the Mind of Gideon Rayburn
description: Transmits the thoughts and feelings of Gideon Rayburn, a student at prestigious prep school in New England, through the eyes of one of his female classmates.

title: Spider Mountain
description: The appalling practices of a dangerous Appalachian mountain gang are exposed to by former police officer Cam Richter and special agent Carrie Santangelo, who then uncover the group's hidden activities that involved abandoned and abused children.

title: Where the Mountain Casts Its Shadow
