description: Provides an insider's account of the experiences of renowned mountaineers, including Jim Wickwire, Conrad Anker, and Lynn Hill, to reveal their personal histories and emotional conflicts.

title: Sideways
description: In Sideways, Miles and Jack travel together for the last time to experience everything that makes being young and single enjoyable: pinot noir, putting green, prowling bars, visiting Santa Ynez wine country, experiencing D-Day, and other things.

title: Baby Proof
description: Despite their previous promise not having children, Claudia and Ben's marriage is tested when Ben realizes he wants to be a father after all.

title: Lean Mean Thirteen
description: Stephanie Plum, a bounty hunter from Trenton, New Jersey, and her entourage embark on their thirteenth adventure, which is both unconventional and hazardous. The second edition of Twelve Sharp has sold 1,250,000 copies.

title: The Last Wife of Henry VIII
description: Provides a made-up depiction of Catherine Parr, the sixth wife of Henry VIII, who navigated the dangers and intrigue associated with Henry's court to her confrontational rivalry with Princess Elizabeth for the affections of Thomas Seymour.

title: The Forsaken
description: As the Chairman of the Vampire Council passes away and the seventh level rises above Hell, Damali confronts her last obstacle, an entity that was previously exiled but has the potential to halt a Neteru. Original print. 35,000.

title: A Woman of Substance
description: Emma Harte transforms a small shop into the world's best department store, going from impoverished, pregnant servant to wealthy businesswoman, outwitting her enemies and seeking revenge on her mistresses; she then achieves her lofty ambitions.

title: The Red Tent
description: The Book of Genesis serves as the foundation for Dinah's understanding of religious practices and sexultism.

title: Dirty Little Secrets
description: This novel is a must-read for fans of the glamorous and scandalous entertainment industry, as it follows Georgian girl Tyler Blake as she navigates the fast-paced life of New York City. While her goal is to become an actress, she encounters men who promise commitment and support in return; at one point, when she realizes she has found her perfect partner, hip-hop producer Brian McCall, things begin to unravel.

title: Think Like a Guy
description: A fun and informative guide to modern dating that explains what makes guys tickle your fancy, as well as providing practical advice to ensure that you always have a selection of men around you. First edition: 25,000 copies.

title: The Ravenscar Dynasty
description: The Harte family was first introduced by Barbara Taylor Bradford in her acclaimed A Woman of Substance. She has since created an unforgettable new dynasty known as the Deravenels, which forever changed everything. Cecily Derivell, the mother of one of England's most beloved sons, tells her son Edward that his father, brother, uncle, and cousin were all killed in a fire at the age of eight on this day cold December 27, 1904.

title: The Devil in the Junior League
description: The flawless lifestyle of Fredericka Mercedes Hildebrand Ware, a member of the elite Junior League in Willow Creek, Texas, becomes shattered when her husband cheats on her, steals her money, and disappears. The only way for her to avoid becoming fungible in the JLWC is to bring Howard Grout, the wealthy but tasteless lawyer, into the high-class community. 100,000 copies were printed.

title: The Silver Pigs
description: Marcus Didius Falco, a Roman "informer" with heightened concerns about Sosia Camillina's safety, is immediately uneasy when he meets her in the Forum. She discloses that she is fleeing for her life, and FalCo makes the willful decision to save her, which weighs more than what she had before being taken captive.

title: The Mystery Method
description: According to The New York Times, Mystery is a highly respected expert in seduction who offers guidance on how average men can approach, attract, and establish intimate relationships with beautiful women.

title: Marked
description: At the age of six, Zoey Redbird joins the House of Night and is a vampyre who has already developed into an adult.

title: Let's Go Australia 9th Edition
description: For over 40,000 years, people have been coming to Australia from far and wide in search of the wonders of earth. This guide has been compiled by students who know how to explore the world at a low cost, and includes tips and information for those who prioritize social responsibility.

title: The Paris Review Interviews  I
description: William Faulkner, Toni Morrison, Isaac Bashevis Singer, Graham Greiner, and more are among the world's top writers tucked into a new batch of interviews from the best-selling literary magazine.

title: More Plums in One
description: A collection of three novels depicts the involvement of a bail jumper with the assistance of an ex-prostitute and aspiring transvestite, Stephanie's uncle hunt down being foiled by her grandmother who wielded firearms, and Ranger'S disappearance after being charged with murder.

title: James Herriot's Dog Stories
description: James Herriot's complete set of 50 dog stories.

title: Beatrix Potter
description: Despite the widespread popularity of Beatrix Potter among famous characters like Peter Rabbit and Mr. McGregor, few people are aware of the woman who illustrated them. Her personal life, including a romantic relationship with her publisher, Norman Warne, and notable accomplishments outside of children's literature, is mostly unknown. In Linda Lear' new biography, we learn about this remarkable, funny, self-centered individual. Potter was one of many pioneers of naturalism that brought the world beauty and importance to the field.

title: The Twenty-Seventh City
description: S. Jammu, a driven Indian woman, is appointed as the police chief of St. Louis, where the actions of non-military individuals are monitored and Martin Probst and his family's actions threaten to dismantle her plan.

title: Haussmann  Or the Distinction
description: Baron Georges-EugFne Haussman, the most prominent architect in France, is at the center of this one-of-a-kind novel about the rebuilding of Paris during the 1800s. First printing: 10,000.

title: The Journey to the East
description: The hero, a German choirmaster, remembers an unproductive trip to the East during his youth and begins to comprehend its concealed spiritual implications.

title: This Side of Brightness
description: The winter of 2003.

title: What Was She Thinking?
description: Barbara Covett, a single schoolteacher, writes an account of her affair with Sheba Hart that exposes not only her secret but also her own.

title: Middlesex
description: The discovery that Calliope is a hermaphrodite during her teenage years affects her social life and her sense of self, which was once rooted in her grandparents' survival struggles in the 1920s.

title: The Interpreter
description: A first novel by Korean-American Suzy Park, who works as an interpreter in the New York City court system and uncovers a shocking truth five years after her parents were murdered while working as greengrocers. The Reader's Guide is available for purchase.

title: Hand to Mouth
description: This heart-wrenching autobiography recounts a series of humorous yet absurd tales of survival from the streets of Manhattan to Paris, emphasizing the desperation and amusement of those who do not have much money. The first printing is limited to 15,000 copies.

title: A Feather on the Breath of God
description: A young woman, born to parents of multiple ethnicities and immigrants in the 1950s and 1960s who lived in a New York housing development project, escapes into 'the world of nightmares' thanks to her parents' tales, her own reading material and her ballet performance.

title: Galatea 2.2
description: The main character, a Humanist-in-Residence at the center for Advanced Scientific Research, participates in executing he project to train 'a machine that can take English literature comprehensive test' and interacts with the degree hopeful it is competing with. (See reprint)

title: Mason & Dixon
description: Charles Mason and Jeremiah Dixon, the British surveyors who were famous for their marking of the Mason-Dixon line, are reimagined as misfits drawn into naval battles, political plotterry, and heavy caffeine consumption as they navigate the dangers of 18th-century America.

title: The River at the Center of the World
description: The author's narrative of his journey along the Yangtze from the Tibetan border to the East China Sea is a vivid depiction of China' rich cultural history, politics, people, geography, and climate.

title: Primo Levi
description: This profile examines the author's life experiences, including his time as a paint factory manager, caring for an invalid mother, and living in the same house throughout his entire life.

title: Dry
description: The author of Running with Scissors has authored Dry, a humorous and unconventional account of his experiences.

title: A Home at the End of the World
description: With the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of "The Hours" comes a one-of-a-kind family that is formed when Jonathan relocates to New York with Bobby and Clare, despite his previous involvement in an erotic war there. The film will be released soon alongside Colin Farrell, Sissy Spacek, and Robin Wright Penn.

title: Call It Sleep
description: The debut novel by Henry Roth in 1934 was met with considerable critical acclaim, but its sales were lackluster during that challenging period. Its paperback release thirty years later did not receive the recognition it has now, and has sold millions of copies worldwide.

title: I Am Charlotte Simmons
description: Charlotte Simmons, a college freshman at Dupont University, realizes that her intellect is not enough to make her happy.

title: Small Island
description: Queenie, the white landlady of the Joseph family, makes friends with them after their arrival from Jamaica in World War II's end, but her racist husband, Bernard, arrives home from the front.

title: Collected Prose
description: Features a range of essays, true stories, autobiographical writings, prefaces (often humorous), collaborations with artists and articles on various subjects from New York City and Kafka to the contemporary art world, including high-wire artist Philippe Petit.

title: Saints at the River
description: The people of the small South Carolina town that is named after the Tamassee River are in the news for their actions. A twelve-year-old girl has drowning and her body is trapped in a deep eddy, and while her parents are determined to save her, environmentalists fear it will cause permanent damage to the river. Maggie Glenn, formerly an elementary school student but now based in Salem on August 24, 2012, is at odds with her family due to being turned into riot police.

title: Chemistry and Other Stories
description: The Old and New South's impact on the lives of Appalachian natives is chronicled in a book that dates back to the twentieth century. The first printing contains 20,000 stories, depicting the struggle of rural communities to adapt to modern life while set against pristine surroundings.

title: Vita
description: Diamante and Vita, both children of impoverished families in southern Italy, are sent to America by their families for a better life. Their story is an unforgettable one, as it follows them from the crime-filled tenements of Little Italy to the harsh rail yards of the Midwest, along with paths that cross with civilizations such as Caruso and Chaplin.

title: Night Draws Near
description: The Iraq War is examined by an Arab-American journalist who takes a realistic look at the dislocations, hardships and tragedies faced by ordinary Iraqis.

title: A Woman in Berlin
description: A wartime journal written by a reporter and editor who lived through the Russian occupation of Berlin. The journal documents residents' survival from starvation, lack of water, freezing temperatures, mass rapes among women, and corruption of city dwellers by their Russian occupiers.

title: The Brooklyn Follies
description: Nathan Glass, a retired life insurance salesman, moves to Brooklyn to live in seclusion and solitude, but encounters his long-lost nephew Tom Wood who turns him upside down by finding out about his past.

title: Limitations
description: The rape case witnesses Judge George Mason questioning the legal system and his professional skills.

title: The Price of the Ticket
description: Among the most significant contributions to twentieth-century American literature is James Baldwin's works, as evidenced by his book The Price of the Ticket, which includes nearly fifty years of nonfiction writing that offer readers both personal and prophetic insights into the experience of race and identity in the United States.

title: The Humanoids
description: A classic sci-fi novel depicts humanoids spreading throughout the galaxy, threatening to destroy all humanity, and a secretive group of rebels who aim to limit the humanoid population before it becomes too late.

title: The Demon Princes  Vol. 1
description: Retrieves three of the author's books that portray the Demon Princes, a group of creatures that disguise themselves as humans and cause destruction. Additionally, Kerth Gersen is seeking revenge for destroying his world.

title: The Memory of Whiteness
description: Johannes Wright, the renowned Musician, and his associates and foes journey through time to gain knowledge of the Universe's workings, coinciding with the year 3229 AD, when music is considered the most effective and occasionally only means of communication.

title: Xenocide
description: In the midst of the battle for life on Lusitania, a child named Gloriously Bright, Ender discovered an alternate world where humans, pequininos, and the Hive Queen could coexist peacefully.

title: The Dark Descent
description: An anthology of horror stories from past and present authors, including Stephen King, H.P. Lovecraft, Harlan Ellison, Charles L. Grant, and Clive Barker, documents the evolution of the genre.

title: Ports of Call
description: In this romantic story, a space swashbuckler and con artist travels the world plying his trade while drinking in wild bars and flirting with women.

title: The Demon Princes  Vol. 2
description: Jack Vance is undoubtedly a gifted and versatile science fiction writer, having earned prestigious accolades such as the Hugo, nebula, and World Fantasy Award, during his 30-year career. He has also gained widespread popularity and was recognized by Tor Books for his novels, which have been brought back to life over the past five decades. The first volume of Volume One, followed by an all-new omnibus, contained the first three books of VANCE's beloved Demon Princes series, along with two additional volumes.

title: Jack of Kinrowan
description: Jacky Rowan's two tales are combined into one book, revealing how she is dumped in the dangerous Faerie world and how a young prostitute breaks her bonds. The original copy will be printed for 20,000 copies.

title: Lurulu
description: The story of Myron Tany, a rebellious member of swanky family, who travels across the Galaxy on an intergalactic freighter with gang of actors, musicians, thieves, and other dubious characters. Author: Ports of Call (first printing) Reprint 15,000 Pages.

title: The Land of Laughs
description: The Land of Laughs is the most fantastical book you've ever read, and have you ever wished it had existed? It's about a schoolteacher who struggles to balance his familial responsibilities with his affection for an eccentric young girl named Saxony Gardner.

title: Tales of the Dying Earth
description: A first-ever collection of a classic science fiction series, The Dying Earth books contain all four books--The DyING Earth, the Eyes of the Overworld, Cugel's Saga, and Rialto the Magnificent- where in Earth one last time tried to survive the death of its red sun.

title: The Fantasies of Robert A. Heinlein
description: The first collection of Heinlein's top-notch fantasy short stories and novellas, featuring "Magic, Inc., " They," and "The Unpleasant Profession of Jonathan Hoag," along with several other notable works, is published as a single volume.

title: Songmaster
description: Ansset, the aspiring singer from Ender's Game author, was taken hostage and raised in seclusion at the Songhouse. He has a unique voice that is both soothing and disturbing, as it can convey both emotions and desires.

title: Lovelock
description: Designed to be the ultimate servant, Lovelock is a capuchin monkey with intelligent behavior, agility and composure. He is also privileged to observe the life of one of the world's most brilliant scientists through his eyes (he has been granted Witness status) and loves his owner deeply, not just to spare her from any pain but to do what she truly wants.

title: Duel
description: Gathers horror tales such as "Third from the Sun," "Little Girl Lost," and "Death Ship," which served as the basis for the Spielberg movie of the same name.

title: The Collected Stories of Arthur C. Clarke
description: Exposes the reader to the writer's shorter pieces, such as "The Nine Billion Names of God," "Nemesis," and " The Sentinel" from his lengthy career.

title: Sword & Citadel
description: "At the Citadel of Autarch, Severiain and the dreadful auster in The Book of the New sun meet in a final battle, fulfilling an ancient prophecy that will forever change the world known as Urth." -- Back cover.

title: The Starry Rift
description: This book is a story of the human race's exploration of alien planets with mysterious and inexplicable creatures, filled with action, extraordinary characters, and imaginative speculation.

title: Pacific Edge
description: The story takes place in California at the end of the 21st century, where Kevin Claiborne, a bio-architect, believes he has found Utopia. However, his discovery is overshadowed by events that expose the hidden corruption within.

title: Devil's Backbone
description: The Modoc Indians had been pursuing war with American officials in the Oregon Territory for some time, but when their chief Keintpoos was killed during negotiations, the U.S. Army launched a deadly attack against the rebels.

title: The Circle
description: Dan Lenson, who was just released from Annapolis, boarded an aged destroyer on his way to the Arctic Circle, where he and his crew face a rogue submarine, bad weather, and the possibility of being taken to court martial.

title: Faking It
description: While trying to outmanoeuvre the stunning gold-digger Clea Lewis, Matilda Goodnight and Davy Dempsy will form a temporary but reluctant alliance to confront an inept art collector, heir, hitmat, and seductive woman as they battle false identities, counterfeit paintings, deceit, romance.

title: Welcome to Temptation
description: Sophie Dempsey is determined to assist her sister in filming a video and then leaving Temptation, Ohio. Meanwhile, Mayor Phin Tucker wants to play pool with the police chief while simultaneously experiencing gory situations. Their encounter leads to murder, blackmail, sexual assault, vehicular abuse, and even perverse but excellent sexual behavior.

title: Full Bloom
description: Annie Fortenberry inherits the local B&B and its eccentric handyman, but her life is complicated by rumors of a ghost, the wedding of millionaire Max Holt, an unknown stranger named Wes Bridges, and her murdered ex-husband.

title: Full Scoop
description: The town of Beaumont, South Carolina, has become a breeding ground for Maggie Farnsworth, the pediatrician who is currently facing difficulties with her ex-partner, an escaped convict, and handsome FBI agent Zack Madden in pursuit of both her and her daughter.

title: The Damned
description: The Un-Named One's consort, Lilith, releases the Damned to cause destruction in human history. Consequently, Damali, Carlos, and the Guardians must find and kill the evil LiliTH to put an end to the plague caused by these creatures of hell.

title: The Cursed One
description: Amelia Sinclair, a stunning socialite who has been married and widowed in just one day, must depend on the kindness of stranger Gabriel Wulf to avoid vicious creatures that are stalking her. Original.

title: A Quiver Full of Arrows
description: Anthology of short stories featuring "One Night Stand," "Old Love," and "The Chinese Statue," the story tells of a priceless antique, city love, casual encounters, and lifelong passions. Reprint.

title: The Hunted
description: After thwarting the vampire civil war, Damali Richards, a vampire huntress, travels to Brazil to investigate he brutal murders committed by gang members of 'a vicious female were-demon' in revenge for her own people.

title: The Forbidden
description: Damali and her companions from the Guardian team battle their final adversary in Lilith, the consort of the Un-Named One, who has been summoned from level seven to open Hell's portals and eliminate them.

title: When the Lion Feeds
description: In late nineteenth-century South Africa, Sean Courteney travels to Pretoria and embarks on a journey through the gold mines while his twin, Garrick, takes revenge on his brother for the gunshot incident that left him crippled.

title: A Sparrow Falls
description: After the events of World War I, Mark Anders returns to South Africa only to discover that his grandfather has been killed and his land taken away, as well as being targeted by the rogue member of the Courtney clan.

title: The Unfortunate Miss Fortunes
description: Three Fortune sisters, including shape-shifting Lizzie, telekinetic Mare, and Dee, fall in love with unconventional men while facing the perilous villain who will take their talents to heart. Original.

title: Hot Stuff
description: Due to her busy schedule, Cate Madigan is unable to find time for men or marriage, but she finds herself in a difficult situation when she meets ex-cop Kellen McBride.

title: Two for the Dough
description: Defiant: Kenny Mancuso (left) who fled after accidentally shooting his best friend, New Jersey bounty hunter Stephanie Plum (right) becomes the focus of a massive manhunt for gunmen and illegal weapons as vice cop Joe Morelli follows him. Reprint.

title: The Edge of Honor
description: After leaving his wife and home for a tour of duty in Vietnam, Lt. Brian Holcomb witnesses the crew's drug-induced recklessness and an explosive showdown.

title: Wings of Fire
description: Inspector Ian Rutledge is sent to investigate the sudden deaths of three members of a prominent Cornwall family, but he is not convinced by his initial findings that the case is anything but ordinary. He is even given the chance to study the identity of one of the deceased, revealing if only for the reclusive spinster O. A. Manning, and finds inspiration in the silence of those who wrote about his experiences in France.

title: All Creatures Great and Small
description: The experiences and joys of being a rural veterinary doctor in Yorkshire recount his early years and interactions with his particular group of clients.

title: The Lord God Made Them All
description: The Yorkshire vet encapsulates the beauty of rural England, the joys and sorrows of its inhabitants, and the rewarding life of a rural veterinarian.

title: Four to Score
description: Stephanie Plum, the resident of Trenton, New Jersey, who is known for her passion for pistol-packing and carrying condoms, is now on the trail of a waitress who has skipped bail. She may ultimately succeed in getting her hands on by Grandma Mazur, former hooker Lula, transvestite musician Sally Sweet, and all-too-sexy Joe Morelli.

title: Thrones  Dominations
description: The winter season of 1999.

title: Black Coffee
description: The original novel by Christie is reprinted with permission from the author.

title: El Paso
description: Dallas Stoudenmire's objective is to bring an end to the bloody violence between Americans and Mexicans in El Paso, Texas, while also putting down the two Banning Brothers.

title: Search the Dark
description: Scotland Yard's daring inspector is dispatched to Dorset with rigorous instructions to coordinate the search for two missing children, but his investigation is complicated by his developing feelings for a potential suspect.

title: What the Corpse Revealed
description: A forensic medicine expert presents sixteen cases from scientific records worldwide to illustrate how technology and science can work together to uncover unsolvable crimes.

title: Name Dropping
description: Despite her professional struggles, pre-school teacher Nancy Stern's newfound confidence is affected by the presence of other women who have moved into her building.

title: Seven Up
description: Despite the fact that Stephanie Plum and Lula are confronted with multiple challenges when a senior citizen is accused of trafficking in illegal cigarettes, they end up with squabbling on an old man on their lam. Meanwhile, she is more invested in vice cop Joe Morelli, who has proposed to her, and partnered with Ranger from the bounty hunter team for one night.

title: Hardcase
description: Despite his extensive knowledge of the family business, former private detective Joe Kurtz is convinced that someone will intervene to stop him from finding the missing accountant hired by Don Byron Farino.

title: Warlock
description: Following the passing of Queen Lostris, Taita journeys to the harsh climes of North Africa to study the occult, become a warlock, and fulfill his destiny to save the Lostragri family from the evil that permeates ancient Egypt.

title: Crooked House
description: The passing of Aristide Leonides, the widow of a wealthy manor worth millions of dollars, has raised suspicions about her. However, critic Charles Hayward is questioning the purity of his words and believes that she was unaware of what had happened when she died from barbiturates.

title: Abandoned Prayers
description: During Christmas Eve in 1985, the body of an unidentified young boy was discovered by a hunter in icy corn fields in Nebraska. Although residents of Chester, Nebraska initially buried him as "Little Boy Blue," authorities later found out that his father, Eli Stutzman, was actually an Amish bishop and farmer who belonged to one of the strictest religious groups in the country. However, he also maintained ties with someone who was involved in pornography before his death.

title: The Sigma Protocol
description: An American investment banker discovers the mystery behind Sigma, a mysterious OSS case that is linked to his famous financier father when an unidentified friend attempts to murder him in Switzerland.

title: True Believers
description: A woman's body is found in Philadelphia'St. Anselm' Church, and her husband, a local parishioner, commits suicide; former FBI chief Gregor Demarkian is called to investigate after the widowed woman died from severe diabetes from arsenic poisoning, not natural cause.

title: Full Blast
description: Jamie Swift and Max Holt are confronting a killer who is targeting the less popular residents of Beaumont, South Carolina, after discovering that the newspaper's personal ads are responsible for the killings.

title: Hard Eight
description: When Stephanie Plum is hired to look for a missing child, she begins to question whether she is working in the right place at all times. Meanwhile, Ranger finds time to act on their tumultuous relationship with Morelli.

title: Eleven on Top
description: Stephanie Plum, the author of Ten Big Ones, embarks on a new adventure that involves her unwittingly conflicted love life, chaotic family, and fondness for wrecking cars, ultimately wanting to abandon her career as heiress and seek out'something safer'. Reprint.

title: Minion
description: Warriors of Light Records' Damali Richards, a vampire hunter and vocalist, joins forces with her Guardian team to combat the rogue vampires who have been killing offenders.

title: The Janson Directive
description: After being taken captive by the terrorists during the 9/11 attacks, Paul Janson leads a team of rescuers who are loyal to his former colleagues.

title: The Tristan Betrayal
description: During the Second World War, Stephen Metcalf works for the U.S.'s covert intelligence units in Europe, where he is responsible for uncovering and betraying an ex-partner to safeguard free-world interests.

title: The Ambler Warning
description: After being drugged and imprisoned in a closed island psychiatric facility for government intelligence employees, Hal Ambler, formerly referred to as Consular Operations agent, makes an audacious escape and sets out to find out why he was placed there, but only after realizing that his facial features and all records about him have been modified.

title: Robert Ludlum's The Moscow Vector
description: Lt. Col. Jon Smith, an Army research doctor who specializes in infectious diseases and is an agent for Covert-One, contacts Dr. Valentine Petrenko at an international conference in Prague. Petrovrov is worried about a small cluster of mysterious deaths in Moscow and the Russian government's refusal to release any information or data on the outbreak. The encounter between the two leads turns violent, leading to the death of Petrantenko, with his notes and medical samples being lost, and Smith barely manages to escape with their cell phones.

title: The Firefly
description: DC police say the fiery wreckage of a high-end plastic surgery clinic and its staff is business as usual, but they are willing to let it go this week because with Washington D.C. on full alert for the presidential inauguration (even more so than normal) Retired agent Swamp Morgan pulls off what appears to be 'a firefly' case—however no evidence exists—we haven't found the last patient, the one woman who was nursed alive, yet another mysterious tape suggests that her body or both offenders mayopathogeneous material translate toxic substances

title: As the Crow Flies
description: The vegetable barrow that Charlie Trumper inherited from his grandfather and his ambition to build London's largest department store are among his many accomplishments, which will ultimately be crushed by a dangerous enemy.

title: Dakota
description: Teddy Roosevelt, a Harvard-educated legislator from New York, set out for Dakota Territory in 1884, where he was overcome by the tragic deaths of his mother and wife on the same night. He returned to the place that had impressed him with its beautiful scenery and abundant opportunities for game and commerce. By the Little Missouri River, Teddy established s ranching empire, and soon found himself at the center of terrorism.

title: The Fantastic Vampire
description: Wherever vampires roamed the imagination of different peoples, they adapted to local customs. John Polidori's The Vampyre (1819) marked the beginning of the vampire craze in the 19th century, which led to a proliferation of vampire-related literature in Germany, France, and Britain. This tradition was confirmed by Bram Stoker'

title: From Hinton to Hamlet
description: The text presents titles organized by current young adult literature in terms of themes, to serve as a bridge between the classics and other works.

title: SantaKid
description: Chrissie's father had a lesson from his daughter that Christmas is supposed to be over soon, as she can barely look at him during the festive season. When Warrie Ransom buys an Exmas gift and changes her mind, leaving Santa behind, they find themselves overwhelmed with excitement and sadness at the sight of children being cut off from their world.

title: Trials of Death
description: Darren starts the Trials of Initiation to prove his worthiness as a half-vampire, while the clan's blood rivals, the vampaneze, gather near VampIRE Mountain.

title: Oblivion
description: The narratives of Oblivion feature David Foster Wallace blending raw humanity with infinite self-consciousness, creating worlds that are unimaginable.

title: Julie and Julia
description: In a new paperback edition, Julie Powell's memoir is the most anticipated and amusing of recent years. She cooks every recipe from Julia Child' book, Mastering the Art of French Cooking, and rediscovering how life was redone in just one year.

title: The Truth of the Matter
description: The heroine of Dew's mellow period piece, Agnes Scofield, can be found sitting with Mrs. Ramsay and Mrs Bridge at the table of beautifully carved literary matrons. She is a proud Ohio native who has grown up with three adult children and is starting to establish herself as an independent middle-aged person (including her husband) when her children come back in 1947. They have full lives, but take for granted that their mother never goes out without dinner.

title: The Beatles
description: After The Beatles became famous, the spin machine created a myth that persists to this day. However, Bob Spitz's biography has been eagerly anticipated by fans due to its captivating and thrilling nature.

title: Twilight
description: This book is the first romance to ever chart a new course in American romanticism.

title: Cirque Du Freak #10: The Lake of Souls
description: "If you're after Harkat, it's a gamble. Your friend is worth the risk." What does this mean for someone on their trip to the Lake of Souls? Will they make it through without assistance?

title: The Terror
description: There is no doubt that the men aboard HMS Terror will achieve victory. They are part of the 1845 Franklin Expedition, a scientifically supported expedition to discover the legendary Northwest Passage. As they embark on an unfreezing second summer in the Arctic Circle, they are trapped in darkness with scarce food and shelter.

title: Hollywood Station
description: "The Oracle," the sergeant, leads the LAPD's Hollywood Station crew in their most challenging case as they confront the Russian mob, diamonds, counterfeiting, and grenades.

title: The Harry Bosch Novels
description: Michael Connelly's LAPD homicide detective, Harry Bosch, is the focus of his three novels in The Black Echo (Winner of the Edgar Award for Best First Novel).

title: Consider the Lobster
description: Can lobsters be painful? Did Franz Kafka have a comical personality? What's the deal with John Updike? And what happens when an adult film actress meets her fans in real life?

title: The Bookseller of Kabul
description: The Norwegian journalist paints a picture of devoted Muslim man and his family in post-Taliban Kabul, Afghanistan.

title: Yiddish with Dick and Jane
description: With a Saturday event and an open house on the agenda, Jane must make her way to the car by following the Open House signs.

title: The Lovely Bones
description: The first novel by Susie Salmon, a fourteen-year-old, contains her spirit's account of her murder, surprise visit to heaven, witnessing her family' grief, searching for the perpetrator, and grappling with the aftermath. The Reader'S Guide is reprinted at 750,000 copies and offers an insight into life after death.

title: Blink
description: The Tipping Point, Malcolm Gladwell's top-selling book, is a groundbreaking work that redefines the role of leadership and decision making. Blink examines how people make choices without thinking and challenges our perception of what it means to be an expert in this area.

title: Paint it Black
description: A young woman's search for a true world after losing her soul to the best love of her life, along with heartbreak. The book is from the bestseller "White Oleander."

title: The World Treasury of Physics  Astronomy  and Mathematics
description: This volume features the works of over 60 authors, including Isaac Asimov, Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking, Pierre Curie, Primo Levi, and James Gleick. Each one offers an opinion on the Sciences.

title: White Oleander
description: White Oleander, a book that is both breathtaking and potent, tells the story of Ingrid, an exceptional poet who is serving time for murder, and her daughter Astrid as she navigates ten different foster homes in Los Angeles- each with its own unique characteristics and lessons.

title: Midnight Riders
description: Freeman tells the story of the original Southern rock band's turbulent career, from their early blues days to their recent comeback.

title: The Magus
description: The story of Nicholas Urfe, a young Englishman assigned to teach at Xi's island in Greece, follows him as he discovers that his relationship with the millionaire is tense and dangerous, leading to heightened tension between reality and fantasy. He must then battle for his mental health and survival.

title: Mythology
description: The story of heroes and gods that have inspired human creativity from antiquity to the present has been brought to life in Mythology by Edith Hamilton, a writer who wrote "over thirty books" and sold millions of copies worldwide since its publication by Little, Brown and Company in 1942.

title: Last Lion  The: Volume 1
description: William Manchester's book, The Last Lion: Visions of Glory, is the first in a comprehensive and impressive series on Winston Churchill. It chronicles his life from birth to 1932, when he began advocating for German unity and warned against Nazi expansion.

title: Candy
description: An international literary sensation, Candy is a story of tenacious Chinese woman who runs away from home and sets her sights on the city she loves.

title: The Black Veil
description: The author combines historical context and family legend to tell his personal story of struggling with depression and searching through his family's paternal lines for clues that could have led to his sadness.

title: Harry Bosch Novels  The: Volume 2
description: The Last Coyote, a murder mystery by Harry Bosch, is set to be broadcast on Fox News.

title: Miracle on the 17th Green
description: On Christmas, Travis McKinley experiences a Zen-like moment while playing golf, evolving into an accomplished professional, competing against his idols, and ultimately salvaging his troubled marriage.

title: The Ice Storm
description: A novel set in Connecticut during a severe winter storm in 1973 depicts two families, the Hoods and the Williamses, as they confront each other's emotions and experiences.

title: Gossip Girl #6: You're the One That I Want
description: My friends and I are situated in a stunning apartment on the Upper East Side of New York City, where we attend exclusive private schools and have our own playground. The experience is almost as pleasurable as spending time with our best friend's boyfriend. Gossip Girls season 6!

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J. D. Salinger's book, which was published by The New Yorker, is renowned for its humor and message, and has become a beloved source of literature for millions of readers worldwide.

title: Mind Over Money
description: Educates on the intricacies of investing psychology and offers guidance on exploiting strengths to achieve long-term success.

title: Strangers from a Different Shore
description: The author's account of Asian Americans is a remarkable blend of narrative history, personal recollection, and oral history. It includes stories of Chinese immigrants who built railroad tracks, Hawaiian plantation workers, Japanese Americans being married to foreigners, Hmong refugees facing discrimination in Wisconsin, etc.

title: Stephen King Omnibus
description: Stephen King's Dead Zone and Cujo are two books in one, written by a horror writer.

title: Vampire Mountain
description: The first book in The Vampire Mountain trilogy is now available in paperback, providing a raw and unsettling experience.

title: An Unfinished Life
description: The year 2003 marked the release of AN UNFINISHED LIFE, a book that revolutionized our understanding of JFK and included an epilogue just in time for the 50th anniversary of Kennedy's assassination. It also revealed additional information about his health, love life, siblings, and father figure, while still reeling from the Vietnam War. A blockbuster success, it was welcomed by both critics and readers.

title: Gossip Girl #1
description: The first book in the hit CW show, which is set to debut in Spring 2020, is an amusing comedy. My friends and I live on the Upper East Side of New York City, where we can all befriend each other and do things together, even spend some time together. S has returned from boarding school, and she's going to win over our teachers, make us wear expensive clothes, steal any accessories or don those shoes that weren't suitable for her.

title: Gossip Girl #3: All I Want is Everything
description: The third book in the new and highly anticipated HBO Max series, which is set to debut in Spring 2020 alongside Pretty Little Liars and Friends, is a hilarious comedy that follows the trail of scandal during Christmas.

title: A Supposedly Fun Thing I'll Never Do Again
description: The book, which includes seven pieces on topics such as television, tennis, the Illinois State Fair, David Lynch's films, postmodern literary theory, and luxury cruisers, is exudingly well-received by readers of David Foster Wallace'Signato.

title: Brideshead Revisited
description: Waugh's portrayal of the Marchmain family, a noble, charming and endearing group of people, is rooted in England and depicted in this 1920s novel about the decline of society and the fall from grace of 1930s.

title: The Complete Stories of Evelyn Waugh
description: This is a "lavishly entertaining" version (Publishers Weekly) of what Waugh was capable of and that one of the most popular English novelists of this century was also an expert in the short form, with evidence that her short fiction exposes the elements which made Evelyn Wough the greatest satirist of its time: from portraits filled with giggling British upper class men to something different; from...with - I don't wanna say no to my A Handful of Dust" to other author's story.

title: Don't Stop the Carnival
description: A parrot's dream is to escape the hustle and bustle of work and start a new life in the sun, with the warmth of tropical islands and refreshing drinks. The story follows Norman Paperman, despite his age, as he prepares for the middle age transition and embarks on re-establishing himself as hotel management. (Hurricades: Some of these incidents are rather comical, but they don't last long.)

title: Youngblood Hawke
description: A swashbuckling chronicle of the difficulties that arise from the remarkable triumph of a young author from Kentucky.

title: American Government
description: O'Connor/Sabato's latest edition of the book has been revised to offer a comprehensive and current coverage of recent events in American government.

title: Essentials of American Government
description: "Essentials of American Government: Continuity and Change" is a textbook that offers an engaging and current introduction to the subject, while also offering supplementary material on Texas government and politics. Like the comprehensive edition, this non-coarse edition emphasizes the importance of understanding the evolution of America's government to comprehend our present political system.

title: The Non-designer's Web Book
description: The best-selling Web design guide is back with a recent update that covers the latest browsers, software, and standards.

title: Don't Make Me Think!
description: Steve Krug, a specialist in web-usability, revises his classic handbook on designing user-friendly navigation for optimal efficiency.

title: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley's Frankenstein  or  The modern Prometheus
description: Mary Shelley's remarkable novel is presented in various stimulating and enlightening ways, including cultural, critical, or literary contexts, in the second edition of Frankenstein from the Longman Cultural Editions series. Series Editor Susan J. Wolfson presents the 1818 version as well as its "conversation" with contemporary texts, such as those by Shellеy’s own parents, husband, and friends. A lively introduction is followed by a chronology based on an ancient Greek story box.

title: Oscar Wilde's The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: Longman's Cultural Editions Series includes The Picture of Dorian Gray, a novel and contextual material from the Oscar Wilde era, as well as other works. This edition highlights the novel'S modernity and its revolutionary nature, while also charting its relationship to modernist literature and culture of modernization.

title: Andrew Carnegie and the Rise of Big Business
description: A historical account of Andrew Carnegie's life, as the founder of Carnegie Steel, details his involvement in rewiring the industrial sector.

title: The Power of One
description: Through this book, the reader is encouraged to develop a personal theatrical experience through techniques of writing, acting, and directing.

title: Running in the Family
description: Michael Ondaatje's cherished family memoir merges fact and fiction to present an original and captivating portrayal of a lost time and place. He left Ceylon (now Sri Lanka) at the age of eleven. His goal was to reconcile the forgotten experiences, myths, and family scandals and recreate the hopeless, blissful existence his parents and grandparents had built in n ode where drink, gambling, undiscipline, irrelevance,and sports fans entertained on the verge of the moon.

title: The Circus of Adventure
description: The beginning of an adventure that includes a circus and secluded castle awaits Bill as he returns home with an unfamiliar guest.

title: The Island of Adventure
description: A sinister occurrence is taking place on the Isle of Gloom, and the children are determined to uncover it.

title: A Gift of Wings
description: These tales, inspired by Bach's passion for flying, are brimming with memories of friends from the past and those who have not yet met, but also contain heartfelt honesty or bravery. Through signs of both beauty and complexity, these stories demonstrate how life can be complicated or teach us valuable lessons. Each story is a mini-parable, drawing on the allegorical power of flight to inspire readers with its simple beginnings.

title: The Orchard Keeper
description: This book tells the story of a small, rural Tennessee town where young John Wesley Rattner and Marion Sylder, an outlaw and bootlegger, have murdered the boy's father without realizing it. Rattler is played by his Uncle Ather in the play.

title: The Real Frank Zappa Book
description: Frank Zappa, renowned for his innovative and controversial ideas in music, takes us on a humorous journey through his life and personal experiences.

title: A Dangerous Fortune
description: The students of a high-end English boarding school are haunted by the mysterious death of their teacher.

title: The Border Trilogy
description: All the Pretty Horses by Cormac McCarthy depicts the upbringing of two young men in rural America. The book follows John Grady Cole and Billy Parham, who are both cowboys and live on the brink of a world that is about to be forever changed. Their adventures cross the border into Mexico, each marked with fear and pain, marking their way into adulthood and ultimately salvation.

title: Misreadings
description: The Odyssey, Don Quixote, and Kanye West's literary works are featured on the cover.

title: Vurt
description: Scribble and his stash riders are addicted to Vurt Feathers, the most potent drug available. Although it offers protection, it poses risks. VURRT is a dark tale of England that won the 1994 Arthur C. Clarke award.

title: In Pharaoh's Army
description: Tobias Wolff, who survived the extraordinary childhood depicted in This Boy's Life and is now serving in a Mekong Delta unit, finds solace in boredom, terror, and grief for his lost friends.

title: The Reality Dysfunction
description: As of AD 2600, the human race is at its peak, with a multitude of prosperous and diverse cultures on hundreds of colonized planets across the galaxy. Genetic engineering has enabled evolution by defeating disease while producing extraordinary spaceborn creatures. Sensitive trader starships thrive on the wealth created by the industrialization of entire star systems, while the Confederation Navy safeguards peace throughout inhabited space. A golden era is imminent.

title: Paper Money
description: Despite the lack of connection between these three events, they all unfold simultaneously in London.

title: An Unquiet Mind
description: An international specialist on manic-depression shares her personal experience with the affliction that has plagued her since she was a girl. She recounts how she triumphed over it and its influence in her life.

title: The Golden Key
description: Births, marriages and official documents are painted in Tira Verte, not written down. The paintings created by some members of the Grijalva family also have mystical qualities. This book tells the story of a painter-magician who was fixated on power, life, and an unattainable love.

title: Into the Wild
description: Krakauer uses the real-life account of a young man who ventured deep into the Alaskan wilderness in 1992, where his SOS note and emaciated body were discovered four months later, to examine the obsession that drives some individuals to explore the outer limits of their own identity, abandon their civilization, and seek spiritual guidance through solitude and contact with nature.

title: A Second Chance at Eden
description: The Night's Dawn trilogy and six stories are situated in the same universe and time-period as this novella.

title: The Memoirs of Cleopatra
description: The author of "The Autobiography of Henry VIII" and "Mary Queen of Scotland and the Isles" brings to life the words and opulent kingdom of Cleopatra, Queen Of The Nile, in this lush, expansive, and richly detailed chronicle of ancient Egypt.

title: Just Disgusting!
description: With a twist on his trademark, Andy Griffiths has created nine original and humorous stories about Andy G. These stories include gruesome death from flesh-eating zombies, guerrilla warfare with brussel sprouts (which won't stop until they die), and the fact that canary-headed cockroaches can live for nine days without their heads (they only die because they starve to death). They are accompanied by imaginative, chaotic, and downright disgusting illustrations by Terry Denton.

title: Bridget Jones
description: Bridget's Diary concludes with the end of the Wilderness Years, where she and Mark Darcy embraced the sunset. In this episode of Edge of Reason, she discovers what it feels like to have the man of her dreams in your flat and he hasn't done the washing up on you, not just this week but all along.

title: Rumer Godden
description: The story of a writer who is deeply touching and an uncommonly strong woman.

title: Hot Six
description: "Sexual temptation, homicidal insanity, car crashes, doughnut addiction," says Stephanie Plum, who is dealing with the aftermath of Grandma Mazur's arrival.

title: The Sign of the Cross
description: Colm Tóibin's book on Catholicism in Europe is a personal and insightful examination of its effects on nationalism. It was written over four years from 1990, exploring the contradictions and challenges faced by the Catholic Church while also exploring how it shapes national identity. This is not merely an autobiographical work, but rather reimagined as examining both faith and literature.

title: Them
description: "Them: Adventures with Extremists" is a humorous and insightful take on the British government's approach to identity politics.

title: Just as Long as We're Together
description: Despite their differences, Stephanie and Rachel have been best friends for years, with Alison joining them recently. But is it possible to have two close friends? And how can you maintain a friendship without sharing your most vulnerable secrets?

title: Hour Game
description: The #1 "New York Times" bestseller by Baldacci features Sean King and Michelle Maxwell, the enduring duo from "Split Second," as they embark on a quest to track down two malevolent killers, one of whom is copying the other and taking away the "credit."

title: Bosnia
description: The aim of this publication is to capture the historical and political essence of the war in the Balkans. This edition features a chapter that covers the events from 1993 to 1995.

title: Every Boy's Got One
description: When Holly, the best friend of cartoonist Jane Harris, invites her and Mark to a romantic trip to the Italian Riviera, Jane jumps at the chance and agrees to be her maid-of-honour. Regrettably, she doesn't take this risk by accepting Mark's choice for best man, journalist Cal Langdon.

title: Under the Banner of Heaven
description: Krakauer's focus shifts from extreme physical excitement to religious conviction in a real-life double murder committed by two Mormon Fundamentalist brothers who claim God ordered their own death.

title: Downsize This!
description: By exposing the vulnerable underbelly of those who set themselves up as role models, Michael Moore has established himself as someone who refuses to shut up, retreat, or follow any political agenda.

title: Marching Powder
description: After being inspired by the description of San Pedro Prison in Bolivia, Young spent four months listening to McFadden and learning about one of the most bizarre places on earth.

title: Absolute Power
description: The Daily Mail has compiled an exceptional and impressive book that is sure to impress.

title: Chasing the Monsoon
description: After dreaming of experiencing the most extreme weather events in history, Frater finally succeeded in observing the Indian monsoon in 1987. He followed it from its burst on the beaches of Trivandrum to its passing through Delhi, Calcutta, and Bangladesh, providing insight into the immense influence of nature on India and its people.

title: Indecision
description: The middle of Dwight's life is causing him significant issues. He is only twenty-eight years old and working in tech support at Pfizer. His biggest challenge is the chronic pain caused by his inability to think critically. This leads them to swallow the first fateful pill, which was encouraged by a roommate.

title: Blackout
description: What happens when a passenger ship crashes into Cuba, and does it indicate an accident, terrorist act, or an attack by Castro's government? Robert McCabe, based in Los Angeles, has been informed by enigmatic friends that someone who was just murdered is sending him cryptic messages.

title: American Psycho
description: The world-renowned writer of Patrick Bateman, who now works on Wall Street and is an international bestseller, has a unique approach to his character.

title: The Mimic Men
description: A humorous and emotionally charged novel that portrays the perspective of a colonial man in post-colonial times.

title: A Bend in the River
description: Excellent and alarmingWatchman Salim, who left the coast to travel across the African seas.

title: The Enigma of Arrival
description: The story of Naipaul's journey from Trinidad, a British colony, to the ancient countryside of England is likely his most autobiographical work.

title: A House for Mr Biswas
description: V.S. Naipaul's third novel, A House for Mr Biswas, is a heart-wrenching account of how Mohun Biswe was born into repressive society and his lifelong struggle for independence have been marred by tragedy.

title: The Hunters
description: Maria Poniatowski's book, titled "A Simple Tale," is a collection of short stories about her life in Toronto.

title: Dirt Music
description: The raw, earthy and sensual nature of Georgie Jutland's story is more heartbreaking than any mysticism can convey.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: This beautifully clothbound and beautifully presented book is the ultimate collection of Adams's long-standing sci-fi/comedy classic, packed with never-before-seen material, original scripts from the BBC radio series, and much more, guaranteed to satisfy every fan.

title: City on the Seine
description: In his new book about Paris during the 17th century, Andrew Trout provides a fascinating and memorable social history of the city, focusing on the lives of Cardinal Richelieu and Louis XIV. He begins by discussing the development of bourgeois society in the region and concludes with an analysis of residential buildings that were flush with the street.

title: Fire on the Mountain (Hb)
description: In the 18th century, Britain was the leading participant in the slave trade worldwide, and while the Church of England and the Tate Gallery were among the beneficiaries, anti-slavery activism was brought to the forefront of British political life by abolitionists starting in 1788. This culminated in Thomas Clarkson, 63, who traveled 35,000 miles on horseback documenting slavery and participating in organized crime against women.

title: The Poet  the Warrior  the Prophet
description: The book's influence on theology is mirrored by works such as Rainer Maria Rilke, Gabriel Garcia Marquez, Emily Dickinson, Albert Camus, Sigmund Freud, and the Tao Te Ching.

title: From Russia with Love
description: Op de Russische dienst zichtbar was Agent 007 bijzonder in Moskou.

title: Casino Royale
description: The story continues with the enduring legend of James Bond, and you can expect more surprises and unexpected happenings in this timeless action novel.

title: How the Irish Saved Civilization
description: As the dark ages settled in Europe in the fifth century, Ireland played a crucial role in maintaining European culture. This was achieved through the restoration of Irish monks and scrines, who imitated the manuscripts of pagan and Christian writers like Homer and Aristotle, while libraries on the continent were lost forever.

title: Escape
description: Erikki Yokkomen, a pilot for the Finnish government, and his wife Azadeh, who was born in Iran, attempt to reach safety on their helicopter during the chaotic period following the Shah's departure from Iran.

title: Flatmates
description: While fibbing over their phone bill and being reliant on laundry, Fiona's flatmates are left reeling from the unexpected arrival of her new boyfriend. Gaetano, who is both gorgeous and unintelligent, causes chaos as events become unbearable.

title: Crucifix Lane
description: Crucifix Lane, a gripping thriller film, also delves into topical issues such as genetic engineering and incorporates Celtic mythology in an original and innovative manner.

title: Shōgun
description: The story of Pilot-Major John Blackthorne, a mariner who navigates through the harsh realities of feudal Japan, is brought to life by James Clavell's epic journey.

title: Whirlwind
description: In February 1979, a story that involves three weeks of intense fanaticism, self-sacrifice, and heartbreak unfolded in Tehran. A team of professional pilots is involved in this conflict, with two of them having Iranian wives whom they held in high regard.

title: Running Away from Richard
description: After graduating from drama school, Lizzie Jordan has been eagerly anticipating her chance to become Mrs Richard Adams and share a shabby house in Venice Beach with her boyfriend, but she is now facing the challenge of living as tainted waitress in infamous transvestite bar.

title: The Road to War  1933-1939
description: This book focuses on the origins of World War II and uses a source approach to structure questions, including activities and end-of-chapter questions at Intermediate level 1 and 2, as well as exam structure and extended-response questions.

title: Five on a Treasure Island
description: A ruined castle and hidden treasure are the starting points for the Famous Five's first adventure.

title: Five Go Adventuring Again
description: The Famous Five, including Julian, Dick, Anne, George, and Timmy, are on the lookout for the culprits behind the Kirrin Cottage thefts. They also discovered an old map and a very unusual underground location that could be linked to someone who may have been involved in the crime.

title: Five Go to Smuggler's Top
description: Eileen Soper has reissued a series of Famous Five prints that feature the original drawings in full color.

title: Five Get Into a Fix
description: The Famous Five's cover is updated to meet the needs of a new audience in the 21st Century.

title: Five Have a Mystery to Solve
description: The Famous Five delve into the hair-raising tales surrounding Whispering Island and discover that they are not alone.

title: On Writing
description: This autobiographical account provides insight into Stephen King's life, including his home life and family experiences, as well as insights into his writing style and the influences of books and movies. It also includes information on his early novel ideas, a true story that Carrie was inspired to write about, and tips for writers to avoid common errors and use professional writing aids such as setting characters, pace, plotlines, prophecies, descriptions of animals, historical figures, etc.

title: Girl Meets Ape
description: Dr Jennifer Niederhauser, the leader of the chimpanzee project at Prowdes Animal Sanctuary, is now known as the Ice Queen. However, she has become disillusioned with the system and finds herself in danger when she meets with head keeper Guy Gibson for the first time. She ultimately decides to never work with animals or the childish nature again.

title: The Waste Lands
description: Roland's band in the devastated city of Lud and its surrounding wastelands is confronted with new evils, including gruesome battles against Blaine the Mono, the piratical Gasher, and the frightening Tick-Tock Man.

title: The Art of Happiness at Work
authors: Dalai Lama XIV Bstan-ʼdzin-rgya-mtsho;Howard C. Cutler
description: The ART of HAPPINESS is the latest book in a series that brings together Dalai Lama and Howard Cutler's inspirational message for practical use.

title: Stranger in a Strange Land
description: When it was first published, it sparked controversy and uproar. However, the story of Valentine Michael Smith, who became the first man from Mars to visit Earth, remains controversial and controversial due to its unique storytelling style.

title: Interstellar Pig
description: Barney's new next-door neighbors are unlike any he has ever encountered - they are charming, quirky, and obsessed with a board game. They invite him to play Interstellar Pig with excitement, but things get out of hand when the situation becomes more difficult.

title: Nightingale's Song
description: During her work at her father's tavern, Maggie Nightingale discovers an unexplained conspiracy that prompts her to join a smuggler and flee on ferocious ships to the New World in order to escape the dangers of her surroundings.

title: The Secret Seven
description: A stolen race horse is discovered by seven children and a dog following their late night adventures with thieves.

title: Visions from Nowhere
description: The series' debut novel, "Return to the Planet of the Apes," depicts astronauts who move from their time period to join an ape-dominated society.

title: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight  Pearl  and Sir Orfeo
description: The scholar-fantacist is a reliable source for accurate translations of the three classics from the Medieval period in English verse.

title: The Centurions
description: The Roman Empire's glory is the goal of two half-brothers who find romance and adventure.

title: Story of O
description: The world's first erotic novel, Story of O, which is now known as Fifty Shades of Grey, was introduced to the genre. How far can a woman go in expressing her love?

title: The Crucible of Time
description: Observes the evolution of a society belonging to an exotic extraterrestrial race, whose amusing demeanor, adaptability, and metalworking abilities are the achievements and optimism of their civilization.

title: On a pale horse
description: Zane is thrust into the role of Death in a world where the scientific revolution has been succeeded by the magic revolution.

title: Job  a Comedy of Justice
description: Alex Hergensheimer encounters a series of world-altering events while on holiday in Polynesia, all of which indicate Armageddon and reveal his involvement in the ancient war between God and Lucifer.

title: With Friends Like These
description: The songs of Willie Whitehorse made him a unique guitarist who could have been anything but ordinary.

title: The Doom that Came to Sarnath
description: A group of conquering warriors celebrates their victory in a city filled with gems and riches, where the mere sight of it sets them free from mortal danger.

title: Mission to Moulokin
description: Ethan Fortune, the explorer, goes to the off-world trading post to book passage home, but he decides to stay and help organize a government of the universe after witnessing how traders are exploiting the local Tran.

title: The Tolkien Reader
description: Fantastic collection of short stories, poetry, and commentaries by The Lord of the Rings author including "The Adventures of Tom Bombadil" and 'Farmer Giles of Ham' as well as an essay on the art of fairy story and fantasy treatment. Reissued.

title: The Dragons of Eden
description: The famous astronomer and astrobiologist examines current knowledge of the development of intelligence on Earth in various forms of life and rationalizes that intelligence evolved along similar lines throughout the universe.

title: The Best of H.P. Lovecraft
description: Features "The Shadow Out of Time" as one of the sixteen Lovecraft horror stories.

title: The Adversary
description: In The Saga of Pliocene Exile, there are four books to read.

title: Five Patients
description: An introduction to the workings of a new hospital recreates the experiences of five patients at Massachusetts General Hospital.

title: Douglas Adams's Starship Titanic
description: Despite being launched seconds early, the Starship Titanic experiences SMEF (Spontaneous Massive Existence Failure) and vanishes, only to be discovered mysteriously at the residence of Dan and Lucy Gibson, who reside on Earth.

title: Anne Rice's the Vampire Lestat
description: Lestat narrates the tale of his descent into vampirism in France during the 18th century.

title: The Book of Lost Tales
description: The adventures of Eriol, Beren and Luthien, Turin and the dragon, the necklace of the dwarves,[note 2] and finally the fall of Gondolin are all part of Tolkien's first form of Middle Kingdom myths and legends. Reissue.

title: The Proud Highway
description: The personal messages of America's outlaw reporter scrutinize Thompson' kinship from the mid-1950s to 1967.

title: The Transition of H.P. Lovecraft
description: Her career-spanning horror tales include: "The Street", the crime drama "Little Black Eye," "Dagon" and "I Killer Clergy"; and, more recently, "Cool Air."

title: The Battle for God
description: Exposes how the fundamentalist movements in Christianity, Judaism, and Islam were shaped by fear of modernity.

title: Better Than Sex
description: An exploration of the American electoral process offers insights and observations on the 1992 presidential campaign.

title: First King of Shannara
description: The Druid Bremen is banished from Paranor after studying the forbidden arcane arts, but he soon finds out that Brona, the malevolent Warlock Lord, and his dark forces are once again on the run, with only a united Four Lands can stop them with mighty weapons. Reissue.

title: Ilse Witch
description: A body is found in the Jerle Shannara, where the Isle Witch, a stunning young woman with mystical powers, joins forces with the last of the Druids, Walker Bob, to solve.

title: Waterborn
description: Hezhi, an exotic princess whose blood is the source of the River God's magic, embarks on a perilous quest to uncover the truth when her favorite cousin vanishes, leading her to discover Perkar.

title: Cry to Heaven
description: The heartbreaking tale of two peasant-born students, Guido Maffeo and Tonio Treschi, who are both castrated and resentful, and the son of a patrician immigrant, is set in the heart of eighteenth-century Naples where they eagerly await their full lives.

title: The Vampire Companion
description: The Anne Rice series of vampire novels features a diverse range of topics, including characters, themes, places, and symbolism, in hundreds of entries.

title: Starshield Sentinels
description: The collapse of galactic civilization is imminent, and Merinda Neskat, the information-oriented explorer, must face her past and find the answers required. They are on a $150,000 advertising/promo. trip.

title: The Mantle of Kendis-Dai
description: The collapse of galactic civilization is imminent, and Merinda Neskat, an information explorer, will need to confront her past and uncover the answers required.

title: The Children of Henry VIII
description: Speculates on the existence of Henry VIII's successors and the perils that emerged from their quest to become the monarch.

title: The demon-haunted world
description: Announces the hazards of a significant amount of scientific ignorance, and discusses how scientific thought has helped to overcome prejudice and hysteria.

title: Twister
description: Scientists are pursuing the most destructive weatherfront in mid-America's Tornado Alley for 50 years. They plan to use electronic sensors to launch them into the funnel and gather enough data to improve the storm warning system. However, they must also intercept the twisters' deadly path before doing so.

title: Does Anybody Have a Problem with That?
description: The television program offers witty essays on topics such as politics, celebrities, feminism, education, beauty pageants, President Clinton, and social issues.

title: Friday
description: A genetically engineered courier of the future travels from New Zealand to Canada, completing a series of daring and captivating tasks. By the author of Starship Troopers. Reprint.

title: The 158-Pound Marriage
description: While The World According to Garp has a more distinct and refined style, this novel is markedly different from the author's typically strong and boisterous writing style. Although Mr. Irving avoids sexual tests and illusions between them, the sexual intrigue between these characters highlights their genuine concern for each other.

title: The Princess Bride
description: The famous fairy tale is framed in Goldman's 30th anniversary edition, featuring an "autobiographical" story. His father briefly read the book to his son, but now he has released a condensed version, with comments for the parts reprinted and excerpts included.

title: Reunion
description: Flinx and his friend Pip enter a covert security facility on Earth to learn about the Meliorare Society, renowned for their human experimentation.

title: Mostly Harmless
description: The daughter of Arthur Dent, who was raised on a planet at the far end of the universe, embarks on an intergalactic quest to locate her forebear planet.

title: Life  the Universe and Everything
description: As they explore the universe, Arthur Dent and Ford Prefect discover why the rest of the galaxy has avoided Earth.

title: The Eight
description: A top-selling item at the national level.

title: The Queen of the Damned
description: Refuses to recount the tales of Lestat, a stunning pair of twins who are haunted by vengeful events and Akasha, the mother of all vampires, who longs for her son's return to the primal world.

title: The Tale of the Body Thief
description: Anne Rice continues the extraordinary Vampire Chronicles that began with the iconic Interview with a vampire, complete with vampire hero, enchanter, and seducer of mortals. Lestat has been pursuing king in the dark and thriving world of the living dead for centuries until he is finally alone after years of being betrayed by his doubts and loneliness.

title: While I Was Gone
description: After the brutal murder of a close friend, Jo Becker is now married and has grown her family, but when an old housemate moves in with her, she finds herself back together and faces potential challenges.

title: Tales of the Cthulhu Mythos
description: Provides a compilation of Cthulhu mythos written by H.P. Lovecraft, with contributions from artists such as Loveart, Frank Belnap Long, Robert Bloch, Stephen King, and August Derleth.

title: Merrick
description: Merrick, a descendant of the Mayfair witches, who inherits her magical gifts from David Talbot, an adventurer and near-mortal vampire, recounts their rich African and French heritage with intricate traditions and voodoo legends.

title: The Straight Dope
description: Questions about animals, human anatomy, religion, history, science, politics, technology, language, music, money, food, television and movies.

title: Nightsword
description: In the second book of the Starshield adventure saga, which is inspired by Dragonlance and Deathgate creators, readers can watch a battle between astronaut Jeremy Griffiths and the power-hungry Targ of Gandri for their Nightsword.

title: The Virtues of Aging
description: The ex-president presents an essay on how aging has altered his perspective and offers tips for readers to turn their later years into the best version of themselves. Reissue.

title: Trust Fund
description: Bo Hancock, the financial magnate and youngest son of Connecticut's most powerful family, is faced with a difficult decision to choose between loyalty and personal honor, as his older brother Paul seeks to win over their campaign for the White House.

title: Star Wars  Episode I
description: Replicas of storyboards from the director's studio are included in the complete screenplay for the latest "Star Wars" movie, which depicted Darth Vader'S youth.

title: The King of Elfland's Daughter
authors: Edward John Moreton Drax Plunkett Baron Dunsany
description: A young prince explores a mysterious forest in search of the land of Faerie and Princesses, one of modern fantasy fiction's landmarks.

title: Omerta
description: Don Raymonde Aprile and FBI agent Kurt Cilke engage in a final war of the "good guys" and "bad guys," as depicted in The Godfather's reprint.

title: The Genome War
description: The competition to complete the human genome sequencing challenge, as described by Craig Venter and Francis Collins, is a result of competing research efforts.

title: The Analects of Confucius
description: Confucian thought is introduced through this translation of the Analects, which draws on the oldest surviving version of his most influential text.

title: The Real James Herriot
description: The portrait of the cherished Yorkshire vet, depicted by his son in an autobiographical piece that recounts his experiences as a rural veterinarian and his love for animals. The initial printing is 20,000 copies.

title: Angel Fire East
description: Hopewell, Illinois, becomes the setting for another epic battle between John Ross and the demonic forces of the Void, as Ross races against time to save a rare gypsy morph from the darkness. Reissue.

title: Morgawr
description: The Druids and their allies are at odds with shocking revelations as they fight against the unthinkable forces of darkness.

title: Tanequil
description: Grianne Ohmsford, the legitimate High Druid of Shannara, is imprisoned in the Forbidden by Dark Magic while her foes take over the Druke Council and start fighting against the Free-born. Meanwhile, Pen Ohmmsfor embarks on a desperate mission to find the Tanequil, despite being only 15 years old, who could use his powers to free her. Reprint. 100,000 first printing.

title: The Dress Lodger
description: A London prostitute borrows a blue dress to appeal to privileged clients, but an evil old woman is hired by the dress's owner to look after her.

title: Henry VIII
description: Explores the impact of the king on the laws, customs, culture and politics of his realm and details the many courtesians, artists, and scholars who worked alongside Henry VIII.

title: The Case of the Curious Bride
description: After her husband, a former con artist, was found dead in july plane crash, Rhoda Lorton is now facing the threat of blackmail. Reissue.

title: The Courtesan
description: In an effort to secure her future, Gabrielle Cheney, a courtesan from the 16th century, must face certain challenges due to the wickedness and dark arts of Catherine de Medici's mastermind, Captain Nicolas Remy.

title: The Collapse of the Common Good
description: The pursuit of fairness without limits has resulted in a society plagued by legal fears.

title: Drowning Ruth
description: The first book in a series by Schwarz, "Drowning Ruth," was picked for the Oprah Book Club and is now available in paperback. It offers readers an unforgettable glimpse into the tight-knit relationships between sisters and the emotional challenges that arise from their shared experiences.

title: The Best of Lester Del Rey
description: Terry Brooks, the founder of Del Rey Books, has written a stunning new book that includes classic tales from his co-founder. The book is now available in an impressive size and is essential for all science fiction fans.

title: I Am the One that I Want
description: The popular comedian's one-woman Off-Broadway show features a comedic take on her childhood, teenage years, and struggles with substance abuse and weight issues.

title: Schmidt Delivered
description: Schmidt faces doubts about his May-December relationship after Carrie rejected his marriage proposals, his daughter returned and questioned her senselessness while he meets a mysterious Egyptian billionaire who may be the key to his ultimate financial success.

title: Black House
description: The Talisman sequel features Jack Sawyer, a former Los Angeles homicide detective who lives in Tamarack, Wisconsin, as one of the two main characters. He is tasked with solving an alarming string of murders that causes Jack to wake up with haunting dreams and returns to the Territories, while also grappling with his own concealed past.

title: My Movie Business
description: In The World According to Garp and Hotel New Hampshire, the author shares his experience of attempting to make Cider House Rules into a blockbuster film while also providing insight into the process.

title: The Dark Arena
description: Walter Mosca, a former G.I. and World War II soldier, returns to Germany after the war in order to find fortune, but his true love lies with Hella and becomes involved in the dangerous black market. Reissue.

title: The Sicilian
description: Michael Corleone, who spent three years in exile in Sicily, is set to return to America with Salvatore Giuliano, a young Sicilian mobster whose actions have provoked the Sicilians' leader.

title: Time to Be in Earnest
description: P. D. James' autobiography, which recounts her life from school in the 1930s to her rise to fame as a writer and membership in parliament, is based on the contents of her diary that she kept for years and is now published with 40,000 copies.

title: The Silent Gondoliers
description: Recounts the tale of Luigi the Gondolier and the enigma of the silent performances by the singing gondolers of Venice's Grand Canal.

title: Welcome to the Great Mysterious
description: Initially, Geneva has no plans to go to Minnesota to take care of Rich. However, she later changed her mind and decided to help her sister's family.
