What have been the benefits and drawbacks of this successful career? Is it valid for her to complain about being a celebrity who is getting attention instead of publishing gossip stories?

title: While I was Gone
description: After a friend was brutally murdered, Jo Becker has since moved on and is married with an adult daughter. However, when an old housemate moves in, it's backfire and threatens her future as she seeks to save her life.

title: A Stroke of Midnight
description: The kingly figure of Faerie, Private Investigator Meredith Gentry, is confronted with unexpected foes and must use her magical abilities to combat the evil that could devour her.

title: The Talisman
description: In his quest to find the Talisman, a surreal parallel world and ultimate rescuer for his dying mother, Jack Sawyer, aged 12, navigates through the U.S. while encountering the hidden dangers of the Territories.

title: Lights Out
description: Despite being sentenced to fifteen years in prison for an unrelated crime, Eddie Nye is determined to find out who was truly responsible and seeks help from his Wall Street freebooter brother, Karen (his lover), and a young sharpshooter.

title: Edge of Victory II
description: Han Solo and Leia Organa Solo are attempting to fortify the Jedi resistance as the Yuuzhan Vong search through the universe for Jedi to eliminate, while Anakin and Tahiri jump into hyperspace to avoid encountering New Republic soldiers who suspect them of being killers.

title: Death in Holy Orders
description: Commander Adam Dalgliesh is enticed by the father of a young priest in training to investigate the young man's untimely death and finds himself caught in the middle of an intricate and violent puzzle.

title: A Chosen Few
description: A strong and optimistic visionary returns to the midst of mourning in Berlin, where Jews gather for the Passover seder. Paris and Antwerp have become significant new hubs of Jewish culture, while small yet proud Jewish communities are revitalizing the ancient cities of Budapest, Prague, and Amsterdam. These movements are indicative of the resilience and hopelessness that has enveloped these peoples, who choose to settle or remain in Europe, following the Holocaust.

title: Boogaloo on 2nd Avenue
description: Speculates on the existence of the people living in a tight-knit, multi-racial neighborhood on New York's Lower East Side, including Nathan, despite his married life and his romantic feelings towards Karoline, an American woman.

title: Star Wars
description: The Star Wars series features a comprehensive list of key characters, including actors from the films, books, comics, TV specials and games, as well as those featured in episodes I and II.

title: Flinx's Folly
description: Flinx and Pip, his mini-drag protector, are enlisted to fight against a terrifying extra-galactic threat while being drawn into heightened danger as they prepare to confront thy enemy and fall into the embrace of the one woman he has loved.

title: Clay's Quilt
description: A romantic coal miner, Clay Sizemore, scour his family history for any indications of his identity, discovering a dramatic tale embedded in his uncle's quilted walls.

title: Sunstorm
description: A woman encounters a mysterious portal that leads to the Firstborn, all-powerful creatures that caused the historical upheaval and the creators of the infamous black monolith of "2001: A Space Odyssey."

title: The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: In this collection of novels, Arthur Dent is ushered into the vastness of the galaxy when he is saved by an alien ally just before Earth's destruction, and begins a series of thrilling adventures with his new friend.

title: Shadow Dance
description: Jordan Buchanan and Noah Clayborne's tumultuous relationship turns into a thrilling romance that moves between the high-end Boston and small Texas towns. The book was first printed with 300,000 copies.

Describes the event that would later be identified as 1968, a critical period in twentieth-century history, with an emphasis on the turbulent events, politics, culture, economics, and social changes that occurred during this time.

title: The Probable Future
description: In a state of distress, Stella is forced to confront her legacy and confront the truth about her wrongdoing when her father is imprisoned due to false charges of murder, and she collaborates with her grandmother and mother to find answers.

title: The Vampire Chronicles Collection
description: Lestat's life span spans three centuries, from his childhood in eighteenth-century France to his current status as a rock star and vampire.

title: Altered Carbon
description: Despite the near-obsession with death in the twenty-first century, Takeshi Kovacs is caught up in an ambitious conspiracy that involves downloading a person's consciousness into reincarnated bodies.

title: Market Forces
description: A wealthy individual, Chris Faulkner, uses his expertise in global revolutions and liberation wars to sell arms, intelligence, and power, but his increasing wealth comes at a steep price.

title: Tales Before Tolkien
description: The book contains twenty-two classic fantasy tales that draw on the early Tolkien works, such as "The Golden Key" by George Macdonald, "Sylvester Lang"'s "Ice Age," and "Creeper Perris' Shadow of Absorbed Love."

title: Body Double
description: Upon arriving back from Paris, Boston medical examiner Maura Isles comes across a murder victim in her driveway who she finds identical twins and an unfamiliar biological mother.

title: Lost and Found
description: Marcus Walker is abducted by a starship that is bound for remote space, and he discovers that despite being from 'a primitive planet' the dog belonged to ’a wealthy collector’. He then becomes friends with George who became an ally of the escape team.

title: The Light-Years Beneath My Feet
description: After being taken captive by aliens to be sold as a pet in another galaxy, Marcus Walker and his companion George have managed to outwit their captors but are now stuck billions of miles away from Earth, with no means of transportation.

title: To The Last Man
description: General John "Blackjack" Pershing's untested American Expeditionary Force, during the spring of 1918, is poised to lead a neutral America into World War I with renewed energy and strength.

title: Sliding Scales
description: A vacation that was supposed to be a peaceful, restful, and risk-free experience for Phillip "Flinx" Lynx and his mini-dragon protector, but is now cut short by new challenges.

title: Running from the Deity
description: Flinx and Pip, the mini-drag team, may have an opportunity to combat a potential Great Darkness that threatens the entire universe. Reprint.

title: Judas Unchained
description: The Commonwealth's factions must unite against both the Prime, a predatory alien species, and the Starflyer, an indiscernible creature with unstoppable mind-control abilities.

title: The Swarm War
description: In the midst of a potential world war between the Killiks and Chiss, Luke Skywalker makes an impatient attempt to stop the war by entering into hostile territory.

title: Yoda
description: During the ongoing Clone Wars, Yoda is informed that his adversary and ex-student wishes to meet in secret to discuss peace on Vjun, leaving him with no choice but to trust Dooku.

title: The Fourth Hand
description: A New York journalist is aided by millions on television after his left hand was eaten by a lion while reporting from India, prompting viewers to rally for him.

title: Bloodcurdling Tales of Horror and the Macabre: The Best of H. P. Lovecraft
description: The Call of Cthulu is one of the most gruesome stories in horror fiction, featuring sixteen terrifying visions.

title: Saving Fish from Drowning
description: In the midst of an unfortunate art expedition in the Burmese jungle, eleven Americans encounter a tribe eager for leadership and enshrined in mystical wisdom will protect them from the military rule of Myanmar.

title: A Parchment of Leaves
description: A Cherokee woman who leaves her community to marry a white man in 1917 is faced with discrimination and isolation as she attempts to adjust to her new life. By the author of Clay's Quilt. Reprint.

title: The Heritage of Shannara
description: Brings together all the four books in its series "Heritage of Shannara"--the Scionaries, Druids, The Elf Queens and finally the talismanes.

title: All I Really Need to Know I Learned in Kindergarten
description: The Unitarian minister considers America and its diverse peoples, everyday wisdom, kindness, and joy, as well as the significant meanings of everyday life.

title: Perfect Nightmare
description: The disappearance of Kara Marshall's daughter, who was one of many people to be abducted and is now at the mercy of a deranged murderer, has left Kara fearful as she continues to investigate the possibility of the teenager running away.

title: The Franklin Affair
description: The passing of a mentor brings about personal and professional disasters, but they do so for ten years when the young historian is sent 'a quiet, orderly letter from the Revolutionary War which exposes an American history that could change in one minute or two -- and I am now part of this committee investigating plagiarism charges against... female biographer who will do whatever it takes to stop these acts of plagiarism' (Reprint. 30,000 first printing).

title: Oh My Stars
description: A new musical masterpiece features Violet Mathers, a disdainful woman, who is drawn to an attractive musical pioneer during the early days of rock 'n' roll.

title: The Chronicles of Riddick
description: In PITCH BLACK 2: THE CHRONICLES OF RIDDICK, the official novel of Universal Studios portrays Riddick, an interplanetary mercenary who faces a peril that could result in his death, as well as those of his friends and allies, and ultimately, consume the entire galaxy.

title: The Amateur Marriage
description: A mismatched couple discovers their distinct personalities and ways of living during World War II, leading them to marry at first sight and their family being devastated by the differences that are taking a toll on their lives.

title: The Guns of August
description: A definitive Pulitzer Prize-winning retelling of the powderkeg that was Europe in the first thirty days of World War I follows the actions of patriots and statesmen in Berlin, London, St. Petersburg, and Paris.

title: Wish You Were Here
description: An authorized biography of Douglas Adams, authored by his editor and close friend, is based on material from the author's family and presents a more detailed portrayal of the iconic writer.

title: The Fortunate Pilgrim
description: Contains the story of an Italian immigrant family that settled in New York during the late 1920s and endured World War II, with a determined mother figure struggling to raise six children and uphold traditional values in contrasting cultures.

title: The Vampire Lestat
description: Having recovered from his prolonged sleep, Lestat now enjoys the spotlight as a contemporary rock star, sharing his tale of an upbringing in pre-revolutionary France and his encounter with vampires to unravel his past. Reissue.

title: Vanish
description: Gabriel Dean, an FBI agent, takes immediate action to safeguard his wife, a homicide detective named Jane Rizzoli, who was abducted and taken hostage by Nicholas Tennant.

title: Darth Bane
description: Darth Bane aims to eliminate the Sith Brotherhood and establish a stronger order in an age of conflict between Jedi and Sidi, well before their ascension.

title: Tempest
description: To outsmart their families and the Jedi, Han and Leia Solo join the Corellian rebels and uncover a conspiracy to murder the pro-Alliance Hapan queen and her daughter, only to face off with their son Jacen.

title: Tsubasa
description: The princess of Clow, Sakura, possesses a peculiar power that has the potential to transform the world. She lives in an alternate reality with her childhood friend Syaoran and embarks on countless journeys to other worlds.

title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass  an American Slave
description: Comprises the memoir of the celebrated abolitionist and politician who fled to the North after twenty-one years of confinement, as well as an account that exposes slavery and the exploitation of African American women as first-person figures.

title: Already Dead
description: The tales you hear about things that only surface in the middle of the night, but are fueled by blood and flesh, are not true. However, they are more dangerous than movies or Stoker's narratives. If you happen to be one of them, Joe Pitt can help explain why there is a man on the loose who is trying to kill people with an infectious illness.

title: No Dominion
description: Despite Joe Pitt's life being unproductive, the only things that matter to him are his stash of blood and money.

title: A Slipping-down Life
description: The Baltimore family and the girl who vanishingly close to their lives.

title: Trump
description: An overview of the entrepreneur's week and his thoughts on topics such as football, New York mayors or Trump' best real estate deals, along with a look at the deal maker'S art. Reprint.

title: Ego & Hubris
description: Despite his intelligence, Michael Malice has had to navigate the challenges of unconventional childhood jobs and eventually finds himself in a dead-end job when he meets the author.

title: Until I Find You
description: Describes the life and times of actor Jack Burns, whose connection to his mother Alice, who is a tattoo artist in Toronto, and their search for his father William, determines how he interacts with women and succeeds in Hollywood.

title: The Coal Tattoo
description: The author of Clay's Quilt has reprinted with her first edition, detailing the hardships faced by Anneth and Easter, two sisters who were raised in a small Tennessee coal-mining community but also experienced heartbreak when their mother died.

title: Throne of Jade
description: Temeraire, a rare Chinese imperial dragon that was meant to be gifted by Napoleon Bonaparte, is summoned to the imperialty by the powerful Chinese emperor, who threatens British naval officer Will Laurence's partnership.

title: A Dangerous Man
description: Reluctant hitman Henry Thompson returns to New York City, where his previous mishaps took place, to assume the role of being the bodyguard for rising baseball star Miguel Arenas. However, he is forced to make a desperate final decision due to the threat against his parents' life, as per the original author of Caught Stealing and Six Bad Things. Original print.

title: Enchantment
description: tracing one man from ninth-century Russia to the modern day America as they fight to save a princess and her kingdom, find true love and conquer evil.

title: How to Be Lost
description: The Winters family, consisting of a wealthy father, mother, and three daughters, experience unforeseen circumstances when their daughter, Ellie, vanishes mysteriously. However, after fifteen years, Caroline, her older sister, is determined to find her long-departed sister through searching in People magazine. By the author of Sleep Toward Heaven. Reader's Guide, first printing, contains 30,000 copies.

title: Queen of the Underworld
description: In 1959, Emma Gant is released from her Cuban exile and begins working as a reporter for The Miami Star. She faces conflicting loyalties, clandestine relationships, and professional setbacks as she strives to achieve her goals in the city. A Reader's Guide with original content has been printed and includes 30,000 copies.

title: Jarka Ruus
description: After two decades, Grianne Ohmsford, the evil Ilse Witch, decides to become head of the Druid Council responsible for safeguarding the Four Lands, but she vanishes and her nephew Pen and his friends are left to rescue her.

title: Armageddon's Children
description: With civilization in decline, evil wizards are at war with the remnants of the former United States, causing their deaths and enslaving them. However, Logan Tom must eventually find a child with powerful magic to save the world.

title: Tsubasa 9 Reservoir Chronicle
description: The princess of Clow, Sakura, possesses a peculiar power that has the potential to transform the world. She lives in an alternate reality with her childhood friend Syaoran and embarks on countless journeys to other worlds.

title: Thirteen
description: A hitman named Carl Marsalis, who lost his passion for killing on a government experiment to create an even more deadly military warrior, is apprehended in Miami and has government officials strategizing to use his skills to achieve their own ends. 30,000 copies were first printed worldwide.

title: Tsubasa  11
description: The princess of Clow, Sakura, possesses a peculiar power that has the potential to transform the world. She lives in an alternate reality with her childhood friend Syaoran and embarks on countless journeys to other worlds.

title: Tsubasa 12 Reservoir Chronicle
description: The princess of Clow, Sakura, possesses a peculiar power that has the potential to transform the world. She lives in an alternate reality with her childhood friend Syaoran and embarks on countless journeys to other worlds.

title: Candy Licker
description: The House of Homicide's CEO, Hurricane Jackson, and Candy Raye Montana receive more than she bargains for when they sign a contract.

title: Drop Dead Gorgeous
description: Blair Mallory, who narrowly escaped two assassination attempts, launches a personal campaign to uncover her attacker's identity without the aid of her fiancé, police detective Wyatt Bloodsworth.

title: The Devil's Labyrinth
description: Saul, the author of "New York Times" best-selling book, portrays an exorcist who has learned to reverse the enigmatic art of summoning evil rather than driving it out.

title: Feel the Fear-- and Do it Anyway
description: A psychotherapist presents a guide to uncovering the obstacles that are impeding one's life, such as public speaking, intimacy, aging, and rejection, while also teaching participants how to turn frustration and helplessness into power to create success in all areas of life.

title: The Devilish Pleasures of a Duke
description: Emma Boscastle, a teacher at her London school for young ladies, is saved from unwanted attention by Adrian Ruxley, an injured rogue photographer who finds himself under Emma's roof during recommencement and draws the righteous young woman into witty theatrical displays of impropriety.

title: Star Wars Republic Commando
description: The Republic, with the assistance of Delta squad and a notorious ARC trooper, confronts their most formidable adversary, the Omega Squad, renowned for their deadly combat abilities and heavy weaponry.

title: The Manhattan Hunt Club
description: Known for his mastery in psychological suspense and heart-stopping terror, John Saul, the New York Times bestseller, invites readers to explore dark corners of the earth and uncover a secret world hidden deep within our own consciousness.

title: The Voyage of the Jerle Shannara Trilogy
description: Provides an account of the heroes' journey through the Four Lands, where they confront the enigmatic yet deadly Ilse Witch and her associates in a thrilling battle between good and evil.

title: The Plague Dogs
description: Rowf and Snitter, a large black mongrel and white terrier, escape from an animal experiment center in England's Lake District and learn to live independently with the help of poop. However, they are soon turned into fugitives due to reports of killed sheep and bubonic plague-carrying dogs. Reprint. 15,000 first printing.

title: The Making of Star Wars
description: A work by a Lucasfilm employee, which includes unrecorded interviews and photos, is written to celebrate the first Star Wars film's thirtieth anniversary.

title: Star Trek Logs Five and Six
description: To mark the 40th anniversary of Star Trek, preserve original mission logs and uncover some of the crew's most peculiar missions and encounter with alien races.

title: Logs Seven and Eight
description: The Counter-Clock Incident, which takes place on the final frontier of the Enterprise, marks the fortieth anniversary of Star Trek and features original mission logs from this time period.

title: The Hobbit / The Lord of the Rings
description: Contains the complete "Lord of the Rings" trilogy and its prequel, "The Hobbit."

title: The World According to Garp
description: The "New York Times" bestseller's 20th anniversary edition includes a new afterword that explores the life and death of T. S. Garp, the son of feminist leader Jenny Fields who was known for his boldness in pushing the boundaries of sexual liberalism.

title: If this is a Man ; and The Truce
description: Armed with the moral stamina and intellectual poise of a twenty-year Titan, this modest man was determined to remember the German hell on earth in meticulous detail. He formulated it into clear, unpretentious prose, and then communicated it clearly. Levi's writing is richly illustrated by his intimate knowledge of the most heartwarming human occurrences and the contemplativeness of its subject matter.

title: The Drowned and the Saved
description: Primo Levi took his own life shortly after finishing THE DROWNED AND THE SAVED. The death was characterized by sudden, violent, and unexpected events. Some believed that he killed himself due to his guilt, which made him feel better than others about not having survived Auschwitz while others had better.

title: The Life and Death of My Lord Gilles de Rais
description: A retelling of the Bluebeard tale, featuring a French Army captain who was murdered in 1440 in Brittany. The list of his transgressions includes witchcraft, heresy, sacrilege, sorcery (incest), the evocation of demons, and the practice of unnatural crime against children, concluding with their murder for his enjoyment.

title: Lincoln
description: Despite his lack of empathy towards American history or its historical figures, Gore Vidal's historically provocative novels offer a stunning and almost hero-like portrayal of Abraham Lincoln.

title: The Age of Extremes
description: According to the Publisher, Hotsbawm's account divides the century into three eras: the Age of Catastrophe from 1914 to 1945, the Golden Age from 1947 to 1973, and the Landslide from 1973 to 1991, all of which have had a profound impact on human life.

title: Hitler's Willing Executioners
description: Daniel Goldhagen revisits a question that has been consistently ignored by history. His research leads him to the conclusion that the Holocaust cannot happen given the amount of anti-Semitic sentiment in German society. He proposes an urgent need for rethinking our understanding of the events from 1933 to 1945, using fresh, primary evidence and extensive testimony from the perpetrators to establish that they were innocent Germans who lived beyond the Nazi regime's control.

title: Brief Interviews with Hideous Men
description: In his latest and unique short story collection, David Foster Wallace pushes the boundaries of fiction with his trademark witty humor and seductive insight. These stories include 'The Depressed Person', a brightly witted look at baffling female mental state, "Adult World," describing an adult woman's agony over her husband' sexual relationship, and acclaimed - but not surprisingly -30 percent -- riffs on dark, comical portraits of men whose lives had been taken by someone of this same day as

title: Embrace
description: The story of Karl De Man's awakening to the Berg academy in South Africa during the 1970s is woven together by events from his early years.

title: The Tipping Point
description: The TIPPING POINT is a straightforward explanation that the majority of issues we confront, such as crime, teenage delinquency, and traffic jams, behave like epidemics. They are not linear in nature and can be abruptly transformed by the amount of effort put into solving them. However, it can result in drastic changes in direction through carefully planned interventions.

title: Aldous Huxley
description: Despite being born to T. H. Huxley's parents, Aldous Humphries was raised in a wealthy family and received education at both Eton and Oxford. However, his vision did not improve as he learned to read braille, which led him to pursue writing. He later wrote humorously and provocative novels such as CROME YELLOW (1921), ANTIC HAY (1923), and POINT COUNTER POINTES (1928).

title: Me Talk Pretty One Day
description: After moving from New York to Paris, David Sedaris attempted to learn French with the help of his sadistic teacher, who likened each day spent with him to giving birth to Caesarean supine. These amusing essays were inspired by that experience.

title: Long Walk to Freedom
description: The life and journey of Nelson Mandela are narrated in LONG WALK TO FREEDOM, a captivating memoir that captures the moment of his detention on Robben Island, his triumphant rise to power, and his profound emotions.

title: Dead Air
description: The East End's loft apartment, which is situated in a former factory that will soon be demolished, is where Iain Banks' new novel opens. Ken Nott lives in London, but his beliefs about religion make him an ideal contrarian during his wedding breakfast. People come and go, throwing fruits from the balcony onto drooping carparks (lower areas), as well as other objects such as an old TV that won't work, spoiled beans, beanbags, etc.

title: The Kalahari Typing School for Men
description: A former CID, Ex-New York, and Excellent woman signs outside the Satisfaction Guarantee Detective Agency. Can Cephas Buthelezi handle her current case involving a man who has been attacked by ostrich rustlers and is eager to reevaluate his life? Meanwhile, there are problems at Tlokweng Road Speedy Motors where an apprentice discovered God, while issues at home are evident.

title: A Likely Lad
description: A young man in Manchester in the 19th century runs away from school, escaping with a new perspective on his future, after being coerced by his father into leaving.

title: The Love Artist
description: The book 'The Love Artist' by Valerie Parv, released on Jul 24, 1987, is now available for purchase.

title: The Sultan's Bought Bride
description: The book titled The Sultan's Bought Bride, which was released on August 25, 2004, is currently available for purchase by Jane Porter.

title: A Mistress For The Taking
description: In order to save her brother from ruin, Marina Lucchesi, an inexperienced young woman, must confront her mistress, Ronan Carlisle, who is willing to pay the price. Marina has no reason to betray this decision, as she is too emotionally invested to risk his life without Ronans support.

title: The Stranger Next Door
description: A stunning woman with treacherous secrets was poised to become the next door neighbor of Langley Randolph, a vulnerable stranger who could easily be detected by any red-blooded male.

title: The Sheik & the Princess Bride
description: Prince Jefri of Bahania was defeated by a woman, not just any woman. His flight instructor, Billie Van Horn, was equally impressive and determined to keep her feet on the ground.

title: Burning The Map
description: A trip to Rome and Greece with her two best friends turns her into a self-discoverer at the age of 26, having her life perfectly planned, leading her to question her own choices and questioning her relationship with boyfriend John.

title: Slightly Settled
description: At what point did Tracey Spadolini's life become complicated and she suddenly found herself in the presence of three men?

title: Monkey Business
description: Kimmy, Russ, Jamie, and Layla are new college students at the University of Connecticut, but they don't know anyone. They all plan to attend university for an MBA program, while living in a coed dorm and studying monkey business.

title: The Right Stuff
description: The book, The Right Stuff by Merline Lovelace, released on Feb 23, 2004, is now available for purchase.

title: In Dark Waters
description: The book In Dark Waters by Mary Burton, which was released on Jun 21, 2005, is currently available for purchase.

title: The Bluest Eyes in Texas
description: Despite the fact that his foster parents were murdered by him, Logan Marshall from the Army was determined to seek revenge or face death. P.I. Bailey Madison's offer of help meant that he would return with her family after the killer was caught and could not refuse it.

title: Wild Fire
description: Debra Cowan's Wild Fire, which was released on Jan 24, 2006, is now available for purchase.

title: The MacGregors
description: A stoic politician in "All the Possibilities" falls for a free-spirited beauty despite their long-standing family feud, while in one of the more graphic cartoon series, "One Man's Art," he rediscovers his romantic innocence with the help of an artist.

title: Dream Makers
description: The lion trainer, Jo Wilder, is drawn to Keane Prescott, a lawyer who inherits the circus; and Megan Miller is in love with David Katcherton, an attractive stranger who offers to buy her grandfather's amusement park.

title: Rebellion
description: Brigham Langston, a good-looking English lord, finds himself drawn to Serena MacGregor, an arrogant Scottish hoyden, in despite the hostility between their two countries.

title: The Gunslinger's Bride
description: The Gunslinger's Bride, illustrated by Cheryl St.John, was released on August 24, 2001 and is currently available for purchase.

title: Tallchief for Keeps
description: The arrival of prim Elspeth Tallchief's secret lover in Amen Flats one day causes shock to everyone, but Elsie is aware that her other secret is even more shocking.

title: Time & Again
description: A romantic premise.

title: First Impressions
description: In "New York Times" bestseller author Nora Roberts' holiday romance, a wealthy businessman seeks refuge in the countryside to escape from women. However, his gracious, persistent, and beautiful neighbor has something he cannot ignore. Together, they discover that love is the ultimate Christmas gift.

title: Year's Happy Ending
description: The cynical widower Professor Gideon Beaufort offers Deborah Farley a marriage of convenience, but her quiet existence is marred by the challenges of becoming accustomed to motherhood and being united with someone who no longer believes in love.

title: Father to Son
description: With his new role as Reigning Master of Sinanju, Remo must demonstrate that the Sinaniju is the most effective strategic weapon in existence, but a malevolent adversary awaits him with eagerness to fulfill vengeance by killing the Destroyer.

title: Savage Sun
description: Kane, Brigid, and Grant are sent to Ireland on a trans-mat jump from the Outlands to investigate the alien Archons, but they discover wild hinterlands inhabited by holocaust survivors who have reverted to clandestine societies.

title: Omega Path
description: Kane teams up with Brigid Baptiste and Grant, two outcasts, to travel to pre-apocalyptic New York City in search of a young man who could potentially transform the world. Original.

title: Hydra's Ring
description: A sacred pyramid in China is invaded by a Tong crime lord and his army, who claim an invaluable artifact, leaving Kane and the rebels facing off against nefarious forces that have existed for four thousand years. Original.

title: Expectant Father
description: Employs humor and wit to ease anxiety and respond to queries from fathers-to-be who are about to give birth.

title: The Accidental Bodyguard
description: Bethany Ann Moran, the granddaughter of the deceased "dark horse," was left with her fortune after being left unattended by a mysterious amnesiac hiding in his house. Lucas knew that the beautiful stranger was in trouble, but nothing could stop him from protecting her.

title: Blame it on the Blackout
description: Heidi Betts's album Blame It On The Blackout, which was released on Jun 07, 2005, is now available for purchase.

title: Bedded Then Wed
description: After an unlikely meeting, wealthy rancher Mitch Ramsey and his neighbor Emma Davis became unnerved. Their relationship was a source of intense romantic attraction, but they eventually decided to marry and share the love.

title: Blackmailed Into Bed
description: Despite the bold statements made by businessman Chase Ramsey, Elena Sanchez had no choice but to rebel against him. She would have turned on Chase and become his mistress in order to avoid any negative consequences. However, her longing for him intensified, making it impossible for them to reconcile.

title: Tell Me No Lies
description: A desperate strategy to catch a thief is necessary as some of the world's most valuable artifacts are being smuggled into the U.S. from China, leading to an international crisis.

title: A Lady At Last
description: Amanda Carre, daughter of a pirate, is taken to London by Cliff de Warenne, renowned rake and gentleman privateer, who transforms her into 'the lady' and becomes her number one suitor after her father was sentenced to death.

title: The Pirate  the Adventurer & the Cowboy
description: This compilation of three romance classics is authored by Jayne Ann Krentz.

title: Call After Midnight & Under the Knife
description: In the middle of the night, Sarah Fontaine wakes up from her husband's call to their London residence. Despite knowing that Geoffrey passed away in a hotel fire and is now dead, she and Nick travel across Europe searching for Geoff.

title: Manhunting
description: Kate Svenson devises a plan to find an eligible bachelor at The Cabins resort after three unsuccessful engagements. However, as her potential partners begin to flock to her, Jake Templeton decides to rescue the men in their lives.

title: Reckless Love
description: Janna Wayland, the wild stallion Lucifer, and Ty MacKenzie, who had come to meet El Cascabel and his renegade deputies, combine to escape from the rugged mountains and canyons of the Utah Territory. Reissue.

title: The Perfect Score
description: Despite her impressive academic achievements, Mattie Brown is determined to prove herself by proposing Cullen Slater.

title: Elphame's Choice
description: Returning to the Greco-Roman civilization of Partholon, this follow-up to "Goddess by Mistake" depicts Elphame confronting the ancient enemies of her people while on a quest for self-discovery.

title: Winter Moon
description: In this collection, which includes Mercedes Lackey's "Moontide" and "The Heart of the Moon" by Tanith Lee and C. E. Murphy, a story about ten lads who follow their foolishness until the moon rises above, an extraordinary power comes to life. Original.

title: Brighid's Quest
description: Brighid, the follow-up to "Elphame's Choice," departs from her centaur clan' repressive customs and prejudice to find harmony with Clan MacCallan. When her family visits her home, she must make a final choice.

title: Shattered Dance
description: Valeria, the first woman to be named after Kerrec, is pregnant and must fight against the Unmaking forces while simultaneously battling for control.

title: Sizzle
description: The ad campaign for the sensual new perfume Sizzle. Original features an encounter between Emily Tate, an advertising executive, and accountant Richard Parker, where romance is no longer favored in the business world.

title: The Foundling
description: The second of six special Georgette Heyer Collector Editions by Harlequin in 2003, this rare Regency romance is reissued with a special Foreword by Kay Hooper.

title: Sylvester
description: After he proposes to the woman that would be fitting for his high position in life, the Duke of Salford is left horrified when lulls discover that the sought-after maiden has written a romance novel which casts him as the antagonist. Reprint.

title: And the Envelope  Please...
description: At the I Love New York Film Festival, three female protagonists encounter unexpected love intrigues in this humorous and entertaining story by popular authors.

title: Suddenly Daddy
description: After a hectic honeymoon, Ciara and Mitch Mahoney were brought to the altar. However, it was not until later that she begged her husband to resign from his position as an FBI special agent.

title: Seven Sunny Days
description: Rachel Buckley and her partner, Carrie Ann and Yaslyn, embark on a journey to Turkey before their wedding, where they encounter bitterness, insecurity, and dark secrets.

title: Cross-X
description: This compelling and moving documentary follows the 2002 season of four debaters from Kansas City Central High School's debate team, who finished in the top ten at the national championships, and their journey back to their hometown.

title: The Echo Maker
description: Mark Schluter, who is 27 years old and has a rare brain condition that makes him think his sister is an impostor, struggles to explain the circumstances surrounding the motor vehicle crash that caused his head injury.

title: That Same Flower
description: A fictional letter written by Floria Aemilia, a concubine to St. Augustine for more than ten years before his spiritual awakening, challenges St-Augustine's view of women and love as described in his "Confessions."

title: Sylvia
description: Sylvia's book, which was initially a memoir and later adapted into YA fiction, depicts the struggles of surviving in Manhattan during the early 1960s. They are consumed with sexual fantasies, paranoia, drugs, and the intense pain of self-inflicted violence. Leonard Michaels uses vivid storytelling to portray the painful details of their young marriage that were on the verge of failing.

title: Uncommon Carriers
description: The subjects of McPhee's books are real-life individuals in their environments. He has spent a considerable amount of time with those who work in freight forwarding for the past eight years, and his book covers them. From Atlon, Scotland, he travels from Dublin to Cape Town on various trips.

title: The World Is Flat [Updated and Expanded]
description: Provides a brief overview of globalization, covering events such as the 9/11 terrorist attacks and the middle-class transformations in China and India.

title: The Discomfort Zone
description: His account of growing up in a family of only boys in Webster Groves, Missouri includes reflections on his experiences with Christian youth groups, his role as the school bully, marriage issues, and life lessons from birds.

title: Everything on a Waffle
description: The Newbery Honor Book tells the story of Primrose, an 11-year-old who lives in a small fishing village in British Columbia. She shares her experiences and learns about human nature and the uncertainty of life after her parents are lost at sea.

title: Gimpel the Fool and Other Stories
description: This book is a compilation of short stories that explore Jewish culture in both the United States and Europe, featuring vibrant illustrations of Yiddish lifestyle.

title: The Natural
description: Malamud draws on the opulent and combative atmosphere of pro baseball to portray contemporary culture.

title: The Slave
description: A story in Hebrew where a divine messenger sells himself to save 'em for thy work'.

title: Giving Good Weight
description: The Greenmarket, where the sun was shining and you were able to enjoy some fresh air, is home to individuals who are just as charming as you.

title: Heirs of General Practice
description: Describes the experiences of newly graduated doctors who are transitioning to family practice, and their interactions with patients.

title: The Control of Nature
description: The Control of Nature, a book that has been best-selling for over ten years, examines the territories where individuals engage in physical combat with nature and explores methods to manipulate it. Most impressive is McPhee's portrayal of the primary challengers: nature in intricate and magnificent forms, and those attempting to control her - determined characters who are sometimes foolish but often arresting.

title: The Death of Artemio Cruz
description: A landowner in modern Mexico, who is elderly and powerful, reflects on his corrupt life after falling ill during a business meeting.

title: Coming Into the Country
description: A narrative of a kayak and canoe trip through the Brooks Range wilderness, experiences in urban life, political activism, and portraits of people in the bush are all part of an ongoing study of modern Alaska.

title: Assembling California
description: Assembling California, a cross-section of human and geological time, was made by John McPhee and Eldridge Moores during their fifteen-year exploration of the Sierra Nevada, Mother Lode, wine country, San Francisco Bay, Angelo Canyon, Mendocino, and Santa Cruz Mountains.

title: Satan in Goray
description: The Jews of Goray, who share the same philosophy as the Rabbi, are divided between those who believe in the omnipotence of "no one can bring about the end" and those following the messianic pretender Sabbatai Zevi. However, with mounting hysteriis and depravity, it is soon evident that the Messiah is not present in Gorgon.

title: The Stories (So Far) of Deborah Eisenberg
description: When Deborah Eisenberg's first book, Transactions in a Foreign Currency, was published, John Updike said that "every new writer has opened up countless new windows of life." This same year saw the publication of her second collection, Under the 82nd Airborne (which The New York Times Book Review called "extraordinarily unique"), and both collections showcase Eisenberger's remarkable range of perspectives.

title: The Lost Lunar Baedeker
description: Gathers works by the avant garde poet of the early 20th century, and provides a brief introduction to the mysterious writer.

title: The Spirit Level
description: A collection of poems by the Nobel laureate explores the new beginnings of life, the value of everyday objects, a deceased Scottish poet's legacy, and the state of affairs in his native Northern Ireland. Reprint.

title: The Artist of the Missing
description: A young artist travels to the city in pursuit of his parents' disappearance and meets a woman who vanishes within seconds.

title: The Magic Barrel
description: Jhumpa Lahiri Bernard Malamud's first book of short stories, The Magic Barrel, won the National Book Award for Fiction Introduction and is considered a classic from its 1959 release. The storyline takes place in New York and Italy, with Arthur Fidelman, portrayed as Yuri in painting his way to finding his artistic legacy, wandering through the ruins of old Europe; it includes egg sellers, shoemakers, matchmakers or rabbis, in ringhead tales of pilgrimage to perform on behalf of children offspring at Easterwood, and finally finally

title: The Eclogues of Virgil
description: The renowned translator of The Odes of Horace and Gilgamesh, known as The Eclogues of Virgil, provided the ultimate definition for the pastoral mode, and these exquisitely beautiful poems are perhaps the most fitting demonstration of what pastoral can accomplish.

title: The Oresteia of Aeschylus
description: A modern translation of the ancient Greek trilogy about the murder and retribution that took place within the Argos royal family was commissioned by the Royal National Theatre for a performance in the Fall of 1999.

title: Get Out of My Life  But First Could You Drive Me & Cheryl to the Mall
description: A humorous yet shrewd guide to educating parents on how to handle teenagers in a more rapid and unethical society.

title: Selected Verse
description: Gathers poems from the playful to the elegaic, including English translations and original Spanish texts.

title: Crescent and Star
description: The writer examines Turkey's past glory and future aspirations, while also examining its untapped potential as a nation situated between Europe and Asia.

title: Memoirs of Hadrian
description: Since its initial publication in France in 1951, Memoirs of Hadrian has been praised internationally for both its exploration of character and its historical interpretation. Marguerite Yourcenar reconstructs Emperor Hadrien's challenging childhood, triumphs and setbacks, and ultimately his gradual transformation into a godlike figure, writing with the imaginative wisdom of renowned twentieth-century writers but with prose that is as elegant and precise as her own.

title: The Fixer
description: A Jew in Tsarist Russia is facing charges for the murder of a Catholic boy and is being subjected to harsh punishment.

title: The Poetry of Pablo Neruda
description: The poet who won the Nobel Prize has compiled translations of nearly six hundred works, with many of them being specially commissioned.

title: Play It As It Lays
description: With its wry and disturbing portrayal of Hollywood, Las Vegas, and the Mojave Desert, Play It as It Lays remains a deeply gripping read that resonates with readers even more than three decades after its first release.

title: Gimpel the Fool
description: Isaac Bashevis Singer's first collection of stories, Gimpel the Fool, is a landmark work that has been widely recognized internationally since its publication in 1957. The title story follows Gimel, despite being known as an intelligent baker, who is commonly mistreated by others but refuses to take revenge against his oppressors. All the characters in this book live in the unique ghettos of the pre-World War II era.

title: Martin and John
description: The New York Times praises Peck's debut work for its poignancy and uniqueness.

title: Georgics (Zongo Classics)
description: The Georgics, a poem by Latin poet Virgil, was probably published in 29 BC. It is named after the Greek word, gergika, which means "agricultural (things)," and is not considered peaceful rural poetry. This makes it arguably virtuous; it is also characterized by tensions in both its theme and purpose. The text is considered Octavian's second major work by Gregorio XVI following his Eclogues before the Aeneid.

title: Palm-of-the-Hand Stories
description: The Palm-of-the-hand-stories, written by Yasunari Kawabata, a Nobel Prize winner, reveal the essence of his art in contrasting ways.

title: Sophie's World
description: Sophie's World, a captivating novel that has been translated into over twenty million copies, is not only about Western philosophy but also ignited the imagination of readers worldwide.

title: The complete stories
description: "The unthinkable achievement of this exceptional volume affirmed the significance of Flannery O'Connor's contribution to American fiction. There are thirty-one stories in total, and twelve of them are not included in the two short story collections she created during her brief life, which are Everything that Must Converge and A Good Man Is Hard to Find."

title: Molloy
description: Molloy is mysteriously imprisoned while searching for his mother, a dying man looks back on his life, and an unidentified person wonders about his existence.

title: Ralph Ellison
description: Drawing from Ellison's personal papers, a critical biography of the author of Invisible Man offers revealing details about his life, work, and impact as an Oklahoma native with poor upbringing, his education and involvement in New York'S liberal intellectual circles, one of his personal relationships, among others, plus how racism had affected his perspective.

title: Collected Shorter Fiction
description: Contains excerpts from Tolstoy's shorter fiction, providing insights into his experiences as a soldier, spouse, peasant, belief in truth and simplicity, and interest in religion.

title: On Late Style
description: The late cultural critic's first printing features 15,000 essays that examine the great works of music and literature by Beethoven, Schoenberg, Mann, Cavafy, Beckett, Gould, Straus, Genet und others.

title: The Good Husband of Zebra Drive
description: Mma Ramotswe is burdened with a heavy case load at The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency and the ongoing struggle to confront an intruder in her home, which makes her happy. However, her husband, Mr. J.L.B. Matekoni, appears to be taking too much time to attend to her past issues. It seems that one of his trainees at Tlokweng Road Speedy Motors has made erratic advances towards an older, more upscale woman.

title: Blue Shoes and Happiness
description: P.I. Precious Ramotswe confronts a cobra, investigates an untruthful doctor, and discovers that Aunty Emang is not her true self.

title: Black Hole
description: Seattle adolescents in their 1970s are suddenly confronted with a devastating, disfiguring, and fatal plague that is transmitted solely through sexual activity.

title: The Heart of a Woman
description: Her autobiography's fourth volume delves into her experiences as a singer-dancer in New York and her observations on the Civil Rights movement.

title: Cliffs of Despair
description: The author recounts his journey to Beachy Head, England, where a close relative's suicide left him feeling distraught.

title: In Cold Blood
description: Special anniversary edition: Reissued with a 10,000 first printing, Capote details the grisly murder of four members of 'a dairy family' in 1959 in Holcomb, Kansas as well as the manhunt for his killers—Richard Eugene Hickock and Perry Edward Smith.

title: Shakespeare's Kitchen
description: A celebrated food historian presents a collection of contemporary, straightforward recipes inspired by sixteenth- and seventeenth century cookbooks, including Grilled Tuna with Carrots and Sweet Onions, Fish Bisque with Chestnuts& Artichokes, and Red Snapper with Caviar. The first printing of 35,000 copies was released in 1889.

title: As She Climbed Across the Table
description: Professor Philip Engstrand, who is deeply in love with physicist Alice Coombs, becomes involved in her research on the creation of "Lack": a conscious space in the universe that consumes preconceived notions.

title: Evening
description: Despite her illness and lack of friends, Ann Grant Lord, aged 65, fondly remembers a beautiful summer weekend forty years ago when she met someone she loved but passed away. The author of Folly has gone on to tour for the first time in just 100,000 copies.

title: The Executioner's Song
description: Reconciles the crime and fate of Gary Gilmore, the convicted murderer who sought his own execution in Utah, based on taped interviews with family members, friends, lawyers, and law enforcement officials.

title: Night Falls Fast
description: The author's personal experience with severe manic-depression and suicide attempts is incorporated into a study that examines the increasing number of young people experiencing suicide.

title: Geisha
description: Looks to the private lives of the geisha to capture this unique symbol of Japanese traditional culture, after their training, preparation for a performance, and role in Japanese society.

title: The Amen Corner
description: It focuses on the situation in which members of an old storefront church find out that their leader, Sister Margaret, is not a saint.

title: Tell Me how Long the Train's Been Gone
description: While recovering from a heart attack, Leo Proudhammer, an African American actor, is in the hospital and recalls his past life and love for his ex-partner.

title: The Moviegoer
description: In a state of madness, Kate must confront her cousin Binx, who is forced to abandon his dreamworld.

title: The World and Other Places
description: Presents a compilation of seventeen stories that span the author's entire career.

title: Melville
description: The life and career of Herman Melville, a prominent American author, are the subjects of this captivating biography, exploring his autobiographical details, discussing the historical and cultural significance of his writing, and evaluating his achievements as he traveled across the United States.

title: A Virtuous Woman
description: Two mismatched individuals-Jack Ernest Stokes and Ruby Pitt Woodrow Stokez- describe their lives as friends and enemies in alternating chapters.

title: Maximum City
description: A snapshot of Bombay, India, and its inhabitants is a chronicle of the city's existence, ranging from the violent mafia to the diverse group of people leaving the villages for better opportunities.

title: Glamorama
description: A young man from the opulent, famous city of New York is drawn into a dark and shadowy side of that city's culture, until he becomes trapped in an unforgiving world where politics, family, terrorism, and celebrity are intertwined.

title: Awakenings
description: Describes the author's work with institutionalized patients at Mount Carmel Hospital and the dramatic effects of the drug L-DOPA on twenty patients with encephalitic Parkinsonism.

title: Sons of Mississippi
description: The life and death experiences of seven white Mississippi sheriffs, portrayed in a haunting 1962 LIFE magazine photograph, are the focus of this disturbing study on the legacy of racial intolerance and prejudice, which resulted from James Meredith's attempt to integrate the University of Mississippi, and the impact of such violence on their lives and those of their children and grandchildren.

title: For the relief of unbearable urges
description: A compilation of ten stories that explore Jewish history and Orthodox customs includes "The Twenty-Seventh Man," which tells the story of an unpublished writer who ends up in a Stalinist prison, and "Let's just say it," "Peace to the Grail: A Protestant Novelist."

title: Breath  Eyes  Memory
description: The Book Club of Oprah.

title: Founding Brothers
description: The following is an introduction, discussion questions, author biography and suggestion to help your reading group in discussing Joseph Ellis's book "The Founding Brothers: The Revolutionary Generation" (for those who have never read the book before) so they can enjoy it more than ever.

title: The Tiny One
description: The loss of her mother is comforted by Via Revere's vivid recollection of the day she died in a Massachusetts car accident, and she struggles to cope with the grief.

title: Crucible of War
description: The author argues that the "Seven Years' War" caused a shift in the balance of power between the British and French in North America, leading to the destruction of the delicate balance.

title: No Country for Old Men
description: Llewelyn Moss and his young wife are caught up in a violent confrontation after discovering gruesome murder, heroin, and more than two million dollars in cash during 'hunting'.

title: I Married a Communist
description: Ira Ringold, a radio personality who was raised in Newark during the 1940s, is betrayed by his wife, Eve Frame, her silent film star, who exposes his Communist connections from the McCarthy witch hunts of the 1950s.

title: Lives of Girls and Women
description: A young girl's journey to becoming a woman in the 1940s is chronicled in this book by Del Jordan, which explores both male and female identities and documents her experiences in small towns across Canada.

title: The Working Poor
description: The deeply personal accounts of impoverished American working families from diverse ethnic backgrounds reveal their legacy of low-paying, dead-end jobs, dysfunctional parenting, and substance abuse. It also faults the government for not providing them with adequate housing, health care, or education. Reprint. 40,000 first printing.

title: Masters of Death
description: The historian who won the Pulitzer Prize challenges conventional interpretations of the Holocaust in a study that describes the role of task forces, such as Einsatzgruppen, deployed by the SS in Eastern Europe to kill Eastern European Jews, the development of less personalized methods of killing, and Hitler's eventual plans to annihilate members of other ethnic groups.

title: American Chronicle
description: A fictional account of Aaron Burr's life and death, highlighting his political achievements and fatal confrontation with Alexander Hamilton.

title: De Kooning
description: Discusses the personal life of abstract expressionist Willem de Kooning, his relationship with his wife Elaine Fried, and his struggles with alcoholism and Alzheimer's disease. The book is a reprint that received 35,000 copies at its first printing after winning the Pulitzer Prize for Best Book in History.

title: Geek Love
description: A new edition of the renowned cult classic features the proprietors of a traveling carnival, Aloysious and Lillian Binewski, who are trying to reduce expenses by breeding their own freak show, with tragic outcomes. The first printing is limited to 30,000 copies.

title: John James Audubon
description: John James Audubon's private life is explored in a biography that includes his arrival in America from France in 1803, his time spent in frontier Kentucky, and his exceptional depictions of native American wildlife.

title: Mediterranean Winter
description: Describes an intimate Mediterranean expedition that covers the region's history, literature, and heritage, recounting the mythologies and succeeding medieval civilizations of ancient Greece and Rome while also providing insight into the significance of the past for contemporary times. Reprint. 17,500 first printing.

title: Manufacturing Consent
description: Examines the impact of political influence on events, analyzes the relationship between media and the corporations that produce and support them, and discusses how to differentiate between news and propaganda.

title: Peanuts
description: Offers copies of over five hundred comic strips, sketchbooks and early prototype drawings for "Peanuts" as well as select Schulz cartoon features and commentary on the artist's life and work.

title: Good-bye  Chunky Rice
description: A shady skipper and two conjoined twins, Ruth and Livonia, accompany Chunky Rice, a small green turtle, on his way to the ocean. However, it is also revealed that he also leaves behind Dandel, who treats him with letters in pens. The first printing of this book was sold for 20,000 copies.

title: The Adolescent
description: Despite the political and social changes in 19th-century Russia, Arkady Dolgonsky finds it challenging to determine his own identity.

title: The Double and the Gambler
description: The Gambler is a psychological novel that merges the elements of naiveties and gambling fever, while Goliadkin's life is transformed by the discovery of an enigmatic doppelganger in The Double.

title: Anil's Ghost
description: After spending 15 years abroad, a forensic pathologist comes back to Sri Lanka to aid in the identification of civil war victims.

title: The Stories of John Cheever
description: Cheever's collection of sixty-one short stories is comprised of forty-eight pieces, four of which have never been published.

title: Ghostwritten
description: A strange sequence of events involves the lives of nine strangers from nine different countries.

title: Theatre
description: In this classic, out-of-print novel by the author of Of Human Bondage, Julia Lambert's life is turned upside down as a quiet stranger turns her into... an amazing woman.

title: The bridegroom
description: The author of Waiting. Reprint. 60,000 first printing presents twelve short stories that depict the struggles of Chinese men and women who face the effects of Western influence on their daily lives.

title: Stranger in the Forest
description: The author of Motoring with Mohammed shares his account of a seven-month, three-thousand-mile trek across Borneo and contrasting Western culture with life in the jungle.

title: Elect Mr. Robinson for a Better World
description: Pete Robinson, a schoolteacher who values civic engagements, is becoming more invested in his wife, Meredith, as he navigates the complex neighborhood conflicts that are prevalent in their respective neighborhoods. His first novel is published after undergoing reprints and receiving 10,000 copies.

title: Shroud
description: The young woman who tries to uncover a damaging secret from his past life challenges Axel Vander, an aged scholar and master liar, to examine his history and find out the truth.

title: Acts of Faith
description: A diverse group of individuals, including men and women, face their own moral dilemmas, fears, and physical hazards as they strive to alleviate the suffering caused by civil war and famine in contemporary Sudan.

title: Double Fold
description: Discusses how American libraries have dismantled original bound newspapers and brittle books to replace them with microfilmed copies, explaining the reasons behind this behavior.

title: The Box Man
description: A man, whose identity is unknown, chooses to live in a small cardboard box and records his surroundings and observations of the world from its tiny window while wandering the streets of Tokyo. Woman in the Dunes. Reprint. 12,500 first printing.

title: The Ruined Map
description: During the search for a missing salesman in modern Tokyo, an anonymous private investigator loses his sense of self.

title: The Face of Another
description: A scientist is left horribly disfigured by an accidental lab explosion and feels disconnected from society as he creates a mask that provides him with reassurance.

title: A Coffin for Dimitrios
description: Charles Latimer, an English writer, embarks on a quest during his trip to Istanbul to uncover the captivating history of the most notorious criminal in Europe, Dimitrios, and risks his life in enmity-laden networks of spy mafia, narcophagus, clandestine agents, intrigue, or assassination. Reprint. 12,500 first printing.

title: Journey Into Fear
description: On a ship bound for Turkey, Graham, an English weapons expert, discovers that Nazi killers are plotting against him to prevent him from returning to England with plans for constructing the Turkish defense system. Reprint. 12,500 first printing.

title: The Light of Day
description: A million-dollar heist that began with Arthur Abdel Simpson, a small con artist, being blackmailed and coerced into driving smashed car across the Turkish border after stealing traveller's checks from the wrong man.

title: Julian
description: This witty historical novel recounts the short but brilliant career of Julian, the Roman philosopher and emperor who dedicated himself to reinstating Hellenism and trying to stop the spread of Christianity. Reprint.

title: The Dive from Clausen's Pier
description: Carrie Bell begins to question her familiar world, from her daily life in Wisconsin to her relationships, as she tries to find her true self again after her fiancé Mike is left paralyzed by a tragic accident.

title: Lunar Park
description: The narrator's rise to fame as a best-selling author and wealthy celebrity during his college years is followed by grueling drug use and alcohol abuse, leading to unforeseen events.

title: Salonica  City of Ghosts
description: A compelling narrative history that portrays Salonica's rise as a Byzantine port and its subsequent occupation by the Nazis during World War II is presented.

title: World Light
description: Olaf Karason is resolute in his mission to become a great poet, despite the disdain and indifference of those around him. He endures hardships such as poverty, loneliness, failed relationships, and sexual misconduct while traveling across Iceland.

title: Paradise Reclaimed
description: The Nobel Prize-winning author's book, Independent People, chronicles the hardships of an Icelandic farmer who travels from London to Mormon Utah and back, in a desperate attempt to bring his broken family together.

title: In Search of Lost Time: Time regained & A guide to Proust
description: This is the only paperback edition of the definitive translation of part one, which contains the first half of Marcel Proust's famous seven-part series. The narrator recalls his childhood and uses the famous tea-soaked madeleine in part two, while M. Swann shares his love for Odette.

title: In Search of Lost Time Volume III The Guermantes Way
description: In the second volume of the classic French novel, which was first published in 1920, the Duc and Duchesse de Guermantes are introduced to the characters of Parisian high society in the standard English translation. The original version had 12,500 copies at first printing.

title: Iceland
description: Photographs capturing the beauty of Iceland's stunning landscape complement the stories of real-life heroes and magical creatures.

title: Sailing Alone Around the Room
description: Contains the popular and critically acclaimed poet's collection of witty, emotional, and direct poems, including selections from his four previous collections and new works such as "Man Listening to a Disc," which explores headphones.

title: Nine Horses
description: It is a collection of poems that reflect on the beauty and mystery of everyday life.

title: The Trouble With Poetry
description: A new collection of poetry by America's former Poet Laureate features clever, insightful, and uncomplicated verses that explore themes such as jazz, time travel, love, childhood, writing. The book is available for purchase at 99 cents or more with a first printing of 50,000 words.

title: Pipe Dream
description: The murder of a Philadelphia politician who is known for his corruption-exposing could spark outrage if it is revealed that the man was blackmailed and police officials may have been involved.

title: The Return of the Native
description: Presents a classic Hardy novel that centers on two individuals who are passionate about each other and have conflicting desires.

title: Ethan Frome & Summer
description: The first book features a New England farmer who is faced with the difficult decision of caring for his invalid wife or falling in love with her cousin, while the second book depicts Charity Royall and Lucius Harvey enjoying privileged summers together.

title: The Basic Works of Aristotle
description: Examines the extensive impact of this renowned Greek philosopher through a selection of his significant works.

title: Paris to the Moon
description: The author revisits a persistent American fixation with the French capital and delves into its meaning for Americans as he recounts his personal experience of Paris.

title: Comfort Me With Apples
description: The renowned food critic recounts her journey from chef to food writer, charts her way through restaurants from Bangkok to Paris to Los Angeles, and shares colorful stories about her life and encounters with delicious food.

title: Crossing to Safety
description: Sid and Charity, along with Larry and Sally, a mix of rich and poor, form an emotional bond in 1937 Madison, Wisconsin.

title: The Waste Land and Other Writings
description: The Waste Land, a monumental poem by T.S. Eliot, was first published in 1922 and is considered one of the most important works of modernism and poetry of its time. It offers sagacity, contemplation, and hope, while also challenging the established poetic traditions of other writers.

title: The Lost Painting
description: Recalls the quest for a hidden masterpiece by Michelangelo Caravaggio, an Italian Baroque master, as he travels with his graduate student through four countries and hundreds of years to unearth the mystery of "The Taking of Christ."

title: Daniel Deronda
description: Despite being a young man with high aspirations, Deronda is drawn to the world of Gwendolen Harleth through contrasting experiences in an English country-house setting and the lives of Mirah, despite her oppressive husband.

title: The Botany of Desire
description: Using botany, the research examines four fundamental human desires--sweetness, beauty, intoxication, and control-through plants: the apple, tulip, marijuana, potato, which are all plants.

title: Paris 1919
description: The PEN Hessell Tiltman Prize and the Duff Cooper Prize were awarded to Margaret MacMillan for her work on the "Big Three" narrative history.

title: Savage Beauty
description: Millay's flamboyant and turbulent life is documented in an authentic portrait of the Pulitzer Prize-winning poet, which draws on her private journal, letters, and other sources.

title: The Survivor
description: A retrospective examination of the Clinton presidency and its impact provides a valuable insight into the administration's major personal, political, and policy choices, emphasizing Bill Clinton' leadership style, his achievements and inadequacies, as well as the long-term effects of her presidency. Reprint. 40,000 first printing.

title: The Truth About The Drug Companies
description: The New England Journal of Medicine's ex-editor presents a blistering critique of the pharmaceutical industry, detailing its perilous impact on medical research, education, and physicians; uncovering the reasons behind the increasing cost of prescription drugs; and proposing sweeping reforms.

title: Flap Your Wings
description: After accidentally laying an alligator egg in the nest, two birds attempt to teach their "son" how to fly.

title: The Phantom Tollbooth
description: Milo finds nothing exciting in his daily routine. He drives to the tollbooth unexpectedly, but on the other side, he encounters something truly fascinating: it takes him beyond just jumping to learn about time with a tick watchdog named Tock and then embarking on rescuing Rhyme and Reason!

title: Jurassic Park Institute Dinosaur Field Guide
description: Delves into the subject of studying dinosaurs and its potential lessons, revealing details about their age, vegetation, dinosaur species, non-dinosaur fauna, and Earth's appearance during their time.

title: The School Skeleton
description: The disappearance of Mr. Bones, the skeleton in the nurse's office at Green Lawn Elementary, leads to an ongoing mystery that involves the entire school community.

title: Love  Stargirl
description: After being dumped by her Arizona boyfriend Leo, Stargirl, a home-schooled free spirit, writes the world's longest letter to him, detailing her new life in Pennsylvania.

title: Terrier
description: Using her police training, natural talents, and magic skills, Beka becomes "Puppy" to a team of "Dogs" who are assigned to investigate the murder of ten-year-old Isabelle Moynihan in Tortall's Lower City.

title: Big Dog ... Little Dog
description: The two dogs are the best of friends, despite their opposite personalities.

title: Junie B.  First Grader
description: First-grader Junie B. copies a classmate's paper after her father refuses to let her stay up late to finish their homework.

title: Ancient Greece and the Olympics
description: A Magic Tree House Research Guide is packed with captivating facts that transport readers back to the ancient Greek world, where gods and goddesses were pre-dating them and where the Olympics began.

title: Moose Master
description: In the north woods of Canada, will Adam Sharp be able to disguise himself as a Mountie and save his own life?

title: Code Word Kangaroo
description: Adam Sharp, the spy who has access to gadgets, girls, and bad guys, is unable to find anything on television.

title: The Easter Rabbit's Parade
description: A surprise Easter surprise awaits Ann Eliza, the little girl who looks after the farmyard animals. Little Brown Hen prepares eggs for her, chicks and goslings gather flowers, and White Rabbit paints an egg. The children then join in the parade and give her a basket on Easter morning! Happy Easter!

title: The People of Sparks
description: Lina and the others escape to the Unknown Regions, where they seek help from the village inhabitants of Sparks.

title: Young Warriors
description: Reprint: Fifteen original short stories by a number of authors follow teenage warriors who defeat their enemies with cunning and skill as they strive to fulfill their destiny.

title: Ancient Rome and Pompeii
description: Describes the former city of Pompeii and the lifestyle in ancient Rome.

title: Tsunamis and Other Natural Disasters
description: This book is intended for children and provides a comprehensive overview of natural disasters.

title: Nick and Norah's Infinite Playlist
description: High school student Nick O'Leary, who is part of a rock band, asks Norah Silverberg to be his girlfriend while he meets him in college for five minutes.

title: Toys Go Out
description: The adventures of three best friends, who are all toys, are chronicled in six stories.

title: The Realm of Possibility
description: Free verse stories are written by students from the same high school who share their experiences, ideas, and relationships in a series of interconnected tales.

title: Mayflower Treasure Hunt
description: Dink, Josh, and Ruth Rose arrive in Plymouth, Massachusetts for Thanksgiving and uncover a mystery that has pertained to the Pilgrims' arrival.

title: Are We There Yet?
description: Two brothers, one in high school and the other in college, are forced by their parents to travel to Italy and now reflect on their own lives and how far they have come.

title: Naomi and Ely's No Kiss List
description: Naomi and Ely, who have known each other for years, face a difficult relationship during their first year at New York University when she starts dating Bruce.

title: The Amber Spyglass
description: Lyra and Will are at odds with the forces of the Authority and those gathered by Lord Asriel.

title: Ox
description: Cal, Veg, and Aquilon aim to escape from a dangerous world of killer robots and return to their own reality.

title: Laura
description: Using her unpublished memoirs, Laura's family journeyed through the Big Woods of Wisconsin and along the Dakotas to settle in their small home. Their story was beloved by millions of TV viewers and Little House book readers as it featured perseverance, devotion, and courage during difficult times.

title: Boy Who Turned Into a TV Set
description: Despite his mother's warning that he could become a serial TV addict, Ogden Pettibone refuses to believe her until l.p. lights out on his stomach.

title: Stephen Hawking's Universe
description: Discusses the theoretical contributions of Stephen Hawking, the celebrated British physicist who has made significant strides in cosmology.

title: The Grass Crown
description: The Romans' military, including Gaius Marius and Lucius Cornelius Sulla, were impacted by the Republican Republic's struggles in a world of treachery and bloodshed.

title: Caesar's Women
description: The fourth book in a series of Masters of Rome is dedicated to the lives of women during the reign of the Roman emperor Gaius Julius Caesar.

title: Tim
description: A middle-aged, intelligent spinster falls in love with a young laborer who is simple and pure.

title: Neither Here Nor There:
description: During the early seventies, Bill Bryson traveled across Europe in search of spirituality, beer, and women. He chose to embark on a journey again 20 years later, starting with the film Neither Here nor There, which takes him from the cold waters of Scandinavia to Istanbul's chaotic tumultuous path, with stops in some of Europe' most diverse and historic locales.

title: Made in America
description: Bill Bryson, who lent his voice to The Mother Tongue, now praises her magnificent offspring in the book that unveils how a deserted western village became Hollywood and why Mr. Yankee Doodle named his befeathered cap "Macaroni."

title: The Mother Tongue
description: Bill Bryson, the author of The Lost Continent, brilliantly portrays the English language's remarkable history, eccentricities, resilience, and humor through his humorous yet captivating tales.

title: Lucie Babbidge's House
description: In the orphanage, Lucie leads an unhappy life after discovering a dollhouse filled with dolls.

title: Wrinkles in Time
description: For twenty years, George Smoot, an astrophysicist and adventurer, pursued the "holy grail of science" by exploring from Brazil's rain forests to Antarctica. He faced challenges such as time travel, the elements, ignorance, and bureaucratic insanity before making a groundbreaking discovery on April 23, 1992.

title: Shadow of a Dark Queen
description: A terrifying darkness is falling on a vast land in Midkemia, which has been shrouded by twisted and malevolent creatures. Meanwhile, Destiny's two young companions must fight for their right to defend their world from the intimidating reptile army of Westeros.

title: The Death of an Irish Sea Wolf
description: Clement Ford, the "Sea Wolf," is a reclusive resident of secluded bays on the west coast of Ireland where gossip-happy locals are quick to question his generosity. However, after he was unexpectedly brought back to the island by an unknown person, three people were killed and Ford vanished by morning. In the aftermath, Chief Superintendent Peter McGarr and his intuitive wife Noreen must solve the mystery surrounding the deadly night's events and answer questions about who was responsible for the fatal incident.

title: Notes from a Small Island
description: "I suddenly realized what I loved about Britain- which is to say, everything in it." After spending almost 20 years on British soil, Bill Bryson, the author of The Mother Tongue and Made in America, made the decision to return to the United States.

title: Prayers for Rain
description: A former client of Patrick Kenzie, a private investigator, jumps from the twenty-sixth floor to investigate the psychopath who killed herself.

title: Devil May Care
description: Despite being young, wealthy, engaged and in love, Ellie is currently experiencing days where she enjoys unwinding and spending time with her family at Aunt Kate's luxurious estate in Burton, Virginia. Although she finds comfort in the presence of invisible housekeepers and numerous pets, she soon realizes that there are hidden secrets about the local aristocracy that have caught her attention unexpectedly.

title: Street of the Five Moons
description: The discovery of a fake "Charlemagne talisman" in the suit pocket of an murdered man has caused medieval historian Vicky Bliss to be cause for concern.

title: Summer of the Dragon
description: The prospect of a high salary and an all-expenses summer spent at her Arizona ranch is too appealing for D.J. Abbott, the fledgling anthropologist, to refuse. However, she was already in possession of some credentials as he now supports various non-traditional projects from alien conspiracy theories to the search for dragon bones.

title: Wayside School Is Falling Down (rack)
description: The extraordinary thirty-story school and its eccentric inhabitants are back in the long-awaited sequel of SIDEWAYS STORIES FROM WAYSSIDE SCHOOL, one of the most popular Camelot books ever. "Rib-tickling...sure-to-please..."

title: Shutter Island
description: While searching for a mentally ill man who has escaped, Chuck Aule and U.S. Marshal Teddy Daniels arrive at Ashecliffe Hospital on Shutter Island, where they encounter true evil as AshercliffE's covert patient care renders them almost insane.

title: The Deeds of the Disturber
description: A haunted mummy case, supernatural curses and a lunatic killer get the attention of Amelia Peabody, her husband Emerson, and their precocious son Ramses at the British Museum.

title: Killing Time
description: The murder of a male erotic dancer who sought his assistance is the subject of Slider's investigation into her life, which involves working in disreputable nightclubs, sexual activity, and clandestine cabinet ministers.
