He also links the incident to that of an influential policeman. PW. K. NYT.

title: Anne Frank
description: A diary was kept by Anne Frank, a young girl, between July 1942 and August 1944. Although it is common for other girls to keep such journals, hers was unlike any other. She described how she and her family were hiding from the Germans who sought to eliminate all Jews in Europe for two years. In this moving and thoughtful introduction to the Holocaust, Johanna Hurwitz captures the unforgettable spirit and tragedy of the war while drawing on historical context.

title: Silver Nights
description: Despite being an arrogant young woman, Sophia is a fearless matriarch who has the power to change people's hearts. She accepts her fate in an unfaithful marriage that could potentially increase her fortunes. However, Adam falls for her with his own skin and becomes irresistible, leaving him feeling startled by it.

title: Xanth 15: The Color of Her Panties
description: Gwenny Goblin, Che Centaur, and Jenny Elf are the only creatures on Xanth who have not been exposed to Mela Merwoman's undergarment. They must first master space and thyme and find their hiding place before trying to defeat her half-brother Gobble.

title: Firefly
description: In a remote estate of Florida's savannah country, the inhabitants are lured into harrowing encounters with an aggressive predator that inflicts pain and manipulates their sexual desires, leading to gruesome acts.

title: Only Mine
description: Whether crafting unforgettable love stories of redemption or breathtaking romantic suspense, Elizabeth Lowell is unmatched in her writing.

title: Neon Lit:city of Glass
description: Based on Maus creator Paul Auster's novel City of Glass, the story follows a New York detective-turned-novelist who is caught up in revealing her identity.

title: To Love a Dark Lord
description: Emma Langolet attempts to persuade James Killoran, the naive mole incompetent, to surrender his self-loving nature and reveal the gentle man inside.

title: Runaway Bride
description: Using her skills in martial arts and disguise, Melanie Wyatt smuggles stolen items to procure freedom for Chinese children in captivity, but Alex McClure, the agent appointed to investigate, discovers her operation and her vulnerable heart. Original.

title: The Night Remembers
description: After escaping her painful past, Angela Prescott finds solace in the arms of Jesse Brown Wolf, a Native American healer whose existence is shrouded in mystery and even appears incantating.

title: Smoke and Mirrors
description: In Neil Gaiman's first book, his imaginative writing showcases the potential for anything and everything in the realm of magic.

title: Shards of a Broken Crown
description: Once the demon is gone, the foe has been defeated. But now that Winter's cold grasp is slipping on the world and its army vanquished by her tormentors back to the Bitter Sea, treachery being the only recourse. A lackey has declared himself Lord of the defeated in order to launch one last attack on a weakened realm, gathering together the remnants of ruthless fighting forces from the ancient warring factions.

title: Sins of a Shaker Summer
description: Two young girls have passed out unexpectedly, and Rose Callahan suspects they may have consumed something from the Medicinal Herb Garden. She becomes suspicious of Andrew, who is expanding the small business and trying new herbs. However, as she investigates, an unexplained death occurs and some dark secrets are revealed, potentially making Rose the next victim.

title: Regarding the Fountain
description: Principal Walter Russ has a quick turnaround in the project as it begins to leak, prompting him to request restitution from Flowing Waters Fountains, Inc. and receive congratulatory emails filled with requests for new drinking fountains.

title: What Looks Like Crazy On an Ordinary Day
description: Pearl Cleage's debut novel is a stunning display of suspense, with its richness, human drama, and profound understanding that draws readers along the way.

title: Exile's Return
description: A mage's intervention has saved Kaspar, the wicked Duke of Olasko, from certain death, resulting in his downfall as an exile and his return to harsh territory. He is now forced to roam through the vast and merciless deserts that are once the fortress of his empire. His past was marked by fear-mongering, but his desire for revenge is increasingly imbued with daily battles.

title: The Great Book of Amber
description: Roger Zelazny's Chronicles of Amber are considered the most exceptional works of imaginative literature. Now, all ten novels have been combined into one magnificent omnibus volume, showcasing the fierce competition for dominance on Earth, in the Courts to Chaos, and in a magical realm filled with mystery, adventure, or love.

title: The Wolves in the Walls
description: The sounds of sneaking, creeping and crumpling are audible to Lucy. She suspects wolves may be living among the walls in her house.

title: Lamb
description: There is little knowledge about the life of Jesus, his birth or how he taught and performed miracles after his thirtyth birthday, except for Biff, who has been brought back to life in a divinely inspired work that is like Vonnegut and Douglas Adams (Philadelphia Inquirer). The story is truly miraculous, filled with remarkable adventures, journeys, and heroic acts.

title: The Body in the Lighthouse
description: In the heat of August on Penobscot Bay in Aleford, Massachusetts, Faith Fairchild and her family opted to head for their cottage at Sanpere Island. However, things have changed since they last visited due to aggressive developer plans that will destroy the island's unique atmosphere, leaving residents feeling bewildered.

title: The Nightingale's Song
description: Despite Maggie Quinn's belief that she can only care for the helpless orphans in her life, Gordon Kincaid enters St. Columba' where he meets his lost daughter and brings her back to Virginia.

title: In the Beginning...was the Command Line
description: "The Word" is a concise and well-reasoned statement on the state and challenges of our computerized world. Neal Stephenson, known as Hemingway, is an exceptional figure in this field.

title: Olympos
description: The powerful armies of Greece and Troy fought with great courage and power, without the approval of the gods. However, before Thomas Hockenberry, a scholar from the 20th century, provoked Achilles to team up with his arch-nemesis Hector, they had already turned their deadly attacks against Zeus in rapture.

title: The Marriage Lesson
description: Lesson #1: Never Tempt a Lady Become - Don't Make A Deal! Lady Marianne Shelton has traveled to London for opulence, and while she never contemplates marriage, she writes anonymous stories that will become her talk. Only she realizes that her maleficent husband is based on Thomas Effington, the future Duke of Roxborough.

title: First Comes Love
description: Kitty Wilder is determined to redeem her family's reputation for past misdeeds by holding handsome FBI agent Dylan Matthews accountable for their accidental marriage.

title: Red Message
description: The CIA concludes that the disappearance of math genius Teddy Wu is an obvious defection to Red China, but his lover, Beth Hunter, investigates and uncovers an international political conspiracy of terrifying proportions.

title: Love Poems and Sonnets of William Shakespeare
description: A selection of Shakespeare's love poems and sonnets are presented in color.

title: Your Child's Self-esteem
description: Examines the impact of parental attitudes on the child's self-conception and provides advice on developing positive relationships.

title: Complete Stories and Poems of Edgar Allan Poe
description: A comprehensive compilation of all the poems, fantasies, satires, and mysteries written by Poe.

title: A Man of the People
description: A young thinker becomes entangled in the struggle of Nigerian revolutionaries.

title: Saint Thomas of Aquinas
description: The celebrated British author of Orthodoxy presents a captivating portrayal of Saint Thomas Aquinas, which delves into significant aspects of his theological writings. Reprint.

title: The Birth of Tragedy and The Genealogy of Morals
description: Highly proficient translations of Nietzsche's significant works on the tension between moral and aesthetic perspectives, the impact of Christianity on human values, science definitions, differences between Apollonian and Dionysian spirits, and other key themes are included.

title: Plagues and peoples
description: A prominent historian examines the crucial role that infectious diseases played in shaping global societies.

title: Night Shift
description: More than twenty-five horror and nightmarish fantasy stories use everyday circumstances to create terrifying experiences in the realms of the living, the dying, and the nonliving.

title: The Complete Fairy Tales and Stories
description: Presents 156 narratives with the author's explanations of their background.

title: The King's buccaneer
description: After nine years since the last riftwar, as depicted in Prince of the Blood, the Kingdom of The Isles is once again under attack from dark forces, with one prince having to face them all.

title: Trials of Tears
description: Describes the numerous breached treaties between the Cherokees and the U.S., how they were forced to withdraw from their territories in Tennessee, Georgia, and North Carolina, as well as the hardships that they faced on the westward side of the country.

title: Lost in the Funhouse
description: In chronological order, fourteen brief literary experiments are set in both modern society and classical Greece.

title: The Beginning and the End
description: Kamel Effendi's middle-class family is left in poverty after his sudden death.

title: Children of the Alley
description: The story of an Egyptian family exemplifies the spiritual journey of mankind as a feudal leader disowns their son for his wickedness and puts another son to the test.

title: The Book of Ruth
description: The runaway father, sassy mother, and crazy husband are all important figures to Ruth, who lives in a rural Illinois area.

title: Dragonfly in Amber
description: Now, twenty years later, Doctor Claire Randall returns to Scotland with her daughter in search of the stone which sent her on her magical journey many years ago.

title: Rain of Gold
description: Victor Villasenor's Rain of Gold narrates the tale of two families and their respective countries, portraying the timeless love between an unyielding bootlegger named Jacob and the beautiful Lupe, as well as his mother who is surrounded by people from both sides who share real and imaginary experiences and have faith in one family to survive.

title: The Last Lion
description: Discusses the early life and political career of the British prime minister.

title: Shakespeare A to Z
description: Brer Rabbit is always undeserving of knowledge and enjoys playing games, tricks, and traps for his friends, only to be defeated by them at the last moment. This collection contains numerous versions of Breer Rabbin tales from Enid Blyton's popular and successful books like Breck Rabbiter, Brewster and Brear Rabbitler.

title: The Sixteen Pleasures
description: An attractive twenty-nine-year-old book conservator from America finds an old book of erotica in an Italian convent, which exposes her to the sensual and sometimes risky life of Florence. Reprint.

title: A Day in the Life
description: Employs the archives of Abbey Road Studios in London to trace the development and influence of the Beatles, providing a glimpse into their creative process and the influences that contributed to them.

title: Running from Safety
description: After fifty years of promising to return and teach himself, Richard is confronted by Dickie Bach, a nine-year-old boy who reminds him of his promise.

title: Follow Your Heart
description: In America, Olga, an elderly Italian woman, writes a series of heartfelt letters to her teenage granddaughter, emphasizing the distressing lessons she has learned in her own life and that of her daughter.

title: There's No Such Place as Far Away
description: Drawing on Bach's usual soaring fantasy, this meditation expresses the thoughts and beliefs that inform his daily life.

title: Brian's Winter
description: This story depicts what Brian would have encountered in the wilderness with only his survival kit and hatchet, rather than being saved from a plane crash as in Hatchet.

title: The Outlandish Companion
description: The creator of Outlander provides readers with a detailed account of her tales of time travel, adventure, and eternal love, along with information on all the characters, their genealogy, Gaelic vocabulary, descriptions, photos, etc.

title: Laura Ingalls Wilder's Fairy Poems
authors: Laura Ingalls Wilder;Stephen W. Hines;Richard Hull
description: The author of the Little House series, who wrote fairy poems in 1915, has gathered a treasure trove that includes rich illustrations and an excerpt from his essay, "Fairies Still Appear to Those with Seeing Eyes," for the first time.

title: Black and Blue
description: Fran Benedetto's new life and identity are the focus of her third novel, which follows the breakdown of a loving marriage that transforms into gruesome violence.

title: God Bless You  Mr. Rosewater
description: A lawyer aims to take control of a significant amount of money by having the current claimant declared insane.

title: Welcome to the Monkey House
description: Vonnegut's versatility and vision are exemplified in his works, which include tender stories of love, passionate essays on human greed and misery, and imaginative tales of futuristic happenings.

title: Bluebeard
description: The autobiography of Rabo Karabekian, an abstract expressionist artist, who acquired the most extensive collection of abstract expressionism paintings in a private setting.

title: King Rat
description: The timeless classic depicts a tragic conflict between nefarious black marketiers and Japanese POW camp captives, with new material and dramatic detail not seen in the original manuscript.

title: Player Piano
description: The story of engineer Paul Proteus, a man struggling to survive in 'the world' controlled by machinations, is told as the first novel written by Kurt Vonnegut and is full-fledged comedy, deadly seriousness, and terrifyingly realistic.

title: Wampeters  Foma & Granfalloons (opinions)
description: Kurt Vonnegut's memoirs, "Wampeters, Foma & Granfalloons" (Opinions) offer a unique perspective on his personal life, worldview, writing, and the work of others. The book is an indescribable collection of literary works that are both outrageous and deeply touching.

title: Galapagos: A Novel
description: Ghost of decapitated shipbuilder wryly showing off the decline of human race, including: a biology teacher, bomb-radiated wife of 'Japanese computer genius and blond woman' and gold digger, motley band whose fate is determined by infertility and local tribe of cannibals. Reissue.

title: Jailbird
description: Vonnegut, a celebrated author of contemporary American literature, has written 18 highly acclaimed books and numerous short stories and essays. This dark tale follows Walter F. Starbuck from Harvard to the Nixon White House to his final days at the penitentiary as Watergate's undisclosed collaborator.

title: Deadeye Dick
description: An innocent youngster is slain on the head by an unidentified gunman, his father, while playing with one of his many rifles.

title: Slapstick
description: While flying to the funeral of his favorite uncle, Kurt Vonnegut, a middle-aged man, recalls how one-hundred-year-old Wilbur Oriole-11 Swain, who was renowned for writing the most popular child-rearing book and selling the original Louisian family's estate, fantasizes about his role in creating history.

title: Palm Sunday
description: The famous author's autobiographical collection comprises of unpublished articles, essays, letters, sketches, songs, and talks that offer insight into his life and experiences.

title: The Naked Ape
description: Observes sexual behavior, child development, facial expressions, feeding behaviors, and animal research in order to form relationships with the animal realm.

title: Aches & Pains
description: Presents a comical depiction of medical attention, hospitalization, and recovery.

title: The Midwife's Tale
description: Elizabeth and her mother, who work as midwives in a rural area of prewar Appalachia, are intimately connected to the lives, affections, and wounds of every family in the region, but their neighbors are unenlightened about their personal secrets, hopes, fantasies, or desires--including the mystery of Elizabeth's father figure and how desperately she yearns for her own child. A first novel. Reprint.

title: Kissing in Manhattan
description: In this reissue, the Preemption, an unexplained apartment complex with a gifted doorman named Sender, showcases the lives of three individuals--James Branch, Patrick Rigg, and Rally McWilliams- in their intertwineted tales. The first printing is limited to 45,000 copies.

title: Voyager
description: Claire Randall, a time-traveller, returns to her previous self while pregnant and fatigued, but her memories of her Scottish partner Jamie Fraser from the 18th century will not fade, leading her to revert to him in earnest.

title: Intuition
description: Three researchers become entangled in the desperate pursuit of a financial aid from the Philpott, renowned research laboratory in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

title: The Cloud Atlas
description: In World War II, Louis Belk, a young American bomb disposal sergeant, is dispatched to Anchorage, Alaska, to defuse balloon bombs launched by the Japanese against North America. His quest leads him to encounter haunting figures and sets him on 'a journey of discovery' about faith, friendship, trust, and love. A first novel. Reprint. 25,000 first printing.

title: Coming of Age in Mississippi
description: Anne Moody's first-person account of her upbringing as a black person in the rural South during the nineteen forties and fifties is fascinating.

title: A Painted House
description: A boy of seven years old is brought up in a Southern cotton-farming community during the 1950s to witness racial tension, gang marriage, and sexual assault.

title: Lucifer's Shadow
description: Disillusioned by the dark side of Venice, an English cataloguer named Daniel Forster stumbles upon a lost musical masterpiece in 'a library of dusty old manuscripts' and is plunged into ruthless mode of deception over three centuries, from the days of Vivaldi and Rousseau to the present day. Reprint. 20,000 first printing.

title: The Client
description: Mark Sway, who is eleven years old, stumbles upon murder and is victimized by ruthless prosecutors and the mob, with only Reggie Love, an attorney who had just completed law school, remaining capable of saving him. Reprint. 35,000 first printing.

title: The Street Lawyer
description: Following a violent encounter with smoldering man, Michael the skilled corporate lawyer finds himself in the middle of nowhere, fortunate to be alive and holding hacked up 'the top secret' file from one of his former employers, leading law firm that is hiding thriller. Reprint. 35,000 first printing.

title: The Summons
description: The retired, reclusive Atlee sends a letter to his son, brother, Forrest, instructing them to discuss his estate in Clanton, Mississippi. However, the judge passes away before their sons arrive, and Ray is unaware of their relationship with him.

title: The Rainmaker
description: The prospect of facing a crucial legal case that could potentially end his life or make him the biggest rainmaker in the country is making Rudy Baylor, an upstart Memphis lawyer, feel threatened and unprepared to face it.

title: The King of Torts
description: The latest case, centered on a routine street killing, uncovers evidence of terrorism and conspiracy theories. Clay Carter, the public defender, is surprised by the discovery of this lawsuit and its potential settlement in his latest book that has been printed for only 35,000 copies.

title: The Chamber
description: The accused killer, Sam Cayhill, has almost run out of options for his death row appeals after the Mississippi law office was bombed in which Marvin Kramer's two sons were killed.

title: The Brethren
description: The brethren, three former judges who reside in a maximum security federal prison, attend daily meetings to conduct arbitrary justice within their new community and earn some money. However, when one of their schemes fails, they must confront the world that they have created themselves. Reprint. 35,000 first printing.

title: The Runaway Jury
description: Juror #2: The explosivest trial of the century against a giant tobacco company. (First printing, 35,000 copies) First printing: A mysterious man with clumsy past and hidden agenda teams up with an attractive woman on the outside to get the verdict he wants.

title: The Pelican Brief
description: A law student named Darby Shaw constructs a case against 'a very strong suspect who threatens to run underground' when the most liberal and conservative justices of the Supreme Court are shot down.

title: A Breath of Snow and Ashes
description: The governor asks Jamie Fraser in 1772 to help protect the colonies for King and Crown, but he is now aware of the final outcome of an American Revolution due to his wife's travels in the twentieth century.

title: The Golden Tulip
description: Despite her desire to become a painter, Francesca Visser's dream comes true as she is forced to wed Ludolf Van Deventer.

title: The Art of Alfred Hitchcock
description: A completely revised and updated version of the classic text provides a comprehensive overview of all Alfred Hitchcock films, including their descriptions and analysis.

title: The Power of Myth
description: The celebrated mythologist explores the connection between ancient legends and contemporary reality, encompassing recent figures, romantic relationships, mythological significance, and cultural themes.

title: The Art of the Personal Essay
description: From ancient Greece to the present day, writers from all over the world compose essays such as Seneca, Thoreau, Dillard, Vidal, and Orwell.

title: On the Origins of War and the Preservation of Peace
description: Examine historical data to ascertain the reasons behind conflicts, whether there are valid laws that justify nations' opposition to each other, and whether peaceful solutions exist.

title: Texas! Trilogy
description: The Tyler Drilling enterprise and the three strong brothers named Tyler, who are adamant about their actions, are chronicled in one book, detailing their love stories.

title: History of Philosophy
description: Examines crucial aspects of Western philosophy from its classical roots to the present day.

title: Obasan
description: 'A poignant portrayal of an insult to democratic values... A breathtakingly moving book with a profoundly melancholic tone' - New York Times.

title: Like Water for Chocolate
description: Even though she has fallen in love with a young man, Tita, the youngest of three daughters born to ruthless ranchers, must follow tradition by remaining single and at home to care for her mother. Reprint. Movie tie-in.

title: Youth in Revolt
description: Teens in their thirties, including Nick Twisp, who is dark and precocious, encounter difficulties such as high school, divorce, paranoia (no friends, no family), being a vaginated teenager, homelessness, and the constant demands of teenage girls.

title: Marie Antoinette
description: The Six Wives of Henry VIII, a well-known book, recounts the story of her marriage to an impoverished young woman, who later became King Louis XVI, and her battle with the revolutionaries that resulted in her being sent to the guillotine after marrying him. The first edition of this readable guide is available for purchase at 75,000.

title: Sister of My Heart
description: The sisterhood of two girls, one of whom is the daughter of a higher-caste family and the other who is black, becomes an uneasy bond when one girl learns about  dark family secrets.

title: What are the 7 Wonders of the World?
description: Explains the items on these lists, such as "Who are the three destinies?" and "What are his last seven words?"

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: The story of Offred, a Handmaid in the Republic of Gilead, which is set in an oppressive world where women are only considered worthy of reproduction and cannot read, is being revisited.

title: The Robber Bride
description: A story featuring three women residing in Toronto delves into the paradox of women's dual roles as humans and villains.

title: Surfacing
description: A female man in the hunt for her absent father joins her lover and another couple on a remote island in northern Quebec, where they face violence and death.

title: Lady Oracle
description: A sardonic novel that explores the disinterested wife of an anti-nuclear activist on a thrilling trip from Canada to Italy, featuring literary fame, ruthless news reporters, menacing plots, intense sexual fantasies, and the idea of eternal death. Reissue.

title: The Girl in the Flammable Skirt
description: This spooky anthology features comical characters whose sexual desires draw them into the absurdity of their lives.

title: An Invisible Sign of My Own
description: The debut novel features Mona Gray, a young second grade teacher who orders her universe with orderly numbers, but also encounters an unusual math teacher.

title: Fermat's Enigma
description: The story of Fermat's Last Theorem, authored by Pierre de Ferat in the 17th century, chronicles the challenges faced by 3500 scientists to prove its existence.

title: Into Thin Air
description: The writer recounts his trip to Mt. Everest during spring 1996, a catastrophic expedition that resulted in the deaths of eight climbers, and explains how he managed to survive the trek.

title: The Mating Mind
description: The connection between evolution and human sexuality is explored in a groundbreaking study, which suggests that the development of the human brain can be linked to the desire for sexual partners.

title: The Hot Zone
description: Elucidates the occurrence of a lethal virus strain in Virginia laboratory in 1989, and describes the actions taken by an army biohazard SWAT team to detect and contain the virus.

title: The Code Book
description: Examines the impact of codes on the world, from the World Wars to the passing of Mary, Queen of Scots, and also delves into the future of cryptography.

title: Sailing the Wine-Dark Sea
description: Describes the remarkable legacy of the ancient Greeks, from the origins of Greek culture to the formation of Western literature, drama, poetry, and philosophy, including the Greek influence on human science, mathematics,and logic.

title: Traveling Mercies
description: Through the lens of her spiritual studies and personal reflection, the author shares her journey of faith and explores how it influences one's daily existence.

title: Thumbsucker
description: Despite his serious oral fixation, a boy attempts to break the cycle of sex, substance abuse, fly fishing, work, and religion, but nothing seems to succeed.

title: Waterfront
description: Advails through guided walks along the shoreline of Manhattan to gain knowledge about the Brooklyn Bridge and other public places and historical sites, including myths, legends (including Pandora's home), economic systems, ecology, and politics.

title: D. B.
description: American folk hero D. B. Cooper's fictional account of a hijacking of an airplane features him as he parachutes through the counterculture of the early 1970s before disappearing from the aircraft and being investigated by retired FBI agent Frank Marshall.

title: Moral Disorder
description: A new collection of short fiction features ten stories that depict significant moments in the journey of life and the lives linked to it, covering a wide range of locations such as "The Bad News," "It's All Right,"" The Art of Cooking and Serving," My Last Duchess", "My Boys at the Lab," and even the title tale. The first printing was limited to 75,000 copies.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: The Great American Read by PBS's The Amazing American read, is among the most-loved novels in America.

title: The Diary of Anne Frank
description: The diary of the Jewish girl who was only 15 years old and died in the Nazi death camps.

title: House of Leaves
description: The Navidson Report is a story of Will Navindson and his family moving into rented apartments, where the notebook was found by Zampano.

title: Walk about
description: Bryson's book, Down Under, is a collection of biographies that include his unforgettable journey across Australia and his memoir, A Walk in the Woods, which tells the story of his trip on The Appalachian Trail, the world' best-known continuous footpath, with his former friend Stephen Katz. The trail travels along the East Coast of the United States, passing through breathtaking and iconic landscapes like the Smoky Mountains, Shenandoah National Park,the Berkshire Hills of Massachusetts, and the Great North Woodes of New Zealand, both from

title: The French Kitchen
description: Joanne Harris's culinary trilogy, Chocolat, Blackberry Wine, and Five-Quarters of the Orange, is renowned for its delicious recipes inspired by her cookbook.

title: Where's My Cow?
description: Sam Vimes attempts to vary the bedtime narrative he typically presents to his child.

title: A Map of the World
description: In a Midwestern farm town, the Goodwin family experiences devastating consequences when squaddily one of their own children drowns in their household caretaker's pond.

title: Willful Creatures
description: A compilation of all original tales narrates love, heartbreak, sex, hardship, and potato babies.

title: The Complete Fiction of Nella Larsen
description: A concise account of Larsen's background and contributions to three stories and two novels, both written during the Harlem Renaissance.

title: Good Faith
description: Real estate salesman Joe Stratford, who had to overcome an unpleasant divorce in the early 1980s and find himself at odds with his friend Marcus in a quick-fix scheme for wealth. He is curious about the advances of 'freedom' and is questioning whether she would be interested in being married. The Pulitzer Prize-winning author wrote A Thousand Acres. Reader's Guide was published again with 100,000 copies printed in its first printing.

title: Oryx and Crake
description: The novel depicts a world that has been devastated by ecological and scientific catastrophes, set in the future.

title: The Age of Grief
description: The Age of Grief, a stunning novella and tales, explore the difficulties of love, friendship, and marriage with the empathy and understanding that are only found in works such as "The Pleasure of Her Company," which features naive, single women who befriend married couples.

title: Man Walks Into a Room
description: A brain tumor has been discovered in Samson Greene, a Columbia University English professor, while wandering in the desert outside Las Vegas. The surgery results in his removal, leaving him with no recollection of his life after the age of twelve. A first novel. Reprint. 12,500 first printing.

title: In the Beginning
description: During the writing of The Journey, she delves into the origins and history of the world's most well-known translation of Bible; the political, religious, and technological influences that led to its creation; and reviews the impact of King James Bible on literature and religious belief. (Reprint with first 25,000 copies).

title: Ella Minnow Pea
description: Describes the situation where islanders must use all their abilities to converse in a more restricted language due to the government's gradual elimination of letters from the alphabet.

title: Forever in Blue
description: Throughout their journey, Lena, Tibby, Carmen, and Bridget uncover additional details about themselves and the significance of their relationship.

title: The Second Summer of the Sisterhood
description: A pair of jeans bought from a thrift store is so comfortable for Carmen and her three friends that they decide to form 'a sisterhood' and set off on.

title: Frogs and French Kisses
description: High school freshman Rachel Weinstein asks her younger sister, a witch, for magical assistance in winning the heart of Raf Kosravi during lulls with love spells in New York City.

title: Bras & Broomsticks
description: With her mother and younger sister, Rachel, a fourteen-year-old living in New York City, she attempts to persuade Miri, who has recently become 'a witch', to make her popular at school and try to prevent their father from marrying to them.

title: Cuba 15
description: Violet Paz, a high school student from Chicago, reluctantly gets ready for her fifteenth birthday celebration, which is celebrated in Spanish and known as the "quince."

title: Messenger
description: In this novel that blends characters from "The Giver" and "Gathering Blue," Matty, a young man in an idealistic utopian community, uncovers an unexplored healing power.

title: The Giver
description: The Giver, who possesses the memories of the true joys and sorrows of life, is given special training at the age of twelve. Jonas is from a seemingly utopian, futuristic world where he was raised. An ALA Notable Book for Children & Newbery Medal Winner. Reissue.

title: Gathering Blue
description: Kira, who is small and suddenly orphaned, is mysteriously removed from her squalid village to reside in the luxurious Council House, where she is anticipated to use her abilities as a weaver to fulfill the wishes of the powerful Guardians.

title: Code Orange
description: Mitty is concerned that he has infected himself and New York City by discovering smallpox scabs in an envelope from 100 years ago while researching for a school paper on small pox.

title: King Dork
description: Tom Henderson, a former high school star, discovers that "The Catcher in the Rye" may be the key to solving his life's mysteries.

title: Anatomy of a Boyfriend
description: Dom, who is seventeen years old and attending a private school in Fort Myers, Florida, discovers that her life has been altered by her first boyfriend, Wes, an active track star at the same public school as her best friend.

title: Spells and Sleeping Bags
description: Rachel and her younger sister, who are witches, spend most of the summer at Camp Wood Lake, where Rachel tries to have a regular camp experience while secretly practicing her newly discovered skills.

title: BFF
description: Comprises of two novels that Judy Blume has previously authored.

title: Leaps of Faith
description: The Times of London presents a book that is both captivating and accessible, regardless of one's opinion.

title: Three Greek Plays
description: Edith Hamilton presents and critically discusses three classic Greek tragedies in their translation.

title: The Echo of Greece
description: Describes the life of Greeks in the 4th century, the types of men and significant events that took place.

title: What Einstein Told His Cook
description: The Washington Post's "Food 101" columnist, a chemistry professor, offers straightforward explanations of kitchen mysteries, such as food types, temperature, cooking techniques, and food myths. It was first printed in 30,000 copies.

title: The Annotated Huckleberry Finn
description: A new version of Twain's story about a boy and heiress who travel down the Misssippi are featured in reproductions of the original illustrations from the 1885 first edition, which also includes detailed notes on the text and time.

title: The Confident Child
description: Her book, which focuses on children aged five to fifteen, provides parents with strategies to help them develop self-esteem, problem-solving skills, social and emotional control, as well as identify the dangers to this confidence during adolescence.

title: The Complete Plays
description: The Power of Hypnosis, a first edition of Ivanov, and early humorous dialogues are all included in this one-volume English-language collection that includes Chekhov's plays.

title: Will in the World
description: The portrait depicts the influence of Elizabethan England on William Shakespeare's development, including his migration to London, lack of financial resources, connections, and formal education, as well as his family and attempts to establish a career in theater while dealing with religious and political pressures.

title: The Annotated Christmas Carol
description: Features the authentic writing of "A Christmas Carol" along with annotations, photographs, and information about the publication.

title: Trainspotting
description: America, be prepared for Irvine Welsh's Trainspotting, the novel and movie that catapulted him to fame and cult hits in Britain. Its author introduced his career with a true, unrelenting, and eccentric episodic collection of individuals who followed closely the footsteps of Hubert Selby, Jr.'d Last Exit to Brooklyn. Rents, Sick Boy, Swanney, Spuds-in-Seattle, Seeker, etc. are equally memorable as Hollywood films.

title: Redemption
description: Utilizes FBI records and interviews with his family and friends to paint a picture of the twentieth-century American literary icon, from his incestuous childhood on the Jewish Lower East Side to his later years in New Mexico.

title: Power  Faith  and Fantasy
description: A study of American involvement in the Middle East, spanning over two centuries, delves into the contributions of various Americans, including statesmen, merchants, soldiers, missionaries, and explorers.

title: Six Frigates
description: Describes the early history and beginnings of the American Navy, including debates among the founding fathers about the need for a permanent naval force, the choice to build six heavy frigates, his battle against Tripoli, and the war of 1812, which included clashes between the USS Constitution and HMS Guerriere that propelled the U.S. to great power. 70,000 first printing.

title: In Search of Memory
description: The search for memory is conducted by KANDEL/IN SEARCH OF MEMORY.

title: The New Annotated Sherlock Holmes
description: Gathers fifty-six of Doyle's renowned short stories, organized in the order they appeared in late 1800s and early 1900s book editions, into a set that includes four novels, biographies by editors of Holmes, Watson, and assorted literary works.

title: The Annotated Uncle Tom's Cabin
authors: Harriet Beecher Stowe;Professor Harriet Beecher Stowe
description: An interpretation of the American classic challenges criticisms cited by James Baldwin in 1955 regarding its dehumanizing qualities, explaining how it helped to raise awareness about slavery and abolitionism while also providing insight into modern race relations and other social issues.

title: Civilization and Its Discontents
description: Provides insights into the prominent Austrian psychoanalyst's stance on the unintended contradiction between instinctual impulses and the oppressive nature of society.

title: The 9/11 Commission Report
authors: National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States
description: Presents the 9/11 Commission's report concluding their investigation into the September 11 attacks.

title: Coach
description: Reflects on a crucial moment in the author's life when he was given the ball by his baseball coach, whose confidence spurred him to exceed his own expectations.

title: Will Eisner's New York
description: The Big Apple is the setting for a graphic collection that depicts the varied lifestyles and landscapes of its diverse community.

title: IWoz
description: Apple's creator of high-tech gadgets shares his personal experience of creating the first personal computer by combining computer circuitry with a typewriter keyboard to create the simple and affordable Apple I. He also provides insights into his experiences before and after Apple, as well as his thoughts on an invention that started the computer revolution (50,000 initial prints).

title: The Making of the Fittest
description: A geneticist and author of Endless Forms Most Beautiful discusses the role of DNA in the evolution of life on Earth, explaining how an analysis of this material provides a comprehensive record of the events that have shaped each species and supports the validity of theory of evolution.

title: The Richness of Life
description: Enumerates forty-four crucial sections from the departed paleontologist and evolutionary biologist, as well as unpublished works, including essays, books, and papers.

title: Anton Chekhov's Short Stories
description: The thirty-four stories in this book are a reflection of Chekhov's artistic journey.

title: Three Plays of Euripides: Alcestis  Medea  The Bacchae
description: "Paul Roche's translation of Greek dramas is widely recognized as one of the most exceptional works of modern times." —Robert W. Corrigan.

title: Red and Black
description: In this nineteenth-century French novel, the central character is a young man with lofty goals and an exceptional talent for exploiting profitable opportunities.

title: Wonderful Life: The Burgess Shale and the Nature of History
description: The Burgess Shale, a sea bed that is 530 million years old, will be examined for its significance and findings.

title: The Panda's Thumb
description: Gould delves into the theory of evolution through a series of essays that examine various conundrums, such as the Piltdown Man hoax, the slowing down of earth's rotation, and other phenomena.

title: The Book of Embraces
description: Short stories about life in South America, memories from his own past, and reflections on reading, literature, or freedom are all part of the author's writing.

title: Maurice
description: A master novelist's work takes us through the elegant Edwardian world of Cambridge undergraduate life, with Maurice Hall being introduced at the age of fourteen and entering public school and his father' s company. He is a conventional young man in almost every aspect, but it was only because his family is of the same gender.

title: Hen's Teeth and Horse's Toes
description: This collection of essays provides answers to questions about important scientific concepts, with a particular emphasis on Darwin's theory of evolution and natural selection, as well as its influence on biology, natural history (including the constitution of the universe), and modern science.

title: Eight Little Piggies
description: A science writer discusses environmental pollution and the extinction of Earth's species in the sixth issue of Natural History magazine.

title: Black Holes and Time Warps
description: Examines the underlying mechanisms that govern the universe, including black holes, wormholes, singularities, gravitational waves, and time machines.

title: Girl with Curious Hair
description: David Foster Wallace's collection of short stories is centered around the various ways in which people experience their lives.

title: The Wanting Seed
description: Tristram Foxe and his wife, Beatrice-Joanna, inhabit a skyscraper world where homosexuality is glorified by the official family. Over time, their world becomes filled with cannibalistic dining-clubs, fantastical fertility rituals (such as witchcraft), and unashamed wars. The novel is both extravagantly humorous and grimly serious.

title: Uncommon Ground: Rethinking the Human Place in Nature
description: Revisionist historians, scientists, and cultural critics examine the relationship between nature and American culture in essays. They analyze how it is presented and packaged at places like Sea World and the Nature Company stores.

title: Marabou Stork Nightmares
description: During his stay in an Edinburgh hospital's comatose state, Roy Strang encounters bizarre hallucinations that explain how he ended up in his present condition, including dealing with his anxious parents and embarking on a strange adventure in Africa.

title: The Doctor Is Sick
description: Dr. Edwin Spindrift, a linguist, departs from the hospital on the eve of his brain tumor surgery and discovers that there are other individuals in his world who do not share his language expertise.

title: Reinventing the Enemy's Language
description: Presents poetry, fiction, and other works written by Native American women.

title: The Hemingway Women
description: Describes the remarkable women who were integral to Hemingway's life, including his mother and four wives, or those who served as models for his characters.

title: Filth
description: Describes the scenario where a detective is given an opportunity to advance their career in racial crime after being wrongly murdered.

title: On Becoming a Novelist
description: An engrossing and humorous guide for those who want to pursue novels, written by a twenty-five-year veteran, offering advice from the writer's workshop to agent information. Reissued edition.

title: "What Do You Care what Other People Think?"
description: The late scientist, who won the Nobel Prize, is the focus of this two-part documentary that delves into his life and the impact of his father and first wife on his achievements, including his involvement in the "Challenger" explosion investigation.

title: Blue at the Mizzen (Vol. Book 20) (Aubrey/Maturin Novels)
description: With the Napoleonic Wars now in their eleventh year, Jack Aubrey, the frigate captain, will face abandonment, near-sunk attacks, and territorial clashes with British sailors before heading to Chile to assist the fledgling nation in freeing Spain and taking on some distinguished passengers. Reprint. 50,000 first printing.

title: Police Brutality
description: A compilation of thirteen essays from various sources that examine a major domestic issue in America, analyzes its historical and sociological context, and seeks answers.

title: Proust's Way: A Field Guide to In Search of Lost Time
description: This captivating paperback book, set in the heart of Europe, not only introduces readers to Proust, who is considered one of the most enduring 20th-century novelists, but also offers a detailed reenactment of his work, particularly "In Search of Lost Time."

title: Strangers on a Train
description: A reprint of the first novel by The Talented Mr. Ripley features Guy Haines, who loses his sense of self due to his involvement in a murder plot.

title: When Broken Glass Floats: Growing Up Under the Khmer Rouge
description: The Cambodian genocide survivor narrates her experience of growing up in rudimentary labor camps in the country, where modern technology had yet to be developed, leaving behind cars and electricity.

title: The Feminine Mystique
description: The first paperback edition of this influential social and political work on feminism is credited with raising awareness, liberating women, and initiating significant strides in the feminist movement.

title: The Bush Dyslexicon
description: "The TV coverage of the campaign, the election, and the political aftermath is a highly intelligent examination." --Newsday.

title: Next: The Future Just Happened
description: The author of Liar's Poker and The Next New Thing outlines the impact of the Internet on people'd lives, work, and thoughts, characterizing a status transformation in which individuals are key players, as well as providing op-eds about the future effects of this technological shift on human society. Reprint. 55,000 first printing.

title: The Sisters: The Saga of the Mitford Family
description: The Mitford siblings' portraits include communist Jessica, followed by Debo, the Duchess of Devonshire, best-selling novelist Nancy (the most hated woman in England), and Adolf Hitler's obsession with Unity.

title: Fanny
description: As per Anthony Burgess' "Saturday Review" article, Jong has surpassed Joyce by filling a gap in the great tradition of picaresque novels. In terms of linguistic strength, "Fanny" is incredibly strong.

title: The Future of Spacetime
authors: Stephen W. Hawking;Kip S. Thorne;Igor D. Novikov;Timothy Ferris;Alan Lightman
description: Provides essays on the topic of time travel, black holes, and gravity holes by Stephen Hawking, Kip S. Thorne, Igor Novikov, Timothy Ferris, Alan Lightman.

title: Moneyball: The Art of Winning an Unfair Game
description: How is Oakland Athletics general manager Billy Beene using a new kind of thinking to build 'a winning, successful baseball team without breaking the bank'?

title: Naked Economics: Undressing the Dismal Science
description: Desires a thoroughly engaging and comprehensive introduction to economics that deviates from technical terminology and employs simple examples. Reprint. 20,000 initial copies.

title: The Bacchae of Euripides
description: An entirely fresh take on the classic play written by a Nobel laureate.

title: The 9/11 Commission Report: Final Report of the National Commission on Terrorist Attacks Upon the United States (Authorized Edition)
authors: National Commission on Terrorist Attacks;National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States;United States. National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States;Govt. Commission Usa;Stany Zjednoczone. National Commission on Terrorist Attacks upon the United States;NORTON & CO.;Stati Uniti d' America. National commission on terrorist attacks upon the United States;USA National Commission on Terrorist Attacks Upon the United States
description: Presents the 9/11 Commission's report concluding their investigation into the September 11 attacks.

title: Korea's Place in the Sun: A Modern History (Updated)
description: The twentieth century in modern Korea is chronicled through a narrative lens, with the focus on its turbulent history, including its loss of independence in 1910, its years under Japanese rule, division during the Korean War, and its postwar recovery and economic growth.

title: Country of Origin: A Novel
description: In Tokyo's 1980 underground of sexual activity, a young U.S. Embassy official seeks the aid of an unpopular and neurotic Japanese police officer after discovering he was missing with her father in 1980. A Reprint. 13,000 first printing.

title: Fight Club: A Novel
description: Tyler Durden, a projectionist, waiter, and anarchic genius, devises nifty plans to establish clubs where young men can escape their mundane lives and demonstrate their worth in sparring. Reprint. 50,000 first printing.

title: The End of Faith: Religion  Terror  and the Future of Reason
description: The contrast between faith and logic in the contemporary world highlights humanity's readiness to challenge religious belief systems throughout history, citing the biological basis of spirituality while cautioning that fundamentalism requires acceptance with respect for the modern world'skates for violence. Reprint. 50,000 first printing.

title: The History of Love: A Novel
description: In Man Walks Into A Room, the author remembers his lost love and missing son 60 years after the book's release, while a teenage girl, named after one of the characters, searches for her namesake and finds happiness.

title: Spook: Science Tackles the Afterlife
description: Inspires upon the achievements of scientists, engineers, and mediums to explore the possibility of life after death, from a reincarnation researcher's testing of out-of-body encounters with consciousness to laboratory experiments investigating ghosts.

title: Identity and Violence: The Illusion of Destiny (Issues of Our Time)
description: In his account of how the world can move towards peace, a Nobel laureate asserts that modern conflicts are not solely caused by cultural differences but also by misunderstandings about identity and morality.

title: Another Bullshit Night in Suck City: A Memoir
description: The son of a bank robber and con artist, who is now 51 years old, recounts the complicated relationship between him and his father, whom he met while in prison but later returned to Boston as 'a caseworker'. The first edition of this book has been printed with 25,000 copies.

title: The Body Remembers: The Psychophysiology of Trauma and Trauma Treatment
description: Linkages the effects of trauma on the body to somatic memory. The book emphasizes the importance of comprehending the psychophysiology of injury for therapists and their traumatised clients. It moves from theory to practical application.

title: Living on the Razor's Edge
description: Through the use of a multifaceted, flexible approach that is based on solution-focused therapy, the author offers clear and sensible ways to deal with the challenging and disturbing issue of teenage self-harm.

title: Paradise Lost
description: The Norton Critical Edition aims to make Paradise Lost accessible to students, providing them with essential contextual and biographical information and the tools they need to critically analyze this historic epic.

title: Anton Chekhov's Selected Plays
description: By creating exceptional performances of morally challenging characters, Anton Chekhov revolutionized Russian theater.

title: Keats's Poetry and Prose
description: Keats, who is widely regarded as one of the best English poets ever, is being revisited in this Norton Critical Edition to trace his development as a public poet and examine his cultural milieu.

title: A History of Modern Europe
description: The Second Edition of A History of Modern Europe is a shorter and more comprehensive read-and-write edition, with room for recent research and detailed analysis.

title: The Norton Anthology of Western Literature: Beginnings through the Renaissance
description: Millions of students have read The Norton Anthology of Western Literature over seven editions, making it the most dependable undergraduate survey and one of the top-selling college texts ever.

title: The Norton Anthology of Short Fiction
description: For readers and those who aspire to write fiction, The Norton Anthology of Short Fiction is the go-to resource for classic or contemporary tales, serving as the classroom standard.

title: The Norton Anthology of English Literature
description: The Norton Anthology of English Literature has been revitalized in the Eighth Edition, thanks to the efforts of six new editors and experienced ones, who have taken cues from the strengths of all previous Norton anthologies by revising it as a teaching tool that can be used for any purpose.

title: Born in Blood and Fire
description: Born in Blood and Fire, the First Edition, was adopted at more than 450 colleges and universities and has become the standard survey history of Latin America.

title: The Norton Anthology of Literature by Women
description: The Norton Anthology of Literature by Women, which was once the standard teaching anthological source, has brought about a diverse range of women's writing in English for readers of all ages.

title: The Scarlet Letter
description: The narrative of Puritan life and the impact of conscience on the human heart is accompanied by critical essays.

title: The Turn of the Screw
description: The New York Edition, which had James's ultimate authority, was the only modern text to be based on this.

title: Walden ; And  Resistance to Civil Government
description: Thoreau advocates for the idea of being grounded in nature and living modestly, as depicted in the classic tale of a communion with nature at Walden Pond.

title: The Foundations of Early Modern Europe  1460-1559
description: This book summarises the Renaissance and Reformation periods of Europe thematically, tracing the transition from medieval to modern times: technological breakthroughs and their social and economic effects; the links between discovery of new lands and recovery of ancient learning; Europe's economic growth; humanist culture; formation of the early modern state; and reform and revolution in the Church.

title: Frankenstein
description: Contains works on the novel, including annotations and related writings, as well as criticism from the nineteenth and twentieth centuries.

title: The Norton Anthology of Theory and Criticism
description: The Norton anthologies now include 148 authors, including Gorgias of Leontini, Plato, Aristotle, Horace, Longinus, Quintilian, Dante, Corneille, Dryden, and Aphra Behn.

title: Sense and Sensibility
description: This nineteenth-century novel is characterized by the juxtaposition of two sisters who enter unhappiness-filled romances, despite one being cool and the other emotionally charged.

title: George Bernard Shaw's Plays
description: This DVD includes four George Bernard Shaw plays, namely "Mrs. Warren's Profession," "Pygmalion," and even "The Phantom of the Opera," with each play having an explanation and the author providing a chronology and selected bibliography.

title: Death and the King's Horseman
description: This edition of Death and the King's Horseman by Norton is exclusive to the United States, where students can read it. It centers around 1946 events in the ancient Yoruban city of Oyo, which are characterized by cultural conflict, tragic decision-making, and psychological mindsets. The play is presented with an introduction and explanatory notes for its multiple references to traditional Nigerian myth and culture.

title: The Tempest
description: Features "The Tempest" by William Shakespeare and excerpts from its sources, along with eighteen criticism works by writers such as John Dryden, Barbara Fuchs, and seventeen based on the play by authors like Percy Shelley and Ted Hughes.

title: Passing
description: African American, Modernist, and female literature all feature Nella Larsen as a central figure.

title: 1 Henry IV
description: The text of the play is based on the original First Quarto (1598) edition, with few exceptions.

title: The Scarlet Letter And Other Writings
description: Features an annotated version of "The Scarlet Letter," the seventeenth-century tale of a young wife imprisoned for adultery in New England, as well as five other shorter works by Hawthorne, along with critical analysis and citations from various sources.

title: A Tear and a Smile
description: The most significant edition of Gibran's canon comprises 56 parables, stories, and poems in his unique style, as well as 4 of his own paintings and drawings.

title: The Castle in the Forest
description: A mysterious SS man provides insight into Adolf Hitler's life and career, providing insights into his family, childhood, and teenage years, as well as the development of the character who became the embodiment of evil, in a comprehensive work that explores the essence of good versus evil within us.

title: Race of Scorpions
description: In 1462, Niccolo, a twenty-one year old widower and merchant/adventurer, and his private army are at odds with Queen Carlotta and her brother, James, in their quest to gain control of Cyprus.

title: Essentials of Classic Italian Cooking
description: Featuring over 100 illustrations by Karin Kretschman.

title: Bernard Shaw's Saint Joan  Major Barbara  Androcles and the Lion
description: Shaw's most popular plays are available in 3 volumes, all of which contain their texts.

title: Hawthorne's Short Stories
description: These are the top-rated short stories of Hawthorne. There are twenty-four of them, not just the most well-known ones, that are largely unknown to the average reader. Professor Newton Arvin of Smith College, a respected scholar and literary critic, selected this selection. His excellent introduction provides narratives on Hawes' thought process and artistic expression.

title: The Will to Power
authors: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche;Walter Arnold Kaufmann;R. J. Hollingdale
description: Provides a selection of the author's notebooks, handpicked by his sister, that sheds light on his beliefs about nihilism, art, morality, religion, the theory of knowledge, and other topics.

title: The Occult
description: Examines the parapsychological phenomena that have fascinated mankind throughout history and examines individuals who are renowned for their involvement in the occult.

title: The Dot and the Line
description: A romantic story with a mathematical theme that depicts the eternal triangle, where an unattached straight line falls in love with another dot who then reciprocates the love between them.

title: The Ravishing of Lol Stein
description: After moving back to her hometown, Lol Stein's married life is cut short when she reveals that her former partner left her for lack of a relationship.

title: Common Ground
description: This story about the busing crisis in Boston has been recognized with three awards.

title: The Civil War  a Narrative: Fort Sumter to Perryville
description: Observes the events of the war from 1862 to 1864, delves into the tactics employed by both sides in significant confrontations, and evaluates how the Union generals performed.

title: The history of sexuality
description: The French philosopher, who died in 1984, presents an examination of how the ancient Greeks viewed sexuality in their second volume, The History of Sexuality, Volume I: An Introduction. In The Uses of Pleasure, Foucault examines various texts on eroticism and why people did not consider other bodily desires like hunger and civic duty as fundamental?

title: The Wall
description: Integrates historical and fictional elements to depict the motives, impulses & actions of individuals in the Warsaw ghetto during the persecution by the Nazis.

title: The Simple Art of Murder
description: The essay on detective fiction includes eight stories, including a politician's murder, heiress' job, missing pearls, and gangsters.

title: The Long Goodbye
description: A private detective in his middle age, who is cynical and avoids alcohol, experiences both excitement and difficulty when confronted by a drunk person.

title: The High Window
description: Mrs. Murdock's family member is believed to have stolen a valuable gold coin, which is being sought by private investigator Philip Marlowe.

title: Farewell  My Lovely
description: Marlowe is about to abandon a routine case when he finds himself in the wrong place at the right time, leading to repercussions such as ringing with jewel thieves, thudding with teller machines, more murders, and greater corruption than any ordinary cemetery.

title: The Big Sleep
description: A paralyzed California millionaire, two psychotic daughters, blackmail, and murder are the subjects of Philip Marlowe's first case, who was a seamy undersider in Los Angeles during the 1930s.

title: Oscar Wilde
description: Contains an in-depth analysis of the complicated and tragic journey of Oscar Wilde's life and pays tribute to his unwavering humor and exceptional literary skills.

title: Green Eggs and Ham
description: Sam-I-Am tries to convince his friend to indulge in green eggs and ham.

title: Snow
description: Snow is a fantastic place for children to play, making it an ideal habitat for both boys and girls.

title: Happy Birthday to You!
description: Describes the birthday festivities held in Katroo by the Birthday Bird.

title: McElligot's Pool
description: The boy imagines the rare and wonderful fish he might catch in McElligot's pool.

title: Dr. Seuss's Sleep Book
description: Provide a verse description of what occurs when all ninety-nine trillion and three animals in existence go to bed.

title: Juniper
description: The prequel to "Wise Child" features a young girl who is apprenticed by the witch woman Juniper, and she must fight against her aunt Meroot's power-hungry schemes to keep her family safe.

title: The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins
description: Whenever Bartholomew Cubbins tries to comply with the King's request to remove his hat, he finds himself wearing another one on his head.

title: Baby's Animal Friends
description: Board pages display images that capture the intimate bond between small children and baby animals.

title: The Languages of Tolkien's Middle-earth
description: Describes the fourteen languages and alphabets of Middle-earth, provides translations for Elvish poetry, war slogans, and sayings (and includes an extensive dictionary) of non-English words in the Middle Earth classics.

title: Richard Brautigan's Trout Fishing in America ; The Pill Versus the Springhill Mine Disaster ; And  In Watermelon Sugar
description: The sixties counterculture in America is explored through two novels and a collection of poetry.

title: The Natural Way to Draw
description: This book provides exercises to enhance the work of both novices and experts.

title: The Turtle and the Monkey
description: Greedy Monkey endeavors to rob Turtle of her bananas.

title: Richard Brautigan's A Confederate General from Big Sur  Dreaming of Babylon  and The Hawkline Monster
description: The works of Richard Brautigan include ten novels, a contemporary classic called Trout Fishing in America, nine volumes of poetry, and he also wrote his own collection of stories. His three novels--A Confederate General from B ig Sir; Dreamsworth: I Have Chased Home; and The Hawkline Monster (also published as one-volume omnibus edition)- demonstrate his literary talent.

title: Memoirs of the Second World War
description: Examines the war and its political dynamics.

title: Sauron Defeated
description: Announces an unreleased alternative ending to the ninth volume in Middle-earth's history, and introduces Tolkien fans to "The Notions Club" and "Adunaic," which is based on his fifteenth invented language. The first printing was limited to 15,000 copies.

title: In Search of Dracula
description: Contains information about the origins and legends of vampires.

title: Morgoth's Ring: The legends of Aman
description: Documents the evolution and transformation of Tolkien's Elder Days myths and legends, as well as previously unpublished accounts that reveal his struggles to understand the nature and destiny of his characters. The first printing was released in 13,000.

title: Revenge of the Lawn
description: A one-volume omnibus edition of three Brautigan masterpieces has been released.

title: The War of the Jewels
description: Tolkien's Middle Earth story is analyzed by exploring the wars of Elves and Men against Morgoth, the "Grey Annals," and the geography of Beleriand.

title: The Old Way of Seeing
description: An architectural critic traces the evolution of great architecture, showing how architects lost their "master" in 1830 and how to recapture the fundamental elements that can improve our visual environment.

title: Sector 7
description: The boy is taken by a pleasant cloud during his school trip to the Empire State Building, and visits Sector 7 to explore how clouds are formed and transported across the nation.

title: The Riverside Shakespeare
authors: William Shakespeare;Gwynne Blakemore Evans;Irving Babbitt Professor of Comparative Literature Harry Levin;Herschel Baker;J. J. M. Tobin;Anne Barton;Heather Dubrow;William T. Liston;Frank Kermode;Harry Levin;Marie Edel;Hallet Smith;Charles H. Shattuck
description: This second edition of "A Companion to Shakespeare's Works" features two essays on recent criticism and productions, fully revised textual notes, a photographic insert of recent production(s) and two works recently attributed to the playwright by two University of Wisconsin at Madison authors: Heather DuBrow and William Liston.

title: An American Plague
description: Reveals the calamity of Philadelphia in 1793, caused by an incurable disease called yellow fever, and details significant social and political events during this period, as well as the medical beliefs and practices that were prevalent at the time.

title: The Riverside Milton
description: Students and scholars will find solace in the fact that John Milton's works have joined those of Chaucer and Shakespeare in a definitive, one-volume Riverside series. While Milton left his early poetry and important prose behind, his epics were prioritized over his own plays, including PARADISE LOST and PARPISE REGAINED, as well as his final masterpiece, SAMSON AGONISTES.

title: Demonic Males
description: Explores recent advancements in human evolution to determine if violence among men is due to their early development and seeks solutions for war, rape or murder.

title: The Gettysburg Address
description: Illustrations in a reprint of the Gettysburg Address of 1863 highlight the potency and power of President Abraham Lincoln's words.

title: Roverandom
description: By The Hobbit. Reprint: Rover, a toy dog who becomes possessed by wizards and has adventures on the moon with giant spiders, dragon moths (Peter Pan) and the Great White Dragon (The Dark Lord).

title: Conversations with God
description: Provides God's solutions to the author' s inquiries about personal life and human responses to opportunities and challenges.

title: Three Complete Novels
description: Come to Grief, Decider, and Wild Horses are three of the author's most celebrated novels that tackle various criminal activities related to horses and horse-racing.

title: Hercule Poirot's Casebook
description: The complete set of fifty stories about Hercule Poirot is now available in one volume.

title: The Last Assassin
description: The author of Killing Rain has printed 50,000 copies, in part to help the reluctant contract killer John Rain save his child's life by placing them in the path of dangerous enemies and having to resort to using the assistance of his antagonists, including the Japanese FBI and a former marine sniper.

title: White Lies
description: Clare Lancaster travels to California to work for her father's business and meets Jake Salter, a financial consultant with whom she shares an unlikely bond due to her fear of losing her relationship.

title: John's Story
description: Despite being the last of the original twelve apostles to not be martyred, John, at the age of ninety, is dedicated to spreading the word of Jesus Christ and has been called by God to write a gospel. He recounts the events of his life with Jesus and uses them to bring about positive change in people's lives.

title: Book of the Dead
description: Dr. Kay Scarpetta's move to Charleston after a strenuous case results in her starting emancipated private forensic pathology practice, but she is soon drawn into local politics and the covert agent before her skills are exposed by dozens of violent deaths that result in their careers being taken seriously. BOMC, Lit Guild, Doubleday, & Mystery Guild Main have printed 1,500,000 copies of the first book.

title: Under Orders
description: The discovery of three bodies on Cheltenham Gold Cup Day, including a jockey who won the Triumph Hurdle, leads Sid Halley to investigate the possible connection to Lord Enstone's perplexing losing streak, which exposes him to the darker side of the racing industry. 350,000 copies were printed initially.

title: The Navigator
description: The relevance of an ancient Phoenician statue stolen from the Baghdad museum is highlighted by a series of murders that concern Austin and Zavala, who are leading NUMA's historical investigation into the lost treasures of King Solomon. 650,000 copies were printed in Arabic.

title: Eric Carle's Very Little Library: The very hungry caterpillar (1st board book ed.  1994)
description: The world of Eric Carle is vibrant and full of wonder, making it a delightful experience as he sings songs, cooks, and creates with the worl-based book box.

title: Amphigorey
description: The macabre world of the American artist and author is explored in fifteen works.

title: The Out-of-sync Child Has Fun
description: KRANOWITZ/OUT OF SYNC CHLD FUN REVENUE.

title: A Clockwork Orange
description: The stage play by Anthony Burgess, based on his cult classic book and movie of the same name, depicts Alex and his teenage gang that engages in violent acts, including mugging and rape. Alex also enjoys Beethoven's music, as the language used is intricately designed due to their musical style. When murder happens, Alex is finally caught and given a life sentence after being brainwashed into good citizenship and released from prison.

title: The Truth
description: According to reports, a new stage adaptation of Pratchett's bestseller There'll Be The One is set to take place.

title: The Name of the World
description: Despite the difficulties of losing his spouse and child, Michael Reed finds himself in a difficult position where he must seek help from those who can offer unwavering support to navigate his private world.

title: Resuscitation of a Hanged Man
description: After a failed suicide attempt, Leonard English is perplexed by his situation and turns to ambiguity for guidance, ultimately accepting an unambiguous job offer at secluded Cape Cod resort full of religious fanatics and promiscuous transvestites.

title: Jesus' Son
description: A collection of linked stories narrating the story of Jesus' Son is a chilling portrayal of hope and loneliness, written by alcoholic and heroin addict Beth Lee Davis. He journeys through an American underworld filled with star athletes, hospital waiting rooms, doomed relationships, and senseless violence.

title: The birds
description: A contemporary version of The Birds by an award-winning poet was released to coincide with a major production at the National Theatre directed by Kathryn Hunter Pez and Eck.

title: The Presocratic Philosophers
description: The majority of scholars have inquired about the statements of the Presocratics and external factors, but not about their actual speech or based on sound arguments. My book's focus is on these last questions.

title: Introduction to Phenomenology
description: The book is suitable for all students who want to expand their knowledge of analytic philosophy and enhance their comprehension of European thought.

title: Eats  Shoots & Leaves
description: TRUSHER, EATS SHOOTS AND LEAVES.

title: A Routledge Literary Sourcebook on Herman Melville's Moby-Dick
description: 'Moby Dick' is considered one of the most exceptional American novels. This literary sourcebook provides a comprehensive overview of this epic work, as well as contemporary documents, critical reviews, and annotated passages that are essential for accurate reading.

title: The Road to Serfdom
description: Hayek asserts that socialist ideals cannot be achieved through unconventional methods, despite their tempting nature.

title: Tractatus Logico-philosophicus
description: Wittgenstein's sole philosophical publication during his lifetime is regarded as the most crucial work of philosophy in the 20th century.

title: The Franco-Prussian War
description: The Franco-Prussian War, which began in 1870 and was a turning point in European history, saw Bismarck send the Prussiand Army into war with France. Not only that, but Europe experienced an overwhelming victory for German military might, leading to widespread admiration and imitation, and ending era of power politics that culminated in 1914. Published in 1961 and updated with new text, it is now acknowledged as the definitive history of one of the most dramatic and decisive conflicts on European soil.

title: Phenomenology of Perception
description: Phenomenology of Perception, authored by Merleau-Ponty, is both challenging and rewarding. Its use of an abstract model of perception allows for a new perspective on the body, reflecting the philosophy of Plato.

title: New Media Language
description: Through an examination of the impact of language changes on the world's media, this book explores a diverse array of topics and highlights their significance to the overall development and understanding of society.

title: Marxism and Literary Criticism
description: Can we still consider Marx's works relevant? What role does his writing play in contemporary literature? Terry Eagleton, a leading critic of our time, offers some insights in this concise yet highly-detailed analysis. It is undoubtedly the most important work on literary analysis that has emerged from the practice of Marxist philosophy and social theory since the 1800s.

title: Mary Shelley
description: Routledge, an imprint of Taylor & Francis, published it for the first time in 1990.

title: Assemblywomen
description: Presents three comedy plays written by the ancient Athenian playwright that illustrate the diverse social, political, and cultural roles played by women in ancient Greece.

title: Chomsky on Democracy & Education
description: In this volume, Chomsky combines various writings to assert that education's purpose is to create free individuals who are not subject to accumulation or domination, but rather to engage in free association with equality.

title: Diana Wynne Jones
description: The study follows the path of the sublime mode from Burke and Kant to Wordsworth, Dickens, Eliot, and Hardy. It examines the continuities between the romantic and Victorian "periods" that are often perceived as differences within their respective historical contexts.

title: Shattered
description: While en route to live in San Francisco, Alex and Colin are followed by an insane individual who is also looking after Courtney.

title: The Psychology of Winning
description: The author of An Uncommon Freedom, Charles Paul Conn, is a significant figure in the world of motivational literature.

title: The Regatta Mystery and Other Stories
description: Famous detectives such as Hercule Poirot, Mr. Parker Pyne, and Miss Marple are the subject of nine enigmas and lethal cases.

title: The Cardinal of the Kremlin
description: De "star war"-raketten vinden alle op alles in de rust van de vergelijkt worden.

title: The Bone Yard
description: This is a collection of horror, suspense, and dark fantasy short stories that explore the themes of money, murder, evil forces, faceless killers, as well as money.

title: Patriot Games
description: A former CIA analyst who is on vacation with his family in London prevents the terrorist attack of a member of the Royal Family and becomes the victim of their brother's murder.

title: Shadow Fires
description: Following the disappearance of her husband's dismembered body from the morgue, Rachel is being followed by an unknown individual who is seeking revenge.

title: Without Remorse
description: By bending the rules of justice and morality, John Kelly becomes the CIA's Mr. Clark, a mastermind of merciless and brilliant cunning, with whom one is completely devoid of emotion during an all-out war.

title: Clear and Present Danger
description: In Colombia, three American officials were assassinated without warning, leaving many people in disbelief from their missions. The future was too hazy for them to contemplate, and things that were previously considered impossible would be left unnoticed. Tom Clancy's latest thriller examines the U.S. war against drugs and the covert and shocking reaction of the United States.

title: A New Leash on Death
description: Reissue: Holly Winter, an amateur detective and writer, teams up with her adopted Alaskan malamute, Rowdy, at a dog show to find the killer.

title: The Key to Midnight
description: A #1 best-selling author reunites with her daughter, Joanna Rand, whom she had been the daughter of a Senator who disappeared 10 years ago while on an anti-American mission in Japan.

title: Debt of Honor
