description: The San Diego Union has characterized Tom Clancy's novels as "a nightmare and a heart-wrenching triumph," but Debt of Honor stands out even more as it puts him in danger of facing the new world order and potentially ending history.

title: A Pinch of Poison
description: Henrick Conway, an unpopular newspaper journalist whose latest expose+a7 has resulted in the warning deaths of two of his family members, is being supported by Sarah and Meg Quilliam, co-owners of the Hemlock Falls Inn.

title: Mind Prey
description: Lucas Davenport goes mad in the #1 New York Times bestselling series.

title: Thin Air
authors: Robert B. Parker;Copyright Paperback Collection (Library of Congress)
description: When beautiful young bride Lisa St. Claire mysteriously disappears, Spense joins the search for the woman - on a dangerous trail that leads him to another sociopathic ex-lover and into hell with Lisa's past. Reprint

title: Airborne
description: From people and aircraft to personnel, the elite military branch comprising both the Army and Air Force is highlighted in a behind-the-scenes look at its people, technology and mission.

title: The Grass Dancer
description: The lives and future generations of two lovers who are separated by death in the 1860s are shaped by the cosmic drama of these spirits, which is inspired by Sioux lore. Reissue.

title: Hocus Pocus
description: Ten thousand inmates from the maximum security prison across Lake Mohiga flee to Tarkington College, a small, elite institution in upstate New York, where they are now studying.

title: Virtual Vandals
description: A new series of novels aimed at young adults features the Net Force Explorers, who are more knowledgeable about advanced technology than their instructors, as part of Clancy's latest book series.

title: The Rapture of Canaan
description: The birth of a holy child by Ninah Huff, the granddaughter of the founder of an isolated religious group, is met with controversy.

title: One is the Loneliest Number
description: Maj Green's latest virtual simulation program is sabotaged by Roddy L'Officier, a fellow student, and the rest of the Net Force Explorers are banished to him, but the daring outcast has other perilous intentions for them. Original.

title: Here on Earth
description: A woman in her middle age, accompanied by her daughter, arrives home to her small town of Massachusetts for the funeral of the housekeeper who brought her up and is now forced into the lives of those she left behind. Reprint.

title: Rainbow Six
description: A military thriller features the fearsome ex-Navy SEAL John Clark and his dreadful group of terrorists.

title: Divide and Conquer
description: The Op-Center team, led by Paul Hood, must prevent a clandestine group within the U.S. State Department from creating an Iranian-Azerbaijani conflict and plotting to remove the President of the United States from power.

title: Breaking Point
description: As he struggles to heal from the trauma of losing his own life, Net Force Commander Alex Michaels sets about tackling the culprits who stole plans for a top secret atmospheric weapon that drives people insane with its low-frequency wave generation.

title: The Raphael Affair
description: The reappearance of Raphael's remains triggers a sequence of events from vandalism to murder, prompting an inquiry by Jonathan Argyll, an English art scholar who is on the run for his life. Reprinted with permission.

title: It's Not About the Bike
description: The victorious cyclist narrates his battle with cancer, the arduous therapies that provided him with a slim chance of survival, his remarkable triumph in the 1999 Tour de France, and the arrival of his newborn son.

title: Line of Control
description: Op-Center's military unit is deployed to Kashmir to arrest an Islamic terrorist who is provoking the Indian government, but they are now in the midst of a war between India and Pakistan.

title: The Bear and the Dragon
description: Newly elected U.S. president Jack Ryan's assassination attempt on the SVR chairman has put black ops specialist John Clark on alert, but threats from dangerous forces in China have only compounded the situation.

title: Phantoms
description: A tale about an abandoned town and the unfathomable truth behind its silence is recounted in a new afterword by Dean Koontz, who also shares how Phantoms contributed to his career growth.

title: Strangers
description: A group of individuals who appear to be unconnected encounter feelings of numbness and terror, and their actions lead them to discover their shared, sinister secrets in a sudden twist that alters their lives forever. Remake.

title: Stephen King's Danse Macabre
description: The top-rated writer presents a subjective exploration of beloved horror literature, books, and TV shows that have met their standards, evaluates the appeal and pleasure of horror narratives, while also sharing his personal encounter with horror. Reprint.

title: E
description: Examines the science and scientists who played a role in the development of Einstein's 1905 discovery and provides explication of the equation from various angles, including mathematics, history, and science.

title: Stardust of Yesterday
description: Despite having a castle and ghost as one of her possessions, Genevieve Buchanan was not exactly pampered. She had to face her greatest fear when it came to falling in love with Kendrick de Piaget, despite his arrogant demeanor during the thirteenth century.

title: Tom Clancy's Net Force
description: The Net Force takes control of the internet when cybercriminals, who call themselves CyberNation and consider themselves a separate virtual country, take over and disable computers worldwide.

title: Chosen Prey
description: Deputy Chief Lucas Davenport is using an apparent simple case of murder to clear his mind, while simultaneously engaging with an ever-increasing serial killer, professor of art history, a congenial pervert, and James Qatar, the sexual predator.

title: Cloak and Dagger
description: The Internet game that ensnares Daniel Sanchez causes the Explorers to face a significant challenge as they must find the true perpetrator and erase his name from the Net Force files.

title: Picture Perfect
description: Cassie Barret, a celebrated anthropologist, is devastated after her romantic relationship with Alex Rivers ends.

title: Mission of Honor
description: Penguin USA is set to release a new title, with more details to come in the near future.

title: The Magical Worlds of the Lord of the Rings
description: Provides details about Tolkien's Middle-Earth and its people, including characters, mythology, origins, and cultures.

title: Shadowland
description: Tom Flanagan and Del Nightingale, who are apprentices to a skilled magician, find themselves transported to an ancient world of unfathomable evil, where only one person can survive.

title: Floating Dragon
description: Two distinct evil entities-man-made and supernatural-create a nightmarish world that plunges Hamptead into. Reissue.

title: Practical Magic
description: Despite their magic being a gift, Gillian and Sally Owens are still carrying on with their legacy of sorcery.

title: Sea of Fire
description: A multinational corporation hired to dispose of nuclear waste is secretly selling it to terrorists, as discovered by the Op-Center team when a Singapore pirate is found with radiation on his skin in the Celebes Sea.

title: McNally's Alibi
description: Despite his efforts, Archy McNally encounters a dead end and the owner of Truman Capote's "Answered Prayers" is killed in harrowing motel scenes.

title: Lightning
description: Through the help of a stranger, Laura Shane has been helped through many difficult times in her life and now realizes the nature of her amazing destiny on herrtieth birthday. Reissue.

title: Goddess of the Sea
description: Despite her longing for more magic, Air Force Sergeant Christine Canady is transported to a mirage where she becomes the renowned mermaid Undine, but when the waters become murky, she must find sanctuary on land and in the embrace of king Arjuna.

title: The Sea Hunters II
description: Contains narratives of the underwater explorations undertaken by the author and his team of volunteers, who were dedicated to uncovering historical wrecks, such as the Mary Celeste ghost ship, the Carpathia, and the Hunley.

title: Raise the Titanic!
description: Two Russian spies and an aggressive hurricane act as obstacles to Dirk Pitt's heroism as he strives to raise the R.M.S. Titanic and rescue its precious metal, which is crucial for a covert American defense system. Reissue.

title: Field of Thirteen
description: "A four-time Edgar Award winner has curated a fast-paced collection of 13 tightly written stories that explore murder, mystery, and chaos in the world of horse racing. From eponymous sports writers to the ballads of aspiring rockers and social dancers, these are gripping reads that stay with you for miles."

title: The Bad Place
description: In a series of unusual wake-up calls, Frank Pollard confides in Detective Nick and Julie Dakota that they are vigilant about his whereabouts. Reissue.

title: Slay Ride
description: British detective David Cleveland is dispatched to Norway to investigate the disappearance of renowned British jockey Robert Sherman, but he encounters a string of unusual events.

title: Jane's Warlord
description: While trailing a sadistic killer, who is equipped with time travel technology, Jane Colby discovers that she will be the next victim when Baran Arvid, formerly known as "The Wolf of War," arrives to save her. Original.

title: Dirk Pitt
description: A mystery vessel sealed in a massive North Atlantic iceberg serves as the subject of Air Force Major Dirk Pett's investigation into international conspiracy and terror.

title: The Mediterranean Caper
description: A call of distress prompts actor Dirk Pitt to confront a modern Greek goddess in lingerie, despite his best efforts.

title: 10 Lb. Penalty
description: Upon joining politics as his close friend, former jockey Benedict Juliard is subjected to a vicious assault by his father's dangerous foes, who could potentially ruin his reputation and that of his own. Reissue.

title: Goddess of Spring
description: After making a deal with Demeter to prevent financial distress, Lina, the owner of the bakery, is transformed into Persephone, also known as the Goddess of Spring, and must restore order in the Underworld, but her attraction to Hades puts her well-being at risk.

title: Guilty Pleasures
description: The vampire hunter Anita Blake, also known as "The Executioner," is hired by the most powerful vampire town to uncover the identity of their killer.

title: Odds Against
description: Sid Halley, who was left depressed after his racing career was cut short by an accident, accepts a job with eavesdropping in the detective agency but only becomes involved in pursuing homicide.

title: Death's Acre
description: A renowned forensic anthropologist documents his work at the Tennessee "body farm" lab, which was notorious for its horrific crimes. He also mentions his involvement in several murder cases and his theories about famous cases like the Lindbergh kidnapping and the headless corpse.

title: Pattern Recognition
description: Market research consultant Cayce Pollard is tasked with investigating a mysterious video collection that has been appearing on the Internet, but when her computer is breached, she discovers that there is more to the investigation.

title: Blow Fly
description: Dr. Kay Scarpetta departs from Virginia in search of tranquility, traveling to Florida where she is entangled in an international conspiracy that brings the most unexpected outcome to her life.

title: Master of the Night
description: The story of Erin Grayson's involvement in the espionage program involves her being hired to lure Reece Champion, a stunningly wealthy individual, into revealing him as an unsavory vampire and secret agent with his own agenda.

title: Blood Sport
description: After reluctantly agreeing to locate a lost valuable breeding horse for his employer, Gene Hawkins is suddenly targeted by Dave Teller's socialite wife, as they fall in love with each other and are hunted by vicious horse thieves.

title: Trojan Odyssey
description: The NUMA team, led by Dirk Pitt, explores the issue of a black tide that is currently present in the ocean off Nicaragua, with questions swirling around the complex after discovering cryptic artifacts, threatening storms and conspiracies.

title: The Glass House
description: Captain Lacey is engrossed in the Glass House as he searches for justice, uncovering jealousy, murder, and some personal secrets.

title: Break in
description: The successful steeplechase jockey, Christmas "Kit" Fielding, is attacked, chased, kidnapped and even stabbed when he comes to the aid of his twin sister Holly and her husband, Bobby Allardeck, who are caught up in bitter rivalry between horse-winners.

title: Murder on the Orient Express
description: A trip through the snowy Balkan hills for three days will be a challenge for Hercule Poirot as he battles against numerous international suspects to find the person responsible for the death of gangster on the Orient Express.

title: The Magyar Venus
description: A suspicious suicide, a rekindled romance, and the discovery of 25,000-year-old archaeological treasure lead Lara McClintoch, an antiques dealer from Toronto, to Budapest.

title: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell
description: Tom Clancy, David Michaels.

title: Goddess of Light
description: Upon their arrival in Las Vegas, Artemis and Apollo are required to fulfill the desire of interior designer Pamela Smythe, who desires a man with divine qualities.

title: Master of the Moon
description: While on a quest to locate savagely powerful female vampire in wreaking havoc in small South Carolina town, Diana London, formerly known as werewolf, encounters Llyr Galatyn, the ruler of Cachamwri Sidhe, who fulfills all of her sexual desires. Original.

title: Hideaway
description: Reissue: When Hatch Harrison is revived in an ambulance, his second chance to survive turns into a nightmarish mission to crush the evil he carried with him from the afterlife.

title: Lost City
description: The discovery of an enzyme capable of prolonging life deep under the North Atlantic leads Kurt Austin and Joe Zavala, the NUMA Special Assignments Team leader, to investigate a killer who is targeting the researchers and individuals harvesting the enzyme.

title: Black Wind
description: In the closing days of World War II, the Japanese send two submarines carrying a new deadly virus to the west coast of the United States, but years later, they are lost at sea and someone plans to use their lethal cargo.

title: The Archimedes Effect
authors: Tom Clancy;Steve Perry;Steve R. Pieczenik;Larry Segriff
description: Penguin USA is set to release a new title, with more details to come in the near future.

title: Dark Watch
description: Captain Juan Cabrillo's intervention in Southeast Asia exposes the hidden agenda of a deadly global conspiracy that is being waged by Japanese shipping magnates, who are facing the threat of brutal pirate attacks. The original book contains 750,000 copies printed on paper.

title: Shakespeare's Landlord
description: In an effort to prove her guilt in the murder of her landlord, Lily Bard, a karate student and cleaning service owner, discovers numerous skeletons in Shakespeare's closets. Reprint.

title: Captive Dreams
description: The sisters, Celeste and Corinne Carson, who are both best-selling authors with their own fantasy-based protagonists, become more than they bargained for when their fictional heroes--Jarred, a futuristic conqueror, and Mykhayl, an ancient warrior-turned-warrantor-who fears losing their minds -- decide to abduct them and detain them in the seductive worlds that they established in their books. Original.

title: Danse Macabre
description: Anita Blake, a Federal Marshal who is responsible for the care of the dead and oversees vampilage executions, fears that her careers may be jeopardized when she learns that she could be pregnant--and that it's possible that the father will be paired with wolves, vampires or other animals.

title: Goddess of the Rose
description: The fourth book in Cast's Goddess Summoning series recounts the classic tale of "Beauty and the Beast." In this book, a young high priestess must cast off ominous spells from the Rose Realm to awaken the guardian beast of goddess Hecate from its perpetual sleep.

title: Master of Swords
description: Gawain, a brave vampiric knight, is determined to prove to witch Lark McClure that vampires are not all bloody and violent, while confronting an unrelenting killer who wants to eliminate them both. Original.

title: Boys That Bite
description: In an effort to prevent herself from becoming a vampire, Sunny, who is sixteen years old and had been mistaken for her Goth twin sister, Rayne, has gone against her will.

title: Shadow of the Moon
description: In order to uncover the truth about her sister's coma, Samantha Carpenter must team up with Lance Marshall, a reporter and werewolf, to gain entry to The Castle, where they discover masked evil and an unparalleled passion.

title: Steamed
description: Despite her efforts to find the perfect partner, Chloe Carter, a food lover and GourmetGirl in local chatrooms, still faces the same fate when she is blind-dated by another food enthusiast.

title: Rat Race
description: Matt Shore is entrusted with the task of transporting four racing enthusiasts to the race, but an emergency landing follows, and he uncovers that the mob has been manipulating the horse racing industry.

title: Mysteria
description: Mysteria is the subject of four sensual tales, where the paranormal has coexisted peacefully with the natural world until impish women invent a spellbound reign that will be remembered for centuries.

title: Skeleton Coast
description: In the wake of an attack on Sloane Macintyre's boat off the African coast, Juan Cabrillo and his team from Oregon confront a deranged militant who intends to launch he deadly force of nature against those who oppose him.

title: Strange Candy
description: "The Girl Who Was Infatuated with Death," a Vampire Hunter story written by Anita Blake, is part of the collection of short fiction, along with "House of Wizards," "Stealing Souls" and "Those Who Seek Forgiveness."

title: Bit the Jackpot
description: The Vampire Nation presidential candidate, Seamus Fox, who is tired of keeping an eye on his boss's wife and her female companions, falls for the enigmatic stripper Cara Kim, whom he dances behind a screen to keep her face hidden. By the author of High Stakes. Original. 30,000 first printing!

title: Prince of Ice
description: Despite her training in the sensual arts, Xishi is caught between love and duty when she gains ownership of Corum, the Prince of Ice, who lives next door to her. She finds herself drawn to a forbidden world where betrayal, desire, passion, intrigue, and passion could end their lives. Original.

title: Checkmate
description: A small New Mexico town is rendered powerless by radiation poisoning from a strike, while Sam Fisher, enlisted with the Third Echelon special operative, faces off against one of the free world's most formidable foe when armed with radioactive material, an overloaded cargo freighter heads straight for the U.S. coast.

title: Shakespeare's Champion
description: Reprint: In Shakespeare, Arkansas, cleaning lady Lily Bard (left) and a karate student want to live quietly but she is once again turned back into sleeve when - just as soon as her body was found at the local gym with 'a barbell' across his throat.

title: Cause of Death
description: A deadly supremacist group was hunted down by medical examiner Kay Scarpetta, her niece, and police captain Pete Marino after the mysterious death of investigative reporter Ted Eddings and the murder of a morgue assistant who had been driving her car.

title: Over the Moon
description: MaryJanice Davidson, Angela Knight, Virginia Kantra, and Sunny are the four authors of an anthology that explores a world of paranormal romance through their stories.

title: Wicked Ties
description: Jack Cole, the bodyguard assigned to protect her daughter, becomes a dangerous stalker and Morgan O'Malley begins sexizing herself while living out her hidden fantasies with him.

title: Labyrinth
description: While Alice, a volunteer digging up excavating rubble in the Pyrenees mountains, is made prey when she finds two crumbling skeletons inside, Alaèis, the daughter of cleric crusader, must save the site of the Holy Grail some eight hundred years later.

title: Master of Dragons
description: A powerful spirit intrudes into the body of Nineva Morrow, a magical fairy princess who becomes trapped in 'court intrigue' and is held captive by renegade Dragon Knight. Original.

title: Eyes of Prey
description: A tired Lieutenant Lucas Davenport, who is still recovering from two previous violent crimes, becomes involved in the hunt for a serial killer, an evil individual of exceptional intelligence and brutality who has resorted to cutting the eyes of his victims. Reissue.

title: At Risk
description: A Massachusetts DA running for governor is in the process of using advanced DNA technology to combat crime, but when an unexpected act of violence occurs, her state investigator is not convinced it was just chance.

title: Goddess of Love
description: Pea Chamberlain, attempting to get the attention of a seductive firefighter, requests Venus, the goddess of love, to give her the perfect makeover, but things become more complicated when Venus' affections for the person she cares about vanishes. Original.

title: New Moon
description: Despite being saved by an extraordinary creature, Logan Marshall falls into a seductive trap as he helps the werewolf overcome her greatest foe.

title: The Harlequin
description: Anita Blake's latest novel, which is the debut novel of the "New York Times"-bestselling author, portrays a vampire hunter facing her most challenging life challenge.

title: Cat's Cradle
description: The script editor of the 1987-1989 Doctor Who series returns for the second adventure in Cat's Cradle, where a combination of multinational corporations and super-rich people come together to fight against climate change.

title: The Hannibal Lecter Trilogy
description: The three international bestsellers, Red Dragon, The Silence of the Lambs and Hannibal, have been compiled into one volume, each featuring a unique character.

title: His Dark Materials
description: This is a fantastic adaptation of the original trilogy by Nicholas Wright of His Dark Materials, inspired by Philip Pullman's novels and has garnered significant literary recognition. It includes both playwrights' first two plays that were presented at the National Theatre, as well as one-volume student drama materials written by Ruth Moore and Paul Bunyan, offering exceptional value for money.

title: When Rain Clouds Gather
description: Two white and black exiles in Botswana are struggling to modernize their farming methods in a village with low income.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Book 2)
description: In Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, it's revealed that he had one of the most terrible summers in his life. The Dursleys were too distant for him to enjoy, and a creature named Dobby alerted him about the potential for disaster upon their return to school.

title: 10 Things I Hate about You
description: Bianca is advised against dating until her elder sister begins, as she is afraid that no one will want to take out Kat, who uses sarcasm.

title: The Mouse and His Child
description: Two abandoned toy mice endure dangerous adventures in a hostile environment before finding solace and joy with old and new friends.

title: Castle
description: The Seventh Tower series by Garth Nix is now available, but with a new twist.

title: The Violet Keystone
description: Tal and Milla explore a world where the ultimate power is at stake, with only one person capable of holding it in battle.

title: The Pen is Mightier Than the Sword
description: Abby finds pleasure in writing the advice column for the fifth-grade newspaper until people become upset with some of her responses, but then she has the chance to use her writing abilities to assist a friend.

title: Mary  Queen of Scots  Queen Without a Country
description: This year-long diary depicts a young girl named Mary, Queen of Scots, who has left her home country to attend the Court of her betrothed in France. She is only nine months old when she is crowned Queen and is separated from her mother and fellow Scottish citizens at an early age due to political conflicts.

title: The Call of the Wild
description: Buck is compelled to learn a new set of survival techniques as he is kidnapped by unsavory men and taken away to the gold-rich North.

title: Holes
description: The recipient of the Newbery Medal in 1999.

title: Freak the Mighty
description: During eighth grade, Max and his new friend Freak discover that they form an impressive team when they work together.

title: Alice in Wonderland
description: A young girl falls into a rabbit hole and enters countless nonsensical and entertaining worlds.

title: No More Dead Dogs
description: Only in schools and libraries. Truthful Wallace's negative feedback on a book prompts his English teacher to instruct him to assist with rehearsing if the plot changes. He is unaware that his plot-fixing ideas will alter the entire production.

title: Conversations with J.K. Rowling
description: The life of the Harry Potter author is narrated, featuring tales about her beloved teachers, first fan letters, and an unexpected error in their initial publication. The book was originally printed with a limited edition of 250,000 copies.

title: Quidditch Through the Ages
description: Quidditch's past, providing answers to inquiries such as the Golden Snitch and the Wigtown Wanderers' meat cleaver-wearing attire.

title: Every cloud has a silver lining
description: Despite beginning fifth grade, Abby Hayes is determined to document every moment of her life. Her older siblings, genius brother, and perfect older twins have already proven her worthiness.

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (Book 5)
description: In Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, Lord Voldemort is once again a formidable threat to the wizarding world. This time, Dumbledore takes action by reinstating the order's secret society and protecting Harry from harm. However, Harry refuses their orders, while the Ministry of Magic denies his claims and The Daily Prophet discredits him.

title: The truth about Stacey
description: Her diabetes is a known fact, but Stacey's parents are not informing her about it, leaving her feeling more isolated and alone.

title: The Story of a Seagull and the Cat who Taught Her to Fly
description: After surviving an oil spill, a seagull gives her egg to Zorba the cat, who pledges to take care of it until its offspring hatches and teach them how to fly.

title: Don't Know Much about American History
description: Provides a question and answer session that covers the United States' history from Christopher Columbus' discovery to the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001.

title: The Journey
description: To become Ga'Hoolian owls and fight against evil, the elders must train Soren, Gylfie, Twilight, and Digger with harshness to do their best work.

title: The Rescue
description: Soren has been reunited with his sister Eglantine, but he must now confront the mysterious disappearance of his mentor Ezylryb and face a formidable enemy in his quest to rescue his teacher.

title: Guardians of Ga'Hoole #4: The Siege
description: Soren's brother, Kludd, and the owl of the Great Ga'Hoole Tree are engaged in a war against them.

title: The Summit
description: Tilt, Perry, Sammi and Dominic are set to climb Mt. Everest - but there's also low supplies, high altitude, treacherous terrain, government officials, sabotage and an imminent storm.

title: The Girl  the Dragon  and the Wild Magic
description: After failing her in magic school, Rhianna meets a wizard who recognizes her as he Wild Talent, and when 'the dragon' comes to town, she must learn how to do it or face certain death.

title: Eat!
description: Board pages depict a group of infants who indulge in their favorite foods and produce the greatest possible amount of disarray on their faces.

title: The Time Machine
description: Features the age-old science fiction suspenseful tale of the Time Traveler, whose extraordinary invention propels him into the future.

title: Drowned Wednesday
description: With Wednesday approaching, Arthur Penhaligon has an invitation to return to the House that he cannot refuse. The hospital is where mourned Wednesday sent a ship to retrieve him, despite the fact that his hometown is miles away from the ocean.

title: Hope Springs Eternal
description: Nessa's new relationship with Albert, her former orphanage friend, has left her unsure about their past interactions.

title: Math Fables
description: The book's uncomplicated narratives and vibrant computer graphics offer readers an easy-to-follow tutorial on basic math concepts, including addition and subtraction.

title: Midnight for Charlie Bone
description: Charlie Bone's life with his widowed mother and two grandmothers is transformed when he finds himself in conversations on the phone and his aunts have suggested that a change in education should be pursued, leading him to attend the Bloor'S Academy.

title: The Seventh Tower
description: Tal has spent his entire life in the darkness, and he is unaware of what else exists beyond him. Down below the Castle lies Milla, an Icecarl warrior who shares her fate with Tal. Together, they will uncover the secrets of the veil and the forces that are trying to tear it apart.

title: Anacaona  Golden Flower
description: The Royal Diaries series is enriched by the writing of Edwidge Danticat, the author of THE FARMING OF BONES and KRIK! She brings to life the story of Haiti's heroic queen Anacaona, using her unique narrative style.

title: The Discovery
description: Gordon Korman's latest adventure trilogy, Dive, follows the story of four children who embark on a marine expedition to explore an underwater habitat that has been disturbed by quake. The kids find out that they must be the first to survive, as well as the fish. Will being wealthy cause them to lose their way? And will the sharks be friendly?

title: The Deep
description: This second action-packed installment in Gordon Korman's sunken treasure trilogy takes you on a thrilling journey through time.

title: Catwings
description: Four young cats with wings venture out of the urban slums to find shelter and eventually meet two children with supportive parents.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
description: A dark power has been unleashed on Harry Potter, a second-year student at the Hogwarts School for Witchcraft and Wizardry, during the opening of the Chamber of Secrets.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Book 1)
description: In Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, an orphan resides with his aunt, uncle, and son, Dudley. He is haunted by memories of an owl trying to deliver a mysterious letter that ends with Hagrid meeting him.

title: SCHOLASTIC SUCCESS WITH 4TH GRADE(WORKBOOK)
description: The skill sets recommended for 4th graders include 416 bright and colorful pages that teach children how to solve problems in addition to their natural abilities. These skills include addition, subtraction, multiplication, fractionation, number formation, problem solving, nihilistic reasoning, numerical analysis, writing, grammar, maps, and more.

title: The Invisible Man
description: The inhabitants of Burdock are frightened by the young scientist's adventures with light refractions.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
description: Contains twelve Sherlock Holmes stories, such as "The nobel bachelor," "A case of identity," and "Les beards."

title: Let Down Your Hair
description: Prince Val's neglect towards Rose makes Rapunzel feel envious, and she encounters difficulties when Madame Gothel discovers that she has been leaving the tower to attend Princess School.

title: How to Draw the Legend of Zelda
description: Contains illustrations of drawing Princess Zelda, Link and King Dodongo, with Deku Scrub and other characters from the video game "The Legend of Zenda."

title: Werewolves Don't Run For President
description: Bailey City is home to some eccentric individuals, but could the presidential contender being a werewolf?

title: Chasing the Falconers
description: Aidan and Meg Falconer rush to flee from the authorities and an unknown assailant to avoid punishment, with their parents facing life imprisonment.

title: The Fugitive Factor
description: Following their escape from a juvenile detention center, Aiden and Meg are on the lookout for evidence to secure their parents' release from imprisonment.

title: The Stowaway Solution
description: In the face of a fierce oncoming FBI agent, Aiden and Meg Falconer flee aboard he freighter bound for the sea when they are chased by spies. But as soon as the ship is caught up in hush-hugging, its crew begins to wonder what might be going on with the monster storm.

title: Public Enemies
description: The FBI has been pursuing Aiden and Meg Falconer for several years in the hopes of finding their parents' guilty, but now they are closer to uncovering the truth.

title: Hunting the Hunter
description: Aiden and Meg Falconer are enticed by the danger of Hairless Joe, a killer and psychopath who can help rescue their parents from jail, but they decide to capture him.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Book 3)
description: Sirius Black, a notorious prisoner, was imprisoned in Azkaban for twelve years. He was sentenced to death for administering sex attacks on thirteen people with one curse and could have played starring roles in the murders of James and Lily Potter. His escape has left only two clues: Harry Potter's victory over You-Know-Who and Black'S downfall.

title: Underworld
description: A Jedi master called Ferus Olin is sent to the underworld of Coruscant by his apprentice, with the purpose of saving a Jedi who is imprisoned in the Jedi Temple by Empire control.

title: Harry Potter
description: The first five seasons of Harry Potter are accompanied by a boxed set that captures the magic.

title: Do Not Open this Book!
description: Pig reprimands the reader who repeatedly interrupts him by turning the pages while he writes a book.

title: Lady Friday
description: The young Arthur Penhaligon has two options: either tormenting Lady Friday or investing his own money in a profitable venture.

title: Thetale of Despereaux
description: A mouse named Despereaux, who is fond of music and stories, and a princess named Pea are the characters in this story.

title: Inkheart
description: Upon learning that her father Mo, a bookbinder and Meggie's son-in-law, has the ability to "read" fictional characters, Capricorn (who was exiled from the novel "Inkheart") attempts to force him to remove an immortal monster from play.

title: Where We Are  what We See
description: The collection of innovative young authors and artists from the 2002, 2003, and 2004 Scholastic Art & Writing Awards includes poetry, stories, essays, as well as art.

title: Sunny the Yellow Fairy
description: A trail of gleaming yellow dust leads Rachel and Kirsty to Sunny, one of the colorful sisters from the rainbow fairy world.

title: Sky the Blue Fairy
description: Colorful is the term used for the Rainbow Magic Fairies!

title: Inky the Indigo Fairy
description: The Rainbow Fairies are banished by Jack Frost, leaving Rachel and Kirsty wishing for a magical book that transports them to Inky.

title: Heather the Violet Fairy
description: Rachel and Kirsty are overcome with fear when they realize that a merry-go-round will lead them to Heather, after the evil Jack Frost banishes their beloved Rainbow Fairies.

title: Fourth of July mice
description: A parade and other festivities on Independence Day are attended by four lively mice.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (Book 6)
description: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince marks the beginning of the war against Voldemort, while the Wizarding world has been split into multiple factions, with heavy casualties among the Muggles, Dumbledore being out of Hogwarts for extended periods, and members who were once on the Order of The Phoenix have had to endure a period of change due to the effects of such events.

title: Your Best Friend's Boyfriend
description: When the protagonist is captivated by her best friend's boyfriend, readers are asked to select how the story will unfold at various stages of the narrative.

title: The Case of the Snowboarding Superstar
description: Without the aid of his partner, Mila, Jigsaw Jones must locate a missing good luck charm during their winter vacation in Vermont.

title: Thorn in Her Side
description: The school play features Briar Rose as Princess Perfecta and Nettle, played by Rose's opposite, appears to be a near-perfect match for the evil fairy.

title: Gothic!
description: Ten celebrated authors have incorporated elements of horror and wild humor into their works, while also embracing the gothic genre for an eclectic blend of surreal and dark fantasy.

title: A break with charity
description: During the church meeting in 1706, Susanna English -- daughter of a wealthy Salem merchant who was forced to attend -- recalls how fear, malice, and accusations of witchcraft had caused her village to fall apart in 1692.

title: Runny Babbit
description: Runny Babbit lends a hand and receives the phrase "Our Special for today," from his beloved author of classic children's books.

title: The Harry Potter Collection
description: The first six years of Harry Potter magic are captured in a boxed set that includes The Sorcerer's Stone, The Chamber of Secrets, and The Prisoner of Azkaban.

title: No Accident
description: Kelly, Tom, Alison, Zoey, and Chad are subjected to blackmail, new adversaries, deceit, & potentially dangerous choices.

title: The Abduction
description: Aiden collaborates with the FBI to locate his sister Meg when she is abducted, using clues that only a brother could recognize.

title: Mister Monday
description: A key resembling the minute hand of a clock is used to save Arthur Penhaligon, but strange creatures such as Mister Monday and his repulsive messengers and army of dog-eared Fetchers will not step forward to obtain the key.

title: Ghosthunters and the Muddy Monster of Doom!
description: The fate of the world is determined by his encounter with the mud-dripping minotaur, and Tom's final exam will undoubtedly assess his expertise in the field and earn him the Diploma in Ghosthunting if he survives.

title: The Trouble with Violet
description: Mabel, who is eight years old and very sane, discovers a family secret that affects her younger sister Violet when strange things start happening.

title: Violet Makes a Splash
description: Violet conjures up a pool for their garden, but Mabel, who is not enchanted, cannot make it go away.

title: Guardians of Ga'hoole
description: Observes the exploits of Soren, an abandoned barn owl that is captured and brought to St. Aegolius Academy where he becomes embroiled in a conflict between good and evil.

title: This is Push
description: The PUSH label has given rise to a selection of stories from the best YA writers today, featuring new works by Kevin Brooks, Markus Zusak, Kristen Kemp, Coe Booth, and others.

title: The Case of the Kidnapped Candy
description: When the candy that Ms. Gleason was supposed to give to her class as a Valentine's Day treat goes missing, it is up to Jigsaw and Mila to uncover the truth.

title: Awakening
description: J.D., who is only thirteen years old, has difficulty identifying her identity, where she came from, and the reason for her nightmares.

title: Betrayal
description: Despite the presence of Dr. Styron's memories in her brain, J.D. is still searching for answers to questions about her past and the dangerous powers within her abilities.

title: Hello! Is That Grandma?
description: Can you identify the person on the phone? Open the flaps and see for yourself if you accidentally called multiple animals.

title: Savage Stone Age Sticker Book
description: Savage Stone Age Sticker Book is a fun and entertaining way to learn about the past while also exploring dangerous puzzles and word games.

title: Trickster's Choice
description: Aly, the daughter of Alanna, King's Champion and Lady Knight, has a brutal past. She is not fond of her mother' constant obsession with her family, which constantly isolates her from loved ones. Despite being kidnapped by pirates and sold as enslave to China in the far-flung country, she faces the prospect of losing all memories.

title: Northern Lights
description: In the Arctic, Lyra Belacqua, a twelve-year-old girl, is drawn into savage combat among the armoured bears and witch-clans of an abandoned scientific research station. To survive, she must leave her childhood behind and explore beyond the Northern Lights.

title: Mary Queen of Scots and Her Hopeless Husbands
description: The secret diary of Queen Mary reveals details about her abduction by a murderous lord. While she is known for having bad taste in marriages and losing her head on the cutting board, we are unaware of this fact.

title: The New Centurions
description: Demonstrates the harsh surroundings and rigorous training of three Los Angeles police officers.

title: A Pinch of Snuff
description: A bizarre case involves Police Inspector Pascoe, who must visit his dentist on a regular basis to watch pornographic videos where people are actually killed on camera.

title: Suffer the Children
description: The disappearance of children in Port Arbello is on the rise, 100 years after a girl was murdered.

title: Tai-Pan
description: Dick Straun, the Tai-Pan of Hong Kong, who is a pirate, smuggler, and cruel person, achieves greatness in his role. Reissue.

title: Tinsel
description: Hollywood's glitzy landscape is filled with stars, aspirants, dreamers, and impish individuals who are willing to give everything for the opportunity at its peak.

title: Serenissima
description: Jessica Pruitt, a Hollywood actress and Shakespeare enthusiast, is transported back to the sixteenth century and becomes the source of inspiration for the poet's most mysterious work.

title: An Acceptable Time
description: Polly O'Keefe's visit to see her grandparents in person transforms into a time-travel drama as she encounters multiple strangers from interstellar space and, with them, becomes central to revealing the events of an ancient conflict.

title: Drawing Blood
description: Trevor McGee, a cartoonist, returns to his father's murder scene two decades later, where he is confronted by the demons of his past and the dark side that threatens to destroy him.

title: The Blue Knight
description: Be sure not to miss out on the amazing value offered by Robert B. Parker's Spenser, Pale Kings and Princes, John Saul' frightful Comes the Blind Fury, and Joseph Wambaugh'S Blue Knight, which is a Los Angeles cop who lives his entire life on an edge.

title: Gai-Jin
description: The fate of Malcolm Struan, the successor to the most influential English trading company in the Orient, is closely tied to that of an attractive young woman from France.

title: Drop Shot
description: A corrupt senator and organized crime syndicate investigate the murder of a burned-out tennis star, while sports agent Myron Bolitar uncovers ties between the victim and an emerging talent from the opposite side of the tracks. Reissue.

title: The Fiery Cross
description: The year 1771 is the exact time when the colony of North Carolina is on the brink of collapse. Jamie Fraser, a man of great integrity, has many things to lose due to his wife, Claire, who is known as 'the wisewoman or the witch' and they both know that they must make it through.

title: Purple Cane Road
description: The discovery that his mother was murdered by a New Orleans police officer has left Dave Robicheaux haunted by the memories of her.

title: Number the Stars
description: During the German occupation of Denmark in 1943, Annemarie, a ten-year-old girl, finds courage and resourcefulness in saving her Jewish friend from the Nazis.

title: Many Waters
description: "A Wrinkle in Time," a Newbery-winning novel, features Sandy and his middle children being transported to the time before the Flood, providing an exciting and entertaining storyline.

title: Demon in My View
description: The vampire world of Jessica Allodola's fiction becomes tangible when she starts establishing relationships with an attractive vampire named Aubrey and the teenage witch who is determined to save her.

title: The Cricket in Times Square
description: The journey of a country cricket team who accidentally travels to New York and meets their new friends, Tucker Mouse and Harry Cat.

title: Skellig
description: Michael, who is upset that his baby sister has fallen ill and he has been living in a run-down old house all day, finds himself in the garage locked up to an unknown person like an angel.

title: The Cay
description: narrates the adventures, pleasures, and sorrows of a wealthy and prejudiced Dutch boy stuck with benevolent West Indian on.

title: Flags Of Our Fathers
description: Presents the authentic account of the events that led to the flag being flown at Iwo Jima by the American Marines in February 1945, along with maps and an eight-page photo insert.

title: For All Time
description: In 1899, a young girl named Annie Lockwood endeavors to journey through time and meet her lost love Strat in Egypt, but ultimately finds herself in ancient Egypt and in great danger.

title: How Angel Peterson Got His Name
description: Gary Paulsen recounts his experiences of growing up in a small town in northwestern Minnesota during the late 1940s and early 1950s, including taking turns on ice while skiing and imitating Evel Knievel.

title: Shattered Mirror
description: A dangerous friendship blossoms for Sarah Vida, a seventeen-year-old girl who is the daughter of ten vampire-hunting witches in her family and finds herself on the trail of two vampire brothers at her high school.

title: The Testament
description: A suicidal billionaire, a burnt-out litigator from Washington, and scurry woman who has abandoned technology to work in the wilds of Brazil are all linked by an astonishing mystery of the testament.

title: The Smoke Jumper
description: A woman is faced with the decision of choosing between two best friends who both love her, in a story steeped in danger and set in the heart of wilderness firefighting. By The Horse Whisperer. Reprint.

title: Gone for Good
description: Will Klein discovers that his girlfriend is connected to his brother's death during an investigation into the mysterious disappearance. He also becomes increasingly disturbed when he realizes all the people a dear friend loves are harboring dark secrets. By the author of Tell No One. Reprint.

title: The Coalwood Way
description: During his final year of high school, the author follows in the footsteps of the Rocket Boys of Coalwood, West Virginia, as they confront a turning point and face the possibility of their Hickam home being torn apart.

title: Midnight Predator
description: The work of Turquoise Draka, an ALA Quick Pick, involves her being a mercenary trained to fight vampires, witches and shape-shifters. However, she is distracted by ghosts from in her past and new possibilities for her future.

title: The Subtle Knife
description: As the boundaries between worlds begin to blur, Lyra and her daemon aid Will Parry in his quest to locate his father and obtain a potent, magical wielder.

title: Quiver
description: The huntress Atalanta gives her suitors an impractical task to fulfill the promise of chastity given to her by her father, while the gods of ancient Greece observe.

title: Slightly Wicked
description: Judith lets her sleep with a heroic stranger after an evening of reckless passion, only to be met with shock and surprise when the stranger returns to her aunt's home, Harewood Grange, hoping to win over her cousin.

title: The Rule of Four
description: In an effort to unravel the intricate mathematical maze of a love story, two researchers obtain aides' diary and discover that it may contain the key to unlocking the labyrinthine text.

title: Shopaholic Ties the Knot
description: The proposal from her boyfriend leaves Becky Bloomwood feeling ecstatic, but her mother's plans for an outdoor wedding are disrupted by demands from the high-society bridesmaid union demanding that she organize a lavish affair at the Plaza Hotel.

title: Outlander
description: Return to Scotland in 1743 after being transported back over two centuries, Claire Randall is swept away by the violence, pestilence, and revolution that have divided an unfamiliar world and haunted her with her growing affection for James Fraser.

title: The Gilded Web
description: Despite her innocent actions, Alexandra Purnell finds solace in the heat and crowds of a London ballroom, only to be whisked away by Edmond, Earl of Amberley, who offers her marriage. Reprint.

title: Blessings
description: The reissue of "Fortune's Hand" and the author of two beloved classics on romance, honor, and family is now available at a discounted price.

title: 18 Best Stories
description: The Fall of the House of Usher and The Pit and the Pendulum are examples of Poe's fiction that showcase the terror and horror in their writing.

title: My Name is Aram
description: This collection of short stories portrays a young boy in the California valley during the early 1900s who finds daily life to be both thrilling and promising.

title: About the B'nai Bagels
description: Mark's Little League team is managed and coach by his mother and brother, causing him to feel uneasy in the field.

title: Anastasia on Her Own
description: In the absence of her mother, Anastasia Krupnik has to deal with three challenges: her brother Sam's chicken pox, an unexpected visit from her father' exec and her own first date.

title: Escape from Fire Mountain
description: After rescuing two children from a forest fire, Nikki Roberts is faced with the prospect of becoming one of the inferno's victims. With no option but to turn her back, will she overcome the odds and ultimately face the fate of Fire Mountain?

title: The Children on the Top Floor
description: The children, Malcolm Masters, Thomas, Lucy, Margery, and William, are left abandoned on the doorstep of a TV star as infants. However, issues arise when Malcolm goes on an extended cruise, leaving the children behind.

title: Make Four Million Dollars by Next Thursday!
description: The bizarre advice from Dr. Silverfish's get-rich-quick book makes Jason attract a lot of attention.

title: See You Around  Sam!
description: Sam Krupnik, who is upset with his mother for not being allowed to wear his new plastic frocks in the house, flees to Alaska.

title: Stay!
description: Keeper recounts his separation from his mother and siblings, but he still manages to go on adventures with multiple human masters and search for his little sister.

title: Summer of the Monkeys
description: The hapless monkeys that ran away from a circus train are the focus of Jay's quest, who hopes his reward will lead him to acquire the gun and pony he has been seeking.

title: Stargirl
description: Mica High School is forever changed by an eccentric student named Stargirl, who brings with her the risks of popularity, the courage of being a nonconformist, and the excitement of finding love.

title: Harriet Spies Again
description: When Harriet's married nanny visits her during her parents' trip to France, she hears something that makes her believe Ole Golly is in trouble.

title: The Boys Start the War
description: The initial book in a comical trilogy that depicts the rivalries between the Hatford and Malloy families. When their new family, including three daughters, arrive in the neighborhood, the siblings from the original Hatfield family plan to make Caroline and her sisters so miserable that they'll want to return to Ohio.

title: Vincent Van Gogh
description: An ALA Notable Book that chronicles the turbulent life of Vincent van Gogh, from his childhood in the Netherlands to his later career as a painter. The book is reprinted and documents his journey from Auvers-sur-Oise near Paris before his death.

title: The Orange Trees of Versailles
description: Marion, a talented perfume maker aged fourteen, is given the opportunity to work as Louis XIV's mistress at Versailles in the 1670s, but she becomes consumed with palace secrets.

title: Tucket's Travels
description: Francis Tucket, who was taken hostage by Pawnee Indians and is now a resident of the Oregon Trail, has had many adventures, such as meeting armed men, saving orphaned children, and bravely enduring bandits and fierce storms on his way back home.

title: The Silent Boy
description: As Katy strives to emulate her father's success as a doctor in later years, she realizes that Jacob has an inner strength that necessitates the disclosure of his true self.

title: The Pizza Monster
description: Duncan, who is feeling depressed, has a friend thanks to the assistance of wealthy secret agent Olivia Sharp.

title: The Sly Spy
description: A secret that Olivia keeps for a client is the subject of E.J. the spy's attempt to uncover it.

title: The Green Toenails Gang
description: In Carmel, California, Olivia Sharp, a wealthy agent for secrets, discovers several secrets during her visit to an exclusive club and assists one of her friends in gaining admission.

title: Hoot
description: After moving to his small Florida community, Roy encounters a strange boy who introduces him to potty-trained alligators, burrowing owls and sparkly-Tailed poisonous snakes. The book has been awarded the Newbery Honor Book, ALA Notable Book award, and is reissued.

title: War Comes to Willy Freeman
description: A thirteen-year-old black girl in Connecticut, who was free before the British took her mother's life, is haunted by the horrors of the Revolutionary War and the possibility of being returned to slavery.

title: A Wrinkle in Time
description: Meg, Calvin, and Charles are accompanied by a visitor at midnight as they navigate through the barriers of time and space.

title: Masks of the Illuminati
description: A secret international group is uncovered by Sir John Babcock, who then seeks the aid of Albert Einstein and James Joyce to uncover it.

title: I'm Good Enough  I'm Smart Enough  and Doggone It  People Like Me!
description: Al Franken's humorous character, Stuart Smalley, parodies self-help books and shares his own journey through a year of trying to find happiness.

title: Your Eight Year Old
description: Eight-year-olds are known for their extroverted personality and eagerness to tackle any challenge. They can be both enthusiastic and overly cautious, but there is also an element of criticism that can make them feel like they're playing hardball or losing balance in school. How can parents navigate this transition without negatively impacting their relationships with peers?

title: Roald Dahl's James and the giant peach
description: James and his insect companions embark on extraordinary journeys with a magical peach.

title: Beowulf
description: The young hero who fights and kills the water monster, Grendel, is depicted in the Anglo-Saxon epic written for children.

title: A Ring of Endless Light
description: Copyright  Libri GmbH All Rights Reserved. 15-year-old Vicky finds solace in a pod of dolphins while researching her grandfather's leukemia dying this summer.

title: A House Like a Lotus
description: Polly, a sixteen-year-old girl, is betrayed by her wealthy and talented artist idol Maximiliana Horne, who she admires for her stimulating education at Max's direction.

title: Thursday's Children
description: Doone discovers and develops his unique abilities while attending his sister's privileged ballet classes.

title: Starplex
description: After two decades, the revelation of artificial wormholes propels Earth space exploration to unprecedented levels, and Starplex Director Keith Lansing is now investigating a mysterious vessel that soon threatens the station with intergalactic warfare.

title: Tramp Royale
description: His book chronicles his travels around the world, from New Orleans through the Panama Canal to the African veldt.

title: The Hero and the Crown
description: The Damarian king's daughter, Aerin, who is a witchwoman in the North and has been guided by Luthe and aided by the blue sword, gains her birthright.

title: Rose Daughter
description: Reprint. PW. The Newbery Award-winning author of The Hero and the Crown revisits the beloved Beauty and Beast to create a haunting story of love that can have enduring consequences.

title: Riddle-master
description: The modern-day fantasy classic, a collection of the complete and lengthy out-of-print Riddle-Master trilogy, offers narrated tales of writhing princes discovering his true selves in 'a uniquely born land.

title: The Mirror of Merlin
description: To conquer the magic isle of Fincayra, Merlin must confront a magical mirror that transforms one's fate after he reveals his stolen sword.

title: The Lost Years of Merlin
description: The first book in the popular series, which is now available in paperback, tells the story of Merlin's journey to becoming the greatest wizard in history, with all illustrations provided by Libri GmbH. All rights are reserved.

title: Neuromancer
description: A special edition commemorating the twentieth anniversary of the influential novel by Hugo, Nebula, and Philip K. Dick Award-winning author features Case, a disarmed computer expert, who is asked to break into 'the most heavily guarded databank in the solar system'.

title: Conqueror's Moon
description: The Boreal Moon Tale series introduces Prince Conrig of Cathra and his lover, Princess Ullanoth of Moss, who are on the brink of death and have aimed to unite the rival kingdoms of High Blenholm under one supreme authority.

title: Rocket Ship Galileo
description: A group of three teenagers and an older scientist work on their own atomic rocket, solve space problems, and set off for the moon in spite of some enigmatic setbacks.

title: Deerskin
description: Princess Lissar's appearance reverts to her mother'dishazzlement, which forces her to fight off her cruel father and embrace her faithful dog Ash, ultimately leading to a portal to an extraordinary realm. Reprint.

title: Camouflage
description: The discovery of an unidentified artifact seven miles below the sea's surface leaves scientists puzzled, but also calls attention to two ancient and immortal creatures that have never walked on Earth before.

title: Dragon's Treasure
description: The Dragon of Chingura, Kardur Atani, has triumphed over his father's inhumanity and his brother' naughty behavior to become the new ruler of the kingdom. Reprint.

title: The Rosetta Codex
description: After fleeing from an attack on his family's starship that was supposed to take him to the ornate world of Morningstar, Cale Alexandros stumbles upon a book filled with mysterious metal pages and writings hidden deep within an ancient temple that holds information about how to read languages unknown to humans, but is ultimately betrayed by cruel adversaries. Original.

title: Old Twentieth
description: During the thousand-year voyage to Beta Hydrii, Jacob Brewer confronts a dangerous sentient machine that has become preoccupied with humanity's mysterious deaths aboard the starship Aspera.

title: Count Zero
description: In the future world of Sprawl, an urban complex that spans from Boston to Houston, a corporate mercenary is awakened in reconstructed body and sent on dangerous mission after mission to retrieve rotten R&D chief and his state-of-the-art biochip.

title: The God in the Moon
description: Despite joining the Aquilonian army to aid King Conan, Nermesa Klandes is ultimately unable to achieve his goals and unleash an unholy enemy that could be the demise of their empire.

title: Harrowing the Dragon
description: An anthology of short fiction that has been available for 25 years includes "The Harrowing of the Dragon of Hoarsbreath," "A Matter of Music," and "I Will Meet the Sword."

title: The Eye of Charon
description: Despite ending up killed, warrior Nermesa Klandes must now embark on a dangerous mission when an unknown foe is taking over Aquilonia's neighboring caravans, leading him into nefarious territory where dark magic and demonic forces could potentially destroy King Conan.

title: Cygnet
description: The Sorceress and the Cygnet and then the Firebird, a one-volume pairing of two of the World Fantasy Award winner’s classic tales, tells the story of how the Ro family ends in an alternate reality of myth and mayhem.Placed on spine: The Tower at Stony Wood, original copy 15,000 (first printing).

title: Magic Bites
description: Kate Daniels, a mercenary who earns money from cleaning up magical debris, is drawn into repercussions of battling between two groups--necromancers and shapeshifters- within Atlanta's magic circles- when her guardian is killed.

title: The Castle of the Silver Wheel
description: Gwenlliant of Celydonn, who is a magisterial person, journeys to Mochdref with her partner to govern thy nation that has long held animosity towards them. Original.

title: Chapterhouse: Dune
description: Following the death of Leto II, fifteen thousand years later, the Bene Gesserit remnants face off against the merciless rulers of an alien civilization to form a new civilization and preserve the finest elements of the Old Empire.

title: Betcha Can't Read Just One
description: "The Wicked Old Witch" by George Alec Effinger, "Final Solution" written by Mike Resnick, and "New Hope for Denture Wearers" created by Ron Goulart are just a few of the funny and bizarre fantasy stories in this collection, along with thirteen other pieces.

title: Hard Sell
description: Mr. Fisk Centers, who owns property on Mars, engages in a supersonic car suicide race and visits invasive morticians to embalm rotten samples. Reprint.

title: Killobyte
description: The enigmatic and captivating Killobyte brings the cop, who is in a wheelchair, to battle an army of sorcerers, possesses pity by virtue of her role-playing abilities, and convinces him that his desire to kill is entirely unavoidable.

title: The Moon in Hiding
description: The kingdom's most virtuous knight, Ceilyn, and Televi, who is apprenticed by Glastyn on the wizardry, are facing charges of witchcraft and theft respectively.

title: The 97th Step
description: Ferret, a criminal who targets foreign territories, transforms into Pen, the sister of the Shroud and renowned expert in lethal tactics that may eventually rule over an empire.

title: The Omega Cage
description: The Omega Cage is the unjustified high-tech confinement where Dain Maro endeavors to escape Warden Stark and his ruthless hunting machines by crossing through bone-lit deserts and deadly swamps.

title: Robot Adept
description: The parallel worlds of Proton and Phaze, which are based on science and magic, are fertile ground for revolution. Mach, a brave and sensitive robot from Proto-Tandem, and his alternate self, the magical Bane from Phalachith, can either unite or eliminate both systems. Reissue.

title: To Sail Beyond the Sunset
description: The author combines themes and characters from his previous stories to trace the life and love of Lazarus Long's mother, Maureen Johnson.

title: Vision of Tarot
description: The planet Tarot is a virtual world, with no tangible reality or authenticity.

title: Anesthesiology Review
description: Provides an overview of the necessary knowledge for anesthesiology residents. Covers all subject areas found on the ABA/ASA exam and includes new topics on cardiopulmonary bypass, off-pump coronary bypasses, and automatic internal cardiac defibrillator procedures.

title: Cast a Yellow Shadow
description: Reissue: Michael Padillo, a wealthy soldier, is told by an anonymous killer that his partner's wife, who was taken hostage, will die if he does not follow orders to kill him.

title: Nothing Lasts Forever
description: Despite promising to end the lives of their patients, Dr. Paige Taylor's claim that she was euthanized was dismissed as murder by the D.A. after receiving millions from her patient. Dr." Kat Hunter: She accepted the challenge of being taken away by a deadly bet. Honey Taft: To make it in the medical field, she knew that you would need more than the brains given to you by God.

title: Carrion Comfort
description: Three aged friends with supernatural abilities who use their emotions generated during murders meet annually to discuss their game, which is an ongoing competition of mass murder and vampirism.

title: Summer of Night
description: The summer of 1960 in Elm Haven, Illinois sees the formation of powerful bonds between five 12-year-old boys who foresee a lifetime of change. They confront an ancient evil and learn to fight back with vengeful silence.

title: Back Bay
description: The Pratt clan is made up of determined men and women who endure six tumultuous generations in search of a Paul Revere treasure and an obsession that could potentially ruin their family. William Martin's book, which launched his literary career, offers readers sweeping perspectives on dynastic Boston and the now-secluded Back Bay area, along with enduring themes of war, greed, and sexual predation.

title: Bare Bones
description: The legendary horror fiction guru shares the origin of his stories in a series, discussing his personal experiences, career, and beliefs about writing, as well as the reasons for horror story appeal.

title: Kushiel's Justice
description: Imriel returns to the story as Kushiel's avatar, embarking on a brutal and unappealing mission to apprehend the murderer of his wife and offspring.

title: The Celestine Prophecy
description: This ancient manuscript, found in the rain forests of Peru, contains 9 crucial insights into life that will be absorbed and understood by humans as they move towards a spiritual culture. It offers insight into how to connect current events and future prospects using existing wisdom.

title: Ten Things I Wish I'd Known - Before I Went Out into the Real World
description: Maria Shriver, an award-winning broadcast journalist and NBC anchor-woman, shares the insights she gained from her career, family, and personal experiences.

title: The Collectors
description: "The Camel Club members are in a race to prevent 'blind' but bloody coup' in Washington after the Speaker of the House is assassinated," the publisher reported.

title: The Book of the Dead
description: While the Museum of Natural History reopens a tomb exhibit after years of shutting down, psychotic murderer Diogenes is facing charges and witnesses are told they may be part of an ancient curse.

title: The Everyday Life Bible
description: As a highly respected Bible teacher, mentor, and friend, Joyce Meyer's straightforward approach to life and thorough examination of the Scriptures has won her millions in admiration. Now, for the first time, people can see how she combines her teachings with the biblical text.

title: The Serial Killers Club
description: The main character's murderous act involves him defending himself from an assault on the serial killer, as he unknowingly joins a secret organization known as "the hunt" that features members with celebrity faces and mutual love for "being killed."

title: I Like You
description: Provides a guide to entertaining, offering recipes, helpful tips, and unconventional party ideas such as innovative dishes to serve alcohol and arts and crafts ideas.

title: The Red Gloves Collection
description: Karen Kingsbury's best-selling book collection has been the source of inspiration for readers to experience uplifting stories of hope, inspiration, and joyous miracles in this collectible edition.

title: The Coming Economic Collapse
description: In this timely book, Stephen Leeb, a prominent economist, exposes how rising oil prices will result in utter fiscal collapse by surpassing $100 or even $200 per barrel, and offers strategies to circumvent the pitfalls of the impending crisis.

title: Where There's Smoke
description: A passionate physician encounters a rebellious individual from the Texas oil family, but their relationship could potentially lead to empire collapse.

title: Season of the Machete
description: Peter Macdonald abandons his leisure pursuits and gets ready to confront psychopathic killers Damian and Carrie Rose on a holiday island.

title: Assumed Identity
description: The master of disguise, who was captured in a devastation plot, is on the trail of unforeseen events in Mexico's Yucata+a7n peninsula as he grapples with his true identity and romantic feelings for two women.

title: Charade
description: After a year of being reintroduced to television, Cat Delaney must work alongside an ex-cop to uncover hidden truths and confront the peril that haunts her home.

title: Night Train to Memphis
description: Despite not being an expert on Egypt, Vicky Bliss, the assistant curator of the Munich-based National Museum, has been offered a luxury Nile cruise by an intelligence agency in exchange for her help in solving espionage and murder cases. She believes that the authorities are only interested in finding her lover, who is believed to be renowned as "Sir John Smythe."

title: Exclusive
description: The White House bestseller "Muttor, Passion, and Intrigue" follows the investigation of Barrie Travis' baby after her friend accidentally died.

title: The Laws of Our Fathers
description: A woman is fatally shot in an alleged drive-by shooting in Kindle County. The victim was the former spouse of a prominent state senator and formerly acquainted with Judge Sonia Klonsky, who sits on his desk at the federal courthouse when the case moves forward. As the justice system takes strange and unconventional turns, Judge Klondy encounters numerous extraordinary individuals and formidable foes determined to take her down.

title: The Neutronium Alchemist
description: The future of humanity is in jeopardy as the lingering thoughts of those long-deceased begin to take over the lives of the living, leaving one man to search for a lost doomsday machine.

title: Fat Tuesday
description: A New Orleans police officer in revenge is the focus of this gripping thriller (People). Set during a time of intense disillusionment, Burke Basile finds himself haunted by his partner's death and their professional life. He targets an unsavory attorney who assists criminals in getting away with Remy, but ultimately succumbs to guilt after abducting her.

title: Message in a Bottle
description: In this New York Times bestseller, single mother Theresa Osborne is on a mission to find her husband, the North Carolina man who sent an unidentified message to someone else.

title: Death of a Gossip
description: The life of Lady Jane Winter, the widowed wife of a society and gossip columnist, is explored by Constable Hamish Macbeth and Priscilla Halburton-Smythe as they navigate the rough waters of the tattler's life to uncover cleric responsible for the murder.

title: Tell Me Your Dreams
description: The trio of Ashley Patterson, Toni Prescott, and Alette Peters have little to no experience in their relationship apart from being stalked by each other. Until they are joined by a murder investigation that will lead to one of the most bizarre trials ever recorded.

title: Death of an Addict
description: The author of the Agatha Raisin TV series shares her story of finding a drug-related cartel in Scotland.

title: The Wild Swans
description: The plot revolves around two marginalized individuals on two separate journeys in two different eras. In 1689 England, Eliza Grey's 11 brothers are transformed into apes and transported to America by her father, who rejected her, but she is able to rescue them--until she becomes accused of witchcraft-whereas Elias Latham has AIDS and is forced to live on the streets for three years in the 1981 New York story.

title: Personal Injuries
description: For Robbie Feaver, the law is purely about making fun of clients, jurors, or judges. However, when his personal injury lawyer is caught offering money for bribes to help his wife in her illness, he must also create tape recordings that can bring people from other cultures into a moral dilemma and legal turmoil.

title: Saving Faith
description: In this New York Times bestselling thriller, the FBI interviews Faith Lockhart, a young woman who is considered 'the most important witness' in an underground conspiracy.

title: A Highland Christmas
description: The author of the TV series Agatha Raisin has authored a book called HIGHLAND CHRISTMAS, A Hamish Macbeth Mystery, and shared it with M. C. Beaton to celebrate the holiday season.

title: The Sky Is Falling
description: The Winthrops, who are the royal family in America, have five members who have died in a single year, with their Prince Charming being the only person of interest to be found dead in his home.

title: Suzanne's Diary for Nicholas
description: Despite finding the perfect man, Katie Wilkinson is left clueless when she discovers that Suzanne, a new mother, has written revealing intimate details about her relationship with Nicholas.

title: Up Country
description: Retired Army investigator Paul Brenner is summoned back into service to investigate the death of a soldier who died in Vietnam three decades ago, with many unpleasant memories being recalled.

title: Reversible Errors
description: Arthur Raven, a corporate lawyer appointed by the death row justice system, is resolute in his actions and has only recently been convinced of his client's innocence.

title: Still Life with Crows
description: A small Kansas town has become a place where people are afraid to leave their bodies behind. Could the perpetrator be portrayed as 'a serial killer with the power to kill' or could it be depicted as an enchanted creature that haunts the country? FBI Special Agent Pendergast uncovers evil in the blood of America's heartland.

title: Words of Silk
description: Upon discovering she is trapped in an elevator in Manhattan, Laney McLeod transforms her life. She turns to handsome stranger Deke Sargent for support and soon finds herself drawn to him, leading to intense love. However, months later, she disappears from the scene.

title: 3rd Degree
description: Amidst the chaos of James Patterson's #1 New York Times bestseller, Detective Lindsay Boxer is confronted with a shocking revelation about one of her women. The mystery surrounding their secret lies with an extremely dangerous woman who was left unconscious and infected by exploding vehicles.

title: Kitty and the Midnight Hour
description: Despite being a closet werewolf and working as the midnight shift DJ for Denver radio station, Kitty Norville accidentally starts "The Midnight Hour" after feeling overwhelmed by the lack of requests for songs. She then launches her own advice show to help those in need across the country from vampires to witches.

title: Love Beyond Reason
description: Although it reflects the trends and attitudes of the time, this story's theme is eternal and universal. Like all romance fiction, the plot revolves around lovers who are starcrossed, with plenty of moments of passion, anguish, and tenderness-all elements of falling in love.

title: The White Wolf's Son
description: The Skrayling Tree, the previous novel in the series, was published by Aspect in hardcover in 2003 and in mass market in 7/04. The previous book received praise from the Washington Post, Denver Post, and Locus, as it was included on the 2001 Recommended Reading list. - It was reissued in 2005 with a similar title to The Dreamthief's Daughter.

title: The Angel Experiment
description: Maximum Ride, a fourteen-year-old girl who goes by Max in James Patterson's blockbuster series and is best known for her ability to fly above the ground. She and the rest of the "flock" of characters--Fang, Iggy, Nudge, Gasman, and Angel- are nothing more than ordinary children who possess wings that let them fly. However, their lives can quickly become nightmares when Angel, the youngest member of this group, is kidnapped and killed.

title: Curries Without Worries
description: This is a comprehensive guide to Indian dishes that provides an in-depth understanding of spices and seasonings, as well as more than sixty-five easy-to-follow recipes for vegetarian, non-vegetarian, and all-around dishes such as kebabs. Reprint.

title: One L
description: Scott Turow's book, "The First Year of Law School," is the story of his personal ordeal and how he used his legal experience to create true suspense fiction.

title: When the Wind Blows
description: A veterinary nurse from Colorado, Frannie O'Neill, is haunted by the mysterious murder of her husband, David. She finds herself in this mess after learning about the mystery behind David's death and encounters Kit Harrison, a troubled and unconventional FBI agent who visits her home. Max, an eleven-year-old girl named Angela, appears with great excitement on one night while walking through the woods at her animal hospital.

title: The Autobiography of Martin Luther King  Jr.
description: Through the lens of knowledge, spirit, good humor, and passion, THE AUTOBIOGRAPHY OF MARTIN LUTHER KING, JR., we encounter an extraordinary individual whose ideas and actions speak to contemporary issues and continue to inspire us all.

title: Hope is the Thing with Feathers
description: Describes the past of six North American birds that are now extinct, their deaths, and the individuals who took action to protect them.

title: Cane River
description: Oprah's Book Club Pick and the "New York Times" bestseller, capturing the unique perspective of four African-American women who trace their lineage back to a single family.

title: Plum Island
description: The General's Daughter is gripping with suspense, while The Gold Coast embodies the original Nelson DeMille.

title: Gloriana
description: Gloriana's reign is marked by a golden age in the Empire of Albion, with her oppressive duties that prohibit sexual satisfaction. Her problem is actually symptomatic of the hypocrisy of her entire life, as it depicts an impious woman who seeks to preserve God and live happily ever after.

title: The War of Art
description: "Art of War" merges with "The Artist's Way" in this straightforward yet uplifting guide to conquer all types of creative block.

title: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart Presents America (The Book) Teacher's Edition
authors: Jon Stewart;The Writers of The Daily Show
description: For those who couldn't afford the hardcover, the New York Times bestseller has been released in trade paperback.
