The book now features updated photos of the latest Supreme Court justices and was edited by a respected college professor, along with historical errors and falsehoods corrected by an authentic bearded college instructor.

title: Feynman's Rainbow
description: Leonard Mlodinow sought advice from Richard Feynman, a Nobel Prize-winning physicist, during his time at Cal Tech. By studying the conversations and analysis of their meetings, this book offers revealing insights into Feyer's life and career as he moves on in his final years.

title: Three Weeks with My Brother
description: The story of two brothers, Nicholas Sparks and his brother, who embarked on a three-week trip around the world in January 2003, is as heartening as ever.

title: Sister Freaks
description: A compilation of inspiring stories about young women who sacrificed everything for Jesus is presented by Rebecca St. James, a bestselling author and award-winning singer.

title: Strip Tease
description: Tourist Season's author weaves together murder, politics, and societal tension in this gripping suspenseful story. A strip joint experiences become comical due to an outburst of drunken revelry, elevating the party to a point of menace for big money and big government.

title: The Guardian
description: Before her husband's death, Julie Barenson had two surprise gifts: a Great Dane puppy named Singer and the assurance that he would always be there for her. Now four years later, she is still living in Swansboro, North Carolina. She is emotionally prepared to choose between Richard Franklin, despite her previous relationships with Mike Harris, who treats her like king.

title: True Believer
description: Jeremy Marsh, a science journalist who regularly writes for Scientific American, is an expert in debunking supernatural theories. He travels to Boone Creek, North Carolina and hopes to uncover the truth about the spirits that haunt the town's cemetery. However, his only hope of finding love is with Lexie Darnell, the granddaughter of the psychic who has taken on his daughter.

title: 1st to Die
description: A group of four friends in the Women's Murder Club series, which began with James Patterson and features Lindsay Boxer, Claire Washburn, Jill Bernhardt, and Cindy Thomas solving crimes. The quartet is facing a deadly confrontation in San Francisco as they work together to solve crimes that have been widely condemned by critics.

title: Fear and Loathing
description: The "gonzo" political commentator presents his subjective observations on the personalities and political machinations of the 1972 presidential campaign in a new edition of this classic account of American politics.

title: The Black Dahlia
description: The discovery of a beautiful young woman's tortured body in unused abandoned lot in Los Angeles on January 15, 1947, prompts Bucky Bleichert and Lee Blanchard to embark on the most significant manoeuver in California history.

title: Robert Ludlum's (TM) The Arctic Event
description: The discovery of a mysterious aircraft from the World War II era on an isolated Canadian island prompts the Russian Federation to reveal its unmarked plane, which vanished with its crew over fifty years ago. To prevent any political and diplomatic problems, the U.S. president sends Deputy Attorney General Dr. Jon Smith and his team to the crash site in search of explosives. Meanwhile, other teams have ventured into the cold, windy locations across North Carolina to investigate the wreckage.

title: The Closers
description: Despite leaving his position three years ago, Detective Harry Bosch joins the elite Open/Unsolved Unit in LA to help solve murder cases that were flawed, delayed, or left unfinished.

title: The Haunted Bridge
description: A double homicide case centers around Nancy Drew's involvement in a bridge that is believed to be haunted and the disappearance of jewel thieves.

title: Anne of Avonlea
description: Anne, who is now sixteen years old, returns to Avonlea to teach at her former school and strives to earn the respect of younger students.

title: The Mysteries of Sherlock Holmes
description: Sherlock Holmes, the expert in deductive reasoning, employs his friend Dr. John Watson to solve various mysteries and find out why he is so bright at 221 Baker Street in the morning. Why does Watson speak so loudly? From Twitterature: The World's Greatest Books in Twenty Tweets or Less.

title: Nancy Drew Starter Set
description: The starter set, which is priced at $199, includes six of Nancy Drew's favorite books: "The Secret of the Old Clock," The Hidden Staircase, The Bungalow Mystery, and The Mystery at Lilac Inn, Shadow Ranch," and Red Gate Farm.

title: Lara's Leap of Faith
description: The Royal Ballet School's first year featuring Ellie is a time of exhilaration, strain, homelessness, an unexpected performance opportunity, and new friendships, only made worse by the rude and derogatory conduct of Lara, the girl she had just met at her audition.

title: Who Was John F. Kennedy?
description: Describes the president's tenure, which included his involvement in the Cuban Missile Crisis, founding the Peace Corps, and being assassinated during his first term.

title: Isabelle's Perfect Performance
description: During their second term at the Royal Ballet School, Ellie and her friends are getting ready for a crucial assessment of their dancing and are also trying to establish kinship with Isabelle, despite her newfound friendliness.

title: Boys Or Ballet?
description: Despite being preoccupied with Luke's company, Ellie is forced to make a tough decision when she is chosen for the Royal Opera House Christmas ballet due to her overwhelming workload of homework, friends, rehearsals, and responsibilities.

title: Who Was Anne Frank?
description: Examines Anne Frank's life before the secret annex, her experiences in hiding against the Nazis, and the significance of her diary.

title: The Gift of Asher Lev
description: Asher Lev, a painter, returns to his native Brooklyn after two decades of living with his uncle's death and is confronted with contrasting emotions between his birthplace and life.

title: Wartime Lies
description: A spooky and unforgettable novel by Louis Begley about an orphaned boy and his aunt, who manage to survive the war under assumed false identities.

title: Naked Came the Manatee
description: A serialized suspense story written by thirteen Florida writers, including Dave Barry, Carl Hiaasen, and Elmore Leonard, includes odd events such as a riot in Coconut Grove and an appearance by Fidel Castro.

title: Murder in Foggy Bottom
description: The reprint features the work of suave investigator Max Pauling, who is both an admirer of the birds and a shadowy militia group, as they investigate three plane crashes that lead readers from the State Department to the rogue black markets of Russia.

title: Your Oasis on Flame Lake
description: Your Oasis on Flame Lake, a small cabaret club located in Dick Lindstrom's tastefully decorated basement in White Falls, Minnesota, is the dream come true for the Cadillac salesman.

title: The Bride Finder
description: Septimus Fitzleger, also known as the Bride Finder, calls upon Madeline Breton to rescue Anatole St. Leger from his isolation in a castle in Cornwall, but she ends up trapped in an imaginary world of ghosts.

title: A Thread of Grace
description: Claudette Blum and her father make their way to Italy from the Alps, where they find themselves faced with an open battleground of Nazi concentration camps.

title: Children of God
description: The priest, Emilio Sandoz, embarks on a quest to dispel the idea of God's providence, which leads him to question the validity of faith.

title: Catching Alice
description: Discouraged by the loss of her job, apartment, and boyfriend, twentysomething Alice Lewis agrees to have her American girlfriend, Tash, move to Los Angeles for a PR job. However, she soon finds herself at odds with an unknown man who has traveled extensively to pursue her. Reissue.

title: A Pirate Looks at Fifty
description: The singer-songwriter and author commemorates his 50th birthday by recounting the events that led to him becoming a musician, writer, and journalist, as well as sharing some of his life's journey.

title: Midnight Voices
description: Upon moving to her new spouse's apartment on Central Park West with her two children, Caroline experiences the disturbing truth about her son'destroyment when a young girl disappears and Caroline' daughter begins to waste it.

title: Murder at Ford's Theatre
description: Two law enforcement officials, Rick Klayman and Moses "Mo" Johnson, uncover the truth about Nadia Zarinski, a young theatre volunteer who was an intern and sexually involved with some powerful right-wing Senator.

title: The Changeling
description: In the genres of FICTION-ROMANCE/GOTHIC,

title: Lost Boy  Lost Girl
description: A woman's bizarre suicide and the disappearance of her teenage son Mark entice Timothy Underhill to his hometown of Millhaven, where his investigation uncovers an area haunted by a serial killer and an abandoned house that may have been inhabited by another girl.

title: Iberia
description: The author's personal thoughts and recollections, along with photographs, contribute to the informal portrayal of Spanish culture and lifestyle.

title: The Bridge at Andau
description: The Bridge at Andau by James A. Michener is the most gripping account of a doomed rebellion that holds as much significance and poignancy as any of his best-selling novels.

title: Drifters
description: In Torremolinos, Spain, eight wanderers from three generations are thrown together.

title: Journey
description: The author of the best-selling novel Mexico reprints an account of four English nobles and their Irish servant risking their lives to find Klondike gold on a treacherous expedition across the Arctic in 1897.

title: Driving Force
description: Ex-jockey Freddie Croft, who owned a successful business selling horse vans, becomes embroiled in the murder of 'a hitchhiker' who was found dead.

title: Darker Than Amber
description: A girl is rescued from a bridge in Florida by McGee.

title: Asylum
description: The famous horror novel's conclusion features Oliver Metcalf, a newspaperman, who discovers the secret behind the terrifying terrors in Blackstone, New England, when an unexpected package arrives on his doorstep.

title: Centennial
description: With CENTENNIAL, Michener once again proves that he is the greatest writer in America. The publication is available for purchase at Pittsbourg Pressa.

title: Ice Castles
description: Despite being blinded in an accident, Alexis Winston is determined to become a champion figure skater and trains regularly.

title: Winter of Magic's Return
description: Wellington, Earl, and Heather discover that a nuclear holocaust has occurred five centuries later and are convinced that an enchanted pulpit is on the horizon, leading them to attempt to rectify the world's misfortunes.

title: Indian Givers
description: Describes the extensive and long-lasting effects of Native American cultural heritage on both American and European communities.

title: The Dragon Doesn't Live Here Anymore
description: A collection of insightful essays written by the author for Dare to Be Yourself is intended to assist readers in achieving personal spirituality and self-discovery. Revision.

title: The All-true Travels and Adventures of Lidie Newton
description: Presents the pre-Civil War accounts of an abolitionist who, in 1855, became involved in the conflict between Kansas free-staters and slaveholders in Missouri.

title: And I Don't Want to Live this Life
description: Most of us would have thought it was just another terrible headline, but for Deborah Spungen, the mother of Nancy who was murdered at the Chelsea Hotel, it felt both beautiful and sad. "Her heartbreaking story is a testament to the strength and bravery of her daughter, who almost destroyed her parents' marriage and the happiness of the rest of their family."

title: Davita's Harp
description: Despite the challenges of her upbringing in Spain during the Spanish Civil War and World War II, Davita Chandal, daughter of a non-believing Jewish mother and devoted gentile father, both of whom were Communists, finds solace in Judaism as remembrance and spiritual sustenance.

title: The Tin Can Tree
description: After the tragic death of Janie Rose, the Pike family, including her ten-year-old brother Simon, face their own grief in different ways. The Reader's Guide includes the first printing and reissue.

title: Rabbit at Rest
description: John Updike's fourth and final book about Harry "Rabbit" Angstrom is the culmination of a successful literary process that includes acquiring an apartment in Florida, tying the knot with his second grandchild, receiving mixed signals from relatives and friends, as well as being sent home by his daughter-in-law.

title: The Shining
description: Danny, a five-year-old boy, is shimmering and bright with psychic voltage. His father's role as the caretaker of an old hotel causes his visions to spiral out of control, while also creating danger for the hotel due to blizzards. Who are the mysterious guests in the abandoned building?

title: The Dark Half
description: This novel, authored by Thad Beaumont, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of CARRIE, SALEM'S LOT, THE SHINING, and CHRISTINE, follows George Stark, who has transformed into a wealthy thriller writer. He is no longer entertaining people and wants to end his life.

title: Nightmares and Dreamscapes
description: A compilation of horror sagas.

title: 'Salem's Lot
description: One of the most savage vampire novels, Salem's Lot, chronicles the besieged town of "an average town" and its cunning exploration of dark veins and small-scale American villains.

title: The Dead Zone
description: Following a four-and-half year coma, Johnny Smith wakes up with the ability to see the future and know the death zone, which is an unsettling power that he cannot escape.

title: Fools Die
description: Merlyn and his brother, Artie, are now engrossed in the corruption and violence that exist within their professions of gambling, publishing, and film production.

title: I Never Promised You a Rose Garden
description: Describes the three-year struggle of a mentally unstable, yet intelligent girl who battled against her own made world, emphasizing her bond with the physician who empowered her to break free from the realm of fantasy.

title: The Gunslinger
description: Roland, the ultimate gunlinger in the world, pursues a mysterious Man in Black and fights against both mortal and otherworldly forces.

title: Cujo
description: King's top-selling book is a must-read for fans of his rabid appetite for violence.

title: For the New Intellectual
description: The first non-fiction book by Ayn Rand, presented here, is a challenge to the conventional philosophical ideas of our time and the atmosphere of guilt (terrified), panic (desperate, hopeless, dull, and all-pervasive evasion) that they generate. It is an important and relevant guide for people who want to understand existence, just as they did sixty years ago. In the title essay, she provides insight into Western culture's growth, the reasons for its development, her writing style in general, but also offers some tips on how it was left us.

title: The Virtue of Selfishness
description: Provides a compilation of essays that clarify the ethical principles of the writer's philosophy, Objectivism.

title: The Eyes of the Dragon
description: When Flagg, the wicked court magician, spots a mouse chance on 'a grain of dragon sand' behind Prince Peter's shelves and die--as did the king-but in fire and smoke -- then he plots to keep Peter locked up in the Needle and take over the kingdom. Reissue.

title: Skeleton Crew
description: The grandmaster of horror fiction merges ancient symbols of terror with the iconography of modern American society in this compilation of twenty-two tales. Reissue.

title: It
description: A group of teenagers encounter an evil entity that will lead them back to Derry, Maine, for a final battle. Revision.

title: The Langoliers
description: A flight from Los Angeles to Boston yields only 11 survivors, but landing in a lifeless atmosphere is reminiscent of the past.

title: Matters of Choice
description: Whether Dr. Roberta Cole is willing to keep the medical secrets of a desperate girl or let them slip away to preserve his love for her husband, who has overcome her own painful marriage.

title: The Bone Collector
description: The first novel in the series by Detective Lincoln Rhyme, written by the New York Times bestseller author of The Stone Monkey, is sure to frighten readers.

title: Thinner
description: Useful only in schools and libraries. Lawyer Billy Halleck is forced to undertake a nightmarish journey to confront the demise of an old gypsy woman who was fatally shot by his car after being diagnosed with wasting flesh-to-blood.

title: Ritual Sins
description: Rachel Connery is determined to eliminate the man who had remunerated her mother with millions of dollars, while also challenging Luke Bardell, a notoriously manipulative and charismatic person who enjoys trying. Original.

title: Wizard and Glass
description: During their time traveling between worlds, Roland the Gunslinger and his companions experience an inner turmoil that is felt only when they are experiencing love.

title: The Running Man
description: The year 2025 will be the time when America's elite men don't run for president but rather vie for their lives, winning the ultimate death-defying competition.

title: Devil's Embrace
description: Cassandra Brougham is abducted by Lord Anthony Welles, who then takes her English fiance to Italy and attempts to force her into marriage.

title: The Stranger Beside Me
description: Based on the viewpoint of the ex-policewoman, crime writer, and elusive friend, recounts the story of Ted Bundy, a gifted law student who was executed for murdering three women, but later confessed to killing 35 more.

title: Trauma
description: In this short novel about the hidden menace of everyday life, Bonnie Winter, a working mother and wife who is responsible for cleaning up crime scenes, finds herself caught up in the horrors of what people do to each other daily. Original.

title: Dead Sleep
description: The mysterious series of paintings at a Hong Kong art museum, which features resemblances of women who appear almost identical to one another, leads photojournalist Jordan Glass in revealing her quest to find the culprit behind her twin sister's murder, as she engages in deadly battles with the covert killer who knows all about her.

title: Blessings from the Other Side
description: The well-known psychic compiles a list of holiday reflections, forgiveness, and various celebrations.

title: The pillars of the earth
description: A tale filled with zeal and utopia, featuring a team of individuals from the Middle Ages who are fated to be involved in the construction of ecclesiastical structures.

title: The Love You Make
description: The personal life of the Beatles, including their early years in Liverpool, their rise to fame in pop music, and the death of John Lennon in 1980, is portrayed by a friend and business manager for the band.

title: Trapped
description: A psychopathic con artist kidnaps Will and Karen Jennings' five-year-old daughter, prompting the couple to fight back and rescue her.

title: Jackdaws
description: As the Allies get ready to invade Nazi-occupied Europe, British special operations agent Felicity "Flick" Clariet must now work alongside an all-woman team to destroy German communication lines.

title: The Oath
description: Attorney Dismas Hardy, representing Dr. Eric Kensing, a man charged with murdering the head of San Francisco's largest HMO, uncovers evidence that threatens his friendship with homicide lieutenant Abe Glitsky and family.

title: The Key to Rebecca
description: The classic World War II thriller features a Jewish girl and ruthless British officer, as well as scheming Nazis targeting Cairo during the attack by Rommel's army. Reprint.

title: Black Like Me
description: A writer of Caucasian descent recounts his time in the American South after undergoing botched treatments, and shares his perspective on the challenges of racism and discrimination.

title: The Man from St. Petersburg
description: A conglomeration of world-changing, ultimately fatal events was initiated by two men, one of whom was a high-ranking Russian envoy and the other occupant of Europe's underground, just before the outbreak of World War I.

title: Codebreakers' Victory
description: Haufler's comprehensive analysis of World War II codebreaking is a groundbreaking work, drawing on years of research, interviews, and the examination of secret archives to reveal how cryptography brought down the Japanese and Germans.

title: No Second Chance
description: A ransom note arrives as Dr. Marc Seidman is left in a hospital bed, wounded by an unsuspected attacker who shot him twice. His wife has also been killed, and his baby daughter is missing.

title: A Case of Need
description: The initial novel features a young woman who dies suddenly on an operating table, followed by her physician who is charged with murder. A colleague's investigation follows him from ruthless sexual misconduct and drug trafficking to the highest point of Boston society as he seeks closure.

title: The Drawing of the Three
description: Roland is enticed by a portal of time and space into the twentieth-century world of drug-and-crime to confront nefarious forces that seek to prevent him from reaching the Dark Tower.

title: A Whole Lotta Love
description: With Over the Rainbow by Donna Hill, Jessica Morgan, Monica Jackson, and Francis Ray, all four curvaceous women find love and romance in a delightful collection.

title: Night Over Water
description: An English aristocrat, heiress, German scientist, killer, thieves and beautiful woman are among the desperate passengers who board the most luxurious airliner ever built to escape England just two days after the declaration of war against Germany in 1939 (reprint. 12,000 first printing).

title: Monkeewrench
description: The murder mystery computer game's creator, Grace McBride, and her team are frightened when the killer takes advantage of the situation by replicating it in real life.

title: On Wings of Eagles
description: Represents the gruesome account of Col. Bull Simons' successful prison escape, which involved saving two Texas citizens imprisoned in a Teheran jail on behalf of Ross Perot.

title: The Agony and the Ecstasy
description: A historical novel that celebrates the five hundredth anniversary of Michelangelo's famous David sculpture is a true-to-life account of his life, including his love affairs, disagreements with cardinals and popes, and his involvement in the Sistine Chapel.

title: The Innocent
description: Despite being released from jail, Matt Hunter's hopes of moving on with his pregnant wife are dashed when he is the target of a serial murder investigation.

title: Dispatch
description: Although he is an accomplished letter writer, Jason Handford's offer of writing for money results in unpleasant consequences.

title: Dark Lover
description: Wrath, the sole purebred vampire left on Earth, becomes the daughter of Beth Randall and is ushered into the undead world where she must fulfill her destiny with him after one of his most trusted fighters was killed. Original.

title: The Godfather
description: A Mafia family portrait showcases the life and times of patriarch Don Vito Corleone, a godfather from Sicily-America, and his sons.

title: Black Sunday
description: An Arab terrorist group hires an American Navy pilot to carry out a bombing at the Super Bowl football game.

title: Bitter is the New Black
description: This funny book follows the adventures and mishaps of a woman who loses her dream job, perfect life, and perfect man when she goes from earning millions to being unemployed. Original.

title: A Certain Justice
description: This book delves into the concept of justice-related injustices, depicting an ordinary man who is hunted, hounded, and almost destroyed for a crime he did not commit.

title: Lover Eternal
description: The Scribe Virgin's cursed vampire, Rhage, who is a fierce warrior and the dark side of the story, discovers salvation in Mary Luce, the innocent beauty he has sworn to protect. Together, they battle their enemies and strive for eternal love. Original.

title: Promise Me
description: The entertainment agent, Myron Bolitar (far right) takes the young girl on his home to stop him taking a ride from an intoxicated driver who is trying to take her away, only to have to rescue her later when she vanishes so he can come clean of his mistake.

title: Lover Awakened
description: Zsadist, the most feared member of the Black Dagger Brotherhood, saves Bella from the evil Lessening Society, but his anger towards her tormentors makes him almost insane, and he must confront his tortured past to have a future with this brave beauty who is his destiny. Original.

title: Belle Ruin
description: In the woods near her small hometown, twelve-year-old cub reporter Emma Graham discovers clues surrounding a forty-yr old unsolved crime that involved discovering deeply buried family secrets.

title: What Angels Fear
description: Sebastian St. Cyr, a young emancipated member of the family, emerges from hiding as the prime suspect in the brutal rape and murder of 'a minor whose corpse has been found in an ancient church, while her younger brother is pursued by ruthless powerbrokers linked to the Prince Regent.

title: The Last Templar
description: Tess Chaykin, an archaeologist, is joined by FBI anti-terrorist specialist Sean Reilly for an investigation after being attacked at the Vatican exhibit's opening gala by four horsemen dressed as Templar Knights who stole an artifact.

title: The Old Wine Shades
description: NOW IN PAPERBACK, THE NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER IS PURCHASING.

title: Bright Lights  Big Ass
description: The author of the best-selling book Bitter Is the New Black has written a humorous new memoir that chronicles the unpleasant aspects of her life in the big city, including reporting rude neighbors to Homeland Security and having ties with her local grocery store clerk before ultimately losing the Battle of Stairmaster.

title: Angel Christmas
authors: Topaz;Mary Balogh;Emma Merritt;Marilyn Campbell;Patricia Rice;Carole Nelson Douglas
description: "Guarded by Angels," "The Trouble With Angelina," and "Catch a Falling Angel" are among the five yuletide romances that explore the idea of divine intervention. Original includes Mary Balogh, Marilyn Campbell, Carole Nelson Douglas, Emma Merritt, and Patricia Rice.

title: Shadow Lover
description: After caring for her dying Aunt Sally, the only mother she has ever known, Carolyn Smith is shocked to learn that her son Alex had come back after eighteen years, having witnessed his murder on the night of his supposed disappearance. Afterward, she rushes to expose the sensual fraud and plunges herself into a world of sinister passions and deceit. Original.

title: The Medusa Stone
description: The American spy satellite Medusa failed and crashed ten years ago, but its malfunctioning sensors only revealed a hidden secret deep in the Earth that many will never be able to reveal or even hold.

title: Pandora's Curse
description: A secretive fifty-year-old document from World War II, kept at a top-secret Nazi submarine facility, could result in utter disaster for the modern world unless geologist Philip Mercer and his colleague Anika Klein can convince him otherwise.

title: River of Ruin
description: While attempting to uncover the Panama Canal, geologist Philip Mercer was involved in a complicated Chinese scheme that aimed to change the world's power dynamics.

title: Deep Fire Rising
description: A secretive order known as the Order and their ambition to dominate the world are revealed by Dr. Philip Mercer, a wealthy geologist responsible for overseeing the construction of'regular' nuclear waste holding tank at Area 51 in Nevada.

title: Jerusalem Inn
description: A Christmas vacation is spent by Superintendent Richard Jury of Scotland Yard at a colorful country inn, which is situated near opulent and home to the entitled, wealthy, famous (and unexpectedly deceased) individuals. Reprint.

title: Vulcan's Forge
description: The eruption of a Pacific Ocean volcano leads to heightened global competition for control when it is revealed that Vulcan's Forge can supply an infinite amount of clean nuclear energy.

title: Charon's Landing
description: The Alaska pipeline is the subject of a multi-million dollar scam paid in part by rogue Arab oil minister, as Russian maverick Ivan Kerikov accidentally meets with geologist Philip Mercer, leading to the unraveling of an intricate web of ecological and economic terrorism.

title: Lover Revealed
description: The only person left in the inner circle of the Black Dagger Brotherhood is ex-cop Butch O'Neal, whose heart was broken when he saved a civilian vampire from being consumed by the evil spirits.

title: Robot Visions
description: Featuring classic and innovative pieces, this book is a visionary look at humanity's future relationship with robots, featuring eighteen stories and essays that span Asimov'oeuvre. The book has been reissued.

title: Dealing in Futures
description: Eleven of the author's greatest stories are included in this book, spanning from beyond our understanding to a terrifying future Earth. Original: By the writer of The Forever War.

title: Bored of the Rings
description: The Harvard Lampoon features a humorous parody of J. R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy book, The Lord of the Rings, written by two authors. Reprint.

title: The Innkeeper's Song
description: While searching for his deceased lover, Tikat encounters three women who each have their own impossible plans.

title: The Forest House
description: The story of Eilan in Druidic England revolves around her love for a young Roman soldier, but also her desire to become ordained as prelates to her Goddess.

title: Not of Woman Born
description: Michael Armstrong, Robert Silverberg, Susan Palwick, and other authors have contributed to a compilation of stories that explore the impact of modern science on human perceptions of conception, birth, parenting, etc.

title: The River's Gift
description: A remarkable horse from the woods will give Ariella a special treat as she spends her time caring for the animals in the forest.

title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
description: In his London laboratory, a humane scientist endeavors to uncover the most disgraceful elements of malevolence.

title: Les Miserables a New Unabridged Translation
description: Jean Valjean has been incarcerated for nineteen years and finds it tough to adapt to the outside world that despises and discredits him.

title: Arrowsmith
description: A man of science must triumph over public ignorance and the petty indulgences of his friends as he seeks to acquire knowledge.

title: The Call of the Wild and Selected Stories
description: Contains stories that portray the adventures and hardships of individuals in the cold Yukon and other northern regions.

title: The Odyssey
description: The prose translation features Odysseus' journey back to his homeland after the Trojan War.

title: Great Dialogues of Plato
description: The Republic, Apology, Crito Phaido, Ion, Meno and Symposium have all been translated into a new edition which highlights the genius of Plato as he grappled with education, justice and the "philosopher king," as well as utopian ideals of society. Reprint. BAKER & TAYLOR Bks.

title: The Hunchback of Notre-Dame
description: Set in the middle ages of medieval Paris, Quasimodo, the tall bellinger of Notre-Dame Cathedral, finds himself fighting to prevent the beautiful gypsy dancer Esmeralda from being executed. Reissue.

title: Paradise Lost and Paradise Regained
description: Reprints the two epic poems written by the English poet in the seventeenth century, which deal with the destruction, fall, and redemption of humanity, as well as the ethical and spiritual dilemmas of God's judgment.

title: Ten Great Works of Philosophy
description: This collection explores the history of civilization from ancient Greece to America in the 19th century, using the works of its most influential writers such as Plato, Aristotle, St. Thomas Aquinas, John Stuart Mill, and others.

title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer  And  Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: Two popular American novels are now released, featuring Twain's timeless classics that tell the story of two boys' lives along the Mississippi River, an updated bibliography, and a new introduction.

title: The Death of Ivan Ilych and Other Stories
description: Tolstoy's most renowned and significant stories are contained in one book, covering four major themes: murder, greed, lust, vanity, and love.

title: Anne of Green Gables
description: Green Gables, a farm near Avonlea, Prince Edward Island is where the alluring redhead Anne Shirley begins her journey. When she discovers that the elderly Cuthberts were considering adopting fewer children, she endeavors to gain their favor and readership.

title: Grade 4 Common Core Exemplar Collection
description: Publisher's website states that "Common Core Classroom Collections comprise a range of titles that reflect the level of complexity and quality demanded by the Common Core State Standards."

title: The Origin of Species
description: Describes the proof behind an evolutionary theory, provides an explanation of how evolution occurs, and covers instinct, hybridism, fossils, distribution, classification, etc.

title: The Travels of Marco Polo
description: From his native Venice to the farthest reaches of Asia, Marco Polo follows him through the 13th century by foot, horse, and boat, traveling through Persia (historically in Africa), Tibet, India, China... with a new Foreword.

title: Around the World in Eighty Days
description: Describes the journey of Phileas Fogg and Passepartout, an English gentleman, during the late 1800s as they traveled around the world.

title: David Copperfield
description: David Copperfield faces his abusive stepfather and the betrayal of his scheming aunt, Uriah Heep, leading to a new beginning for him in boarding school and eventually falling in love with Dora.

title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
description: Traces Stephen Dedalus, a dissident artist, through his childhood and later years in college, where he challenges the norms of his educational institution.

title: Chekhov  the Major Plays
description: The collection of classic plays, including Ivanov (1889), The Sea Gull (1896), Uncle Vanya (1902), Three Sisters (1901), and The Cherry Orchard (1904), is a stunning display of naturalistic drama.

title: The Autobiography of Andrew Carnegie and the Gospel of Wealth
description: Explains the journey of Andrew Carnegie, recalling how he left Scotland at the age of thirteen, began working in a modest job at bobbin factory, and eventually became wealthy, with most of his earnings going to charity.

title: Four Plays
description: Classic Greek plays showcase a mockery of Socrates, ill-fated utopias, aspirations for peace, and entreachenes between playwrights who have passed away.

title: The Oedipus Plays of Sophocles
description: Includes the entire texts of Sophocles' Theban trilogy, which portrays the decline of a noble family from its wealth and authority through pride, incest, suicide, and murder.

title: Atlas Shrugged
description: The choices made by certain industrial leaders shattered the foundations of capitalism and restore man's self-reflection as a hero.

title: Sleeping Beauty Novels
description: Embrace the boldness of Anne Rice, writing as A. N. Roquelaure, with this beautifully repackaged boxed set of the three erotic novels in her famous Sleeping Beauty trilogy.

title: Stephen King's Creepshow
description: The comic strips depict a dead man coming out of the tomb, an unusual meteor, venomous monsters, husbands' bitter revenge, and pests.

title: Song of Solomon
description: The novel introduces readers to a world of magic and richness, which includes four generations of African American people. All rights reserved.

title: Because it is Bitter  and Because it is My Heart
description: The 1950s in upstate New York witness a murderous street fight between two distinct individuals, and the conflict is so bizarre that it leads to an unsettling relationship.

title: When Food is Love
description: The connection between eating disorders and the desire for intimacy explains how they affect intimate relationships, while also explaining why many people overeat in order to satisfy their emotional needs. First printing: 50,000 copies.

title: Feeding the Hungry Heart
description: Explains the experiences of obsessive eaters, their obsession with both food and thinness, and offers tips on how to change one's eating habits. Reissue.

title: Breaking Free from Compulsive Eating
description: Offers readers the necessary guidance and practical assistance to rewire their unhealthy eating habits.

title: The Porcelain Dove  Or  Constancy's Reward
description: A dark and opulent novel with tales of magic, romance, and nobles, written by the family's chattel chambermaid.

title: For Keeps
description: "Hud" to "Dances with Wolves," among others, is the title of a collection of film reviews that were picked from the author's previous collections.

title: In the Time of the Butterflies
description: A fourth Mirabal Sister, a survivor of the Dominican Republic's revolutionary struggle, recounts the life and death of three sisters who joined the opposition to the Trujillo dictatorship in the 1950s. They were held captive and tortured while their soldiers watched on, but they were attacked one night by an ambush.

title: Zombie
description: A sex offender named Quentin P is on his way to prison after being released from jail, where he sets out to carry out a series of murders in gruesome detail.

title: The McDougall Quick and Easy Cookbook
description: Over 300 easy-to-prepare recipes for healthy salads, appetizers and main dishes, as well as desserts – from the McDougall Program to The McDermott Cookbook — are available, with all of them being meatless, dairyless and almost fat-free. Reprint.

title: Man Crazy
description: Traces the journey of a young woman from her childhood with her mother to her involvement with cult and her struggle to rid herself of its impact on her.

title: Savage Love
description: With a unique and humorous perspective, Savage delves into the realm of human sexuality and offers advice on various provocative issues.

title: Journals of Ayn Rand
description: The personal writings of a prominent writer from the 1900s illustrate the evolution of Rand's literary and philosophical concepts.

title: Something to Declare
description: The author narrates her journey as a daughter of Dominican Republic immigrants and her subsequent endeavors to integrate into the literary world.

title: Anthem
description: In a post-Marovani society where all individuality has been destroyed, aspiring men seek to defy collectivism by engaging in personal decisions, seeking forbidden knowledge, and be with the woman they desire, as described in Equality 7-2521.

title: The Feeling Good Handbook
description: Describes methods for conquering fears, phobias, and panic attacks; improving intimate communication, handling anxiety disorders, including the use of prescribed psychiatric drugs.

title: Beauty's Punishment
description: Beauty is sold as erotic slavery and subjected to strict supervision by the Captain and Mistress Lockley.

title: Hot Chocolate for the Mystical Lover
description: Announces 101 couples who have been brought together by the power of God and other miracles.

title: The Bluest Eye
description: Pecola Breedlove's narrative portrays the upbringing of an eleven-year-old Black girl in a society that values blondes with blue eyes and the aftermath of her desire to be accepted.

title: We Were the Mulvaneys
description: Initially, the Mulvaneys were fortunate and close, but their relationship eventually crumbles when their youngest son, Judd, discovers their past and sets out to bring them back together.

Transmits a spine-chilling image of the future, where 'the totalitarian regime that dominates all aspects of life and governs every citizen as if it were an artificially created world' and takes charge of all citizens, becoming increasingly powerful with age.

title: Riding the Bus with My Sister
description: The writer recounts the time she and her sister spent a year traveling on the buses of Pennsylvania, and how participating in those trips helped her to slow down her life and build stronger relationships.

title: A Long Short War
description: Presents an account of a witness who witnessed the 2003 war in Iraq, and maintains that it began in 1990 with Saddam Hussein's invasion of Kuwait, while also exploring how the conflict has caused division among people.

title: Stolen
description: The author of Bitten. Reprint writes about the ordeal of being the only female werewolf alive at thirty years old, who is determined to confront Tyrone Winsloe, an Internet billionaire who has been capturing Elena's paranormal brethren, conducting experiments on them, and hunting them to their deaths in a live video game.

title: Bitten
description: On the eve of their wedding, Elena Michaels finds out that her fiance has been keeping his werewolves hidden and even turned her into one.

title: The Jane Austen Book Club
description: Six Californians come together for a book club to discuss Jane Austen's novels, but their lives are consumed by complicated marriages, unrequited relationships, and evolving love life. Written by Sarah Canary. Reprint.

title: How the García Girls Lost Their Accents
description: After an attempted coup, Carlos and his wife Laura, along with four daughters, were forced to flee their native Caribbean island. The Garcias must now embrace a new way of life in the Bronx while still holding onto what they once held dear.

title: War and Peace and War
description: Imputes that the foundation of an empire is a community's capacity for collective action, which results from individuals coming together to combat if one person opposes another person on the same level. Additionally, highlights how empire expansion leads to increased conflict rather than cooperation, and ultimately dissolution. Reprint. 25,000 first edition.

title: The Bachman Books
description: The early works of Stephen King, authored by Richard Bachman, are included in this compilation.

title: The Sword and the Shield
description: The FBI's discovery of a remarkable body of secret papers provides insight into the history of the past 100 years, as well as information about every nation.

title: The Clock Of The Long Now
description: Using the Clock of the Long Now as a framework, this book offers practical tips on how to use long-term thinking and avoid it in public.

title: The Evolution of Desire
description: The origin of human mating behavior is revisited in fascinating new research by David Buss.

title: Crime And Punishment In American History
description: The criminal justice system's evolution can be traced back to colonial times, which have also been influenced by changes in American culture, economics, politics, and social structure.

title: The Culture of Fear
description: The Culture of Fear reveals that people today are more afraid than they were in the past, even during periods like war or the Great Depression.

title: The Drama of the Gifted Child
description: Why do many of the most accomplished individuals experience a sense of emptiness and isolation, and how can this insightful book help them navigate life with confidence?

title: Drama Of The Gifted
description: Addresses the issue of parental bullying, which has led to a decline in their child's self-esteem.

title: After Theory
description: After Theory, a book that charts the rise and fall of postmodern theory, examines its evolution from the 1960s to the 1990s.

title: The Pleasure of Finding Things Out
description: The renowned scientist's short biography, which includes his account of the space shuttle Challenger disaster and Nobel laureate speech, is included in a collection.

title: The Classical World
description: Robin Lane Fox's account of the history of armies, empires, statesmen, and tyrants over the course of one thousand years chronicles the two great civilizations that preceded the Western world.

title: Why is sex fun?
description: Why do human beings engage in private sex more frequently than other animals? What makes menopause rare among female mammals? Why does the human penis become excessively large? The author of THE THIRD CHIMPANZEE is well-versed in this topic.

title: Knowledge And Decisions
description: In The Vision of the Annointed, Thomas Sowell's seminal work on decision making is updated with a new preface by the author. He discusses how knowledge is shared and disseminated in modern society, highlighting the growing gap between personal knowledge and decision-making, which endangers freedom and economic and political efficiency.

title: Philosophy In The Flesh
description: How do we define human beings? What is the process by which knowledge is obtained? Where does ethics stem from? These questions have been the subject of debate among Western philosophers for centuries. They posited that we can know our own minds, most of our thinking about the world is literal, and that reason is disembodied and universal. However, empirical evidence has contradicted this notion, suggesting that most thought is unconscious and we lack direct conscious access to the mechanisms of thought and truth.

title: The Republic of Plato
description: The most accurate translation of Plato's Republic ever published has been acclaimed, and this second edition is the first to be translated literally. Professor Bloom, who wrote the original version in 1968, contributed a new introduction and an index that will help readers understand the true meaning of the text.

title: River Out of Eden
description: What is the origin of the replication bomb that has annihilated life, and where is it headed in the universe? Richard Dawkins tackles this ancient mystery with an unusual combination of humor and science-fiction sensibility.

title: Shattered Bonds
description: Remarks on a significant number of African-American children being placed in the U.S. foster care system, noting that black communities are negatively affected by racial differences and political policies that contribute to child poverty and family separation.

title: A Conflict Of Visions
description: The politics of the past and present exhibit a consistent pattern, with conflicts that persist for generations or centuries. In this well-known book, Thomas Sowell presents two competing visions of reason and power: the "constrained" version that views human nature as unchanging and self-serving, and the more flexible and imperfect "unconstricted" one. A Conflict of Visions provides reassurance that disputes over ethics and policy arise from the disparity between human values and ideals.

title: Applied Economics
description: A book that complements Basic Economics examines the use of economics in addressing global issues like healthcare, racism, and nation-building, scrutinizing their immediate and long-term effects on economic strategies.

title: Not Even Wrong
description: Has physics been misguided? Peter Woit presents the alternative viewpoint to string theory, contending that it is not within the realm of science.

title: Jane Austen For Dummies
description: Providing an easy-to-understand introduction to Jane Austen, this guide offers insights into her methods, motivations, and principles.

title: Personal Finance For Dummies
description: Personal finance consultants often offer advice that neglects investing, allowing individuals to plan their finances for success. Instead, they need to understand personal finance in all areas to achieve this. Personal Finance for Dummies, 5th Edition provides comprehensive financial guidance on debt consolidation, expenses, and investment strategies.

title: Crash Proof
description: There is no longer a theoretical realm to speculate on how the United States will experience an economic tipping point. Instead, the country has experienced deteriorating global economic conditions, currency weakness, and slowdowns in manufacturing. Peter Schiff provides sensitivity analysis of these factors and strategies for safeguarding investors.

title: eBay For Dummies
description: If you're interested in participating in eBay auctions, Fifth Edition is the perfect resource for those who want to make informed purchases and earn money.

title: Texas Hold'em For Dummies
description: The game of Texas Hold 'Em is the most commonly played among poker enthusiasts, whether they are at home or playing on the local television. Its straightforward structure allows for a diverse range of gameplay experiences, including honesty, dishonesty, fear, luck, and unexpected outcomes.

title: The Man Who Changed Everything
description: James Clerk Maxwell's biography is the first in twenty years of his life, featuring a scientist who was one of the most innovative thinkers of our time and whose discoveries had repercussions for the 20th century.

title: Extraordinary Popular Delusions and the Madness of Crowds and ConfusiÃ3n de Confusiones
description: The study of crowd behavior includes two historic books, Extraordinary Popular Delusions and the Madness of Crowds, as well as Confusions de Conflits. These volumes explore the impact of mob psychology on market dynamics. Reprint.

title: The Skeptic's Dictionary
description: A wealth of evidence for those who doubt and disseminate, including the latest shark cartilage scam and new'repressed memory' incongruity, is available to all.

title: Color Drawing
description: A completely revamped second edition of Michael Doyle's classic Color Drawing is a must-have for professionals and students who want to convey their design ideas through clear, eye-catching, and impressive color drawings. It includes an all-encompassing system that covers everything from sketching to final presentation drawing, with redesigned sections providing easy access to essential materials.

title: A Modernist View of Plated Desserts (Grand Finales)
description: "The American pastry industry has undergone a transformation, leading to the rise of modernity. Its innovative use of flavor combinations and visually striking designs is set it apart from past trends."

title: Bad Astronomy
description: Philip Plait's book, Bad Astronomy, is highly regarded by Stephen Maran, the author of Astronomie for Dummies and editor of The Astropaed. He has disproven many misconceptions about astronomy and space that were previously overlooked.

title: The Warren Buffett CEO
description: The Warren Buffet investment philosophy is outlined in this book, providing a comprehensive overview of the strategies and fundamentals employed by this successful management team.

title: The Science of Sherlock Holmes
description: The Science of Sherlock Holmes is a fascinating book, with Otto Penzler's description of his investigation as "insane and inexplicable."

title: All the Shah's Men
description: Based on declassified documents, including those from the CIA, this book offers a compelling account of the 1953 coup in Iran, which remains unresolved and is considered the first full-length work ever produced.

title: Information Technology for Management
description: The Fifth Edition of "Information Technology for Management" provides a comprehensive overview of how IT is changing business, with emphasis on the role of global IT players in achieving global competitiveness from Shanghai to San Francisco.

title: Limbo
description: Alfred Lubrano, an award-winning journalist, presents his story in Limbo, which explores the cultural divide between those raised in blue-collar homes and those who live in white- collar jobs. They are often left feeling disconnected from their working world and struggle to make sense of the unspoken rules that govern their lives.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java
description: Using a consistent object-oriented framework, Goodrich and Tamassia's Fourth Edition of Data Structures and Algorithms in Java provides accessible coverage of fundamental data structures. They also provide detailed descriptions and analysis of these structures, including simplified mathematical analyses using illustrations (with many illustrations) that support important analytical concepts.

title: The Warren Buffett Way
description: After a decade since the publication of The Warren Buffett Way by Robert Hagstrom, who is widely recognized as the greatest investor in history, many people still struggle to understand how this value investing mastermind can consistently generate billions in wealth, despite being labeled as untouchable.

title: Lady on the Hill
description: The book Lady on the Hill is a heartening read-and-feel novel that charts the decline of this once-desolate beauty for 35 years, without any government or outside foundation support. Its story centers on William A. V. Cecil, grandson of George Vanderbilt, who is both well-mannered and knowledgeable about his family's history and culture, but at the same time becomes enticed by ideas and enthusiasm, as described by Howard Cohen.

title: Baby Signing For Dummies
description: With over 100 illustrated signs, baby-specific signing techniques, and educational games, this guide is a hands-on resource that enhances the bond between parents and children. It also provides tips on how to incorporate baby signs into daycare settings, as well as ways to increase the IQ of babies in comparison to infants who do not sign.

title: Power of An Hour
description: Bob Burg recommends The Power of an Hour as a highly effective tool for achieving systematic change in your life or business.

title: The Science of Stephen King
description: From Proms to Cells: The Psychic World of Stephen King, Carrie's book, the Dead Zone, and Hearts in Atlantis Cell are featured.

title: Feminist Measures
description: Examines the impact of gender on poetic expression, the conflicts between poetry and modern literary theories, and the fluctuation between literary and theoretical writing.

title: Simulacra and Simulation
description: The initial comprehensive English translation of a significant postmodernist publication.

title: Their Sisters' Keepers
description: The investigation into prison reform marks a new chapter in the annals of women's justice in America.

title: The Will to Believe
description: Two works by the American psychologist address various aspects of intelligence, will, belief, chance, and free will.

title: Fads and Fallacies in the Name of Science
description: Reviews fads, hoaxes and cults are all propagated under the guise of being scientifically proven and founded.

title: Three Graphic Novels
description: HORACE WALPOLE, WILLIAM BECKFORD, JOHN POLIDORI, and LORD BYRON's FRAGMENT OF A NOVEL are the most well-known films in the series.

title: Best Science Fiction Stories of H. G. Wells
description: Among the eighteen paranormal stories, there are tales of an undead man, a Martian egg, and sperm-sucking orchids.

title: The World as Will and Representation
description: The German philosopher elucidates his ideas about intellectual perception and abstract representation and analyzes Kant's concepts and teachings critically.

title: Technical Manual and Dictionary of Classical Ballet
description: The "Technical Manual" by Gail Grant has long been a highly sought-after and successful reference book for ballet. With extensive revisions and updates, this third edition is essentially new and should be owned by every student, teacher, choreographer, and enthusiast of the discipline, even those who purchased the second edition.

title: Lost Continents
description: Examines the mythologies, mystic cults and literary works as well as dissident viewpoints that have been presented in Plato's dialogues about lost continents.

title: Mozart's Don Giovanni
authors: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart;Ellen H. Bleiler;Lorenzo Da Ponte
description: The greatest opera ever written is Don Giovanni, which has been praised as an almost flawless piece. Mozart's masterpiece features several popular songs such as "Aida," "La Boheme," and "Carmen." Its popularity was so great that Rossini chose "Don Giovanni" as his favorite choice, and this Dover edition includes the standard Italian libretto alongside a new English translation of the work.

title: 1001 Illuminated Initial Letters
description: In this book, the renowned Victorian designer Owen Jones showcases illuminated letters from an illustrated edition of "The Psalms of David," which are based on popular alphabet motifs copied by artists and designers across Europe and North America for over a century. Each page in this versatile archive contains approximately 40 exquisitely decorated individual letters. Additionally, there is another page with equally beautiful Arabic and Roman numerals. The collection's varied designs range from simple to impressive, and it includes intricate embellishments.

title: Galapagos
description: With more than 100 stunning illustrations, this captivating firsthand account of a 1923 expedition to survey the wildlife of the Galápagos Islands is truly unforgettable. Beebe, renowned biologist and explorer, merges literary talent with meticulous research to create an incredibly readable book. "High romance, precise science, fascinating history, and wild adventure." - Nation.

title: Bartleby and Benito Cereno
description: Two kings in one: "Bartleby," an alluring moral drama set in 19th-century New York, and "Benito Cereno," a thrilling sea voyage that explores the very essence of human sin.

title: Candide
description: Describes Candide, a young man with no sense of purpose, who is conscripted, ransacked, bootetched, and subjectedited to torture by the Inquisition but persists in his determination to survive.

title: Young Goodman Brown  and Other Short Stories
description: The title story, along with "The Birthmark," "Rappaccini’s Daughter," and "Lorenzo Ruglione’S Burial" are included in this selection of short fiction. Other stories explore scientific experimentation, witchcraft, revenge, and other themes.

title: The Gift of the Magi and Other Short Stories
description: Features sixteen short fiction stories by O. Henry, a writer from the 1800s, including the title story that portrays two married couples giving up their Christmas sacrifices.

title: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner and Other Poems
description: Included in the collection are a title poem with significant elements from "Kubla Khan," "Christabel," 20 sonnets, lyrics, odes, "Sonnet," and other classic poems.

title: A Diderot Pictorial Encyclopedia of Trades and Industry
description: The initial paperbound edition featuring 485 exceptional plates, with over 2,000 illustrations, showcases significant Enlightenment artwork. The images are highly detailed and include information on various subjects such as agriculture, science, engineering, mining, and more. It is an invaluable resource for those interested in art and craft.

title: The Road Not Taken  and Other Poems
description: "The road that separated two miles in a forest was the primary means of transportation, and I chose to go to the one less traveled."

title: The Secret Garden Coloring Book
description: Mary, who is ten years old, relocates to a secluded residence on the Yorkshire moors and uncovers an invalid family member and the secrets of enchanted gardens.

title: The Adventures of Jimmy Skunk
description: Describes how Jimmy Skunk thanks Peter Rabbit for pulling a practical joke, and what transpires when he and Billy Possum go egghunting in Farmer Brown's henhouse.

title: The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
description: This striking facsimile of Blake's romantic and revolutionary work showcases his fundamental wisdom and philosophy in a concise way. It includes 27 color plates of his captivating illustrations, along with his unique handwritten text.

title: Children's Christmas Stories and Poems
description: Dicken's "A Christmas Carol" is a condensed version that includes Christmas tales, poems, and songs.

title: A Modest Proposal and Other Satirical Works
description: A Treasury of five shorter works by the author of Gulliver's Travels contains ample evidence for the inspired lampoonery of the great satirist. These include the title piece, The Battle ofthe Books, A Meditation Upon an Broom-Stick, and a Discourse Concerning the Mechanical Operation of Spirit, as well as The Abolishing of Christianity in England.

title: Great Short Stories by American Women
description: Includes thirteen short stories written by American women in the 1800s and 1900s.

title: The Oresteia Trilogy
description: The House of Atreus is the subject of a classic trilogy that portrays the violent history of the ancient house. These plays, written in grand language and filled with dramatic dialogue, depict Aeschylus' preoccupations with the destiny and fate of both people and state, all unfolded under the watchful gaze of gods.

title: Black Beauty Coloring Book
description: The story of a horse's experiences with multiple owners, captured in large type and illustrated with 35 ready-to-color scenes, is gripping and moving.

title: Ballet Class Coloring Book
description: Forty-two detailed, precise drawings depict every aspect of a beginner's class, from selecting shoes to executing the perfect arabesque. Exhibited guidance on proper posture, warm-up exercises and arm positions as well as other helpful tips.

title: Best Ghost and Horror Stories
authors: Bram Stoker;Richard Dalby;Stefan R. Dziemianowicz;S. T. Joshi
description: Fantastic selection: 14 spine-chilling stories by the author of Dracula, including "The Dualitists," Stoker's most fearsome story, "Squaw," "the Burial of the Rats", and 11 more with an introduction by Richard Dalby.

title: Enter Jeeves
description: Bertie Wooster, the devious snob and Jeeves, his intelligent and unruly servant, are featured in the first eight stories of this impressive collection. Additionally, there is the complete Reggie Pepper series (Bertie's archetype).

title: The Wit and Wisdom of Mark Twain
description: Mark Twain's humorous and insightful anthology features quotes on various topics, such as life, love, history, culture, travel, and politics.

title: An Ideal Husband
description: Despite his short and tragic life, Oscar Wilde is best known for his dramatic skills, which were hailed as atat as humorous as the writers of An Ideal Husband, a play about marriage that forces an innocent couple to question their moral values.

title: Politics
description: Provides an English translation of Aristotle's book on the nature of the state, constitutions, revolutions and democracy and oligarchy.

title: The Canterville Ghost and Other Stories
description: Presents eleven works by the English author, with the title story centered on a ghostly figure who remains calm and composed until the last few residents of his mansion are relocated.

title: The House of Mirth
description: The novel is a parody of New York's early 20th century, with Lily Bart struggling between wanting the rightful spouse and trying to stay true to her own identity.

title: Letters to a Young Poet
authors: Rainer Maria Rilke;Franz Xaver Kappus;Reginald Snell
description: Letters addressed to F.X. Kappus between 1903 and 08.

title: Women in Love
description: A new book set in a small, Midland mining town explores the intricate connection between two couples.

title: The Trojan Women and Hippolytus
description: The Trojan Women, one of the most impactful war indictments ever written, and Hippolytus, a gripping story of how humans must fight for their souls to succeed.

title: Life Is a Dream/La Vida Es Sueño
authors: Pedro Calderon de la Barca;Stanley Appelbaum
description: Features a bilingual interpretation of the ancient Spanish play from the 17th century, which tells the story of an imprisoned prince who is repatriated.

title: The Pilgrim's Progress
description: It is one of the most compelling dramas ever written about the journey of a man in search after salvation, as depicted by Worldly Wiseman and Giant Despair. Monsters and spiritual terrors haunt this work, making it an iconic example of 17th-century drama known for its beauty of language and uncomplicated passages.

title: Gorgias and Timaeus
description: Two significant works by one of history's most renowned and widely read philosophers. Gorgias examines the temptations of success and the rewards of a moral life, while Timaeus offers an explanation of the world through metaphysical and religious principles.

title: Great Russian Short Stories
description: "The Queen of Spades," " The Overcoat," and other Russian short stories are included in the collection, along with "White Nights," a darker romance by Annecy Patterson, and "A Matter of Fate" is also included.

title: Babbitt
description: Provides an account of a prosperous, aggressive real estate agent who represents the middle-class American lifestyle.

title: The Jew of Malta
description: Prejudice, the intricacies of Mediterranean politics and Machiavellian strategy are present in this Elizabethan drama where the protagonist aims to maintain control over his wealth, social status, and daughter.

title: The Idiot
description: A mid-19th-century Russian literary work that explores the idiosyncratic personality of a nobleman who is known as "the idiot" due to his gentle and childlike disposition.

title: Critique of Pure Reason
description: The capacity of perception constrains human knowledge, as argued by Immanuel Kant in his Critique of Pure Reason. He attempts to categorize two forms of knowledge: a posteriori knowledge gained through experience and affliction not acquired through expérience. Kantian reasoning suggests that the most practical forms involve making judgments based on the state of mind, which requires setting the conditions of its own experience. This precise translation by J. M. Meiklejohn presents an accurate representation of this problem within the genre descriptor from Kan's abstract that is more than one-handedly chosen

title: Discourse on the Origin of Inequality
description: The Discourse is a distinctive examination of politics and human nature, offering neoclassical perspectives on individuals in 'pre-social' conditions and the consequences of civilization. He formulates an evolution theory that predates Darwinism and integrates elements of ethics, sociology, and epistemology. It is one of the most significant works of Enlightenment thought.

title: The Philosophy of History
description: This classic was written by Hegel as an introduction to a series of lectures on the "philosophy of history." With this work, he created the history of philosophy as if it were science: philosophical theory is neither an accident nor an artificial construct, but rather an example of its age.

title: The Sword of Welleran
description: This collection features 12 tales penned by an English native that take readers on adventures of both fantasy and sensuality. It is enhanced by the author's expressive writing skills and 10 haunting images by S. H. Simes, featuring such inventive stories as "The Highwayman," "In the Twilight,"" The Ghosts", "Land of Youth," and even the title piece.

title: Autobiography of Thomas Jefferson
description: Throughout his distinguished career, Thomas Jefferson played numerous roles for his country, including President of the United States. However, he is best remembered as an exceptional architect, naturalist, and skilled linguist who was most famous for writing the Declaration of Independence. In his autobiography, which began in 1821 at the age of 77, Jefferson details his early life and the period during which a draft of this document was written. This edition features both the first and second drafts.

title: Philosophy of Right
authors: G. W. F. Hegel;S. W. Dyde
description: In the 1821 classic, Hegel applies his dialectics, which he considers essential, to law, rights, morality, the family, economics and state: "Unanimous right is the union of the thesis of an individual acting in accordance with the law and the occasional contradiction of desire to follow private convictions."

title: The Worm Ouroboros
description: "The most exceptional and believable writer of invented worlds I've encountered" J. R. Reif (Eddison) is the mastermind behind Homeric epics, with his tales of warriors and witches drawn from the finest sources."

title: Great Speeches by African Americans
description: The festival is held in the year 150 years, and it celebrates both frihed and menneskerettigheder.

title: Intimate Journals
description: The collection of essays written by the infamous poet goes beyond the poverty of his financial ruin and the suffering of bodily decay to offer compelling perspectives on his world, people, and philosophy.

title: On the Origin of Species
description: Describes the evidence supporting an evolutionary theory, its mechanism, and discussions on instinct, hybridism, fossils, distribution, classification.

title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
description: Tolstoy's The Kingdom of God Is Within You, which was banned in Russia, was deemed a threat to church and state. It is the culmination of many years of contemplation and emphasizes Jesus' message of "returning to Christ" by convincing his audience why they should avoid violence, even those that are sanctioned by the state or the church.

title: Quicksand
description: A principled racially conservative teacher is forced to leave a stable job and sexism by hypocrisy and prejudice.

title: Sociology in Our Times
description: By incorporating a varied array of theories, research, and real-life experiences that accurately reflect the diversity of society, this cutting-edge book highlights the importance of sociology. The author's lively and applied writing style engages diverse students, providing them with compelling examples to make sociological theory relevant today. SOCIOLOGY IN OUR TIMES is particularly notable for its strong integration of Lived Experiences, which provide extended examples of various topics and help illustrate chapter coverage.

title: A History of Modern Psychology
description: The ebook version may not contain all media content that is mentioned in the product description or product text.

title: The Seventy Wonders of the Ancient World
description: From the Great Temple of the Aztecs to the Nazca lines of Peru, a look at some of nature's great ancient wonders, with information on how architecture was created and its intended use.

title: Graphic Design
description: Graphic design evolved from its beginnings in printing as a means of identification, knowledge-improving, and promotion to 'a profession and discipline of its own' This authoritative documentary history begins with the poster and proceeds to describe how word and image have developed in various media including brochures and magazines, advertising, corporate identity, television and electronic media, plus the impact of technical innovations such as photography and the computer. In the revised edition, he adds: "The role of the Computer and Internet in design innovation and globalization; the final chapter on the last year that includes the conclusion that this remarkable foreground

title: The Rainbow Goblins
description: The Rainbow is careful not to touch the earth again after seven goblins made an attempt to steal it.

title: Big Bad Wolf
description: Despite her grandmother's concerns, Molly goes to the woods to follow her instincts when she sees handsome Wolf Trevelyan and loses her cool. Original.

title: An Original Sin
description: When the male species are extinct, Fortune MacDonald's skills as a "man-maker" become highly valued, but when he seemingly perfect specimen emerges from her bed, she wonders if their love is more profound than just physical pleasure. Original.

title: Aphrodite's Passion
description: Tracy Tannin, the granddaughter of a famous movie star, becomes irresistibly loved and well-known for her Aphrodite girdle, prompting Hale to convince her that she is still beautiful regardless of her attire.

title: Call of the Moon
description: A man who was bitten by a werewolf discovers an unfamiliar beauty and journeys to the Canadian Northwest, teaching him the way of the wolf.

title: Love Bites
description: A lovely nurse who works in the night is compelled to teach her how to love both herself and the vampire she loves.

title: Dancing on my grave
description: The biography of the American ballerina details her struggles with love, teachers, addictions, cocaine use, anorexia, and being held in a mental health facility before making re-entry to the workforce.

title: The Aviators
description: The emergence of the new Air Assault Division in 1964 is hindered by logistical challenges and interpersonal conflicts among the male and female troops, as the Vietnam War intensifies.

title: The Valentine Legacy
description: Jessie Warfield and James Wyndham, who are antagonists, marry and embark on a quest to find Blackbeard's treasure.

title: The Maze
description: The murder of Sherlock's sister is the focus of a case that puts both Lacey Sherlock and FBI Special Agent Dillon Savich on the defensive.

title: Cold Blood
description: Lorraine Page, a recovering alcoholic and private eye, is on the hunt for the daughter of an actress who disappeared during Mardi Gras and becomes deeply attached to the father of the victim.

title: Flying Finish
description: Escape from the demands of his ancestral home: Henry Grey takes a job ferrying race horses across the Atlantic, before joining gang activity.

title: Heart of the Sea
description: The heartfelt story of a woman's quest for financial success leads her to the ultimate treasure, ending Nora Roberts' celebrated Irish trilogy.

title: Out of this World
description: Includes paranormal and futuristic romance featuring a police officer being taken into custody for an off-world murder, love triangles, witches seeking the love of one man, and the desire of another telepath to meet him in person.

title: Beyond Seduction
description: To steer clear of an unwanted union, Merry Vance devises a scandalous plan to remove her long-standing suitor from her life. She will violate all ethical principles by pretending to be naked for Nicholas Craven, London's most sought-after and infamous artist.

title: Shadow Game
description: New series from the "New York Times"bestselling author follows two telekinetic geniuses who both discover they are under a spellbinding threat of destruction.

title: After Glow
description: Lydia Smith, a para-archaeologist, is lost in the catacombs beneath Harmony city and uncovers something that contradicts her beliefs about her lover, Emmett London.

title: Cravings
description: The nocturnal world is marked by fiery pleasure and perilous longing, as fearless creatures take their victims to the brink of ecstasy and terror in this sensual anthology written by four best-selling authors: Laurenll K. Hamilton, MaryJanice Davidson, Eileen Wilks, and Rebecca York. Original.

title: Bite
description: Penguin USA is set to release a new title, with more details to come in the near future.

title: Incubus Dreams: An Anita Blake  Vampire Hunter Novel
description: The role of Anita Blake's lover in the investigation into a vampire serial killer who is stalking strippers creates ambiguity between her and Jean-Claude, the seductive Master Vampire of the City.

title: Micah. (Anita Blake
description: There are many reasons to bring the dead alive, both private and public. The feds have a witness who died before they could testify on the record. I am now heading to Philadelphia to work alongside my Queen, but with the help of Micah, her husband-in-law and closest confidant.

title: Ghost Hunter
description: After ending her marriage with Cooper Boone, the ghost-hunter, Elly St. Clair relocates to Cadence City, but he's haunted by a new friend who appears to be an unknown entity and is determined to keep her alive.

title: Morrigan's Cross
description: The powerful vampire Lilith is preparing to unleash her fury in battle, prompting a medieval sorcerer from the Morrigan circle to travel back in time.

title: Dance of the Gods
description: Observes the circle of six in their mission to safeguard the planet and its souls from a vampire who is determined to dominate the universe.

title: Valley of Silence
description: In this thrilling finale of The Circle trilogy, a vampire challenges Lilith and her minions as they vie for supremacy, using his affection for the newly wedded queen of Geall to finally complete the circle of six and alter the course of history.

title: The Complete Science Fiction Treasury of H.G. Wells
description: Encompasses fantasies of time and space travel, personal madness and megalomania, and practical and grotesque utopias.

title: Complete Poems
description: Edgar Allan Poe, who is recognized globally as a pioneer of the macabre, wrote short stories and poetry. He is also known for inventing the detective story and modern gothic horror tale, and has had enduring influence on writers such as William Faulkner, Fyodor Dostoevsky, Baudelaire, H.P. Lovecraft, Kate Butler Yeats, Jonah Wheeler, J.K. Rowling, Bonnie Tyler, Charles Darwin, Mary Shelley, Kenneth Hansen, Stephenson, Janeway, Motherliebliebeinein

title: The Complete Hans Christian Andersen Fairy Tales
description: Over 156 of the great Dane's most beloved fairy tales.

title: Four Novels
description: The Pickwick Papers, The Adventures of Oliver Twist, David Copperfield, Great Expectations, and A Tale of Two Cities are among the top-selling works by Dickens.

title: A New Collection of Three Complete Novels
description: Fans of Jurassic Park and Rising Sun, as well as the books and movies, will appreciate having a copy of Crichton's previous technical suspense novels, such as Congo, Sphere, and Eaters of the Dead.

title: Two Complete Novels
description: Two novels, Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency and The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul, address themes of zany space exploration, time travel, and mystery.

title: The Tolkien Companion
authors: J. E. A. Tyler;John Ronald Reuel Tolkien
description: J. R. Tolkien's imaginative Middle-earth provides a comprehensive and accessible overview, including the history, languages, and people of its fictional realm, as well as fans' references to The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings.

title: John Irving
description: This highly acclaimed author has gained millions of fans for his first three novels, which are set in the heart of New York Times bestsellers: Setting Free the Bears, The Water-Method Man, and The 158-Pound Marriage.

title: The Ultimate Hitchhiker's Guide
