description: This swashbuckling volume features six unconventional adventure stories written by an exceptional writer, featuring top-selling titles such as The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy and The Restaurant at the End of the Universe.

title: The Crossing
description: Following All the Pretty Horses by Cormac McCarthy is a grippingly detailed and deeply moving novel that offers readers both an opportunity to experience, and their characters' perspective on life in America.

title: The Complete Adventures and Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
description: Presents a duplicate of the twenty-four authentic "Strand Magazine" chronicling Sherlock Holmes' adventures, which were initially published in 1891 and 1893, respectively.

title: Three Terrifying Bestselling Novels
description: Three thrillers consisting of: Embrace the youngsters; Punish the wrongdoers; and Cry for the unknown characters.

title: The Secret Garden
description: An orphan of ten finds herself in a lonely house on the Yorkshire moors, where she has an invalid cousin and the secrets of one of the gardens.

title: Three complete novels
description: Enumerates three of the author's initial horror narratives.

title: A Christmas Carol and the Night Before Christmas
description: This exquisitely illustrated, gilt-bound edition of the classic Christmas story and poem will be a lasting keepsake of hilarity for years to come.

title: Works of Jack London
description: Includes 40 short stories and The Call of the Wild, White Fang, The Sea-Wolf.

title: Favorite Tales of Sholom Aleichem
description: The famous Yiddish writer's short stories depict the lifestyle, customs, and mannerisms of the Jews in Russia.

title: H.G. Wells Science Fiction Treasury
description: The time machine, the island of Dr. Moreau, and the invisible individual.

title: Be Here Now
description: The book's augmented audio or video content has resulted in a larger file size, which may take longer to download than anticipated.

title: Classic Myths to Read Aloud: The Great Stories of Greek and Roman Mythology  Specially Arranged for Children Five and Up by an Educational Expert
description: Enumerates the primary myths of Greece and Rome, which form the basis of our literary culture.

title: The Illustrated Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: The uncommon and sometimes extraterrestrial journeys, ideas, and companions of galactic traveler Arthur Dent are portrayed through digitally produced graphic images and cunning visual tricks.

title: China and Japan
description: An examination of the origin, meanings, and similarities between Oriental myths and legends.

title: The Orion Mystery
description: This fascinating account of one of the great mysteries of ancient times draws from more than a decade of research, linking the construction of pyramids and Egyptian religion to precise astronomical studies. TV package. 20,000 first printing.

title: The Pound Era
description: "Identifying the exact level of dominance among one's peers is notoriously challenging."

title: The Haunted Screen
description: Report on the use of expressionism in German cinema.

title: The Politics of Cultural Despair
description: By examining the thoughts and influence of three influential critics of modern Germany, this study explores the potential risks and ethical dilemmas associated with a specific type of cultural despair. Lagarde, Langbehn, and Moeller van den Bruck were active during the period from 1880 to 1945 when German culture and spirit were attacked in various ways.

title: Europe and the People Without History
description: Examines the history of European peasants, workers, and artisans, highlighting how they were affected by significant economic shifts.

title: The Responsibility of Forms
description: The late essays by Roland Barthes are centered on the visible and auditory worlds, and their intenseness and satisfaction stem from their personal preferences as an artist and musician and his lack of understanding about the value of attaching art and music to written texts and criticism.

title: Balanchine
description: This edition of Balanchine is a must-read for fans of biography and dance, as it boasts witty, insightful, and candid insights into the events that shape his life, from his controversial will to his current status. The book sheds light on various legal, financial, or institutional questions after his death, but the main focus in its epilogue remains on the aesthetic issue at the center: "In the absence of my ballet gown, there is no such thing as an aesthetic."

title: Haiti  History  and the Gods
description: By examining Haiti during the Revolutionary War through the lenses of gender and sexuality, Joan Dayan provides a significant perspective on the country's history.

title: Masculinity and Male Codes of Honor in Modern France
description: Robert Nye argues that manhood, masculinity, and male sexuality are cultural constructs like femininity from the 1789 to the 1918 World War II period, with strict ideals and codes of honor that few men have been able to embody. By doing so, Nyme incorporates gender into the fabric of cultural history and destabilizes/historicalize the male body.

title: Infections and Inequalities
description: Points to the fact that impoverished populations are afflicted by diseases such as AIDS and drug-resistant tuberculosis, malaria, and typhoid.

title: Undertaker of the Mind
description: The creation of Undertaker of the Mind is a remarkable piece of original research that highlights the early history of British psychiatry. Its authors, Andrews and Scull, have exploited previously unrecognized documentation to bring the murky world of an eighteenth-century mad doctor to life and dispel many deep-seated myths. According to Roy Porter, author of The Creation of Modern World, "This works is brilliantly written...and it is highly convincing."

title: Exiled in Paris
description: This book is the initial exploration of the English-language literary community in Paris after World War II, encompassing the connections made by Richard Wright, Samuel Beckett, James Baldwin, and Maurice Girodias.

title: The Whole World Is Watching
description: The investigation examines how news organizations, as the category suggests, manage the news world, which includes both practitioners and consumers.

title: Berlioz
description: Provides an account of the French composer's journey to settle down in Paris and the process of creating his pieces.

title: 浅草紅団
description: The only work in English that is not currently available and authored by a Nobel-Prize winner and well-known Japanese writer outside of Japan has been translated.

title: The Poems of Exile
description: The translation is a valuable achievement for language enthusiasts who appreciate graceful, fluid English verse and those who are more inclined to follow the Latin vocabulary and rhythmic variation of Ovid's language.

title: Pathologies of Power
description: The most important human rights struggle of our time is the promotion of social and economic rights for the poor, as argued by "Pathologies of Power" using heart-wrenching accounts of both life and death.

title: Giovanni and Lusanna
description: The Renaissance Florence's archives offer a unique perspective on the intersection of social class and politics, making this tale of Lusanna and Giovanni incredibly relatable.

title: World Atlas of Great Apes and Their Conservation
description: The publication provides a comprehensive overview of Great Apes' distribution and conservation status, with sections dedicated to each species and specific country profiles.

title: Storming the Gates of Paradise
description: An anthology of almost forty essays that sum up the author's work on American politics, current affairs, culture, society, and history over the last decade. Written from the point of view of a prominent environmental activist, anti-globalization campaigner, undisciplined public thinker. By the writer of A Field Guide to Getting Lost.

title: Gardening with a Wild Heart
description: The essays cover topics such as wildflower gardening, the ecology of native grasses, collecting wildland seeds, principles of natural design, and the relationship between plants and animals in California gardens.

title: Spinoza
description: It is the first full biography of Spinoza in any language, and draws on extensive archival research.

title: The Ethics and Politics of Asylum
description: The political debate surrounding asylum has gained traction in developed nations over the past 20 years. This book draws on political and ethical theories, as well as the experiences of countries like the United States, Germany, the UK, and Australia, to offer suggestions on how to handle the issue. It also provides insight into how states can move towards providing morally acceptable solutions to refugees.

title: Insurgent Collective Action and Civil War in El Salvador
description: Emotions and morals are the foundation of collective action in Wood's model.

title: Who Needs Greek?
description: A lively analysis of disputes regarding the significance of Greek identity in both modern and ancient cultures.

title: Moral Luck
description: Bernard Williams has authored a new volume of philosophical essays that is aimed at challenging the themes of personal identity in Problems of the Self. However, Moral Luck highlights the importance of moral philosophy and rational thinking as an area that has been revitalized over the past few decades, rendering earlier moral and political philosophy seemlessly lacking in substance.

title: Evolution and the Theory of Games
description: The theory of games, which was initially developed to study economic behaviour, is adapted in this book published in 1982. This book provides a comprehensive account of the theory and its data for senior undergraduate and graduate students.

title: Problems of the Self
description: Focusing on personal identity issues, this volume offers insights into philosophical topics related to the philosophy of mind and moral philosophy.

title: The Winter's Tale
description: An updated version of The Winter's Tale, complete with a detailed introduction and full commentary.

title: Tolstoy: Anna Karenina
description: An up-to-date analysis of this renowned book that scrutinizes the subtle psychology in Tolstoy's portrayal.

title: Reading Greek Tragedy
authors: Simon Goldhill;Professor of Greek Literature and Culture and Fellow and Director of Studies in Classics Simon Goldhill
description: The author aims to combine the best contemporary scholarly criticism of classics with modern literary studies in other fields to provide an advanced critical introduction to Greek tragedy for those unfamiliar with the Athenian drama festival.

title: Gabriel García Márquez: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: The author contextualizes the novel with modern Colombia's violent past, examining the intricate perspective of Gabriel Garcâia Mâarquez.

title: Philosophical Papers: Volume 1  Human Agency and Language
description: Philosophical Papers are of great interest to both philosophers and students of human sciences.

title: Cicero: On Duties
description: The last theoretical work of Cicero is titled De Officiis (On Duties), which presents his analysis of the political and ethical values of Roman ruling class in the late Republic using a Greek theoretical framework. Although often considered an integral part of those Greek philosophical works, this volume seeks to make DeOfficius more understandable by elucidating its connection to its own time and place.

title: Hegel: Elements of the Philosophy of Right
description: The book is a translation of arguably the most important work in modern social and political thought. Elements of the Philosophy of Right, Hegel's last major published work, attempts to integrate ethical theory, natural right, philosophy of law, political theory (which includes an analysis of human evolution) and sociology of today'S society into the framework of Hegelian philosophy: It has been radically interpreted by some as influencing many political movements from far right to far left, and is widely considered central to the communitarian tradition of ethics.

title: The Collapse of Complex Societies
description: Dr Tainter narrates almost 24 instances of collapse and examines more than 2000 years of explanations before developing a new and far-reaching theory.

title: The Return of Grand Theory in the Human Sciences
description: A collection of essays that focuses on the most significant developments in social and political theory during the past three decades. The authors highlight how different traditions of thought, often Continental, have had a detrimental impact on empiricist ideas like empiricism and the positivist ideal of unification of science. Each contributor provides lucid insights into these changes, while also acknowledging the contributions of other important figures or schools within their field.

title: Fitzgerald: All The Sad Young Men
description: Based on surviving manuscripts and typescripts, this publication contains twenty Fitzgerald short stories.

title: The Rise and Fall of Anne Boleyn
description: Retha Warnicke's new interpretation of Anne' fall is both fascinating and controversial, highlighting the sexual intrigues and family politics that are prevalent in the court.

title: The Invention of Tradition
authors: Hobsbawm, E. J. Hobsbawm;Eric Hobsbawm;Terence Ranger
description: The book delves into the intricate relationship between past and present, showcasing the use of ritual and symbolism as examples of this process of invention.

title: The Myth of the Magus
description: The anthropological basis of this text can be traced back to ancient rituals performed by a shaman or wizard, and it then follows the development of the Magus through pre-Christian religious and mystic philosophers, medieval sorcerers and alchemists (the Chaldeans), and the occult revival in the 18th and 19th century.

title: Nations and Nationalism Since 1780
description: The renowned narrative of Hobsbawm, adjusted to present-day political instability.

title: The Cambridge Companion to Plotinus
description: The most significant philosopher of the 700-year gap between Aristotle and Augustine was Plotinus, who considered himself a follower of Plato. However, his efforts to defend Platinenism against the Aryan, Stoic, and other scholars resulted in an upliftedite version of its principles that became known as "Neoplatonism". In this volume, sixteen leading scholars provide citations on various aspects of PLOTINUS' intricate system, emphasizing how it intersects with the history of ancient philosophy while also showing how

title: Foucault's Virginity
authors: Simon Goldhill;Professor of Greek Literature and Culture and Fellow and Director of Studies in Classics Simon Goldhill
description: The emergence of Christianity and the Church's dominance over the pagan world in the early centuries led to the creation of novels, poetry, and dialogues that were both sexy, funny, or unconventional, with works like Daphnis and Chloe by Longus, Leukippe and Cleitophon by Achilles Tatius; and Amatorius by Plutarch also. Modern writers on the history of sexuality have mostly turned down this literature due to its lack of humor and portrayal.

title: Aristotle: The Politics and the Constitution of Athens
description: Aristotle's political writings have been repackaged to provide the student with all they need to understand his work as a political scientist. The expanded Cambridge Texts edition includes an extensive guide to further reading, along with biographical notes for each individual author, and features two volumes: The Politics and The Constitution of Athenses.

title: The Cambridge Companion to Jane Austen
description: Provides a history of Jane Austen in the context of her current life.

title: King Richard II
description: A lively and informative introduction to Shakespeare's intricately written works.

title: Hamlet  Prince of Denmark
description: In the current edition, Robert Hapgood has included a section on the contemporary critical and performance approaches to Hamlet.

title: Twelfth Night Or What You Will
description: The text by Elizabeth Donno includes a completely new Introduction by Penny Gay.

title: Aeschylus: The Oresteia
description: In this introduction to the Oresteia by Aeschylus, Simon Goldhill concentrates on its themes--justice, sexual politics and violence, as well as the role of man in ancient Greek culture. The book opens with an overview of how Aesthelus creates a myth for the city he lived in, followed by examining the impact of theorists' works on modern theater. This volume is highly recommended for students and teachers because of its well-organized structure and easy access to resources.

title: Nietzsche: Daybreak
description: A fresh rendition of Nietzsche's mature philosophy.

title: The Tragedy of King Lear
description: Revised edition of King Lear with a new section on interpretations.

title: The Cambridge Companion to Schopenhauer
description: A compilation of essays that analyze Schopenhauer's philosophy based on specially commissioned research.

title: Nietzsche: The Birth of Tragedy and Other Writings
description: A recent translation and edition of a significant philosophical work from the modern era.

title: Pearl S. Buck
description: Discusses the achievements of the Nobel- and Pulitzer-prize-winning author and activist in terms of their literary, social, and personal aspects.

title: Practical Philosophy
description: The first English edition of Kant's moral and political philosophy works, published in 1997, was produced.

title: The Cambridge Companion to Cervantes
description: The Cambridge Companion to Cervantes is a comprehensive guide to the life and work of Cerverantes.

title: Numerical Recipes Example Book (C++)
description: Includes C++ source programs that exercise and demonstrate all subroutines, procedures, and functions in Numerical Recipes in C.++.

title: Jungle Love Level 5
description: I was instantly drawn to Ian's kiss and knew it would be perfect. He responded with a heartfelt expression, saying, "You're absolutely beautiful. But I can't do this until I break up with Caroline."

title: Genres in Dialogue
description: This book from 1995 examines Plato's innovation of philosophy.

title: Charles Taylor
authors: Ruth Abbey;Lecturer in Philosophy Ruth Abbey;Cambridge University Press
description: During a period of increasing specialization, Charles Taylor is renowned for his contributions to philosophical debates across various fields such as moral theory, subjective ideas, political theory and politics. His most recent works have led him to explore religion. This collection will be read by students and professionals from various universities and research centers, but it will also appeal to broader audiences.

title: A First Course in String Theory
description: For advanced undergraduates and graduate students, this course provides a straightforward introduction to string theory.

title: Myths of the Underworld Journey
description: The traditional tale of a journey to the realm of the dead is used by the writers of Orphic, including Plato, Aristophanes, and the creators of "Orphi" gold tablets, to redefine the borders of their societies within the mythic narrative.

title: Economic Origins of Dictatorship and Democracy
description: The book provides a systematic explanation for why some countries are considered democracies and others are not.

title: Boltzmon!
description: In this science fiction novel for children, young Chris is surprised by the villain's power and his life is turned upside down.

title: Boy  Were We Wrong about Dinosaurs!
description: Examines the knowledge about dinosaur bones, features, and processes, analyzing how these information are often inconsistent with earlier scientific evidence from ancient China to the present day.

title: The Grits (Girls Raised in the South) Guide to Life
description: True stories, recipes, amusing anecdotes, tips, and advice on how to wear watermelon for summer clothing, prune a magnolia tree, or drink like Dames are all featured in this tribute. The first printing of the book was sold outright by 50,000 people.

title: The Woods
description: Despite his grief over the murder of his sister and his decision to raise his six-year-old daughter alone after losing his wife to cancer, county prosecutor Paul Copeland is now unknowingly involved in a murder investigation that could potentially uncover family secrets.

title: The Last Eyewitness
description: The last week of Jesus Christ's life is narrated by Rob Pepper in 17 dramatic ways, using John 13-21 and first person commentary to convey the urgency of his message to his disciples.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms in C++
description: The book, which uses the C++ programming language, focuses on three key aspects of data structures and algorithms: First, it emphasizes the relationship between data objects and their algorithms, including an examination of the algorithms' complexity. Second, its approach to data structure in the context of object-oriented program design, emphasizing the principle of information concealing in its treatment of encapsulation and decomposition, and final page coverage of implementation. Overall, this practical and theoretical book provides students with a solid foundation in data operations for future courses and work in design projects that apply within the framework of abstract concepts linked to

title: Slaughterhouse Blues
description: The meat and poultry industry in the United States and Canada is examined in depth in SLAUGHTERHOUSE BLUES: THE MEAT AND POULTRY INDUSTRY, which draws on over 15 years of research by the authors. The book includes chapters on current beef, poultry, and pork industries, as well as surveys that examine the effects of industry on workers and communities that host its plants.

title: Strata
description: An alternate universe with a romantic storyline.

title: A Prayer for Owen Meany
description: "You have to safeguard something. If you're lucky enough to find a way of life that you love, you must have the courage to live it."

title: A Tourist Guide to Lancre
description: The Discworld's most captivating kingdom, Granny Weatherwax, Nanny Ogg, and Magrat Garlick, is located in the Kingdom of the Ramtop Mountains.

title: Nanny Ogg's Cookbook
description: Nanny Ogg, the Discworld witch who is widely recognized, shares her recipes and imparts wisdom on life, death, and proper manners. Original.

title: The Swords of Night and Day
description: After a thousand years of fighting, Druss and Skilgannon, two heroes, remain venerated in the war-torn lands of the Dernai, where both men and women live in complete isolation from the evil Eternal Spirit.

title: Queen of Sorcery
description: The BELGARIAD is a magnificent epic that depicts the struggles of Gods, Kings, and humans over seventy years, as well as strange places, fate, or unforeseen events. Legend tells of Torak's desire for the power of the Orb of Aldur, but also mentions he would awaken and reign upon Earth to rule it once more after losing control of an Orbiter.

title: Castle of Wizardry
description: A magnificent epic set against a seven-thousand years of the trials and hardships experienced by Gods, Kings, and people, as well as strange places to visit and events to be fulfilled that must be predicted in order for something to happen.

title: Not Without My Daughter
description: "Betty, an Iranian doctor residing in America with his American wife Betty and their child Mahtob, expresses a desire to return home."

title: Moving Pictures
description: In Moving Pictures, the tenth Discworld novel, it is revealed that Victor Tugelbend and Theda Withel must uncover the mysterious truth behind Holy Wood hill.

title: Reaper Man
description: The idea that death is inevitable has shifted from the philosophical question to the real world aspect.

title: Lords and Ladies
description: Midsummer's Night brings a new challenge for the fairies, as they come face to face with real elves and their own little coven.

title: Bravo Two Zero
description: Sergeant Andy McNab led a covert operation in January 1991 that involved eight members of the SAS regiment. The mission was to breach the underground communication link between Baghdad and north-west Iraq, while mobile Scud launchers were targeted. Each member carried 15 stone of equipment and patrolled 20km across flat desert to reach their target. Within days, their position was compromised due to enemy forces.

title: Hogfather
description: Although superstition was prevalent in the Discworld, it had its roots in science and practical applications such as holding a tooth between two teeth for long periods of time.

title: Spindle's End
description: As the princess disappears from her home country, a fairy curse is cast upon her as she grows up in an unremarkable village far from the royal city where magic is all over her body. But Rosie cannot stay ordinary for the rest of her life because it is always true, according to Newbery Prize-winning author obin McKinley.

title: Vox
description: "In the crumbling Palace of Statues, Vox Verlix, the Most High Academe but in reality no more than a prisoner, is set to reveal his plan to kill goblins and shrykes at last. When he is kidnapped and forced to work for Rook, can it be found out that despite his efforts, SS Willy will not be vindicated and could potentially save his librarian friend Carol who was murdered by VoX."

title: Past Mortem
description: When Edward Newson, a detective with burgeoning romance and former classmates, visits the Friends Reunited website in search of his past crushes, it prompts him to question whether they require enemies.

title: Popcorn
description: "In one night, Bruce Wayne and his wife Scout are unable to fathom the true nature of their relationship, while they explore the world's secrets.

title: Merde Actually
description: Paul West, an Englishman who arrived in France a year ago, is still grappling with questions such as: "Is it really that good?" and "Shouldn't it be different to sleep with your boss's mistress?"

title: The Hotel New Hampshire
description: The Hotel New Hampshire is a family-friendly and unconventional story, devoid of any historical elements.

title: בין אלקסרין
description: A sweeping and moving portrait of both a family and the struggle for freedom in midst an increasingly secular society. Set against the backdrop of Britain's post-World War I occupation of Egypt, Palace Walk features Al Jawad, pictured right alongside his wife Faisal al-Ghazni, who runs their household according to the Qur'an while exploring Cairo at night.

title: The Sparrow
description: Emilio Sandoz, a Jesuit priest and skilled language expert, is the protagonist of The Sparrow, an extraordinary story set in the 21st century. He is sent on ersatz scientific expeditions to discover alien culture after receiving an impressive radio signal from space, with Sandova and his companions willing to endure isolation and death, but nothing can prepare them for the civil war that will eventually sweep through their community.

title: Blackberry Wine
description: His choice was "Everyday Magic", the transformation of base matter into the substance of dreams, and Layman's Alchemy.

title: The Short History of a Prince

description: The engineered killers of New Orleans must be thwarted by detectives Carson O'Connor and Michael Maddison.

title: The Smoke Thief
description: The young leader of a mysterious tribe that can transform themselves into dragons travels to London in search of the rogue drkon, who has been using his powers to plunder tens of thousands of jewels. However, when Kit sets himself up with this wicked young woman and confronts her brutal tactics, she falls for him. Reprint.

title: Prince of the Blood
description: Despite his limited history with accidents, Percy and Harold are always willing to lend their support when they need it.

title: Exit Strategy
description: The Feds are being brought all the way down the street as Nadia Stafford, a former police officer turned assassin with fervently committed to eliminating criminals, is hired to bring down 'a truly merciless and effective serial killer' who is endangering the entire community of killers for profit.

title: Velocity
description: Bill Wiles is thrust into a confrontation with the deranged killer as he receives messages offering fatal consequences and facing imminent danger.

title: Forever Odd
description: In Pico's extraordinary world, Odd- a hero who exists between the living and dead--takes on the fight against evil in an arena where no innocent people can be found. Reprint.

title: Public Secrets
description: Despite her upbringing in bitter secrets, Emma is still haunted by her past and desires a loving detective, but the truth is closer than she appears.

title: Lines and Shadows
description: The only true story of a group of California police officers who set loose in no-man's land to either become heroes or dead was not told to the world by Joseph Wambaugh.

title: The Universe in a Nutshell
authors: Stephen W. Hawking;STEPHEN W AUTOR HAWKING
description: In his quest for the Theory of Everything, which is at the heart of the universe's mysteries, he delves into recent scientific developments in supergravity, supersymmetry, quantum theory, and superstring theory. Additionally, there are theories such as p-branes.

title: Social Intelligence
description: The author of Emotional Intelligence, who has sold over 250,000 copies, reimagines the impact of human relationships on all levels of daily life by combining the most recent findings in biology and brain science to uncover how one's everyday experiences shape the brain and affect the body, from mood to immune response.

title: I  Robot
description: Nine science fiction stories depict how robot technology will be perfected by future civilizations.

title: Sailing from Byzantium
description: The preservation of Byzantium's cultural, artistic, religious, and scientific heritage after its conquest by the enemy in 1453 is explored in A history of the Byzantine Empire, which also outlines its impact on Western civilization.

title: The Husband
description: Landscaper Mitchell Rafferty will embark on a remarkable, seventio-hour journey of adventure, sacrifice, and redemption after receiving reassurances via phone that his wife has been taken captive and payment is two million dollars.

title: The Dream Thief
description: In English during the 18th century, Lia, daughter of the drakon tribe leader who had the ability to transform from human to dragon, uses her own talents to find a powerful diamond, which could allow if given the opportunity, that particular gem.

title: The Devil in the White City
description: The story of two individuals, an architect and a serial killer, is rooted in the Chicago World Fair, the most significant fair in American history.

title: Nights in Rodanthe
description: After her husband leaves her for a younger woman, Adrienne Willis, who is now forty-five years old, thinks about her future and reconsiders her decision. However, she eventually meets Paul Flanner, renowned surgeon, while visiting his residence at Rodanthe in North Carolina's outer banks.

title: The Sinner
description: A scene of inhumane violence is uncovered within the walls of a concealed convent, where two nuns were found dead and severely injured on the snow. The autopsy report by medical examiner Maura Isles exposes gruesome evidence while another woman's body is recovered.

title: The Mapmaker's Wife
description: A group of scientists set out from France in the early 18th Century to explore the unexplored South American continent. They sailed through the Peruvian Andes, faced numerous dangers from wild cats, insects, and vampire bats; some were frightened to death by smallpox, others were killed by locals in bullfights while Jean Godin fell for a beautiful young woman who was willing to marry her lover.

title: Princess
description: "I am a Princess in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and I wish to disclose my true identity as Sultana for fear that my family and myself may be in danger."

title: The Surgeon
description: Her body will be discovered today, and I am familiar with the sequence of events that will occur.

title: The Apprentice
description: Boston homicide detective Jane Rizzoli has been haunting the city for years due to her disturbing past, but she is now questioning how the FBI can be so involved in solving the case when they are already investigating it.

title: Light
description: In M. John Harrison's new novel, the tale of three quantum outlaws is retold from their perspective: they find themselves in a self-made universe that allows them to make up rules and break them as quickly as possible; Michael Kearney is an unidentified serial killer in contemporary London who seeks to escape reality through "a quantum world" which they must enter by breaking physics laws.

title: The Last of the Mohicans
description: The black-and-white version of James Fenimore Cooper's renowned journey brings the excitement and adventure of the American frontier and the French and Indian War to life.

title: Doctor Who
description: Despite believing that they have all the information about the latest version of "Doctor Who" on BBC-TVU, this book is what has left viewers scratching their heads. Pre-production drawings and paintings, along with numerous candid shots taken during filming, as well as comments and opinions from everyone involved, provide insight into everything related to the show.

title: Terry Jones' Medieval Lives
description: Did medieval England consist of many mercenaries on horseback saving frail damsels in distress? Was the Middle Ages devoid of superstition and ignorance, and did monarchs never wear undergarments?

title: Colossians and Philemon
description: International Critical Commentaries, which have been in existence for more than one hundred years, have a distinct position among Bible works. They combine various resources from different historical, cultural, literary, and theological fields to help readers understand the meaning of Old Testament books. The new commentaries follow this tradition, using all modern evidence and applying new study methods. All authors are highly respected worldwide and strive to maintain orthodoxy and originality in their work on the biblical text.

title: Death of a Naturalist
description: The auspicious beginnings of an acclaimed master are represented by Death of a Naturalist, the first book of poems that is outstanding for its accuracy in perception and richness in language.

title: The Real Thing
description: A companion piece to the upcoming Broadway adaptation of Tom Stoppard's exceptional play about love and union, which has been described as "the most impactful play" by The New York Times.

title: New Selected Poems of Seamus Heaney  1966-1987
description: A selection of Seamus Heaney's poetry, including The Haw Lantern (1987), is presented in this volume.

title: Immortality
description: "Immortality" is a contemporary classic that boasts both humor and intelligence, as well as provocative and intelligent content.

title: The Complete Herbal Handbook for the Dog and Cat
description: The safety of processed pet food and the potential side-effects of excessive antibiotic and hormone treatments are causing concern among many dog and cat owners. This updated version includes information on Natural Rearing, herbal remedies, and disease prevention.

title: The White Castle
description: A young Italian scholar who is seized by pirates is sold for a high price at the Istanbul slave market, and an eager individual learns about scientific and intellectual advancements in the West. The book was awarded with the 1990 Independent Award for foreign fiction.

title: Even Cowgirls Get the Blues ; My Own Private Idaho
description: Adapted from Tom Robbins' cult classic, Even Cowgirls Get the Blues, is a whirlwind of suspenseful cowgirl action with FBI agents and flying cranes. Meanwhile, My Own Private Idaho follows the journey of an insane hustler who is on his way to finding his long-lost mother in midst of worldly despair.

title: Lawrence Durrell
description: Describes the English author's life and how his personal life was integrated into his writings.

title: The Last Temptation
description: The novel depicts Christ as a human being who is caught between his passionate desires and his victorious outcome on the cross.

title: Tales from Ovid
description: When Hughes was a finalist in the 1995 publication of Michael Hofmann and James Lasdun's groundbreaking anthology After Ovid (also Faber), his three contributions to the collective effort were widely recognized by critics. He demonstrated narrativists' skills for providing not just an accurate description of the original text but also one that is so full of his own qualities that it felt like he was from Latin America and English poetry.

title: View with a Grain of Sand
description: Chosen from the poetry of Szymborska, who is also known as Shimboorska and has won the Nobel Prize for Literature.

title: The New Life
description: An aspiring university student becomes fixated on an alluring book that explores the perils of love and self, while abandoning his studies and family to pursue a story with Janan.

title: Tom Stoppard: Plays 5
description: Arcadia The Real Thing Night & Day Indian Ink Hapgood is the fifth instalment of Tom Stoppard's celebrated dramatography. It is one of the most highly regarded plays written by any English-speaking playwright, and won several awards including the Evening Standard, the Oliver, or the Critics Awards, as well as the Tony Award.

title: Garden State
description: Garden State, the debut novel by the renowned author of Demonology and The Ice Storm, follows a group of friends in Haledon, New Jersey, as they navigate their turbulent journey towards adulthood. They are not only high school dropouts but also those who seek employment and musical experiences within their suburban hometown. The book captures the intense and unforgettable lyricism of their lives through their friendship, betrayal, and daring self-discovery.

title: Letters Home
description: This volume compiles Sylvia Plath's correspondence, which was primarily addressed to her mother, from her time at Smith College in the early 1950s until her suicide in London.

title: Girl  Interrupted
description: "Gay Interrupted is a film that portrays the emotional journey of Susanna, whose troubled youth becomes trapped in psychiatric facilities. Her brief respite, prescribed by therapists she had only met for the past year, turns her into something more like Alice's Wonderland, as she struggles to navigate the thin line between what was considered 'normal' and what seemed too much. She also begins to flirt with the idea of having fun while still being active in society."

title: Gilliam on Gilliam
description: The hysterical filmmaker looks ahead with curiosity to uncover the reason behind the creation of Monty Python and the Holy Grail, The Fisher King, Twelve Monkeys, and other masterpieces.

title: My Century
description: Gunter Grass documents significant events, both mundane and extraordinary, along with technical advancements and scientific discoveries, cultural triumphs, sports victories or faltering successes, persecution and murder, warfare, natural disasters (war), and new beginnings.

title: Taxi Driver
description: Drama: The New York cab guy becomes obsessed with trying to save a teen prostitute, then goes on 'his own rampage' through the streets in an attempt to clean up his dirty, filthy, corrupt world.

title: The Journals of Sylvia Plath  1950-1962
description: The Journals are a remarkable and captivating publication, with the author recounting the vivid passages of 1950s New England, pre-co-ed Cambridge, Benidorm, and Devon during their honeymoon and 1962 birth.

title: Laughable Loves
description: A set of seven stories, Laughable loves was first published in Prague before the 1968 ban on publishing it. The stories are about love or the intricate strategies used by women and men to cope with desires and impulses that can trigger a chain reaction. Sexual attraction is depicted as impulsive and often fruitless games that cause distressing feelings and release uncertainty, panic, jealousy, and an unrelenting desire for comfort.

title: Herzog on Herzog
description: François Truffaut recently hailed Werner Herzog as the "most important film director alive," and his career-length interviews are highly valuable. Despite the numerous false claims and lies about him, Aguirre, The Wrath of God, which featured Klaus Kinski as a notorious fanboy, is considered one of the most important works in postwar European cinema.

title: Collected Children's Stories
description: The first time a collection of three classic children's stories, namely Mrs Cherry'S Kitchen, The Bed Book, and The It Doesn't Matter Suit, has been published.

title: The Wars
description: The War to End All Wars was a novel that explores the harsh reality of war in Canada, including the haunting scenes of trench warfare, bloodshed, and death. Canadian officer Robert Ross, who was nineteen years old at the time, expressed his resolve to live long after passing away.

title: Famous Last Words
description: Hugh Selwyn Mauberley scribbles his desperate story on the walls and ceiling of his cold, freezing prison cell in the Austrian Alps while soldiers serving in World War II search for his frozen body and remarkable testament.

title: Finders Keepers
description: Seamus Heaney, a Nobel laureate in poetry, has amassed dozens of prose works over the past 30 years, with his previous publications being limited to three books. His book Finders Keepers: Selected Prose 1971-2001 offers delegates an opportunity to explore and learn about various strong works, including memoirs, lecture transcripts or literary criticism.

title: Fat Pig
description: Adults are considered as part of the cast.

title: A Beautiful Mind
description: A Beautiful Mind, a biography by Sylvia Nasar, is an award-winning film that explores the wonder of the human mind, the triumph of great loss, and the healing power of love.

title: The Greek Islands
description: This unique and captivating book, which was initially created as a picture book but is now in paperback format, blends vivid descriptions, history, and myth with Durrell's own stories. It is an essential read for anyone who has traveled to the Mediterranean or is drawn to his artistry on any level.

title: Vernon God Little
description: In 2003, GQ magazine recognized the novel as one of the 100 Best Things in the World and awarded it winner, Vernon Gregory Little's riotous adventures set in small-town Texas and beachfront Mexico. It is an extraordinary and quirky debut film that showcases innocence and simple humanity (disregarding swear words) in an evil world.

title: Finnegans Wake
description: James Joyce's dream, a significant work of twentieth-century literature, is now available as compiled edition with original text and corrections made by Joyce himself.

title: Tales From Firozsha Baag (Ji)
description: The eleven stories in Rohinton Mistry's book reveal the intricate patterns of life within this Bombay apartment building. From Jaakaylee to Rustomji and Kersi, all depict lingering characters who explore the past and present.

title: The Kid Stays in the Picture
description: "According to Newsweek, 'It's the most insane, debauched, and absurdly captivating movie diary ever'"

title: The Moth Diaries
description: At a high-end boarding school, he writes about the most intimate thoughts in his diary. The focus is on Lucy Blake and her new classmate who becomes obsessed with her. Ernessa is portrayed as spooky and mysterious, with pale skin and hypnotic eyes. Rumours swirl around her, secrets shared by both parties, and disasters unfold as fear collides.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
description: In The Unbearable Lightness of Being, Milan Kundera explores the essence of twentieth-century 'Being' through witty and humorous philosophical speculations. His masterly novel, which tackles both comedy and tragedy, was celebrated by critics as a contemporary classic. This hardback edition marks the twentieth anniversary of its first publication in English.

title: A Pale View of Hills
description: A Japanese woman named Etsuko, who now lives alone in England, is fixated on the death of her eldest daughter, Keiko. Although her deceased daughter has attempted to ease her concerns, she still remembers a specific summer in Nagasaki after the bomb fell.

title: The Unconsoled
description: In The Unconsoled, a man's life has decelerated beyond his capacity, making it an extraordinary study.

title: The Avignon Quintet
description: The quintet by Durrell is an omnibus edition that features five novels published in a kaleidoscope from 1974 to 1985, with the books set mostly in Avignon and the ancient kingdom of Provence, but also exploring the Egyptian desert, Venice, Paris, Vienna, and Geneva.

title: City of Glass
description: The publication of City of Glass in the UK is a significant milestone for Faber, as it was initially listed among the '100 Most Important Comics of the Century'. According to Art Spiegelman's introduction, David Mazzucchelli and Paul Karasik created an unusual imitation of their work on the original book.

title: Eric
description: Eric summons a demon to grant three wishes, but the most unenlightened wizard from Discworld is granted instead.

title: Soul Music
description: The gift of xylophones to other children and Susan's need to remove their vest were unexpected.

title: The Last Hero
description: Cohen the Barbarian, who has been a legend for many years, can still remember when heroes were free from fences, lawyers, and civilisation. However, he now struggles to remember where his teeth once rested after killing dragons. He plans to use his ancient sword, new walking stick,and his old friends' memories as reenactors of heroic acts by climbing the highest mountain in the Discworld and conquering the most dangerous one.

title: The Man in the High Castle
description: The end of World War II in 1962 has brought about a period of adjustment for the population, as the Mediterranean was depleted to make room for farmland, Africa was decimated, and America was split between the Nazis and the Japanese. Meanwhile, there is an underground bestseller that presents nefarious theories about how the world dealt out before Hitler's triumph.

title: Worlds
description: The Earth has experienced many changes, including a second revolution in America, as 41 small satellites with 500,000 inhabitants orbiting the planet towards the end of the twenty-first century. Marianne OHara, 57, is presently on Earth as he begins her first year as postgraduate student. She is interested in exploring the intricate and unpredictable political dynamics between the four Worlds and our planet.

title: Dark Lord of Derkholm
description: Is it possible for the Wizard Derk and his human and griffin family to prevent Mr Chesney from harming the world?

title: Replay
description: Jeff Winston, who is now 43 years old, is tired of his low-paying job and unrewarding work. He also struggles with the absence of children to ease his old age. Despite hoping for better things, a sudden heart attack causes him to lose all his happiness but not yet gain weight until he wakes up in his eighteen-year-old form without any memories from the previous twenty-five years.

title: Grendel
description: Grendel is dragged into the fresh night air with his mother, who is unwell and looks like a fat hag of pig, to lay waste in Hrothgar's meadhall and destroy the people he meets there. He also experiences human frustration for organization and recognition of the meaninglessness of his existence.

title: The Hyperion Omnibus
description: By incorporating Keats' works, the Hyperion books revolutionized and reinvigorated SF in the 1990s. They are a comprehensively researched and imaginative book that offers fusion of intelligent storytelling with science, characterisation, and thrill-seeking elements.

title: A Scanner Darkly
description: The most lethal substance ever sold on the black market is Death, also known as Substance D. It destroys the connections between the brain's two hemispheres, leading to first dissolution and then permanent brain damage. Bob Arctor, an undercover drug dealer, is determined to find a way to access the supply but must eventually become addicted to cocaine, and soon, without knowing what happened, he is as dependent on it as any of the addicts awaiting trial.

title: Dark Visions
authors: Stephen King;George R. R. Martin;Dan Simmons
description: The book DARK VISIONS is the result of commissioning one-third of contemporary horror writers from three prominent names, starting with Stephen King's "Sneakers" and ending with Dan Simmons' "Metastasis", which is among the most powerful and disturbing stories.

title: A Sudden Wild Magic
description: A delightfully funny and unconventional tale of conflicts, alternate realities, and worlds authored by one of Britain's most celebrated fantasy authors.

title: The Body
description: In the 1960s, America, four young boys embark on a journey to locate the body of. A boy who was killed by  train and finds that it is not only cruel but also beautiful.

title: The Firm
description: The Memphis tax firm of Mitch McDeere, a Harvard Law graduate, is under scrutiny due to the involvement of mysterious deaths, office security threats, and the Chicago mob in its operations.

title: The Caves of Steel
description: A classic tale of a robot.

title: Banco
description: Henri Charriere, also known as Papillon, embarks on a journey through Venezuela to secure his freedom after thirteen years of escaping and serving time in prison. The story follows him as the protagonist, Banco, engages in various activities while running nightclubs throughout the country.

title: A Darkness at Sethanon
description: Dark magics have taken over the Kingdom of the Isles, causing it to crumble under an evil wind that is blowing through Midkemia. The final battle between Chaos and Order will begin in the ruins of Sethanon, where Pug, the master magician Milamber, must now face off against a dangerous and ancient Enemy for the fate of one thousand worlds.

title: Faerie Tale
description: Contemporary fantasy is about the Hastings family, who move from California to a deep wooded area and become immersed in ancient magic.
A science fiction-roman.

title: Mistress of the Empire
description: The third book in the Empire trilogy.

title: The Master of Whitestorm
description: There was no way to escape the Murghai's slave galleys, and everyone knew that death was the only option. Nevertheless, Korendir persists in his desperate but successful revolt, with the help of his companion Haldeth.

title: The Curse of the Mistwraith
description: The world of Athera is an ever-eggnut, with the Mistwraith's bleak presence in the background covering its skies. Arithon and Lysaer are two half-brothers who can challenge their powerful allies and become trapped in a web of fate determined by deep beliefs. However, as sorcerers within the Fellowship of Seven guilds, there is more than just themselves that are at stake.

title: The witches
description: An individual of interest in witchcraft, consisting of his Norwegian grandmother and a young boy, foil spies' plans to destroy the world's children by altering them into mice.

title: Expository Writing
description: James Henslin's Sociology: A Down-to-Earth Approach, 12/e, is a personal writing style that exudes excitement and introduces the subject of everyday sociology. Its emphasis on six central themes, such as globalization, cultural diversity, critical thinking, new technology, and the impact of mass media on students' lives, helps students develop their sociological imagination.

title: Scary stories 3
description: Ghost stories, hauntings, superstitions and monster tales from the past and present.

title: Descriptive Writing
description: Explore and instruct students in descriptive writing across grades 4-8. Provides resources such as reproducibles, visual aids/presentations, mini-lessons (and a checklist) to help students develop their writing skills.

title: Persuasive Writing
description: Contains reproducibles, graphic organizers and mini-lessons as well as practical tips and check-list for students learning persuasive writing.

title: P.S. Longer Letter Later
description: Tara-Starr and her twelve-year-old best friend Elizabeth keep in touch through letter-writing after her family's relocation to a new state.

title: How Much is that Guinea Pig in the Window?
description: Mr. Day's fourth-grade class is participating in a recycling competition to collect bottles and cans, which will help them earn enough money to purchase guinea pigs.

title: The lion  the witch and the wardrobe
description: Through the use of a wardrobe, four English school children enter the magical realm of Narnia and help Aslan, the golden lion, defeat the White Witch who has cursed the land with eternal winter.

title: Something Fishy at Macdonald Hall
description: As the Headmaster of Macdonald Hall nears retirement, a wave of practical jokes occurs at the school, and Bruno and Boots become the most sought-after suspects.

title: Run
description: In an isolated house, three teenagers are gathered by chance and encounter a peril that becomes more apparent in the darkness outside.

title: Blind Flight
description: Debbie, who is 13 years old and has been blind for a year, must take over the controls of the plane when her uncle becomes unconscious while flying with him.

title: The Trolley Car Family
description: With the purchase of an old trolley car, Father enjoys a delightful summer vacation and new employment opportunities.

title: Mrs. Piggle-Wiggle's farm
description: A child who was unable to speak the truth, another who mistreated her pets, and a boy who caused harm in sight were all treated by Mrs. Piggle-Wiggle.

title: Radio Fifth Grade
description: The Venice Menace causes chaos in the fifth-grade years by bullying his peers into allowing him to appear on "Kidsview," the school's radio show.

title: Avalanche
description: A star athlete, Chris Palmer is always competing with his brother. During their skiing excursion, his rifle ignites a thundering snowstorm, leaving Chris buried alive in the snow.

title: Drina Dances Again
description: When Drina is unable to dance due to an untimely injury, she enters a play to keep her mind off her pulled muscle.

title: Blubberina
description: Due to her weight, Gwen is unable to wear pointe and the Bunheads have started calling her "Blubberina," prompting the girls to take action in order to get rid of excess weight and obtain her toe shoes.

title: The Littles and the Lost Children
description: Trash City, the hidden community beneath the town's dump, leads Winkie and Tip Small-Fry to their whereabouts.

title: Vampires Don't Wear Polka Dots
description: Bailey Elementary students are convinced that their teacher is a vampire.

title: Werewolves Don't Go to Summer Camp
description: A growling barefoot creature greets Bailey Elementary School third graders at camp, while also avoiding lights and eating raw hamburgers.

title: Koko's Kitten
description: Shares the tale of a gorilla that uses sign language and her affection for her kitten, All Ball.

title: The Stranger
description: Nicoletta becomes interested in Jethro and follows him to a deserted cave, where she uncovers his dark secrets.

title: The mystery of the missing cat
description: The Boxcar children are engaged in intricate detective work as they investigate the mysterious disappearance of a quiet neighbor's pet cat.

title: These Happy Golden Years
description: Laura's first job as a teacher is followed by an interest in her by Almanzo Wilder.

title: On the Banks of Plum Creek
description: Laura and her family move to Minnesota and live in a dugout until he new house is built, where they face the misfortune of floods, blizzards and grasshoppers.

title: Mary Anne and the Little Princess
description: Mary Anne is hired to be Victoria Kent's companion while she spends six months in the states with her parents, who are now distant from her in line for the British throne.

title: Good-bye Stacey  Good-bye
description: Stacey and her parents are moving back to New York! Not only is Claudia losing her best friend, but the Babysitters are also in the process of losing their treasurer.

title: Angels Don't Know Karate
description: In Bailey City, the school crossing guard is Miss Angela Michaels, who is so kind and generous that Melody believes she is a guardian angel. Original.

title: The Littles and Their Amazing New Friend
description: The discovery on a hill above the Big Valley is so significant that it changes the world as the Littles discover tiny people living in the forest.

title: The Meanest Thing to Say
description: Little Bill instructs his second grader counterparts on how to make friends better by encouraging them to engage in a game where the students exchange cruel words with each other.

title: Wanted!
description: Alice Robie accepts that she will have to run and prove her innocence when her father is assassinated and the police obtain an e-mail confession that implicates her.

title: The Illustrated A Brief History of Time
description: Stephen Hawking's renowned work has been updated, expanded, and illustrated, featuring new developments in the field of science, many of which were anticipated by him. The new visual dimension helps explain his intricate theories through stunningly detailed illustrations that have been specially commissioned to help understand popular mythic images of our century. However, these ideas still remain challenging and abstract due to the use of advanced technology. This edition features a new introduction written for this purpose.

title: Firedrake
description: New York Timesbestselling author Richard A. Knaak brings to press a magical realm of his own creations, where Cabe Bedlam is pursued by the shape-shifting Dragon Kings for both his legacy and future plans—how terrifying it all may be in the face of dragon sorcery!

title: Vesco from Wall Street to Castro's Cuba
description: The tale of Robert Vesco, the Kingfish, who embezzled investors with $250 million dollars in the early seventies and escaped from the Feds to Cuba.

title: High performance MySQL
description: This manual is intended for MySQL administrators and covers topics such as benchmarking, indexing (for query processing), the stages of processing a query, hardware configuration details, data copying to multiple servers, and safeguarding against hardware failure.

title: Hackers & Painters
description: The writer discusses a broad range of topics, including the morality of web applications, the rise of programming languages, spam filtering, Internet startups, and more. He also recounts significant stories about technical innovators, uncovering their identity and abilities.

title: BSD Hacks
description: BSDs are a versatile and powerful way to hack any Unix operating system, thanks to their extensive library of high-quality software.

title: IMovie 4 & IDVD
description: Describes the steps involved in recording and editing digital videos, performing effects, creating DVD menus, and burning DVDs using Macintosh video production software.

title: Ruby Cookbook
description: Describes the Ruby programming language, covering topics such as strings and arrays, XML processing, Ruby on Rails development, databases, and graphics.

title: MySQL Cookbook
description: Provides a brief overview of MySQL 5.0, including code pieces and programming exercises.

title: CSS Cookbook
description: Provides guidance and illustrations on how to utilize CSS for Web page formatting, encompassing aspects such as Web typography, links, navigation, page layouts, and site design.

title: The New Hite Report
description: The latest report includes unpublished data and personal accounts from women in the UK and Commonwealth.

title: The Barefoot Contessa Cookbook
description: Offers a range of menu options that feature appetizers, main dishes, desserts and side dishes.

title: Execution
description: The latest edition of the best-selling reference includes a new section that provides insight into how to execute crucial business processes in light of today's challenging economic and financial conditions. Coauthored by the author of What the CEO Wants You to Know.

title: Full House
description: Disavows commonly held beliefs about the tenets of progress and evolution, and highlights the importance of diversity in human existence.

title: Awakening Intuition
description: Elucidates the process of utilizing intuition to tap into bodily and emotional signals to achieve optimal physical and psychological wellness.

title: Dispatches from the Tenth Circle
description: Contains articles from The Onion that ridicule politicians, religious figures, rural communities, anti-beverage content, celebrities, and Starbucks.

title: Theater Shoes
description: Three children come to London to live with their grandmother after their father was captured during the war and join all the cousins of their talented theatrical family in a school for stage training.

title: The Princess Diaries
description: Mia, the crown princess, shares her witty and insightful observations of her difficult first month at high school.

title: Laura Ingalls Wilder Country
description: Utilizes family photographs, mementos, and archival materials to paint a portrait of the land and people featured in the "Little House" series.

title: The Two Towers
description: The Lord of the Rings' second volume features a large format fold-out map.

title: Farmer Giles of Ham
description: The Roverandom, the first book in Tolkien's world, depicts a hero who is wary of dragons and must confront them to save his village from ruin.

title: Unweaving the Rainbow
description: Presents a reflection on the nature of science, how it fuels human curiosity and how uncovering scientific discoveries can be more captivating than solving them.

title: Baumgartner's Bombay
description: BAUMGARTNER'S BOMBAY, a well-written and emotionally charged Holocaust novel by Anita Desai, tells the story of Hugo Baumgartner's journey from Nazi Germany to India, where he is eventually imprisoned as an unfriendly foreigner and sent back to Bombay after the war.

title: The 42nd Parallel
description: The U.S.A. trilogy, which includes THE 42nd PARALLEL, 1919, and THE BIG MONEY, is widely regarded as the work of John Dos Passos, who is considered the great American novel. While Fitzgerald and Hemingway were creating their own "own little corners," John D. was taking on the world in this book.

title: Nineteen Nineteen
description: The second volume of John Dos Passos' U.S.A. trilogy, 1919, continues his expansive and expansive panorama of twentieth-century America, which he has lauded as a "virtually unprecedented" publication that utilizes experimental devices to capture the diverse flavors, aromas, and background noises of modern day life with an unmistakable cinematic quality.

title: The Big Money
description: John Dos Passos's three-volume "fable of America' s material success and moral decline" (American Heritage) is the final chapter in THE BIG MONEY, which showcases an ambitious American novelist.

title: The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A few of his written pieces discuss his literary works, their significance, interests, and his perception of the world.

title: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Detailed anecdotes on Tolkien's life, uncovering unexpected correlations between his own experiences and his literary works, particularly The Lord of the Rings trilogy and Silmarillion. Reprint.

title: The Origin of Consciousness in the Breakdown of the Bicameral Mind
description: In this influential book, Julian Jaynes presents his controversial thesis that human consciousness is a learned process that began just three thousand years ago and is still evolving, rather than beginning with animal evolution. This groundbreaking new approach has implications for virtually every aspect of our psychology, history, culture, religion, and future.

title: Clear Light of Day
description: In the classic novel of Diamond Dust, the author recounts the traumatic events of India after the British invasion, including the dysfunctional relationships between a Hindu family in Old Delhi and four individuals. Reprint.

title: The History of the Lord of the Rings
description: J.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings is a highly popular book that has captured the imagination of readers for millennia, thanks to its captivating fantasy world and unique approach. In his seminal work, The History of The Dark Lord Of The RingS, Christopher Tollkison delves into the development of this epic, detailing its writing, including its early drafts and unpublished passages, which provide crucial insights into his literary creations.

title: The Return of the Shadow
description: The sixth volume of The History of Middle-earth provides a summary of the story's conclusion, which includes an account of how Christopher Tolkien developed and expanded his novel.

title: The Heart is a Lonely Hunter
description: A reticent, sensitive girl seeks beauty in a small Southern town.

title: Once a Wolf
description: "Once a Wolf," authored by formerly National Geographic Society photographer, presents rare and powerful photographs that shed light on the complicated bond between humans and wolves. It documents the persecution of the wolf throughout history and exposes scientists' efforts to safeguard these animals from harm. The book is available in color.

title: Stern Men
description: Ruth Thomas, a lively young woman who is born out of the struggle between two groups of Maine lobsterheads, finds herself in an awkward position where she has to find retribution. A first novel. Reprint.

title: Colter
description: In a look at the interconnectedness of dogs and human characters, the author recounts his memories of his beloved dog, Colter, and the ways in which he altered the writer's life.

title: Chimera
description: In CHIMERA, John Barth injects his signature humor into the stories of Scheherezade of the Thousand and One Nights, Perseus, and Bellerophon. He then retells these tales from various angles in a book that the Washington Post describes as "stylishly maned, tragically songful, serpentinely elegant," while also exploring the myths' connection to reality and their resonance with modern day culture.

title: Henry Adams and the Making of America
authors: Garry Wills;Pulitzer Prize-Winning Journalist and Historian Garry Wills
description: The impact of Henry Adams, a historian from the 1800s, on historical research is explored through his use of archival materials, personal accounts, and eyewitnesses.

title: Nixon Agonistes
description: Wills' analysis of Richard Nixon is a true classic, as it takes into account the president's opinions, ultimately concluding that Nixon was actually viewed as essentially liberal.

title: Hear the Wind Blow
description: During the final days of the Civil War, a thirteen-year-old boy and his little sister set out from Virginia to find relatives as their mother died and their home was in ruins.

title: Midnight is a Place
description: In northern England in 1842, fourteen-year-old Lucas lives a lonely, uninterested life in the house of his nasty guardian, until an unexpected little girl comes into his life that completely changes him.

title: Silent Spring
description: Exposes the reckless killing of fish and birds by pesticides and highlights the genetic consequences it may have on humans.

title: The Best American Sports Writing 2003
description: Includes articles on topics from magazines and newspapers about bullfighting to basketball, baseball, and boxing.

title: Two of Us
description: The author of A Good Family shares a touching and entertaining anecdote about how his and his son's love for the Beatles helped to foster broader discussions on friendship, teamwork, art, sorrow, failure, and mortality.

title: Queen of Scots
description: A new historian of Mary Queen of Scots uses fresh sources to dispel myths about her peculiar reign and uncover the political machinations and scandals that have underpinned her reign.

title: Inventing America
description: In Inventing America, Wills challenges the stereotyped belief that Thomas Jefferson's original version of the Declaration of Independence was driven by individual rights and instead emphasizes the importance of interdependence over individual interests.

title: The Best American Mystery Stories 2004
description: Offers a selection of mystery stories from magazines published in the United States and Canada.

title: Fergus and the Night-Demon
description: A lax young man with a high level of intelligence is confronted with an evil demon while heading out to enjoy the town, and the devil warns that his time has come for him.

title: The Hermit's Story
description: Featuring original fiction and short stories, this collection of short tales by the author of Colter and Where the Sea Used to Be features the title story, "A man and woman who cross over an icy lake," along with other such classic pieces as "The Distance," "Eating," and "Real Town." Reprint.

title: JRR Tolkien Companion & Guide
description: A comprehensive guide to Tolkien's life and works features concise alphabetical entries on a variety of subjects, such as his sources, synopses, chronology, analysis of his characters, and the personal and historical influences on his writings.

title: The Maps of Tolkien's Middle-earth
description: Comprises of four posters that showcase Tolkien's Middle-Earth world, utilizing maps from The Hobbit, Beleriand, and Numenor, along with a handbook detailing the importance of geographical development in the author'd texts.

title: Understanding the Lord of the Rings
description: A selection of essays on Tolkien's trilogy, including an essay by W. H. Auden about the quest of the hero, a piece by C. S. Lewis about how myth should be valued in society, an article by Marion Zimmer Bradley about worshipping heroes, and authored by Tim Shippey about his film trilogy; all of these essays are original.

title: Dunk
description: The summer before his junior year of high school, Chad is preparing to play the role of the clown in a dutch tank at an amusement park on the New Jersey shore, but struggles with his best friend's severe illness, police trouble, and the girl who managed to escape.

title: The Bake Shop Ghost
description: Following Miss Cora Lee Merriweather's demise, she haunted her bake shop until Annie Washington, the new owner, struck a deal with her.

title: Reefer Madness
description: Revelations America's "shadow" economy of illicit drugs, pornography, and undocumented immigrants, asserting that these industries are still growing under the radar of government policies.

title: The Last Shot
description: The Abraham Lincoln High School Railsplitters consider basketball as their sole source of income, hoping to secure a college scholarship and escape the neighborhood, but the challenges of SATS, the NCAA, and college recruiting present arduous.

title: Dark Star Safari
description: The author narrates his journey from Cairo to South Africa, detailing the unsatisfactory food, numerous delays, discomfort, and hazards of the trip, as well as the people and attractions of real Africa.

title: The Best American Sports Writing 2006
description: Includes articles on topics from magazines and newspapers about bullfighting to basketball, baseball, and boxing.

title: Since 1500  Chapters 15-30
description: The Earth and Its Peoples Brief Edition is a concise history of the world that is balanced and comparative, with the themes of "Environment and Technology" and "Diversity and Dominance" uniting the regions of humanity. The book is both informative and accessible to students due to its high level of scholarship it provides.

title: Trip to the North Pole
authors: Ellen Weiss;Robert Zemeckis;William Broyles;Chris Van Allsburg
description: A Christmas eve scene features a young boy and other children on an all-night train trip to the North Pole, inspired by the new movie.

title: Fun Home
description: A cult hit comic artist has written a graphic novel that offers eerily humorous perspectives on her family life, including her father's involvement as he works as the director of reunification and is now openly gay.

title: Natural Health  Natural Medicine
description: Natural Health, Natural Medicine is a comprehensive guide that offers practical insights into preventive health maintenance, alternative healing, and general information on traditional medicine.

title: The Namesake
description: In her debut novel, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author recounts the story of the Ganguli family's journey from their traditional life in India to their difficult integration into an American culture that spans three decades across two continents and two generations.

title: Entre Amis
description: In order to develop their interpersonal, interpretive, and presentational communicative skills, students in Entre amis are required to perform situations that resemble those they will encounter in real life. The program follows a progressive approach, where all four-language skills are covered with sensitivity to oral communication. French culture is integrated into the language presented and practiced through experimentation and reflection.

title: The Lord of the Rings Complete Visual Companion
description: Through photographs, screenshots, and images from all three films, a visual summary of "The Lord of the Rings" film trilogy showcases the diverse characters and locations in Peter Jackson's Middle-earth vision.

title: Firefighters in the Dark
description: While in bed at night, a creative child hears sirens from the local fire station and creates fantastic stories about the firefighters' actions.

title: Tolkien And The Great War
description: This edition focuses on one of the most underrated aspects of J. R.R. Tolkien's writings, specifically his experiences in the trenches during World War I, and how the passing of two of his associates had an impact on his life and work.

title: The Best American Travel Writing 2006
description: Announces a collection of the most exceptional travel content published in the previous year, chosen from various publications such as magazines, newspapers, and websites.

title: The Best American Spiritual Writing 2006
description: This collection of the best spiritual writing of 2014 includes essays and articles on faith, spirituality and its effects upon society, politics, culture, creativity, literature and more, reflecting a wide range of perspectives from Christian, Muslim, Jewish, Buddhist and other traditions.

title: The Polar Express
description: A boy takes a magical train ride to the North Pole on Christmas Eve to receive cherished presents from Santa Claus, which includes personalised Caldecott Medal Books in slip-cases.

title: Bury the Chains
description: Describes the first significant human rights campaign that took place in England during the 1780s and resulted in the liberation of hundreds of thousands of slaves worldwide.

title: The Ancestor's Tale
description: A distinguished biologist presents a comprehensive account of the evolution of life on Earth for over four billion years, providing new insights into evolutionary theory, history, sexual selection, speciation, extinction, and genetics.

title: The Lord of the Rings Sketchbook
description: The Lord of the Rings and recent film trilogy illustrated set contains more than 150 drawings and paintings, plus twenty full-color plates made for Peter Jackson's production company.

title: Gossamer
description: A young dream giver tries to rescue an eight-year-old boy from his abusive past and the nightmares caused by frightening Sinisteeds while learning how to grant dreams. The first printing of 100,000 copies was completed on time.

title: In the Lake of the Woods
description: A politician and his wife escape to a lakeside cabin in northern Minnesota, where they hide from the public eye due to allegations of the atrocities committed during the Vietnam war.

title: Chew on this
description: A glimpse into the behind-the-scenes action of fast food.

title: The Diezmo
description: Two young men are ensnared in a real-life raid on the Mexcian village of Mier, where they become participants in an international chess match that will ultimately decide the fate of Texas. The novel is based on one of history's most tragic events in Texas and follows them.

title: Three Nights in August
description: A three-game series between the Cardinals and Cubses, featuring Albert Pujols, Sammy Sosa, Mark Prior, and Scott Rolen, is chronicled by a Pulitzer Prize-winning author.

title: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
description: In search of a lock that fits the black key left by his father, Oskar Schell, who is the nine-year-old son of the man killed in the World Trade Center attacks, searches the five boroughs of New York City.

title: The Hungry Tide
description: Spectacles the life of modern India, chronicling the interconnected journey of an American marine biologist and a businessman from Delhi who embark on ere footing to the distant Sundarban islands.

title: King Leopold's Ghost
description: Hochschild's "Christian Science Monitor" feature features a captivating tale of King Leopold of Belgium, depicted in 31 photos and accompanied by engrossing characters, intense drama, thrilling adventure, deceitful manipulation, fearless honesty, and exceptional moral zeal.

title: The Chosen
description: The University of California's sociology professor shares the results of his admission research at Princeton, uncovering a century of exclusion that impacts the American experience while also raising important questions about higher education stratification.

title: Children of Húrin
description: A fantasy adventure saga set in the early days of Middle-Earth depicts an epic battle between good and evil, with humans and elves, dwarves and dragons, and orcs fighting against each other.

title: The Ideology of the Aesthetic
description: Eagleton's book, The Ideology of the Aesthetic, offers a detailed history and critique of this concept in modern Western thought. This is essentially narrating tenets from Marx to Adorno, with an emphasis on the complex relationships between aesthetics, ethics, and politics.

title: On Certainty
description: The collection of Wittgenstein's thoughts on knowledge and certainty, about knowing a proposition for sure, was written during the last 18 months of his life. This volume draws inspiration from G. E. Moore' defense of common sense and explores these concepts.

title: Western Philosophy
description: From ancient Greece to the present day, Western Philosophy: An Anthology is the most comprehensive and authoritative compilation of philosophical texts.
