It contains 100 well-crafted extracts that cover all the major branches of philosophy, including theory, metaphysics, philosophy of mind, religion, science, moral philosophy (both theoretical and applied), political theory und aesthetics. The book is presented chronologically and substantively, with a clear philosophical commentary that guides the reader through the key points.

title: Liberals and Communitarians
description: This edition is a substantial improvement over the traditional guide to this crucial issue in contemporary political philosophy.

title: Philosophical Investigations
description: The Philosophical Investigations of Ludwig Wittgenstein (1889-1951) is a personal account of his two decades of intensive research on the philosophy of mind, language, and meaning.

title: Michael W. Smith
description: The piano solo folio of Freedom, the first instrumental CD by the multi-million-selling CCM artist, contains all 12 tunes and was recorded in Ireland and released in 2000.

title: The Mystery of the Ancient Pyramid (Cairo  Egypt)
description: A mystery involving a cursed mummy, satan and an arrogant archer's body is the subject of Mimi, Papa, Grant and Christina in Egypt.

title: The Gospel According to Tolkien
description: In this book, Ralph Wood portrays how J.R. Tolkien's work is deeply Christian and meaningful, as it challenges readers to see beyond the horrors of our era.

title: That Godless Court?
description: The First Amendment's religious clauses, while seemingly unambiguous, have been and continue to be a source of controversy. In fact, there has never been questioned the complexity and division surrounding church-state issues. Ronald B. Flowers offers remarkably succinct explanations on the specific aspects of Supreme Court decisions that have affected relations between church and state, as well as their impact on U.S. citizens. This book is an ideal work of analysis for those who have already heard the debate about the relationship between churches and states, and where courts.

title: Luther and Erasmus
description: Included in this volume are the works of Erasmus's 1524 diatribe and De Libero Arbitrio, as well as Luther' s violent counterattack. E. Gordon Rupp and Philip Watson provide commentary on these texts.

title: Self-made Man
description: A columnist for the Los Angeles Times narrates her eighteen-month covert mission as a man, during which she faced significant personal risks such as working in sales, joining sex clubs, dating, and experiencing rigid masculinity codes.

title: Swapping Lives
description: Vicky Townsley, the magazine director, participates in a competition that involves her and Amber Winslow, despite her busy work schedule and many friends.

title: The Roald Dahl Treasury
description: Contains selections from the author's children' book series that are organized into categories such as "Animals," (fiction), "Magic", "Family, friends and enemies," and "Matters of importance"

title: Mayflower
description: The author of Sea of Glory. 450,000 first printing rebuts widely held assumptions about the Pilgrim settlement of New England, discussing topics such as the European-related illnesses experienced by the Wampanoag tribe, the delicate interactions between the locals and their Indigenous counterparts, and the destructive outcomes of King Philip's War.

title: Special Topics in Calamity Physics
description: Blue van Meer, who was raised by her father with aphorisms, transitions from one academic community to another. She joins prestigious St. Gallway School in her final year of high school and is soon joined by enigmatic friends before the deaths of teacher and student spark ignite her analytical mind. Her first novel will be printed for 50,000 euros.

title: Helen of Troy
description: At a young age, Helen wed the Spartan king Menelaus, and although she hopes for an unrequited union, she eventually falls in love with the Trojan prince Paris. She then moves to Troy with disastrous consequences after dissolving the marriage.

title: Dust
description: The disappearance of a wealthy unidentified bachelor named Dust is being investigated by Richard Jury.

title: The Mistress's Daughter
description: A woman who was adopted as a baby shares her encounter with her birth parents, discussing how adoption impacted her sense of self-worth, her efforts to understand her mother's personal life, and her disillusionment with the fact that her biological father had no desire to allow her to join his family.

title: Vinyl Cafe Diaries
description: The subsequent adventures of Dave and Morley.

title: Spycatcher
description: The ex-assistant of MI5 provides an overview of British Intelligence, citing his work on the Ring of Five and uncovering Soviet spy activities and the plot to remove Harold Wilson from his position as Prime Minister in the 1970s.

title: The Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
description: A compilation of three books that were previously published: Pippi Longstocking, Pipi goes on board, and Pippe in the South Seas.

title: Haroun and the Sea of Stories
description: The letter is the starting point for Penguin Drop Caps, a new series of twenty-six collectible and hardcover editions that showcase stunningly illustrated letter letters on their type cover. Jessica Hische, an iconic figure in typography and illustration, collaborated with Penguin Art Director Paul Buckley to create this unique cover art.

title: Matthew Flinders' Cat
description: A bronze statue of Trim, a member of Matthew Flinders' cat, sits on the window sill above Billy O'Shannessy, who used to be an influential barrister. Ryan, aged ten, is presently in search of all the usual trouble after meeting him and becoming an unlikely friend.

title: Artemis Fowl
description: A twelve-year-old criminal named Artemis Fowl is the most astute and daring individual ever. His ultimate goal is to hold a leprechaun to ransom, but he ultimately leads the group to abduct Captain Holly Short of the Lep-Recon.

title: In the Shadow of No Towers
description: After discovering that his daughter Nadja was not alive when she was found in her school at the foot of the burning towers, Art Spiegelman rushed to the World Trade Center on September 11, 2001. He then returned home to write and perform a comic strip about the hijacking of events by America, known for its subversive nature and iconic tone.

title: Echo Platoon
description: The Navy SEALs, with Major Jessica Van Pachen and the Rogue Warrior, are dispatched to safeguard American interests in the Caspian Sea as Iran and Russia seek oil resources.

title: Pieces
description: Sophisticated by "Write Stuff" contestants, the award-winning short stories depict a series of changes and life's events, including failed relationships, heartbreaks, and reunions.

title: The Law of Enclosures
description: The account of a forty-year marriage depicts the turmoil and joys experienced by Henry and Beatrice, who ultimately discover their love for each other after falling apart.

title: You Belong To Me
description: The New York Times and USA TODAY both praise the novel by author Mary Higgins Clark, titled "The Mistress of High Tension," for its exceptional blend of suspense and mystery.

title: Runaways
description: V.C. Andrews® has put the magical Orphans series finishing with this new novel that narrates the story of three orphane children who lived in a deplorable foster home, where Brooke, Crystal, Raven, and Butterfly were all sisters and could forget about their past and hope for rebirth. But then they found out something even more disturbing: Gordon's boots were gnawing on the wooden floors.

title: Private Parts
description: The first "shock jock" has written an autobiography in which he shares his thoughts on politics, current affairs, women, and the entertainment industry.

title: My Gal Sunday
description: A dashing former president and his young congresswoman wife turn heads in four beloved stories penned by the Queen of Suspense.

title: The Millionaire Next Door
description: Argousts that the way wealth is generated in America is primarily through diligent effort, conservative savings, and living a frugal lifestyle.

title: The Tenth Man
description: A wealthy French lawyer, held captive by the Germans during World War II, is compelled to die but trades his life for it as a cowardly act while still free.

title: The Gun Seller
description: A drifter in a British parody of the spy genre orchestrates an epic caper that features the CIA, international terrorists, arms dealers, cliffhangers on skis and high-speed chases with blonde buxomas.

title: She's Come Undone
description: The extraordinary coming-of-age story tells the story of Dolores Price, as depicted in Wally Lamb's book.

title: Morgan's Run
description: Colleen McCullough's The Thorn Birds, a well-known and widely enjoyed bestseller, has brought readers back to Australia. Her tales are filled with passion, history, and drama, while also exploring the invading nature of modern Australia through an unknown continent.

title: The October Horse
description: The author of "The Thorn Birds" has authored a comprehensive historical account of ancient Rome, depicting Gaius Julius Caesar in the final days of the Roman Republic, which is now available in paperback.

title: Bag of Bones
description: Reprint: Mike Noonan, the widower who had been haunted by nightmares about the summer house he shared with his late wife, returns to his old Maine holiday, only to discover a town under the control of an unfeeling millionaire and bewildered by repeated ghost visits.

title: Wither
description: A smart college freshman and a local amateur historian work together to uncover the most horrific crime in their small college town's history.

title: The Empty Chair
description: Renowned criminal Lincoln Rhyme is confronted by the Insect Boy, a kidnapping and murderer who poses ill-equipped to succeed. However, his only option is to capture someone while also attempting to keep them captive after undergoing life-threatening spinal cord surgery in North Carolina. He now finds himself fighting against the killer in southeastern swampland, as well as competing with his protégé, Amelia Sachs, in an intense yet dangerous battle.

title: Clive Cussler and Dirk Pitt Revealed
description: Features pictures, synopses of all Dirk Pitt novels, an interview with Cussler, and questions about the actor.

title: All Through the Night
description: A couple who inherited their neighbor's after-school shelter for neighborhood children are prevented from moving into another building, prompting amateur detective Alvirah to investigate with her husband Willy.

title: The Fuck Up
description: Urban comedy: A budding writer who doesn't quite fit the bill, gets dumped by his girlfriend and then fired for asking for an raise, before stumbling onto a pile of cash (and even embroiled in one of her husband’s murders).

title: How to Stop Worrying and Start Living
description: The first edition of the timeless guidebook on conquering the fears and worries that obstruct individuals from living well offers practical guidance on how to deal with business and financial issues, turn criticism into an advantage, avoid exhaustion, and more. Reprint. 25,000 original prints.

title: Present Tense
description: The Enterprise is hurled three days into the past due to the explosion of a dying world, and expeditions to its surface take on ill-defined new meaning as Captain Kirk and Dr. McCoy vanish mysteriously.

title: Carrie
description: Represents the eerie narrative of a severely neglected young girl with extraordinary powers of observation.

title: Salem's Lot
description: The classic Stephen King horror tale tells the story of a man who travels to his native Jerusalem's Lot, Maine, only to discover that the area is haunted by vampires.

title: Ice
description: Ice Goodman, a young woman with severe depression, must use her exceptional singing voice to overcome the tragedy, deceit, and her mother's jealousy that are threatening to ruin her world. Original.

title: The Living Blood
description: As Jessica struggles to regain her life after losing her husband and the death of her firstborn, she finds out that her daughter was blessed with her father's eternal glory and heads to Africa for guidance.

title: Diablo: Legacy of Blood
description: In a Blizzard Entertainment M-rated novel, Norrec Vizharan discovers the ancient armor of Bartuc, the Warlord of Blood, which is cursed. This item causes Norrect to engage in grueling battles against his own bloody desires as he seeks to escape from the darkness or defeat the evil demons pursuing him.

title: The Girl Who Loved Tom Gordon
description: A young girl gets lost in the woods after a six-mile hike on the Appalachian Trail, according to Stephen King, who is acclaimed as the undisputed King of Horrors and has been hailed as one of the greatest suspense novels.

title: Venice: Lion City
description: The art presents a unique historical perspective on Venice, one of the most captivating cities in the world, during the fifteenth and sixteenth centuries, with an emphasis on its imperial religion.

title: Uncle Shelby'S Abz Book
description: A humorous parody of alphabet books is presented by the acclaimed author of children's literature for adults.

title: Confessions of an Actor
description: The actor from England writes an autobiography that offers insight into his theatrical and film career and his personal life, with a particular emphasis on his relationship with actress Vivien Leigh.

title: Mornings on Horseback
description: Describes the life of Theodore Roosevelt from the age of ten to twenty-seven and how his family relationships contributed to his maturation into a man.

title: Guilty as Charged
description: This anthology features courtroom drama and whodunit suspense, with a focus on short works by well-known writers like John Lutz, Stuart Kaminsky, Jay Brandon, John Jakes, Lia Matera, and Bill Brozini.

title: The Night Awakens
description: With her signature style of elegant and sophisticated thrillers, Mary Higgins Clark has become the Queen of Suspense. Her books are full of depth and beauty that explore the heartbreak of couples who are deeply in love...and driven to commit murder. Sara Shankman joins a group of writers to share stories of love between men and women and their motivation to kill, while John Hansen adds chilling details.

title: The Leader In You
description: The words and works of Dale Carnegie & Associates, Inc. have been evidence of success for nearly 100 years, as proven by millions of satisfied graduates, a consistent enrollment roster per week, and book sales exceeding thirty million copies. Now, in the new book, The Leader In You, Stuart R. Levine and Michael A. Crom draw on the foundational human relations principles of the organization to illustrate how anyone, regardless of their profession, can make the most of this opportunity.

title: Sharp Edges
description: A museum curator and a private detective venture into the dark, high-stakes world of priceless art to uncover that the most important treasure is knowing who to trust.

title: Harvest
description: Dr. Abby Matteo, a resident of Boston's Bayside Hospital, expresses her joy when she is approached by the cardiac transplant team. However, she must now direct the harvested heart to teen teenagers due to financial difficulties. This leaves her emotionally distraught and needless as she struggles to make decisions about her life.

title: Life Support
description: A novella by New York Times bestselling author, Tess Gerritsen, is filled with medical intrigue as a determined woman doctor investigates the mysterious and deadly outbreak. Dr. Toby Harper was initially comfortable working in the intensive care unit at Springer Hospital ER, but later discovered he had an infectious brain infection that lasted only ten minutes and did not respond to treatment.

title: Alien Stars
authors: C. J. Cherryh;Haldeman, Joe W;Mitchell, Elizabeth;Zahn, Timothy
description: In their stories of future alien wars, three prominent science fiction writers challenge both genders by pitting men and women against challenging alien races.

title: Orchid
description: JAYNE CASTLE, the bestselling alter ego of New York Times author Jayne Ann Krentz, delivers an unforgettable evening of paranormal suspense in the unique and synergistic world of St. Helen's, as depicted in Literary Journal.

title: The Man Who Sold The Moon
description: Comprehensive Teacher's Guide.

title: Teach Your Child to Read in 100 Easy Lessons
description: Having read over 500,000 copies, Teach Your Child to Read in 100 Easy Lessons is the ultimate guide for teaching your child how to read and improve their reading skills today.

title: Field Guide to Home Buying in America
description: The list encompasses home selection, financing, real estate agents, negotiation, contracts, title, closing, insurance, and moving.

title: Wind Child
description: With her storytelling talents, Nancy Harding narrates the story of a young woman who would challenge all traditions of her male-dominated community and emerge victorious! Wind Child takes place in the Scythian world of 513 B.C., showcasing fervent, thrilling, and unforgettable stories.

title: Anne Frank Remembered
description: The recollections of Miep Gies, the woman who kept the Frank family secret in Amsterdam during the Second World War, offer a compelling insight into life under Nazi rule.

title: Ghost Story
description: The connections between a disinterested young girl being held captive in shady Florida motel, surviving whirlwind party where aspiring actress passes away, and teen teacher's fixation on one of his students raise questions.

title: Blue World
description: Features a collection of macabre stories alongside the novella "Blue World"

title: Cyclops
description: A secret American/Cuban agreement between the president and Fidel Castro and a secret moon base named the Jersey Colony, built by ten influential Americans, surpasses even Dirk Pitt's unquestionable talent.

title: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People
description: A demonstration of a comprehensive, all-encompassing, principle-based approach to managing personal and professional issues.

title: A Cast of Corbies
description: A peculiar pall has formed over Alanda. The Church's representatives are actively working to identify unauthorized magic, and music is now being held responsible for its origination as a mystery that cannot be completely destroyed. If it remains suspect, it must be made harmless and reduced to the same level of priestly authority. Meanwhile, Free Bards who were not allowed to join the Guild are being expelled from various lands. However, all Free individuals have the option to escape persecution while remaining in freedom camp.

title: Shakespeare's Sonnets
description: Provides a list of 154 sonnets by Shakespeare and includes detailed descriptions of each, as well as an introduction to the play.

title: The Color Purple
description: A set of letters exchanged over three decades reveals the lives of two sisters-Nettie, a missionary in Africa, and Celie, another southern woman married to he dislikes.

title: Night of the Fox
description: When an American officer who knew about the D-Day invasion goes missing in German-occupied Jersey, the Allies enlist Harry Martineau to lead the rescue effort.

title: Wolf's Hour
description: This book offers an incredibly thrilling and captivating account of the werewolf as a conflicted being and enthralling warrior.

title: Journey To Ixtlan
description: The author reflects on his ten-year apprenticeship in sorcery and the teachings of his teacher, a Yaqui Indian.

title: Second Ring of Power
description: Don Juan transforms Dona Soledad, a mysterious and formidable woman, into Xenical sorcerer Donales who is on opportune duty to test Castaneda in retaliation for almost murdering him.

title: Power of Silence
description: Carlos recalls more of the teachings of Don Juan, including the true significance and purpose of sorcery and magic, and the fictitious nature of all realities.

title: Fire from Within
description: The author describes being taught by the sorcerer Don Juan about the mystical religious ideas and rituals of the Mexican Indians.

title: Tales of Power
description: Don Juan imparts his final lessons to Carlos before he and Don Genaro vanish, including the principles of naugal and tonal, as well as the techniques of the perfect warrior.

title: STINGER
description: Inferno, a remote Texas town, is haunted by an evil creature that captures the heart of the universe and causes destruction through brutal executions and mutations until the people unite to fight against him.

title: The Story of Philosophy
description: Examines the history of speculative thought by paying special attention to the works of Plato, Bacon, Spinoza, Kant, Schopenhauer, and Nietzsche.

title: Swan Song
description: A mythical entity, known as the Man with the Scarlet Eye, roams the bleak terrain of an America devastated by nuclear war. He is consumed by the dark desires of his followers and has no desire to harm them except for Swans soul. Those who would protect her are determined to fight for what is left of the worldand their souls. In a wasteland filled with monstrous creatures and marauding armies,

title: Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul
description: The burning of a passenger check-in desk at Heathrow Airport prompts Dirk Gently to investigate the cosmic forces responsible for the incident.

title: Boy's Life
description: After investigating the gruesome murder of Cory Mackenson and his father, they come face-to-face with the barbaric Blaylock clan. A group that is believed to be united by racism, along with a river-dwelling reptilian creature. Reissue.

title: Joy Within
description: This book is a helpful guide for beginners in meditation, carefully guarding against any particular religious or spiritual beliefs. It provides lucid explanations of what meditation is and offers various benefits, such as inner tranquility, stress reduction, relaxation, and joy.

title: Mystery Walk
description: The Shape Changer's machinations threaten the lives of Billy Creekmore and Wayne Falconer, two young men with exceptional psychic abilities.

title: Principle Centered Leadership
description: The author encourages business readers to prioritize principles of excellence and quality in their professional lives and discusses the six conditions of effectiveness and organizational excellence patterns.

title: In the Name of Love
description: Jerry Harris, a self-made millionaire, is among the many true crime cases that are part of this collection, with his wife's eight-year search for answers after he disappeared.

title: Star Trek: The Next Generation: Nightshade
description: In the latest Star Trek book from New York Times bestseller bestselling author Laurell K. Hamilton, we meet Odin and Aretha Franklin. The story follows two centuries of intense conflict in Earth where most of the surface vegetation has disappeared along with the majority of surface air and almost all population extinct. Captain Picard and the U.S. SCUFF are sent to negotiate a settlement, while Lt. Worf and Counsellor Troi continue to send their cargo to Oriana as they prepare for an invasion.

title: Scar Lover
description: Harry Crews has established himself as a true American pioneer through twelve novels and non-fiction books and articles. With Scar Lovers, he ventures into the familiar "Crews territory" of the Southern landscape, where quirky characters coexist with unappealing individuals to explore the realities of redemption and the power of love without fear.

title: The Good Earth
description: A chronicle of a Chinese rural dweller and his persistent accumulation of land, while enduring hardships such as famine, drought, and revolution.

title: Star Trek
description: The Counter-Clock Incident, The Eye of the Beholder, Bem, and Slaver Weapon are four thrilling tales narrated from the USS Enterprise's log books.

title: Lincoln at Gettysburg
description: An account of Lincoln's speech details how the President utilized 272 words to bring back the Greek Revival rhetoric, transcendentalism categories, and Rural Cemetary Movement imagery.

title: Forever After
description: The heroes of a millennium-long war against the evil forces are about to find joy in life, but they are unaware that they have discovered four mantic objects that can cause chaos around the globe.

title: The Ship Avenged
description: The Kolnari who destroyed her home and an unscrupulous uncle are the two main factors that Joat needs to overcome in order to save herself from a devastating "breakout" disease that is threatening the lives of its victims.

title: The Free Bards
description: Instructs the tales of Rune, the most prominent violinist, who played Skull Hill to put them to sleep, Robin who must seek out the Ghost to aid them, and Nightingale who collaborates with T'fyrr, a creature with the face of raptor.

title: Berserkers
description: In one volume, the war against the berserkers begins! The death machines are designed to eradicate all life in the Galaxy, but there is still a segment of Galactic civilization that has evolved from Earth.

title: What Jane Austen Ate and Charles Dickens Knew
description: An essay offers an account of nineteenth-century British life.

title: Daily Reflections for Highly Effective People
description: Contains a daily reading plan that utilizes the author's guidelines for personal fulfillment and provides inspiration, insights, and motivational guidance.

title: Seamus Heaney
description: This book is a fitting representation of Seamus Heaney's poetry as art, as it draws on the insights and wisdom of the Nobel laureate.

title: American Tragedy
description: Examines the factors that led to America's involvement in the Vietnam War and how the Eisenhower, Kennedy, and Johnson administrations influenced the conflict.

title: This Craft of Verse
description: This work, which was transcribed from newly discovered tapes, is a deeply personal yet far-reaching introduction to the pleasures of language, and represents firsthand testimony to literature.

title: The Gardens of Emily Dickinson
description: Examines the connection between Emily Dickinson's love for gardening and her profession as a poet, noting that more than one-third of her poems feature her flowers and how her passion for plants was reflected in her choice of metaphors.

title: Rebecca's Revival
description: This is the story of how Caribbean slave Rebecca Protten, who helped spread black Christianity throughout the Atlantic world, became an evangelist on three continents.

title: The Writer of Modern Life
description: In these essays, Benjamin challenges Baudelaire's depiction as a late-Romantic dreamer and draws inspiration from the modern poet who is struggling to survive under the influence of urban commodity capitalism in Paris circa 1850.

title: Iron Kingdom
authors: Christopher M. Clark;University Christopher Clark, MD
description: Following the Second World War, Prussia, a historical entity that played incredibly important roles in European development, was no longer present. The Allies were determined to eliminate the Third Reich and its allure by writing about it. However, Christopher Clark's pioneering history highlights the complexity of PWC. Although now fading from the heartlands, the true story of German statehood offers eloquent insight into the explosive growth of modern Europe.

title: Ancilla to the Pre-Socratic Philosophers
description: The book is a comprehensive translation of the pre-Socratic philosophers' fragments that were originally presented in Diels, Fragmente der Vorsokratiker, fifth edition.

title: Doubling the Point
authors: Professor of General Literature J M Coetzee;J. M. Coetzee
description: Nadine Gordimer explains that J.M. Coetzee's perspective on the center of being is more profound than what most people realize, and it is conveyed through a skilled writer who uses tension and elegance to express this insight. Doubling the Point takes readers into the heart of his vision, which encompasses his extensive engagement with his own culture and modern society, making it essentially scholarly writing.

title: Ethics and the Limits of Philosophy
description: A prominent philosopher, in an effort to reorient ethics from hierarchical systems to individualisms, criticizes Kant's systematic moral theory and offers insight into a provocative alternative perspective.

title: The Ethics of Authenticity
description: There is a widespread belief in the decline of civilization and its improvement over the past few decades. While some mourn the shift towards relativism and nihilism, others acknowledge the progress made by Western culture. Taylor urges us to confront these moral and political challenges and take advantage of modernity.

title: The Fate of Reason
description: According to the author, the Fate of Reason is a general history that delves into the period between Kant and Fichte, which was one of the most innovative and fruitful periods in modern philosophy. The authors of this period rejected the two fundamental principles of Cartesian thought, including the authority of reason and epistemology, as well as the completion of Kantian philosophy and the beginnings of post-Kantian idealism.

title: New Worlds  Ancient Texts
description: Jose de Acosta, a Jesuit who encountered "the Indies", wrote that his experience in the Torrid Zone had left him with doubts about his ability to cope with extreme heat.

title: The Art of Shakespeare's Sonnets
description: Evaluates all of Shakespeare's sonnets with regards to their poetic structure, semantics, and incorporation of sounds and images.

title: Origins of the Modern Mind
description: In this book, "Old Man and the Modern Mind," we explore the evolution of human culture and cognition from prehistoric apes to artificial intelligence, with an original theory explaining how the human mind evolved from its presymbolic form. The book is illustrated with line drawings that highlight the remarkable feats of genius in these areas of life sciences.

title: Playing in the Dark
description: Describes how a divided society affected modern-day American literature and discusses works by Poe, Hawthorne (narrator), and writers such as Melville and Twain.

title: The Principles of Psychology
description: Presents a reliable updated version of the classic text, which rectifies numerous errors and incorporates all changes James made in the eight printings under his supervision, as well as revisions and new content added by the author to his own annotated copy.

title: The Roman Empire
description: Provides information on the Roman Empire from 44 B.C. to A.D. 235.

title: Sex and Reason
description: Examines the intricate past of human sexuality from ancient Greece to present-day Sweden and asserts that although sexual desires and dispositions are innate, much of individual sexual behavior is determined by conscious decision-making.

title: Sor Juana  Or  The Traps of Faith
description: The life of the seventeenth-century poet, intellectual, and feminist who became a nun and eventually abandoned secular education, is depicted in her times and Spanish intellectual traditions, with an emphasis on the inconsistencies within her group.

title: Sources of the Self
description: Examines the current notions of individuality, their formation, and consequences.

title: Summer for the Gods
description: explains the modern legal and historical impact of the 1925 Scopes trial, which dealt with teaching evolution in the classroom.

title: Time's Arrow  Time's Cycle
description: Explores scientific concepts related to the measurement of the earth's past.

title: The Visible Hand
description: Examines the methods of production and distribution in the U.S. and how their management has become more organized over time.

title: Wittgenstein on Rules and Private Language
description: This book by Saul Kripke highlights Wittgenstein's examination of the concept of following a rule through his insightful philosophical insights.

title: The World  the Text  and the Critic
description: Observes that contemporary critics manipulate literature to fit their theories and examines the influence of Marxism, linguistics, psychoanalysis, and structuralism on literary analysis.

title: De officiis
description: During the turbulent period of Julius Caesar's rule, dictatorship and death in a republic, Cicero (Marcus Tullius) lived as 106-43 BCE and delivered speeches to various groups of people.

title: Metamorphoses
description: Ovid, who was born in Sulmo and spent his formative years studying rhetoric and law in Rome, became deeply involved in public service and devoted himself to poetry and society. He was initially banished after insulting the emperor Augustus with his Ars Amatoria, but later lived in the cold and isolated town of Tomis on the Black Sea before continuing writing for various reasons including being exiled for unknown reasons.

title: Plato in twelve volumes
description: The life of Plato, the great philosopher of Athens, is uncertain. He was an admirer of Socrates and established his own philosophical school in the grove of Academus after being born in 427 BCE. It is possible that he left Athina for a time after the execution of Jesus Christensen, traveled to Cyrene, Egypt, and Sicily, was wealthy, critical of advanced democracy, but it is not clear how much clerical influence had influenced his ideas.

title: History of the Peloponnesian War
description: The Peloponnesian War was made up of three battles, with Thucydides merging them into a single narrative before his death in 396 BCE. Although unfinished and not fully researched, this history is unparalleled in its description and depth of understanding.

title: Hiero
description: Xenophon, who lived around 430-354 BCE, produced several minor works including Hiero, Agesilaus, Ways and Means, Wealth and Manipulation, The Constitution of Lacedaemon, Athenian politics, and the Constitution Of The Athenians.

title: Epictetus
description: Epictetus, a slave philosopher, wrote the "Discourses" in these volumes. Volume 2 features "Fragments" and "The Encheirdion," which are practical precepts for stoicism and can be considered as if life were an art.

title: The Art of Love  and Other Poems
description: Ovid (43 BCE-17 CE) employs didactic poetry in Face Cosmetics, Art of Love, and Remedies for Love. His Ibis is an elegiac curse-poem.

title: Babrius and Phaedrus
description: The first century CE may have been the time when Babrius wrote his fables in Greek verse that were both humorous and pointed. Later, Phaedrus created lively fictitious Latin verses that ridiculed the social and political conditions in Augustan Rome.

title: Αλκηστισ
description: A freshly edited Greek text of three plays and a precise, elegant translation with explanatory notes has been published in the first volume of Euripides David Kovacs.

title: Fragmenta
description: In all age groups, Euripides (ca. 485-406 BCE) was highly regarded for his dramatic works, which contained pathos, terror, unexpected plot turns, and intellectual investigation. His new edition includes the text and translation of three plays. Trojan Women, a play about the causes and effects of war, develops the theme "the tragic unpredictability of life," while Iphigenia among the Taurians and Ion show off their bravery in exploring the mysteries of ancient Rome.

title: Never Let Me Go
description: A gothic spectacle. A discussion on death and lost innocence: a portrayal of teenhood as the pivotal moment in life when self-identity brings meaning to one's future.

title: Gift from the Sea
description: A woman's musings on life, its phases, and states, juxtaposed with the natural riches of living in the ocean.

title: Doctor Faustus
description: The book is not being backed by the publisher.

title: Toni Morrison
description: The book includes six novels by Toni Morrison, an American Nobel laureate who writes about the African-American experience in America's largely white society, including "Beloved," "Sula," and "Jazz," as well as "Tar Baby," Song of Solomon, and finally "The Bluest Eye."

title: If on a Winter's Night a Traveler
description: The ten novels that are so distinct and dissimilar that they overlap, with each book being interrupted at a crucial time of excitement to proceed with another novel reflecting another literary movement.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A man is obligated to endure unrelenting physical and psychological punishments as a form of revenge for murder.

title: Selected Short Stories of William Faulkner
description: Featuring exquisitely illustrated hardcover classics, the Modern Library collection features works such as Snopes (written by William Faulkner), As I Lay Dying and The Sound and the Fury, as well as Light in August and Absalom, Absolu.

title: The Complete Collected Poems of Maya Angelou
description: This is a definitive collection of Angelou's previous anthologies, including Just Give Me. Cool Drink of Water, Oh Pray my Wings Gonna Fit Me Well, And Still I Rise, I Shall Not Be Moved, On the Pulse of Morning and Shaker, Why Don't You Sing? (50,000 First Print).

title: The Sword of Honour Trilogy
description: Evelyn Waugh's most remarkable accomplishment is this trilogy that focuses on World War II and its military officer experiences. The protagonist, Guy Crouchback, finds himself caught up in the challenge of protecting Christian values against Nazi barbarism, but eventually learns to embrace the complexities and cruelties of war.

title: In the Kitchen with Rosie
description: With 50 recipes and 8 full-color photographs by author Micheal McLaughlin.

title: Rabbit Angstrom
description: Harry "Rabbit" Angstrom's life is chronicled in four novels, which portray the changes occurring in American society between the 1960s and 1980s.

title: A fine balance
description: In the mid-1970s, a "State of Internal Emergency" has been declared in India, and four different people find themselves caught between their lives. Author readings from the award-winning Such ol' Journey.

title: The Sibley Field Guide to Birds of Western North America
description: A handbook for bird enthusiasts aimed at the field provides details on 703 bird species found in the western Rocky Mountains, as well as illustrations that illustrate species from different perspectives.

title: Swann's Way
description: The narration interrupts recollections of his childhood in late-nineteenth-century France to recall the ongoing affair between Odette de Crecy and a family acquaintance.

title: The Sound and the Fury
description: Describes the challenging upbringing of Jason, Quentin, Caddy, and Benjy Compson from the south.

title: Stars in Their Courses
description: Presents the Battle of Gettysburg in Confederate and Union terms.

title: The Poetry and Short Stories of Dorothy Parker
description: The first part of Ketubot's story.

title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas and Other American Stories
description: Comprises the journalist's customary narrative of his Las Vegas excursion and three supplementary readings.

title: Blood Meridian  Or  The Evening Redness in the West
description: "The Kid," a fourteen-year-old boy, is the main character of this novel, which follows an organized crime campaign that took place in the USSR and Mexico circa 1850. The book was first printed with 15,000 copies.

title: In Search of Lost Time  Volume IV
description: "Flowers and plants lack any conscious intention and are resigned to exposing their genitals. Proust's male and female counterparts are similarly shameless, with no question of right and wrong. Homosexuality is as unquestionable as the mode of fecundation of Primula veris or the Lythrum salicoria."

title: The Red and the Black
description: Julien Sorel's pursuit of power during the Bourbon Restoration goes against all established moral principles.

title: The Killer Angels
description: In an effort to draw down the Union Army of the Potomac, the Confederate Army invades the North and engages in a bloody four-day battle at Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.

title: The Collected Autobiographies of Maya Angelou
description: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings, Gather Together in My Name, SINGIN' AND SWINGIL' and Gettin' Merry Like Christmas, The Heart of a Woman, All God's Children Need Traveling Shoes, and A Song Flung Up to Heaven are all featured in 20,000 copies of Angelou' autobiographies in one omnibus edition.

title: The Murders in the Rue Morgue
description: A retired detective is tasked with solving a puzzled pair of murders, and the book features commentary, biographical notes, as well as supplementary reading group instructions.

title: Darkness Visible
description: The author shares his experience of struggling with depression and offers advice on how to seek help for others.

title: The Fall
description: The confessions of one man show his belief in justice and his own failure to live up to the expectations.

title: Hiroshima
description: The conventional narrative of the day the initial atomic bomb was dropped is a haunting reminder of those who made it through, and serves as harbingeringer for the conscience of humanity.

title: Mama Day
description: Mama Day, a healer and seer in southeastern Georgia, has her talents tested when her niece's life is at stake.

title: Where I'm Calling from
description: A one-of-a-kind collection by a remarkable writer, this compilation of Carver's finest works spans his entire literary career and features seven new additions. Since his passing in August of 1988, Raymond Carvers' fame has surged.

title: Running Dog
description: An erotic film shot in the Berlin bunker of Hitler was discovered by a woman reporter and an American senator's staff assistant, who were informed that it had been sold by someone who was found murdered and dressed as.

title: The Names
description: The discovery of a ritual-murder cult in the Aegean causes James Axton, an American risk analyst, to travel to Lahore and explore its hidden meanings.

title: What We Talk about when We Talk about Love
description: Male and female characters with no education, knowledge, or aspirations, are the focus of these narratives, but they are too lacking in imagination to be successful.

title: Gideon's Trumpet
description: The tale of a prisoner's defense that someone on trial should not be denied the right to seek legal counsel should come true.

title: Invisible Man
description: A black man's quest for success and the American dream culminates in a trip from college to Harlem, where he encounters personal rejection and social awkwardness.

title: Lolita
description: A book that examines the moral fallout resulting from a man's obsession with his step-daughter, which causes harm to those in his vicinity.

title: Cathedral
description: Loneliness, loss, the tragic jargon of everyday life, and redemption are all featured in twelve stories.

title: The History of Sexuality
description: One of the 20th century's most prominent scholars presents a controversial narrative that examines the changing social, economic, and political landscapes that have shaped our perceptions of sex.

title: I  Claudius
description: Claudius, the emperor, recounts his experiences during the reigns of Augustus and Tiberius, as well as Caligula, and the events that led to his rise to power in a classic novel.

title: No Exit  and Three Other Plays
description: The head of French existentialism has produced English versions of four plays that explore the concept of human guilt.

title: Ada  Or  Ardor  a Family Chronicle
description: The novel portrays an incestuous love affair that occurred in a utopian America during the turn of the last century.

title: Aké
description: According to the Nigerian author's account of his early childhood, which includes stories of being raised by his parents, Yoruba elders and Christian missionaries, he shares their experiences of growing up under such conditions.

title: Strong Opinions
description: Nabokov's personal opinions on art, education, politics, literature, movies, and modern times are evident in interviews, articles, or editorials he read during the 1960s and 1970s.

title: Mary
description: A young Russian exile recounts in poetic form his first love affair.

title: The Complete Monty Python's Flying Circus
authors: Graham Chapman;Monty Python (Comedy troupe);Terry Gilliam;Eric Idle;Terry Jones
description: Provides the complete scripts for the Monty Python TV program, which was initially aired on BBC television from 1969 to 1974.

title: The Defense
description: The grandmaster of Luzhin is recognized for his exceptional skill in chess, but his passion quickly turns into obsession, causing his world to crumble during a championship match when his defense fades under his opponent's unexpected strategy.

title: The Eye
description: Smurov commits suicide due to being humiliated by her spouse, only to be even more embarrassed in the afterlife.

title: The Annotated Lolita
description: The literary analysis conducted with this novel examines the technical and thematic elements that make it a literary masterpiece.

title: Maus II
description: Vladek and his mother, Anja, survive the Holocaust and are reunited with their family. The author's story is told in a comic-book format.

title: The Best of Roald Dahl
description: A variety of funny and grotesque characters from all walks of life are depicted in stories, sharing their macabre adventures.

title: The Stories of Vladimir Nabokov
description: The book contains 65 stories that cover topics such as human relations, human nature, and political satire, with 13 English translations being first read in the country.

title: Hit Men
description: An in-depth exploration of the multibillion-dollar music industry provides insight into the business operations of major record labels and includes profiles of key figures involved in the industry.

title: The Origin of Satan
description: The examination of the devil's role in both biblical and modern times suggests that social gorups who opposed Christianity, such as pagans and Jews, were typically depicted as demons and thus established as threats. Reprint. 60,000 first edition.

title: A History of the World in 10 1/2 Chapters
description: Provides an eclectic and historically correct portrayal of the origins of life on Earth, ranging from a playful depiction of Noah by arkark's to the spiritual journey of an American astronaut.

title: Go Down  Moses
description: The mythical Yoknapatawpha County is the setting for seven interconnected tales that explore the dynamic, evolving connections between Blacks and whites as well as between humans and nature.

title: Light in August
description: The novel, which depicts a life without end, features Lena Grove, who is helpless and searching for her unborn child's father, Reverend Hightower, plagued by dreams of Confederate mounted soldiers, and drifter Joe Christmas consumed by his mixed heritage.

title: Chilly Scenes of Winter
description: Charles is the subject of this book, featuring his love interest, Phi Beta Kappa member Sam, who used to sell coats, and Charles' mother who spends a lot of time in the bathtub feeling depressed.

title: Shoot the Piano Player
description: Previously, Eddie played the piano in Carnegie Hall hall with revered people and now performs at nightclubs in Philadelphia. However, he is suddenly confronted by two strangers who offer both opportunities and treacherous pasts. In Shooting the Piano Player, we explore the emotional journey of respecting one's family and trusting others to come back to his former self.

title: The Beggar Maid
description: This article was originally titled: "Who do you think you are? 1978."

title: A Midwife's Tale
description: Describes the life of Martha Ballard, an 18th-century midwife who lived in Maine, using her extensive diary from the 1920s.

title: The Woman in the Dunes
description: A Japanese biologist is imprisoned in a deep sand hole by the locals of tented seaside communities.

title: The Rebel
description: The author examines how the theories of philosophers like Rousseau, Hegel, and Marx have been exploited.

title: The Art of Fiction
description: A guide to creative writing explores different aspects of writing style, and features analyses of works by a diverse range of writers, from Homer to Mark Twain.

title: Success
description: Martin Amis transforms Success into a Jacobean revenge plot, with its deviously written storyline and ingenious portrayals of two foster siblings who engage in ruthless confrontations filled with class animosity, sexual hostility, and heartbreak.

title: Dead Babies
description: The Marquis de Sade's presence at a house party of P. G. Wodehouse would make for an unexpected and comical scene similar to the events in London Fields.

title: Hype and Glory
description: From the perspective of a former and current Miss America Pageant judge, the author of "Adventures in the Screen Trade" shares stories from his time at the Cannes Film Festivals.

title: The Heidi Chronicles and Other Plays
description: Three dramas depict the dilemmas of recent college graduates, a woman striving to become entrepreneur and mother, and an art historian changing with the times from the 1960s to the 1980s.

title: Dispatches
description: Men on patrol in Vietnam who were under siege at Khe Sanh, strapped into helicopters, and experiencing ongoing nightmares documenting the daily realities of war.

title: Touching the Rock
description: Blindness is explored through an intensely personal investigation that uncovers a world of sound and echo, individuals without faces, the peculiar connection between waking and dreaming, and new perceptions of nature, personality, or human experience.

title: The Hamlet
description: Observes the growing dominance of Flem Snopes, a white-trash farmer, in the Frenchman's Bend town of Mississippi.

title: Athena
description: A woman appears to emerge from an artist's paintings with a violent past, and their ongoing infatuation leads to the sudden disappearance of the woman.

title: The Radicalism of the American Revolution
description: Discusses the nature of colonial society and the changes that came about due to the republican tendencies that emerged after the Revolution.

title: Mortals
description: In Botswana's capital, a series of events unfolds as ten former Americans, including CIA agent disguised as an English school teacher, disillusioned wife, and black holistic physician, become embroiled in tumultuous rebellion. Reader' Guide: Reprinted. 10,000 initial printing.

title: Selected Speeches and Writings
description: Documents Lincoln's campaigns for public office, the evolution of his stance against slavery, his debates with Stephen Douglas, and the significant speeches he gave during his presidency.

title: Caramelo  Or  Puro Cuento
description: Lala Reyes and her family travel by car from Chicago to Mexico City every year, where she recounts tales about her grandmother, the forefather of renowned shawl makers, including one that has been preserved in Lalap's collection.

title: Written on the Body
description: Combining love and philosophy, the novel takes readers through the life of a married woman and her sexual relationship with an unknown lover.

title: After Henry
description: Provides reflections that assess the societal and political implications of the most inexplicable news of recent times.

title: The grass harp
description: These nine short stories depict a group of protagonists who come to terms with the intense isolation they face in life.

title: Other Voices  Other Rooms
description: Among the strange creatures that inhabit Skully's Landing is a boy who grows up.

title: Sanctuary
description: The dramatic tale of a Mississippi debutante's kidnapping is told through the presence of various wicked individuals.

title: The Great American Novel
description: A comedy starring Philip Roth portrays an unlikely group of men as the nation's baseball heroes.

title: The Comfort of Strangers
description: A young couple encounters violence during their vacation when they are enticed by sexual obsession and the local gentry's son.

title: Asa  as I Knew Him
description: Dinah Sachs recollects the history of her affair with Asa Thayer, the attractive editor of the magazine where she works, and shares both the disintegration of fervor and the imaginative and eternal meaning-filled experience of love.

title: The Death of Virgil
description: During Emperor Augustus' reign, Publius Vergilius Maro, the poet of the Aeneid and Caesar's enchanter, was summoned to the palace where he will soon pass away. Hermann Broch, from Austria, created one of modern twentieth century literature out of last hours of Virgil' life and the final stirrings his consciousness gave rise to a book that covers an entire world and conveys it with an immediacy that is both sensual and intellectual.

title: The Son Avenger
description: With its powerful writing and stunning scenes of medieval life, 'The Son Avenger' suggests a Greek tragedy with contrasting themes of fate and Christianity. Similarly, the antihero created by sculptor Undset is as mesmerizing as Oedipus or Lear.

title: When I was Puerto Rican
description: An enthralling autobiography that showcases magic, sexual tension, high comedy, and intense drama as a young girl leaves rural Puerto Rico for New York's tenements and pursues success. Reprint. 35,000 first printing.

title: When She was Good
description: A small town in the Midwest is the setting for this amusing and eerie story, which follows an elderly woman who is wounded by a strong American moralist disease.

title: Snow Country
description: The Nobel Prize-winning Japanese writer's tale of a failed love affair between opulent magnate and mountain geisha recounts the heartfelt journey of an unreserved woman who abandons her lover. 10,000 copies were printed initially.

title: Beauty and Sadness
description: A married writer and a teenage girl are involved in shattered love, more than two decades later.

title: Blues for Mister Charlie
description: drama about the white man killing a black teenager in an Southern town, and the racism and violence it causes.

title: Aman
description: Describes the life of a female in Somalia during the 1960s and offers insights into Somali culture through her own experiences.

title: Thousand Cranes
description: Upon receiving an invitation to attend the tea ceremony, Kikuji is unaware that Chikako has asked him for permission to view another bride.

title: Encore Provence
description: The author's celebration of Provence persists through a new book filled with culinary treats, colorful Gallic figures, and personal anecdotes.

title: Art & Lies
description: A high-speed train travels through the near future, carrying three passengers: Handel, a former prisoner who became forensic surgeon, Picasso, an outcast woman who relied solely on painting for comfort, and Sappho, the lesbian poet. The first printing of the book is available for 25,000 copies.

title: The Camera My Mother Gave Me
description: In her quest to diagnose a perplexing disorder through gynecological medicine, the author shares her experience and discusses the bigger questions that arise when sexual pleasure is sacrificed for pain.

title: Corelli's Mandolin
description: The world of the Greek island of Cephallonia is forever changed by the indescribable events of World War II, as its people find it challenging to adapt to the Axis invasion and subsequent occupation.

title: Resistance  Rebellion  and Death
description: These carefully chosen pieces reflect the author's personal convictions and his responses to the most important issues of his life.

title: Letting Go
description: Gabe Wallach, who was recently released from the Korean War, is finding it difficult to live a meaningful life and exhibit kindness. Philip Roth's fictional examination of American morals and social norms during the 1950s is renowned by TIME as "The unchallenged genius of comic irony."

title: The Simple Truth
description: Presents thirty-three verses that juggle a diverse web of myth, public and private history, family, memory, and invention while delving into the timeless truths of human life.

title: Walt Whitman's America
description: The life and works of one of America's most renowned poets are examined in this new study, which takes into account the social, cultural, and political contexts of the period.

title: Selected Stories
description: The author's career spans fifteen years and twenty-three stories, each representing a range of emotions from violence to tenderness, destruction to salvation, and hedonism to asceticism.

title: The Untouchable
description: A reprint of the book, which won the Lannan Literary Award and Publishers Weekly's Best Book of Year, features an account of a British intelligence agent and art historian who is caught working for Russia.

title: Psycho Shop
description: This book is a dark acid curio that was written by two of our finest writers, with an unexpected and memorable ending.

title: A civil action
description: The case involves a group of childhood leukemia victims and two industrial chemical plants, with the aim of covering nine challenging years and driving the young Boston trial lawyer to near bankruptcy.

title: The Grotesque
description: The paralyzed Sir Hugo Coal ponders the mystery of how his daughter’s fiance was murdered+a7, and what could be behind it all? Reprint. Movie tie-in.

title: The Road to Reality
description: Provides a summary of the physical laws that govern the universe, as well as information on theories related to relativity and quantum mechanics, cosmology, the Big Bang, black holes, and string and M theory.

title: Birdsong
description: A young Englishman named Stephen Wraysford travels to France in 1910, where he is confronted with a series of distressing events, including revealing his secret love life and becoming trapped in the First World War. Reprint. 40,000 first printing.

title: The Living and the Dead
description: The life of Secretary of Defense Robert McNamara, a combat Marine, an Army nurse, and an artist are the five individuals who find themselves caught in the chaos of the Vietnam War.

title: The Rules of Attraction
description: The author of Less Than Zero narrates the sexual behavior of a group of students at prestigious New England college with ironic and sympathetic tone.

title: Less Than Zero
description: Set in the early 1980s in Los Angeles, this best-selling novel portrays a group of attractive, drug-dependent, college-age characters who embark on oscillatory adventures and achieve fame. The first printing of the book was sold 17,500 copies.

title: The Charterhouse of Parma
description: Observe the exploits of Fabrizio del Dongo as he becomes a part of Napoleon's army shortly before the Battle of Waterloo, and faces difficulties in keeping his affection for Clelia concealed from the intrigues and secrets of the small court of Parma.

title: Basic Writings of Nietzsche
description: "The Birth of Tragedy," "Beyond Good and Evil," and "On the Genealogy of Morals" are among the six selected works by which Nietzsche primarily critiques Western morality while providing insights into Christianity and art.

title: Shalimar the Clown
description: In 1991, Shalimar the Clown, a Kashmiri Muslim driver, killed Ambassador Maximilian Ophuls, America's ex-ambassador to India and counterterrorism chief, at his home where he was staying in an illegally built house.

title: In the Land of White Death
description: An Arctic expedition in 1912 aboard the Saint Anna is recounted by a Russian navigator, who describes the challenging journey across the Arctic Ocean to seek assistance in 1914.

title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
description: Documents the journey of a freelance writer who ventured into the drug trade on risqué, eccentric adventures.

title: In the Hand of the Goddess
description: Alanna is granted the honor of being Prince Jonathan's squire, but she must also possess courage to save him from the evil sorcerer.

title: P.J. Funnybunny Camps Out
description: Although P.J. and his friends object to Donna and Honey Bunny going camping with them, the girls demonstrate that it is a challenging endeavor even for boys.

title: Junie B. Jones and a Little Monkey Business
description: Junie B. misidentifies her new baby brother as a baby monkey, causing both excitement and confusion in her kindergarten class.

title: Ballet Shoes
description: A classic children's story features three indomitable orphans who, while hopeful, set out to make a name for themselves in the entertainment industry. Reprint.

title: Dear God  Help!!! Love  Earl
description: Earl is willing to do whatever it takes to avoid the most mischievous student at school-even if it means acting like a complete fool.

title: Daisy-head Mayzie
description: A young Mayzie McGrew becomes a global sensation when she has something to say about an orange flower growing out of her head, and everyone wants to get rid of it.

title: Dr. Seuss's ABC
description: Various pictures start with each letter of the alphabet, including an alligator belonging to Aunt Annie and a yellow yak that is seen yawning.

title: The Berenstain Bears and the Blame Game
description: The Bear family endeavors to resolve their issues without resorting to a blame game for each catastrophe.

title: The Little Butterfly
description: Observes the behavior of a newly formed caterpillar from birth to metamorphosis, mating, and migration.

title: The Lorax
description: Local pollution and business practices that harm the environment are outlined in the Once-ler.

title: Three Tales of My Father's Dragon
description: A collection of three stories that recount the fanciful adventures of Elmer Elevator and a young flying dragon named Boris.

title: The Trail of Tears
description: The Cherokee Nation, led by their chief John Ross, were forced to leave their ancestral land and travel 1,200 miles to Oklahoma in 1838. A tale of friendship, hostility, rejoicing, and even betrayal.

title: Earthquake in the Early Morning
description: Jack and Annie are transported to San Francisco in 1906 by the magic tree house, just in time for one of the most massive earthquakes ever recorded in the United States.

title: The Cat in the Hat
description: On a rainy day, the Cat in the Hat entertains two children at home by showing them some tricks and games.

title: The More Than Complete Hitchhiker's Guide
description: There are five stories in the story by Douglas Adams.

title: Every Night Italian
description: Exhibits the method for creating speedy, delectable Italian dishes in bite-sized portions.

title: The Metamorphosis  in the Penal Colony and Other Stories
description: The Metamorphosis, In the Penal Colony, and Other Stories, translated by Joachim Neugroschel for PEN, are considered to be the most exceptional English-language anthology of Kafka's works. These translations have made Kaifka’s work accessible to a new generation, providing insight into one of his most controversial writers of all time, as well as timeless pieces of modern fiction such as "The Judgment", which is widely acclaimed among critics.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: Despite his former love being married and financially stable, a recently wedded young man is determined to get back together.

title: A Life in Letters
description: An artist's life-sized self-portrait is a vibrant representation of the literary figure.

title: The Pat Hobby Stories
description: The late 1930s saw the emergence of a Hollywood scenario hack that featured seventeen episodes, introduced by Arnold Gingrich, the publisher of "Esquire," which was published from January 1940 to May 1941.

title: The Short Stories of F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Gathers over forty Fitzgerald tales and provides brief background information on each one.

title: The Garden of Eden
description: Ernest Hemingway's final unfinished novel, The Garden of Eden (1986), became a sensational bestseller after his death in 1961. It recounts the story of David Bourne, ten-year-old Catherine, and their tragic alliance with Catherine on the Côte d'Azur in the 1920s.

title: American writers
description: Includes essays on important American writers, including biographical and critical works. Presents essays signed by scholars submitted by experts in the area.

title: Janet  My Mother  and Me
description: The writer describes the impact of his mother's friendship with Janet Flanner on his life.

title: Achilles in Vietnam
description: A groundbreaking and innovative book that compares the soldiers of Homer's Iliad with Vietnam veterans who suffered from post-traumatic stress disorder.

title: John Adams
description: This epic biography by David McCullough narrates the story of John Adams, a brilliant intellectual who was known as "the colossus of independence" and one of the most courageous but also dangerous national heroes.

title: The Making of the Atomic Bomb
description: traces the progress of the atomic bomb from Leo Szilard's idea through the struggle to design a practical device, and then on to the Hiroshima bombing.

title: Italians
description: Explores the essence and past of Italy's people.

title: The Promise of Rest
description: The conclusion of Reynolds Price's A Great Circle is a stunning and completely independent account of the emotional journey that unfolds. It tells the story of Wade Mayfield'Story, in which his parents are separated and their friends come together to care for him with all their hearts. However, they are not prepared for the incredible mystery that Wade has prepared to reveal when he dies, which prompts them to discuss how they came to know each other again after his passing, and what this will mean for future generations.

title: The Reawakening
description: In 1965, Primo Levi's "Survival in Auschwitz" was published as a sequel to his classic Holocaust memoir "The Reawakening." The book recounts the story of his liberation from the German death camp in January 1945 by the Red Army. He then traveled through the Soviet Union, Hungary, and Romania to return to Italy via train trains passing through bombed cities and transit camps.

title: Survival In Auschwitz
description: The writer recounts his twenty-month stay in the Nazi death camp.

title: The Sun Also Rises
description: During the socially dislocated period following World War I, an American immigrant and a British maiden marry off in vain.

title: Touched With Fire
description: The author of An Unquiet Mind, Kay Jamison, is a leading American psychologist who has gained recognition for her insights into the profound connections between manic-depression and creativity.

title: The Denial of Death
description: The author aims to demonstrate that the fear of death is the most significant factor in man's quest for eternal life, by drawing on religious and human sciences, particularly psychology after Freud.

title: A Calendar of Wisdom
description: A Calendar of Wisdom, the first English-language edition of Leo Tolstoy's work from his final years, is a daily life guide that illuminates how to live without fear and without constraint.

title: Good as Gold
description: A high-ranking State Department position could be in the hands of Dr. Bruce Gold, a forty-eight-year-old professor of English who is now facing the possibility of being disowned by his family.

title: Tolkien
description: Tolkien's fictional world is categorized by alphabet and contains information on historical, geographical, sociological, natural history, and biographergraphical details.

title: Something Happened
description: Bob Slocum, a man of great worth, had everything. He had adored his wife, three children, and girlfriends, but his discontent quickly transformed into frustration before something unexpected occurred. Joseph Heller's latest novel, Something Happened, is satirical and controversial, telling the story of business and American culture as though the reader was listening to the patter.

title: God Knows
description: In Joseph Heller's novel, the story of King David is both a powerful and heartwarming piece and an unforgettable experience.

title: On Death and Dying
description: Describes the manner in which individuals on the brink of death perceive themselves and others, and provides a humane means of easing the mental suffering of the terminally ill and their families.

title: Two Girls  Fat and Thin
description: This captivating novel, reissued to coincide with the paperback release of "Because They Wanted To", is infused with dark intensity and wicked humor. Gaitskill's pace and metaphors create a remarkable blend of eroticism, anger, sadness, and amusement that transports readers into the darker depths of modern life and the deepest senses."

title: The Complete Short Stories Of Ernest Hemingway
description: The sole complete collection by a Nobel Prize-winning author features Ernest Hemingway's most beloved short stories, such as "The Snows of Kilimanjaro," "Hills Like White Elephants," and "A Clean, Well-Lighted Place," along with seven new tales that have been published for the first time.

title: Soul of the Sword
description: This comprehensively illustrated history of war and its weaponry takes readers on a fascinating journey through humanity's most persistent and damaging characteristic, as well as the advancements in warfare technology. The first printing is available now at 35,000 copies.

title: Across the River and Into the Trees
description: In World War II, Colonel Richard Cantwell, an American soldier, falls in love with a young Italian countess in Venice.

title: Unlimited Power
description: According to Anthony Robbins, it is the new science of personal achievement. If you have ever dreamed of a better life, Unlimited Power will show you how to achieve that extraordinary quality of life and master your own professional and personal life. He has demonstrated through his books, tapes& seminars that by harnessing the power of the mind, you can do, have, achieve, and create anything you want for your life from heads of state or royalty to Olympic and professional athletes.

title: Tearing the Silence
description: Represents the sentiments of German-born Americans who still experience the shame caused by the Holocaust.

title: The Wheel of Life
description: A specialist in death and dying presents a memoir of her life, from war-torn Poland to teaching at the University of Chicago, where she shares her perspective on the afterlife.

title: Kate Vaiden
description: This contemporary American odysey of small-town life and red-clay land is the epitome of feisty, spellbinding and compelling heroine in modern fiction. Kate Vaiden's journey through middle age gives her an unrequited love for her son, who she left behind when she was only seventeen, and whether she finds him real or not.

title: Ronald Reagan
description: Evaluates Reagan's political career, including his involvement in the California tax revolt and the economic success of the United States during his tenure.

title: The Children's Book of America
description: Features American history, folk legends, and poems, as well as patriotic songs.

title: The Secret Diary of Anne Boleyn
description: Upon her coronation, Elizabeth I is presented with her mother Ann Boleyn's diary and informed of her love for her and her torment at the hands of Henry VIII.

title: The Fall of a Sparrow
description: A midwestern professor's career was ruined by his affair with a student, and he now goes to Bologna to attend judicial proceedings against terrorists who had murdered his eldest daughter.

title: The Walrus Was Paul
description: An explanation of the fabrication that Paul McCartney died in a car accident in 1966 and was substituted with an imitation.

title: The Last Temptation of Christ
description: The novel depicts Christ as a human who is at odds with his passionate desires and his victorious outcome on the cross.

title: Shadow
description: Gerald Ford declared that the country's long-standing national nightmare was over in a New York Times Notable Book after Richard Nixon stepped down. However, his book Shadow examines the subsequent administrations and highlights their realization of how the presidency was forever changed by the Watergate scandal.

title: Hamlet's Dresser
description: A Shakespeare tutor in the acting industry recounts his experiences of growing up with a troubled mother, unreliable father, and sister with severe disabilities, discovering Shakespeare that gave him pause and opportunity to explore life, as well as working alongside notable actors, seniors, or college students.

title: Out of the Woods
description: The life of men who were influenced by the rough, remote lifestyle of rural Kentucky is depicted in this collection of eight stories by an award-winning author known as "The Good Brother."

title: Merde!
description: Evaluates the significance of French slang expressions, idioms and epithets as well as colloquialisms.

title: Merde Encore!
description: Describes the significance of French language terms such as slang and local dialects, while also recognizing typical French gestures.

title: Mad Cowboy
description: The former cattle rancher, whose appearance on "The Oprah Winfrey Show" led to a lawsuit against him and his ex-wife, exposes the dangerous practices of the cattle and dairy industries.

title: The Noonday Demon
description: National Book Award-winning author Andrew Solomon's personal and cultural research on depression informs his treatment philosophy.

title: Cryptozoology A To Z
description: Examines the veracity and folklore of fabled creatures such as the Loch Ness demon and Sasquatch hero.

title: The Rum Diary
description: In the 1950s, Paul Kemp, a young journalist, began his profession on an urban newspaper in Puerto Rico and witnessed vivid depictions of colorful individuals during that time.

title: Easy Riders Raging Bulls
description: Speculates on the influence of the Hollywood elite over the films of both the 1960s and 1980s.

title: To Have and Have Not
description: The book To Have and Have Not portrays Harry Morgan, a sincere boat owner who is forced into running contraband between Cuba and Key West to save his family from financial ruin. His adventures take him into the world of wealthy and dispossessed yachtsmen who frequent the area, and involve him in an unexpected love affair. Hemingway's novel is both harshly true and oddly relatable as it explores the struggles of both those at the top and those that are not well-off.

title: No Heroes
description: The writer of The Same River Twice recounts his distressing yet ultimately revealing endeavor to return to Kentucky and commemorate the memory of his parents-in-law, who were Holocaust survivors on their way home from Poland in 1946.

title: Jukebox Queen Of Malta
description: The story of Rocco Raven's journey to Malta, where he meets his fate in the world-famous Jukebox Queen. It is a captivating and beautiful novel about love and war on an island that is perilously close to reality.

title: Yesterday I Cried
description: Iyanla Vanzant's National Bestseller: What is the lesson to be learned from the heartbreak of losing a loved one?

title: Of Time and the River
description: Leaving his Southern home, Eugen Gant journeys to Harvard University, New York City, and Europe, exploring his identity as an American and falling in love with a stunning stage designer.

title: Picture This
description: Rembrandt's "Aristotle Contemplating the Bust of Homer" re-conveys Aristotel'storied history and historical figures, concluding that not much has changed in 2,500 years.

title: The Mutineer
description: In the third and final book of unpublished letters, literary pioneer Hunter S. Thompson's last years (1976-2005) are documented.

title: Hey Rube
description: The ESPN columnist Hunter S. Thompson's columns are a blend of sports, politics, and sex. Along with his father who wrote Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, Hey Rube was an inspiration to American journalism due to his innovative ideas and gonzo tactics.

title: Screwjack
description: The book written by Hunter S. Thompson is sure to satisfy the fans of his famous Screwjack, which has been rumored to be as salacious, disturbing, and brutally lyrical as it was in rare collectors' and leather-bound copy copies printed in 1991. This edition includes "Mescalito," which was published in Thompson's 1990 collection Songs of the Doomed, but has only recently been made available for purchase by the public.

title: Exclusion and Embrace
description: At the end of the twentieth century, we are confronted with a disturbing reality that is not unique to each individual. The concept of otherness has become an unhealthy definition of "bad" and it is believed by some scholars that Christian theology must address the hatred towards others in order to propagate the gospel's message.

title: The Merlin Trilogy
description: The Merlin Trilogy by Mary Stewart is a highly acclaimed and beloved rendition of the Arthurian legend's lasting tale, featuring vivid prose depictions of Myrddin Emrys, Merlinus Ambrosius, and other legendary characters.

title: Leadership and the One Minute Manager
description: Leadership and the One Minute Manager® is a concise guide that educates managers on how to achieve effective Situational Leadership®. It defies the conventional management mandate of treating all employees equally, emphasizing the importance of tailoring management styles to employee needs, identifying the appropriate leadership style for each person, and using the same style consistently will lead to better management and increased motivation on all levels.

title: A Short History of World War II
description: Despite the proliferation of books on World War II, there has been no comprehensive and objective survey. Previous volumes have typically been written from a limited British or American perspective, or have neglected the significant causes and effects of the war. A Short History of World Wars II is primarily based on military history, but it covers everything from the peace settlements of Iw II to the postwar world ofthe late 1940's. It is also lucidly written and thorough enough to satisfy the needs of such historians as well as professional historian alike.

title: Worlds enough and time
description: Mariane O'Hara chronicles the events that take place in her home town during the last part of the parable, where most of Earth's history and literature is erased from computer banks, causing her family and colleagues to flee from the destruction of our planet.

title: The first man in Rome
description: A narrative that follows the formation of Republican Rome depicts the individuals who founded an empire, such as Marius and Sulla, each determined to become the First Man of Rome.

title: Ten Days to Self-Esteem
description: Have you ever found yourself feeling anxious about the future? Are you dissatisfied with your past achievements in life? If so, then this is the way to go. All you need to do is follow Dr. David Burns' book, Ten Days to Self-esteem, and you can achieve it without any drugs or therapy.
