title: Korean Short History
description: While Stokesbury' scholarly survey of "the half war" is as intense and concise as his brief histories of the two world wars, it takes a comprehensive approach with an emphasis on the details. The first third covers events such as the North Korean invasion in June 1950, the Pusan perimeter crisis, MacArthur's master stroke at Inchon, and the Chinese forces' intervention that November. Other popular histories also end at the three-quarter mark, often ending with equivocal but succinctly summar

title: Trapped in T Mirror
description: In this gripping book, Elan Golomb identifies the core emotional and psychological issues that millions of adults face. Simply put, the children of narcissists who prioritize their parents' well-being over their future prospects share a common belief that they are not entitled to exist: They believe they lack the right to do what they want with their lives. Physically unbearable self-loathing can lead to conditions such as overeating, anorexia, or any other form of mental illness.

title: Julius  the Baby of the World
description: Despite being the most amusing character in Chester's Way, Lilly thinks her new baby brother, Julius, is unclean and would be devoid of any sense of humor. However, when Cousin Garland criticizes him, she becomes aggressive and declares his sibling as the newborn prince, until she takes him for herself.

title: The Twelve Dancing Princesses
description: The tale of twelve stunning princesses and a charming young boy who solves their shoes' mystery has been cherished by children for generations. Now, Marianna Mayer brings all the magic and romance of this classic to life, from the magical forests of silver, gold, and diamonds to enchanting twilight palaces where dancers can dance to music. Kinuko Craft, an award-winning artist, adds her own magic with intricately painted jewel-like artwork that enchants visitors across the globe.

title: Love Poems
description: Known for her contortionista skills over the course of her career, Nikki Giovanni is now back in the business of being one of America's most celebrated and contemptuous writers.Her latest release includes more than twenty new poems, such as "Seduction" which explores the world-famous "Just a Simple Declaration of Love," and "I Wrote & OMelet", written for jazz musician Tupac Shakur, as well as the fearsome yet beautiful "All Eyez on U."

title: Behind a Mask
description: Six years before writing Little Women, Louisa May Alcott entered a novelette called "Pauline's Passion and Punishment" into tin in. Not only did it win the $100 prize but it was also published as an anonymous piece, becoming the first of many such "blood & thunder tales" for her.

title: NYC Ballet Workout
description: The New York City Ballet Workout is a revolutionary fitness program that will help you develop lean abs, firm buttocks and contoured legs, slim thighs, strong arms, perfect posture, flexibility, and dance moves. It features over 300 step-by-step and other photographs, making it the most beautiful exercise book ever created.

title: Kevin Trudeau's Mega Memory
description: According to Kevin Trudeau, the world's foremost memory improvement training expert, if you have a "bad memory," then it is impossible. Truddingly, there are no bad memories, but we must learn to access our natural memory. As the founder of the American Memory Institute, Truddedeau advises that every lesson in this book takes no more than thirty minutes per day and uses pictures instead of laborious word-association techniques.

title: Chester's Way
description: They were kind and had their own ways of doing things, such as cutting their sandwiches diagonally and using hand signals when riding bikes. This was until the arrival of Lilly, who lived with her own way of life.

title: The Purpose of Your Life
description: In her book, The Celestine Prophecy Experiential Guide, co-author Carol Adrienne reveals how to tap into the unseen power of intuition and synchronicity to achieve success, contentment, and serenity.

title: Naked Pictures of Famous People
description: These nineteen whip-smart essays feature Jon Stewart, the MTV generation' renowned master of modern humor, a face-in-the-blank comedian with witty sense of humour and discerning taste in his world.

title: Phantoms in the Brain
description: V.S. Ramachandran, an internationally acclaimed neuroscientist, has gained the respect and admiration of many scientists for uncovering answers to intricate and unconventional questions that few scientists have attempted to answer. His experiments, which employ simple tools like cotton swabs, water-based instruments, and dime-store mirrors, offer unparalleled insight into the deeply cellular architecture of the human mind. In Phantoms in the Brain, Dr. Ravi Shankar explores how his work with patients with unusual neurological disorders has led to new perspectives.

title: The Lost Tomb
description: Kent Weeks made history by uncovering the largest and most intricate mausoleum in Egypt, located 70 feet underground in the Valley of the Kings. He now speaks for the first time about the discovery and offers insights into what KV5 will reveal as it moves forward. The tomb was built during the era of Exodus and could have influenced ancient and biblical history, with lower levels likely to contain the remains of Ramesses II's mummies.

title: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs
description: The most popular tale of edible weather is reimagined! Wouldn't food falling like raindrops be amazing? Or would it likely be unappetizing?

title: The Bears on Hemlock Mountain
description: In a suspenseful novel, an eight-year-old boy overcomes his fear of crossing Hemlock Mountain and takes on the task by chanting, "There are no bears on Hemmons." Reissue.

title: The Fourth of July Story
description: This accessible tale of America's birthday by Alice Dalgliesh, a two-time Newbery Honor recipient, is full color and has the potential to make history.

title: My Name Is Maria Isabel
description: Marâia Isabel, a third-grader from Puerto Rico who now lives in the United States, is eager to fit in at school and has been given an assignment by her teacher to write "My Greatest Wish".

title: Hitty Her First Hundred Years
description: The memoirs published by Hitty are a delight to read, as they contain details of her most exhilarating adventures on land and sea. Her charming personality is all-pervasive even when viewed in ONE view. She is not an ordinary doll. Made in the 1800s, she was gifted to Phoebe Preble, who took her with her on errant sailings across the globe.

title: A Child's Garden of Verses
description: Robert Louis Stevenson, a master poet and storyteller, has written this delightful collection of sixty-six poems that capture the essence of childhood. The poems recount various moments of joy from sailing boats down pondering rivers to waiting for the lamplighter in his imagination. Tasha Tudor's watercolor paintings depict eras past where she loved children and nature. Her talent is perfectly matched with these inspiring poems, making this cherished gift edition perfect.

title: Sad Underwear and Other Complications
description: I come across an individual with a disheveled underwear that makes me feel uneasy, similar to my best friend's feeling.

title: Salt in His Shoes
description: Despite his small stature, Michael Jordan's determination and hard work ethic are valued more than his size in basketball.

title: Where Is Baby's Mommy?
description: Let's play hide-and-seek together as baby plays, with its sturdy construction and easy-to-open flaps making it an excellent interactive book for parents and children.

title: Poppy
description: Poppy is a journey of self-discovery and bravery that holds great significance for every child.

title: Silver on the Tree
description: Will Stanton, the last-born of the Old Ones who are determined to free the world, must now collaborate with Merriman and Bran, a Welsh boy who is tied to the Light. The three Drew children are also drawn into the story, but they will also be mortal and battle death in an epic quest through time and space that explores the ancient myths of Britain.

title: The Tombs of Atuan
description: Ursula K. LeGuin's latest Earthsea novel features Tenar, a young wizard named Ged, who is now guarding the ancient Tomb of Atuan in Awakening.

title: Sagwa  The Chinese Siamese Cat
description: Ming Miao reveals to her kittens the ways of their forefather, Sagwa of China, that gave rise to the peculiar markings that have been present for millennia.

title: The Storm
description: Seabold the dog is saved by Pandora the cat, who becomes a lighthouse keeper and together they raise three young mice from the sea.

title: Voting Rights Days
description: Hitty, the daughter of a suffragist, is set in 1916 and has access to an up-close and personal account of the political battles that are necessary for women's voting rights. A companion guide is available at the time of writing.

title: Counting Christmas
description: Get ready to rejoice and anticipate the arrival of Christmas!

title: Who Wants a Cheap Rhinoceros?
description: If you're fed up with cats, dogs, goldfish, gerbils, and hamsters but want to own a cheap Rhinoceros, Shel Silverstein suggests that you might as well be the lucky kid in your life.

title: What a Scare  Jesse Bear
description: Jesse Bear is well-suited for Halloween, but his fear of going to the store becomes unbearable when it comes time to do it. He enjoys carving pumpkins and dressing up in costumes. Despite this, he soon learns to wear his mask and even perform some tricks with his parents.

title: The House of the Scorpion
description: The novella's story follows a drug lord with an iron halo, clones bred for their organs, and the essence of humanity. It won the National Book Award as well as the Newbery and Printz Honors. Matteo Alacrán was not born; he was harvested. His DNA originated from El Patrón, who lived in Argonne, Arizona, but his first cell split and then separated in another petri dish.

title: Dragondrums
description: Anne McCaffrey, the award-winning fantasy novelist, has returned with her bestselling Harper Hall Trilogy in a digest format, providing imaginative classics filled with wonder.

title: Dragonsinger
description: Due to her disallowed music making activities, Menolly flees her home and is escorted by the Masterharper to Harpershall, where she discovers that only her own self-doubt is impeding her progress.

title: Moo  Baa  la la La!
description: Sandra Boynton's signature animals are illustrated in a large, bold board book format, making it ideal for children who enjoy playing and mimicking the sounds and noises of animals.

title: The Octopus
description: A young octopus and Whistler, who are mice children living in a lighthouse, meet at the beach during low tide.

title: The Eagle
description: In a lighthouse, there are two mice, accompanied by dogs, cats, and another mouse, who wander around the woods but become unintelligent before being saved by an eagle.

title: Rash
description: In a future where society values freedom over safety, sixteen-year-old Bo's anger control issues result in his placement in incarceration on ice in the tundra, where he relies on his running skills and an artificial intelligence called Bork to ensure his well-being.

title: The Children's Homer
description: Young readers will find Publishers WeeklyColum's captivating portrayal of the Greek epics to be an unparalleled introduction to the classic myths.

title: Invisible
description: The Madham Line holds significant value for me, as it is my closest friend and a favorite spot. My only escape from society is building an elaborate bridge on the basement platform with his best friend Andy Morrow, who happens to be pretty cool.

title: Beatrice's Goat
description: Project Heifer's case illustrates how a young girl in her small Ugandan village dreams of attending school, but her family is given an income-generating goat.

title: Michael's Golden Rules
description: The Badgers' big baseball game sees Jonathan's friend Michael, his parents, and family members supporting him in achieving his best performance.

title: Amelia's 6th-Grade Notebook
description: Amelia encounters difficulties when she begins sixth grade at the same middle school where her older sister Cleo is an eighth-grader, and she has the most unpleasant teacher in three of her classes.

title: The Au Pairs
description: Three girls have a common ground: They want to spend their summer in the Hamptons, but Mara, Eliza, and Jacqui are all interested in being au pair.

title: I Love Saturdays y domingos
description: The child in this story has very special Saturdays and Sundays where she spends time with her grandparents, Abuelito y Abueleta.

title: Star Bright
description: PopTV has planned to keep Star in the news for 24 hours, but once the cameras are turned off, things start to look sour.

title: Alanna
description: The journey of Alanna towards knighthood begins with Alan, the younger twin from Trebond. She has always been interested in adventure and courage reserved for boys, while her twin, Thom, is eager to learn magic through a night out at the convent.

title: The Woman Who Rides Like a Man
description: "Alanna of Trebond is about to be crowned worthy as a man."

title: Soldiers of Destruction
description: Examines the origins of the Nazi SS and its Death's Head Division, documenting the significant influence of this influential group on military history.

title: Sounds  Feelings  Thoughts
description: The bilingual edition features seventy poems, with a focus on the period since 1967.

title: Dionysiac Poetics and Euripides' Bacchae
description: The author includes a later paragraph (p. 349-393) that discusses Dionysus and the Bacchae in light of recent scholarship.

title: The Myth of the Eternal Return
description: The essay on humanity's perception and comprehension of history commences with an examination of the conventional or mythological viewpoint and concludes by evaluating modern historiological approaches.

title: Eugene Onegin: Commentary and index
description: The book's title, Eugene Onegin: A Novel in Verse: Commentary, will be included in the description.

title: EUGENE ONEGIN - A NOVEL IN VERSE V.1
description: Presents Pushkin's poetic Russian classic about the ruthless fop who is betrayed by an ardent young woman.

title: The Essential Kierkegaard
description: A compilation of significant excerpts from the Danish philosopher's works.

title: A Source Book in Indian Philosophy
description: Contains important texts from the Vedic and Epic periods, the Heterodox and Orthodox systems, and contemporary Indian thought.

title: Philosophy and the Mirror of Nature
description: Philosophy and the Mirror of Nature was a major blow to the philosophical world. Richard Rorty, despite being renowned for his contributions to philosophy, wanted to address the problems that had troubled the analytic tradition. The book's popularity has increased significantly since its release, and it is now one of the best-selling books in philosophy.

title: Images and Symbols
description: Mircea Eliade, a prominent exponent of religion, mythology, and magic, asserts that myth and symbol are essentially 'a mode of thought' not only pre-existing to discursive thinking but also an essential part of human consciousness. He discusses some of the most powerful and ubiquitous symbols which have dominated folkloric imagination in both the East and West throughout history and cultural development.

title: Vladimir Nabokov
description: The story of Nabokov's life endures as he arrives in the United States in 1940, where a sudden triumph of Lolita sets him apart from his fellow countrymen and families.

title: The Rise of Christianity
description: In his book, which is aimed at ending the Christian-bashing in academia, sociologist Rodney Stark shows that Christianity gained popularity quickly because it provided its adherents with a superior faith and treated them better physically and spiritually than competing religions.

title: Making Democracy Work
description: What factors contribute to the success or failure of democratic governments? In a time when there is optimism for democratization but uncertain whether they will fail, this book provides empirical evidence for the role of civic community in building successful institutions. Robert Putnam and his colleagues conducted an experiment in 1970 that involved testing the performance of various governments across different regions, including agriculture, housing, and health services.

title: Multiculturalism
description: The latest edition of the acclaimed book Multiculturalism and "The Politics of Recognition" brings together a wider range of leading philosophers and social scientists to explore the political controversy surrounding multiculturalism. Charles Taylor's initial inquiry into whether liberal democratic governments should or shouldn't recognize the value of cultural traditions is now the focal point of this new edition, which is also supplemented by Jürgen Habermas' extensive essay on recognition and the democratic constitutional state and K. Anthony Appiahl'interview discussing how states might grant recognition programs.

title: The Nature of Space and Time
description: Provides a set of lectures given in 1994 by Hawking and Penrose, who were distinguished professors at Cambridge and Oxford, respectively, on the topic of how mathematical physics could best depict the universe's truths.

title: The Essential John Nash
description: Despite being announced as the winner of the Nobel prize in economics in 1994, John Nash's life was revealed to the world when Sylvia Nasar'S A Beautiful Mind biography released it. The book details his contributions to both game theory and mathematics, including Riemannian geometry and partial differential equations, for the first time.

title: Hamlet in Purgatory
description: In this piece, Stephen Greenblatt recounts his origins as a child who was fascinated by the ghost of Hamlet's father. His daring and ultimately enjoyable expedition takes him on an unexpected and fascinating journey through intellectual terrain that provides an unusual perspective on the rise and fall of Purgatory as both cult classics and wealthy establishments--and also offers supple versions of how Hamle played – in the mid sixteenth century English authorities fundamentally altered the definition of the living and dead.

title: The Two-Mile Time Machine
description: Describes the 1990s research in Greenland that exposed a past of worldwide climate change, and suggests that "switches" and "dials" that regulate Earth's climate may cause severe weather changes in the future.

title: Shamanism
description: Examines Shamanism's evolution throughout the millennia of human civilization, progressing from the Shaman traditions of Siberia and Central Asia to North and South America, Indonesia, Tibet, China, and other places. Eliade sheds light on the magico-religious existence of societies that prioritize the Shaman figure as a prominent figure.

title: Hegel's Preface to the Phenomenology of Spirit
description: This is a new translation of Hegel's most important short work, which includes running commentary and breaks down the most innovative aspects of his philosophy. The commentary serves as the foundation for all other works by providing an explanation of what was once considered to be the fundamental aspect of Historiography; it is both easy to read and highly precise, breaking away from Hegelian phrases and more closely based on the original while still being more faithful to the text than any previous translation.

title: On Bullshit
description: Describes the concept of bullshit, its dissimilarity from lying, how its perpetrators alter communication rules, and how consumption of such material can impact an individual's ability to tell the truth.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia CD Box Set
description: The Chronicles of Narnia, a 31-CD set of the seven stories in the popular fantasy series, is available for audiophiles who have read and enjoyed performances by some of America's most celebrated performers.

title: Second Home
description: Advised in planning, budgeting, real estate shopping, construction, remodeling, and decorating of lakefront cottages, beach homes, ski chalets or log cabins.

title: Sisters
description: The lives and careers of actresses Olivia de Havilland and Joan Fontaine are portrayed in a candid narrative, detailing their constant rivalry and mutual attraction.

title: The Legend of the Poinsettia
description: Despite her efforts, Lucida is unable to complete her gift of the Baby Jesus in time for the Christmas procession, but she can miraculously present the poinsettia.

title: Many Luscious Lollipops
description: Adjectives and their applications are introduced in short rhyming text and pictures.

title: Mine  All Mine
description: Describes the different types of pronouns, their proper usage, and offers humorous depictions of how it might sound without them.

title: Fantastic! Wow! and Unreal!
description: Introduces and elucidates multiple interjections, including "astonishing," "unbelievably," and "within the range of."

title: The Risk of Darkness
description: The risk of darkness explores the abduction and murder of a child in Yorkshire, with Simon Serailler playing an innocent character.

title: The Beatles years
description: The most eloquent and intimate account of the band's 30th year on record.

title: The Mansion on the Hill
description: The Mansion on the Hill is a definitive work that dispels the myth that rock 'n' roll was solely focused on revolutionizing the world. It is an indispensable read for any music enthusiast who lacks justification for their fascination with myths.

title: The World is Flat
description: The leveling of the playing field has been aided by the convergence of advanced technologies, knowledge pools, and resources across the globe, making each person potentially equal and competitive.

title: America
description: Many countries eagerly await the implementation of American democracy, which is why they find it so appealing. However, Jon Stewart and his fellow countrymen from The Daily Show provide an explanation of this unique form of government, detailing its history, processes, and how concepts like 'One man, one vote', -based on citizenry's input versus political influence, have become urban legends.

title: Alfred Hitchcock and the Making of Psycho
description: After 30 years, Psycho has taken the slant off other thrillers by providing an intimate look into its making process, featuring Stephen Rebello's meticulous instructions to darken theaters and close the curtains for 30 seconds after the opening credits.

title: Euripides
description: The story of Iphigenia at Aulis, which portrays the sacrifice made by Agamemnon during his expedition against Troy, is written at the end of the Peloponnesian war and delves into the social collapse that has influenced Greek society and its consequences. Pantelis Michelakis examines various topics from mythology to modern criticism, concluding with an analysis of major issues and themes related to race relations.

title: The Egyptologist
description: A witty and brilliantly written novel, The Egyptologist is set in the UK. It follows an archaeologist's quest to find the tomb of an apocalyptic ruler, starting with the desert plains of Egypt in 1922 and moving westward through Oxford, the First World War battlefields, and regal court.

title: Economics: European Edition
description: An introductory text to economics, Economics: European Edition brings together an international perspective of real-world examples and economic theory. It is equipped with various elements to enhance student understanding and add further resources to reinforce the learning experience.

title: Banker
description: It's not easy to identify the source of disaster, but identifying one event as specific will lead to far-off cataclysm. Tim Ekaterin first recognizes the day his boss stepped into a fountain and then encounters unconnected people and events that combine in random acts of violence with the threat of death. Set in the worlds of thoroughbred racing and merchant banking, the story takes place over  three years, gradually evolving from peaceful to violent explosive action.

title: Sushi for Beginners
description: Who will suffer the nervous breakdown? Clodagh, who awaits her beautiful husband's return, or Lisa, a fragile and unbalanced woman who has just been demoted. Or maybe Ashling, an ordinary person who is actually weirder than she appears to be.

title: Medicus and the Disappearing Dancing Girls
description: Gaius PetreiUS Ruso's detective novel features a range of characters, including corrupt officials, dangerous killers, bedazzling slaves and charming centurions.

title: A Farewell to Arms?
description: This compilation of articles by scholars on the subject paints a realistic picture of the peace negotiations that have occurred in Northern Ireland, without any overbearing optimism or pessimistic assumptions.

title: Maisie Dobbs
description: Hillary Clinton's acclaimed mystery series, which has been featured in publications such as What Happened, The New York Times Book Review, and NewYork Magazine, is now being followed by Maisie Dobbs, the fiercely independent maid of the London aristocracy.

title: Birds of a Feather
description: During the 1929 London crisis, Joseph Waite, a wealthy man with Havana cigars and Savile Row suits, seeks an alternative source of power: Maisie Dobbs.

title: Robbins and Cotran Review of Pathology
authors: Edward C. Klatt;Stanley Leonard Robbins;Vinay Kumar
description: With over 1,000 questions, including those that cover the basics of gross and microscopic pathology and the latest developments in molecular biology and genetics, this is a valuable study aid for the American Board of Pathology exam, also known as the USMLE Step 1.

title: Mutant Message from Forever
description: This captivating story of two aboriginal twins who are separated at birth and their journey to find their roots takes them halfway across the world is narrated by Marlo Morgan, best known for her book 'Mutant Message Down Under'.

title: The Tale of Jemima Puddle-Duck
description: Elucidates how the barnyard collie and her offspring save Jemima Puddle-Duck from the fox's eating space.

title: The Tale of The Flopsy Bunnies
description: The first time ever, an authentic and authorized version has been recreated electronically, featuring reproductions of Potter's unmistakable artwork that is optimized for use on color devices like the iPad.

title: The World of Peter Rabbit
description: Dishonored in a container.

title: The Dig
description: Featuring an exciting CD-ROM game by LucasArts, this epic SF story is set in the heart of a multimedia hit. The story follows three astronauts who are trapped by an unknown planet that threatens to collide with Earth on one side and sends them flying away for safety.

title: Exit to Eden
description: The Club is a place where you can satisfy your innermost desires, provided you have the means to do so. It's alluring, sophisticated, radiant in the Caribbean sun, bright with sparkling champagne, and filled with delightful games of pleasure that bring about both pain and joy.

title: Desert Heat
description: Jenny, Joanna Brady's beloved nine-year-old daughter, and her husband Andy, a lawman running for Sheriff of Cochise County, are content with their life in Bisbee, where they have thriving families. However, the police allege that Andy was involved in drug trafficking and smuggling and is believed to have attempted suicide when his body was struck down.

title: The Dark City
description: Eliot Ness, the infamous "hero" who defeated Al Scarface Capone in The Untouchables and became one of the world's greatest living legends until 1935, when he traveled to Cleveland to rescue an evil city from underworld with a group of bent cops.

title: Code
description: The history and future of coding theory are explored in this book, which highlights the inventiveness of language systems and their applications from Braille and Morse code to 32-bit operating systems.

title: Writing Secure Code
description: Covers a range of topics, including the significance of secure systems, threat modeling, canonical representation problems, database input, denial-of-service attacks, and security code reviews and checklists.

title: The Girlhood Diary of Louisa May Alcott  1843-1846
description: Extensive excerpts from Louisa May Alcott' yearly girlhood diary, which chronicles her time on a communal farm in the 1840s, including sidebars and timeline.

title: Israel  My Beloved
description: With a new cover and historical timeline, Kay Arthur's book tells the dramatic story of Israel as it paints an unforgettable panorama that will change the way we think about God'S people.

title: Living with Passion and Purpose
description: This study offers practical and logical insights into how readers can become more like Jesus in their daily lives, with gentle encouragement and solid Bible teachings. Great for group study and personal study.

title: The Rapture
description: LaHaye, who has authored over 40 books, describes The Rapture as the culmination of his most extensive study and research effort. His fully convincing defense of the pre-Tribulation theory includes a timeline and detailed chart of events, challenging both mid- and post-Tribulous theories, and providing compelling arguments against these claims.

title: Life Management for Busy Women
description: This study guide, based on Elizabeth George's book Life Management for Busy Women, offers practical tips for women who want to simplify their hectic schedules. It includes clear steps to help women become more efficient with their time and resources, as well as with the key components of the book.

title: Simple Acts of Faith
description: The beloved art of Rockwell depicts the simple pleasures that fill ordinary life with meaning.

title: A Wife After God's Own Heart Growth and Study Guide
description: The guides created by George have been instrumental in helping women to mine the riches of God's Word and develop spiritual strength. This latest addition to the series will be available for women, along with the corresponding book.

title: Loving God with All Your Mind
description: George's approach to women involves utilizing both biblical principles and personal experience to help them manage their emotions and find inner peace through their focus on what is true.

title: Perfectly Reasonable Deviations from the Beaten Track
description: The writings of the physicist, Nobel laureate, and writer provide a personal glimpse into the mindset and existence of renowned scientists.

title: Middlesex Borough
description: Middlesex Borough, which is protected by the Watchung Mountains on the north and surrounded by clean, bubbling brooks, has thrived over the past century. It is located some thirty miles west of New York City and was famous for its colorful gardens, farms, and greenhouses. Orchids and other local blooms grown at Thomas Young Orch were distributed in Boston, Philadelphia,and NewYork and were said to have been favored by Eleanor Roosevelt. Middleton Borough delves into the town's history from its roots rootstoestroy this

title: Juneau and Sauk Counties
description: The Baraboo Bluffs provided a stunning backdrop for the pioneers' spirits, with wild flowers and powerful rivers filling the landscape. They also experienced the beauty of dreams, faith, and courage that helped families into wagons drawn by oxen to take them to Juneau and Sauk Counties as the forces in their homelands drove them further south towards Wisconsin. Highway 12 brought people from the same communities to settle near each other.

title: Sebastopol
description: Since the 1850s, Sonoma County has been a peaceful and welcoming place for settlers, with communities of every kind-from farmers to homesteaders to businesspeople and commuters-and Sebastopol has always had 'the feel of being in the heartland of its own' This book of vintage photography charts the journey through time, early Mexican land grants and early settlements; Luther Burbank's far-reaching botanical experiments; and the rich farming industry that made this town one of the world' among the many small town on rolling country.

title: Lake Orion
description: Orion Township was established in 1835 and by the beginning of the 20th century had become a prosperous inland agricultural and resort community, with Lake Orissa becoming the center of commerce for township residents as well as attracting tourists and revivalists during summer months. With the advent of passenger boats and an amusement park, Lake appeared to be primarily populated by tourists seeking recreation; however, its suburban development has not yet lost much of its charm: Orie Township, where living is essentially opulent.

title: Cypress Gardens
authors: Mary M. Flekke;Sarah E. MacDonald;Randall M. MacDonald
description: The history of Cypress Gardens located in Winter Haven, Florida.

title: Center City Philadelphia in the 19th Century
authors: The Print and Photograph Department of the Library Company of Philadelphia
description: During the 1680s, Philadelphia was designed to stretch from the Delaware River to the Schuylkill River and from Vine Street to South street, which is now known as Center City. The population growth led to settled areas that expanded westward beyond early landmarks such as Christ Church, the Pennsylvania State House, and Pennsylvania Hospital. By the mid-19th century, commercially-oriented, religious, or cultural institutions emerged along Broad Street, while exclusive residential neighborhoods developed even further west in previously undeveloped areas or used as industrial sites.

title: Selections from the Oakland Tribune Archives
description: The Oakland Tribune clock tower in downtown Oakland has been displaying the time for over a century, but the paper first began appearing on city streets in 1874.

title: Book of Nightmares
description: The abduction of Pixel by Destiny requires Score and Helaine's intervention to save him from the planet Zarathan, where dreams are feigned and those who doze off pass away.

title: Rincewind the Wizzard
description: Encompasses "The Colour of Magic", "the Light Fantastic", the source, and "Eric".

title: Hitchhiker's Trilogy
description: Suggests the peculiar and occasionally extraterrestrial voyages, concepts, and associates of Arthur Dent, a galactic adventurer.

title: All the Pretty Horses
description: John Grady Cole, who was left deserted from the ranching he loved after his grandfather's death, escapes to Mexico with two friends and embarks on a treacherous and idyllic adventure in the rugged terrain.

title: The Chrestomanci Quartet
description: The Chrestomanci's four escapades.

title: The Last Herald-mage
description: Is Vanyel's worst experience a precursor to his own tragic circumstances?

title: Wizard's Castle
description: Sophie, the youngest of three sisters, is trapped in a fated place where she was apprenticed to fashion and eventually finds herself in the castle of the Wizard Howl.

title: The Abhorsen Trilogy
description: In order to save the Old Kingdom, Sabriel and Lirael must confront ancient evils and uncover their own fate.

title: Time Quartet
description: Madeleine L'Engles's captivating novels, which combine illusion and quantum physics, have captured the attention of readers. Discover these beloved books in our exclusive 4-in-1 omnibus release.

title: The Christmas Thief
description: An eighty-foot blue spruce tree and a recently released prisoner are the focus of an investigation led by amateur detective Alvirah Meehan and private investigator Regan Reilly.

title: Marley and me : love and life with the world's worst dog
description: At the outset of their lives, John and Jenny were young and in love with their perfect little home, but life was never the same after they adopted Marley, a Labrador retriever who quickly transformed into slick-and-tumble dog. He even broke through screen doors by chewing through drywall and hiding women's underwear.

title: Twelve sharp
description: A female stalker is being sought after by Stephanie Plum, a bounty hunter in Trenton, New Jersey.

title: Bill Gates
description: Describes the life of Bill Gates, including his childhood, education, and work as the mastermind and leader of Microsoft, a multi-billion-dollar computer software company.

title: Another Day in Paradise
description: The latest collection of the popular strip, "Another Day In Paradise," is a satirical take on modern culture that includes Sherman, his sidekick sea turtle Fillmore, and schools of other coral reef creatures.

title: Calvin and Hobbes: Sunday Pages 1985-1995
description: Presents a compilation of Sunday cartoons and the author's commentary.

title: Another Day in Cubicle Paradise
description: From bizarre personnel choices and the most terrible meetings on record to secretaries and consultants who look like schizoid demons, Dilbert and his colleagues (Dog, Catbert, and their boss) explore the mysteries of corporate America.

title: The Complete Calvin and Hobbes
description: Represents all of the "Calvin and Hobbes" cartoons that have been syndicated, as well as classic collections of stories and poems.

title: Chomsky on Miseducation
description: Chomsky's influential publications on education provide a wider perspective on our educational requirements, starting with the evolving nature of schools and exploring new models of public education for citizenship.

title: A Primate's Memoir
description: The author, Robert Sapolsky, who won a MacArthur Genius Grant and followed in the footsteps of Jane Goodall and Dian Fossey, recounts his experience living in remote Kenya with baboons.

title: New Jewish Wedding  Revised
description: The book provides guidance on preparing for a Jewish wedding, including guidelines for attire, rabbis, vendors, readings, and invitations. It also includes information for converts as well as non-Jews and same-sex couples.

title: Bowling Alone
description: Demonstrates how changes in work, family organization, and women's responsibilities have resulted in people becoming more disconnected from their families, acquaintances, neighbors, or democratic institutions--and how they may reintegrate.

title: The Blackwater Lightship
description: A novel that explores the intricate relationships among loved ones is set in the middle of AIDS, as three generations of his family members are reunited at his bedside in Ireland.

title: The Most Of P.G. Wodehouse
description: Provides a compilation of amusing anecdotes, such as "The Truth about George," "Ukridge's Dog College," and "A Slice of Life."

title: How Right You Are  Jeeves
description: The bumbling Bertie Wooster and his all-knowing valet, Jeeves, are the subjects of an English comedy.

title: Jeeves And The Tie That Binds
description: Despite Jeeves' previous efforts to save his master, Bertie Wooster may finally find him the culprit. This comes as a surprise to many who have witnessed how anonymous their information has been when the Junior Ganymede club in London's West End is now demanding its members reveal their employers' names.

title: The Body Artist
description: The author of White Noise and Underworld, who won the National Book Award for his book "Underworld," has lived in modern times. His novel Americana is a testament to his ability to speak with the inner voices of both marginalized groups and everyday people. Don DeLillo's language is defiantly beautiful, mirroring that of those who were once part of our culture. In The Body Artist, his twelfth novel, he navigates the quiet world of Lauren Hartke, an artist whose work translate translates as disorients us about underworld-be

title: Sarah Ban Breathnach's Mrs. Sharp's Traditions
description: Offers guidance on hearth and household cooking, highlighting ways to enhance modern living with traditional practices.

title: Not Much Fun
description: Dorothy Parker's collection of over one hundred previously unpublished poems examines the dangers and inadequacies of love, explores alternative rhyme schemes, and discusses current perspectives on her era. The first printing is out now and 12,500 pieces are printed.

title: An Hour Before Daylight
description: In his memoirs, the ex-president describes how he was raised in Georgia during the Depression and includes accounts of his life's events.

title: Cover Her Face
description: Sally Jupp, a beautiful and resilient housemaid, is put on ice and strangled in her bed behind an open door. Adam Dalgliesh, the brilliant policeman of Scotland Yard, must locate her killer among dozens of suspects who had good reason to wish her well. P. D. James's first novel Cover Her Face elevates her to the status of one of the world' best suspense writers.

title: The Skull Beneath the Skin
description: With its combination of murder mystery elements, horror stories, ghostly encounters, and hairbreadth-themed scenes, "The Skull Beneath The Skin" is a crime fiction classic that leaves readers feeling uneasy and claustrophobic.

title: Authentic Happiness
description: posits that happiness is a learned and developed behavior, explaining how everyone has at least five of twenty-four strengths which can be used to improve life.

title: Yanks
description: The birth of the modern American army and its pivotal role in World War I is best described by renowned military historian John S. D. Eisenhower, who with the help of his wife Joanne, blends a narrative told from the perspective of top officers with that of average soldiers, drawing on diaries and memoirs to bring each engagement to life, from initial planning to actual experiences of soldiers fighting in battle or at sea.

title: Man and Boy
description: With trepidation, Harry Silver faces his thirtieth birthday as his dream life eludes him after his wife leaves him and he has to deal with the challenges of raising his son alone.

title: Seventeen Seventy-six
description: Employs evidence from personal letters and period notebooks to create a narrative of the American Revolution that includes the attack on Boston, the defeat at Brooklyn, how the Americans retreated across New Jersey, and the triumph at Trenton.

title: President Nixon
description: President NIXON portrays a man with no personal agenda, operating in opulent White House environments that are plagued by lies and secrets, seeking to enforce traditional values at home and adapt to new global power dynamics. Reeves highlights the importance of using national security to orchestrate coups, burglaries, falsehoods (including those related to 9/11), and ultimately undermine America's allies through murder.

title: The Other Boleyn Girl
description: Philippa Gregory's novel, which is penned by the queen of royal fiction and published in New York Times magazine USA TODAY, is an all-encompassing and captivating story about love, sex life, ambition, and intrigue at the Tudor court of Henry VIII. Mary Boleyn is initially rejected by Henry after being brought to court as a fourteen-year-old girl, but she eventually falls in love with her golden prince and becomes disillusioned.

title: Shampoo Planet
description: Having grown up around Ronald Reagan, Tyler Johnson is now an entrepreneurial mind who sees the future bright ahead. He has plans to work at the nuclear power plant where his hippie idols have been hanging out for years. However, he is set on making it through another life-changing experience as one of the "low-ambition" Euro-teens returns to L.A.

title: Shout!
description: An in-depth exploration of the Beatles' history and the individuals who shaped their music, image, and signature style.

title: Man and Wife
description: Although Harry Silver is willing to make a comeback, he recognizes the challenges of managing multiple marriages and dealing with challenging work-related commitment.

title: Teacher Man
description: In his writing, the author narrates his journey of becoming a teacher, storyteller, and writer, during which he spent fifteen years finding his voice in class and acknowledging the underappreciated value of teaching.

title: The Partly Cloudy Patriot
description: The author discusses issues ranging from the 2000 election to current civil rights activists and the relationship between the United States and Canada.

title: Will You Miss Me When I'm Gone?
description: Describes the Carter family's achievements in bluegrass country music, from their discovery by a New York record maker to their eventual separation and subsequent success, emphasizing their impact on the careers of prominent musicians.

title: Cosmopolis
description: A white stretch limousine carrying an affluent billionaire asset manager navigates through the streets before meeting with dozens of important visitors in the fields of technology, politics, and security. Reprint. 75,000 first printing.

title: Chronicles
description: The winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature, Bob Dylan's first memoir, recounts his experiences in 1961 and how he felt like a beacon of hope for his future.

title: The Boat of Dreams
description: Upon arriving at the trailer where they reside, Lila and Will Foster spot an old man who is considered indifferent but has shown kindness to them, making it a tradition to ask for their father's beautiful lobster boat.

title: The Glass Castle
description: Walls has penned a breathtaking and inspiring story of surviving despite being willfully impoverished, eccentric, and profoundly misunderstood, in the style of Mary Karr's "The Liars' Club" and Rick Bragg'S "All Over But the Shouting."

title: Wideacre
description: Beatrice Lacey, an Englishwoman from the 18th century without any property rights, is bound to forfeit her family's ancestral estate of Wideacre if her ambitious schemes are not successful.

title: The Favored Child
description: The Lacey estate is once again magnificent in the thrilling sequel to Wideacre, helmed by Philippa Gregory, who has been described as the "queen of royal fiction" by USA TODAY.

title: The Master
description: The performance of Henry James' first play in contrast to Oscar Wilde's The Importance of Being Earnest is a source of distress for the writer, who struggles with questions about his sexual identity, marriage, and emotional issues.

title: Generation of Swine
description: The Gonzo Papers are a collection of provocative essays that includes discussions on Hurricane Gloria, blood pressure machines, the Super Bowl, televangelist behavior, Iran Contra hearings, 1988 Presidential race, and other topics.

title: The Great Shark Hunt
description: Represents the works of the renowned American journalist, covering everything from the Super Bowl to Watergate, Hemingway to Brando, and even sharks and drugs.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People Personal Workbook
description: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People, a companion publication, provides seven essential organizational rules for boosting productivity and effectiveness at work and at home. The book includes detailed exercises and solutions that teach the importance of fairness, integrity, honesty, and dignity to help readers set goals, enhance relationships,and achieve success.

title: Sea of Thunder
description: A captivating narrative of the Battle of Leyte Gulf in October 1944, narrating the actions of four naval leaders, including two American commanders and two Japanese admirals, offers a glimpse into how the war was marked by deep cultural differences. The first edition is limited to 100,000 copies.

title: A Separate Peace
description: Described as the dark and lonely boy in New England during World War II, A Separate Peace has been an American classic and great-selling book for over three decades.

title: Plan of Attack
description: Bob Woodward's latest book, Plan of Attack, provides a unique perspective on the behind-the-scenes maneuvering of President George W. Bush, his war council, and allies to achieve victory in Iraq by defeating Saddam Hussein.

title: The Scarpetta Collection Volume II
description: The omnibus edition of Kay Scarpetta's third and fourth books, All That Remains and Cruel & Unusual, is now available for the first time in print worldwide.

title: The Trial of Queen Caroline
description: Covers the early nineteenth-century adultery trial of Queen Caroline, detailing her wrongful marriage to George IV, their mutual separation, affairs, and the public's aggressive defense.

title: Benjamin Franklin
description: Describes Benjamin Franklin's life as one of the Founding Fathers of America, including his contributions as a scientist, inventor, diplomat, writer, business strategist, and statesman.

title: The Sleeping Doll
description: With the aid of three victims from her former cult and the sole survivor from a family he killed, Kathryn Dance, an interrogator and body language expert with the California Bureau of Investigation, endeavors to bring back this dangerous escaped killer.

title: Liars and Saints
description: A story of sexuality and longing, loss, and the possibility of dishonesty in family relationships is woven into each chapter of this deeply moving book.

title: Einstein
description: The rebellious nature of Albert Einstein is reflected in his scientific imagination, as described by the biographer Isaacson.

title: I Heard that Song Before
description: The gardener's daughter, Kay Lansing, who is married to the son of her wealthy father' s employer, is growing increasingly suspicious about her husband, Peter, and the mysterious deaths of his first wife and a high-school senior.

title: I'm Too Young To Be Seventy
description: With his humorous and wise words, the beloved author of Forever Fifty and Suddenly Sixty delves into the intricacies of becoming a septuagenarian. Viorst's poems are perfect for anyone interested in humor and reflections on marriage, milestones, children, and other topics related to this phase of life.

title: The Virgin's Lover
description: The story of Elizabeth I, the new queen in 1558, is a touching and scandalous love story written by the #1 New York Times bestseller author and "queen of royal fiction" (USA TODAY) who portrays contrasting perspectives on three characters.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
description: Stephen R. Covey's book, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People, offers a comprehensive approach to problem-solving in personal and professional contexts. He provides insightful insights and practical examples to guide individuals in living with fairness, integrity, service, and human dignity, which provide us with the tools we need to adjust to change and reap the rewards of change.

title: The Organized Student
description: For parents who are struggling with disorganization, The Organized Student is a must-read for organizing their child's education. It offers practical tips on how to organize and succeed in middle school and high school, as well as tips specifically designed for children with ADHD/ADHD and learning disabilities.

title: Team of Rivals
description: In an account that examines Abraham Lincoln's political skills and strengths, the author recounts how he used these skills to rally former opponents into victory in the American Civil War.

title: Untouchables
description: The untouchable is an Indian and every sixth person on earth belongs to the same caste.

title: Brokeback Mountain
description: The friendship between Ennis del Mar and Jack Twist, two cowboys who are working together as a herder and camp attendant, becomes intense over time and their frequent separations.

title: Love Smart
description: Advancing dating, emotional issues, and online romance with practical advice for singles on how to find the perfect partner and sustain a strong relationship.

title: The Constant Princess
description: The fictional portrayal of Katherine of Aragon, Henry VIII's first wife, follows her young marriage to Arthur, her late widowhood, and the divorce that led to Henry marrying Anne Boleyn.

title: The Boleyn Inheritance
description: Jane Boleyn, the lady-in-waiting who was the only surviving member of the ambitious Bolyn family, testifies against Anne of Cleeves, Henry VIII's new queen, and plots to bring her young cousin, Catherine Howard, to power.

title: Virgin Earth
description: In this second edition of Earthly Joy, John Tradescant the Younger is portrayed as a gardener for King Charles I. He decides to join the Royalist colony of Virginia to protect his family, testing his botanical abilities and becoming involved in the struggle against Native American oppression.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People for Teen Girls
description: Donna Dale Carnegie, daughter of the late motivational author and teacher Dal Lee Carnegie teaches young women practical lessons on how to become confident friends and influence others. In How to Win Friends and Influence People for Teen Girls, she offers practical advice on peer pressure, gossip, popularity, defusing arguments, admitting mistakes, and making self-defining decisions.

title: Love-Lies-Bleeding
description: A group of three individuals come together to determine the destiny of a man who sits in limbo and refuses to move on. The individual is Alex Macklin, an artist who abandoned his easel to pursue land art in the southwestern desert after suffering from pheromone seizures. His son, wife, and older wife are all carrying layers of complex love. They ask what life truly means and why.

title: The Coffin Dancer
description: A serial killer who alters his appearance with each murder, except for a Grim Reaper tattoo inked onto the front of an old man's coffin, is being hunted by Lincoln Rhyme and Amelia Sachs, members of the New York Police Department.

title: Diary of a Mistress
description: Which should a wife trust: the words of her husband or the diary of his mistress?

title: Female Chauvinist Pigs
description: Examines how certain women are promoting chauvinism by behaving in sexually favorably, in an account that evaluates how women may be contributing to misogynistic and stereotyped belief systems.

title: Persian Mirrors
description: The Afterword to the book that exposed Iran to Western audiences is now a new addition to Persian Mirrors. Elaine Sciolino, who has covered the 2005 presidential election in Iran for several years as eponymous correspondent for Newsweek and The New York Times, claims to have extensive experience covering revolutionary Iran. She was part of the delegation that brought Ayatollah Khomeini to Tehran in 1979.

title: Chuck Klosterman IV
description: In addition to twenty "hypothetical questions," the collection includes some of the pop culture commentator's most notable profiles and trend stories, along with his favorite opinion pieces and a semi-autobiographical short story.

title: Kissinger
description: The biography of the political icon, which includes more than one hundred and fifty interviews with Kissinger and others, documents his upbringing in Nazi Germany, his political ascent, and his public speaking involvement.

title: Lisey's Story
description: After the death of her husband of twenty-five years, Lisey reflects on their bond, the strength of their marriage, his achievements as an award-winning novelist, and his covert beliefs that helped her build her own survival. The book was printed in first class at 1,250,000 copies.

title: True Evil
description: Chris Shepard, a busy doctor in Natchez, loses his way in the case of alleged murder of his spouses by undercover FBI agent Alex Morse.

title: You On A Diet
authors: M. D. Roizen (Michael F.);Michael F. Roizen
description: Dieting can only be successful if you make food choices so routine that you don't even know you're following the prescribed diet. Drs. Roizen and Oz use humor to educate you about your body.

title: The Good House
description: Tananarive Due's award-winning supernatural thriller offers a thrilling journey as the heroine searches for her innate power to protect her hometown from evil.

title: Does Anything Eat Wasps?
description: What is the ideal weight and quantity of fat to become bulletproof?

title: The SPEED of Trust
description: A guide for businesspeople who wants to overcome bureaucratic obstacles and inspire confidence with their 7 Habits series, authored by the author's son, is available for 100,000 copies.

title: Look Homeward  Angel
description: A Southern family with a strong desire to live is controlled by their father, who allows their older son, Eugene, to leave his rural North Carolina hometown and venture into the big cities for an Ivy League education. Reissue. 75,000 first printing.

title: Fargo Rock City
description: Chuck Klosterman's memoir is a testament to the transcendence of rock music, as it recounts his upbringing in Wyndmere, North Dakotoa, and how he navigated the hair-band history.

title: Eye of the Storm
description: The third installment of the magnificent RAIN series is now available.

title: Like Shaking Hands With God
description: Represents images and transcripts from a seminar held on October 1, 1998, where the authors addressed topics such as writing, identity, and writing.

title: The Second Time Around
description: Mary Higgins Clark, the "Queen of Suspense," presents a gripping account of deception and unexpected twists that could have been erased from past headlines. When Nicholas Spencer, head of an anti-cancer vaccine development firm, vanishes without evidence, it is revealed that Spencer has stolen vast amounts of money, including the life savings of several employees, with little effort to change Carley's fate.

title: The Inhuman Condition
description: Presents five horror stories, which include a brutal parable of the body in revolt, enigma wrapped in string, an ordeal of Hell on Earth, tale of an unholy marriage of immortals and spirits, and voyeuristic vision of evil.

title: Star Trek Voyager Companion
description: A follow-up to the popular syndicated television show provides a detailed look at the series, including plot summary and behind-the-scenes information.

title: Deck the Halls
description: With the aid of her parents' neighbors Willy and Alvirah Meehan, Regan Reilly goes to great lengths to find her father when he is abducted three days before Christmas.

title: Music & Silence
description: After being recruited to join the king's orchestra at the Danish court in 1629, Peter Claire, an English musician, becomes embroiled in royal intrigue when he falls for a young woman who is the queen' partner. The Whitbread Prize winner has been revealed and the story is reprinted in the Reader'S Guide.

title: Salem Falls
description: Jack St. Bride is struggling to rebuild his life after a student falsely accused him of raping him, and recent allegations of sexual assault by teenage girls from his former school suggest that he will be destroyed again.

title: Perfect Match
description: A disturbing incident occurs when District Attorney Nina Frost and her spouse, Caleb, learn that their son Nathaniel has been molested, leaving him mute, terrified, and unable to identify his attacker due to trauma.

title: God Bless You  Dr. Kevorkian
description: According to John Irving, Vonnegut is the most talented and tenacious writer on earth.

title: Blink-182
description: Provides a behind-the-scenes look at the band's journey on tour, videos, and performances.

title: The Diablo: The Black Road
description: After years of wandering, Darrick Lang returns to Bramwell where he encounters a terrifying entity that has captured its inhabitants, and is determined to take hold of him.

title: The Diablo: The Kingdom of Shadow
description: The Burning Hells and the angelic hosts of the High Heavens have been fighting for control over all of Creation since ancient times. This battle is now common in the mortal world, and neither Man nor Demon nor Angel will be able to escape unharmed. According to legend, Ureh was once a gateway to the high heavens when the sun rose and clouds shone.

title: The Twentieth Wife
description: Mehrunnisa, daughter of servents, rose to prominence as an empress of the Mughal empire.

title: Black Cat
description: Celeste, who remains in the dual state of pretending to be her deceased brother Noble, is struggling to raise Baby Celester, whom she must refuse to have and take it as her own, but when her mother weds a kind neighbor, vicious enemies emerge from within.

title: Last Man Standing
description: The FBI's elite Hostage Rescue Team leader, Web London was unable to save himself after only seven seconds due to a high-tech ambush. He had previously lost his friends, team, and reputation in the process.

title: Songs of the Humpback Whale
description: The debut novel by Picoult is a heartwarming story of family, friendship, and love that has been widely enjoyed and is back in print.

title: March Upcountry
description: Amidst the chaos of his spaceship's mission, Roger MacClintock, a disgraced prince, and his entourage of Royal Marines must undertake evasive maneuvers on an unfamiliar planet with dangerous plants and hostile inhabitants.

title: Roughing It
description: An anthology of autobiographical essays recounts the author's thrilling adventures and experiences during his six-year journey through California, Nevada, and other parts of the American West.

title: The Vanished Man
description: Lincoln Rhyme and his apprentice, Amelia Sachs, are tasked with tracking down a killer and skilled illusionist who was the first of many brutal murders at prestigious New York music schools.

title: One More for the Road
description: The Master of storytelling brings you eighteen new stories, including seven that have never been published but are set in stone.

title: Double Dealer
description: In Las Vegas, the forensic investigators are not only little-known but also much undervalued. They include Gil Grissom, Sara Sidle, and other experts who have been assigned to the Criminalistics Bureau's graveyard shift by police officers. Their task is to identify the clues behind this yellow tape while investigating a newly discovered murder that Nick and Catherine suspect in.

title: Shooting Stars Omnibus
description: Her ability to dream of imaginary worlds allowed Cinnamon to break free from her family's turmoil, as she was able to do so with the help of her talent.

title: Serpent
description: After saving the life of stunning marine archaeologist Nina Kirov off Morocco, Texas industrialist Don Halcon becomes his next target. The focus of his plan is on using Christopher Columbus's discovery and a precious pre-Columbian artifact found in the ruins of the abandoned Italian luxury liner Andrea Dorset.

title: Shock Wave
description: A mysterious plague in the Antarctic, a sinister diamond empire under the control of an evil genius, and utterly devastating new technology that could wipe out millions.

title: The Footprints of God
description: Dr David Tennant and Psyche Rachel Weiss are now running for their lives against a ruthless team of NSA agents, fearing that someone would use the revolutionary new technology for such unethical purposes.

title: My Sister's Keeper
description: In 2009, the American Library Association listed one of its top 10 books that were banned and removed from shelves for various reasons, including homosexuality, sexually explicit material, religious views, drugs, and suicide. The book was a best-selling novel with over 1 million copies sold.

title: Vanishing Acts
description: As she collaborates with the Search and Rescue bloodhound team to locate missing individuals, single mother Delia Hopkins is anxiously anticipating her upcoming wedding. However, an unexpected series of unsettling memories threatens to ruin her life and the lives of those she cares for. Published by the author of My Sister's Keeper and Second Glance. Reprint. 300,000 first printing.

title: Sex and the City
description: A guide for fans of the award-winning cable TV show provides details on the show's actors, producers, costume designers, and sets, as well as recaps from each season and interviews with the cast.

title: He Sees You When You're Sleeping
description: The Heavenly Council sends Sterling Brooks back to Earth to help reunite a seven-year-old girl with her father and grandmother who were forced into the witness protection scheme due to the greed of two mafias.

title: From Sawdust to Stardust
description: The first printing of a definitive biography on DeForest Kelley, who is best known for his role as Dr. Leonard "Bones" McCoy on Star Trek, contains 12,500 pages.

title: The Honourable Schoolboy
description: George Smiley sends one of his most trusted agents to the Far East as he attempts to rebuild his spy network after a traitor is revealed.

title: Changeling
description: Changeling and Madwand are two volumes in the series.

title: Click  Clack  Moo
description: Farmer Brown's problem is a result of his cows constantly typing and leaving notes behind.

title: Eight Black Horses
description: As the number of dead bodies rises dramatically, and cryptic notes with patterns of eight black horses are handed over to Steve Carello, the cops of the 87th Precinct realize that the Deaf Man is back.

title: Band of Brothers
description: Explains Easy Company's involvement in the western European campaigns through soldiers' journals and letters, as well as their stories of survival.

title: Pendulum
description: Léon Foucault, despite not being a mathematician or trained physicist, was always aware of the presence of an elusive force of nature among his fellow creatures.

title: The Price of Pleasure
description: The return of Kresley Cole is a stunning tale of love, honor, and passion, as he recounts the story of Captain Grant Sutherland's search for Victoria Dearbourne.

title: Fall on Your Knees
description: This epic tale is the story of four sisters who lived for five generations, from Cape Breton Island in Nova Scotia to the desolate terrain of World War I and New York City's vibrant jazz scene.

title: Homecoming
description: Despite being trapped in the Delta Quadrant for seven years, Admiral Kathryn Janeway and her crew find new opportunities, adventures, and reunions with loved ones. However, it's only after an enigmatic cybernetic plague strikes Earth, transforming humanity into a new generation of Borg species. Original.

title: First Things First
description: FIRST THINGS FIRST, an international bestseller, is a groundbreaking tool for managing time that follows the pattern of THE 7 HABITS OF HIGHLY EFFECTIVE PEOPLE and promotes work-life balance.

title: Goodnight Nobody
description: During her school days, Kate Klein (left) investigates the murder of her children while attending to their classmates, having moved to a suburban Connecticut home after an altercation in New York City. She also works as ten years' worth of housekeeping.

title: said the shotgun to the head.
description: Those who are the most exceptional Americans have not yet been born but are eagerly anticipating their past deaths.

title: The Diablo: The Sin War #1: Birthright
description: From the very beginning, the High Heavens and the Burning Hells have been engaged in an unending struggle for dominance over all of Creation. This conflict now extends to the world of Sanctuary, where evil and good are waged secret battles for human souls. The Sin War is a historical drama that would change the destiny of man three thousand years ago.

title: Diablo: The Sin War #2: Scales of the Serpent
description: Since ancient times, the Eternal Conflict between the High Heavens and the Burning Hells has been a constant source of conflict in the realm of Sanctuary. This conflict now encompasses both world-building events as well as those related to human civilization.

title: Diablo: Moon of the Spider
description: From ancient times, the High Heavens' angelic hosts and the Burning Hells have been engaged in a battle for dominance over all of Creation. However, this battle has now reached the mortal world, leaving mankind with no choice but to confront Satan as they search for answers.

title: Paradise
description: A romantic novel with a fast-paced pace, Matthew Farrell's corporate raider story is vastly different from the childhood experience of surviving in steel factories.

title: The Best of Ray Bradbury
description: Contains the best of the popular science-fiction author's novels, including "Come Into My Cellar," "The Golden Apples of The Sun," and "A Sound of Thunder."

title: Romeo and Juliet
description: Contains explanatory text on each page that faces the end of the play and information on Shakespeare's language, life, and theater.

title: Othello
description: Ithello by Shakespeare is a powerful play that portrays the marriage of Moor Othella and Desdemona, which begins with elopement and mutual devotion but ends with jealousy and death. While Shakespeare differs greatly on race, age (the dominant element in the story), and culture among his characters, most readers and audiences believe Shakespeare's hero and heroine would have been destroyed if not for Iago, who set out to destroy Othalia.

title: Undaunted Courage
description: President Thomas Jefferson's decision to send Captain Meriwether Lewis on a pioneering expedition into uncharted territory in 1803 was not solely driven by exploration and gathering, but also through military force.

title: The Sea Hunters
description: Collects narratives of the underwater explorations undertaken by the author and his team of volunteers to uncover historical structures such as the Lexington and the Arkansas.

title: Blood Enemy
description: The werewolves, who were once the servants of vampires, use their power to transform into beasts and engage in clandestine battles against their former masters.

title: Twelfth Night
description: Information regarding Shakespeare, Elizabethan theater, and the play that delves into the themes of unreciprocated love and false identity.

title: The Languages of Pao
description: The Panarch of Pao is assassinated, and Beran Panasper, his son and heir, must escape to Breakness to uncover the truth about his father's death...and more.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: Leaving the island fortress where his captivity for treason was imposed, Edmund Dantes, a young sailor, sets out to find the treasure of Monte Cristo and seek revenge against those who wrongly accused him. This book features an assortment of study materials.

title: The Awakening and Selected Stories of Kate Chopin
description: Features "The Awakening" and other short stories, such as "Beyond the Bayou," "A decent woman," and "Some Silk Stockings."

title: My Antonia
description: A prosperous attorney reminisces about his time in Nebraska and his connection with a Bohemian girl who was an immigrant.

title: The Notebooks of Lazarus Long
description: Lazarus Long, the oldest living member of humanity, recounts his wit and wisdom gained from his twenty-four century journey through space and time in an illustrated, hand-lettered edition of maxims. Reprint.

title: Twisted
description: In the collection of short fiction, there are "Gone Fishing," "Triangle," and "The Kneeling Soldier" to name a few, including "Without Jonathan."

title: Star Trek: The Original Series: Crucible: McCoy: Provenance of Shadows
description: The dislocation of Dr. Leonard McCoy's life leads to two divergent paths: one is shaped by his past actions, which could have devastating effects on the future and present.

title: Star Trek: The Original Series: Crucible: Spock: The Fire and the Rose
description: Following his friend's decision to save the timeline due to his own happiness, Spock is confronted with a similar crisis and decides to intentionally change the past, only for him to find himself struggling to cope with his emotions.

title: A Star Trek: The Next Generation: Time #7: A Time to Kill
description: The final stages of their conflict with Shinzon saw a number of crew members, including Captain Jean-Luc Picard, embarking on new challenges and assignments. This included the promotion of William Riker to captain, his marriage ceremony to Deanna Troi, and Beverly Crusher's new job at Starfleet Medical. Despite this, there is no record of what led them to abandon the Starship EnterpriseTM until now.

title: Getting the Love You Want
description: With a new introduction, Dr. Harville Hendrix shares his insights into the psychology of love and how it can help couples transform their relationships into enduring sources of affection and companionship.

title: The Manolo Matrix
description: Julie Kenner, the bestselling author of The Givenchy Code, returns to her classic sports brawl with this latest book.

title: Never Go Home Again
description: Shannon Holmes, the author of B-More Careful and Bad Girlz, reflects on his own personal experiences and their impact on contemporary society through her novels.

title: Tinker
description: In a future Pittsburgh that is mostly filled with elves, Tinker is an inventor and girl genius who runs her salvage business while paying taxes and using her own inventions to keep the local magic in check. However, her life takes nutty adventures when she encounters an Elven nobleman in her scrap yard who pursues her through the Elf court system, intelligence agencies like the National Security Agency (NSA), technology smugglers, and college students.

title: Irish Girls Are Back in Town
description: Popular Irish women's authors Cecelia Ahern, Patricia Scanlan and Gemma O'Connor, Suzanne Higgins and Morag Prunty are among the nineteen short stories in an anthology that explores family, friendship and love.

title: The Dead Yard
description: In this stunning sequel to "Dead I Well May Be," Michael Forsythe is compelled by the FBI to infiltrate an Irish terrorist cell, facing murder, mayhem, and the possibility of his own death.

title: Performance Assessments for Adult Education
description: This guide offers gamers an opportunity to enhance their game play by providing walkthroughs and maps that provide detailed character descriptions, monsters, and magic.

title: Final Fantasy® Origins Official Strategy Guide
description: Features both games with walkthroughs, area maps, strategies, equiptment, and character profiles.

title: Grand Theft Auto
description: Provides insights into the game's fundamentals, characters, objectives, weapons, vehicles, and tactics.

title: World of Warcraft Atlas
description: The World of WarCraft Atlas by BradyGames provides a comprehensive guide for every region of this massive MMORPG, complete with maps and descriptions of major cities and all the important locations and characters. Each illustration includes key location information such as enemies, shops, merchants, flight points, exit routes, and more. Additionally, cross-referenced indices provide an abundance of information about each region and its gameplay.

title: Killer 7 Official Strategy Guide
description: The Killer 7 Official Strategy Guide by BradyGames provides a detailed walkthrough of the entire adventure, along with detailed map sections for crucial items. Additionally, the guide offers Boss strategies to defeat every enemy and explore the unique personalities within the "Smith Alliance." This game is only available for purchase in North America on PlayStation 2 and GameCube Genre: Action Game.

title: Juiced
description: The Juiced Official Strategy Guide by BradyGames includes detailed maps and techniques to maximize your chances of winning.

title: Dragon Quest VIII
description: Provides valuable tips and strategies for playing Dragon Quest VIII: Journey of the Cursed King on PlayStation 2, including how to master every spell and ability, character information, a bestiary, side quests, map, item lists, foldable map... and more.

title: Castlevania
description: BradyGames' Castlevania: Curse of Darkness Official Strategy Guide offers a comprehensive overview of the game, including detailed maps, unlockables, items, and weapons, as well as expert tips for defeating every boss in the series.

title: Sir Gawain and the Green Knight
description: The most renowned knight, Sir Gawain, is probably the most well-known member of King Arthur's Round Table. In this captivating story, his bravery and honor are tested by the formidable Green Knight.

title: The Sea-thing Child
description: The sea-loving youngster, swarmed by waves on the beach, holds onto the shore in fear and waits to discover his fate. Recommended grade: elementary.

title: The Judy Moody Mood Journal
description: A new and colorful edition of a never-before-seen journal invites Judy Moody to explore their diverse moods and other aspects of their life. The book features interactive activities, informative content, and ample writing space. With illustrations and engaging content.

title: Propaganda and the Public Mind
description: A call to action and join forces with a prominent intellectual from our time. Published in 2001, this book features interviews with journalist David Barsamian and is an excellent addition to Chomsky's media studies on topics such as Manufacturing Consent and Necessary Illusions. Topics include the Seattle protests, US intervention in East Timor, and the beginning of the Iraq War.

title: Zizek
description: Zizek is widely recognized as the most important interdisciplinary philosopher in recent times. His work is a potent and often explosive blend of Lacanian psychoanalysis and philosophy, which compares crucial psychoanalytical concepts with those of leading European thinkers like Hegel. It has generated excitement and encouraged new approaches across diverse fields, and appears to be gaining popularity among readers due to his diverse interests including film studies, literature, ethics, theology, etc.

title: Political Philosophy: A Beginner's Guide for Students and Politicians
description: Political Philosophy: A Beginners' Guide for Students and Politicians provides an overview of the fundamental concepts of social justice, liberty, equality, and community. However, how can politicians from different political ideologies reconcile these convictions?

title: Conversations with Zizek
description: Slavoj iek's new book features an array of entertaining discussions with Glyn Daly, exploring the unique perspectives of the Slovenian sociologist who writes about psychoanalysis, philosophy, multiculturalism, popular/cyber culture, totalitarianism, ethics, and politics.

title: Sociology
description: The fifth edition of Sociology, which is completely revised and updated, provides a unique and engaging introduction to the subject for students with complex and challenging ideas. It was written by one of the world's leading sociologists, who ensured that all aspects were presented in lucid, accessible, and jargon-free language, while maintaining some advanced debates. Previous editions of this book combined various cutting-edge topics into anintroductory text, such as the influence of globalisation. However, this fifth version remains unchanged.

title: Political Philosophy
description: How can political parties reconcile their differences and embrace the same principles?
