description: The book contains an essay on the fiction of horror and tales of terror written by Clive Barker, William Faulkner, Stephen King, Edgar Allan Poe, Joanna Russ, and Flannery O'Connor.

title: A Fabulous Formless Darkness
description: Originally published as part of The Dark Descent, this stunning collection of horror literature explores the most powerful emotions in humanity--fear, love and hope. Authors include Robert Aickman, Philip K. Dick, Charles Dickens, Stephen King, Joyce Carol Oates, Edith Wharton, and others.

title: The Sixth Book of Lost Swords
description: Prince Murat's possession of the long-lost Mindsword leads to the enslavement of his own wife, Kristen, who is also beloved by Prince Mark. It is up to Mark and his companions to save their husband and kingdom from harm.

title: The Shadow Rising
description: While Rand explores the Aiel Waste and the infamous Rhuidean, Perrin Aybara must now return to Emond's Field to confront the Whitecloaks who have taken over.

title: Lord of Chaos
description: PBS Great American Read Selection! Now in development for TV! The Wheel of Time® by Robert Jordan has captured the interest of millions of readers worldwide with its breadth, creativity, and captivating cast. Its journey through time becomes legend as it faded into legend, while legends vanished when the era returned to life. In the Third Age, an Age of Prophecy, the World and Time were intertwined.

title: Hart's Hope
description: Although Palicroval the Fair spares Asineth's life by killing her father and removing her kingdom, she remains unyielding and seeks revenge against his mercy.

title: An Armory of Swords
description: Saberhagen has gathered together some of the most distinguished fantasy writers in the world to create their own tales within the realm of his Lost Swords series. This book features Walter Jon Williams, Sage Walker, and a new account by the author--Fred Sabherha's "Blind Man'Sharp"-–which details how the S sword was originally drawn into human society.

title: Red Prophet
description: Alvin Maker is engrossed in the political maneuvering of his visionary sibling and Napoleon Bonapart, a French colonel who was exiled to Fort Detroit, in this chronicle set in an alternate reality of America.

title: Anthonology
description: Autobiographical accounts of the experiences that have inspired his fantasy and science fiction novels are prominent in a retrospective anthology of tales.

title: Orion
description: The Dark Lord's reign over the earth is being contested by John O'Ryan, an eternal warrior, in their quest to control the future. Reissue.

title: The Call of Earth
description: Despite Harmony's weakening Oversoul, a great warrior has emerged to challenge its bans. Moozh, the conqueror of the Banished Warriors, has won battles by using banned technology and is now targeting the city of Basilica as his troops remain trapped within. Wetchik and his sons are too feeble to prevent he from stopping an army, so will Rasa and her allies follow him?

title: The Ships of Earth
description: After the fall of the City of Basilica, Wetchik, Nafai, and their family must now face the desert wastes and travel across vast continent to reach Harmony's secret spaceport. Only a few have chosen to go into exile, while others have been forced against their will due to anger and animosity towards Rasa'S spiteful daughters and husbands.

title: A Meeting with Medusa
description: The two-volume set includes a tale of an astronaut's tragedy and the true meaning of life, as well as an image of trekking on Mars.

title: Demons Don't Dream
description: Xanth is the setting for two young players who are drawn to its world through a computer game and face unforeseen challenges of treachery, danger, and dishonesty.

title: Roc and a Hard Place
description: Roxanne Roc, a bird, is required to face trial before Demoness Metria and Magician Humfrey in the land of Xanth.

title: Seminole Song
description: A Seminole warrior leader holds onto a captive girl who was killed by her blood-soaked husband, the U.S. Army, as they surround their reservation in the Florida Everglades.

title: A Crown of Swords
description: In the seventh volume of the Wheel of Time series, Elayne, Aviendha, and Mat work together to restore the world's natural weather, while Egwene gathers female channelers and Rand confronts the dreadful Forsaken Sammael.

title: Drum Calls
description: Every generation, the two worlds of Clandair and Iomard merge magically, enabling individuals with special abilities to navigate between them. However, Cymel recognizes the peril when she encounters an unfamiliar wizard in flight. Reprint.

title: Blood of the Fold
description: The New World is at risk of being destroyed by a vicious cycle of war, monsters, and treachery as Richard Rahl and Kahlan Amnell fight against the ancient forces of evil.

title: The Fourth Book of Lost Swords
description: The sword, Farslayer, is the prize for Black Pearl, a mermaid, Cosmos, her mischievous lover, Prince Zoltan and Prince Mark, the evil macrowizard Wood, and griffin-wielding beauty.

title: Yon Ill Wind
description: When a tempestuous hurricane hits Xanth, the Demon meets with Chlorine and their human family to save the land from the storm's winds of mischief and madness.

title: A Quantum Murder
description: The savage murder of Professor Edward Kitchener leads Greg Mandel, a Psi-endorsed high-ranking official, to an urgent investigation that culminates in recurrences and theories that suggest the confrontation may never have happened.

title: Shadow of the Hegemon
description: Ender Wiggin and his team of child-warriors have emerged victorious in the War, destroying the enemy and saving the human race. Although he does not want to return to Earth, his crew has scattered across the globe to fight alongside their family. The Battle School is no longer present, but with the external threat gone, the Earth has become a battlefield once more. Not only are the children of the Battle Schools powerful; they can also be considered weapons that could bring power to the countries that govern them.

title: The Dastard
description: In the midst of its long and storied history, Xanth's magical realm has been plagued by numerous wicked menaces, none more treacherous than the Dastard-a malevolent criminal who sold his soul to a despicable demon for the power to erase events. Now all that remains in xanthe is an evil dragon-girl named Becka, who can only be stopped by her father'Sexy daughter!

title: Swell Foop
description: Six fearless adventurers, including Cynthia Centaur, Che, Breanna from the Black Wave, Justin Tree from Xanth City, Sim the immortal bird, and Jaylin from Hawaii, embark on a perilous quest to uncover the mystical Swell Foop, which is the only weapon that can defeat tenacious Demons.

title: Vale of the Vole
description: Young Eskan, an ogrenymphhumanfind, collaborated with a winged centaur and viking Volney to save the "Vale of the Vole" from ruin.

title: Up In a Heaval
description: The twenty-sixth book in the Xanth series depicts Umlaut, a character with an enigmatic past and unknown future, and his friends' mission to save the magical realm from unforeseen circumstances after the Demon Jupiter is provoked to throw his dreaded Red Spot at xanthe.

title: Winter's Heart
description: The Wheel of Time story unfolds as Rand and Min evade capture, Black Tower commander Mazrim Taim is caught up in secret, a Seanchan princess arrives in Ebou Dar, and the White Tower conspirators are besieged by rebels.

title: The Sword of Truth
description: Richard Rahl confronts the dark side of his former self as a rare foe turns on himself, corrupting magic against good and murdering innocent people in an idyllic fantasy world.

title: Knife of Dreams
description: With the release of its eleventh installment in the best-selling series, Rand al'Thor, the Dragon Reborn, is faced with a challenge from the Forsaken and his quest to obtain the remaining seals on the Dark One's prison.

title: The Gate of Fire
description: The sequel to The Shadow of Ararat features Prince Maxian, who revived Julius Caesar and Alexander the Great, in a discussion on how to use the Oath to release Rome from the curse, while Zoe, the newly appointed queen of Palmyra, vows to take revenge.

title: Ariadne's Web
description: Ariadne, the daughter of King Minos, tries her best to save the man she loves from the gods' sacrificial altar, but Dionysus causes them trouble.

title: Mindstar Rising
description: The author of the book "Gulf War II: Shadow of Destiny" reimagines Greg Mandel's journey through computer crime, zero-gravity smuggling, and artificial intelligence to uncover an undeclared killer who threatens a powerful organization and forever redefines the very future of humankind.

title: The Simpsons and Philosophy
authors: William Irwin;Mark T. Conard;Aeon J. Skoble
description: The writer explores the depths of America's beloved animated family for insights into philosophy and society, examining Aristotle, Marx, Camus, Sartre, and more.

title: Woody Allen and Philosophy
description: In fifteen clever essays, fifteen philosophers tackle the queries of Woody Allen's writer, director, actor, comedian, musician, and profound thinker, as well as why anyone should care.

title: Harry Potter and Philosophy
description: The authors of this one-of-a-kind guide urge readers to explore the world beyond wizards, boggarts and dementors by including comments from seventeen philosophers who have written on various topics in the Harry Potter series, such as the distinction between good and evil, the morality of sorcery, and Aristotle's own school for wizardry.

title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Philosophy
description: Analyzes "Buffy the Vampire Slayer" using philosophical concepts in metaphysics, epistemology, ethics, and political philosophy.

title: The Lord of the Rings and Philosophy
description: Historians delves into the life-learning lessons of J.R. R. Tolkien, exploring themes such as happiness, morality, and the quest for ultimate truth.

title: Superheroes and Philosophy
description: A compilation of essays by different writers that explore how superheroes tackle philosophical issues.

title: Star Wars and Philosophy
authors: Kevin S. Decker;William Irwin;Jason T. Eberl
description: A compilation of essays that tackle philosophical issues related to the making of the "Star Wars" films.

title: The Undead and Philosophy
description: "Depicted as a collection of essays on the undead, including vampires and zombies, who are not physically or morally dead but remain present in our world. The topics covered include questions about the metaphysics and ethics of the realm of death."

title: The Beatles and Philosophy
description: "The publisher presents a compilation of essays that delves into the philosophical aspects of the Beatles' music, lyrics, and political activism. The topics covered include skepticism and epistemology, the philosophy of love, altered consciousness and drug culture, Marxism and socialphilosophy."

title: Bullshit and Philosophy
description: Both the media and academia are abuzz with the mention of Bullshit. Harry G. Frankfurt's groundbreaking work significantly boosted the field of bullshim studies, but his thesis left many questions unanswered.

title: The Little Baby Snoogle-Fleejer
description: Due to his incapacity to walk, young Jeremy is teased by his friends and abandoned on the seashore. As everyone prepares to escape the terrifying sea monster, he discovers a kind soul and elusive friend among the creature known as little Snoogle-Fleejer. The book was printed for 50,000 copies.

title: Random House Crossword Megaomnibus
description: The crossword puzzles in his new series are less challenging than those in The New York Times, and they were originally published by United Feature Syndicate and have been featured in many of America's top newspapers.

title: Living Faith
description: In this national best-seller's paperback edition, which includes a new foreword by the author, the former president discusses how his religious beliefs shaped his life both in the past and present. The first printing of the book was limited to 150,000 copies.

title: Theodore Rex
description: Theodore Roosevelt's presidency was marked by the challenges of a new century, in which the United States gained global influence, and detailed anecdotes about his successes and failures, as well as his enemies and personal life.

title: Islam
description: Examines the history of Islam, from the inception of Muhammad to the establishment of the first mosques, and examines its current beliefs and practices.

title: King Solomon's Mines
description: Allan Quatermain and his colleagues journey through the secluded African continent to uncover hidden gold.

title: A Working Stiff's Manifesto
description: Levison's ten-year journey of working 42 odd jobs across six states is the highlight of this book, which offers a vivid and unforgettable glimpse into wage labor in America. It is advisable for anyone who has experienced racing against time to read it.

title: Funny in Farsi
description: The author's autobiography portrays the experience of growing up as an Iranian-American, detailing their relocation from Iran to Southern California in 1971, the family' s diverse culture, and dealing with culture shock.

title: The Birth of Venus
description: Alessandra Cecchi turns fifteen in the Renaissance Florence of the 20th century and becomes engrossed in what her father brought to the city to decorate their Florentine palazzo with paintings, made worse by an unwanted marriage between two young men and a war between the Medici family and fundamentalist Savonarola supporters.

title: The Knight Of Maison-Rouge
description: In 1793, in Paris, a Republican named Maurice saves an attractive and mysterious woman from the clutches of an angry mob and is unwittingly drawn into 'a secret' Royalist scheme involving Marie Antoinette, the Queen's captive, and her dark-skinned protector: the Knight of Maison-Rouge.

title: A War Like No Other
description: The Peloponnesian War is portrayed in a vivid and unforgettable manner, depicting the events that took place during the conflict and the impact on the cities of Athens and Sparta, as well as the notable figures such as Pericles, Alcibiades, Sophocles, and Thucydides. This book is first printed in 35,000 copies and features historical accounts.

title: Reading Lolita in Tehran
description: Discusses her upbringing in the Islamic Republic of Iran and the group of young women who gathered at her home every Thursday to read and discuss Western literature, emphasizing the influence of Lolita, The Great Gatsby, Pride and Prejudice, and other classics on their lives and future endeavors. First printing is limited to 50,000 copies.

title: Kim
description: "The modern Library of the world's best books" has been a proud legacy of The Modern Library since 1917, featuring classic books, significant translations of great works, and rediscoveries of literary and historical significance.

title: Color
description: A freelance journalist explores the social, political, and cultural effects of color on the physical world.

title: Rendezvous in Black
description: "The modern Library of the world's best books" has been a proud legacy of The Modern Library since 1917, featuring classic books, significant translations of great works, and rediscoveries of literary and historical significance.

title: No God But God
description: This authoritative study of the Islamic faith in comparison to other global religions provides a new perspective on its origins and history, including Muhammad's social reformation impact and the effects of fundamentalism and terrorism on Islam.

title: The Mysterious Island
description: The bold new translation of Verne's classic adventure story features a fresh perspective, with Caleb Carr providing hints and insights as the book begins.

title: The Ox-Bow Incident
description: A cowboy's killing prompts a vigilante team to go on nagging the killer and ultimately end up lynching three innocent men, marking re-enactments of life, death, justice, and mob violence on the Western frontier.

title: Mountains Beyond Mountains
description: Dr. Paul Farmer, an infectious disease expert, portrays the tireless efforts of this outspoken Harvard moron to grasp the world's pressing health, economic, and social issues and provide a cure for humanity.

title: Caribbean
description: The Caribbean islands are a turbulent place in history, with characters portraying their colorful lives and the past, including tribal violence on the island of Dominica, exploration periods, the Cuban uprising, and current turmoil. Reprint. 15,000 first printing.

title: The Cossacks
description: Since 1917, The Modern Library has been renowned as "The modern Library of the world's Best Books" and its paperback collections contain valuable classics, translations of significant works, and rediscoveries of literary and historical significance.

title: Fooled By Randomness
description: Declares that probability and randomness have a significant influence on life, but that it is often overlooked by people. Furthermore, they explain how to distinguish between random events and financial markets.

title: Summer Crossing
description: Despite being sixteen years old, Grady McNeil is not bound to pursue her illicit relationship with Clyde Manzer, a Jewish parking attendant from Brooklyn, when her parents leave her alone for the summer. Reprint.

title: The Alienist
description: The investigation in 1896 New York involves a group of investigators who must use unconventional methods such as fingerprinting and psychological analysis to uncover the true motives of an insane individual who stalks victims on the streets.

title: The March
description: The final years of the Civil War are set against the backdrop of Union General William Tecumseh Sherman's ferocious march through Georgia and the Carolinas, in a richly textured historical novel that captures the diverse characters involved in the conflict.

title: Wonderland
description: Jesse Vogel, a battered man, embarks on countless journeys through the maze of his youth and adult life, from rural Lockport, New York, to his career as thriving neurosurgeon in Chicago, and his quest to save his daughter from the effects of drug-fueled counterculture. First printing: 15,000 copies.

title: The Gospel of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
description: In this book, readers can find a compilation of Pastafarianism's religious beliefs, which assert that the Flying Spaghetti Monster (FSM) is the true creator of the universe.

title: Holding on to the Air
description: This monumental portrait of Suzanne Farrell, the renowned ballerina who was the inspiration for George Balanchine, depicts her life and career.

title: Winter Season
description: Announces the diary of Toni Bentley, who began her dance career as a dancer for the New York City Ballet and continues to recount her daily experiences and the emotional turmoil that George Balanchine's troupe endured.

title: The Story of Avis
description: It's just the way it is.

title: Echoes of the Marseillaise
description: According to Hobsbawm, the French Revolution gave people a sense of hope that history could be transformed through their actions and demonstrated the power of the common people in varying ways. We can learn countless lessons from both its interpretation and subsequent changes in perspectives.

title: Moods
description: It's just the way it is.

title: Daughters of Decadence
description: "New Women" published new and controversial stories in English and American magazines like the Atlantic Monthly, Harpers, and the Yellow Book during the turn of the 20th century. These stories were often bold in their expressions of female sexuality, marital dissatisfaction, or feminist protest, which caused Victorian critics to rebuke the authors as being "literary degenerates" or "erotomaniacs." This book features twenty of these works by prominent writers who are included in this collection.

title: Girls who Wore Black
description: What are some facts about the Beat Generation women writers? Up until now, little research has been done on their contributions to the literary world. Among them, prominent female authors Elise Cowen, Joyce Johnson, Joanne Kyger, Hettie Jones, and Diane Di Prima were prominent figures in postwar British Columbia politics who were both pioneering and innovative. They wrote in various genres and took part in and bridged two different divides within American culture.

title: Latin Via Ovid
description: The authors have created a unique teaching tool that helps students become proficient in Latin within 1-2 years at college level or intermediate level. The book includes innovative and connected reading from Ovid's simple myth tales to the rich poetry of Ovidian Latin (with appropriate teaching aids) in just forty lessons, following grammatical tradition followed by an early reading for each chapter.

title: Practice! Practice!
description: This student workbook is the clearest version of Latin taught in Ovid and audio, with all the necessary elements to ensure the students' comprehension. It also features a variety of grammar and vocabulary drills along with innovative directions for practice that are essential for learning Latin.

title: The Gramsci Reader
description: Stuart Hall, Professor of Sociology, Open University.

title: Cold Counsel
description: Cold Counsel is the sole compilation that examines the role of women in Old Norse literature and culture. It draws on historical, sociological, feminist, ethnographic, and psychoanalytic approaches to explore novel topics such as gender, class, sexuality, family structure, or ideology in medieval Iceland.

title: George Eliot
description: A captivating autobiography that delves into the life of George Eliot from childhood, through her scandalous affair and social isolation, to her arduous rise to become one of Victorian England's literary magnates.

title: Marilyn Monroe
description: A biography of the screen legend employs 35 thousand previously sealed documents--letters, diaries and other papers-to study almost every detail of Monroe's life and death.

title: Temptations
description: The Temptations' founder shares their story, complete with 57 photos, to reveal the group's commercial success and critical acclaim during the 60s and 70s.

title: Edgar Allan Poe  A to Z
description: Over 3,400 entries are available, which include a chronological arrangement of Poe's life and work. These entries include works like essays, reviews, poems, and tales, as well as historical and fictional accounts. Additionally, there is coverage of events and publications that had an impact on PoE' literary history, including the films of Roger Price and Vincent in the 1920s.

title: Christopher and His Kind
description: The book, originally published in 1976, describes Christopher and His Kind's ten-year journey from Isherwood' left England to live in Berlin for a week before moving to America in 1939. "What stood out to early readers was the candidness with which the author recounted his experiences in gay Berlin during the 1930s and his determination to rescue Heinz from the Nazis," according to the memoir.

title: The Condor and the Cows
description: The book, which includes a new foreword by Jeffrey Meyers and additional photographs by Bill Caskey, is one of the few truly iconic works on South American travel.

title: The Man who Tricked a Ghost
description: A brave man, Sung, who is not afraid of ghosts, meets one on a dark street and deceives it into concealing its hidden fragility.

title: You Can Never Go Home Again
description: A ghost named BJ, who died in the 1950s, is discovered by Angel and her mother when they move into a cottage on Long Island. This is the first part of two parts.

title: Crackup
description: "Discover the inside details of how to convert an airplane into scrap metal with crack!!" - Page 4.

title: Notebook of a Return to the Native Land
description: Césaire's work that reveals the overlooked and influential aspects of black culture.

title: Robert Penn Warren's All the King's Men
description: One of the most renowned American novels, All the King's Men, written by Robert Penn Warren in 1946 and published in the Pulitzer Prize-winning book of that year still exists. Warren'S characters are still powerful representational of moral dilemmas faced by individuals in positions of power, fifty years after the novel was written; his first play (proudfülle) unpublished in his lifetime, followed by a sequel (ouan/unpublished) called Willie Stark: His Rise And Fall; and another version (sharing posttoto be honest) caused by his entire series of plays

title: Odes to Common Things
description: The "odes to common things" collection is a bilingual poem that features 25 Spanish-language poets who have recently been translated into English, each of which is beautifully illustrated with pencil drawings. From bread and soap to bed and tea to coffee and milk, these poems capture the essence of their subjects in eloquent manners. There are also 50 b&w illustrations available for reference.

title: The Camera
description: Ansel Adams (1902-1984) is known for his innovative photographic ideas and unparalleled technical proficiency in advancing the art of photography. The first book in his series, The Camera, educates photographers on how to use their camera's artistic potential. This handbook is as important today as it ever was when Adams began working with photography, providing essential insights into visualization, image management, photoshop techniques, and other essential tools.

title: The Negative
description: Through his creative innovations and unparalleled technical expertise, Ansel Adams (1902-1984) helped to create some of the most iconic photographic images in history. The Negative, the second volume in his collection of books on photography techniques, has educated photographers on how to use film and the film development process creatively for generations. Examples of Adams' own work provide examples of this knowledge while still being relevant today.

title: The Print
description: Ansel Adams (1902-1984) is credited with producing some of the most iconic photographic images in the 20th century and contributed to the development of photography through his innovative ideas and unparalleled technical proficiency. His third book, The Print, is dedicated to teaching photographers about printmaking and has been extensively illustrated by examples of Adams' own work. This handbook summarizes the knowledge gained during their long careers and still holds value today.

title: Final Rain
description: A new particle beam weapon has been developed by the invading Russians, and John Thomas Rourke, a former CIA agent, is now leading the international forces against them.

title: Bright Star's Promise
description: The second installment of Love's Bright Star follows Sandrine Renard, a stunning actress, who is left to her death due to tragedy. The separation is worsened by an accident that leaves Wade without any memories of his love.

title: A Devilish Dilemma
description: Miss Minerva Potts was disillusioned with her engagement to the self-absorbed Lord Whithall, so she resorted to vowing not to wed. She then went on to marry Chadwick Brumfield, Earl of Rossland and became known as the Devil's Delight. The charming earl had a reputation so scandalous that Minera believed she would never be turned off by him--until she deviated from her original plan.

title: Prince of Magic
description: After dancing barefoot in the moonlight to shame her minister father, Elizabeth Penshurst is exiled to Yorkshire. She meets Gabriel Durham, who becomes involved with a Druid cult that plans to use her as retribution for their relationship.

title: My Lord Eternity
description: The second title of a new trilogy tells the story of three noble vampires who are entrusted with protecting their species and discover that human desires are not lost, and they may only yearn for love.

title: See how She Dies
description: The first romantic suspense novel by the author of "Whispers," which was published in 1994, is now being repackaged, titled "Treasures," and has been updated to include more suspérité, intrigue, and atmosphere.

title: This Christmas
description: In the surburban homewife Sarah, who is unhappy with her marriage and finds herself on break with a husband who moves to Chicago indefinitely due to his job, and learns that the grass isn't always greener on the other side, Jane Green's Vacation is one of three holiday romances. Original.

title: My Wicked Pirate
description: The pirate, the Viper, uses Alanis, a stunning heiress, as his tool to seek revenge on those who had betrayed him, and eventually develops romantic feelings for his lively captive as they embark on opportunistic journeys up high in the sea. Original.

title: CliffsNotes on Shakespeare's King Henry IV
description: Sir John Falstaff, a distinguished character in the world of theater, is born in this popular play that features both humorous and serious moments. In it, Prince Hal's young son rebels against his father, the king, until he must seek the assistance of the monarch to quell the noble rebellion.

title: CliffsNotes on Shakeapeare's Twelfth Night
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background. The latest titles in this series also feature glossaries and visual aids that complement the classic, familiar format. In Cliff's Notables of Twelfth Night, you'll encounter several groups of characters whose stories are seamlessly integrated, creating one of Shakespeare'

title: CliffsNotes on Tolstoy's Anna Karenina
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background.

title: Cliffs notes on Faulkner's As I lay dying
description: Contains information on the life of William Faulkner, the plot of the novel, and additional notes about each character in the "As I Lay Dying," as well as analysis and commentary on specific sections.

title: CliffsNotes on Wright's Black Boy
description: CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters and literary devices, as well as historical information. For example, the book Black Boy reveals the author's separation from both white society and his own people.

title: CliffsNotes on Voltaire's Candide
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical details. Specifically, the Candide study guide explores Voltaire's most famous philosophic tale. It provides an introduction to his profound views on politics, religion, philosophy. Additionally, it is an adventure tale about a young hero who travels extensively and faces great danger.

title: CliffsNotes on Heller's Catch-22
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background. Catch-22 is an unforgettable novel that is brimming with satire, exaggeration, grotesque and comic caricatures, as well as telling allusions. Heller's main characters are two Jewish boys from Brooklyn who lived in World War II, with their friendship growing stronger each time due to their shared social status. This study guide illuminates the tensions within American society over the period of the conflict between the boys and their relationship for this love

title: CliffsNotes on Euripides' Medea & Electra
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide comprehensive commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background to help you understand great works you're likely to study for school or pleasure. In Electra & Medea, you’ll explore two classic Greek tragedies by Euripides and discover how he introduced many innovations to the drama of his time.

title: CliffsNotes on Williams' The Glass Menagerie & Streetcar Named Desire
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide insight into key themes and elements in classic literature. In particular, they highlight two popular plays set in the South that draw inspiration from Tennessee Williams's personal experiences.

title: CliffsNotes on Flaubert's Madame Bovary
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background. Madame Flaubert is the focus of the book, which was written in 1857 and criticized so much as to be brought to trial for immorality.

title: Middlemarch
description: The book provides information on George Eliot's life and career, a summary of characters, chapter summaries and commentaries, an analysis of main characters for the book, and more.

title: CliffsNotes on Wiesel's Night
description: These first-person, hand-referenced CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes and plots.

title: CliffsNotes on Hansberry's A Raisin in the Sun
description: The original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background. The latest titles in this series also feature glossaries and visual elements that complement the classic format. A Raisin in the Sun was first published in 1959 and has been translated into over 30 languages. It tells the story of a black family facing financial difficulties and their loss of independence, ultimately leaving them feeling heartbroken and losing all hope.

title: CliffsNotes on Faulkner's The Sound and the Fury
description: Original CliffsNotes study guides provide expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background. The latest titles in this series also feature glossaries and visual aids that complement the classic format. For example, you can read The Sound and the Fury, which focuses on the decline of the once noble Compson family in Yoknapatawpha County, northern Mississippi, as well as other notable novels.

title: CliffsNotes on Hemingway's The Sun Also Rises
description: This book is about the lives and times of "the Lost Generation," who were Americans living in Europe during the world wars. Hemingway's expatriates came to the country for two reasons: one to escape the horrors of war and create something worth living. Jake Barnes, a heartbroken love story, tells it beautifully.

title: Beckett's Waiting for Godot  Endgame  & Other Plays
description: Waiting for Godot, a truly remarkable work of the Theater of Absurd, is one of its most impressive productions. Despite its dim reflection, the subject and story retain realism as the two characters maintain their innocence. This volume also includes Endgame, All That Fall, Act Without Words I, and Krapp's Last Tape.

title: The Heidi Chronicles
description: Throughout the play, there are interwoven scenes that depict the development of Heidi Holland, a prosperous art historian, as she struggles to find her place in sane society.

title: Four Baboons Adoring the Sun
description: A true story is the basis for the plot of the play, which follows the trail of a young black con artist named Paul who insinuates his connection to the lives of two wealthy New Yorkers, Ouisa and Flan Kittredge, by pretending to know their son at college.

title: A Streetcar Named Desire
description: The classic drama of Tennessee Williams depicts the heart-wrenching breakdown of a Southern woman who is besieged by her brother-in-law, causing her to lose her last chance for joy.

title: Having Our Say
description: As the story begins: Sadie Delany, 103, and Bessie Delana, 101, arrive at their Mount Vernon, New York, home to celebrate their father's birthday with a meal and remark, "What can we say?"

title: The Santaland Diaries ; And  Season's Greetings
description: During the holiday season, a slacker becomes essentially an elf to keep him busy, as depicted in THE STORIES: THE SATINADIAN DIARIES. The job initially seems unremarkable at first, but it turns out to be worth the effort once the excitement is over.

title: Wonder of the World
description: The story of Cass' husband is so unsettling that she has to flee to the honeymoon capital of the world in a desperate search for her missing life.

title: An Adult Evening of Shel Silverstein
description: Shel Silverstein's comic universe is a place of suspense and humor where even the most innocent talk can become violent in an instant.

title: Franz Kafka's The Castle
description: The Castle, Kafka's most magical novel, was named one of the 100 greatest works of fiction by a panel of international writers in 2002.

title: Gunslinger
description: A masterful critique of late twentieth-century capitalism, Dorn's anti-epic is a comic masterpiece that has become renowned throughout the United States.

title: Immigrant Acts
description: In Immigrant Acts, Lisa Lowe argues that understanding Asian immigration to the United States is essential to comprehending the country's culturally and economic makeup. She highlights the paradox of Asians being included in U.S. workplaces and markets while being separated from national culture through exclusion laws and citizenship restrictions.

title: Photography's Other Histories
description: With 128 photos and over 100 illustrations, this volume offers a comprehensive exploration of how photography can contribute to the development of historical awareness across diverse geographic, cultural, and historical contexts.

title: Nikola Tesla
description: Detail the career and achievements of the Croatian engineer who created alternating-current technology and developed the radio.

title: Oprah Winfrey
description: Discusses the childhood, teenage years, career path, and parental experiences of an entertainer known as the Queen of Nice.

title: Barack Obama
description: Describes the life and work of the community organizer, Harvard Law School graduate, civil rights lawyer and legislator who has worked on voting rights and employment discrimination cases. He was selected to deliver the keynote address at the conference.

title: The Classical Drawing Atelier
description: By showcasing the principles of realist drawing and painting in the works of Old Masters and modern realistic artists, this comprehensive art course is designed to educate serious art students.

title: Freaks!
description: Provides a step-by-step guide for drawing intricate and unusual anthropomorphic fantasy creatures.

title: The Munsters
description: Take a Trip Down Mockingbird Lane with The Munsters, one of the most beloved families that have ever graced television. Stephen Cox, renowned TV and film historian, introduces you to the true story of this 1960s sitcom as you explore their home.

title: A Picture Book of Thomas Jefferson
description: Marked by the life and legacy of Thomas Jefferson, the creator, philanthropist, presidential candidate, and author of the Declaration of Independence.

title: Patrick
description: Discusses the life and stories of Patrick, the patron saint of Ireland.

title: A Picture Book of Anne Frank
description: Hints about the life of the young Jewish girl, whose diary documents the years she and her family kept hidden from the Nazis in an Amsterdam attic.

title: In the Name of Jesus
description: Discusses the challenges and potential solutions that exist in contemporary Christian leadership, urging a reconsideration of leadership strategies grounded in the divine order.

title: Life of the Beloved
description: When asked by a secular Jewish friend to describe his faith in simple language, Nouwen replied with the phrase "Life of the Beloved," which implies that God loves all people regardless of their beliefs.

title: Save the Date
description: Freitas and King's humorous and lighthearted book offers a perspective on dating, highlighting the spiritual significance of dating for young adults.

title: Huxley and God
description: In this book, the authors present a collection of essays that covers topics such as Action and Contemplation, Religion and Time, Reflections on the Lord's Prayer, and Notes on Zen, with their trademark elegance and wit.

title: Reinventing Jesus
authors: J. Ed Komoszewski;M. James Sawyer;Daniel B. Wallace
description: Despite the rhetoric of extreme doubt, Reinventing Jesus uncovers the true authenticity of ancient Christianity. This book is meticulously researched and readable, providing a wide-ranging audience with first-hand evidence of Christianity's beginnings.

title: Quito 1599
description: Quito has been one of the most mysterious Spanish American cities throughout its history, and the history of its vast hinterland, which makes up only a fraction of what constitutes the modern Republic of Ecuador, is not well-known. This engaging book begins with the 1599 turning point, but moves forward in revealing the origins of sixteenth-century Spanish colonialism through six interconnected narratives that Lane brings to life.

title: Art of Being
description: Fromm explores the authentic routes to self-awareness and enlightenment, as opposed to false teachings, and proposes an alternative approach to achieve self–acknowledgement and happiness, which is grounded in psychoanalysis and self—through meditation.

title: Nathan the Wise  Minna von Barnhelm  and Other Plays and Writings: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
description: As a playwright, scholar, poet, critic, and archeologist, Lessing's works are impressively listed in this book, including Minna von Barnhelm (fierce fatal), Emilia (glorious), Galotti, Nathan the Wise, The Jews (and related correspondence), Ernst and Falk: Conversations for the Freemasons, as well as selections from philosophical and theological writings.

title: The Art of Listening
description: Erich Fromm, a psychotherapist by profession, had always intended to publish his work, but this book is the perfect fit. Instead, these reflections offer valuable insights into Fromme's approach to understanding mental health issues and how he managed patients in an informal and intimate manner.

title: Guerilla Film Makers Movie Blueprint
description: The Guerilla Film Makers Movie Blueprint is centered on flow charts, which provide a clear and concise overview of all the necessary steps in making VFX. This approach ensures that novice and established filmmakers can easily understand each area with its extensive and insightful notes. The text is broken up into box outs, hot tips, and sub-diagrams for easy reading enjoyment.

title: Don DeLillo's White Noise
description: A series of books that aim to make contemporary novels more accessible and informative includes Don Delillo's "White Noise," which is the subject of this book. The group has been compiled by a team of modern fiction experts from both sides of the Atlantic who have devised readable and well-written guidelines for each novel in question, following essentially the same five-part format: introductory biography; an extended analysis;

title: Gabriel Garcia Marquez's Love in the Time of Cholera
description: IAN RANKIN: It's like having a reading group in your pocket.

title: David Foster Wallace's Infinite Jest
description: This is part of a new series of contemporary novel guides, designed to make reading accessible and informative for readers who have enjoyed or are interested in some of the most popular, most acclaimed, and most influential novels of recent years. The group has been assembled by scholars from the field of modern fiction from both sides of Atlantic, with the aim of providing an insightful and comprehensive overview (or summary), of each novel's various sections.

title: Anita Diamant's The Red Tent
description: The series, titled Continuum Contemporaries, provides readers with informative and accessible access to some of the most popular, highly acclaimed, and influential novels of recent years. A team of contemporary fiction scholars has been assembled from both sides ofthe Atlantic to provide a comprehensive analysis of each novel in question, following the same format:... an author's biography (with additional material on the authors or their literary predecessors), other influences (such as pop culture or advertising),..."—- its thorough examination of key themes and ideas;.... conclusion

title: Beyond the Chains of Illusion
description: BEYOND THE CHAINS OF ILLUSION, originally published in 1962, is a book that explores the intellectual heritage of two significant figures: Marx and Freud. Fromm's interpretation of Marx is exceptional, and his revival of the Freudilian and Marxist perspectives on society and individuals provides an untold vision of how people live their lives.

title: JK Rowling's Harry Potter Novels
description: Examines the themes within the novels, learns about critiques of the books, and provides details on J.K. Rowling's life.

title: Arundhati Roy's The God of Small Things
description: This is part of a new series of contemporary novel guides, designed to make reading accessible and informative for readers who have enjoyed or are interested in some of the most popular, most acclaimed, and most influential novels of recent years. The group has been assembled by scholars from the field of modern fiction from both sides of Atlantic, with the aim of providing an insightful and comprehensive overview (or summary), of each novel's various sections.

title: History of Philosophy Volume 1
description: Is there a lack of marketing misstep?

title: Culture of Fear Revisited
description: showcasing a more advantageous side of humanity.

title: Cervantes in Algiers
description: After being seized by Barbary pirates during his return to Spain from the Battle of Lepanto and other Mediterranean campaigns against the Turks, Miguel de Cervantes's five-year stay in Algerian bagnios or prison-houses (1575-1580) had a lasting effect on his writings.

title: Helena
description: According to the Chicago Tribune, Helena is a book that showcases both good and bad writing skills.

title: Too Busy Not to Pray
description: The majority of us struggle to find the energy to pray due to busy schedules, leading to difficulties in finding uninterrupted time. This practical book offers suggestions on how we can slow down and be with God while also providing guidance on prayer for individual and group members.

title: The Nature of the Atonement
description: The book, edited by James K. Beilby and Paul R. Eddy, is a collection of essays on four perspectives on atonement: the healing, Christus victor, kaleidoscopic, and penal substitutionary views. Its purpose is to assist Christians in comprehending the issues, distinguishing themselves from the minor differences,and moving towards expressing their understanding of the atoverement.

title: Original Sin
description: Henri Blocher's new book, New Studies in Biblical Theology, offers a sophisticated philosophical examination of the biblical evidence for original sin, exploring the best theological perspectives on the topic. She argues that while the nature of originality is shrouded in mystery, believing in it provides elucidation of both evil and wrongdoing.

title: The Cross from a Distance
description: Peter G. Bolt's study of Mark' Bible in New Studies in Biblical Theology examines the significance of the cross in the narrative, exploring how Mark’s teaching can contribute to our understanding of atonement and how it can inform, correct, and enhance our own practice in preaching the gospel in today' s context.

title: Courageous Faith Through the Year
description: A devotional that lasts for a year emphasizes the fundamental elements of Christian life, such as morality, character, and wisdom, to help believers become more fully acquainted with God and understand his workings in them.

title: Beyond the Postmodern Mind
description: Featuring new perspectives and concluding chapter, this exceptional volume of essays examines potential avenues towards a liberated and awakened consciousness.

title: Mandala
description: Through simple mandala exercises and drawing techniques, Mandala will provide readers of all levels with a comprehensive guide to creating their own unique and powerful works of sacred art.

title: The Calvin and Hobbes Tenth Anniversary Book
description: The creator of "Calvin and Hobbes" shares his insights on cartooning, the process of creating his signature character, and some of his favorite moments from the show's ten-year run.

title: The Days Are Just Packed
description: Calvin, with the help of his mischievous tiger companion Hobbes, sets out to save the world while simultaneously managing Miss Wormwood, Santa, Susie, and the monsters under his bed.

title: Homicidal Psycho Jungle Cat
description: The Days Are Just Packed's format is rewritten as Homicidal Psycho Jungle Cat recounts the adventures of a wild child and his unyielding but doubtful friend, exploring diverse worlds.

title: The Essential Calvin And Hobbes
description: An over-sized anthology like The Essential Calvin and Hobbes features a 16-page story and vibrant Sunday cartoons.

title: The Calvin and Hobbes Lazy Sunday Book
description: The Calvin and Hobbes Lazy Sunday Book is a full-color collection of Sunday cartoons and original art that showcases the magical friendship between Calvin, his stuffed tiger and fellow adventurers.

title: Mary Engelbreit's Home Companion
description: A guide to decorating with style, covering kitchens, windows, walls, children's rooms, and workspaces.

title: Stephen King
description: A supplementary account of Steven King's horror novel.

title: Stephen King from A to Z
description: Encompasses hundreds of entries in alphabetical order that offer insights into the life and work of Stephen King, a well-known author.

title: Foundations of Clinical Research
description: This book is a comprehensive guide for all research contexts. It incorporates the current methods of analysis and design, as well as expanded sections on topics such as outcomes research, diagnostic screening, validity, meta-analysis, scales used in survey and outcomes studies, logistic regression, reliability measures, and data management for computer analysis.

title: Chosen by God
description: He provides an analysis of predestination and God's sovereignty while also referencing scripture to support his argument.

title: Four Mothers at Chautauqua
description: According to Isabella Alden, the aunt and mentor of Grace Livingston Hill, there are children who lack direction and their mothers pray that a summer in Chatauqua will lead them to discover God's love.

title: Desecration
description: The Tribulation Force gains strength as the recently-resurrected Carpathia demonstrates a fondness for brutal killings against those who remain disloyal to him and commits the ultimate act of desecration against the Judeo-Christian population.

title: Armageddon
description: The Middle East becomes the ultimate battlefield for all world armies, including the Tribulation Force, as the world's danger intensifies with death, suspicion, and treachery surrounding us.

title: Left behind
authors: Tim Lahaye;Tim F. LaHaye;Jerry B. Jenkins
description: The author's "last days" book is the debut of a 747 pilot who endeavors to recover from the trauma of "The Rapture." Reprint.

title: Remember
description: In an attempt to survive on her own, Ashley Baxter keeps her family and God far away until the September 11 tragedy changes her life.

title: Sit  Walk  Stand
description: Watchman Nee, a Chinese pastor, provides an inspiring account of Ephesians and the belief that connects believers to Christ, the world, and Satan.

title: Kingdom Come
description: The end of the Left Behind saga marks the conclusion of Tribulation, and as Jesus Christ has established his perfect kingdom on earth, believers worldwide experience a newly enhanced bond with their God, but evil still lurks in the hearts of unbelievers.

title: The Rising
authors: Tim LaHaye;Tim F. LaHaye;Jerry B. Jenkins
description: In the midst of God's plans, young Ray Steele begins to reveal his destiny as Marilena Carpathia gives birth unto the Antichrist, marking the start of the Rapture countdown.

title: The Origin of the Bible
description: Despite the abundance of books on the topic, few have attempted to provide an in-depth account of how the Bible was first inspired, canonized, read as sacred literature, copied in ancient Hebrew and Greek manuscripts, and eventually translated into various languages. This is the most comprehensive one-volume overview yet.

title: Silenced
description: Paul Stepola, the double agent, is still battling to protect his fellow believers from the government's efforts to eliminate Christianity while also navigating how to inform his family about his new religious beliefs without raising doubts about what his father-in-law believes.

title: Rejoice
description: The fourth volume of the Baxter family's series centers around a woman named Brooke Baxxter, who has achieved success in her career, offspring, and children, but is struggling with overwhelming loss towards her uncertain marriage and newfound faith. Original.

title: Forgiven
description: Dayne Matthews, a well-known figure in Hollywood, is finding it difficult to handle the unexpected revelations he has made about his past and find the courage to forgive.

title: Little Miss Birthday
description: Despite her impeccable gift-giving skills, Little Miss Birthday is clueless about how to find a suitable present for Mr. Wrong.

title: Mr. Jelly and the Pirates
description: The pirates are able to capture Mr. Jelly, who is scared of everything, without any delay.

title: Mountain Madness
description: The bravery of Nate King is on full display as he faces his demise after saving two trappers from New York from a Piegan war party, but the men's deadly betrayal leaves Connor and Bettendorf both devastated.

title: The Halloween Man
description: Stony Crawford is the only one who can unlock the power of Stonehaven and the unspeakable creature trapped in a summer mansion, while The Halloween Man walks away from the screaming.

title: Gold Rage
description: Ben Frazier, a destitute trapper, is led to encircled by mercenary Arapaho warriors and is then hunted down by an army of greedy renegade trappers, with Zach King as his only survivor. Original.

title: The Nightmare Chronicles
description: Dean Koontz suggests that short stories written by a master horror writer can have such an impact on the reader's mind that they should keep paramedics on call.

title: Sweet Revenge
description: Kyla is taken hostage and compelled to wed Galen, the leader of the MacDonald clan, while on her way to her wedding. However, this act of vengeance ultimately results in true love.

title: Something Borrowed  Something Blue
description: The matrimonial mantra of "Something old, something new" is embodied in four captivating novels written by Barbieri, Constance O'Banyon, Evelyn Rogers, and Bobbi Smith.

title: The House That Jack Built
description: Craig Bellman is committed to residing in Valhalla, a dwelling where all inhabitants have faced tragedy. His wife Effie agrees to move in, but as death approaches the location, Craig becomes fixated on the house.

title: Mischief
description: A time-honored evil entity is confronted by Jim Hook upon his arrival at a high-end prep school situated on the fringes of an old, prosperous estate in the Hudson Valley of New York.

title: The Deed
description: A stoic new bride realizes that there is more to the wedding night than just a sound sleep and true love.

title: Bliss
description: King Henry's resolve to end their feud results in Lady Tiernay marrying Lord Holden, resulting in an unlikely union that has surprising consequences and leads to love.

title: The Reluctant Reformer
description: Upon learning that the infamous courtesan known as Lady X is his best friend's sister, Margaret Wentworth, Lord James leads her to a disreputable house and rescues her from her own mistake, ultimately leading him back to reforming the ignorant hoyden, only to fall in love with her.

title: The Hour Before Dark
description: A young man is brought back to the family home where his father was killed in a vicious attack, leaving him with an unimaginable evil from his past.

title: Nightmare House
description: The story of how the eerie home at Harrow House was constructed is recounted in this book, following the events described in The Infinite and Mischief.

title: The Chase
description: The stout British knight travels to Scotland with the intention of fulfilling a marriage agreement, but he is more troubled by the rebellious nature of his betrayer's love life.

title: The Abandoned
description: The Harrow House series, which is now famous, is being continued with this unique novel.

title: The Attraction
description: The teenagers who have stopped to see the shriveled mummy in a desert roadside display seem to be unafraid of it until it appears to live on.

title: Blood Moon Over Bengal
description: Elizabeth Mainwaring, the fiercely independent daughter, returns to Bengal, India to meet her separated father, a British colonel, but she is uneasy about one of his soldiers who is also suspected of being involved in ten heinous murders.

title: Love Is Blind
description: The clumsy Clarissa Crambray may not be as sharp as she appears, but finding the brave and scarred nobleman could make her feel like an eternal match. Original:

title: Blood Moon Over Britain
description: Cicely Winterborne is caught in a web of intrigue and espionage when her friend is killed, with only Inspector Fielding of Scotland Yard being trusted by her.

title: The Shakespeare Plays: Romeo & Juliet
description: Explanatory notes and background information are provided for the text of Shakespeare's classic love story.

title: Child of God
description: The story of Lester Ballard, a dispossessed and violent man accused of rape, returns to the hill country of East Tennessee after being released from prison. Cormac McCarthy portrays the harsh realities of life with finesse, humor, and lyrical grace in this gripping novel.

title: The Grace Awakening
description: Christians are urged by Swindoll to wake up and reject legalistic, performance-oriented bondage. He also urges readers not to miss out on living a grace-filled life, as freedom and joy-not assignments, lists, and obligations--await all who believe in the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Lead Like Jesus
description: One Minute Manager, the most popular management method globally, is based on the principles of Jesus as a role model, which link four internal and external domains--the heart, head, hands, and habits.

title: Salvation to the Ends of the Earth
description: Andreas Kstenberger and Peter O'Brien, who are part of the New Studies in Biblical Theology series, offer a comprehensive biblical theology of missions that covers the Old Testament, Second Temple Period and the Bible.

title: The Valley of Vision
description: The Puritan tradition's character and life were shaped by prayer and meditation, which held the highest significance. Prayer was considered the most important aspect of this practice as it allowed for writing rather than reading. This led to the development of an important corpus of devotional literature in the Puritsa tradition. Arthur Bennett distilled these prayers into "aspiration units" and presented them in modern form, with their individuality or merit.

title: Discovering God's Will
description: Discovering God's Will uncovers the fundamental principles by which God guides us. This passage emphasizes that God obtains guidance primarily through knowledge, affection, and obedience.

title: The Complete Theory Fun Factory
description: Comprises books 1, 2, and 3 in the Boosey & Hawkes Scores/Books.

title: The Shawshank redemption
description: A true and unexpected success, the film is an account of one of cinema's greatest hits.

title: The Little Mouse  the Red Ripe Strawberry  and the Big Hungry Bear
description: Little Mouse is anxious that the large, ravenous bear will take his ripe red strawberry that was just picked.

title: Head  Shoulders  Knees and Toes ...
description: A visual representation of the song that identifies body parts on board pages.

title: Dissecting Marilyn Manson
description: The cultural phenomenon of Marilyn Manson is not just a rock star, but also renowned. He has created an incredibly realistic world of freaks that resonates with young people who are deeply uninterested in science fiction, while stirring up controversy and opposition from conservative and Christian groups. Gavin Baddeley's book, Dissecting Marilyn Monroe, examines the psychotic sources and seminal influences that have inspired this fascinating Frankenstein'scheme.

title: For the Sake of Argument
description: The essays cover topics such as international politics, modern conservatism, politicians, and literature.

title: From Hell
categories: Detective and mystery comic books, strips, etc
description: A stunning volume is presented in the wake of the smash hit From Hell by Knockabout. The volume includes a new story by Alan Moore called Snakes and Ladders, which was inspired by 'Ancienne' Perkins' performance in Holborn on 16 October 1979.

title: Eight Mindful Steps to Happiness
description: The author offers insights on the "Eightfold Path" of Buddhism and provides guidance on how to live with a focused focus on understanding, thinking, speech, action, livelihood, effort, mindfulness, and concentration.

title: Assassinating Shakespeare
description: The unexpected adventures of a young Shakespearean performer on the streets of Africa during the 1970s.

title: Full Circle
description: The author's travels in South America are documented, and he recounts the encounters with remarkable people during his trips.

title: The Evolution of the Gilgamesh Epic
description: Special Features aim to document the development of The Gilgamesh Epic from its beginning to its latest version, examining the stylistic, thematic, structural, and theological changes along various themes.

title: Corroborating Evidence
description: Rasmussen offers evidence to establish with reasonable certainty that someone else committed the murders that have kept William Heirens, the longest-serving inmate in the Illinois penal system, in jail for 58 years.

title: West with the Night
description: Discusses the experiences of growing up in a deserted African country, raising race horse breeders and training them, sending mail to Sudan, and being the first woman to fly the Atlantic from east to west.

title: Moon in a Dewdrop
description: The so-called Soto School was founded by Eihei Dogen (1200-1253), who was not only a highly influential Zen philosopher but also one of the most stimulating figures in Japanese letters. Kazuaki Tanahashi, working with other Zen authorities, has translated some of Dogent's most important texts accurately and sensitively, including key essays and background materials that will help Western readers approach this important work.

title: Suburban Nation
description: In North America, there is a growing movement to stop suburban sprawl and replace the automobile-based settlement patterns with traditional planning principles, which are supported by three members of the Congress for the New Urbanism.

title: Rent Girl
description: The tale of a young lesbian's journey into and out of the sex industry on both the East and West Coasts of America.

title: Summa Theologica
description: Although writing about everything human being has become difficult in the 21st century, we still have a lot to learn from Summa Theologica. St. Thomas Aquinas' teachings are unparalleled and focus on how to approach challenging questions that have persisted for centuries.

title: Crime Partners
description: A white cop, cons, and drug traffickers are all targets of a ghetto chief," said Cover.

title: Whoreson
description: A gripping account of the life of Whoreson James, the offspring of a stunning black prostitute who was once imprisoned in the Ghetto world and is now thriving.

title: The Grail
description: The author's visit to their Oregon winery by Don and Jesse Lange occurred in the same year.

title: Sherlock Holmes
description: Describes the character's involvement in the political events of late-nineteenth-century England, his links to the British mafia, and his investigations into some of his most notorious crimes during that time.

title: Halsey's Typhoon
description: The 1944 naval disaster is the story of how General MacArthur's Pacific Fleet, led by naval admiral William Halsey, was swept to safety by a category-four typhoon that destroyed three destroyers and killed nearly 800 young soldiers.

title: Suffer the Little Children
description: A pediatrician is subjected to a brutal attack by prosecutors, who claim that the captain of the Carabiniere and two privates abducted his eighteen-month-old son.

title: Mapping the Big Picture
description: Explains the process of creating and working with curriculum maps in seven steps, from data collection to ongoing curriculum review.

title: Getting Results with Curriculum Mapping
description: Teachers and administrators provide practical suggestions on how to optimize curriculum mapping in districts and schools.

title: The Tutor's First Love
description: Another age-old classic of romance. Intriguing storylines with profound spiritual themes.

title: Complete Poems  1904-1962
description: The poet's use of satire and sentiment in unconventional verse is evident in his collection of works.

title: Tulips and Chimneys
description: Cummings's poems are fresh and honest, with a blend of earthy, tender, rebellious, and romantic elements, as they celebrate the individuality of each person, the necessity of repudiating the dehumanizing force of institutions, or the exuberant power of love.

title: Basic Political Writings
description: Raymon M Lemos, "Teaching Philosophy", states that the release of these exceptional translations brings pleasure to those who teach political philosophy and political theory.

title: Introduction to The Philosophy of History
description: Graham Parkes, University of Hawaii's philosophy department, states that this translation is both intelligent and elegant, providing an ideal solution to the challenge of introducing Hegel to students in a survey course on Western philosophy.

title: On Justice  Power  and Human Nature
description: This collection of extracts from The History of the Peloponnesian War is specifically designed for students who are not well-versed in ancient Greek culture and language. It includes passages that provide valuable insights into Thucydides' political theory, as well as lesser-known pieces that are often overlooked by nonspecialists.

title: The Grand Inquisitor
description: The latest edition features The Grand Inquisitor, Rebellion, and Dostoevsky's extended response under the title The Russian Monk. This edition highlights how Dobby presents the Grand Incidental as it unfolds within the novel and reflects his unique perspective on modernity.

title: Complete Works
description: Gathers translations of Plato's works and provides guidance on how to approach reading and studying the text.

title: Aristophanes 1
description: Provides information on three satirical plays, their translations, and topics such as staging, history, religious practices, myths or issues related to each play.

title: The Peloponnesian War
description: Provides an English translation of the Greek text that details the people and events that took place during the long, disputed battle between Athens and Sparta in the fifth century, along with notes, glossary, and other materials.

title: Discourse on Method ; and
description: Includes English translations of Descartes' Discourse on the Method for Conducting Reason Well and for Searching for Truth in the Sciences, which was published in 1637. The works are later translated into English and include a selected bibliography.

title: Statesman
description: The translation of Statesman, as amended and annotated, was published by Aris and Phillips Ltd. A student edition edited by Christopher Rowe is now available, including a brief introduction, notes, and supplementary material, which showcases the book's accuracy and fluency.

title: The Trial and Death of Socrates (Third Edition)
authors: Plato;George Maximilian Anthony Grube;John Madison Cooper
description: G. M. A. Grube's renowned translations are featured in the third edition of 'The Trial and Death of Socrates,' which was edited by John Cooper and published as part of his book "Plato, Complete Works." The book features updated footnotes and a Select Bibliography.

title: Five Dialogues
description: Provides translations of five dialogues from Plato, along with notes on history and mythology.

title: Confucius Analects
description: The list of cited sources includes Kung Fu-tses, Analects, Glossary, Disciples of Confucius, Historical personages, and Traditional Chinese commentators.

title: Complete Poems and Major Prose
description: Odyssey Press first published this classic edition in 1957, which includes all of Milton's poetry and major prose works, with extensive annotations, in a sturdy and reasonably priced hardcover.

title: Aeneid
description: The classicist who is most recognized for his translations of Homer, Sappho, Hesiod, and Callimachus has made a comeback to Roman poetry with the Aeneid.

title: Republic
description: With a thorough grasp of S.R. Slings' new Greek text of the Republic, Reeve has translated it with both accuracy and clarity. Each page is meticulously written and filled with profound knowledge of Plato's ideas.

title: Readings in Classical Chinese Philosophy (Second Edition)
authors: Philip J. Ivanhoe;Bryan W. Van Norden
description: This updated version includes a wider range of readings from Kongzi, Mengzi and Mencius, as well as two new works, 'Robber Zhi' and -White Horse'. It also features brief introductions and selective bibliographies for each work, along with four appendices that provide information on significant figures, texts, and terms in Chinese thought.

title: Plato on Love
description: The complete works of Plato on love, including Symposium, Phaedrus, Lysis, and Alciabiades, as well as selected texts from Republic and Laws—including an introduction by C. D. C." Reeve.

title: A Hundred Camels in the Courtyard
description: The four stories depict contemporary life in a country where cannabis, not alcohol, is traditionally considered an exit from the paranormal. In these tales, Salam employs advice from those who use smoking kif to rid himself of...

title: Kaddish and Other Poems: 1958-1960
description: The author of Howl wrote remarkable visionary poems during the mid-twentieth century when they were struggling with a sense of being disconnected from oneself and feeling alone. I felt compelled to reconstruct that peaceful relationship, which I believed was divine, and so I created hymns filled with longing and triumph.

title: Erotism
description: New York's Walker reprints Death and sensuality in 1962.

title: The Scripture of the Golden Eternity
description: The poet's quest for peace and joy through oneness with the universe is encapsulated in these traditional Kerouac meditations, zen koans, and prose poems.

title: Howl and Other Poems
description: The epigraph titled Howl was inspired by Walt Whitman, which reads "Take off the locks from the doors!" and features Allen Ginsberg's celebrated poetry.

title: A Power Governments Cannot Suppress
description: Howard Zinn's latest book, A Power Governments Cannot Suppress, is a significant and informative blend of essays that examine American history, class, immigration, justice, and ordinary people who have made repercussions.

title: Chekhov's Doctors
authors: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov;Jack Coulehan;John L. Coulehan
description: In his short life, Chekhov excelled as a doctor, essayist, dramatist and humanitarian, and believed that there was no conflict between art and science or art&medicine. This collection of stories showcases doctors in their everyday lives, struggling with personal problems and seeking healing from the inside.

title: Early Candlelight
description: The story of how Deedee DuGay, a young girl from Minnesota who lived in Fort Snelling during the 1830s, became synonymous with her. She shared that she had strong feelings for Jasper Page, the most influential fur trader in the area, and even considered herself above her social status.

title: The St. Paul Stories of F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The St. Paul family and associations that shaped Fitzgerald's perception of his wealth and social standing were evident in classic novels like The Great Gatsby and Tender is the Night.

title: Approaches to Teaching Atwood's The Handmaid's Tale and Other Works
authors: Sharon Rose Wilson;Thomas B. Friedman;Shannon Eileen Hengen
description: With seventy-three volumes, the MLA series (ISSN 1059-1133) now covers a diverse range of literary works. Each volume includes critical and instructional essays that apply various viewpoints to teaching the text. These volumes are ideal for upper-level undergraduate and graduate students, student teachers, education specialists, and teachers in all humanities fields.

title: Julie  Or  The New Heloise
description: A novel in which Rousseau re-concerned the relationship between individual and group life and articulated a new moral perspective.

title: The Search for the Beloved
description: Dr. Jean Houston, a trailblazer in the field of spiritual exploration, presents innovative workshops and literary works that shed light on the concept of inner yearning and offer insights into facilitating personal aspirations for fulfillment by studying various aspects of Sacred Psychology. Houston offers sagacious insights onto the captivating and melancholic depths of human existence.

title: A Gateway to Sindarin
description: A comprehensive examination of Tolkien's Sindarin language, with a focus on grammar, morphology, and history.

title: The Guide to Dan Brown's The Solomon Key
description: The Solomon Key, a new book by Dan Brown, is eagerly anticipated due to its success. Greg Taylor uses information from interviews, his website, and the cover of The Da Vinci Code to provide readers with an unparalleled first look at the book before its release.

title: Three Books of Occult Philosophy
description: The first complete reprint of the original English translation in 500 years was made by Donald Tyson, who edited it and annotated Agrippa's Three Books of Occult Philosophy.

title: Blame It on the Brain?
description: Addresses Alzheimer's disease and dementia, head injury, depression, attention deficit disorder, homosexuality, and alcoholism.

title: Mockingbird Wish Me Luck
description: In Mockingbird Wish Me Luck, Charles Bukowski's poetry captures the combination of pain, hate, love, and beauty in his life. He shares personal stories of lechery and pain while still discovering its beauty.

title: You Get So Alone at Times
description: Charles Bukowski's book, You Get So Alone at Times, explores his childhood and the impact of cats on his life.

title: A Full House
description: The Austins are engulfed on Christmas Eve as they welcome a new mother and an unmarried young woman.

title: The Rock that is Higher
description: The Rock That Is Higher Story by Madam L’Engle captures the essence of our identity and provides a sense of purpose in our lives.

title: Conversations with Ernest Hemingway
description: Interviews with prominent contemporary writers are available as collections.

title: Conversations with Jerzy Kosinski
description: Interviews with prominent contemporary writers are available as collections.

title: Conversations with John Updike
description: Obtains thirty-two interviews with the author from 1959 to 1993.

title: The Good Housekeeping Illustrated Cookbook
description: More than 900 dishes, along with illustrated and step-by-step recipes.

title: Essentials of Conservation Biology
description: Through the integration of theory and basic research, Essentials of Conservation Biology (Fourth Edition) elucidates the links between conservation biology and other areas of study. It is illustrated and written in simple language. The book is highly relevant to graduate students and researchers, as well as offering over 1,000 references and a glossary.

title: Exercitia Spiritualia
description: These meditations, rituals and prayers, as well as instructions on how to pray, chants (her mastery of poetic prose) and litanies were composed by the most scholarly among Helfta's remarkable nuns in the late thirteenth century; she was only five years old when she first entered the highly respected abbey where she never left even once.

title: Harpo Speaks!
description: Describes the personal life of Harpo Marx and his affiliation with the Marx Brothers comedy troupe.

title: Jean Arthur
description: According to the subtitle, the luminous star of Mr. Smith Goes to Washington, Shane, and other classic movies was "the actress nobody knew." Jean Arthur (1900-91) kept her personal life private and avoided the Hollywood publicity machine. She was described as "difficult" due to her perfectionism and remoteness from costars on the movie set. John Oller, another lawyer, tracked down friends and loved ones to capture the essence of a free spirit best expressed in her favorite film.

title: Hamlet's Mill
description: Mythology and science have evolved independently since the Greeks created the language they use for scientific explanation. However, what was their origin? Can we establish that all myths share a common root in astronomical events?

title: Life  a User's Manual
description: Demonstrates the examination of the connection between imagination and reality through the eyes of Serge Valene, a man on death row in Paris.

title: Broken Vessels
description: These twenty-two varied essays, written between 1977 and 1990 and universally acclaimed in Godine hardcover, explore the spiritual strength and shrewd prose writing of Andre Dubus, who has gained worldwide recognition.

title: John Deere Farm Tractors
description: Explains the origins of the plow company's enterprise in the tractor sector, and details the evolution of tractor models over time.

title: Bioinformatics
description: The sequencing of genomes of increasingly large numbers of species has led to increasing computational analysis of these data.This second edition of this acclaimed textbook provides a comprehensive and critical review of the computational methods necessary for analyzing DNA, RNA, and protein data, as well as other genome-related information. It has been updated to include more advanced undergraduate and graduate students in its class, with new chapters featuring chapter guides and explanatory information panels.

title: The Assignation
description: The Assignation by Joyce Carol Oates is a collection of forty-four short and powerful stories that draw inspiration from human experience.

title: First Love
