description: This authoritative text provides a comprehensive introduction to the geography of Africa south of the Sahara, delving into contemporary issues and exploring the sociocultural, political, economic, and environmental processes that shape resource use and development in this rapidly changing region. Students gain unbiased perspectives on the continent's experiences, from postcolonial political unrest and the devastating effects of HIV/AIDS to progress towards democratic and sustainable growth.

title: The Art of Happiness
authors: Dalai Lama XIV Bstan-ʼdzin-rgya-mtsho;Howard C. Cutler
description: Drawing on over 2,500 years of Buddhist tradition and teachings, the spiritual leader offers practical solutions to deal with everyday challenges that come with the baggage of inner peace.

title: Songbook
description: Presents thirty-one of the author's most beloved songs in a compilation that also includes essays on such popular musical renditions as "Thunder Road," "Heartbreaker," and "Caravan."

title: Desolation Angels
description: Jack Duluoz returns to his hometown in San Francisco after spending months as a fire lookout on secluded mountaintops. He realizes how his isolation has affected his life and sees the angel in everything he encounters while walking, talking, and hitching up the hangers.

title: The Color of Water
description: A man of African descent shares his perspective on his life, noting the importance of his mother's presence in shaping his identity and reflecting on how he came to identify as Black.

title: Awakening at Midlife
description: Kathleen Brehony, a psychotherapist who is known for her Jungian approach, offers guidance to individuals on their midlife journey.

title: Caucasia
description: Two daughters, one light-skinned and the other dark-seeded-of a black father and white mother are the focus of racial loyalty in this debut novel. Reprint.

title: High Fidelity
description: Expresses concern about their romantic relationships and eventual remarriage to a record label owner and "Generation X" enthusiast.

title: Still Here
description: Through the humorous and eloquent words of this celebrated spiritual leader, one can gain insight into the difficulties, pleasures, and opportunities that come with living in the later years.

title: Prozac Nation
description: This book chronicles the struggles of a child who struggled with depression and drug abuse in America, detailing their life as children navigate divorce.

title: The Dream of Scipio
description: The fifth, fourteenth, and twentieth centuries are linked by "The Dream of Scipio," an ancient text that includes three love stories set in Provence.

title: The Survivor's Guide to Sex
description: A guide for women who have experienced sexual assault to encourage them. Includes a bibliography and an index. The illustrations are inspiring.

title: The Ultimate Guide to Anal Sex for Women
description: Many women are interested in exploring anal eroticism, but may be unsure of how to proceed. This guide is easy to follow, sexy, candid, and enjoyable for all women--heterosexual, bisexual or lesbian. Features images.

title: Stone Tables
description: The story of Moses is narrated by Orson Scott Card, in an imaginative and vivid way, detailing the difficulties, connections, and challenges that led one man to ascend from a world of greatness to misery and back to Jehovah's light. The epic also follows the journey of destined slaves who struggle with slavery and sin, political intrigue and personal jealousy, rebellion and submission. Stone Tables is both engrossing adventure and virtuous study of human nature.

title: Thus Spake the Corpse
description: During the turbulent decade of its existence, Andrei Codrescu's exuberant magazine Exquisite Corpse became a hub of engaged dialogue. The magazine was named after Surrealism and contained various themes such as rebellion, passion, polemism, black humor, sedition, and modern culture. In this work, Codrough and Rosenthal bring back the finest essays and poems from artists such revered as Carl Rakosi, James Purdy, Joel Oppenheimer, Robert Creeley, Tom Clark, Thomas Cole, Stephen Crailland to achieve great heights in 1888.

title: The John Adams Reader
description: The first-ever full-length English book on the music of John Adams is a collection of 59 essays, which includes reprints by critics and musicologists. Additionally, new interviews with Adams, his collaborators, collaboratorn, and performers, as well as program and liner notes on his works from 1978 to 2005, are also included.

title: Insurgency & Terrorism
description: Enhanced form

title: Shattered Sword
description: This volume, which focuses on the Japanese perspective and relies on Japanese sources, is the first significant contribution to the West's understanding of Midway in more than a generation.

title: Strawberry Shortcake Murder
description: The head judge of Hartland Flour's Dessert Bake-Off, Hannah Swenson, is responsible for the show. However, when a rival judge is murdered, she must search through numerous individuals to uncover whoever might be behind the murder.

title: Bound in Blood
description: Jean-Luc "Jack" Courbet, an art critic turned vampire, kills every man he meets after his sexual encounters but confronts his past and those who want him to be destroyed with the help of his new love, actor Claude Halloran.

title: Managers Not MBAs
description: A McGill University professor discusses the impact of MBA programs on managerial skills and proposes ways to enhance academic business education.

title: Bright Purple
description: When Ramona becomes aware of her best friend's homosexuality in grade school, she finds it difficult to engage in a civil conversation about it within her community and church.

title: Parenting with Love and Logic
description: Cline and Fay suggest that parents can raise children who are self-assured, engaged, and ready for the world by educating them on responsibility and the logic of life, which will enable them to tackle their own problems at any age.

title: Echoes of the Soul
description: After praying for a better understanding of worlds beyond this one on Palm Sunday, Echo Bodine embarked on an incredible journey through life, death, and beyond. Her beautiful words and poetic imagery transport readers through unfamiliar realms filled with hope and wonder, leaving them in the familiar but unexplored world of Echoes of the Soul.

title: The Gift
description: A renowned psychic asserts that being psychic is a gift of the spirit that we all possess, and it helps to dispel common fears about psychics, such as questions like "Are you able to be christian and become psychopathic?" and "Is it safe to communicate with your soul?"

title: The Inner Reaches of Outer Space
description: The second book in the Collected Works of Joseph Campbell series, which is based on a powerful set of lectures given by the "father of modern mythology," proposes that the laws of physics that govern the universe are also present in human consciousness.

title: Myths of Light
description: Campbell's exceptional mind is showcased in this unreleased book, which covers a variety of Asian religions, including myths and metaphors. The volume contains seven lectures and articles on various topics from the ancient Hindu Vedas to Zen koans, Tantric yoga, and the Tibetan Book of the Dead. Campbell uses warm and accessible language to convey complex insights, exploring the details and secrets of his subjects with his usual zeal.

title: The Power of Now
description: The writer reveals the secret to his own existence and the philosophy of being alive in the present.

title: Myth and Reality
description: The primary focus of this renowned research is on global societies, where mythology serves as a blueprint for human behavior and contributes to the meaning and value of life.

title: Live Like a Jesus Freak
description: Spend Today As If It Was Your Last For Anyone Who Has Read Jesus Freaks This book is the next step in your spiritual journey. It features practical ideas for putting your faith into practice, challenging questions to ask about how you can deepen your life, and readings that will help you stay true to yourself. Live Like a Jesus Frak: From beginning to end...it includes everything from believing, praying, worshipping, studying scripture, loving someone who loves you, celebrating another's spirit-bearer, serving, being resurrected by others of those who believe it was

title: Conversations with Don DeLillo
description: Don DeLillo, the author of White Noise and Libra, presents a series of profiles and conversations from 1982 to 2001 that explore various topics such as the differentiation between historical fact and creative imagination, his work habits, media-saturated culture, baseball, Lee Harvey Oswald, novelist's influence on the world, and more.

title: Tim Burton
description: Tim Burton, who began his career as an animator for Disney, made his first feature film directorial debut with the visually stunning, low-budget Pee-Wee's Big Adventure. As it became a blockbuster hit, studios started to trust him with bigger budgets and his vast imagination. His films blend gothic horror, black comedy, and oddball whimsy, often with identical themes.

title: Daisy Bates
description: Daisy Bates (1914-1999) is recognized as the mentor of the Little Rock Nine, the first African American to attend Central High School in LittleRock, Arkansas. She was honored with the Woman of Year in Education award by the Associated Press in 1957 and was the only female recipient of an invitation to speak at the Lincoln Memorial ceremony in the March on Washington in 1963. However, her significance has been disregarded by scholars of civil rights activism.

title: Having a Mary Heart in a Martha World
description: This book is aimed at women who are struggling to find the right balance between work and worship, providing practical tips on how to achieve this goal, relieving stress, and improving service.

title: Dinner With A Perfect Stranger
description: Upon receiving an invitation to dinner with Jesus Christ, Nick Cominsky begins to engage in discussions about family, religion, and faith.

title: Dark Water
description: The mystery that threatens the lives of a jewelry designer and her private investigator, Jake Rikker, is all too familiar to Jake.

title: The Beatles Illustrated Lyrics
description: Presents a compilation of Beatle verses that are illustrated, along with candid interpretations of the songs and their story.

title: The A.B.C. Murders
description: Ascher was identified by A.B.C. Railway's guide before each murder, while Barnard was found strangled in Bexhill and Clarke was killed in Churston.

title: Murder at the Vicarage
description: None of the local residents in St. Mary Mead are taken aback by the discovery of Colonel Protheroe's life, as they were not surprised by his single gunshot wound to the head. It is expected that many people will mourn the loss of this official and hope that he can say good bye.

title: The Body in the Library
description: A library hearth at Grossington Hall is the site where a fashionable blonde woman is found murdered, and Miss Marple investigates her case.

title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
description: A widow's sudden suicide triggers speculation that she killed her first husband, was extorted, and had a secret relationship with the wealthy Roger Ackroyd. The next evening, Ackerroydas son dies in his locked study, but not before is informed that the widow was indeed an unnamed blackmailer. Kings Abbot befriends some of the suspects and it falls to famous detective Hercule Poirot to solve the case.

title: Evil Under the Sun
description: Detective Hercule Poirot is summoned to investigate after a clever stage performer was discovered strangling at an exclusive island resort.

title: Death on the Nile
description: Three beloved Hercule Poirot works by the genre's most esteemed author have been reprinted, reassigned, and rejuvenated. "What more could someone who is an avid reader of mysteries desire?" - stated the New York Times.

title: The Mystery of the Blue Train
description: The classic mystery novel features Ruth Kettering, an American heiress, who is mysteriously killed on the luxurious Blue Train. Sleuth Hercule Poirot must now uncover her hidden life in order to solve the mystery.

title: The Illuminati Papers
description: Robert Anton Wilson's acclaimed Illuminati Papers is now available for purchase. Could this book be the story behind our modern day society?

title: The South Beach Diet
description: An expert in cardiology explains the significance of understanding the glycemic index values of foods and offers a weight-loss program through meal plans and recipes.

title: Mangoes & Curry Leaves
description: Featuring dishes from India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, the book offers readers a taste of the Subcontinent through recipes featuring cashew-coconut meatballs, spicy chickpea fritters, or cumin-coriander beef patties.

title: 1000 Rings
description: An assortment of one thousand exquisite rings from renowned artisans and jewelers is presented in a book filled with inspiring photographs. Original.

title: Artful Paper Dolls
description: A glimpse into the rich history of paper dolls is provided by a multitude of adorable examples that are both manufactured and handmade.

title: International Codes
description: Provides current, comprehensive coverage that establishes minimum standards for building systems through prescriptive and performance-related provisions.

title: International Plumbing Code 2006
description: Provides a comprehensive minimum set of guidelines for plumbing facilities, covering both performance and prescriptive goals, and allows for the inclusion of new and innovative products, materials, or systems.

title: Homelands
description: Featuring contributions from wartime hero Etel Adnan and Agate Nesaule, this beautifully intricate collection of essays merges various viewpoints on "homeland" such as home, nostalgia, longing, and exile.

title: Sukhoi Su-27 Flanker
description: The Su-27 Flanker, a single-seat supersonic interceptor, was designed by Sukhoi OKB and became one of the most successful fighters of its time during the Cold War. It is widely recognized as an unbeatable fighter with impressive range, heavy weaponry, and agility, making it arguably the closest competitor to the newer F-15 aircraft.

title: Hungry Planet
description: A photographic album that showcases the week's worth of food from thirty families from twenty-four countries is available through this publication.

title: Maple Syrup Cookbook
description: The Maple Syrup Cookbook 8-Copy Display is available as ISBN 1580174043.

title: Cider
description: The Pilgrims savvvied up cider while traveling on the Mayflower, with John Adams drinking a bottle of cider every morning for breakfast. Ernest Hemingway enjoyed enjoying ice-cold drinks after his safari experience and Robert Frost expressed his love for beer in 'In A Glass of Cider'.

title: Doyle Brunson's Super System
description: The world's top professional poker players, along with Doyle Brunson and five other experts, provide guidance on how to correctly wager at hold 'em, play 7-stud, and fold. This book is the culmination of over 10,000 hours of dedicated work by David "Chip" Reese, Mike Caro, David Sklansky, Joey Hawthorne und former world champion Bobby Baldwin.

title: The Red Badge of Courage
description: The first encounter with the American Civil War is marked by a young Union soldier who struggles to come to terms with his fear and conflicting emotions about war. This edition features Crane's short sequel, The veteran.

title: Sun Tzu
description: The Art of War for Managers includes the strategic principles of Sun Tzu and incorporates them into your management style.

title: Please Stop Laughing At Me
description: Jodee Blanco's book chronicles how school became a source of fear and pain, where threats, humiliation, and assault were as common as bubblegum and lip-stick.

title: The Stephen King Universe
description: The world of Roland is now home to all the other creations of Stephen King, as he has come to realize that they are all part of one universe.

title: New York 2000
authors: Robert A. M. Stern;David Fishman;Jacob Tilove
description: New York 2000 celebrates international architects such as Sir Norman Foster, Cesar Pelli, Richard Meier, and Renzo Piano by conducting geographically organized surveys of their work.

title: Glass House
description: Philip Johnson's Glass House, a private sanctuary in the tranquil New England countryside that is owned by the National Trust for Historic Preservation, is an iconic representation of modern architecture. The property has been converted into opulent sculptures over the past 40 years and will be open to visitors in April 2007.

title: The Hidden Smile of God
description: In "Comforting God," the author discusses three early Christians- William Cowper, John Bunyan, and David Brainerd-whose words and examples illustrate how their belief in adversity motivates us to trust in God's sovereignty even when we face our own challenges.

title: The Gospel According to Job
description: This book is intended for Christians who are in a state of intense suffering and disconnected from God, as they may feel like Job when they read selected passages from the Bible.

title: Prophet
description: Anchorman John Barrett is aware of something happening. The story doesn't align with his beliefs. Despite experiencing profound spiritual experiences, he eventually uncovers an unsettling narrative about abortion that no one wants to hear.

title: Piercing the Darkness
description: In Bacon's Corner, a small farming community, Sally Beth Roe was forced to flee for her life after an attempted murder, two counts of misidentification, and one lawsuit against reformed Christian schools.

title: This Present Darkness
description: A meditating minister and an indecisive journalist exchange secrets, engaged in a battle to dominate humanity.

title: The Passion of Jesus Christ
description: The Bible's explanation for Jesus' death is rooted in the belief that God was His Son, not because of his suffering.

title: When I Don't Desire God
description: For more than 25 years, John Piper has been advocating for Christian Hedonism, which posits that God is most content in us when we are satisfied in him. However, some individuals have found this truth to be both liberating and devastating. It supports our natural yearning towards happiness while it exposes us to the reality that we don't desire God the way we love Him. What do you do when you discover this?

title: Suffering and the Sovereignty of God
description: John Piper and other authors examine the various forms of God's sovereignty in his Word, enabling readers to develop a biblical understanding of suffering.

title: The Legacy of Sovereign Joy
description: The lives of Augustine, Luther, and Calvin demonstrate the perfect God's grace and glory in the imperfections of his servants.

title: When the Darkness Will Not Lift
description: John Piper approaches depression from a spiritual standpoint, providing guidance and support to those who cannot seem happy.

title: Face Off
description: Discover the fastest and most exciting way to draw comical faces on a daily basis with Face Off. Caricaturist Harold Hamernik offers 40 demonstrations that teach you how to create playful and expressive likenesses. You'll also learn to develop your own unique style. From eyes to lips, mouths, eyes in this activity, plus more detail will be covered.

title: Simply Beautiful Beaded Jewelry
description: Those who love beaded jewelry will appreciate Simply Beautiful Beaded Jewelry, a book that features 50 projects and variations of designer Heidi Boyd's signature style. The book is packed with projects that showcase the materials, techniques, and other essentials for creating your own unique statement necklace, bracelet, or earring.

title: The Southern Haunting of Truman Capote
description: The Southern Haunting of Truman Capote offers a thoughtful examination of the literary roots of Capodo's works, as well as those associated with his early fiction.

title: Shoofly Pie
description: The Bug Man, or forensic entomologist known as Nick Petty, is hired by Kathryn Guilford, who is terrified of bugs, to solve her friend's death. When Polchak discovers the mystery of how her husband was killed years before, he and his client are on the run from someone who will do whatever it takes to keep secrets.

title: Chop Shop
description: Intern forensic pathologist Dr. Riley McKay has detected irregularities in autopsies at the Allegheny County Coroner's lab. She suspects that this is due to an unusual twist in events and seeks assistance from Dr." Nick Polchak, the "bug man" who can use his expertise to solve murders by examining the insects on victims' bodies. Nick and Riley discover a sinister connection between the lab'

title: Schott's Original Miscellany
description: Despite being impossible to read in one sitting, Schott's Original Miscellany is an uncomplicated source of fascinating trivia. What other book contains an index that includes shoelace lengths, sign language, and the seven deadly sins?

title: Soldiers of Salamis
description: In a historical novel set in the Spanish Civil War era, Rafael Snchez Mazas is confronted with evacues from his executioners and run into the forest where an unknown soldier finds him alive.

title: The Line of Beauty
description: The author of The Swimming-Pool Library reprints Nick Guest's account of his life as a twenty-year-old boy who was caught up in the attention of the wealthy and politically connected Fedden family during their stay in their Notting Hill home in 1983.

title: A Year in the Merde
description: A young British man brought back from Paris by a French company to establish his own series of British tea rooms is recounted in this entertaining book, detailing his experiences dealing with laziness at work, an arrogant boss, vain girlfriends and the culture of France. Reprint.

title: Safety Behind Bars
description: Despite his aspirations of becoming a defensible stronghold, Rick Grimes and his associates encounter four zombies before making peace with them.

title: The Best Defense
description: Despite Rick's efforts to rescue a crashed helicopter, he realizes that fewer than 100 people have been involved in their attack. Meanwhile, the group is working to restore electricity at the prison by siphoning off gasoline from abandoned cars in the parking lot.

title: Fell
description: In a city filled with empty garbage, Detective Richard Fell is transported across the bridge to Snowtown. Despite his initial confusion, he holds onto the truth that everyone is hiding something.

title: The Walking Dead
description: Some human survivors, along with police officer Rick Grimes, are battling against decomposing zombies.

title: A Complicated Kindness
description: A teenage girl who is a loser and has her family divided by fundamentalist Christianity balances hope and sadness in this coming-of-age novel. She spends her days unraveling the mystery of why her mother and sister left, leaving her alone and struggling to make sense of her circumstances.

title: D.H. Lawrence
description: A narrative that portrays Lawrence's life, from his awkward childhood in Nottinghamshire to his sudden death at the age of 44, and his turbulent relationship with Frieda and years of exile abroad, is one of the most radical and misunderstood writers of this era.

title: The Horizontal World
description: The poignant autobiography of a time when she was raised on dynastic North Dakota farmland, where her family had been employed for generations, recounts her struggle to escape the hardships of childhood, her connection with and reverence for her father, and the role that place plays in shaping one's sense of self.

title: Write Great Fiction - Plot & Structure
description: Discuss how plot can contribute to the development of an engaging plot? What are the distinctions between plotting in fiction? How do you rework your plot or structure? With Write Great Fiction: Plot & Structure, award-winning author James Scott Bell provides practical tips and easy-to-understand strategies for creating a captivating story.

title: Lithium for Medea
description: Examines the strained relationships between a woman and her emotionally unstable mother, her terminally malnourished father, an ex-partner who is fixated on Star Trek, and Jason, whom she considers physically attractive but manipulative. Reprint.

title: 9-11 [neuf-onze]
authors: Noam Chomsky;Institute Professor & Professor of Linguistics (Emeritus) Noam Chomsky
description: Provides a series of interviews conducted in the first month after the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, that examine the reactions of both domestic and foreign actors, U.S. foreign policy, and the new war on terrorism.

title: The Hip Chick's Guide to Macrobiotics
description: Explains the health benefits of a macrobiotic diet and offers practical advice on how to strengthen the body and mind by consuming high-quality whole foods, along with cooking tips and recipes.

title: Rumble Fish
description: A play written and performed by S. E. Hinton, featuring two brothers who struggle to find their identity and acceptance within the gangs.

title: Posing for Portrait Photography
description: By focusing on the head, shoulders, arms, hands, bust, waist, hips, thighs, and feet, Jeff Smith demonstrates certain techniques for achieving flattering results. He emphasizes the importance of creating images that sell themselves, fixing common figure issues and designing poses that look natural to clients.

title: Healthy Cooking for IBS
description: One hundred delicious recipes, showcasing breakfast items and snacks for Irritablebowel Syndrome (IBS), are created by an esteemed chef and dietitian team members. The menu includes dishes that are perfect for any meal from breakfast, soup or salad to desserts, and include information on the illness and nutritional information.

title: Homeless
description: With the assistance of Dr. Mac, Sunita and other volunteers at the Wild at Heart veterinary clinic join forces to rescue a group of feral and abandoned cats from being taken away.

title: Teacher's Pet
description: The introduction of Maggie's new biology teacher, who is blind, can teach her some things about working with his guide dog, making it easier for the twelve-year-old to adjust to middle school.

title: The Fateful Adventures of the Good Soldier Švejk During the World War  Book One
description: This survival strategy is one of the most unique and successful ever conceived. Joseph Heller credits The Good Soldier vejk for inspiring him to write his American novel Catch-22. Catch 22 is the only Czech book that has been included in the 100 Best Books of 20th Century lists, which was a new translation by Zdenek K Sadlon and Emmett M. Joyce.

title: Childhood Shadows
description: In the Ring of Challenge, the people of Scerone were encircled with hopes of witnessing the passing of their beloved Amulet from one Guardian to another and the fulfillment of an ancient prophecy. However, betrayal and subterfuge caused chaos in their world, leading to the imprisonment of this powerful talisman.

title: Sophocles: the Theban Plays
description: Focus Classical Library has translated three volumes of Sophocles' Oidipous Cycle into English, including King Oydipus, Oodipously at Colonus and Antigone, along with notes and essays to aid in understanding Greek culture.

title: Aristophanes' Acharnians
description: The English version of Aristophanes' witty indictment against war, with an introduction essay and informative notes, provides biographical information on the play's authorship, production history, and suggested reading materials.

title: M is for Mayflower
description: Provides a list of Massachusetts's state names in alphabetical order.

title: O Is for Old Dominion
description: Delves into the history and origins of Virginia, providing information on the historical significance of each letter in the alphabet.

title: The Age of Access
description: Discusses the shifts in American business and demonstrates how accessing experiences is crucial for businesses to gain power.

title: In Search of Captain Zero
description: A surfer, photojournalist, and author recounts his two-year journey from Mexico to Central America in search of his long-time friend and surfing companion, Christopher Conner.

title: Think and Grow Rich
description: The latest version of the best-selling guide includes stories from modern figures like Bill Gates, Dave Thomas, and Sir John Templeton, highlighting how their experiences can help readers achieve wealth and overcome personal obstacles.

title: How to Save Your Own Life
description: Isadora Wing, who has been married twice and authored a best-selling novel, revisits the different phases of her life with Bennett, discovering true love, adventure, and sexual fulfillment in southern California.

title: Parachutes & Kisses
description: Despite her current struggles with divorce, parenthood, and unexpected suitors, Isadora Wing remains deeply in love with Berkeley Sproul III. She asks for some insight into the sincerity of their relationship.

title: Fear of Fifty
description: The celebrated author of Fear of Flying discusses the significant shifts that her era has experienced in areas such as dating, marriage, monogamy, lust, love, and sexual activity. Reprint.

title: Any Woman's Blues
description: Fear of Flying's bestselling author, Leila, is haunted by the betrayal of a younger man who inspires her with her talent and passion. She is convinced that giving up love, sex, alcohol, and hedonism will make her less creative.

title: What Do Women Want?
description: What Do Women Want? is a new book by Erica Jong that features twenty-six essays, each of which is written with varying degrees of honesty and nuanced content.

title: The Book of Leviathan
description: The metaphysical nature of childhood cognition, astronomy, order and chaos, and sibling rivalry are explored in comics, as is the idea of cats taking over from parents.

title: The Arabian Nightmare
description: Balian, an English espionage operative from Norwich, journeys to medieval Cairo and becomes involved in a sequence of bizarre plots and sexual encounters.

title: Laughing Gas
description: There are countless enthusiasts of P. G. Wodehouse's comedic talent, who are convinced of his exceptional skill in exchanging jokes. In the movie Laughing Gas, a disinterested Hollywood youngster and an English nobleman engage in bloodshed-based banter, creating transnational violence at its most intense.

title: Meet Mr. Mulliner
description: At the bar, Mr. Mulliner entertains patrons with tales of his siblings and cousins.

title: This Is Berlin
description: Reissues the author's daily CBS radio broadcasts from 1948-1949, which detailed the aggressive steps Germany took towards World War II, presenting them as America and being heard by the rest of the world.

title: The Stones of Summer
description: The debut novel by Dow Mossman, which was initially praised for its stunning cover art and received great critical acclaim, became wildly popular after almost two decades. It also served as inspiration for Mark Moskowitz's documentary film Stone Reader, later known throughout the country and described by Peter Rainer in New York magazine as "a marvelous literary thriller that explores how books can stay with us forever."

title: Spring Fever
description: P. G. Wodehouse, a comic writer, has released four more antic novels this autumn. In Picadilly Jim, Jimmy Crocker is haunted by scandal and must face the consequences of losing his wife on both sides of the Atlantic. Uneasy Money follows Lord Dawlish as he attempts to escape to America to make tens of millions, while Spring Fever is satirical in terms of love and complications.

title: Money in the Bank
description: When George, the sixth Viscount Uffenham, turns the family fortune into diamonds and hides them, he forgets where a hidden loot was stored and must leave the house to remain before establishing Mrs. Cork's Health Colony.

title: Anthony Powell
description: Michael Barber's first full-length biography of Anthony Powell takes a close look at the man and writer, finding that "his temperament was often at odds with his childhood."

title: The Warrior Prophet
description: The sequel to The Darkness That Comes Before follows the story of Anasûrimbor Kellhus, a formidable logician-monk who witnesses the endtime events of the Holy War that threaten his world.

title: The Various Haunts of Men
description: Following a string of disappearances on 'a foggy, peaceful area of the cathedral town of "the Hill," dedicated young policewoman Freya Graffham and enigmatic detective Chief Inspector Simon Serrailler follow dozens of clues in an attempt to piece together the mind of gangsters.

title: The Unmasking of Oscar Wilde
description: Describes the life of Oscar Wilde, including his career as an author, his interest in Catholicism, and his imprisonment for a homosexual affair.

title: The American Heritage New History of the Civil War
description: The Civil War is portrayed in more than 800 contemporary photographs, sketches, paintings, and maps, with narratives by Bruce Catton and first-person accounts from both males and females who witnessed the war.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (SparkNotes Literature Guide)
description: Get ready to score your "A" with these popular study guides from Harvard University.

title: The Aristotle's Ethics
description: Highly significant, whose influence on Western philosophy endures to this day. Aristotle defines the purpose of life as joy and discusses its attainment through the contemplation of philosophical truths.

title: The Big Book of Boy Stuff
description: A book that covers everything from fostering creativity to exercising and leaving the television on his own is essential for any boy aged nine or thirteen. It also includes engaging chapters on gross things, magic, emergencies, games, experiments, jokes, activities, insults... and more.

title: It's Easy Being Green
description: Elaborates on the process of achieving greener living and identifying earth-friendly products, shopping for sustainable products online, engaging in online activism, and learning about various eco-conscious practices.

title: Fifty-One Tales
description: Lord Dunsany was a prominent writer of fantasy fiction during the 20th century. "Fifty-One Tales" (originally published in 1915 and occasionally reprinted under the name "The Food of Death") is renowned for its accurate depiction of his writing.

title: The Well at the World's End
description: William Morris's The Well at the Worlds End is one of the earliest works of his nature, an epic romance of duplicity, machination, passion, and wizardry. It is a rich fantasy and opulent fairy tale without fairies, making it the most captivating of all his late romances. Morris writes his magical love story with elven voices.

title: The Lure of the Basilisk
description: The overman, Garth, was seeking immortality and the oracle advised him to serve the Forgotten King. However, he was directed towards a basilisk that could turn men insane due to its powerful gaze. What rationale is there for someone to be so desperate in pursuit of such savage creatures?

title: On the Lines of Morris' Romances
description: J. R. Tolkien credited William Morris with being the inspiration for his writing. This book presents two of Shakespeare's most famous tales in a low-cost, broad, and two-column format.

title: Guide to Stress Reduction
description: We are all susceptible to the exhaustion and anxiety that come with living in the 21st century, and we all have headaches, backaches, or insomnia as a result. Dr. L. John Mason is renowned for his work as an expert in stress reduction through the original GUIDE TO STRESS REDUCTION, which has helped thousands of readers overcome this excruciating illness and return to their relaxed lifestyle.

title: Heart and Hands
description: HEART & HANDS, a guide for midwives and parents dedicated to midwifery care, has been revised from cover to cover for its 40th year. The updated material emphasizes the importance of being an independent midwer and examining the physiological basis of birth, as well as the art of nonintervention. Midwife Elizabeth Davis provides practical tips on how to turn breech and posterior babies, mediate pain in labor, and support newborn physiology. Additionally, she offers helpfulhints on postpartum recovery, including some tips about early and caring hands, so as identifying interventions

title: Isis
description: She had already been possessed by spirits of the dead before she heard about Harrow, the legendary house of horrors of what is now New York City. At nineteen years old, a highwayman from hell came for her soul and took her into 'a world of ecstasy and mind' Isis Claviger: The first tale of I amuse bouche in an original novel by Douglas Clegg, "Is

title: Tolkien and C.S. Lewis
description: Describes the intimate relationship between the two literary friends, noting their joint studies at Oxford University, Lewis's contribution to Tolkien'd writing of The Lord of the Rings, and the differences in their personalities and faith. Original.

title: Tomie
description: Tomie's teacher, Mr. Takagi, is shocked to learn that she and his child are pregnant, prompting him to murder her and have the class help him dispose of her body in various places.

title: Category Freaks
description: The creator of Aquarian Age, Asagi Nanami, is the director of Nanamega Paranormal Investigations. He leads his team of supernatural assistants Naoki Amano, Tokiko, and Mahime Yoshino in solving peculiar phenomena caused by |Freaks|. Freak masters are demonic entities with a mysterious agenda that can only be found at home or traveled around Japan.

title: The Pirate Dictionary
description: We hear the phrases avoid, hit the deck, don't rock the boat, and hold a grudge. Pirate crews lived aboard ships for months or even years, but their origins were not widely known until recently. Land lubbers, who were very clumsy and easily transported, adopted this term as an idiom.

title: This Side of Paradise
description: Jack Barrett discovers a sinister plot that endangers all he loves after his father moves the family to Paradise to work for the Eden Corporation.

title: Farewell to Salonica
description: Thessaloniki, once a hub of Eastern and Western civilization, was an oasis in the middle of polarized Turkish territory. It was part of the Ottoman Empire until 1912, but it was also renowned for its cultural significance as ecclesiastical buildings. Leon Sciaky, the son of Sephardic merchants who came to Turkey during the Spanish Inquisition, recounts his upbringing in this vibrant community.

title: The Art of H. P. Lovecraft's the Cthulhu Mythos
description: The Call of Cthulhu collectible card game by Fantasy Flight and the Chaosium role-playing game products from 25 years ago are all featured in this full-color volume, including glimpses of the most horrific beings ever known, whose names are whispered or spoken of.

title: Creative Correction
description: Whelchel's handy reference guide not only provides guidance on topics such as sibling conflict and lying, but also offers biblical insights and practical advice for parents who are feeling stressed.

title: De Vita Propria Liber
description: Known as a prominent figure in the Italian Renaissance, Girolamo Cardano was an internationally-acclaimed voyeurist, physician, and natural philosopher who also invented modern algebra and created the universal joint. He was condemned to house arrest by the Inquisition in his old age but later wrote The Book of My Life, which is replete with unfiltered information about his character and conduct, including his sex life practices, diet, academic rivals' activities, meetings with supernatural beings, or his intimate relationships with women.

title: Witch Grass
description: A man in a Parisian cafe is seen with an unfamiliar person on the train, prompting him to question his identity and wonder how he manages to survive. This leads to recurring comical encounters among various untrustworthy and charming individuals within the dark borough of the city's fringes. Witch Grass (previously known as The Bark Tree) is characterized by its philosophical parody, epic comedy, and mesmerizing book.

title: The Tenants of Moonbloom
description: Norman Moonbloom is a failure, an ex-elite who can't even make it out as livin' in Manhattan. His brother, slumlord, hires him to take on the task of collecting rent in his own apartment complexes; from left to right, Heston Clark faces dozens and Thousands of brilliantly described urban figures that vary from manly to luxury: gay jazz musician with sideline as gigolo; Holocaust survivor; young black male model for James Baldwin (Murry country) while he goes to town.

title: The Ivory Tower
description: The Ivory Tower, Henry James' final book in his series, was a major work that explored the immense new fortunes of America's Gilded Age, with much to his surprise.

title: Mistress Masham's Repose
description: A ten-year-old girl named Maria, who was once an orphaned heiress and lives with her unsavory guardians on a dilapidated English estate called Malplaquet, undergoes unexpected changes in her life when she explores an overgrown island on the estate's lake and discovers Gulliver'S descendants.

title: Hons and Rebels
description: This "wonderfully funny and very poignant" autobiography (by Philip Toynbee) provides Mitford with a fascinating glimpse into the peculiar upbringing of her celebrity family.

title: An Episode of Sparrows
description: A pair of hardy children in post-World War II London attempt to create a covert garden is an act that awakens hidden bravery in their community and significantly distorts the local atmosphere.

title: The Man who Watched Trains Go by
description: A man who has lived a life of good and ethical conduct for most of his life discovers in one fateful evening that his world is unraveling and he commits murder, which seems to contradict his entire life.

title: The New York Stories of Henry James
description: Represents for the first time all the accounts that Henry James narrates about New York City, including "The Jolly Corner," "An International Episode," and "Imprisoned in Times Square."

title: Dime-store Alchemy
description: Charles Simic's book, Dime-Store Alchemy, recounts the life and work of Joseph Cornell, a surrealist artist who is revered throughout America for his mysterious boxes of found artifacts.

title: The Strangers in the House
description: Loversat has lived as an unloved person due to his dirty, drunken, and uninvited wife abandoning him and their daughter eighteen years ago. Despite being part of wealthy parents in the area, he now avoids polite society and enjoys reading books at night while drinking Bordeaux with his family.

title: A Savage War of Peace
description: Despite the fact that war was never officially declared, the Algerian War took place between 1954 and 1962. It resulted in the downfall of six French governments, overthrown the Fourth Republic, restored De Gaulle's authority, and nearly triggered a civil war on French soil. The conflict claimed the lives of more than 200,000 Muslim Algeriars, as well as forcing many European settlers into exile. Additionally, it was marked by an unholy alliance of revolutionary violence and state torture, appearing at the time like affrontered off.

title: Diary of a Man in Despair
authors: Fritz Percy Reck-Malleczewen;Friedrich Reck;Paul Rubens;Richard J. Evans
description: The original publication was published by Macmillan Company in New York in 1970.

title: The Wave in the Mind
description: The author presents a collection of nonfiction literature, featuring essays on topics such as Tolstoy, Tokien, women's shoes, Mark Twain, family life, beauty, and autobiographical writings and contemplation on the arts of reading and writing.

title: Healing Emotions
description: The new edition documents discussions between the Dalai Lama and prominent western psychologists, physicians, and meditation teachers to gain knowledge about the mind's ability to heal the body.

title: A Guide to the Words of My Perfect Teacher
description: This guide offers readers the essential theoretical background for studying and practicing with words of wisdom from the book Patrol Rinpoche, Words of My Perfect Teacher. The author provides a detailed overview of the teacher's role in Tibetan Buddhist practice as they move through the Buddha'S teachings on the Four Noble Truths, concluding with an endnote that briefly summarises the stages of their development.

title: Dewdrops on a Lotus Leaf
description: One of the most beloved poets in Asian literature is Ryokan, a Japanese poet-reclusive poet who is known for his exquisite verses, exquisite calligraphy, and eccentric personality. His poems are so simple that they defy convention by emphasizing pure Zen spirit. Just like Thoreau, Ryoka's poems celebrate nature and the natural world; yet their content encompasses everything about how people feel: happiness and sorrow, optimism and fear, love and loneliness. This compilation of translations represents various aspects of such as those from Odaks.

title: Lovingkindness
description: Sharon Salzberg, a highly regarded spiritual teacher in America, offers insight into the Buddhist path of metta and how it can help us discover the radiant, joyful heart within ourselves. She draws on basic Buddhist principles, wisdom from various traditions, guided meditation practices, and her own experience to illustrate how we can cultivate love, compassion, joy, or equanimity in traditional Buddhism.

title: Making a Change for Good
description: Huber's latest book explores the concept of self-improvement, exploring different ways to change oneself, such as changing our eating habits, shopping habits or engaging in meditation practices. She notes that many people believe that only improving ourselves can bring about happiness, and this is contradictory.

title: The Art of War
description: Sun-tzu's "The Art of War," which dates back to the 6th century BC, is one of the oldest books on war and military strategy. It offers leaders guidance on tactics, troop management, terrain planning, and tactical tactics. Most importantly, it teaches how to anticipate and take control of battles, making it an essential tool for winning matches and catching adversaries.

title: Writing Down the Bones
description: In this updated version of the guide, Goldberg's insightfulness, humor, and practicality serve as a source of inspiration for writers and writers who are considering writing.

title: Fablehaven
description: Upon their arrival at their grandparents' estate, Kendra and Seth are met with the unexpected discovery that it is filled with magic and evil.

title: The Dream Giver
description: A contemporary parable demonstrates how individuals can pursue their aspirations and overcome obstacles that hinder their ability to live the life they envisioned.

title: The Treasure Principle
description: The secret to spiritual transformation is joyful giving, as discovered by bestselling author Randy Alcorn. Jesus' formula for achieving kingdom impact guarantees immediate pleasure and eternal rewards.

title: The Blazing Center Study Guide
description: God is the center of reality, and He invites you to worship Him with all His love, as He knows that only Himself will bring happiness.

title: Reluctant Burglar
description: Given that Desiree's father was an art thief, is it feasible for her to keep the family business running, seek after her heavenly Father, refrain from making death threats, and put faith in FBI Special Agent Tony Lucano?

title: Reluctant Runaway
description: Does it happen by chance that Karen Webb vanishes just one day before Indian artifacts are stolen? The security consultant, Desiree Jacobs, and her FBI agent boyfriend are working together to save Karen's life.

title: Sense and Sensuality
description: Why is the world so full of pleasures if we are not supposed to get them? Ravi Zacharias's humorous dialogue features Oscar Wilde asking Jesus Christ why.

title: Effigies
description: Faye Longchamp and Joe Wolf Mantooth have been to Neshoba County, Mississippi, to excavate a site near Nanih Waiya, the sacred mound where the Choctaw people are believed to have originated. They were disappointed by this archaeologist's request to investigate an ancient Native American mounder, but they feel hurt when he attempts to crush the large relic.

title: Complete Guide to OneNote
description: The potential for OneNote to become the next "killer-app" in the Microsoft Office family is evident from its author's public visibility and advanced content, which will differentiate it from many beginner-level texts.

title: Joel on Software
description: This collection features three years of top-notch essays that span from technical to humorous, yet always real. *Excellently written and timely. **Google's "Joel on Software" includes 183,000 links. Spolsky is one of the most popular programmers in the world, with a large fan base.

title: The Career Programmer
description: The software development industry is known for its unimaginable schedules, unstable releases, constant overtime, and high stress levels. Unlike traditional career paths like accounting or administration, programmers who are as creative and passionate about their work as artists can also find satisfaction in the process. However, many programers and project managers enter the business world and discover that internal politics, inept management, undying marketing, rather than a structured approach based on technical issues and quality, results in an uphill battle. This guidebook, provided with all the necessary resources, is highly recommended.

title: Bull Halsey
description: Adm. William F. Halsey, a highly respected American figure during World War II, was both admired by the public and his fellow soldiers. His unapologetic demeanor earned him the nickname "Bull" but he also demonstrated genuine compassion for his troops and led them to victory in the Pacific. Although hesitant to accept any praise, Halsburg eventually came to trust the unconventional story of swashbuckling that surrounded him.

title: Inuyasha Ani-Manga
description: A teenage girl goes back to medieval Japan to assist Inu Yasha, a half-human dog, in discovering an orb of immense power.

title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
description: The God Warrior, a biotechnological monster from the war known as the Seven Days of Fire, and Princess Nausicaä are on opportune time to seal away the terrible weapons inside the Crypt of Shuwa. Regrettably, no one seems to be willing to let Nauseáä refuse her mission, including the guard who kept the crypt in such pristine condition!

title: Hardball
description: Leaders enter into the realm of hardball competition, where players are passionately committed to victory and driven by the desire to strengthen their competitive positions. This creates a positive cycle that puts them out in the mix of competitors' hearts and minds. Stalk and Lachenauer have been instrumental in educating companies for over two decades on how they can achieve decisive wins without going against legal or moral rules, without having to break any commitments made to customers or stakeholders. These companies often play aggressively without admitting liability.

title: Crash Course in Web Design for Libraries
description: A guidebook provides guidance on developing user-friendly library websites without the use of HTML and outlines the advantages and disadvantages of commercial software.

title: Demon Diary
description: The Demon Lord Krayon challenges Eclipse and his master, Raenef, to prove their loyalty by seeking the assistance of the noble demon, Eclipse.

title: Crescent Moon
description: In this fabled adventure, Mahiru is forced to confront the forces that are awakened by the dark moon.

title: $30 Film School
description: This entertaining guide offers step-by-step guidance on making a film using DV cameras and computers, as well as tips on how to market and sell one's finished product, along with downloadable materials such as sample movies, lessons, interviews, trailers, and other essential tools.

title: Tuf Voyaging
description: Unacknowledged

title: The Canterville Ghost
description: Filmed many times, this timeless classic by Oscar Wilde depicts an American family purchasing a British mansion with ghostly details that still excite new generations.

title: The Greatest Sailing Stories Ever Told
description: Sir Ernest Shackleton, Joshua Slocum, and WIlliam F. Buckley are all renowned sailing yarns.

title: From Baghdad  with Love
description: Demonstrates the story of Marine Jay Kopelman's endeavor to have Lava, a dog discovered in Fallujah, repatriated to the United States, while simultaneously emphasizing Iraqi political corruption, miltary bureaucracy, and the suffering of ordinary Iraqis who are now victims of the war.

title: Here  There and Everywhere
description: During the production of "Revolver," "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band," and other albums, an engineer who worked with the Beatles describes how he was approached by the band and shares his insights into their creative process.

title: Natural Theology
description: This second edition of 'Nature and Grace,' featuring Karl Barth as the author, brings one of the most significant 20th-century theological arguments back into mainstream theology. The conflict over the point of contact for the gospel in relation to natural man is highlighted by Brunner, who asserts that their task was to find a way back to nihilistic nature.

title: LogoLounge
description: Logos, which are used in a variety of industries such as food, fashion, and conferences, are highly valued by designers. The logo lounge website, launched in hardcover last year, was the first in an ongoing series that celebrated the work of top logo designers from around the globe. This book, now available in paperback, highlights the contributions of both established and emerging designers who have made significant contributions to the industry.

title: The Complete Idiot's Guide to World Religions
description: Provides a summary of the major religions across the globe, along with details on their history, customs, festivals, regulations, holy scriptures and deities.

title: Drop the Rock
description: Revealing the flaws in characters that hinder real and joyful recovery is a practical approach.

title: Angels and Demons
description: Born in 1975, Craig Thompson grew up in a small farming community in Wisconsin and won his first graphic novel Good-Bye, Chunky Rice, which won the 1999 Harvey Award for "Best New Talent," with his sophomore album, the 500-page Blankets, set to be released by Top Shelf Productions in summer 2003.

title: Hellsing
description: Announces the Hellsing Organization, a covert group created by the family of Hellstein to safeguard England and the Protestant church from vampires and other creatures, and its chief member, Alucard.

title: Star Wars: Clone Wars Volume 6: On the Fields of Battle
authors: John Ostrander;Jan Duursema;Dan Parsons; Brad Anderson; Tomas Giorello
description: From the Bounty Hunters' Guild's space-station headquarters to untamed worlds on the edge of the galaxy, the Jedi must navigate the Clone Wars. Mace Windu leads an elite strike force against trained killers in a display of Jedi power and resolve. Aayla Secura must confront her former Master in an effort to retrieve the plans for resurrecting their weapon that has already destroyed one world. Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker must collaborate with rogue Jedi Knights of Starkley under Deckham by Blizzard

title: Star Wars: Empire Volume 5
description: In this collection, Luke Skywalker and a shipwrecked Clone War veteran battle it out, Han Solo falls into obscurity after flirting with an old flame, and BoShek attracts both Rebels and Imperials with lots of blaster fire.

title: Star Wars: Clone Wars Volume 8: The Last Siege  The Final Truth
authors: John Ostrander;Jan Duursema;Dan Parsons; Brad Anderson; Tom√É¬•s Giorello
description: Even though they have suffered significant losses in the Clone Wars, the Separatists still face a daunting challenge: on the desert planet of Saleucami, Dark Jedi Sora Bulq has been creating an army of Morgukai killers under the surface of the Outer Rim planet. With so much new information at hand, it's not going anywhere and the Jedi are forced to endure ten months worth of siege after being caught up in terrorism.

title: Eden
description: Following a devastating virus outbreak, humanity is caught between the customs and practices of the past and modern times. Elijah and his fellow soldiers aim to cross mountains across Mexico's Andes region, with Aeon soldiers and armored personnel following behind.

title: Museum of Terror
description: Japanese manga artist Junji Ito is a leading creator of horror comics, and his latest release, Museum of Terror, is an incredible collection of heartwarming tales. The series features charming characters and strong emotions, as well as some of the finest Japanese comic art.

title: Conan and the Demons of Khitai
authors: Akira Yoshida;Paul Lee;Robert Ervin Howard;Pat Lee
description: King Conan of Dark Horse accepts the invitation to trade precious gems and spices with the Eastern kingdom of Khitai, but is hesitant to do so due to fear of dangerous consequences.

title: Star Wars: Clone Wars Volume 9: Endgame
authors: John Ostrander;Welles Hartley;Jan Duursema; Doug Wheatley; Dan Parsons; Brad Anderson; Chris Chuckry; Tomas Giorello
description: Witness the untold tales of the Jedi who fought against Emperor Palpatine in Revenge of The Sith! Additionally, observe Darth Vader's Jedi purge during his quest to capture Obi-Wan Kenobi! In the jungles surrounding Kashyyoyk, Quinlan Vos battles his way to victory over his loyal guardians on the Outer Rim world of Toola.

title: Star Wars: OmnibusXWing Rogue Squadron Vol. 2
description: As the Empire declines and the New Republic grows, a group of elite warriors takes on the most important duties to gain freedom from the oppressive Rogue Squadron. This massive volume, which includes Battleground Tatooine, The Warrior Princess, and Requiem, provides comprehensive insights into keeping XWing RPG Squadrons at bay, safeguarding their weapons or brokering peace in areas where Jabba the Hutt's would-be enemies are undeterred.

title: Star Wars: Empire Volume 6 In The Shadows of Their Fathers
authors: Thomas Andrews;Scott Allie;Adriana Melo; Michael LaCombe; Joe Corroney
description: In a story about Princess Leia, Darth Vader, and the destiny of Xora's planet, Luke Skywalker confronts the legacy of his unknown father!

title: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic Vol. 1--Commencement
authors: John Jackson Miller;Brian Ching;Travel Foreman; Travis Charest
description: Padawan Zayne Carrick will find new allies in his desperate quest to escape from the clutches of Luke Skywalker and secure his release from their mastermind, who is now on trial for murdering every Jedi-in-training member.

title: Facts in the Case of the Departure of Miss Finch HC
description: Come and discover the strange and gruesome story of Miss Finch, an unknown woman betrayed by mystery and abduction in London. Neil Gaiman collaborated with Michael Zulli (Creatures of the Night, The Sandman) to bring you yet another stunning hardcover graphic novel.

title: Star Wars: Empire Volume 7--The Wrong Side of the War
authors: Welles Hartley;Davide Fabbri;Christian DallaVecchia; David Michael Beck
description: After being transported from Jabiim to Kalist VI, Lieutenant Janek Sunber is sent there due to the presence of a prisoner who may be linked to Darth Vader.

title: Devil by the Deed
description: A series featuring one of the most popular and controversial characters in modern comics history, Matt Wagner's diabolical character has earned an Eisner nomination.

title: Ward No. 6 and Other Stories
description: With its selection of quality editions and affordable prices, the Barnes & Noble Classics series offers students and general readers an unparalleled experience.

title: Moby-Dick
description: A chronicle of life aboard a whaling ship in New England during the 1800s, with the captain's obsession being the capture of jubilant white whales.

title: Main Street
description: Features the story of a St Paul college graduate who relocates to upscale Minneapolis to marry – but finds herself confronted with obstacles—to bringing culture and beauty to an otherwise 'invisible' town she had grown up in, testing her idealism.

title: Uncle Tom's Cabin
description: The master of Uncle Tom sells him off, separating him from his wife, and he falls for his new owner's daughter, but after her death, the child is sold to the evil Simon Legree."

title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde and Other Stories
description: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde by Robert Louis Stevenson is part of the Barnes & Noble Classics series, which offers affordable quality editions for students and general readers. It boasts new scholarship, thoughtful design, and carefully crafted extras such as original essays, biographies, historical events, biographical content, or cultural details.

title: The Essential Tales and Poems of Edgar Allan Poe
description: "The Murders in the Rue Morgue," " The Purloined Letter," and "Annabel Lee" are among the short stories and poems written by Edgar Allan Poe.

title: Essential Dialogues of Plato
description: The origins of Western philosophy can be traced back to Socrates and Plato, who invented the philosophical method of inquiry and analysis. Platon used a logical framework to address questions about ethics, politics, art, and life that still plague humans. This volume also features the first three books of Platian law.

title: The Sillymarillion
description: Bored of the Rings parodies a beloved fantasy epic by J.R.M. Tolkien, blending modern humor with his tales of good and evil.

title: The Soloist
description: With four years left on the clock since his last live performance, Max Randal, a 24-year-old pianist, is struggling to balance his career with the ongoing challenges of losing his first wife and returning home from work.

title: The Nature of Play
description: This tightly edited volume is a must-have for researchers and students in developmental psychology, comparative psychology on animal behavior, evolutionary psychology. Additionally, it will be of interest to anthropologists as an advanced undergraduate and graduate-level course that offers valuable insights.

title: Teaching Reading Comprehension to Students with Learning Difficulties
description: Outstanding Academic Title! This book is a practical guide for students of all levels, providing clear and research-based advice to help them understand and learn from the content. The authors explain strategies that good readers use to comprehend text and provide guidance on how to support struggling students in developing these skills. They also highlight methods for teaching effective vocabulary and teaching students about different text structures, as well as instructional practices that promote comprehension before, during, and after reading each chapter.

title: Seabiscuit
description: Anthology that chronicles the legendary thoroughbred's life from Kentucky to Santa Anita victory, with anecdotes about the horse and his guardians.

title: The War of the World
description: Strives to establish a correlation between industrial and technological progress and modern violence, contending that the twentieth century has been the most violent period in history despite unprecedented achievements. By the author of Paper and Iron. 100,000 first printing.

title: The Brief and Frightening Reign of Phil
description: Inner Horner, a peculiar country that is only suitable for one individual, becomes the victim of Phil's ambition and power-seeking schemes, leading to injustice and widespread unrest in an unusual novel by the author of Pastoralia.

title: Plan B
description: The best-selling author of Traveling Mercies offers humorous and inspiring spiritual advice for how to live in the face of terrorism, with elderly parents and children facing environmental challenges. Reprint.

title: The Portrait
description: While sitting for a portrait painted by his artist friend on an isolated French island, the influential London art critic recalls their friendship, his personal impact on future artists, and the conflict between subject and artist during the sitting.

title: The Kite Runner
description: traces the unlikely friendship of an all-powerful Afghan teenager with one of her servants, from the end of the monarchy to today's horrors.

title: A Long Way Down
description: They met on New Year's Eve in the roof of Topper'S House (London, notorious for its suicide bombing).The television talk show host, a musician, an aged seventeen girl and mother were all present to share their experiences and decisions about what had happened between them. by the author of How to Be Good. Reader' Guide available. Reprint. 500,000 first printing.

title: Everything Bad is Good for You
description: Discusses the intellectual advantages of modern popular culture, including video games and reality TV shows.

title: The Ghost Map
description: The first printing of a historical account of the Victorian London cholera outbreak features Dr. John Snow, who risked his own life to prove his contagion theory about the spread of this disease, which was previously dismissed.

title: Grace (eventually)
description: Trouble and wonder, pain and beauty, restoration and darkness--sometimes simultaneously. But if you look carefully, there are otherworldly places, ordinary or mysterious places that hide the emotional confusion we all battle with.

title: How to be a Perfect Stranger
description: A guide to the rituals and celebrations of all the major religions & denominations in the United States and Canada, designed for the well-intentioned public who wish to feel at ease as they explore other people's religious practices. Original.

title: New Rules
description: The host of Politically Incorrect draws on past episodes and the "New Rules" segments of his popular cable show, Real Time, to address topics such as cell phones, fast food, and conservative government officials. The first printing was distributed to 250,000 people.

title: An Inconvenient Truth
description: The ex-vp elucidates the reasons behind the mounting climate crisis, exposes changes in the environment caused by global warming, and discusses how environmental policy is changing to prevent catastrophe.

title: So Yesterday
description: To uncover a high-end client who has vanished without explanation, Hunter Braque must utilize his expertise in trend-spotting and fashion analysis.

title: Diabolo
description: This spooky story follows Ren and Rai as they both sell off their souls to Diabolo in an attempt to rescue Mio, Ren's cousin.

title: RG Veda
description: Three hundred years ago, a warlord toppled the Emperor of Heaven and initiated savage and oppressive rule, but Six Stars was prophesied to potentially bring him down, and Yasha is determined to fulfill the prediction.

title: Dragon Head
description: Despite having the medicine to heal their friend, Ako and Nimura are facing an aggressive local who is determined to murder them and another young man with a scar on his head. Will they be able to save Teru before it's too late?

title: Teleny  Or  The Reverse of the Medal
description: The Victorian era's double moral standards were exposed in this homoerotic novel by Leonard Smithers, who praised it as the most powerful and cleverly written erodic romance ever written.

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 1
description: The world is in a state of despair at 12,090 A.D., as humanity struggles to break free from the Nobility's control, which has persisted for over three centuries. The destruction caused by the vampire war has left cities and countryside scattered, and it remains challenging for those who have managed to subjugate their populations with demons and werewolves. Every village now has villagers seeking hunters who can provide them with protection.

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 2: Raiser of Gales
description: The adventures of Vampire Hunter D continue!

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 3: Demon Deathase
description: The novel that served as the basis for the successful movie Vampire Hunter D: Bloodlust is now available in English!

title: Coffin
description: Vampire Hunter D, a character that has haunted people worldwide for over two decades, is immortalized in the minds of many eyes thanks to Yoshitaka Amano's brilliant artwork. As the original novels come out in English for the first time, American readers are eagerly anticipating reenacting this one-of-a-kind work. Coffin obliges with an exquisite retrospective that highlights the extent of AMANO'S work with the character: in both novels, as inspiration forthe animators’ two theatrical films, rare paintings, sculptures

title: Tale of Genji
description: With his rich watercolors and captivating work on myth and legend, Yoshitaka Amano has won worldwide recognition. Mr. Arun uses his exceptional talent to narrate the tale of one of Japan's most iconic myths: Murasaki Shikibu, who wrote The Tale of Genji, an exquisitely detailed prince character who conquered many lovers in his epic journey.

title: Ju-on
description: A horror novel based on the classic manga and film series, The Grudge, tells the story of a senior citizen outreach volunteer who encounters utterly murderous deadly forces between those affected by harrowing curses.

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 4: Tale of the Dead Town
description: The City, a small floating city with its own residents, has been considered safe from the attack of marauding monsters for centuries. However, when an apparent invasion of vampires takes over, only one person can restore the oasis.

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 5: The Stuff of Dreams
description: Sheavil Schmidt, a seventeen-year-old vampire, has been sleeping in this hamlet for thirty years, never waking up from the night when she was kissed by her immortal vampire. This is where the mysterious Vampire Hunter D is drawn to the peaceful retreat, as monsters stalk even the most remote and least wealthy villagers.

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 6: Pilgrimage of the Sacred
description: As a "people finder" in the barren desert, Granny Viper is dedicated to finding and rescuing Tae, whose life was cut short by vampire Nobility after she disappeared from Castle Gradinia on the Frontier's far side. However, her survival is complicated as she realizes that she and the girl cannot safely return home, considering they must cross all the roads alone down the mountainous terrain to reach Barnabas.

title: Vampire Hunter D Volume 7: Mysterious Journey to the North Sea  Part 1
description: In this gripping prose novel, D is sucked into a quest that will never be fulfilled. The girl's last wish involves giving him ice cream and the precious stone he needs for her sister. However, when she dies, it sends disturbing messages about an unknown danger.

title: Inside Job
description: Inside Job is a narrative that showcases the intersection of spiritualism, seances, skepticism, and ambiguity in relationships.

title: Hard Candy
description: The anthology is ideal for fans of erotic romance, featuring stories from Angela Knight, Morgan Hawke, and Sheri Gilmore.

title: Side Effects
description: Despite being diagnosed with lymphoma at the age of fifteen, Isabelle manages to survive and thrive.

title: Active Literacy Across the Curriculum
description: Describes teaching approaches for K-12 teachers to enhance students' aptitude in listening, speaking, writing, and reading through cross-curricular activities.

title: Sherlock Holmes and the Case of the Hound of the Baskervilles
description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson journey to the murky wastes of Dartmoor to unravel the enigma surrounding the late Sir Charles Baskerville and a ghostly magnate.

title: Roger Zelazny's To Rule in Amber
description: Despite his father's foundational leadership, Oberon is confronted with the challenges of building up an empire from scratch. This involves new enemies, political intrigue, power-hungry siblings, assassins, a violent father, and the King of Chaos.

title: Undead and Unwed
description: A secretary who has just been laid off experiences a terrible week before her death and is elevated to the status of Queen of the Undead in this clever, sophisticated, steamy, and delightfully witty novel.

title: Undead and Unappreciated
description: Betsy Taylor, the fashion-conscious queen of the undead, is attempting to uncover some family secrets while maintaining her uneasy composure.

title: The Algebraist
description: The year 4034 AD has arrived, and Fasi Taak, a Slow Seer at the Court of the Nasqueron Dwellers, may be considered lucky if he survives. Meanwhile, the group living in 'A' galaxy on the edge of space is dismissed as decadents who are trapped in an age of highly developed barbarism and hoarding data without any recognition.

title: LOVE MODE Volume 1: (Yaoi)
description: Tracks the movements of couples and characters to the Blue Boy, a private male dating group.

title: LOVE MODE Volume 2: (Yaoi)
description: Tracks the movements of couples and characters to the Blue Boy, a private male dating group.

title: LOVE MODE Volume 5: (Yaoi)
description: Tracks the movements of couples and characters to the Blue Boy, a private male dating group.

title: Tramps Like Us
description: Sumire is fired from her job on the day she learns her boyfriend cheated on her, but things take a turn when she meets Momo -- essentially an adorable homeless man who makes life even more difficult.

title: Shout Out Loud! Volume 5: (Yaoi)
description: Nakaya confronts Tenryu about his decision to end Shino's relationship, unsure if he can accept the new romance.

title: BLOOD SUCKER Volume 1: Legend of "Zipangu"
description: Kuraha, Migiri's right hand, has revived him and offered a sacrifice: the beautiful Kikuri (right) Yusuke Himukai is the only one left to restore his life!

title: Seikai: Crest of the Stars Volume 2: A Modest War
description: After fleeing Baron Febdash's orbital palace, Jinto and Lafiel are engulfed by the Human Unification Army. They find themselves caught up in an unforgiving war for intergalactic supremacy, and must learn to cooperate before they can escape.

title: Seikai: Crest of the Stars Volume 3: Return to a Strange World
description: After evacuating the Human Unification Army, Lafiel and his partner Jinto find themselves trapped on Clasbul, which is already under enemy control. With no means to rejoin the fleet, they must survive until they are rescued. However, the Abh princess remains an innocent soul, and it will be up to Jinto to protect her from danger.

title: Trinity Blood
description: The conflict between humans and vampires in a post-apocalyptic world is not over until there is resentment towards one another, but despite this, the two species are intertwined by twisted factions of vampire fanatics who pit them against each other.

title: Twelve Kingdoms  The - Hardcover Edition Volume 1: Sea of Shadow
description: After being taken to another world by Keiki, a god-like figure, ordinary high-school student Yoko is left with only her sword and gemstone, as well as doubts about her destiny in the quest for her throne.

title: The Drift House
description: Susan, twelve, and her stepbrothers are sent to stay with their uncle in a ship-like home called Drift House where they embark on an adventure involving duplicitous mermaids, pirates (and actually some sort of permanent solution to stop time for all it ever happened).

title: Naughty Little Secret
description: By nightfall, he becomes an unfamiliar entity solely for her pleasure and unearths a sinister secret.

title: The Great and Secret Show
description: The first volume of an adaptation of Clive Barker's horror-themed journey into the fantastical begins a battle between good and evil that will unfold over many years.

title: Vegas Bites
authors: L. A. Banks;J. M. Jeffries;Seressia Glass;Natalie Dunbar
description: The French Quarter is the ultimate Vegas destination, where vampires, werewolves, and lounge magicians all share their staged performances.

title: Australia and New Zealand on a Shoestring
description: Discover the top destinations of Australia and New Zealand with this comprehensive travel guidebook, designed for backpackers.

title: Australia
description: Travel enthusiasts can rely on these popular guides for a comprehensive list of countries, regions, and cities worldwide, as well as easy-to-use maps, helpful advice, authoritative background information, detailed itineraries, cross-referencing in maps with "Top 10" and " Top 5", and other useful features.

title: Cuba : Brendan Sainsbury
description: With its comprehensive guide to a foreign land, this book provides practical and accurate information for all budgets. The book includes detailed chapters on Getting Started, itinerary sections, highlights sections on must-see destinations, easy-to-use grid-referenced maps, and chapters covering history, culture, food, environment, etc.

title: Switzerland
description: Travel enthusiasts can rely on these popular guides for a comprehensive list of countries, regions, and cities worldwide, as well as easy-to-use maps, helpful advice, authoritative background information, detailed itineraries, cross-referencing in maps with "Top 10" and " Top 5", and other useful features.

title: West Africa
description: The ultimate travel guide from Lonely Planet. Filled with information on a wide range of topics, including traditional tales, reading lists, and exclusive lunches. Pre-trip planning is made simple with sectional highlights and personalized itinerary suggestions.

title: Amsterdam
description: Explore the Dutch Masters, journey back in time in an elegant merchant's abode, chill out in the Red Light District, or cozy up to a brown café. Celebrate Queen'S Day with ice skating and head to Concertgebouw, another liberal party town. Use this chic guide to discover Amsterdam and its vibrant culture with over 250 detailed reviews of the best restaurants, cafes, coffee shops, and nightlife in Europe.

title: Japan
description: Travel enthusiasts can rely on these popular guides for a comprehensive list of countries, regions, and cities worldwide, as well as easy-to-use maps, helpful advice, authoritative background information, detailed itineraries, cross-referencing in maps with "Top 10" and " Top 5", and other useful features.

title: London
description: The guide is a joy to explore and offers detailed information on attractions along the River Thames, as well as entertainment options such as live music, theater, and sports.
